column1: Back in 1991, many thought that Russia could not end high inflation, adopt a market economy, or compete effectively in world markets.
column2: 1991年，许多人认为俄罗斯不可能摆脱高通胀、采取市场经济并在世界市场上展开高效竞争。

column1: Two decades later, Russia has proved the skeptics wrong.
column2: 二十年后，俄罗斯证明了怀疑派是错误的。

column1: Yes, Russia remains too dependent on oil and gas, and should move further on transparency, openness, and competition in business and governance.
column2: 是的，俄罗斯仍然太依赖于石油和天然气，也应该进一步在商业和治理方面实现透明、开放和竞争。

column1: Yet the trend is positive: Russia has become a stable, high-income market economy, with strong prospects for decades of rapid GDP growth and high-tech progress if it pursues a sensible economic strategy in the coming years.
column2: 但趋势是积极的：俄罗斯已成为稳定的高收入市场经济体，如果在未来几年中采取明智的经济战略，俄罗斯未来几十年中将迎来GDP的高速增长和高科技进步。

column1: The Age of Sustainable Development
column2: 可持续发展时代

column1: NEW YORK – A half-century ago, John F. Kennedy observed that, “man holds in his mortal hands the power to abolish all forms of human poverty and all forms of human life.”
column2: 纽约—半个世纪前，约翰·肯尼迪观察道 ： “ 人类可以依靠平凡的双手战胜一切人类贫困，打造任何人类生活 。 ”

column1: Those words speak to us today with special urgency.
column2: 这番话对于今天有着特别紧迫的意义。

column1: Our generation can indeed end the ancient scourge of extreme poverty.
column2: 我们这一代人可以真正结束自古以来一直存在的极端贫困。

column1: Yet it can also destroy the earth’s life-support system through human-induced environmental devastation.
column2: 但人为造成的环境破坏也有可能毁掉地球的生命支持系统。

column1: By necessity, then, we have entered The Age of Sustainable Development.
column2: 因此，我们已经不可避免地进入了可持续发展时代。

column1: So I am enormously excited to be launching a free, global, online university course by the same name in January 2014. (Those interested in joining the course can register here.)
column2: 令我感到极为振奋的是，2014年，同名免费全球性在线大学课程将上线运营（如果你感兴趣，可以在这里注册 ） 。

column1: I hope that people all over the world will join the course – and then join the generation-long quest to achieve sustainable development.
column2: 我希望全世界人民都加入到这个课程来，你也将同时加入实现可持续发展的跨越几代人的追求。

column1: Sustainable development is both a way of understanding the world and a way to help save it.
column2: 可持续发展既是认识世界的方法，也是拯救世界的方法。

column1: As a method of understanding the world, sustainable-development practitioners study the interactions of the economy, the environment, politics, and culture and how they influence prosperity, social inclusion, and environmental sustainability.
column2: 从认识世界角度讲，可持续发展实践者研究经济、环境、政治和文化的互动及其对繁荣、社会包容和环境可持续性的影响。

column1: Students of sustainable development must therefore learn about a wide range of subjects, including economic development, education, health care, climate change, energy systems, biodiversity, and urbanization, among others.
column2: 因此，可持续发展学生必须学习广泛的课程，包括经济发展、教育、医疗、气候变化、能源体系、生物多样性、城市化，等等。

column1: As a method of helping to save the world, sustainable development encourages a holistic approach to human well-being, one that includes economic progress, strong social bonds, and environmental sustainability.
column2: 从拯救世界的角度讲，可持续发展鼓励用全面的视角审视人类福利，这一视角囊括了经济进步、强大的社会联系和环境可持续性。

column1: The challenges are becoming more urgent as the large and rapidly growing world economy causes massive environmental destruction, and as new technologies demand new skills.
column2: 随着规模庞大、快速增长的世界经济造成了巨大的环境破坏，以及新的技术要求新的技能，挑战也正在变得日益紧迫。

column1: Young people without the appropriate training and skills are likely to find few opportunities for decent jobs and incomes.
column2: 没有受过适当训练、掌握适当技能的年轻人可能很难找到体面工作和收入。

column1: I predict that sustainable development will become the organizing principle for our politics, economics, and even ethics in the years ahead.
column2: 我预测，几年后，可持续发展将成为我们的政治、经济甚至伦理方面的组织原则。

column1: Indeed, the world’s governments have agreed to place it at the very center of the world’s post-2015 development agenda.
column2: 事实上，世界各国政府已经同意将可持续发展作为2015年后世界发展日程的核心。

column1: They will soon adopt Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), which will help guide the world to a safer and fairer twenty-first-century trajectory.
column2: 它们很快将实施可持续发展目标（SDG ） ， 并在该目标的指引下建设更安全、更公平的21世纪世界。

column1: Just as the Millennium Development Goals, adopted in 2000, have proved highly effective in the fight against poverty and disease, the SDGs (which will succeed the MDGs in two years) promise to address the global challenges that we face in areas including energy, food, water, climate, and jobs.
column2: 正如2000年开始实施的千年发展目标（MDG）在与贫困和疾病斗争方面表现出极高的成效，SDG（将在两年后接棒MDG）将解决我们在能源、粮食、水、气候和就业等方面所面临的全球挑战。

column1: I also believe that global, free, online teaching about sustainable development can help to propel global solutions.
column2: 我还相信，可持续发展方面的全球免费在线课程能有助于推进全球解决方案。

column1: Online global courses are part of the world’s ongoing information revolution – a revolution that is now fundamentally reshaping higher education, most importantly by creating new avenues of access for more people around the world.
column2: 全球在线课程是方兴未艾的信息革命的一部分 — — 这一个名正在重塑高等教育格局，其最重要的特征是为全世界更多的人创造了获得高等教育的渠道。

column1: I know this from personal experience.
column2: 对于这一点，我个人深有体会。

column1: For most of my years as a professor, the basic educational technologies did not change much.
column2: 在我多年的教授生涯���，基本教学技术并无太多变化。

column1: I stood in front of a class and gave a 57-minute lecture.
column2: 我站在讲台上讲课，每堂课大概57分钟。

column1: Yes, the blackboard gave way to an overhead projector, and then to PowerPoint, but otherwise the basic classroom “technology” changed little.
column2: 是的，黑板逐渐被投影仪取代，投影仪又被PowerPoint取代，但尽管如此，基本教室“技术”并未改变。

column1: Yet, with the new information technologies, higher education (and of course education at other levels) is suddenly changing.
column2: 但是，在新信息技术的带动下，高等教育（当然也包括其他层次的教育）突然发生了改变。

column1: Courses can now incorporate a lot more information – data, videos, and even live chats with experts halfway around the world.
column2: 如今，课程可以嵌入很多新信息 — — 数据、视频甚至与半个地球之外的专家实时沟通。

column1: More and more people worldwide can access free, high-quality educational materials that previously were available only to a lucky few.
column2: 全世界越来越多的人可以获得昔日只有少数幸运儿才能获得的高质量教学资源。

column1: This is especially important today, because the challenges of sustainable development will require knowledgeable and educated citizens everywhere.
column2: 这在今天尤其重要，因为可持续发展的挑战要求各国都拥有渊博之士和受过教育的公民。

column1: According to recent data, online university courses have already reached students in more than 190 countries, enabling them to watch lectures, take quizzes, and interact with fellow students and professors.
column2: 从最新数据看，在线大学课程已经触及190多个国家的学生，他们可以观看课程、参加测验、与同学和教授交流。

column1: Online education is transforming the classroom experience as well.
column2: 在线教育也在改变课堂体验。

column1: Now, rather than watch me lecture for 57 minutes, my students at Columbia University can watch the online lectures ahead of time, permitting a much richer, in-depth discussion in the classroom.
column2: 如今，我的哥伦比亚大学学生们不再仅仅出席教室聆听我57分钟的讲课，而是可以事先观看在线授课，这带来了更丰富、更深刻的课堂讨论。

column1: In the years ahead, I believe that all of us will have to become leaders in sustainable development in our homes, communities, and countries.
column2: 我相信，几年后，我们所有人都会变成家庭、社区和国家的可持续发展领袖。

column1: Millions of young people will soon have to help solve problems of climate change, water, energy, transportation, and education.
column2: 数百万年轻人和快就能为解决气候变化、水、能源、交通和教育等问题出力。

column1: Thousands of cities and 200 countries around the world will need to rally all stakeholders – government, communities, experts, business, and non-governmental organizations – to play their roles, and open online education will be key to disseminating the information they need.
column2: 全世界200个国家的数千城市将需要联合所有相关利益方 — — 政府、社区、专家、商界和非政府组织 — — 扮演各自角色，而开放在线教育将是传播它们所需要的信息的关键。

column1: For these reasons, I am also pleased that my course will be part of a more general education program of the Sustainable Development Solutions Network, an initiative under the auspices of UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon that I am honored to direct.
column2: 出于这些原因，我很高兴自己的课程能成为可持续发展解决方案网（SDSN）普通教育计划的一部分，该计划由联合国秘书长潘基文倡议，我荣幸地担任主管。

column1: The SDSN mobilizes scientific and technical expertise from academia, civil society, and the private sector in support of sustainable-development problem solving at local, national, and global scales.
column2: SDSN动员来自学界、公民社会和私人部门的科学和技术专家支持地方、国家和全球层面的可持续发展问题解决方案。

column1: One of the SDSN’s key objectives is to reach students all over the world by developing and disseminating online materials for sustainable-development curricula.
column2: SDSM的一个关键目标是通过开发和传播在线可持续发展课程素材，并送到全世界学生面前。

column1: More than a dozen institutions have already committed to incorporating The Age of Sustainable Development into their own classes, tailored for their own local circumstances and issues.
column2: 已有十多个机构承诺将可持续发展时代纳入它们的课程体系中，并根据自身环境和问题改编。

column1: The SDSN will encourage the world’s universities to participate in the new era of global online teaching.
column2: SDSN将鼓励全世界各大学参与到全球在线教育新时代中来。

column1: The goal will be to equip today’s young people to use wisely the power that will soon pass into their own hands to help address the world’s great challenges.
column2: SDSN的目标是将我们的本领传授该年轻人，让他们能够明智地使用学到的知识，帮助战胜世界所面临的大挑战。

column1: Putin’s Perilous Course
column2: 普京的危险行为

column1: NEW YORK – The dangers of the crisis in Ukraine cannot be exaggerated.
column2: 纽约—乌克兰危机的危险怎么强调都不为过。

column1: Russian President Vladimir Putin is overtly and covertly inciting separatism in eastern Ukraine, and has declared Russia’s unilateral right to intervene there, in complete contravention of international law.
column2: 俄罗斯总统普京公开和暗地里都在煽动东乌克兰的分裂，并宣布俄罗斯有单边干预乌克兰的权利，完全不顾国际法。

column1: Russia’s provocative policies are putting it on a collision course with the West.
column2: 俄罗斯的挑衅性政策正在与西方产生碰撞。

column1: Putin explained his point of view in a recent television appearance: Russia’s current international borders are provisional, determined by accidents of history, such as the transfer of Crimea from Russia to Ukraine in 1954, or the transfer of Russian territories to eastern Ukraine in the 1920’s.
column2: 普京在最近的电视讲话中解释了自己的观点：俄罗斯目前的边界是暂时性的，是由历史事件确定的 — — 如1954年克里米亚由俄罗斯转给乌克兰以及20世纪20年代俄罗斯领土转给东乌克兰。

column1: Putin claims that it is Russia’s right and duty to defend ethnic Russians in neighboring countries, especially in light of the arbitrariness of the existing borders.
column2: 普京声称，俄罗斯有权利和义务捍卫邻国的俄罗斯族，特别是在现有边界不清不楚的情况下。

column1: If ethnic Russians call for a return to Russia, Putin asserts, then Russia must heed their call.
column2: 普京声称，如果俄罗斯族要求回归俄罗斯，那么俄罗斯就必须响应他们的要求。

column1: Putin pointedly reminded listeners that eastern Ukraine was called “Novorossiya” (New Russia) in Czarist times, clearly implying that it could be Novorossiya again.
column2: 普京尖锐地向听众指出，东乌克兰在沙皇时代被称为“Novorossiya ” （ 新俄罗斯 ） ， 显然，如今那里可以再次成为Novorossiya。

column1: Evidently, Putin believes that relentless pressure and claims over neighboring states, designed to undermine their sovereignty and force them to accede to Russian demands, will result in a stronger Russia, better able to confront the West.
column2: 显然，普京认为对邻国不断施加旨在破坏其主权、迫使其接受俄罗斯要求的压力和主张能让俄罗斯更强大、更有能力对抗西方。

column1: In the recent past, Russia sharply opposed American and NATO military intervention in Libya, Syria, and Serbia on the grounds that the West was violating those countries’ sovereignty.
column2: 从最近的事件看，俄罗斯强烈反对美国和北约军事干预利比亚、叙利亚和塞尔维亚，理由是西方侵犯了这些国家的主权。

column1: Now Putin claims the right to ignore neighboring countries’ sovereignty on the pretext that Russia is merely defending the rights of ethnic Russians abroad, up to and including their right to secede and join the Russian homeland.
column2: 如今，普京又声称有权利忽视邻国的主权，而原因仅仅是俄罗斯要捍卫海外俄罗斯族的权利，包括他们脱离所在国家加入俄罗斯祖国的权利。

column1: Putin no doubt hopes to create facts on the ground – as in Crimea – without provoking a severe Western reaction.
column2: 显然，普京希望在不引起西方强烈反弹的情况下营造既成事实 — — 就像在克里米亚那样。

column1: Even without an invasion, Russia can use threats, displays of military power, secret operations, and heated rhetoric to destabilize its neighbors.
column2: 即使不采取入侵，俄罗斯也可以使用威胁、陈兵、秘密行动和慷慨陈词动摇邻国。

column1: That may be enough to achieve Russian foreign-policy aims, including its neighbors’ docility.
column2: 这可能已足以实现包括令邻国就范在内的俄罗斯外交政策目标。

column1: But Putin’s adventurism is likely to end very badly for Russia.
column2: 但普京的铤而走险可能给俄罗斯带来极坏的后果。

column1: Though the West is justifiably reticent to be drawn into any military confrontations with Russia beyond NATO’s boundaries, and is even reluctant to apply economic sanctions, Putin’s actions have triggered a strong and growing anti-Russian backlash in the US and Europe.
column2: 尽管西方极有可能不会在北约边界之外的地方与俄罗斯形成军事冲突，甚至不太愿意采取经济制裁，但普京的行动已经引发了美国和欧洲日益增长的强烈的反俄情绪。

column1: The West’s response will intensify dramatically if Russia deploys forces across its borders, whatever the pretext; should Russia adopt subtler methods of political destabilization, Western pressure will build more gradually, but build it will.
column2: 如果俄罗斯军队越过边界，不管寻找什么借口，都会引起西方反应的强烈升级；如果俄罗斯采取暗中政治动摇的方针，那么西方的压力将积累得更加缓 — — 仍在积累，只是慢一些。

column1: Existing trade, investment, and financial relations between Russia and the West are already becoming severely frayed.
column2: 现有俄罗斯与西方之间的贸易、投资和金融关系已经遭到了严重破坏。

column1: New investment projects and joint ventures are being put on hold.
column2: 新投资项目和合资企业被叫停。

column1: Loans from Western investors to Russian entities are being called in.
column2: 西方投资者给俄罗斯机构的贷款也被叫停。

column1: Russian banks and companies will face a growing credit squeeze.
column2: 俄罗斯银行和公司将面临日益加剧的信用压力。

column1: In the short term, Russia has ample foreign-exchange reserves to offset capital outflows; but the reversal of capital flows will begin to bite within a matter of months.
column2: 在短期，俄罗斯拥有足够的外汇储备抵消资本外流，但资本流逆转的后果将在几个月后显露。

column1: Following Russia’s forcible takeover of Crimea, it is almost unimaginable that normal economic relations between Russia and the West could survive Russian intervention, subversion, or annexation elsewhere in Ukraine.
column2: 在俄罗斯暴力吞并克里米亚后，很难想象俄罗斯还能在干预、颠覆或吞并乌克兰其他地区的情况下与西方维持正常的经济关系。

column1: In other words, if Cold War II sets in, as appears increasingly likely, Russia would be the long-term economic loser.
column2: 换句话说，如果第二次冷战真的爆发（可能性越来越高 ） ， 俄罗斯将是长期经济输家。

column1: The European Union can certainly survive without imports of Russian natural gas, even with a full cutoff.
column2: 欧盟显然可以在不进口俄罗斯天然气甚至完全切断俄罗斯天然气的情况下活下去。

column1: Russia’s gas exports to Europe constitute less than 10% of the EU’s primary energy consumption.
column2: 俄罗斯对欧天然气出口只占欧盟初级能源消费的不到10 % 。

column1: Russia, on the other hand, would suffer a major loss of revenues.
column2: 而俄罗斯却会因此受到巨大的收入损失。

column1: Putin seems to believe that Russia can offset any worsening of economic relations with the West by strengthening its economic relations with China.
column2: 普京似乎认为俄罗斯可以通过加强其与中国的经济关系抵消一切与西方经济关系的恶化。

column1: But technologies and business are too globally intertwined to divide the world into economic blocs.
column2: 但科技和商业是全球互通的，很难将世界割裂为数个经济区。

column1: China knows that its long-term economic prosperity depends on good economic relations with the US and Europe.
column2: 中国知道其长期经济繁荣取决于与其美国与欧洲的良好经济关系。

column1: Putin seems not to understand this point, or even the fact that the Soviet economy collapsed as a result of its isolation from technologically advanced economies.
column2: 普京似乎没有认清这一点，甚至也没有认清苏联经济是因为被技术更先进的经济体孤立才崩溃的这一事实。

column1: Russia’s future economic strength depends on its ability to upgrade technologies in key sectors, including aviation, high-speed rail, automobiles, machinery, and heavy industry.
column2: 俄罗斯的未来经济优势取决于其能否实现关键部门的技术升级，包括航空、高速铁路、汽车、机械和重工业等。

column1: That can be achieved only if Russian companies are more closely integrated into global production networks that knit them together with German, Japanese, American, and Chinese firms that rely on cutting-edge technology and advanced engineering.
column2: 而这只有在俄罗斯公司紧密地融入全球生产网络、与依赖尖端科技和先进工程技术的德国、日本、美国和中国公司打成一片才能实现。

column1: Of course, matters could become much worse.
column2: 当然，情况可能远比这糟糕。

column1: A new cold war could all too easily turn hot.
column2: 新冷战极有可能转变为热战。

column1: Many in the US are already calling for arming Ukraine as a deterrent to Russia.
column2: 许多美国人已经在呼吁武装乌克兰，以此威慑俄罗斯。

column1: But, while military deterrence sometimes works, the West should emphasize trade and financial retaliation, rather than military responses to Russian provocations.
column2: 但是，尽管军事威慑有时会有效，但西方应该强调贸易和金融关系而不是以军事方式应对俄罗斯的挑衅。

column1: Military responses could provoke disaster, such as turning Ukraine into a Syria-type battlefield, with untold thousands of deaths.
column2: 军事反应可能造成灾难，让乌克兰沦为第二个叙利亚，让成千上万人因此丧生。

column1: There can be no doubt that NATO will defend its own members if necessary.
column2: 毫无疑问，北约会在必要时捍卫其成员国。

column1: But Russia’s belligerency and appalling behavior should not permit Western hardliners to gain control of the policy debate.
column2: 但不能因为俄罗斯骇人听闻的战争行为而让强硬派主宰西方政策争论。

column1: Hardline approaches brought expanded conflicts in Afghanistan, Iraq, Libya, and Syria, leading to plenty of deaths but not to meaningful political or economic solutions in the affected countries.
column2: 强硬路线在阿富汗、伊拉克、利比亚和叙利亚造成了冲突扩大，导致大量死亡，却没有为受影响国家带来有意义的政治或经济解决方案。

column1: War is not politics by other means.
column2: 战争绝非另辟蹊径的政治手段。

column1: War is mayhem and suffering.
column2: 战争只能带来死伤和灾难。

column1: Putin is no doubt acting in Ukraine with domestic politics very much in mind, using his adventurism abroad to shore up his political base at home.
column2: 毫无疑问，普京对乌克兰的动作有其国内政治考虑，利用其对外政策的冒险巩固国内政治基础。

column1: The Russian economy is flagging, and the population is weary of repression, not to mention Russia’s pervasive corruption.
column2: 俄罗斯经济陷入了停滞，俄罗斯人民受够了压抑，更不用说俄罗斯无处不在的腐败了。

column1: Russia’s annexation of Crimea and threat to invade eastern Ukraine appear to be hugely popular.
column2: 俄罗斯吞并克里米亚并威胁入侵东乌克兰似乎受到了人民的热烈欢迎。

column1: It remains a terrifying reality that politicians often perceive war to be an antidote to internal weakness.
column2: 政客们常常把战争作为国内失势的解毒剂，这是个令人恐惧的现实。

column1: Both Russia and the West have played fast and loose with international law in recent years.
column2: 近几年来，俄罗斯与西方都把国际法玩弄于鼓掌之间。

column1: The West violated national sovereignty in Serbia, Afghanistan, Iraq, Libya, and Syria.
column2: 西方侵犯了塞尔维亚、阿富汗、伊拉克、利比亚和叙利亚的主权。

column1: Russia is now playing the same card with shocking brazenness in its own neighborhood, often justifying its actions by pointing to Western precedents.
column2: 而如今，俄罗斯带着令人震惊的厚颜无耻对自己的邻国如法炮制，常常援引西方先例来为自己开脱。

column1: But Russia’s true long-term interests lie in multilateralism, integration into the world economy, and the international rule of law.
column2: 但俄罗斯真正的长期利益在于多边主义、融入世界经济以及国际法治精神。

column1: Putin’s current path is strewn with grave hazards.
column2: 普京当前的道路充满了巨大的风险。

column1: He is undermining Russia’s economic prospects, while confronting the world with a growing threat of war.
column2: 他正在破坏俄罗斯的经济前景，也让世界面对日益增加的战争可能。

column1: Our only hope is that all sides return to the principles of international law, which they have forsaken for too long.
column2: 我们唯一的希望是各方回归被它们抛弃已久的国际法原则。

column1: The Limits of Climate Negotiations
column2: 气候谈判的局限

column1: NEW YORK – If the world is to solve the climate-change crisis, we will need a new approach.
column2: 纽约—如果世界想要解决气候变化危机，我们就需要新方法。

column1: Currently, the major powers view climate change as a negotiation over who will reduce their CO2 emissions (mainly from the use of coal, oil, and gas).
column2: 目前，主要大国将气候变化视为一场关于谁减少二氧化碳排放（主要来自煤炭、石油和天然气的使用）的谈判。

column1: Each agrees to small “contributions” of emission reduction, trying to nudge the other countries to do more.
column2: 所有人都同意为减排做出小“贡献 ” ， 而让其他国家承担更多责任。

column1: The United States, for example, will “concede” a little bit of CO2 reduction if China will do the same.
column2: 比如，美国将在减少二氧化碳方面做出一些“让步 ” ， 条件是中国也这样做。

column1: For two decades, we have been trapped in this minimalist and incremental mindset, which is wrong in two key ways.
column2: 二十年来，我们一直陷于这一最小值和增量思维陷阱中。 这一思维存在两个关键问题。

column1: First, it is not working: CO2 emissions are rising, not falling.
column2: 首先，它并没有奏效：CO2 排放在增加而不是在减少。

column1: The global oil industry is having a field day – fracking, drilling, exploring in the Arctic, gasifying coal, and building new liquefied natural gas (LNG) facilities.
column2: 全球石油工业正在开动马力 — — 致裂、钻井、在北冰洋勘探、煤气化、建设新的液化天然气设施。

column1: The world is wrecking the climate and food-supply systems at a breakneck pace.
column2: 世界正在以极快的速度威胁气候和粮食供给系统。

column1: Second, “decarbonizing” the energy system is technologically complicated.
column2: 其次，能源系统的“去碳化”在技术上十分复杂。

column1: America’s real problem is not competition from China; it’s the complexity of shifting a $17.5 trillion economy from fossil fuels to low-carbon alternatives.
column2: 美国的真正问题不是来自中国的竞争；而是实现规模达到17.5万亿美元的经济从化石燃料转向低碳替代燃料的复杂性。

column1: China’s problem is not the US, but how to wean the world’s largest, or second largest economy (depending on which data are used) off its deeply entrenched dependence on coal.
column2: 中国的问题不在于美国，而在于如何让这个世界第一大或第二大（取决于使用和中数据）经济体摆脱对煤炭的深度依赖。

column1: These are mainly engineering problems, not negotiating problems.
column2: 这些问题主要是工程问题，而不是谈判问题。

column1: To be sure, both economies could decarbonize if they cut output sharply.
column2: 平信而乱，若能大幅削减产出，中美都可以去碳化。

column1: But neither the US nor China is ready to sacrifice millions of jobs and trillions of dollars to do so.
column2: 但中美都不准备为这一目的而牺牲数百万工作岗位和数万亿美���。

column1: Indeed, the question is how to decarbonize while remaining economically strong.
column2: 事实上，问题在于如何既实现去碳化，有保持经济强劲。

column1: Climate negotiators cannot answer that question, but innovators like Elon Musk of Tesla, and scientists like Klaus Lackner of Columbia University, can.
column2: 气候谈判员无法回答这个问题，但特斯拉（Tesla）的艾龙·马斯克（Elon Musk）这样的创新者和哥伦比亚大学的克劳斯·莱克纳（Klaus Lackner）这样的科学家可以。

column1: Decarbonizing the world’s energy system requires preventing our production of vast and growing amounts of electricity from boosting atmospheric CO2 emissions. It also presupposes a switchover to a zero-carbon transport fleet and a lot more production per kilowatt-hour of energy.
column2: 实现世界能源系统去碳化需要阻止我们规模巨大并且仍在日渐增长的发电活动增加大气中的二氧化碳排放；也需要世界向零碳交通和大幅提高每千瓦时能源产量靠拢。

column1: Zero-carbon electricity is within reach.
column2: 零碳电已有希望实现。

column1: Solar and wind power can deliver that already, but not necessarily when and where needed.
column2: 太阳能电和风电即属此列，但还无法实现全天候、全覆盖。

column1: We need storage breakthroughs for these intermittent clean-energy sources.
column2: 我们需要实现这些间歇性清洁能源资源储存方面的突破。

column1: Nuclear power, another important source of zero-carbon energy, will also need to play a big role in the future, implying the need to bolster public confidence in its safety.
column2: 另一个重要的零碳能源资源 — — 核电也应该在未来大放异彩，这意味着需要增加公众对核电安全的信心。

column1: Even fossil fuels can produce zero-carbon electricity, if carbon capture and storage is used.
column2: 即使是化石燃料，也可以产生零碳电，如果采取碳捕捉和储存（碳捕存）技术的话。

column1: Lackner is a world leader in new CCS strategies.
column2: 莱克纳便是新碳捕存战略的世界领袖。

column1: Electrification of transport is already with us, and Tesla, with its sophisticated electric vehicles, is capturing the public’s imagination and interest.
column2: 交通电气化已经成为了现实，特斯拉公司携其先进的电动汽车抓住了公众的想象力和兴趣。

column1: Yet further technological advances are needed in order to reduce electric vehicles’ costs, increase their reliability, and extend their range.
column2: 但我们需要进一步的科技进步以降低电动汽车成本、增加电动汽车可靠性、扩大电动汽车范围。

column1: Musk, eager to spur rapid development of the vehicles, made history last week by opening Tesla’s patents for use by competitors.
column2: 马斯克热切地希望刺激电动汽车的开发，在上周做出了历史性的决定，向竞争对手开放特斯拉的专利。

column1: Technology offers new breakthroughs in energy efficiency as well.
column2: 科技也在能源效率方面带来了新突破。

column1: New building designs have slashed heating and cooling costs by relying much more on insulation, natural ventilation, and solar power.
column2: 新建筑设计通过更多依靠隔离、自然通风和太阳能降低取暖和制冷成本。

column1: Advances in nanotechnology offer the prospect of lighter construction materials that require much less energy to produce, making both buildings and vehicles far more energy efficient.
column2: 纳米技术的进步为我们提供了更轻质、生产过程消耗能源更少的建筑材料，大大提高了建筑和汽车的能源效率。

column1: The world needs a concerted push to adopt to low-carbon electricity, not another “us-versus-them” negotiation.
column2: 世界需要集中力量推动低碳电的普及，而不需要另一场“我们和他们”的谈判。

column1: All countries need new, low-carbon technologies, many of which are still out of commercial reach.
column2: 所有国家都需要新的低碳科技，其中许多仍不具有经济可行性。

column1: Climate negotiators should therefore be focusing on how to cooperate to ensure that technology breakthroughs are achieved and benefit all countries.
column2: 因此，气候谈判员应该将注意力集中在如何合作以确保实现科技突破并惠及所有国家上。

column1: They should take their cue from other cases in which government, scientists, and industry teamed up to produce major changes.
column2: 他们应该从政府、科学家和产业界合作带来重大变化的例子中吸取教训。

column1: For example, in carrying out the Manhattan Project (to produce the atomic bomb during World War II) and the first moon landing, the US government set a remarkable technological goal, established a bold timetable, and committed the financial resources needed to get the job done.
column2: 比如，在曼哈顿计划（二战期间制造原子弹的计划）和首次登月中，美国政府设立了一个宏大的技术目标，制定了雄心勃勃的时间表，并投入必要的金融资源实现目标。

column1: In both cases, the scientists and engineers delivered on time.
column2: 在这两个计划中，科学家和工程师按时完成了任务。

column1: The example of atomic bombs might seem an unpleasant one, yet it raises an important question: If we ask governments and scientists to cooperate on war technology, shouldn’t we do at least the same to save the planet from carbon pollution?
column2: 原子弹的例子也许令人不快，但它引出了一个一个重要问题：既然我们要求政府和科学家合作开发战争技术，为何不在拯救地球免于碳污染的问题上也这样做呢？

column1: In fact, the process of “directed technological change,” in which bold objectives are set, milestones are identified, and timelines are put into place, is much more common than many realize.
column2: 事实上 ， “ 有指导的科技变迁 ” （ directed technological change）过程 — — 包括宏伟的目标、各个里程碑事件的确定以及实施时间表 — — 比许多人认为的要普遍得多。

column1: The information-technology revolution that has brought us computers, smart phones, GPS, and much more, was built on a series of industry and government roadmaps.
column2: 给我们带来电脑、智能电话、GPS和其他许多东西的信息技术革命便建立在一系列产业和政府路线图的基础上。

column1: The human genome was mapped through such a government-led effort – one that ultimately brought in the private sector as well.
column2: 人类基因组也是通过这样的政府领导（最终页引入了私人部门）项目被勾勒出来的。

column1: More recently, government and industry got together to cut the costs of sequencing an individual genome from around $100 million in 2001 to just $1,000 today.
column2: 更晚近一些，2001年政府和产业界合力将个人基因组测序成本从2001年的大约1亿美元下降到今天的区区1,000美元。

column1: A dramatic cost-cutting goal was set, scientists went to work, and the targeted breakthrough was achieved on time.
column2: 此过程设立了一个巨幅削减成本的目标，科学家们孜孜以求并按时实现了预定的突破。

column1: Fighting climate change does depend on all countries having confidence that their competitors will follow suit.
column2: 遏制气候变化确实依赖于每个国家都相信竞争对手也会齐头并进的信心。

column1: So, yes, let the upcoming climate negotiations spell out shared actions by the US, China, Europe, and others.
column2: 因此，诚然，让即将到来的气候谈判使美国、中国、欧洲和其他地区精诚合作。

column1: But let’s stop pretending that this is a poker game, rather than a scientific and technological puzzle of the highest order.
column2: 但我们不能假装这只不过是一场扑克游戏，而不是最高级别的科学和科技难题。

column1: We need the likes of Musk, Lackner, General Electric, Siemens, Ericsson, Intel, Electricité de France, Huawei, Google, Baidu, Samsung, Apple, and others in laboratories, power plants, and cities around the world to forge the technological breakthroughs that will reduce global CO2 emissions.
column2: 我们需要马斯克、莱克纳、通用电气、西门子、爱立信、英特尔、法国电力、华为、谷歌、百度、三星、苹果以及其他世界各地的实验室、发电厂和城市齐心协力促进能减少全球二氧化碳排放的科技突破。

column1: There is even a place at the table for ExxonMobil, Chevron, BP, Peabody, Koch Industries, and other oil and coal giants.
column2: 甚至埃克森美孚、雪佛龙、英国石油、皮博迪（Peabody ） 、 柯氏工业（Koch Industries）和其他石油和煤炭巨头也能有所助益。

column1: If they expect their products to be used in the future, they had better make them safe through the deployment of advanced CCS technologies.
column2: 如果它们期待它们的产品在未来仍有用途，就必须通过开发先进的碳捕存技术让产品更加安全。

column1: The point is that targeted and deep decarbonization is a job for all stakeholders, including the fossil-fuel industry, and one in which we must all be on the side of human survival and wellbeing.
column2: 要点在于定向的深度去碳化是所有相关利益方的共同责任，包括化石燃料业；也是一个我们必须一致站在人类生存和福利立场上的责任。

column1: Ukraine and the Crisis of International Law
column2: 乌克兰与国际法危机

column1: NEW YORK – Russia’s actions in Ukraine constitute a serious and dangerous violation of international law.
column2: 纽约—俄罗斯在乌克兰的行为构成了对国际法的严重且危险的挑战。

column1: In 1994, Ukraine agreed to give up the nuclear weapons it had inherited from the Soviet Union, in return for a solemn commitment by the United States, the United Kingdom, and Russia to protect Ukraine’s territorial integrity and sovereignty.
column2: 1994年，乌克兰同意放弃从苏联继承的核武器，以此换取美国、英国和俄罗斯保护乌克兰领土完整和主权的庄严承诺。

column1: Russia has now violated that pledge, not only harming Ukraine but also undermining the international legal framework for preventing nuclear proliferation.
column2: 如今，俄罗斯违反了这一承诺，不但伤害了乌克兰，也破坏了防止核扩散的国际法框架。

column1: Unless Russia changes course – which seems unlikely anytime soon – the global consequences are apt to be grave.
column2: 除非俄罗斯改变行为 — — 近期看来可能性渺茫 — — 否则全球后果将相当严重。

column1: The US and the European Union will impose sanctions, weakening Russia’s economy and the world economy – and stoking even more tension and nationalism.
column2: 美国和欧盟将实施制裁，削弱俄罗斯和世界经济 — — 并带来更多的对立和民族主义。

column1: Mistakes on one side or the other could lead to violent disaster.
column2: 每一方的错误都可能导致暴力灾难。

column1: We need only to recall the spiral of hubris and miscalculation that led to the outbreak of World War I, a century ago this year.
column2: 对此我们只要回忆一下距今恰好一百年前的一战前的傲慢和失误循环就可了解到这一点。

column1: As frightening as the Ukraine crisis is, the more general disregard of international law in recent years must not be overlooked.
column2: 乌克兰危机是可怕的，同样可怕的是近几年来世界对国际法越来越不放在眼里，这一问题不容忽视。

column1: Without diminishing the seriousness of Russia’s recent actions, we should note that they come in the context of repeated violations of international law by the US, the EU, and NATO.
column2: 我们不应该淡化俄罗斯最近行为的严重性，与此同时，我们也应该注意到俄罗斯的行为是在美国、欧盟和北约一再违反国际法的���景下做出的。

column1: Every such violation undermines the fragile edifice of international law, and risks throwing the world into a lawless war of all against all.
column2: 上述三者每一次违反国际法的行为都会令这座脆弱的制度建筑雪上加霜，增加了让世界陷入无法可言的战争汪洋的风险。

column1: The US and its allies have also launched a series of military interventions in recent years in contravention of the United Nations Charter and without the support of the UN Security Council.
column2: 近几年来，美国及其盟国还发动了一系列违反联合国宪章且未经联合国安理会支持的军事干预。

column1: The US-led NATO bombing of Serbia in 1999 lacked the sanction of international law, and occurred despite the strong objections of Russia, a Serbian ally.
column2: 以美国为首的北约在1999年对塞尔维亚的轰炸便未受到国际法的认可，并且是在塞尔维亚盟国俄罗斯的强烈反对下发生的。

column1: Kosovo’s subsequent declaration of independence from Serbia, recognized by the US and most EU members, is a precedent that Russia eagerly cites for its actions in Crimea.
column2: 随后，科索沃宣布脱离塞尔维亚独立并获得美国和大部分欧盟国家承认，这些先例被俄罗斯在其克里米亚行动中大肆援引。

column1: The ironies are obvious.
column2: 讽刺之处显而易见。

column1: The Kosovo War was followed by the US-led wars in Afghanistan and Iraq, both of which occurred without the support of the Security Council, and in the case of Iraq, despite vigorous objections within it.
column2: 科索沃战争之后是美国领导的阿富汗战争和伊拉克战争，后两者亦未受到安理会支持，伊拉克战争还受到了安理会内部的强烈反对。

column1: The results for both Afghanistan and Iraq have been utterly devastating.
column2: 阿富汗和伊拉克战争最后都成为车头车尾的灾难。

column1: NATO’s actions in Libya in 2011 to topple Muammar el-Qaddafi constituted another such violation of international law.
column2: 2011年，北约推翻利比亚卡扎菲政权的行为是其违反国际法的又一显例。

column1: After the Security Council approved a resolution to institute a no-fly zone and take other actions ostensibly to protect Libyan civilians, NATO used the resolution as a pretext to overthrow Qaddafi’s regime through aerial bombardment.
column2: 此前，安理会批准了一项决议建立禁飞区并采取其他行动保护利比亚平民，而北约将这一决议作为用空中轰炸推翻卡扎菲政权的接口。

column1: Russia and China strenuously objected, stating then and now that NATO seriously exceeded its mandate.
column2: 俄罗斯和中国强烈反对，指出（不论是当时还是现在）北约严重超越了它的权限范围。

column1: Libya remains unstable and violent, without an effective national government, to this day.
column2: 利比亚至今仍处于动荡和暴力状态，没有产生有效的国家政府。

column1: As Russia itself has repeatedly pointed out, US actions in Syria have been similarly illegal.
column2: 正如俄罗斯本身一再指出的，美国在叙利亚的行为也是不合法的。

column1: When the Arab Spring protests began in early 2011, peaceful demonstrators in Syria demanded reforms.
column2: 当2011年初阿拉伯之春示威爆发时，叙利亚的和平示威者要求改革。

column1: President Bashar al-Assad’s regime cracked down violently on the protesters, leading some military units to revolt.
column2: 总统巴沙尔·阿萨德政权用暴力镇压示威者，导致一些军师团体揭竿而起。

column1: At that point, in the summer of 2011, the US began to back the military insurrection, with President Barack Obama declaring that Assad must “step aside.”
column2: 此时（2011年夏 ） ， 美国开始支持军事暴动，美国总统奥巴马声称巴沙尔必须“下台 ” 。

column1: Since then, the US, Saudi Arabia, Turkey, and others have provided logistical, financial, and military support to the insurrection, in violation of Syria’s sovereignty and international law.
column2: 自此以后，美国、沙特阿拉伯、土耳其和其他国家为叛军提供了物流、金融和军事支持，侵害了叙利亚主权，也违反了国际法。

column1: There is no doubt that Assad has behaved cruelly, but there is also no doubt that the US-led support of the insurrection is a violation of Syria’s sovereignty, one that has contributed to an upward spiral of violence that by now has claimed more than 130,000 Syrian lives and destroyed much of the country’s cultural heritage and infrastructure.
column2: 毫无疑问，巴沙尔确实犯下了暴行，但同样毫无疑问的是美国领导的支持叛军的行为侵害了叙利亚主权，助长了暴力循环的升级，至今已造成130,000多叙利亚人丧生，毁掉了叙利亚的文化遗产和基础设施。

column1: One can add many other US actions, including drone strikes on the territory of sovereign states without their governments’ permission; covert military operations; renditions and torture of terror suspects; and massive spying by the US National Security Agency.
column2: 美国类似的行为还有很多，包括在未经主权国家政府许可的情况下用无人机袭击它们的领土；引渡和虐待嫌疑恐怖分子；以及美国国安局的大规模间谍行动等。

column1: When challenged by other countries or UN organizations, the US has brushed aside their objections.
column2: 当其他国家或联合国组织对此提出挑战时，美国对他们的反对置若罔闻。

column1: International law itself is at a crossroads.
column2: 国际法本身也站在十字路口。

column1: The US, Russia, the EU, and NATO cite it when it is to their advantage and disregard it when they deem it a nuisance.
column2: 美国、俄罗斯、欧盟和北约都按自己的需要利用或唾弃它。

column1: Again, this is not to justify Russia’s unacceptable actions; rather, it is to add them to the sequence of actions contrary to international law.
column2: 再一次指出，这并不能证明俄罗斯不可接受的行为是合法的；恰恰相反，这证明了俄罗斯的行为违反了国际法。

column1: The same problems may soon spill over into Asia.
column2: 同样的问题可能很快也会在亚洲出现。

column1: Until recently, China, Japan, and others in Asia have staunchly defended the requirement that the Security Council approve any outside military intervention in sovereign states.
column2: 到目前为止，中国、日本和其他亚洲国家都坚定地捍卫了任何对外部主权国家军事干预需要安理会批准的要求。

column1: Recently, however, several countries in East Asia have become locked in a spiral of claims and counterclaims regarding borders, shipping lanes, and territorial rights.
column2: 但是，最近一些东亚国家陷入了关于边界、航路和领土权利的主张和反制循环。

column1: So far, these disputes have remained basically peaceful, but tensions are rising.
column2: 到目前为止，这些纠纷基本上是和平的，但紧张态势在升级。

column1: We must hope that the countries of the region continue to see the great value of international law as a bulwark of sovereignty, and act accordingly.
column2: 我们必然希望该地区的国家依然珍视国际法作为主权保护屏障的巨大价值并遵守国际法。

column1: There have long been skeptics of international law – those who believe that it can never prevail over the national interests of major powers, and that maintaining a balance of power among competitors is all that really can be done to keep the peace.
column2: 对国际法的怀疑由来已久 — — 有些人认为国际法永远无法凌驾于大国的国家利益之上，维持竞争对手间的实力平衡才是维持和平唯一可行的办法。

column1: From this perspective, Russia’s actions in the Crimea are simply the actions of a great power asserting its prerogatives.
column2: 从这个角度讲，俄罗斯在克里米亚的行为只不过是强国在主张其特权。

column1: Yet such a world is profoundly and unnecessarily dangerous.
column2: 但这样的世界是极其危险的，也根本无须如此。

column1: We have learned time and again that there is no such thing as a true “balance of power.”
column2: 我们一再看到，没有真正的所谓“实力平衡 ” 。

column1: There are always imbalances and destabilizing power shifts.
column2: 失衡和破坏性实力变迁才是永恒。

column1: Without some scaffolding of law, open conflict is all too likely.
column2: 没有法律的约束，开放冲突随时都会发生。

column1: This is especially true today, as countries jostle for oil and other vital resources.
column2: 今天尤其如此，各国正在争相攫取石油和其他关键资源。

column1: It is no coincidence that most of the deadly wars of recent years have taken place in regions rich in valuable and contested natural resources.
column2: 近几年来，大部分伤亡惨重的战争都发生在富于宝贵和稀缺自然资源的地区，这不是巧合。

column1: As we look back in this centennial year toward the outbreak of WWI, we see again and again that the only possible route to safety is international law, upheld by the United Nations and respected on all sides.
column2: 今年是一战爆发一百周年纪念，回顾历史，我们一再看到，唯一可能的安全之路只有受联合国支持和各方尊重的国际法。

column1: Yes, it sounds naive, but no one has to look back to see the naiveté of the belief that great-power politics will preserve peace and ensure humanity’s survival.
column2: 是的，这听起来相当天真，但回顾历史，认为大国政治能维持和平、确保人类生存才是真的天真。

column1: In the Ukraine crisis, the Security Council should help to find a negotiated solution that preserves Ukraine’s sovereignty and territorial integrity.
column2: 在乌克兰危机中，安理会应该促进找出能保全乌克兰主权和领土完整的谈判解决方案。

column1: That will not happen soon, but the UN should persevere, looking for a breakthrough at a later date.
column2: 这不可能马上到来，但联合国应该坚持不懈，力争在晚些时候取得突破。

column1: And, just as the US turns to the Security Council in this case, so it should hold itself accountable to international law as well, helping to build a bulwark against dangerous global instability.
column2: 而正如美国在这场危机中回归安理会，它也应该让自己接受国际法的束缚，帮助建立防止危险的全球动荡的框架。

column1: Deep Decarbonization
column2: 深度脱碳

column1: NEW YORK – Have a look at what happened around the world this past month.
column2: 纽约—看看世界在即将过去的一个月中发生了什么。

column1: Australia’s heat wave filled headlines when temperatures reaching 45° Celsius disrupted the Australian Open tennis tournament.
column2: 澳大利亚45℃的热浪上了新闻，甚至影响了澳大利亚网球公开赛。

column1: California’s extreme drought forced the governor to declare a state of emergency.
column2: 加州极度干旱迫使州长宣布进入紧急状态。

column1: Major floods in Indonesia killed dozens and displaced tens of thousands.
column2: 印尼大洪水夺走了几十人的生命，并导致数万人流离失所。

column1: Beijing’s coal-induced smog forced people to stay in their homes, closed highways, and diverted flights.
column2: 北京煤炭引起的雾霾迫使人们不敢外出、高速公路关闭、航班延误。

column1: Such events are daily warnings to the world: wake up before it is too late.
column2: 这些事件无不在警告世界：再不警醒，悔之晚矣。

column1: We have entered the Age of Sustainable Development.
column2: 我们已经进入可持续发展时代。

column1: Either we make peace with the planet, or we destroy our hard-won prosperity.
column2: 要么与地球和平共处，要么摧毁得之不易的繁荣。

column1: The choice seems obvious, but our actions speak louder than words. Humanity continues on a path of ruin, driven by short-term greed and ignorance.
column2: 选择似乎是毫无疑问的，但所谓行胜于言，人类仍走在破坏的道路上，其背后的推动力是短期贪婪和无知。

column1: Much (though not all) of the global environmental crisis stems from the world’s fossil-fuel-based energy system.
column2: 许多（尽管不是全部）全球环境危机来自以化石燃料为基础的世界能源体系。

column1: More than 80% of all primary energy in the world comes from coal, oil, and gas.
column2: 全世界80%以上的初级能源来自煤炭、石油和天然气。

column1: When these fossil fuels are burned, they emit carbon dioxide, which in turn changes the Earth’s climate.
column2: 当这些化石燃料燃烧时，会释放二氧化碳，而二氧化碳会改变地球的气候。

column1: The basic physics has been known for more than a century.
column2: 其中的物理学原理我们一个世纪前就已经知晓了。

column1: Unfortunately, a few oil companies (ExxonMobil and Koch Industries are the most notorious) have devoted enormous resources to sowing confusion even where there is clear scientific consensus.
column2: 不幸的是，一小撮石油公司（埃克森美孚和柯氏工业集团（Koch Industries）是其中最臭名昭著者）花大力气混淆视听，哪怕科学界早已形成了共识。

column1: But, in order to save the planet we know, and to preserve the world’s food supply and the well-being of future generations, there is no alternative to shifting to a new, low-carbon energy system.
column2: 但是，为了拯救我们所熟悉的地球、保证世界粮食供应和子孙后代的福利，我们只有切换到新的低碳能源体系一途可走。

column1: There are three parts to this transition.
column2: 这一转变有三个部分。

column1: The first is improved energy efficiency, meaning that we should use much less energy to achieve the same level of well-being.
column2: 首先是改善能源效率，这意味着我们可以使用少得多的能源实现相同水平的福利。

column1: For example, we can design our buildings to use sunlight and natural-air circulation so that they require far less commercial energy for heating, cooling, and ventilation.
column2: 比如，我们可以设计利用阳光和天然空气循环的建筑，这样就可以使用少得多的商业能源用于制热、制冷和通风。

column1: Second, we need to shift to solar, wind, hydro, nuclear, geothermal, and other forms of energy that are not based on fossil fuels.
column2: 其次，我们需要转向太阳能、风能、水能、核能、地热能和其他形式的不基于化石燃料的能源。

column1: The technology exists to use these alternatives safely, affordably, and at a scale large enough to replace almost all of the coal, and much of the oil, that we use today.
column2: 我们已经用了技术可以以安全、廉价和足够大的规模使用这些替代能源取代几乎所有我们现在所使用的煤炭和大部分的石油。

column1: Only natural gas (the cleanest-burning fossil fuel) would remain a significant source of energy by mid-century.
column2: 只有天然气（最清洁的化石燃料）将继续充当主要能源来源直到本世纪中叶。

column1: Finally, to the extent that we continue to rely on fossil fuels, we must capture the resulting CO2 emissions at power plants before they escape into the atmosphere.
column2: 最后，由于我们要继续依赖化石燃料，因此我们必须捕捉发电厂产生的二氧化碳而不让它们逃逸到大气中。

column1: The captured CO2 would then be injected underground or under the ocean floor for safe long-term storage.
column2: 捕捉到的二氧化碳可以注入地下或海地，做长期的安全储藏。

column1: Carbon capture and sequestration (CCS) is already being used successfully on a very small scale (mainly to enhance oil recovery in depleted wells).
column2: 碳捕捉和隔离（CCS）已经实现了相当小规模的成功应用（主要用于枯竭油井的油气回收 ） 。

column1: If (and only if) it proves successful for large-scale use, coal-dependent countries like China, India, and the United States could continue to use their reserves.
column2: 当（且仅当）CCS可以成功地得到大规模应用时，中国、印度和美国等依赖煤炭的国家便（才）可以继续使用它们的储量。

column1: American politicians have proved to be incapable of designing policies to shift the US to low-carbon energy use.
column2: 美国政客证明他们在设计让美国转向低碳能源使用方面的政策上十分无能。

column1: Such policies would include a rising tax on CO2 emissions, large-scale research-and-development efforts in low-carbon technologies, a shift to electric vehicles, and regulations to phase out all coal-fired power plants except those that install CCS.
column2: 这些政策应该包括提高二氧化碳排放税、大规模低碳技术研发、推广电动汽车以及通过监管取缔纯火电厂（除非它们采用了CCS ） 。

column1: Yet politicians are pursuing none of these policies adequately.
column2: 但政客在所有这些政策上都没有充分的作为。

column1: Climate-change foes have spent billions of dollars to influence policymakers, support election campaigns by defenders of fossil fuels, and defeat candidates who dare to promote clean energy.
column2: 气候变化的生产者花了数十亿美元影响决策者、支持化石燃料捍卫者的竞选活动、拆敢于推广清洁能源的候选人的台。

column1: The Republican Party as a whole attracts massive financial support from opponents of decarbonization, and these donors aggressively fight even the smallest step toward renewable energy.
column2: 总体而言，共和党获得了来自脱碳反对派的巨额金融支持，这些赞助者积极地与哪怕是最微小的迈向可再生能源的步伐做着斗争。

column1: For their part, many Democratic members of the US Congress are also in the pro-fossil-fuel camp.
column2: 美国国会中的很多民主党议员和站在亲化石燃料阵营。

column1: A few big players in the energy industry, showing no concern for truth (much less for our children, who will bear the consequences of our present folly), have teamed up with Rupert Murdoch.
column2: 能源业的一些巨头无视事实（更不为我们的孩子们考虑，他们将承担我们现在的荒唐行为的后果 ） ， 与鲁珀特·默多克（Rupert Murdoch）勾结在一起。

column1: Indeed, Murdoch, the Koch Brothers, and their allies behave just like Big Tobacco in denying scientific truths; even use the same experts for hire.
column2: 事实上，默多克、柯氏兄弟和他们的盟友在否认科学事实方面与大烟草公司是一丘之貉，甚至他们聘请的专家都是同一批人。

column1: The situation is generally the same around the world.
column2: 全世界面临的局面总体上是一样的。

column1: Wherever powerful lobbies defend existing coal or oil interests, politicians typically are afraid to tell the truth about the need for low-carbon energy.
column2: 在权势游说集团捍卫现有煤炭和石油利益的地方，政客通常不敢告诉人民需要低碳能源的真相。

column1: Brave politicians who do tell the truth about climate change are found mainly in countries that do not have a powerful fossil-fuel lobby.
column2: 勇敢说出气候变化真相的政客往往存在于不存在权势化石燃料游说集团的国家。

column1: Consider the fate of one courageous exception to this rule.
column2: 以这一规则的一个勇敢的挑战者的命运为例。

column1: Kevin Rudd, the former Australian prime minister, tried to implement a clean-energy policy in his coal-producing country.
column2: 澳大利亚前总理陆克文试图实施一项清洁能源政策。 而他的国家是一个产煤国。

column1: Rudd was defeated in his re-election bid by a candidate whose backing from an alliance of Murdoch and coal companies enabled him to outspend Rudd by a huge margin.
column2: 陆克文在连任竞争中败给了一位背后有默多克和煤炭公司支持的候选人。 后两者的支持让他以压倒性优势战胜了陆克文。

column1: Murdoch’s tabloids pump out anti-scientific propaganda opposing climate-change policies not only in Australia, but also in the US and elsewhere.
column2: 默多克旗下的报纸大量灌输反对气候变化政策的反科学宣传，不仅在澳大利亚如此，在美国和其他国家也如此。

column1: The reason all of this matters is that the path to deep decarbonization is open to us.
column2: 所有这些之所以事关重大，是因为深度脱碳之路是一条开放之路。

column1: Yet time is very short.
column2: 但时间不等人。

column1: The world needs to stop building new coal-fired power plants (except those that implement CCS) and to shift to low-carbon electricity.
column2: 世界必须停止建设新的火电厂（除非采取CCS）并转向低碳电能。

column1: It needs to phase out the internal combustion engine for almost all new passenger vehicles by around 2030, shifting to vehicles powered by electricity.
column2: 世界必须在2030年左右彻底淘汰使用内燃机的新造乘用车，采用电动汽车。

column1: And it needs to adopt energy-saving technologies that consume less commercial energy.
column2: 世界还必须采取能源节约技术以更少地使用商业能源。

column1: The technologies are available and will get better and cheaper with use, if only fossil-fuel lobbies can be held at bay.
column2: 技术已经存在，并将变得更出色、更廉价，要是能成功抵制化石燃料游说集团就更好了。

column1: If this happens, people around the world will discover something wonderful.
column2: 果真如此的话，全世界人民将会发现美好的新事物。

column1: Not only will they have saved the planet for the next generation; they will also enjoy sunshine and clean, healthy air.
column2: 他们不但为下一代挽救了地球；还享受到了阳光和清洁健康的空气。

column1: And they will ask what took so long when the Earth itself was at dire risk.
column2: 他们会问，在地球岌岌可危时，是什么让人们拖延了这么久才采取行动。

column1: Let the Middle East Govern Itself
column2: 让中东自治

column1: NEW YORK – It is time for the United States and other powers to let the Middle East govern itself in line with national sovereignty and the United Nations Charter.
column2: 纽约—美国和其他强国应该让中东根据国家主权和《联合国宪章》自治（govern itself）了。

column1: As the US contemplates yet another round of military action in Iraq and intervention in Syria, it should recognize two basic truths.
column2: 美国正在考虑新一轮伊拉克军事行动和叙利亚干预，眼下它应该认识到两大基本事实。

column1: First, US interventions, which have cost the country trillions of dollars and thousands of lives over the past decade, have consistently destabilized the Middle East, while causing massive suffering in the affected countries.
column2: 首先，美国的干预在过去十年里耗费了数万亿美元和数千条人命，却一直在动摇中东，给受影响国家造成了巨大灾难。

column1: Second, the region’s governments – in Syria, Saudi Arabia, Turkey, Iran, Iraq, Egypt, and elsewhere – have both the incentive and the means to reach mutual accommodations.
column2: 其次，该地区的各国政府 — — 叙利亚、沙特阿拉伯、土耳其、伊朗、伊拉克、埃及等 — — 有动力也有办法达成互相妥协。

column1: What is stopping them is the belief that the US or some other outside power (such as Russia) will deliver a decisive victory on their behalf.
column2: 让它们无法达成妥协的是这样一种观点：美国或其他外部势力（如俄罗斯）会代表它们带来决定性胜利。

column1: When the Ottoman Empire collapsed at the end of World War I, the great powers of the day, Britain and France, carved out successor states in order to ensure their control over the Middle East’s oil, geopolitics, and transit routes to Asia.
column2: 一战结束，奥斯曼帝国崩溃，当时的列强英国和法国根据它们控制中东石油、地缘政治和至亚洲运输线路的需要划分新的国家。

column1: Their cynicism – reflected, for example, in the Sykes-Picot Agreement – established a lasting pattern of destructive outside meddling.
column2: 它们的猜忌 — — 体现于赛克斯-皮科协定（Sykes-Picot Agreement）中 — — 造成了持续不断的破坏性外部干预。

column1: With America’s subsequent emergence as a global power, it treated the Middle East in the same way, relentlessly installing, toppling, bribing, or manipulating the region’s governments, all the while mouthing democratic rhetoric.
column2: 随后美国崛起成为超级大国，它对待中东的方式并未改变，鲁莽地扶持、颠覆、贿赂或操纵地区各国政府，每一次都打折民主的口号。

column1: For example, less than two years after Iran’s democratically elected parliament and prime minister, Mohammad Mossadegh, nationalized the Anglo-Iranian Oil Company in 1951, the US and Britain used their secret services to topple Mossadegh and install the incompetent, violent, and authoritarian Shah Reza Pahlavi.
column2: 比如，1951年，在通过民主选举成为伊朗总理不到两年的摩萨德（Mohammad Mossadegh）对盎格鲁-伊朗石油公司（Anglo-Iranian Oil Company）实施了国有化，结果美国和英国通过秘密特工颠覆了摩萨德，扶持了一个拙劣、暴力、极权的巴拉维（Shah Reza Pahlav ） 。

column1: Not surprisingly, the Islamic Revolution that overthrew the Shah in 1979 brought a wave of virulent anti-Americanism in its wake.
column2: 毫不奇怪，1979年推翻巴拉维的伊斯兰革命掀起了一股致命的反美旋风。

column1: Rather than seeking rapprochement, however, the US supported Saddam Hussein during Iraq’s eight-year war with Iran in the 1980s.
column2: 但是，美国并没有寻求重建外交关系，而是在20世纪80年代伊拉克与伊朗的八年战争中支持了萨达姆。

column1: Iraq fared no better with the British and Americans.
column2: 伊拉克与英国和美国的关系也并不比伊朗融洽。

column1: Britain ruthlessly created a subservient Iraqi state after WWI, backing Sunni elites to control the majority Shia population.
column2: 一战后，英国残酷地建立了顺从的伊拉克国，支持逊尼派精英控制占多数的什叶派人口。

column1: After oil was discovered in the 1920s, Britain assumed control over the new oil fields, using military force as needed.
column2: 20世纪20年代石油被发现后，英国又控制了仅有的几个油田，必要时甚至不惜动用武力。

column1: The US supported the 1968 coup that brought the Ba’ath Party – and Saddam – to power.
column2: 在美国的支持下，1968年复兴党（Ba���ath Party）和萨达姆通过政变问鼎权力。

column1: With Saddam’s invasion of Kuwait in 1990, however, the US turned on him, and has been entwined in Iraq’s politics ever since, including two wars, sanction regimes, the toppling of Saddam in 2003, and repeated attempts, as recently as this month, to install a government that it considered acceptable.
column2: 但是，1990年萨达姆入侵科威特后，美国又把枪口对准了他，并且越来越深地干预伊拉克政治，包括发动两场战争、制裁伊拉克政府、2003年推翻萨达姆以及反复尝试（如这个月所发生的事情所证明的）扶持它认为可接受的政府。

column1: The result has been an unmitigated catastrophe: the destruction of Iraq as a functioning society in an ongoing civil war, fueled by outside powers, that has caused economic ruin and collapsing living standards.
column2: 结果造成了彻头彻尾的灾难：外部势力煽风点火的持续内战破坏了经济，大大打击了生活水平，伊拉克社会功能被彻底摧毁。

column1: Hundreds of thousands of Iraqis have died in the violence since 1990.
column2: 1990年以来，数十万伊拉克人死于暴力。

column1: Syria endured decades of French dominance after WWI, and then alternatingly hot and cold relations with the US and Europe since the 1960s.
column2: 在一战后的几十年里，叙利亚一直由法国主宰，随后，自20世纪60年代以来，与美国和欧洲保持着时冷时热的关系。

column1: During the past decade, the US and its allies have tried to weaken, and then, starting in 2011, to topple President Bashar al-Assad’s regime, mainly in a proxy war to undermine Iranian influence in Syria.
column2: 在过去十年中，美国及其盟友试图削弱总统巴沙尔·阿萨德政权，从2011年开始更是试图推翻他，主要方式是通过代理战争破坏伊朗对叙利亚的影响。

column1: The results have been devastating for the Syrian people.
column2: 结果是叙利亚人民都灾难。

column1: Assad remains in power, but more than 190,000 Syrians are dead and millions have been displaced as a result of an insurrection supported by the US and its allies (with Assad backed by Russia and Iran).
column2: 巴沙尔仍在掌权，但190,000多叙利亚人因为美国及其盟友所支持的暴乱（针对俄罗斯和伊朗所支持的巴沙尔）失去了生命，更有数百万人流离失所。

column1: Some US officials are now reportedly considering an alliance with Assad to fight the militant Islamic State, whose rise was enabled by the US-backed insurrection.
column2: 据说一些美国官员现在正在考虑与巴沙尔结盟与伊斯兰国进行军事对抗，而后者的崛起正是拜美国所支持的暴乱所赐。

column1: After decades of cynical and often secret interventions by the US, Britain, France, Russia, and other outside powers, the region’s political institutions are based largely on corruption, sectarian politics, and brute force.
column2: 在经历了几十年来自美国、英国、法国、俄罗斯和其他外部势力自私并且通常是秘密的干预后，该地区的政治制度可以说是建立在腐败、宗派政治和野蛮武力的基础上。

column1: Yet whenever a new Middle East crisis erupts, the latest being triggered by the Islamic State’s recent gains, the US intervenes again, perhaps to change a government (as it has just orchestrated in Iraq) or to launch a new bombing assault.
column2: 但每当新的中东危机爆发时 — — 最新的例子是伊斯兰国的狂飙突进 — — 美国就会再次干预，或者是改变政府（如刚刚在伊拉克所导演的 ） ， 或者是发动新一轮轰炸袭击。

column1: Backroom dealings and violence continue to rule the day.
column2: 幕后交易和暴力仍是日常规则。

column1: Pundits claim that Arabs cannot manage democracy.
column2: 专家们说，阿拉伯人没有能力管理民主。

column1: In fact, the US and its allies simply don’t like the results of Arab democracy, which all too often produces governments that are nationalist, anti-Israel, Islamist, and dangerous to America’s oil interests.
column2: 事实上，美国及其盟友根本不喜欢阿拉伯民主的结果 — — 通常产生民族主义、反以色列、伊斯兰教的政府，并对美国石油利益构成威胁。

column1: When the ballots go in that direction, the US simply ignores the election results (as it did, for example, in 2006, when Hamas won a large majority of the popular vote in Gaza).
column2: 当选举形势向这方面发展时，美国就会无视选举结果（比如，2006年哈马斯赢得加沙民选大胜时就是如此 ） 。

column1: The US cannot stop the spiral of violence in the Middle East.
column2: 美国无法结束中东的暴力循环。

column1: The damage in Libya, Gaza, Syria, and Iraq demands that a political solution be found within the region, not imposed from the outside.
column2: 利比亚、加沙、叙利亚和伊拉克的破坏需要在该地区内部寻找政治解决方案，而不是由外部强加。

column1: The UN Security Council should provide an international framework in which the major powers pull back, lift crippling economic sanctions, and abide by political agreements reached by the region’s own governments and factions.
column2: 联合国安理会应该提供一个国际框架让主要大国写上，取消后果严重的经济制裁，并遵守该地区各国政府和各派系之间自身达成的政治协议。

column1: Iran, Turkey, Egypt, Syria, Saudi Arabia, the UAE, and other neighbors know one another well enough – thanks to 2,000-plus years of trade and war – to sort out the pieces themselves, without interference from the US, Russia, and the former colonial powers of Europe.
column2: 伊朗、土耳其、埃及、叙利亚、沙特阿拉伯、阿联酋和其他邻国十分了解彼此 — — 这是2,000多年贸易和战争史的结果 — — 足以自力更生走出残局，不需要劳烦美国、俄罗斯和欧洲的其他前殖民国家。

column1: The countries of the Middle East have a common interest in starving hyper-violent groups like the Islamic State of arms, money, and media attention.
column2: 中东各国有着共同利益切断伊斯兰国等极端暴力组织的武器、资金和媒体关注。

column1: They also share an interest in keeping oil flowing to world markets – and in capturing the bulk of the revenues.
column2: 它们也有着共同利益让石油流向世界市场，并获得其中的大部分收入。

column1: I am not claiming that all will be well if the US and other powers pull back.
column2: 我并不是说美国和其他强国一走了之就万事大吉。

column1: There is enough hatred, corruption, and arms in the region to keep it in crisis for years to come.
column2: 中东地区存在着大量的仇恨、腐败和武器，足以在多年时间里让该地区处于危机状态。

column1: And nobody should expect stable democracies any time soon.
column2: 没有人可以期待很快就会出现稳定的民主。

column1: But lasting solutions will not be found as long as the US and other foreign powers continue to meddle in the region.
column2: 但只要美国和其他外部势力继续在中东搅局，就无法形成持久的解决方案。

column1: One hundred years after the start of WWI, colonial practices must finally come to an end.
column2: 一战爆发已经过去了一个世纪，殖民主义行为必须结束。

column1: The Middle East needs the opportunity to govern itself, protected and supported by the UN Charter, not by any individual great power.
column2: 中东需要自治的机会，并且这一机会应该得到《联合国宪章》而不是某个超级大国的保护和支持。

column1: Our Last Chance for a Safe Planet
column2: 拯救地球的最后机会

column1: MELBOURNE – Humanity has just about run out of time to address climate change.
column2: 墨尔本—人类再不解决气候变化问题就快没有时间了。

column1: Scientists have pointed out that a rise in temperature of 2º Celsius above pre-industrial levels will put the Earth in dangerous, uncharted territory.
column2: 科学家指出，如若气温较前工业化水平升高2℃，地球就将进入前所未知的危险状态。

column1: Yet we currently are on a path toward an increase of 4º or more this century.
column2: 但照现在的势头，到本世纪末气温将上升4℃。

column1: The last chance for action has arrived.
column2: 我们面临着采取行动的最后机会。

column1: That chance lies in Paris in December 2015, when the world’s governments meet for the 21st annual United Nations climate-change meeting.
column2: 这一机会就在2015年的巴黎，世界各国政府将在此召开第21届联合国气候变化年会。

column1: But this time will be different.
column2: 但这次年会有所不同。

column1: Either governments will agree to decisive action, as they have promised, or we will look back at 2015 as the year when climate sanity slipped through our fingers.
column2: 各国政府必须如承诺的那样同意采取果断行动，否则从未来回头望，2015年将是我们彻底丧失清醒的气候意识之年。

column1: In 1992, the world’s governments adopted the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change, promising to avoid “dangerous anthropogenic [human-induced] interference in the climate system” by reducing the rate of emission of greenhouse gases, especially carbon dioxide.
column2: 1992年，世界政府通过了联合国气候变化框架公约（UN Framework Convention on Climate Change ） ， 承诺通过削减温室气体特别是二氧化碳排放避免“对气候系统的危险的人为干预 ” 。

column1: But, though the treaty entered into force in 1994, the rate of emissions of greenhouse gases, including CO2, has actually increased.
column2: 但是，尽管该条约从1994年开始生效，但温室气体包括二氧化碳的排放速度实际上有所增加。

column1: In 1992, global combustion of coal, oil, and gas, plus cement production, released 22.6 billion tons of CO2 into the air.
column2: 1992年，全��煤炭、石油和天然气燃烧加上水泥生产总共向大气中释放了226亿吨二氧化碳。

column1: In 2012, the most recent year for which comparable data are available, emissions were 34.5 billion tons.
column2: 2012年（可获得可比数据的最近年份 ） ， 排放量是345亿吨。

column1: Humanity has accelerated, rather than controlled, human-induced climate change.
column2: 人类正在加速而不是控制人为气候变化。

column1: This is now the greatest moral issue of our time.
column2: 这就是现时代的道德大问题。

column1: Global fossil-fuel use gravely threatens the poor, who are the most vulnerable to climate change (though the rich are the main cause), and future generations, who will inherit a planet that has become unlivable in many places, with food supply subject to massive shocks.
column2: 全球化石燃料使用大大地威胁到穷人（他们是最易受气候变化影响的群体，尽管富人才是引起气候变化的主因）和子孙后代（他们将继承一个许多地方不再适合居住的地球，粮食供应也将受到巨大冲击 ） 。

column1: We are causing this harm in an age when technological breakthroughs enable the world to shift from dangerous fossil fuels to low-carbon energy sources, such as wind, solar, nuclear, and hydro, and reduce the impact of fossil fuels by using carbon capture and storage (CCS) technology.
column2: 而在造成这一伤害的同一时代，科技突破使世界能够从危险的化石燃料转向低碳能源资源，如风能、太阳能、核能和水能，并且通过碳捕捉和存储（CCS）技术减少化石燃料的影响。

column1: Pope Francis recently put it just right: “Safeguard Creation,” he said. “Because if we destroy Creation, Creation will destroy us!
column2: 方济各教皇最近正确地指出 ： “ 捍卫造化 ， ” 他说 ， “ 因为如果我们摧毁造化，造化也会摧毁我们！

column1: Never forget this!”
column2: 切记切记 ！ ”

column1: Yet, for the many powerful interests, climate change remains a game, with the goal being to delay action for as long as possible.
column2: 但是，对许多强大的既得利益而言，气候变化仍然是一场博弈，目标是尽可能推迟行动。

column1: The giant fossil-fuel companies have continued to lobby behind the scenes against the shift to low-carbon energy, and have used their vast wealth to buy media coverage designed to sow confusion.
column2: 化石燃料巨头公司继续在幕后游说阻止转向低碳能源，并利用巨大的财力收买媒体混淆视听。

column1: Rupert Murdoch’s media empire in the United States, the United Kingdom, Australia, and elsewhere stands out as playing a particularly cynical and harmful role in spreading anti-scientific propaganda.
column2: 在美国、英国、澳大利亚和其他地方，鲁珀特·默多克（Rupert Murdoch）的媒体帝国充当着传播反科学宣传的急先锋。

column1: Even so, the politics of climate change may be changing for the better – a change reflected in the Pope’s forceful message.
column2: 尽管如此，气候变化的政治仍可能在向好的方向发展 — — 教皇的训令即是明证。

column1: Here are six reasons why the stalemate might soon end.
column2: 有六大理由可以认为停滞不前的状态马上就会结束。

column1: First, the world is waking up to the calamity that we are causing.
column2: 首先，世界正在警醒我们正在造成的灾难。

column1: Though the Murdoch propaganda machine churns out a daily stream of anti-scientific falsehoods, the public also sees prolonged droughts (now in parts of Brazil, California, and Southeast Asia, to name a few places), massive floods (recently in Bosnia and Serbia), and lethal heat waves (in many parts of the world).
column2: 尽管默多克的宣传机器每天都在炮制反科学谎言，但公众也目睹了挥之不去的旱灾（目前正在巴西、加州、东南亚等地区肆虐 ） 、 大洪水（波斯尼亚和塞尔维亚）和致命热浪（世界多地 ） 。

column1: Second, the world’s citizens do not want to go down in flames.
column2: 其次，世界人民不希望看到地球毁灭。

column1: Public opinion has so far succeeded in blocking the construction of the Keystone XL Pipeline, which would accelerate the production of Canada’s oil sands – a shocking prospect, given that neither Canada nor the US yet have committed to a climate plan.
column2: 民意已成功地抵制了加速加拿大油砂生产的Keystone XL管道 — — 该项目是十分危险的，因为加拿大和美国都没有做出气候计划承诺。

column1: Third, more severe climate shocks may lie ahead.
column2: 第三，更严重的气候冲击摆在我们面前。

column1: This year could prove to be a major El Niño year, when the waters of the Eastern Pacific warm and create global climate disruptions.
column2: 今年可能是厄尔尼诺之年，东太平洋的海水会升温，造成全球气候扰动。

column1: A big El Niño now would be even more dangerous than usual, because it would add to the overall rising trend in global temperatures.
column2: 如今，大型厄尔尼诺现象的危害将比以往更甚，因为这会进一步加剧全球气温升高的总体趋势。

column1: Indeed, many scientists believe that a big El Niño could make 2015 the hottest year in the Earth’s history.
column2: 事实上，许多科学家认为大型厄尔尼诺现象将让2015年成为地球历史上最热的年份。

column1: Fourth, both the US and China, the two largest emitters of CO2, are finally beginning to get serious.
column2: 第四，最大的两个二氧化碳排放国 — — 美国和中国最终开始认真对待这一问题。

column1: President Barack Obama’s administration is trying to stop the construction of new coal-fired power plants, unless they are equipped with CCS technology.
column2: 奥巴马总统政府试图停滞新煤电站的建设，除非采用CCS技术。

column1: China, for its part, has realized that its heavy dependence on coal is causing such devastating pollution and smog that it is leading to massive loss of life, with life expectancy down as much as five years in regions with heavy coal consumption.
column2: 中国也认识到其对煤炭的严重依赖正在造成了能导致重大生命损失的灾难性的污染和雾霾，主要煤炭消费地区预期寿命将下降五年之多。

column1: Fifth, the Paris negotiations are finally beginning to attract global attention from both the public and world leaders.
column2: 第五，巴黎谈判终于开始吸引包括公众和世界领袖在内的全球目光。

column1: UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon has called for political leaders to attend a special summit in September 2014, 14 months ahead of the Paris meeting, to launch intensive negotiations.
column2: 联合国秘书长潘基文呼吁政治领导人出席2014年9月（巴黎会议前14个月）举行的特别峰会，开战密集谈判。

column1: The UN expert network that I direct, the Sustainable Development Solutions Network (UN SDSN), will issue a major report in July on how each of the major economies can successfully decarbonize the energy system.
column2: 由我牵头的联合国专家网络 — — 可持续发展方案网络（Sustainable Development Solutions Network）将在7月发布重要报告，指出各主要经济体应如何实现能源体系的去碳化。

column1: Finally, technological advances in low-carbon energy systems, including photovoltaics, electric vehicles, CCS, and fourth-generation nuclear power with greatly enhanced safety features, all help make the transition to low-cost, low-carbon energy technologically realistic, with huge benefits for human health and planetary safety.
column2: 最后，低碳能源体系的技术进步，包括光伏电池、电动汽车、CCS和安全性能显著增强的第四代核电，都有助于实现向低成本、低碳能源技术的转型，人类健康和地球安全将大受裨益。

column1: Starting this fall, the UN SDSN will create a platform for all global citizens to participate in the hard work of saving the planet.
column2: 从今年秋季开始，联合国SDSN将打造一个平台方便全体地球公民参与拯救地球的艰巨事业中。

column1: The SDSN will offer a free, online introductory course to climate change, and then host a global online “negotiation” of a global climate agreement.
column2: SDSN将提供免费的在线介课程介绍气候变化，并组织全球气候协议的全球在线“谈判 ” 。

column1: We expect that hundreds of thousands, perhaps millions, of interested citizens worldwide will participate online, showing the way for the politicians.
column2: 我们期待能有几十万甚至几百万有兴趣的世界公民在线参与，向政客表达民意。

column1: The control of climate change is a moral imperative and a practical necessity – far too important to be left to politicians, Big Oil, and their media propagandists.
column2: 控制气候变化既是道德需求，也是现实必要 — — 这个重要任务不能只由政客、石油巨头及其媒体宣传机器参与。

column1: The Oligarchy Fallacy
column2: 寡头政治的谬误

column1: CAMBRIDGE – Income inequality has received a lot of attention lately, particularly in two arenas where it previously received little: American public debate and the International Monetary Fund.
column2: 坎布里奇 — — 近来尤其在美国公众辩论和国际货币基金组织这两个以往关注较少的领域，收入不平等现象已经引起了人们的普遍关注。

column1: A major reason is concern in the United States that income inequality has returned to Gilded Age extremes; but inequality has increased in many other parts of the world as well, and remains high in Latin America.
column2: 人们担忧的主要原因是美国的收入不平等已经回到了镀金时代的极端状况；但是在世界其他国家不平等现象愈演愈烈的同时，拉美的不平等依然没有缓和的迹象。

column1: What have we learned so far?
column2: 到目前为止我们吸取了哪些教训？

column1: Perhaps what is most interesting about the current discussion is that much of the focus has been on the consequences of inequality beyond its adverse effect on the welfare of the poor.
column2: 或许目前讨论中最有趣的一点是人们最看重不平等在穷人福祉以外的负面效果。

column1: One such avenue of debate starts from the hypothesis that inequality is bad for overall economic growth.
column2: 辩论的焦点之一是假设不平等不利于总体经济增长。

column1: Another begins with the view that inequality leads to volatility and instability.
column2: 另一个焦点是不平等破坏稳定，导致经济出现动荡。

column1: Did inequality cause, for example, the subprime mortgage crisis of 2007 and hence the global financial crisis of 2008?
column2: 比方说，不平等究竟是不是2007年次贷危机和2008年全球金融危机的幕后推手？

column1: A third proposition is that inequality translates into envy and unhappiness: someone who would have been happy at a given income is unhappy if he discovers that others are getting more.
column2: 另一个命题是不平等转化为嫉妒和不满：特定收入水平的人本来可能很高兴，但当他们发现别人拿得更多时高兴却变成了不满。

column1: A persuasive version of this claim holds that top executives demand and receive outlandish compensation not because they value the money so much, but because they compete with each other for status.
column2: 一种颇具说服力的观点认为高管对薪酬的离谱要求并非因为他们那么看重钱，而是为了地位而相互争斗。

column1: A fourth concern appears to trump even the first three.
column2: 最重要的莫过于第四种担忧。

column1: It is the fear that, because there is so much money in politics, the rich succeed in persuading governments to adopt policies that favor them as a class.
column2: 人们担心因为金钱在政界的作用越来越大，富人有能力说服政府采取偏袒其所在阶层的政策。

column1: Whereas the first three sources of concern are amenable to self-correction, at least in a democracy, the concentration of economic and political power in an oligarchy is self-reinforcing.
column2: 虽然至少民主国家有能力在一定程度上对前三个问题进行自我修正，但寡头体制下经济和政治权力的集中趋势却能够自我强化。

column1: In the US, recent Supreme Court decisions regarding campaign contributions suggest that the influence of money in politics will only grow.
column2: 美国最高法院有关政治献金案的最新裁决表明金钱对政治的影响力只会越来越大。

column1: But pursuing the anti-oligarchy argument is not the best way to reduce inequality.
column2: 但坚持反寡头论并非控制不平等的最好方法。

column1: Rather, we should work from the premise that poverty in particular, and inequality in general, is simply undesirable.
column2: 我们的出发点应当是贫困和一般意义上的不平等根本是不可取的。

column1: Even in the US, most voters care about inequality, and even among the top 1%, approximately two-thirds believe that income differences are too large and support progressive taxation.
column2: 美国多数选民也关注不平等，甚至就连排名前1%的富人有三分之二也认为收入差距过大并支持累进税制。

column1: Most Americans believe in helping the less fortunate, provided that it can be accomplished without undermining economic efficiency through excessive government intervention or distortion of incentives.
column2: 只要不因为政府过度干预破坏经济效率或改变激励原则，绝大多数美国人都相信应该对不幸群体施以援手。

column1: The problem is that, despite their economic self-interest, voters often elect, and reelect, politicians who enact laws that are inconsistent with such goals.
column2: 问题在于虽然有悖于自身经济利益，但选民却往往会一再选出制定有悖于上述目标法律的政治家。

column1: Ten years ago, for example, America’s elected leaders somehow hoodwinked the median US voter – who is most likely to leave little to his or her heirs – into believing that it was necessary to eliminate taxes on $5 million estates in order to protect small family-owned farms.
column2: 比如10年前，美国的当选领导人不知采用何种手段蒙蔽了美国最可能没有遗产留给子女的中间选民，让他们相信必须取消5亿房地产税才能保护家庭小型农场。

column1: In other words, the problem is not that the median voter is unwilling to trade off growth in exchange for more equality.
column2: 换句话说，问题并不是中间选民不愿牺牲增长换取更多平等。

column1: The problem is that the political process produces outcomes that deliver both less growth and less equality.
column2: 问题在于政治进程产生出既牺牲增长又影响平等的结果。

column1: For the US, the most sensible measures include expansion of the Earned Income Tax Credit (EITC), elimination of payroll taxes for low-income workers, a cut in deductions for high-income taxpayers, and restoration of higher inheritance taxes.
column2: 具体到美国而言，最明智的措施包括扩大实施劳动收入税收抵免政策（EITC ） 、 取消对低收入工人征收工资税、减少对高收入纳税者的税收减免及恢复较高额度的遗产税征收。

column1: These are policies that reduce inequality efficiently, at relatively low cost to aggregate income.
column2: 上述政策能有效缩短贫富差距，同时对总收入的影响也相对较小。

column1: Other policies – including universal pre-school education and universal health care – may even promote overall economic growth while reducing inequality, especially if they are financed by efficiency-enhancing measures such as the elimination of fossil-fuel subsidies (and, preferably, their replacement with a tax).
column2: 尤其如果同时采取取消化石燃料补贴（最好能以某种税收取代）等提高效率的举措，包括普及型学前教育和普及型医保在内的其他政策或许甚至能在缓和不平等的同时促进总体经济增长。

column1: Meanwhile, many government programs that are billed as ways to improve income distribution benefit the poor relatively little and impair economic efficiency.
column2: 此外，许多被标榜为改善收入分配的计划不仅有损于经济效率，而且也让穷人受益极少。

column1: The original rationale for agricultural subsidies was largely to help small farmers, but the main beneficiary has long been agribusiness.
column2: 农业补贴的最初理念主要是扶助小型农户，但农业综合企业却一向是上述政策的主要受益者。

column1: Mortgage subsidies contributed to the subprime loan crisis, without even primarily helping lower-income families.
column2: 按揭补贴催生了次贷危机，但其甚至不是以帮助低收入家庭为主要目的的。

column1: And yet many Americans are persuaded to support such policies, not because it is in their interest, but because they do not understand the economics.
column2: 但很多美国人都被说服支持这样的政策，并不是因为这样做符合他们的利益，而是因为他们对经济问题不甚明了。

column1: Other countries have similar programs that are sold as pro-equality but are inefficient or even undermine their stated goal.
column2: 其他国家也存在类似打着平等幌子的政策，但实际不仅效率低下，甚至有损于既定目标。

column1: In developing countries, distortionary measures that tax, subsidize, or regulate food and energy prices tend to be poor tools for improving income distribution, and frequently have the opposite effect.
column2: 发展中国家扭曲的税收、补贴或食品及能源价格监管政策往往对改善收入分配不太有效，并且往往产生相反的效果。

column1: Of the more than $400 billion that countries spend on fossil fuel subsidies each year, for example, far less than 20% of the benefits go to the poorest 20% of the population.
column2: 举例来讲，在各国每年花在化石燃料补贴上的4000多亿美元中，只有远低于20%的份额最终能被最贫困的20%人口享受到。

column1: A disproportionately small share of social spending goes to the poorest 40%.
column2: 最贫困的40%人口享受到的社会支出同样低得不成比例。

column1: Conditional cash transfers, on the other hand, have proven highly effective; they reach the poor while promoting education and health.
column2: 另一方面，事实证明有条件转移支付非常有效；它们能够惠及穷人，同时改善教育和医疗状况。

column1: The anti-oligarchy argument claim is that the rich have too much money, which they use to elect politicians who will enact laws that favor their interests.
column2: 反寡头政治论主张富人太过有钱，他们会用这些钱选出制定法律照顾其自身利益的政客。

column1: But it seems better to argue about the best policies to improve income distribution efficiently, and to point out which politicians support them.
column2: 但我认为探讨有效改善收入分配的政策、并指出哪些政客支持这些政策其实效果更好。

column1: “Yes” to the EITC and pre-school education; “no” to subsidies for oil, agriculture, and mortgage debt.
column2: 这意味着赞成劳动收入税收抵免和学前教育政策；对石油、农业和抵押债务补贴政策投反对票。

column1: The alternative to such engagement is a very roundabout strategy that would achieve more enlightened policies by weakening the ability of the rich to buy votes.
column2: 还有一种替代方案是采取迂回策略，通过削弱富人购买选票的能力来推进更开明的政策。

column1: However important that goal may be, attaining it requires reducing the share of income that goes to the rich by addressing inequality, which requires pursuing pro-equality policies, like the EITC and pre-school education.
column2: 但无论那个目标有多重要，它的实现需要通过解决不平等问题控制富人所得到的收入，而这反过来又需要实行以劳动收入税收抵免和学前教育为代表的促进平等的政策。

column1: Is complaining about oligarchy really a more effective strategy for achieving these policies than arguing the case for them directly?
column2: 从策略上讲，难道抱怨寡头政治真的比直接为穷人说话更加有效？

column1: The Dollar and Its Rivals
column2: 美元和它的对手

column1: CAMBRIDGE – Since 1976, the US dollar’s role as an international currency has been slowly waning.
column2: 美国剑桥—1976年以来，美元作为国际货币的角色一直在缓慢减弱。

column1: International use of the dollar to hold foreign-exchange reserves, denominate financial transactions, invoice trade, and as a vehicle in currency markets is below its level during the heyday of the Bretton Woods era, from 1945 to 1971.
column2: 国际上用美元作为外汇储备、为金融交易计价、结算贸易以及货币市场载体的程度还不如1945—1971年布雷顿森林时代的鼎盛期。

column1: But most people would be surprised by what the most recent numbers show.
column2: 但大部分人会对最新数字所揭示的东西感到震惊。

column1: There is an abundance of explanations for the downward trend.
column2: 对于这一衰落趋势，解释层出不穷。

column1: Since the Vietnam War, US budget deficits, money creation, and current-account deficits have often been high.
column2: 自越战以来，美国的预算赤字、货币创造和经常项目赤字总是非常高。

column1: Presumably as a result, the dollar has lost value relative to other major currencies or in terms of purchasing power.
column2: 美元相对其他主要货币的价值或者美元的购买力有所损失也不足为奇。

column1: Meanwhile, the US share of global output has declined.
column2: 与此同时，美国站全球产出的份额也有所下降。

column1: And, most recently, the disturbing willingness of some members of the US Congress to pursue a strategy that would cause the Treasury to default on legal obligations has undermined global confidence in the dollar’s privileged status.
column2: 而在最近，美国国会的一些议员有一种危险的意图 — — 追求将导致财政部对其法定债务违约的战略，这影响了全球对美元特权地位的信心。

column1: Moreover, some emerging-market currencies are joining the club of international currencies for the first time.
column2: 此外，一些新兴市场货币正在首次进入国际货币俱乐部。

column1: Indeed, some analysts have suggested that the Chinese renminbi may rival the dollar as the leading international currency by the end of the decade.
column2: 事实上，一些分析师指出，到这个十年结束时，人民币可能挑战美元作为领先国际货币的地位。

column1: But the dollar’s status as an international currency has not fallen uniformly.
column2: 但美元作为国际货币的地位并没有一路下降。

column1: Interestingly, the periods when the public is most concerned about the issue do not coincide with the periods when the dollar’s share in international transactions is in fact falling.
column2: 有趣的是，公众最担心这一问题的时期往往并不是美元在国际交易中的份额下降的时期。

column1: By the criteria of international use as a reserve currency among central banks and as a vehicle in foreign-exchange markets, the most rapid declines took place from 1978 to 1991 and from 2001 to 2010.
column2: 以作为各央行储备货币的国际使用以及作为外汇市场载体的标准看，美元坠落速度最快的阶段是1978—1991年和2001—2010年。

column1: Between these two intervals, from 1992 to 2000, there was a clear reversal of the trend, notwithstanding a popular orgy of dollar declinism around the middle of that decade.
column2: 在这两个时期之间，即1992—2000年，美元的衰落之势出现了显而易见的反转，尽管在这个十年中间美元衰落论甚嚣尘上。

column1: Central banks held only an estimated 46% of their foreign-exchange reserves in dollars in 1992, but that share rebounded to almost 70% by 2000.
column2: 1992年，在各国央行所持有的外汇储备中，大概只有46%是美元，但在2000年这一比例上升到约70 % 。

column1: Subsequently, the long-term downward trend resumed.
column2: 接着，长期衰落之势恢复。

column1: According to one estimate, the dollar’s share in central-banks’ foreign reserves declined from about 70% in 2001 to barely 60% in 2010.
column2: 根据一项估算，美元在央行外汇储备中所占比重从2001年的约70%下降到2010年的60%略多。

column1: During the same decade, its share in the foreign-exchange market also declined: the dollar constituted one side or the other in 90% of foreign-exchange trades in 2001, but only 85% in 2010.
column2: 在同一时期，美元占外汇市场的比重也有所下降：2001年，以美元为一方的交易占外汇交易的90 % ， 到2010年，这一比例为85 % 。

column1: The International Monetary Fund’s most recent statistics suggest, unexpectedly, another pause in the dollar’s long-term decline.
column2: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）的最新数字表明，出乎意料，美元的长期衰落之势再一次停了下来。

column1: According to the IMF, the dollar’s share in foreign-exchange reserves stopped falling in 2010 and has been flat since then.
column2: 根据IMF的数据，美元占外汇储备的比重在2010年停止下降，此后一直保持稳定。

column1: If anything, the share is up slightly thus far in 2013.
column2: 2013年（到目前为止）还略有上升。

column1: Similarly, the Bank for International Settlements (BIS) reported in its recent triennial survey that the dollar’s share in the world’s foreign-exchange trades rose from 85% in 2010 to 87% in 2013.
column2: 类似地，国际清算银行（BIS）在其最新一期三年调查中指出美元占世界外汇交易的比重从2010年的85%提高到2013年的87 % 。

column1: Given dysfunctional US fiscal policy, the dollar’s resilience is surprising.
column2: 考虑到美国财政政策功能失调的状况，美元的恢复力令人吃惊。

column1: Or maybe we should no longer be surprised.
column2: 也许我们本不应该吃惊。

column1: After all, when the global financial crisis erupted in 2008 from the bowels of the American subprime-mortgage market, global investors responded by fleeing to the US, not from it.
column2: 毕竟，当美国次贷市场引发2008年全球金融危机时，全球投资者的反应是逃向美国，而不是从美国出逃。

column1: They obviously still regard US Treasury bills as a safe haven and the dollar as the top international currency, especially given the absence of good alternatives.
column2: 他们显然仍把美国国债视为安全港，把美元视为顶级国际货币，特别是在没有出色替代品的情况下。

column1: In particular, the euro has its own all-too-obvious problems.
column2: 特别地，欧元有其自身的一目了然的问题。

column1: Indeed, the euro’s share in reserve holdings and foreign-exchange transactions have both declined by several percentage points in the most recent statistics.
column2: 事实上，在最新的统计数字中，欧元在储备和外汇交易中的比重均下降了几个百分点。

column1: At the same time, the IMF’s data indicate that the vaunted renminbi is not yet among the top seven currencies in terms of central-bank reserve holdings.
column2: 与此同时，IMF数据表明，从央行储备货币角度讲，受到热捧的人民币还拍不到前七名。

column1: And, according to the BIS, while the renminbi has finally broken into the top ten currencies in foreign-exchange markets, it still accounts for only 2.2% of all transactions, just behind the Mexican peso’s 2.5% share.
column2: 而根据BIS的数据，尽管人民币终于进入了外汇市场前十名，但只占全部交易的2.2 % ， 还不如墨西哥比索的2.5 % 。

column1: Despite recent moves by the Chinese government, the renminbi still has a long way to go.
column2: 尽管中国政府最近出台了一些措施，但人民币还有很长的路要走。

column1: To try to explain the recent stabilization of the dollar’s status, one might note something that the last three years have in common with the previous period of temporary reversal from 1992 to 2000: striking improvements in the US budget deficit.
column2: 要想解释最近的美元地位趋稳之势，可以把注意力放在过去三年与1992—2000年衰落之势暂时扭转期间的相似之处：美国预算赤字大幅改善。

column1: By the end of the 1990’s, the record deficits of the 1980’s had been transformed into record surpluses; today, the federal deficit is less than half its 2010 level.
column2: 到20世纪90年代末，80年代创纪录的赤字变为创纪录的盈余；如今，联邦赤字也不到2010年水平的一半。

column1: Perhaps the fiscal observation is a coincidence.
column2: 也许这一财政现象是一种巧合。

column1: After all, it would be foolish to read too much into two historical data points.
column2: 毕竟，对两组历史数据点做过多解读是十分愚蠢的。

column1: It would be even more foolish to believe that just because American politicians have failed to dislodge the US dollar from its paramount status over the last 40 years, they could not accomplish the job with another few decades of effort.
column2: 更加愚蠢的是相信正如美国政客在过去四十年都破坏美元至高无上的地位，他们在今后几十年也无法做到。

column1: It is not an eternal law of nature that the dollar shall always be number one.
column2: 美元永远是第一，这决非宇宙真理。
