column1: The pound sterling had the top spot in the nineteenth century, only to be surpassed by the dollar in the first half of the twentieth century.
column2: 十九世纪拥有顶级地位的是英镑，但在二十世纪上半叶就被美元超越。

column1: The day may come when the dollar, too, succumbs to a rival. But today is not that day.
column2: 美元也有被后浪拍死在沙滩上的一天，但肯定不是今天。

column1: Absent America
column2: 缺席的美国

column1: CAMBRIDGE – The US Congress has now carelessly blocked a long-awaited reform of the International Monetary Fund.
column2: 发自剑桥 — — 美国国会草率地阻止了国际货币基金组织一项期待已久的改革。

column1: That would be bad enough if it were an isolated episode. But this is just the latest in a series of self-inflicted blows since the turn of the century that have needlessly undermined the United States’ claim to global leadership.
column2: 如果这只是一起孤立事件那也够糟糕的了，但这仅仅是自世纪之交以来一系列自毁行动的最新一起而已，对美国所企求的全球领导力造成了毫不必要的削弱。

column1: The IMF reform would have been an important step in updating the allocations of quotas, which determine member states’ monetary contributions and voting power.
column2: 国际货币基金组织的改革本是更新配额分配的重要一步，它决定了成员国货币的赞助额和投票权。

column1: The US was not being asked to contribute more money or lose its voting weight, which has always given it a unique veto power.
column2: 这并没有要求美国赞助更多或是降低其投票权重，以及一直给予它的特殊否决权。

column1: Instead, the proposed increase in quotas for China, India, Brazil, and other emerging economies would have come largely at the expense of European countries.
column2: 相反，提案所增加的中国，印度，巴西以及其他新兴经济体配额主要是通过缩小欧洲国家的相关配额来实现的。

column1: The change in IMF quotas is a partial and overdue response to the newcomers’ rising economic weight and Europe’s outdated dominance.
column2: 国际货币基金组织配额的变化是对新力量崛起以及欧洲统治衰落的一个局部而滞后的响应。

column1: Indeed, the principle of matching representation to countries’ contributions – sometimes known as the Golden Rule (“He who has the gold, rules”) – is probably one of the reasons that the IMF has usually been more effective than other international organizations (for example, the United Nations General Assembly).
column2: 事实上，把各国的赞助额与其责任相匹配的准则 — — 有时被称为黄金准则 （ “ 谁拥有黄金，谁制定规则 ” ） — — 也许是国际货币基金组织通常比其他国际组织（例如联合国大会）更有效的原因。

column1: To be sure, US President Barack Obama has tried to exercise global leadership.
column2: 无可否认，美国总统巴拉克·奥巴马试图实施全球领导。

column1: He pushed for the agreement to reform the IMF at the G-20 summit in Seoul in November 2010 (the first meeting to be hosted by a non-G-7 country), and he prevailed over understandable European reluctance to cede power.
column2: 他在2010年11月首尔G20峰会（第一届由非G7国家举办的会议）上推动改革国际货币基金组织的协议，并且成功说服了那些显然不愿放弃权力的欧洲国家。

column1: But congressional rejection of an international agreement that the president had painstakingly persuaded the rest of the world to accept is not a new pattern.
column2: 但是国会否决一个总统煞费苦心说服世界接受的国际协议可不是什么新鲜事。

column1: It goes back a century, to President Woodrow Wilson’s inability in 1919 to persuade a myopically isolationist Congress to approve the League of Nations.
column2: 这可以追溯到一个世纪以前，伍德罗·威尔逊总统在1919年就无法说服短视且奉行孤立主义的国会批准国际联盟成立。

column1: Since then, Congress has rejected the International Trade Organization (1948), the SALT II nuclear agreement (1979), and the Kyoto Protocol (1997), among others.
column2: 自那以后，国会否决过国际贸易组织（1948年 ） ， 《第二阶段限制战略武器条约 》 （ 1979年 ） ， 以及《京都议定书 》 （ 1997年）等等。

column1: A history of trying to reopen international negotiations that the executive has already concluded is also the reason why Congress has to give Obama so-called trade promotion authority (which entails fast-track congressional votes on trade agreements).
column2: 而历史上也不乏重开已关闭国际谈判的尝试，这也是为何国会必须向奥巴马授予所谓的“贸易促进授权 ” （ 以加快贸易协议方面的国会投票进程 ） 。

column1: Otherwise, America’s trading partners will not negotiate seriously in ongoing regional and global trade negotiations.
column2: 不然的话美国的贸易伙伴们就不会认真进行现有的区域和全球贸易谈判。

column1: Commentators have been warning since the 1980’s that the US may lose its global hegemony for economic reasons – budget deficits, a declining share of global GDP, and the switch from net international creditor to net debtor – with the historical hypothesis of imperial overreach gaining renewed attention.
column2: 自1980年代以来评论家们一直警告美国可能会由于经济上的原因 — — 预算赤字，全球GDP份额的下降，从净债权国变为净债务国 — — 而丢失其世界霸权，同时帝国过度扩张的历史假说也重新得到关注。

column1: But the main problem seems to be a lack of will rather than a thin wallet.
column2: 但主要的问题似乎是缺乏意愿而不是经济的匮乏。

column1: Or perhaps it would be more accurate to describe the problem as one of wild swings in US domestic politics between excessive isolationism and excessive foreign intervention in response to short-term events, and untempered by any longer-term historical perspective.
column2: 或者可以把问题更准确的描述为：美国国内政治在应对某些短期事件时在过度孤立主义和过度干涉行为之间大幅摇摆，并缺乏任何长期历史视角的指导。

column1: These days, after a decade of war in Iraq and Afghanistan at an estimated cost of $4 trillion (including the medical care that veterans will need for the rest of their lives), the pendulum has apparently swung back in the direction of isolationism.
column2: 到目前为止，也就是伊拉克和阿富汗战争结束十年以来，估计花费了4万亿美元（包括老兵们养老送终所需的医疗保健 ） ， 钟摆的方向显然已经回到孤立主义那一侧。

column1: One had hoped that the shortsighted members of Congress who foolishly shut down the US government three months ago had become aware of the damage caused to America’s credibility and global leadership.
column2: 人们希望，那些在三个月前愚蠢地让美国政府关门的，目光短浅的国会成员已经意识到该事件对美国造成的信誉和全球领导力的损害。

column1: Most visibly, the Obama administration had to cancel its participation at the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) summit in Bali in October, impeding progress on the US-led Trans-Pacific Partnership.
column2: 最明显的是，奥巴马政府不得不缺席十月在巴厘岛举行的亚太经济合作组织（APEC）峰会，阻碍了美国���主导的跨太平洋伙伴关系的进程。

column1: It was widely reported that Asian countries concluded from Obama’s absence that they should cultivate ties with China instead.
column2: 大量报道称，亚洲国家从奥巴马的缺席中得出结论：它们应该转而培养与中国的关系。

column1: The growing power of China and other major emerging-market countries is a reality.
column2: 中国以及其他主要新兴市场国家权力日益膨胀是一个现实。

column1: That is precisely why it is so important that the US support a greater role for these countries in international institutions such as the IMF, the G-20, and APEC.
column2: 这正是为何美国支持这些国家在国际货币基金组织，20国集团，亚太经合组织等国际机构承担更大作用是如此重要。

column1: The rise of China could go well or badly, depending in part on whether the status quo powers make room for the newcomer – a risk to international stability first noted by Thucydides, who traced the cause of the Peloponnesian War to Sparta’s response to the rising power of Athens.
column2: 中国的崛起是好是坏，在某种程度上取决于现有势力是否能为新人腾出空间 — — 这是最早被古希腊历史学家修昔底德所意识到的一项国际稳定风险，他发现伯罗奔尼撒战争的原因正是斯巴达对雅典力量崛起的回应。

column1: Likewise, failure to accommodate Germany’s rise contributed a century ago to the outbreak of World War I.
column2: 同样，一个世纪以前，对德国崛起的无法容纳导致了一战的爆发

column1: Though Chinese President Xi Jinping’s call for “a new type of great power relations” may sound anodyne, the phrase apparently demonstrates awareness of the “Thucydides trap.”
column2: 尽管中国国家主席习近平呼吁“一个新的大国关系模式”听起来很平淡无奇，但这句话显然表明了对“修昔底德陷阱”的警觉。

column1: It signals China’s openness to working with other countries to avoid a repetition of the tragedies of 431 BC and 1914 AD.
column2: 它体现出中国愿意与其他国家开放合作以避免重复公元前431年和公元1914年的大悲剧。

column1: It is only sensible to take him up on his offer.
column2: 唯一明智的方法就是接受他的提议。

column1: The continuing potential for US global leadership, despite America’s move from global creditor to debtor, has partly been a matter of luck.
column2: 除了从全球债权人变成了债务人之外，美国全球领导力的持续延续在某种程度上只是碰运气而已。

column1: In the Asia-Pacific region, historical and territorial frictions among Japan, Korea, and China have ensured that America’s presence remains more welcome than it otherwise would be.
column2: 在亚太地区，日本，韩国和中国的历史和领土摩擦保证了美国的存在仍然比它的缺席更受欢迎。

column1: Meanwhile, Europe’s fiscal follies have been even more egregious than America’s.
column2: 与此同时，欧洲财政政策的愚蠢程度甚至已经超过了美国。

column1: Asians are acutely aware that the IMF has intervened in the euro crisis with much greater support than it provided during the Asian financial crisis of 1997-98, and they understandably feel entitled to a larger say in how the Fund is run.
column2: 亚洲人清醒地意识到，国际货币基金组织在介入欧元危机时提供了比1997-1998年亚洲金融危机时期更多的支持，因此也顺理成章地认定应该对组织的运作有更多的话语权。

column1: But the emerging-market countries have been so disunited that in 2011 they failed to support a common candidate for IMF Managing Director.
column2: 但新兴市场国家是如此难以团结，以致在2011年它们未能推举自己的共同候选人去竞选国际货币基金组织主席的。

column1: As a result, though the three previous incumbents were Europeans who did not complete their terms in office, another European, Christine Lagarde, won the top spot yet again.
column2: 结果尽管前三任未能完成任期的主席都是欧洲人，但另一个欧洲人，克里斯蒂娜·拉加德再次夺得头把交椅。

column1: (Lagarde has done a good job, rather than kowtowing to Europe, but that is beside the point.)
column2: （拉加德工作非常出色，并没有对欧洲唯命是从，但这不是重点。 ）

column1: Latent global demand for enlightened US leadership, which first appeared at the end of World War I, can survive budgetary constraints and even misguided military interventions. What it cannot survive is an abdication of interest by the US Congress.
column2: 对美国开明领导的潜在全球需求最早始于第一次世界大战结束之时，并能在预算收缩甚至误入歧途的军事干预中保存下来，但却逃不过美国国会对这一利益的主动放弃。

column1: Fischer, the Fed, and US Growth
column2: 费希尔、美联储和美国的增长

column1: CAMBRIDGE – Now that Janet Yellen has been confirmed as Chair of the US Federal Reserve Board, attention has turned to her successor as Vice Chair.
column2: 美国剑桥—耶伦即将担任美国联邦储蓄委员会主席，于是人们的注意力转向了谁将接替她担任副主席。

column1: US President Barack Obama's choice, Stanley Fischer, was the perfect candidate, given his unique combination of skills, qualities, and experience.
column2: 斯坦利·费希尔（Stanley Fischer）是理想人选，因为他拥有无与伦比的技能、资质和经验组合。

column1: During his academic career, Fischer was one of the most accomplished scholars of monetary economics.
column2: 在学术生涯中，费希尔是货币经济学界成就最高的学者之一。

column1: He then served as Chief Economist of the World Bank, First Deputy Managing Director at the International Monetary Fund, and, most recently, as Governor of the Bank of Israel.
column2: 接着，他担任过世界银行首席经济学家、国际货币基金组织（IMF）第一副总裁，最近又担任了以色列银行行长。

column1: He starred in each of these positions.
column2: 在这些岗位上，费希尔都做出了斐然的成绩。

column1: Indeed, one has trouble thinking of another economist (at least since John Maynard Keynes) who has done as well as Fischer at combining analytical skill, sound policy judgment, clear expression, selfless dedication to improving the world, and the ability to get things done – with imperturbable good humor.
column2: 事实上，你很难想象还有哪位经济学家（至少从凯恩斯以来）能像费希尔那样完美结合了分析技能、可靠的政策判断、清晰的表达、对世界的无私奉献以及把事情做对的能力 — — 而且还具备了冷静幽默的特质。

column1: Moreover, Fischer gained extensive crisis-management experience during his tenure at the IMF in the 1990’s and as Israel’s central banker during the 2008-2009 global financial crisis.
column2: 此外，在20世纪90年代在IMF以及2008—2009全球金融危机中在以色列央行任职期间，费希尔积累了丰富的危机管理经验。

column1: That makes him an ideal match for Yellen, who is also an unusually accomplished academic and policymaker, but who is at her best when she has had a chance to prepare meticulously.
column2: 这使他成为耶伦的理想搭档。 耶伦也是成就卓著的学者和决策者，但在可以充分准备时，她从来不遗余力。

column1: Fischer’s qualities were acclaimed last month at the IMF’s Annual Research Conference by, among others, outgoing Fed Chairman Ben Bernanke, who in the 1970’s was one of Fischer’s many MIT doctoral students (as was I).
column2: 费希尔的素质在上个月的IMF研究年会上得到了广泛赞誉，即将卸任的美联储伯南克也致了赞辞，在20世纪70年代，他是费希尔的多位麻省理工学院博士生之一（算是我的同门师兄弟 ） 。

column1: The same conference has been much discussed for another reason: Larry Summers, Paul Krugman, and Fed officials each advanced provocative theses concerning the slow pace of economic growth in the United States and other advanced economies in recent years.
column2: 此次IMF研究年会因为另一个原因而广受关注：拉里·萨默斯（Larry Summers ） 、 保罗·克鲁格曼（Paul Krugman）和各美联储官员都讨论了近几年来美国和其他发达经济体经济增长不力这一棘手问题。

column1: These theses will be important influences on the Fed in 2014 and beyond.
column2: 这一话题将对2014年及其后的美联储产生重要影响。

column1: Summers’s controversial explanation for slow growth has received the most attention.
column2: 萨默斯对增长缓慢的争议解释受到了最多关注。

column1: The economic crisis, he argued, is not over until it is over, which it is not yet.
column2: 他说，经济危机只有过去之后才算过去，而现在还没有过去。

column1: He boldly suggested that the reason for sub-par growth over the last ten years is a fundamental structural change, identified as “secular stagnation”: the natural, or equilibrium, real (inflation-adjusted) interest rate may have fallen below zero – perhaps as low as negative 2-3% – “forever.”
column2: 他大胆指出，过去十年的增长萎靡的原因是一种根本性的结构变迁，他称之为“长期停滞 ” ： 自然（或均衡）实际（经通胀调整的）利率“永远”地降到了零以下 — — 可能低达负的2—3 % 。

column1: There are, according to Summers, two possible reasons for this: a saving glut coming from Asia or a long-term IT-induced decline in the relative price of capital goods that has reduced needed investment relative to saving.
column2: 按萨默斯的说法，造成这一局面的可能原因有两个：来自亚洲的储蓄过剩以及由IT造成的资本品相对价格的长期下跌降低了投资相对储蓄的需求。

column1: (Krugman offers more possible explanations: declining rates of population or productivity growth.)
column2: （克鲁格曼提供了更多的可能解释：人口或生产率增长下降。 ）

column1: Whatever the cause, if Summers is right, we are in deep trouble.
column2: 不管原因如何，如果萨默斯是对的，那么我们陷入了大麻烦。

column1: As it is, central banks can have difficulty attaining a sufficiently low real interest rate in recessions, because the nominal interest rate cannot go below zero.
column2: 央行可能难以在衰退时期维持充分低的实际利率，因为名义利率不能低于零。

column1: In Summers’s scenario, the negative equilibrium rate would mean chronically slow growth.
column2: 在萨默斯提出的情景中，负均衡利率意味着长时期增长低迷。

column1: Fischer himself expressed greater optimism at the conference that monetary policy can work, even under current conditions.
column2: 在IMF研究年会上，费希尔本人对货币政策的作用要更乐观一些，即便是在当前环境下。

column1: Quantitative easing and forward guidance can push down the long-term interest rate.
column2: 量化宽松和前瞻性指引可以拉低长期利率。

column1: And there are other channels besides the real interest rate: the exchange rate, equity prices, the real-estate market, and the credit channel.
column2: 而除了实际利率，还有其他渠道：汇率、股价、房地产市场和信用渠道。

column1: Fed staff members are less prone than professors to go out on a paradigm-shaking limb.
column2: 美联储官员不像教授们那样喜欢做范式研究。

column1: But David Wilcox, Director of Research and Statistics at the Fed, and his co-authors argue that the severity and duration of the downturn that began in December 2007 has been steadily eroding the capital stock and the size and skills of the labor force.
column2: 但美联储研究和统计主管大卫·韦尔考克斯（David Wilcox）与合作者指出，始于2007年12月的衰退程度之严重、持续时间之长在逐渐侵蚀资本存量和劳动力规模和技能。

column1: Thus, slow US output and employment growth in the last few years is a result of the financial crisis, not of exogenous structural change.
column2: 因此，过去几年美国产出和就业增长缓慢是金融危机的结果，而不是外生结构变迁的结果。

column1: Without customers, firms do not build new factories, even when the cost of capital is low, while workers who have been unemployed for a long time may drop out of the labor force altogether.
column2: 没有客户，企业就不会建设新厂，即使资本成本很低；而长期找不到工作的工人可能会完全退出劳动力。

column1: The result, as Wilcox and his colleagues persuasively argue, is that productive capacity and the effective labor force have moved onto diminished growth paths.
column2: 结果，正如韦尔考克斯及其同事雄辩地指出的，产能和有效劳动力进入了下降增长轨道。

column1: The cumulative supply shortfall – the authors estimate that potential output is now 7% below the pre-2007 trajectory – may be larger than the current output shortfall attributable to the ongoing lack of aggregate demand.
column2: 累计供给缺口 — — 韦尔考克斯及其同事估算，现今潜在产出比2007年前的水平低7 % — —可能比总需求持续不振所导致的当前产出缺口程度更大。

column1: This unfortunate recent history makes the Fed’s job even harder than it has been, because it further limits policymakers’ ability to stimulate growth without causing inflation.
column2: 这段不幸的历史让美联储的责任比以往更艰难了，因为这进一步限制了决策者在不引起通胀的前提下刺激增长的能力。

column1: At the same time, given the potential for long-lasting damage to growth, it has become even more important to maintain adequate demand stimulus so long as unemployment remains high.
column2: 与此同时，由于可能对增长造成长期伤害，在失业高企时维持足够的需求刺激就变得更加重要了。

column1: The Wilcox paper thus supports continued monetary ease in 2014.
column2: 因此，韦尔考克斯的论文支持在2014年继续保持货币宽松。

column1: Krugman’s presentation at the IMF conference was as surprising as the others: concerns about US fiscal deficits and debt are misplaced even in the longer term.
column2: 克鲁格曼在IMF研究年会上的发言也是语出惊人：即使从长期看，对美国财政赤字和债务的担忧也弄错了对象。

column1: Deficit hawks worry that at some point global investors will lose their enthusiasm for holding ever-greater amounts of US debt, resulting in a sharp depreciation of the dollar.
column2: 赤字鹰派担心，全球投资者总有一天会不再热衷于持有不断膨胀的美国债务，导致美元急剧贬值。

column1: Krugman’s controversial claim is that, even if this were to happen, interest rates would not rise, while the depreciation’s effect on the US economy would be expansionary (via an increase in net exports).
column2: 克鲁格曼的争议结论则是，即使真的发生这一幕，利率也不会上升，同时贬值对美国经济将具有扩张效应（通过增加净出口 ） 。

column1: The policy implication is that there is less reason to worry about the long-term debt problem and more reason to worry that fiscal contraction over the last three years has been depriving the economy of needed demand.
column2: 其政策含义是，不用太过担心长期债务问题，而要更多地担心过去三年中的财政收缩制约了美国经济所需要的需求。

column1: The policy failures have indeed been remarkable.
column2: 事实上，政策失误相当可观。

column1: Though prompt action halted the 2008 financial meltdown, and initial monetary and fiscal stimulus helped to end the recession itself in 2009, the recovery since then has been painfully slow, owing mainly to destructive fiscal policy: misguided drag in 2010-13; repeated self-inflicted crises in 2011-13; and no progress on the genuine longer-term fiscal problem.
column2: 尽管大手笔动作阻止了2008年金融崩溃，一开始的货币和财政刺激也为2009年结束衰退贡献了力量，但此后的复苏极其缓慢，主要原因就在于破坏性财政政策：2010—2013年受误导的拖累；2011—2013年反复的自作自受式危机；以及在真正的长期财政问题上毫无进展。

column1: Together, these fiscal failures have probably subtracted more than a percentage point from US growth in each of the last three years.
column2: 总而言之，在过去三年中，这些财政失误有可能每年都造成美国经济增长减少了一个多百分点。

column1: But there are grounds for optimism in 2014.
column2: 但有理由对2014年保持乐观。

column1: For the first time in four years, fiscal policy probably will not have a negative effect on growth.
column2: 四年来，财政政策第一次有望不再对增长产生消极影响。

column1: True, it would be better if fiscal policy could make a positive contribution.
column2: 当然，如果财政政策可以产生积极影响那就更好了。

column1: But ending the negative contributions is cause for celebration.
column2: 但不再起负面作用已足以值得庆贺。

column1: Meanwhile, monetary policy will be in good hands, especially now that Fischer has joined the team.
column2: 与此同时，货币政策将掌握在能人手中，特别是拥有费希尔的团队。

column1: Market Failure and Political Failure
column2: 市场失灵与政治失灵

column1: PARIS – Markets can fail.
column2: 发自巴黎 — — 市场会出现失灵。

column1: But, as has been demonstrated in areas like air pollution, traffic congestion, spectrum allocation, and tobacco consumption, market mechanisms are often the best way for governments to address such failures.
column2: 但正如类似空气污染，交通拥堵，电信频率分配以及香烟消费等问题所展现的那样，市场机制往往是政府应对这类失灵问题的最佳手段。

column1: So why are such mechanisms now in retreat?
column2: 但为何如今这些机制却逐渐失去了用武之地？

column1: Consider markets for emissions allowances, in which firms that can cheaply cut air pollution trade with those that cannot.
column2: 以排放配额市场为例，在市场里那些可以低成本减少排放的企业可以和其他企业做交易。

column1: A decade ago, the idea that such markets could achieve desired environmental goals at relatively low cost was widely recognized and implemented.
column2: 十年前，一直有主张认为这类市场可以用相对低廉的成本来实现既定的环保目标，并且得到了广泛的认同和实施。

column1: Today, however, politics is killing “cap and trade.”
column2: 但如今政治却在扼杀“设限+交易 ” （ cap and trade）方案。

column1: In the United States, the highly successful cap-and-trade system for sulfur-dioxide emissions has effectively vanished.
column2: 在美国，取得了极大成功的二氧化硫“设限+交易”系统基本上销声匿迹了。

column1: In Europe, the Emissions Trading System (ETS), the world’s largest market for carbon allowances, has become increasingly irrelevant as well.
column2: 欧洲的排放交易系统这个全球最大的碳排放配额市场也逐渐变得形同虚设。

column1: On both sides of the Atlantic, market-oriented environmental regulation has in effect been superseded over the last five years by older “command-and-control” approaches, by which the government dictates who should use which technologies, in what amounts, to reduce which emissions.
column2: 在大西洋另一端，市场主导的环境监管在过去5年中被旧式的“命令+控制 ” （ command and control）手段所取代，谁要用哪种技术去减少某个数量的特定排放物，一切都由政府说了算。

column1: Cap and trade was originally supposed to be a Republican idea in the US: its backers were those who considered themselves pro-market, not those who considered themselves pro-regulation.
column2: 在美国，设限+交易原本应当被视为一个共和党方案：其背后的支持者都是那些自认为倾向市场而非偏好管制的人。

column1: Most environmental organizations initially opposed it, with many believing it immoral for corporations to be able to pay for the right to pollute.
column2: 大多数环保组织原本反对这一方案，许多人认为该方案有违道德，因为它容许企业付钱去购买污染的权利。

column1: Indeed, it was Ronald Reagan’s administration that pioneered the use of cap and trade to phase out leaded gasoline in the 1980’s.
column2: 事实上，是罗纳德·里根总统的政府率先在1980年代运用设限+交易手段去淘汰含铅汽油。

column1: George H. W. Bush’s administration used it to reduce SO2 emissions from power plants in the 1990’s, and his son’s administration sought to use it to reduce SO2 and other emissions further in the 2000’s.
column2: 老布什政府在1990年代沿用这一手段去减少发电厂的二氧化硫并取得了成功，随后其子小布什又试图用它进一步减少二氧化硫以及其他污染物排放。

column1: The problem is not that cap and trade is an ivory-tower theory that cannot work in the real world; on the contrary, its performance surpassed expectations.
column2: 设限+交易并是一个不切实际的象牙塔理论；相反，它的效果超出了预期。

column1: In the 1980’s, it enabled lead to be phased out more rapidly than predicted and at an estimated annual savings of $250 million relative to the command-and-control approach.
column2: 在1980年代它以超乎预计的速度淘汰了含铅燃料，并且估计比命令+控制政策每年节省2.5亿美元。

column1: Similarly, emissions of SO2 were curbed at a much lower cost than even cap-and-trade proponents had predicted before 1995.
column2: 同样，限制二氧化硫排放的成本甚至比设限+交易的支持者们在1995年前预估的还要低

column1: As recently as 2008, the Republican candidate for US president, Senator John McCain, had sponsored legislative proposals to use cap and trade to address emissions of carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gases.
column2: 到了近一点的2008年，共和党推举参议员约翰·麦凯恩（John McCain）为总统候选人，而他本人也支持美国立法使用设限+交易手段去应对二氧化碳和其他温室气体的排放问题。

column1: But Republican politicians now seem to have forgotten that this approach was once their policy.
column2: 但如今共和党政治家们似乎忘记了自己曾有这么一个政策。

column1: In 2009, they worked to defeat climate-change legislation by relying on anti-regulation rhetoric that demonized their own creation.
column2: 为了抵制2009年的气候变化立法，他们转而用反管制言论去把自身的产物妖魔化了。

column1: This left only less market-friendly alternatives – especially after court cases upheld the validity of the 1970 Clean Air Act.
column2: 结果就只剩下不那么市场化的备选方案 — — 尤其是在相关诉讼维持了1970年洁净空气法案的法律效力之后。

column1: Though such alternatives are less efficient, they are again the operative regime.
column2: 虽然这些备选方案效率不高，却依然占据主流地位。

column1: Likewise, the European Union adopted the ETS in 2003 as a cost-effective way to achieve the commitments it had made under the 1997 Kyoto Protocol.
column2: 在欧洲，设限+交易在十年前成为主导。

column1: The ETS rapidly became the world’s largest system for putting a market price on environmental damage.
column2: 欧盟在2003年将排放交易系统采纳为兑现其1997年京都议定书承诺的一个高性价比手段，同时还迅速建立了全球最大的系统去为环境污染设定市场价格。

column1: But now it has been pushed aside by other kinds of regulation.
column2: 但如今排放交易系统却被其他类型的管制手段排挤到了一边。

column1: European directives require that 20% of energy must come from renewables by 2020.
column2: 欧洲的方针要求在2020年时必须有20%的能源来自于可再生能源。

column1: But, while policymakers have helped drive down the price of emissions permits in the ETS by mandating and subsidizing renewable energy, the supply of permits has not been reduced.
column2: 政策制定者们通过批准和补贴可再生能源使得排放交易系统中的许可价格降低���但这类许可的供应却下降了。

column1: As a result, demand now falls short of any binding constraint.
column2: 结果对许可的需求低到无法附加任何捆绑条款。

column1: Indeed, the price of permits fell below three euros a ton in April 2013, rendering the emissions-trading market almost irrelevant.
column2: 到了2013年4月，许可价格已经跌到3欧元每吨，导致排放交易市场基本停滞。

column1: This, in turn, has encouraged greater reliance on highly polluting coal – the worst energy source, from the standpoint of global warming. That would not have happened if the price mechanism still underpinned climate-change policy.
column2: 这反过来鼓励了企业更多地使用污染更严重的煤 — — 在全球变暖问题上危害最大的燃料 — — 而如果气候变化政策依然是以价格机制为的基础的话，这一切都不会发生。

column1: Moreover, the EU’s renewables policy has also proved to be ruinously expensive.
column2: 此外，欧盟的可再生能源政策已经被证明是极端昂贵。

column1: All of this should give pause to the European Council when it meets in March to consider how to extend the 2020 goals to 2030.
column2: 而这一切应该在3月欧洲议会商议如何将2020年目标延长到2030年时扭转过来。

column1: There is a fascinating parallel between the evolution of American political attitudes toward market mechanisms in environmental regulation and Republican hostility to “Obamacare” (the 2010 Affordable Care Act).
column2: 美国针对环境管制中市场机制的政治态度的演化与共和党人对“奥巴马医改 ” （ 2010年《合理医疗费用法案 》 ） 的敌意之间存在着一个令人惊叹的平行关系。

column1: The core of Obamacare is an attempt to ensure that all Americans have health insurance, via the individual mandate.
column2: 奥巴马医改的核心在于通过强制参保的方式确保所有美国人都能享有医疗保险。

column1: But it is a market-oriented program insofar as health insurers and health-care providers remain private and compete against one other.
column2: 但这是一个市场主导的项目，因为医疗保险公司和医疗服务提供者都是私营企业而且相互竞争。

column1: This was originally a conservative approach.
column2: 这原本是个保守的方法。

column1: The two major alternatives to it are much further removed from the marketplace: a “single payer” system, as in Canada (or America’s Medicare system for the elderly), with the government providing health insurance, or “socialized medicine,” as in the United Kingdom (or the US Veterans Health Administration), with the government providing health care directly.
column2: 相比之下另外两个主要的替代方案都离市场更远：一个“单一付款人”体系，比如加拿大（或者美国的长者医疗体系 ） ， 由政府提供医疗保险；或者是“公费医疗 ” ， 比如英国（或者美国退伍军人卫生署 ） ， 由政政府直接提供医疗保障。

column1: The approach taken by Obamacare was proposed in conservative think tanks such as the Heritage Foundation and enacted in Massachusetts by Republican Governor Mitt Romney.
column2: 而奥巴马医改所采用的方案是当年由美国传统基金会这类保守智库所提议，并由时任州长的共和党人米特·罗姆尼在马萨诸塞州推广应用。

column1: But, by the time Obama adopted it, it had become anathema to Republicans, forcing Romney, the party’s presidential candidate in 2012, to run against his own record.
column2: 谁知当奥巴马采纳这一方法的时候，它却变成了共和党人的眼中钉，迫使罗姆尼这位2012年美国总统共和党候选人推翻自己过去的做法。

column1: The market failure in the case of air pollution is what economists call an “externality”: those who pollute do not bear the entire cost.
column2: 在空气污染方面的市场失灵就是经济学家所说的“外部性 ” ： 那些污染者并未承担所有的成本。

column1: The market failure in the case of health care is what economists call “adverse selection”: insurers may not provide insurance, especially to patients with pre-existing conditions, if they fear that healthy customers have already taken themselves out of the risk pool.
column2: 而在医疗保险方面的市场失灵则可归之为“逆向选择 ” ： 如果承保者有理由担心医疗消费者自身已经处于风险之下，那么他们就可能不会提供保障，尤其是对那些已经患病的病人。

column1: But, again, government attempts to address market failures can themselves fail.
column2: 但与此同时，那些尝试应对市场失灵的政府自身也可能会失灵。

column1: In the case of the environment, command-and-control regulation is inefficient, discourages innovation, and can have unintended consequences (like Europe’s growing reliance on coal).
column2: 在环境事务上，命令+管制监管手段效率低下，遏制创新，并可能引发意外后果（正如欧洲对煤的依赖上升 ） 。

column1: In the case of health care, a national monopoly can forestall innovation and provide inadequate care with long waits.
column2: 而在医疗方面，一个国家垄断将会抑制创新，服务不充足，还会让患者轮候更长时间。

column1: In general, the best government interventions target failures precisely – using cap and trade to put a price on air pollution, for example, or relying on the individual mandate to curtail adverse selection in health insurance – while letting market forces do the rest more efficiently than bureaucrats can.
column2: 总而言之，最佳的政府介入手段应当精确定位失灵之处 — — 使用设限+交易去给空气污染定价或者强制参保去减少医疗保险中的逆向选择 — — 并让市场力量比官僚更高效地去解决余下的其他问题。

column1: African Leaders’ Eyes on the Prize
column2: 非洲领袖眼中的巨奖

column1: CAMBRIDGE – On October 14, the Mo Ibrahim Prize Committee announced that for the second year in a row it had not found anyone to whom to award its Prize for Achievement in African Leadership. Why is that important?
column2: 发自剑桥 — — 10月14日，莫·易卜拉欣奖（Mo Ibrahim Prize）评选委员会宣布其已经连续第二年无法找到非洲领导成就奖的得主，而这又意味着什么呢？

column1: The prize is given to a recently retired African head of state or government who was democratically elected, stepped down at the end of his or her constitutionally mandated term, and demonstrated exceptional leadership.
column2: 这个奖项会颁发给一位新近退休的非洲国家领袖，前提是这位领袖必须是由民主选举产生，在宪法规定的任期结束后退位，并展现出了杰出的领导能力。

column1: The winner receives $5 million paid over ten years, followed by $200,000 annually for life, making it the world’s most valuable annual award.
column2: 得奖者将在头10年内领取500万美元奖金，然后每年领取20万美金直至过世，而这也令此奖成为了世界上最丰厚的年度奖项。

column1: The Mo Ibrahim Foundation supports other important activities, particularly the annual Ibrahim Index of African Governance (IIAG), which was also released on October 14.
column2: 莫·易卜拉欣基金会同时也赞助其他一些重要的活动，例如每年评定一次，同样在10月14日发布的易卜拉欣非洲治理指数。

column1: But I am especially intrigued by the prize.
column2: 但笔者最感到好奇的仍然是那个奖项。

column1: It is a fascinating social-policy experiment, which deserves to be more widely known.
column2: 这是一场令人着迷的社会政策试验，也理应得到更多的关注。

column1: Critics of the Ibrahim Prize argue that it makes Africa look bad, because in four out of seven years it has not been awarded to anyone.
column2: 有批评认为这个奖令非洲蒙羞，因为自该奖设立7年以来已经有4年出现的得奖者空缺。

column1: It has also been argued that leaders should not have to be “bribed” into being good.
column2: 另一种说法认为领导人不应在这些巨奖的“贿赂”下去有所作为。

column1: The good will be good, and the bad will be bad, regardless of the prize.
column2: 不管这个奖存不存在，开明者行仁政，暴君则祸国殃民，不会有任何改变。

column1: I don’t buy these criticisms.
column2: 笔者不敢苟同这些批评。

column1: Yes, other parts of the world also suffer from governance problems.
column2: 没错，世界其他地方也面对着治理问题。

column1: And more people should be aware that many African countries have made substantial progress over the last decade, particularly with respect to economic growth, health, and education.
column2: 更多人也应该认识到许多非洲国家都在过去十年中取得了长足的进步，尤其是在经济发展，卫生和教育方面。

column1: But those are not arguments against highlighting the important role of leadership in African countries’ success.
column2: 但这些论点都不能掩盖领导人在这些非洲国家取得的成就中所扮演的重要作用。

column1: Given the abundant attention received by Africa’s truly awful leaders, it is useful to focus on its good ones.
column2: 考虑到人们已经对那些非洲暴君们给予了足够的关注，也是时候把目光移向那些好的领导人了。

column1: And the money that comes with the Ibrahim Prize is enough that it could affect leaders’ behavior.
column2: 而莫·易卜拉欣奖的奖金也足以去影响这些领导人的行为。

column1: The Ibrahim Prize was awarded in 2007, 2008, and 2011 to Presidents Joaquim Chissano of Mozambique, Festus Mogae of Botswana, and Pedro Verona Pires of Cape Verde, respectively.
column2: 莫·易卜拉欣奖曾分别颁发给莫桑比克前总统阿金·希萨诺（Joaquim Chissano，2007年度 ） ， 博茨瓦纳前总统费斯图斯·莫哈埃（Festus Mogae，2008年度）以及佛得角前总统佩德罗·皮雷斯（Pedro Verona Pires，2011年度 ） 。

column1: Botswana and Cape Verde are two of the small-population countries that are consistently placed near the top in rankings of African governance, human development, and economic performance.
column2: 博茨瓦纳和佛得角这两个人口较少的非洲国家一般都会在非洲治理水平，人文发展和经济表现方面排名前列。

column1: Mozambique is different: larger and historically in much worse shape, it suffered a terrible civil war from 1977 to 1992.
column2: 而莫桑比克则截然不同：国家更大，历史问题更多，1977年~1992年间曾持续内战。

column1: Even after two decades of strong political and economic improvement, it still ranks low on most development indicators.
column2: 即便在经历了20年的强劲政治和经济发展，该国在大多数发展指数中的排名依旧偏低。

column1: What defines good leadership is a notoriously complicated question.
column2: 优秀的领导该如何定义是一个极端复杂的问题。

column1: Should leadership be evaluated according to criteria like economic prosperity, public health, respect for human rights, personal security, and peace?
column2: 它是否应该依据经济繁荣程度，公共卫生，人权状况，个人人身安全以及国家和平状态来评定？

column1: Or are the proper criteria the leader’s character and competence, including his or her ability to inspire the country, choose good officials, formulate good policies, and implement them?
column2: 或者应该着眼于领袖的个人品质和治国方略，包括鼓舞国民奋发的魅力，甄选官员的眼光，制定和实施良好政策的能力？

column1: In a word, is leadership a matter of outcomes or inputs?
column2: 简而言之，领导能力究竟是一个关于能力注入还是成果输出的事物？

column1: Successful outcomes are obviously the ultimate objective.
column2: 虽然成功的成果输出显然是最终的目标。

column1: But it is not useful to rely solely or primarily on outcomes to judge a leader.
column2: 但仅仅依靠成果来评断一位领袖是不行的。

column1: Many factors beyond a leader’s control can block his or her country’s progress.
column2: 许多超出这位领导人控制的因素都会阻碍其国家的进步。

column1: Even if good leadership means a demonstrated ability to prevail in the face of intransigent domestic political opposition, coup attempts, and invasions, surely no leader can be held responsible for the effects of droughts, floods, or other natural disasters.
column2: 即便优秀的领导才能意味着在面对国内顽固反对派，政变企图或者入侵时能展现其雄才大略，但显然没有谁能可以为干旱，洪涝或者其他自然灾害负责。

column1: Admittedly, a leader’s integrity and competence are more difficult to measure than outcomes (such as per capita income, life expectancy, infant mortality, literacy, and crime).
column2: 必须承认，一个领导人的品质和能力要比其成果（诸如人均收入、预期寿命、新生儿死亡率，识字率和犯罪率）更加难以测量。

column1: But some of the component indicators of the IIAG (such as rule of law, bureaucratic red tape, and fiscal policy) are more directly under government control.
column2: 但易卜拉欣非洲治理指数中的某些成分指数（例如法治成都，官僚办事作风以及财政政策）都更直接地处于政府当局控制之下。

column1: In any case, one would not expect prize committees or historians to judge leaders solely by quantitative criteria.
column2: 无论如何，我们都不会期望评选委员会或者历史学家会仅仅依靠量化指标去评价一个领导人。

column1: Few Americans thought Harry Truman had been a good president immediately after he left office, but now he is rated very high.
column2: 在美国总统哈里·杜鲁门（Harry Truman）下台时民望很低，但今时今日人们却对他评价甚高。

column1: In Mexico, Carlos Salinas looked good at the time, but is now viewed poorly, while the accomplishments of his successor, Ernesto Zedillo, now appear bold, historic, innovative, and valuable.
column2: 在墨西哥，前总统卡洛斯·萨利纳斯（Carlos Salinas）当年非常风光，如今却遭到甚多批评，因为他的继任者埃内斯托. 塞迪略（Ernesto Zedillo）所取得成就在今天看来更为大刀阔斧，具历史意义，别开生面且有价值。

column1: The list of eligible candidates for the Ibrahim Prize begins with those who were democratically elected and left office constitutionally within the preceding three years.
column2: 莫·易卜拉欣奖的候选名单首先会从那些民选上台并在随后三年内依宪法规定离任的领导人开始。

column1: In a typical year, there may be as few as three candidates who meet these qualifications.
column2: 一般来说，在一年里都会有三位领导人符合这一条件。

column1: The question is then whether any candidate demonstrated the necessary level of excellence in office.
column2: 但问题是这些人是否于在位之时体现出了足够优秀的治国能力。

column1: In 2009, 2010, 2012, and now 2013, the prize committee decided that none had.
column2: 在2009，2010，2012和今年，评奖委员的决议是没人能做到这一点。

column1: Does that mean that the prize has failed to meet the objective of encouraging good leadership in Africa?
column2: 拿这是否意味着该奖项无法实现其鼓励非洲优秀领导实践的目标？

column1: Consider a ruler who comes to power with good intentions and great abilities.
column2: 试想一位才能卓越的统治者胸怀治国雄心上台执政。

column1: Assume that he accomplishes much for his country during his first term (or his first two or three terms if the constitution allows it). But he stays too long (Uganda’s Yoweri Museveni comes to mind).
column2: 假设他在自己的第一个任期内（或者包含宪法许可下最初的一两次连任内）为国家做了许多实事，但他却过于恋栈 — — 正如乌干达总统约韦里·穆塞韦尼（Yoweri Museveni ） 。

column1: He forces through constitutional changes so that he can run for more terms.
column2: 他强制修改宪法条文好让自己能继续连任下去。

column1: Then he starts rigging elections and suppressing opposition.
column2: 然后此人开始操纵选举和镇压反对派。

column1: He or members of his family nurture large overseas bank accounts.
column2: 而自己及其亲属则向海外转移了巨额财富。

column1: Such leaders’ personalities may have changed.
column2: 这种领导人的品质或许已经发生了变化。

column1: They may now regard themselves as indispensable.
column2: 他们也许觉得自己是必不可少的。

column1: They have been corrupted by power, like the porcine elite in George Orwell’s Animal Farm.
column2: 他们被权力所腐蚀，正如乔治·奥威尔（George Orwell）在其名著《动物农场》中所描写的猪族精英那样。

column1: At this point, they are unlikely to be influenced by the money that comes with the Ibrahim Prize.
column2: 到这个时候，这些人也不会被莫·易卜拉欣奖的奖金所打动了。

column1: But now consider a leader who would prefer to serve honestly throughout his term and depart voluntarily. This path might leave a retirement with few resources for him and his family, little in the way of prestige or a platform from which to speak, and perhaps persecution by his successors.
column2: 但如果换成是一位愿意在自己任期内忠心服务国家并在任期届满时自愿下台的领导人，他的清廉可能意味着自己和家人的退休生活不甚宽裕，没有什么提升社会地位的途径也缺乏可供发声的平台，甚至可能遭到继任者的迫害。

column1: It is precisely such a leader for whom the Ibrahim Prize could make the difference, influencing him to continue on the high road.
column2: 那么莫·易卜拉欣奖就能改变这样一位领导人的际遇，令他可以继续尊贵地活着。

column1: If the experiment works, however, the main fruits will lie in the future.
column2: 然而，如果这个实验有效的话，主要的成果将体现在未来。

column1: The Ibrahim Prize was established only in 2007, which means that the candidates have served most of their terms in office at a time when the prize could not have influenced their behavior.
column2: 莫·易卜拉欣奖在2007年才成立，意味着候选人们的任期主要都是在奖项设立之前，因此也无法为了奖金改变其行为。

column1: If it does have the desired effect, we should start seeing winners in more years.
column2: 如果该奖确实能实现其预想效果的话，那么我们将在未来看见更多的获奖者。

column1: Sovereign Debt at Square One
column2: 回到起点的主权债务

column1: CAMBRIDGE – Argentina and its bankers have been barred from making payments to fulfill debt-restructuring agreements reached with the country’s creditors, unless the 7% of creditors who rejected the agreements are paid in full – a judgment that is likely to stick, now that the US Supreme Court has upheld it.
column2: 美国剑桥—阿根廷及其银行家被禁止偿还债务以履行与该国债权人达成的债务重组协议，除非拒绝该协议的7%债权人获得足额偿付 — — 美国最高法院支持的情况看，这一判决可能无法推翻了。

column1: Though it is hard to cry for Argentina, the ruling in favor of the holdouts is bad news for the global financial system and sets back the evolution of the international regime for restructuring sovereign debt.
column2: 尽管我们大可不必为阿根廷哭泣，但这一有利于顽固坚持的判决对全球金融体系来说是一个坏消息，也让重组主权债务的国际机制发生了倒退。

column1: Why is it so hard to feel sympathy for a developing country that can’t pay its debts?
column2: 为何同情无法偿付债务的发展中国家如此困难？

column1: For starters, in 2001, Argentina unilaterally defaulted on its entire $100 billion debt, an unusual step, rather than negotiating new terms with its creditors.
column2: 首先，2001年，阿根廷单方面对其全部1,000亿美元债务违了约，而不是与债权人协商新条款，这是颇为反常的。

column1: When, in 2005, the government finally got around to negotiating a debt swap, it could almost dictate the terms – a 70% “haircut.”
column2: 2005年，阿根廷政府终于拨冗参与债务互换谈判时，它几乎可以任意指定条件 — — 70%的“剃头 ” （ haircut ） 。

column1: In the intervening decade, President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner and her late husband and predecessor, Néstor Kirchner, have pursued a variety of spectacularly bad economic policies.
column2: 在此间的十年中，阿根廷总统费尔南德兹·基什内尔及其已故丈夫兼前任总统捏斯托·基什内尔实施了一系列糟糕透顶的经济政策。

column1: The independence of the central bank and the statistical agency have been severely compromised, with Fernández forcing the adoption, for example, of a consumer price index that grossly understates the inflation rate.
column2: 中央银行和统计部门的独立性遭到了严重破坏，比如，费尔南德兹强迫采取了严重低估通胀率的消费物价指数。

column1: Contracts have been violated and foreign-owned companies have been nationalized.
column2: 契约被恣意破坏，外资公司被国有化。

column1: And when soaring global prices for Argentina’s leading agricultural commodities provided a golden opportunity to boost output and raise chronically insufficient foreign-currency earnings, Fernández imposed heavy tariffs and quotas on exports of soy, wheat, and beef.
column2: 而当主产农作物全球价格飙升为阿根廷提供了提振产出、增加长期不足的外汇收入时，费尔南德兹又给大豆、小麦和牛肉出口施加了沉重的关税。

column1: Some might counter that the holdout hedge funds that sued Argentina deserve no sympathy, either.
column2: 也许会有人反驳说，起诉阿根廷的顽固坚持对冲基金也不值得同情。

column1: Many are called “vulture funds” because they bought the debt at a steep discount from the original creditors, hoping to profit subsequently through court decisions.
column2: 许多这样的基金被称为“兀鹫基金 ” ， 因为它们以深度折价从原始债权人手中购买债务，期望通过法院裁决斩获丰厚利润。

column1: But the problem with the Argentine debt case has little to do with the moral failings of either the plaintiffs or the defendant.
column2: 但阿根廷债务案的问题关税或被告的道德失当没有关系。

column1: The problem is the precedent that the case establishes for resolving future international debt crises.
column2: 问题在于该案为解决未来国际债务危机所树立的先例。

column1: The most common reaction to the recent rulings is pro-holdout.
column2: 对最新判决的最常见反应是支持顽固坚持。

column1: After all, the judge is only enforcing the legal contract embodied in the original bonds, isn’t he?
column2: 毕竟，法官只不过是在强制执行初始债券中所包含的法律契约，不是吗？

column1: As President Calvin Coolidge supposedly said of the American loans to the World War I allies, “They hired the money, didn’t they?”
column2: 据说美国总统柯立芝这样评价美国对一战协约国的贷款 ： “ 它们租用了钱，不是吗 ？ ”

column1: If only the world were so simple.
column2: 要是世界如此简单就好了。

column1: If only a regime of consistent enforcement of all loan contracts’ explicit terms were sufficiently practical to be worth pursuing.
column2: 要是一致执行所有贷款契约的明白条款的机制足够实用、值得追求就好了。

column1: But we have long since recognized the need for procedures to rewrite the terms of debt contracts under extreme circumstances.
column2: 但我们早就认识到需要依靠程序重写极端情形下的贷款契约条件。

column1: The British Joint Stock Companies Act of 1856, for example, established the principle of limited liability for corporations.
column2: 比如，1856年英国合股公司法（Joint Stock Companies Act）规定了公司的有限责任原则。

column1: Indentured servitude and debtors’ prisons have also been illegal since the nineteenth century.
column2: 自十九世纪以来，卖身契和债务人监狱也变为非法。

column1: And individuals and corporations can declare bankruptcy.
column2: 个人和公司可以宣布破产。

column1: There will always be times when it is impossible for a debtor to pay.
column2: 总有债务人无法偿还的时候。

column1: As for corporate bankruptcy, it is recognized that a poor legal system is one that keeps otherwise viable factories shuttered while assets are frittered away in expensive legal wrangling, leaving everyone – managers, workers, and shareholders – worse off.
column2: 而对于公司破产，我们已经意识到，在糟糕的法律体系中，本可以存活的工厂倒闭，而资产在昂贵的法律扯皮中灰飞烟灭，所有人 — — 管理者、工人和股东 — — 都遭受损失。

column1: A good legal system permits employment and production to continue in cases where the economic activity is still viable; divides up the remaining assets in an orderly and generally accepted way; and makes these determinations as efficiently and speedily as possible, while discouraging future carelessness by imposing costs on managers, shareholders, and – if necessary – creditors.
column2: 而良好的法律体系让招聘和生产在经济活动仍然可行时能够继续；以有序的、能被总体接受的方式分割剩余资产；并以尽可能快的速度和尽可能高的效率做出决定，同时通过让管理者、股东以及 — — 如有必要的话 — — 债权人承担代价，以阻止未来的不审慎行为。

column1: No such body of law exists at the international level.
column2: 在国际层面不存在这样一个法律体系。

column1: Some believe that this vacuum is the primary difficulty with the international debt system.
column2: 有人认为这一真空是国际债务体系的主要难点。

column1: Ambitious proposals to redress it, such as a Sovereign Debt Restructuring Mechanism (SDRM) housed at the International Monetary Fund, have always run into political roadblocks.
column2: 雄心勃勃的解决方案，如国际货币基金组织（IMF）所属的主权债务重组机制（Sovereign Debt Restructuring Mechanism，SDRM ） ， 总是陷入政治障碍。

column1: But incremental steps had been slowly moving the system in the right direction since the 1980s.
column2: 但自20世纪80年代以来，实质步骤一开始逐渐将体系推向正确的方向。

column1: In the international debt crisis that began in 1982, IMF country adjustment programs went hand in hand with “bailing in” creditor banks through “voluntary” coordinated loan rollovers.
column2: 在肇始于1982年的国际债务危机中，IMF国家调整计划与通过“自愿”合作贷款展期进行的债权人“自救 ” （ bailing in）双管齐下。

column1: Eventually, it was recognized that a debt overhang was inhibiting investment and growth in Latin America, to the detriment of debtors and creditors alike.
column2: 最终，人们意识到是债务积压制约了拉丁美洲的投资与增长，债务人和债权人都受到了伤害。

column1: Subsequent programs to deal with emerging-market crises featured an analogous combination of country adjustment and “private sector involvement.”
column2: 此后处理新兴市场危机的计划都有类似的国家调整和“私人部门参与”结合。

column1: Voluntary debt exchanges worked, roughly speaking, with investors accepting haircuts.
column2: 总的来说，如果投资者可以接受“剃头 ” ， 自愿债务交换是有效的。

column1: After Argentina’s unilateral default in 2001, many investors saw more clearly the need to allow explicitly for less drastic alternatives ahead of time, and so incorporated so-called “collective action clauses” into debt contracts.
column2: 2001年阿根廷单方面违约后，许多投资者更加认清了需要事先明确允许不太极端的替代方案，因此在债务契约中引入了所谓的“集体诉讼条款 ” 。

column1: If the borrower runs into trouble, CACs make it possible to restructure debt with the agreement of a substantial majority of creditors (usually around 70%).
column2: 如果债务人陷入麻烦，根据集体诉讼条款，如果绝对多数债权人（通常在70%左右）形成协议，就可以进行债务重组。

column1: The minority is then bound by the agreement.
column2: 这样一来，少数派就受到了协议的约束。

column1: Such incremental steps gave rise to a loose system of debt restructuring.
column2: 这些实质步骤促成了宽松的债务重组制度。

column1: To be sure, it still had many deficiencies.
column2: 诚然，它的缺陷仍然很多。

column1: Restructuring often came too late and provided too little relief to restore debt sustainability.
column2: 重组往往来得太晚，提供的纾困也不足以重塑债务可持续性。

column1: But it worked, more or less.
column2: 但它多多少少是有效的。

column1: By contrast, the US court rulings’ indulgence of a parochial instinct to enforce written contracts will undermine the possibility of negotiated re-structuring in future debt crises.
column2: 相反，美国法院裁决囿于狭隘的执行书面契约本能，破坏了未来债务危机协商重组的可能性。

column1: Time will run out for Argentina at the end of July.
column2: 阿根廷的时间到7月底为止。

column1: Unable to pay all of its debts, perhaps it will be forced to default on all of them.
column2: 如果不能偿付所有债务，它就有可能被迫对所有债务违约。

column1: The more likely outcome is that it will manage to come to some accommodation that the holdouts find more attractive than the deal accepted by the other creditors.
column2: 更有可能的结果是它设法向顽固坚持者提出比被其他债权人所接受的更有吸引力的建议。

column1: Either way, future voluntary debt-workout agreements have just become more difficult to reach, which will leave debtors and creditors alike worse off.
column2: 无论哪种情况发生，未来自愿债务解决方案都会更加难以达成，债务人和债权人都会因此蒙受损失。

column1: The Subsidy Trap
column2: 补贴陷阱

column1: CAMBRIDGE – Few policies place good economics so directly at odds with good politics as subsidies for food and energy.
column2: 美国剑桥—没有哪个政策像食品和能源补贴那样让好经济学如此直接地与好政治学对立起来。

column1: The issue of unaffordable subsidies is now front and center for three of the world’s most important new leaders: Egyptian President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi, Indonesian President-elect Joko “Jokowi” Widodo, and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
column2: 无法负担的补贴正在成为三位世界最重要新领导人所面临的的核心问题。 他们是埃及总统西西、印尼总统“佐科维”维多多以及印度总理莫迪。

column1: Sisi is confronting the need to cut subsidies better than might have been expected.
column2: 西西所面临的的削减补贴需要比预想中好一些。

column1: Modi, by contrast, is doing worse than expected – even torpedoing a long-anticipated Word Trade Organization agreement.
column2: 相反，莫迪面临着比预想更糟糕的局面，甚至有可能破坏期待已久的世贸组织协定。

column1: With Jokowi, it is too soon to tell.
column2: 而佐科维面临的局面尚不明朗。

column1: In July, Sisi accomplished what few leaders in North Africa or the Middle East have: he sharply cut longstanding fuel subsidies and allowed prices to rise by 41-78%.
column2: 7月，西西完成了北非和中东很少有领导人能够完成的成就：他大幅削减了存在已久的能源补贴，让价格提高了41-78 % 。

column1: Surprisingly, few protests materialized.
column2: 令人奇怪的是，几乎没有发生反对示威。

column1: Egypt’s food subsidy program, which costs more than $5 billion a year, is in urgent need of reform as well.
column2: 埃及的食品补贴计划每年耗费50亿美元以上，也迫切地需要改革。

column1: The price of bread has been kept so low that it is often fed to animals.
column2: 面包价格一直保持在极低水平，以至于常常被拿来喂动物。

column1: Past attempts to reduce such subsidies in North African countries have brought unrest and even toppled governments.
column2: 在过去，北非国家削减这类补贴的努力常常引发动乱，甚至颠覆政府。

column1: But the Sisi government appears to be making progress here as well.
column2: 但西西政府似乎在这方面也能够取得进展。

column1: Bread subsidies have already been cut by 13%.
column2: 面包补贴已经被削减了13 % 。

column1: Sisi had little choice.
column2: 西西别无选择。

column1: Even with subsidy cuts, the current government is targeting a budget deficit of 10% of GDP in the coming fiscal year (compared to 14% otherwise).
column2: 即使在补贴缩减后，现任政府下一个财年的预算赤字目标仍达到了GDP的10 % （ 若无补贴削减将达到14 % ） 。

column1: Still, few expected Sisi, who took office in a fragile political environment, to move faster than Modi, who was elected with a whopping democratic majority amid hopes for sweeping economic reform.
column2: 但是，几乎没人预料到在动荡政治环境中上台的西西能够比莫迪行动更加迅速。 莫迪在迫切希望彻底经济改革的印度通过压倒性民主多数问鼎总理宝座。

column1: In Indonesia, when Jokowi takes office in October, he will inherit a long history of fuel subsidies that, at $21 billion a year (up to 20% of government spending), the country can no longer afford.
column2: 在印尼，10月开始执政的佐科维继承的是长期存在的燃料补贴，规模高达每年210亿美元（相当于政府支出的20 % ） ，已令国家不堪重负。

column1: Outgoing President Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono took a first courageous step by raising fuel prices a year ago.
column2: 下台的苏西洛在一年前已经采取了勇敢的第一步，提高了燃料价格。

column1: Jokowi’s advisers favor cutting the remaining subsidies, and he has already forthrightly said that he plans to do so gradually, over a four-year period.
column2: 佐科维的顾问们建议裁减剩下的补贴，而他也直率地表示计划在四年时间里逐步落实。

column1: Economists feel confident in opposing commodity subsidies because agricultural and energy markets tend to approach the ideal of perfect competition, with a large number of consumers on the demand side and producers on the supply side.
column2: 经济学家信心十足地反对商品补贴，因为农业和能源市场接近于完美竞争，需求端有大量消费者，供给端有大量生产者。

column1: Where competition is imperfect, government, not large private monopolies, is usually the reason.
column2: 在竞争不完美的领域，政府 — — 而不是大型私有垄断商 — — 才是根源。

column1: Critics of the invisible hand point out that, left to themselves, private markets can fail in a number of ways.
column2: 看不见的手的批评者指出，自我运转的私人市场可能以各种方式失灵。

column1: For example, income inequality and environmental externalities are two of the most prominent justifications for government intervention.
column2: 比如，收入不平等和环境外部性便是政府干预最主要的两大理由。

column1: What is striking about food and fossil-fuel subsidies is that they are often promoted in the name of the environment or equity, but usually do little to achieve these goals, and often have the opposite effect.
column2: 让食品和化石燃料补贴引起尖锐争议的是它们常常打着环境或平等的旗号推行，但实际上对于这些目标于事无补，反而常常适得其反。

column1: Less than 20% of Egyptian food subsidies benefit poor people.
column2: 埃及食品补贴只有不到20%给了穷人。

column1: Gasoline subsidies in most countries benefit the middle class, while the poor walk or take public transportation.
column2: 大部分国家的汽油补贴肥了中产阶级，而穷人依靠步行或公共交通。

column1: In India, less than 0.1% of rural subsidies for Liquefied Petroleum Gas go to the poorest quintile, while 52.6% go to the wealthiest.
column2: 在印度，只有不到0.1%的液化石油气补贴给了最贫困人口，倒有52.6%流入了最富人群的口袋。

column1: Worldwide, far less than 20% of fossil-fuel subsidies benefit the poorest 20% of the population.
column2: 就全世界而言，只有远不足 20%的化石燃料补贴给了最贫困的20%人口。

column1: Food and energy subsidies can also distort public policy, as Modi’s government, seeking to protect India’s agricultural subsidies, has shown.
column2: 食品和能源补贴也有可能扭曲公共政策，意在保护印度农业补贴的莫迪政府就是明证。

column1: Indeed, its veto of a WTO compromise has derailed the most important progress in multilateral trade negotiations of the last ten years.
column2: 事实上，莫迪政府否决世贸组织妥协让过去十年多边贸易谈判最重要的进展毁于一旦。

column1: Agricultural subsidies sometimes seek to benefit consumers at the expense of producers, especially in poor countries, and sometimes seek to benefit producers at the expense of consumers, especially in rich countries.
column2: 农业补贴有时是康生产商之慨让消费者获益，特别是在穷国；而有时则是康消费者之慨让生产商获益，特别是在富国。

column1: India’s policies try to do both.
column2: 印度的政策则以兼而有之为目标。

column1: As a result, India has accomplished the extraordinary feat of rationing grain to consumers at artificially low prices, while simultaneously suffering excess supply, because farmers are paid high prices.
column2: 结果，印度完成了一个壮举：以人为压低的价格为消费者配给小麦，同时又经历过度供给，因为农民可以获得高价。

column1: (Farmers are also subsidized via agricultural inputs – electricity, water, and fertilizer – to the detriment of the environment.)
column2: （农民还通过农业投入品 — — 电、水和肥料获得补贴，而环境遭到了破坏。

column1: The government has purchased huge stockpiles of rotting rice and wheat, while the limited amount available to consumers is allocated in ways that are corrupt and inconsistent with the stated goal of helping the poor.
column2: ）政府收购了大量腐败稻米和小麦，而消费者所能得到的一小部分的分配方式既腐败又不符合帮助穷人的目标。

column1: The government would like to keep its subsidies and stockpiles.
column2: 政府可能会继续保持补贴和收储。

column1: But it knows that this would violate WTO rules.
column2: 但它知道，这会违反世贸组织规则。

column1: Unable to obtain a permanent change in these rules, Modi vetoed the WTO’s eagerly anticipated Trade Facilitation Agreement.
column2: 既然无法永久地改变这些规则，莫迪干脆否决了世贸组织热切期待的贸易促进协定（Trade Facilitation Agreement ） 。

column1: Once subsidies are in place, they are extraordinarily difficult to remove.
column2: 一旦补贴实施，就很难收回。

column1: When world commodity prices rise, as they often have over the last decade, citizens who are accustomed to the domestic price being set in the market are more likely to accept the reality that officials cannot insulate them from the shock.
column2: 当世界商品价格上涨时（如过去十年那样 ） ， 习惯于市场决定的国内价格的公民更有可能接受官员无法将他们与冲击隔离开来的现实。

column1: But people who are accustomed to administratively established food and energy prices hold the government responsible.
column2: 但习惯于官定食品和能源价格的人民会要求政府负责。

column1: That is a strong reason not to adopt such subsidies in the first place.
column2: 这就构成了一个很强的理由，从一开始就不应该实施补贴。

column1: But it does not necessarily mean that, once subsidies are in place, keeping them is a savvy politician’s best option.
column2: 但这并不意味着一旦补贴实施，保持补贴就一定是精明政客的最佳选择。

column1: If the alternative to raising the price is shortages or rationing, angry protesters may mobilize anyway.
column2: 如果涨价的替代方案是短缺或配给，愤怒的反对者也有可能爆发。

column1: Similarly, the procrastinating leader is unlikely to benefit if ever-widening gaps force an even bigger retail-price rise when the day of reckoning comes.
column2: 类似地，如果不断扩大的差距最终导致更大的零售价格攀升，那么动作缓慢的领导人也不可能得到好处。

column1: Ideally, other, more efficient means of supporting incomes at the bottom will be instituted at the same time that food and energy subsidies are cut.
column2: 在理想情况下，在裁减食品和能源补贴的同时，应该采取其他更高效的支持底层收入的措施。

column1: Developing countries have learned a lot about efficient transfer mechanisms, from policy innovations, such as the conditional cash transfers of Mexico’s Progresa-Oportunidades program or Brazil’s Bolsa Família, and from technological innovations such as India’s Unique Identification system.
column2: 发展中国家在有效转移机制方面已颇有学习经验，如墨西哥的进步-机会计划（Progresa-Oportunidades）和巴西的家庭补助金计划（Bolsa Família）等有条件现金转移支付政策创新，以及印度的唯一标识（Unique Identification）系统等技术创新。

column1: But in countries where the adjustment does not come until a budget crisis forces it, there may be no money for transfers to cushion the pain.
column2: 但有的国家在预算危机来临是才被迫调整，它们也许没有钱可用于转移支付以将对痛苦。

column1: The savvy politician should probably announce the unpleasant adjustment as soon as he takes office.
column2: 精明政客或许应该在执政伊始实施不受欢迎的调整。

column1: Jokowi and Sisi seem to have adopted this approach.
column2: 佐科维和西西都采取了这一方针。

column1: Modi, despite his huge electoral mandate and hype about market reforms, has fallen short.
column2: 而以市场改革为口号在选举中大获全胜的莫迪已经落后了。

column1: China is Still Number Two
column2: 中国仍是第二名

column1: CAMBRIDGE – Headlines around the world this week trumpeted a watershed moment for the global economy.
column2: 纽约剑桥—本周，世界各大媒体纷纷抛出全球经济分化时刻论。

column1: As the Financial Times put it, “China poised to pass US as world’s leading economic power this year.”
column2: 《金融时报》说 ： “ 今年中国就将超过美国成为世界第一经济大国 。 ”

column1: This is a startling development – or it would be if the claim were not essentially wrong.
column2: 这是一个令人吃惊的趋势 — — 如果这一论断不错得离谱的话。

column1: In fact, the United States remains the world’s largest national economy by a substantial margin.
column2: 事实上，美国仍以相当大的优势稳坐世界第一大国家经济体宝座。

column1: The story was based on the April 29 release of a report from the World Bank’s International Comparison Program.
column2: 整个故事的起源是4月29日世界银行国际比较项目（International Comparison Program，ICP）发布的一份报告。

column1: The ICP’s work is extremely valuable.
column2: ICP的工作很有价值。

column1: I eagerly await and use their new estimates every six years or so, including to look at China.
column2: 每隔六年，我都会翘首期待使用其新的估计结果，包括关于中国的结果。

column1: The ICP data compare countries’ GDP using purchasing-power-parity (PPP) exchange rates, rather than market rates.
column2: ICP的数据使用购买力平价汇率（PPP）而非市场汇率比较各国GDP。

column1: This is the right thing to do when looking at real (inflation-adjusted) income per capita in order to measure people’s living standards.
column2: 如果要比较真实（经通胀调整的）人均收入以测量人民的生活水平，这样比较是正确的。

column1: But it is the wrong thing to do when looking at national income in order to measure the country’s weight in the global economy.
column2: 但若要衡量国民收入以测量一国在全球经济中的分量，这样比较是错误的。

column1: The bottom line is that, by either criterion – per capita income (at PPP exchange rates) or aggregate GDP (at market rates) – the day when China surpasses the US remains in the future.
column2: 基本要点在于，以两种标准算 — — 人均收入（以PPP汇率衡量）和总GDP（以市场汇率衡量 ） — —中国超越美国的时刻都在未来。

column1: This in no way detracts from the country’s impressive growth record, which, at about 10% per year for three decades, constitutes a historical miracle.
column2: 这并不是说中国令人印象深刻的增长记录不重要 — — 以10%左右的速度连续增长三十年，这绝对是一个历史奇迹。

column1: At market exchange rates, the American economy is still almost double the size of China’s (83% larger, to be precise).
column2: 按市场汇率，美国经济仍比中国大几乎一倍（准确地说是大83 % ） 。

column1: If the Chinese economy’s annual growth rate remains five percentage points higher than that of the US, with no significant change in the exchange rate, it will take another 12 years to catch up in total size.
column2: 如果中国经济年增长率保持比美国高五个百分点的水平并且汇率不发生重大变化，那么还要12年才能从总规模上赶超美国。

column1: If the differential is eight percentage points – for example, because the renminbi appreciates at 3% a year in real terms – China will surpass the US within eight years.
column2: 如果两国增长率之差达到八个百分点 — — 比如由于人民币每年以3%的速度实际升值 — — 中国将在八年内赶超美国。

column1: The PPP-versus-market-exchange-rate issue is familiar to international economists.
column2: PPP和市场汇率之争对国际经济学家来说并不陌生。

column1: This annoying but unavoidable technical problem arises because China’s output is measured in renminbi, while US income is measured in dollars.
column2: 这一令人厌倦但不可回避的技术性问题产生的原因在于中国的产出以人民币计算，而美国收入以美元计算。

column1: How, then, should one translate the numbers so that they are comparable?
column2: 那么，我们应该如何换算数字以使它们变得可比？

column1: The obvious solution is to use the contemporaneous exchange rate – that is, multiply China’s renminbi-measured GDP by the dollar-per-renminbi exchange rate, so that the comparison is expressed in dollars.
column2: 一个明显的办法是使用当时的汇率 — — 即把中国的人民币GDP乘以美元兑人民币汇率，从而以美元单位比较两者。

column1: But then someone points out that if you want to measure Chinese citizens’ standard of living, you have to take into account that many goods and services are cheaper there.
column2: 但随后有人提出，如果你想衡量中国人民的生活水平，你必须考虑许多在中国更廉价的商品和服务。

column1: A renminbi spent in China goes further than a renminbi spent abroad.
column2: 花在中国的人民币比花在外国的人民币值钱。

column1: For this reason, if you want to compare per capita income across countries, you need to measure local purchasing power, as the ICP does.
column2: 基于这一理由，如果你想比较不同国家的人均收入，就需要用当地购买力平价衡量，ICP就是这么做的。

column1: The PPP measure is useful for many purposes, such as knowing which governments have succeeded in raising their citizens’ standard of living.
column2: PPP在很多方面很有用，如了解那些政府在提高人民生活水平方面取得了成功。

column1: Looking at per capita income, even by the PPP measure, China is still a relatively poor country.
column2: 在人均收入方面，即使用PPP很像，中国仍是相对贫穷国家。

column1: Though it has come very far in a short time, its per capita income is now about the same as Albania’s – that is, in the middle of the distribution of 199 countries.
column2: 尽管中国的人均收入在短时间内上涨了很多，但现在仍和阿尔巴尼亚相当 — — 即位列199个国家的中游。

column1: But Albania’s economy, unlike China’s, is not often in the headlines.
column2: 但和中国不同，阿尔巴尼亚经济很少吸引媒体眼球。

column1: That is not only because China has such a dynamic economy, but also because it has the world’s largest population.
column2: 这不仅是因为中国经济充满着活力，也是因为它拥有世界最大人口。

column1: Multiplying a middling per capita income by more than 1.3 billion “capita” yields a big number.
column2: 将中等人均收入乘以13亿多“人口 ” ， 就产生了一个巨大的数字。

column1: The combination of a large population and a medium income gives it economic power, and also political power.
column2: 大人口和中等收入的结合给了中国经济实力，也给了它政治实力。

column1: Similarly, we consider the US the number-one incumbent power not just because it is rich.
column2: 类似地，我们之所以将美国视为在任第一号强国，不仅是因为它富有。

column1: If per capita income were the criterion by which to judge, Monaco, Qatar, Luxembourg, Brunei, Liechtenstein, Kuwait, Norway, and Singapore would all rank ahead of the US.
column2: 如果人均收入可以作为评判标准，那么摩纳哥、卡塔尔、卢森堡、文莱、列支敦士登、科威特、挪威和新加坡都比美国排名靠前。

column1: (For the purposes of this comparison, it does not matter much whether one uses market exchange rates or PPP rates.)
column2: （对于这项比较，使用市场汇率还是PPP汇率并不十分重要。

column1: If you are shopping for citizenship, you might want to consider one of those countries.
column2: ）如果你要选购公民身份，或许会想要这些国家中的一个。

column1: But we do not consider Monaco, Brunei, and Liechtenstein to be among the world’s “leading economic powers,” because they are so small.
column2: 但我们不会考虑把摩纳哥、文莱和卢森堡作为世界“领先经济大国 ” ， 因为它们太小了。

column1: What makes the US the world’s leading economic power is the combination of its large population and high per capita income.
column2: 让美国成为世界领先经济大国的是其庞大的人口和高人均收入的组合。

column1: It is this combination that explains the widespread fascination with how China’s economic size or power compares to America’s, and especially with the question of whether the challenger has now displaced the long-reigning champion.
column2: 这一组合解释了为何将中国经济规模或实力与美国相比较是一件令人如此兴奋的事，特别是挑战者现在是否能够取代长期领先者这一问题。

column1: But PPP exchange rates are not the best tool to use to answer that question.
column2: 但PPP汇率不是回答这一问题的最佳工具。

column1: The reason is that when we talk about an economy’s size or power, we are talking about a broad range of questions – and a broad range of interlocutors.
column2: 原因在于，当我们谈论一国的规模或实力时，我们谈论的是一系列范围很广的问题 — — 以及一系列范围很广的对话者。

column1: From the viewpoint of multinational corporations, how big is the Chinese market?
column2: 从跨国公司的角度看，中国市场有多大？

column1: From the viewpoint of global financial markets, will the RMB challenge the dollar as an international currency?
column2: 从全球金融市场角度看，人民币能挑战美元的国际货币地位吗？

column1: From the viewpoint of the International Monetary Fund and other multilateral agencies, how much money can China contribute, and how much voting power should it get in return?
column2: 从国际货币基金组织和其他多边机构角度看，中国可以贡献多少资金？ 应该回馈给中国多大的投票权？

column1: From the viewpoint of countries with rival claims in the South China Sea, how many ships can its military buy?
column2: 从在南海立场上不同的国家看，中国海军可以买多少艘舰艇？

column1: For these questions, and most others involving total economic heft, the indicator to use is GDP at market exchange rates, because what we want to know is how much the renminbi can buy on world markets, not how many haircuts or other local goods it can buy back home.
column2: 对于这些问题以及其他与总体经济实力相关问题看，有用的指标是市场汇率GDP，因为我们想知道的是人民币可以在世界市场上买到多少东西，而不是人民币可以在国内理多少次发、买多少国产货。

column1: And the answer to that question is that China can buy more than any other country in the world – except the US.
column2: 而这一问题的答案是，中国比世界任何其他国家买的东西都要多 — — 除了美国。

column1: Piketty’s Missing Rentiers
column2: 皮克提忽略的吃租者

column1: CAMBRIDGE – Most reviews of Thomas Piketty’s book Capital in the Twenty-First Century have already been written since its startling rise to the top of bestseller lists in April.
column2: 美国剑桥—大部分关于托马斯·皮克提（Thomas Piketty）的《二十一世纪资本论 》 （ Capital in the Twenty-First Century）的书评是在4月份该书一炮而红、登上畅销书榜首时写的。

column1: But I thought it wise to read the volume in its entirety before offering my thoughts.
column2: 但我认为，明智的做法是先通读全书，在给出感想。

column1: It has taken me five months, but I have finally finished it.
column2: 我花了五个月读这本书，好歹是读完了。

column1: One thing that the book has in common with Karl Marx’s Capital is that it serves as a rallying point for those concerned about inequality, regardless of whether they understand or agree with Piketty’s particular argument.
column2: 该书与马克思的《资本论 》 （ Capital）的一个共同点是，它成了召集担心不平等性的人的一面旗帜，不管他们是否理解或同意皮克提的具体观点。

column1: To be fair, whereas very little of what Marx wrote was based on carefully collected economic statistics, and much of it was bizarre, much of what Piketty writes is based on carefully collected economic statistics, and very little of it is bizarre.
column2: 平心而论，尽管马克思的著作很少具有仔细搜集的经济数据作为支撑，并且许多内容堪称海外奇谈，但皮克提著作的大部分内容建立在仔细搜集的经济数据的基础上，很少有海外奇谈。

column1: In the United States, income inequality by most measures has been rising since 1981, and by 2007 had approximately re-attained its early-twentieth-century peak.
column2: 在美国，大部分不平等性指标自1981年以来都在上升，2007年几乎已经达到20世纪初的最高水平。

column1: The same is true in the United Kingdom, Canada, and Australia.
column2: 英国、加拿大和澳大利亚也是如此。

column1: In these countries, income inequality declined sharply from 1914 to 1950, as it did in France, Germany, Japan, and Sweden.
column2: 在这些国家，收入不平等性在1941—1950年期间迅速下降，法国、德国、日本和瑞典也是如此。

column1: But in the latter group, the income distribution is now far more egalitarian than it was at peak inequality a hundred years ago.
column2: 但后几个国家目前的收入分配比一百年前不平等性最严重的时候平均得多。

column1: Economists, at least in the US, have focused on several causes of the increase in inequality.
column2: 经济学家，至少是美国经济学家，关注着不平等性上升的几个原因。

column1: First, there is the wage difference between “skilled” and “unskilled” workers, defined according to their educational attainment.
column2: 首先 ， “ 高技能 ” （ skilled）和“低技能”工人（根据教育程度划分）之间有工资差异。

column1: Here, higher wages are often agreed to reflect the economic value of skills appropriate to an increasingly technological economy, and the question is how to improve workers’ skills.
column2: 在这里，一个共识是高工资往往反映了适应日益高科技的经济的技能的经济价值，而问题在于如何改进工人的技能。

column1: Second, there is the high compensation of corporate executives and people in finance.
column2: 其次，公司高管和金融业者的薪酬很高。

column1: The financial crisis of 2008 left many observers understandably doubtful of claims that this compensation is a return to socially valuable activities.
column2: 容易理解，2008年金融危机让许多观察家质疑如此高薪酬是有社会价值的活动的回报的观点。

column1: Third, there is the winner-take-all character of many professions.
column2: 第三，许多职业表现出赢家通吃的特征。

column1: In a society that can identify the best dentist in town or the best football player in the world, relatively small differences in abilities win far bigger differences in income than they used to.
column2: 在一个可以区分城里最好的牙医和全球最好的足球选手的社会，能力上的相对较小的差距会导致收入上的比过去大得多的差异。

column1: Finally, there is “assortative mating”: highly accomplished professional men now marry highly accomplished professional women.
column2: 最后是“门当户对 ” ， 高成就的职业男性与高成就的职业女性结婚。

column1: Piketty focuses on none of these sources of inequality, all of which are related to “earned income” (wages and salaries).
column2: 皮克提不关心所有这些不平等性的根源，它们都是关于“赚得收入 ” （ earned income工资和薪水）的。

column1: Rather, his central concern is what he regards as a twenty-first-century trend toward inequality of wealth, brought about by the steady accumulation of savings among the better off, which are then passed down, with accumulated interest, from one generation to the next.
column2: 相反，皮克提的核心关注点是他所谓的二十一世纪趋势 — — 财富不平等性，这种不平等性来自较富有人群的储蓄积累，他们的储蓄连同累计利息代代相传。

column1: It is true that capital’s share of income (interest, dividends, and capital gains) rose gradually in major rich countries during the period 1975-2007, while labor’s share (wages and salaries) fell, a trend that would support Piketty’s hypothesis if it continued.
column2: 诚然，1975—2007年间，主要发达国家资本的收入部分（利息、红利和资本利得）逐渐增加，劳动部分（工资和薪水）逐渐下降，如果这一趋势持续，就支持皮克提的假说。

column1: Piketty deserves credit for pointing out the lack of a foundation supporting assertions that capital’s share will necessarily revert to a long-run constant.
column2: 皮克提的确做出了贡献，他指出，资本的各成分比例趋于长期稳定值的主张没有支撑基础。

column1: But interest rates have been at all-time lows in recent years – virtually zero.
column2: 但利率在近几年中一直保持历史最低水平 — — 几乎为零。

column1: And the claim that in the long run the interest rate must be substantially greater than the economic growth rate is absolutely central to Piketty’s book.
column2: 而长期而言利率必须显著高于经济增长率的观点是皮克提著作的绝对核心。

column1: That said, Piketty’s vision is focused squarely on the truly long run: century-long trends, not decade-long fluctuations.
column2: 如此看，皮克提的着眼点完全是真正的长期 — — 以世纪为单位的长期趋势，而不是以十年为单位的波动。

column1: For example, the recent global financial crisis runs counter to his ultra-long-run hypothesis: his statistics clearly show a discrete fall in inequality and in capital’s share in 2008-09, because asset prices plummeted.
column2: 比如，当前的全球金融危机就有悖于他的超长期假说：他的数据明白无误地表明，2008—2009年不平等性出现了零散的下降，资本比例亦然 ， ， 因为资产价格出现了暴跌。

column1: But, from the perspective of his analysis, this is a historical blip.
column2: 但是，从他的分析角度看，这只是历史的暂时现象。

column1: Three century-long movements constitute the essence of the book: a rise in inequality in the nineteenth century, a fall in inequality in the twentieth century, and a predicted return to historically high inequality in the twenty-first century.
column2: 三个世纪长的运动构成了该书的基础：十九世纪不平等性的升高，二十世纪不平等性的降低，以及预言二十一世纪不平等性回归历史高峰。

column1: Piketty argues convincingly – not just with statistics, but also with references to Honoré de Balzac and Jane Austen – that the first increase in inequality in France and Britain, mostly from 1800 to 1860, took the form of capital accumulation.
column2: 皮克提令人信服地指出 — — 不仅有统计数据，还参考了巴尔扎克和简·奥斯丁 — — 法国和英国的首次不平等性上升（主要在1800—1860年）形���为资本积累。

column1: A small group of rich rentiers lived off their interest; the rest had to work for a living.
column2: 一小撮富有的吃租者（rentier）靠利息过活；其他人则需要工作谋生。

column1: The most dramatic movement in Piketty’s graphs is the second one, the sharp fall in inequality in the period 1914-1950.
column2: 在皮克提的图表中，最戏剧性的运动是第二张，即1941—1950年不平等性的显著下降。

column1: This is attributable to the destruction of capital – owing to two world wars, the 1929 stock-market crash, and inflation – as well as an historic move toward big government and progressive taxation.
column2: 这被归因于资本的毁灭 — — 拜两次世界大战、1929年股市崩盘和通货膨胀所赐 — — 以及趋向大政府和累进税制的历史运动。

column1: What is surprisingly scarce in Piketty’s data is evidence that the third movement – the renewed upswing in inequality that started around 1980 – is due to a shift from labor back to capital.
column2: 皮克提的数据所极度缺乏的是第三次运动 — — 不平等性再次上升，始于1980年前后 — — 源于劳动力衰落、资本复兴的证据。

column1: The share of capital income in the UK and France remains far lower than it was in 1860.
column2: 法国的资本收入比例仍远低于1860年。

column1: The increases in various measures of inequality since the 1970s have had more to do with shifts within labor’s share (between different categories of earned income) than with wealth.
column2: 20世纪70年代以来各种不平等性指标的上升更多地与劳动力内部比例变化（不同赚得收入类别之间）而不是财富有关。

column1: Today’s rich work, unlike those in the Balzac-Austen era.
column2: 今天的富人需要工作，而巴尔扎克-奥斯丁时代不需要。

column1: Thus, Piketty’s hypothesis is more a prediction of the future than an explanation for the past or an analysis of a recent trend.
column2: 因此，皮克提的假说更多地是对未来的预测，而不是对过去的解释或对现有趋势的分析。

column1: It is a prediction that interest rates will rise substantially above the growth rate, capital will accumulate, and the rich will get richer through inheritance and capital income, rather than through outlandish salaries and stock options.
column2: 在这个预测中，利率将升高到显著高于增长率的水平，资本会继续积累，富人会通过继承和资本收入而不是通过离谱的薪水和股票期权变得更富。

column1: For all of Piketty’s impressive historical data, his prediction is based mainly on a priori reasoning: income distribution must tend to inequality because savings accumulate.
column2: 皮克提的历史数据令人印象深刻，但其预测主要基于先验的推理：因为储蓄的积累，收入分配必然倾向于不平等。

column1: But one could just as easily find a priori grounds for predicting that countervailing forces will emerge if the gap between rich and poor continues to grow.
column2: 但你可以同样轻松地做出先验性预测：如果贫富差距继续扩大，制约力量就会崛起。

column1: Democracy is one such force.
column2: 民主就是这种力量之一。

column1: After all, the rise of progressive taxation in the twentieth century followed the excesses of the Belle Époque.
column2: 毕竟，二十世纪累进税制的出现就是在一战前的美好时代的荒淫无度之后。

column1: A few years ago, the US reduced federal taxes on capital income and phased out the estate tax, benefiting only the upper 1% – moves widely viewed as demonstrating the political power of the rich.
column2: 几年前，美国降低了资本收入的联邦税，并逐步取消了房地产遗产税，这只能让最顶层1%获益 — — 被广泛视为富人炫耀政治权力。

column1: But imagine that in the future we lived in a Piketty world, where inheritance and unearned income fueled stratospheric income inequality.
column2: 但想象一下皮克提世界中的未来：遗产和非赚得收入导致收入不平等性一飞冲天。

column1: Could a majority of the 99% still be persuaded to vote against their self-interest?
column2: 99%的大多数还能被说服投出不利于其自身利益的选票吗？

column1: Why the ECB Should Buy American
column2: 欧洲银行应该买美国

column1: CAMBRIDGE – The European Central Bank needs to ease monetary policy further.
column2: 美国剑桥—欧洲央行需要进一步宽松货币政策。

column1: Eurozone-wide inflation, at 0.8%, is below the target of “close to 2%,” and unemployment in most countries remains high.
column2: 泛欧元区通胀（0.8 % ） 低于“近2 % ” 的目标，大部分国家的失业率也依然高企。

column1: Under current conditions, it is hard for the periphery countries to reduce their costs to internationally competitive levels, as they need to do.
column2: 在当前环境下，外围国很难让成本降至具有所需的国际竞争力的水平。

column1: If inflation in the eurozone as a whole is below 1%, the periphery countries are condemned to suffer painful deflation.
column2: 如果欧元区整体通胀低于1 % ， 则外围国必将遭遇痛苦的通缩。

column1: The question is how the ECB can ease policy, given that short-term interest rates are already close to zero. Most of the talk in Europe concerns proposals to undertake quantitative easing (QE), following the path taken by the US Federal Reserve and the Bank of Japan.
column2: 问题在于，在短期利率已经接近于零的情况下，欧洲央行该如何放松货币政策，欧洲的大部分观点提出应该步美联储和日本银行的后尘采取量化宽松（QE ） 。

column1: This would mean expanding the money supply by buying member countries’ government bonds – a realization of ECB President Mario Draghi’s “outright monetary transactions” scheme, announced in August 2012 in the midst of growing uncertainty about the euro’s future (but never used since then).
column2: 这意味着购买成员国政府债券以扩大货币供给，即实现欧洲央行行长德拉吉2012年8月在欧元区未来不确定性日增背景下提出（但从未真正动用过）的“直接货币交易”机制。

column1: But QE would present a problem for the ECB that the Fed and other central banks do not face.
column2: 但QE会给欧洲央行带来美联储和其他央行不会面临的问题。

column1: The eurozone has no centrally issued and traded Eurobond that the central bank could buy.
column2: 欧元区没有集中发行和交易的欧元债券可供欧洲央行购买。

column1: (And the time to create such a bond has not yet come.)
column2: （并且这种债券何时能成为现实还是未知数。

column1: By purchasing bonds of member countries, the ECB would be taking implicit positions on their individual creditworthiness.
column2: ）如若购买成员国债券，欧洲央行就相当于间接肯定或否定了个别国家的信用。

column1: That idea is not popular with the eurozone’s creditor countries.
column2: 这一方案在欧元区债权国并不受支持。

column1: In Germany, ECB purchases of bonds issued by Greece and other periphery countries are widely thought to constitute monetary financing of profligate governments, in violation of the treaty under which the ECB was established.
column2: 在德国，欧洲央行购买希腊和其他外围国发行的债券的操作被广泛认为是向放纵政府提供货币融资，违反了欧洲央行据以建立的条约。

column1: The German Constitutional Court believes that the OMT scheme exceeds the ECB’s mandate, though it has temporarily tossed that political hot potato to the European Court of Justice.
column2: 德国宪法法院认为，直接货币交易超越了欧洲央行的权限范围，尽管它暂时地把这个烫手的政治山芋抛给了欧洲法院。

column1: The legal obstacle is not merely an inconvenience; it also represents a valid economic concern about the moral hazard that ECB bailouts present for members’ fiscal policies in the long term.
column2: 政治障碍不仅在于不方便，也彰显出一个合理的经济担忧，即欧洲央行的援助会造成成员国长期财政政策的道德风险。

column1: That moral hazard – a subsidy for fiscal irresponsibility – was among the origins of the Greek crisis in the first place.
column2: 这一道德风险 — — 对不负责任的财政的补贴 — — 正是当初希腊危机的根源。

column1: Fortunately, interest rates on Greek and other periphery-country debt have fallen sharply over the last two years.
column2: 幸运的是，希腊和其他外围国债务的利率在过去两年里有了大幅下降。

column1: Since he took the helm at the ECB, Draghi has brilliantly walked the fine line required to “do whatever it takes” to keep the eurozone intact.
column2: 自德拉吉入主欧洲央行以来，他起到好处地“竭尽全力”保持着欧元区的完整。

column1: (After all, there would be little point in upholding pristine principles if doing so resulted in a breakup, and fiscal austerity alone was never going to return the periphery countries to sustainable debt paths.)
column2: （毕竟，如果坚持最初的原则造成欧元区解体，那么坚持也就毫无意义了，而财政紧缩决不可能让外围国重回可持续增长之路。

column1: At the moment, there is no need to support periphery-country bonds, especially if it would flirt with illegality.
column2: ）现阶段，没有必要支持外围国债券，特别是这样做有违规之嫌时。

column1: What, then, should the ECB buy if it is to expand the monetary base?
column2: 那么，如果欧洲央行想要扩张货币基础，应该买什么呢？

column1: For several reasons, it should buy US treasury securities.
column2: 出于多条理由，它应该买美国国债。

column1: In other words, it should go back to intervening in the foreign-exchange market.
column2: 换句话说，它应该回归干预外汇市场。

column1: For starters, there would be no legal obstacles.
column2: 首先，这样做不存在法律障碍。

column1: Operations in the foreign-exchange market are well within the ECB’s remit.
column2: 外汇市场操作在欧洲央行的权限范围内。

column1: Moreover, they do not pose moral-hazard issues (unless one thinks of the long-term moral hazard that the “exorbitant privilege” of printing the world’s international currency creates for US fiscal policy).
column2: 此外，这样做也不会有道德风险（除非你考虑印刷世界国际储备货币的“过度特权”给美国财政政策造成的长期道德风险。

column1: Finally, ECB purchases of dollars would help push down the euro’s exchange rate against the dollar.
column2: ）最后，欧洲央行购买美元有助于欧元对美元贬值。

column1: Such foreign-exchange operations among G-7 central banks have fallen into disuse in recent years, partly owing to the theory that they do not affect exchange rates except when they change money supplies.
column2: 近几年来，G-7央行之间再也没有进行过此类外汇操作，部分是因为，在理论上，除非汇率改变了货币供给，否则它们不会干预汇率。

column1: But in this case we are talking about an ECB purchase of dollars that would change the euro money supply.
column2: 但在这里，我们讨论的是欧洲央行购买可以改变欧元货币供给的美元。

column1: The increase in the supply of euros would naturally lower their price.
column2: 欧元供给的增加自然会拉低欧元的价格。

column1: Monetary expansion that depreciates the currency is more effective than monetary expansion that does not, especially when, as is the case now, there is very little scope for pushing short-term interest rates much lower.
column2: 促使汇率贬值的货币扩张比没有这一效果的货币扩张更加有效，特别是在无法进一步降低短期利率的情况下（目前就是如此 ） 。

column1: Depreciation of the euro would be the best medicine for restoring international price competitiveness to the periphery countries and reviving their export sectors.
column2: 欧元的贬值是重塑外围国国际价格竞争力和振兴它们的出口部门的最佳办法。

column1: Of course, they would devalue on their own had they not given up their currencies for the euro ten years before the crisis (and if it were not for their euro-denominated debt).
column2: 当然，如果在危机发生十年前它们没有为了使用欧元而放弃本国货币（并且它们的债务也不是用欧元计价 ） ， 那么它们还可以自主贬值。

column1: If abandoning the euro is not the answer, depreciation by the entire eurozone is.
column2: 如果无法放弃欧元，那么只好让整个欧元区一起贬值。

column1: The euro’s exchange rate has held up remarkably during the four years of crisis.
column2: 欧元汇率在危机的四年中令人注目地保持着坚挺。

column1: Indeed, the currency appreciated further when the ECB declined to undertake any monetary stimulus at its March 6 meeting.
column2: 事实上，在欧洲央行在3月6日的会议上拒绝采取货币刺激后，欧元还有所升值。

column1: Thus, the euro could afford to weaken substantially.
column2: 因此，欧元担得起大幅贬值。

column1: Even Germans might warm up to easy money if it meant more exports.
column2: 即使德国也有可能给货币宽松开绿灯，如果这意味着增加出口的话。

column1: Central banks should and do choose their monetary policies primarily to serve their own economies’ interests.
column2: 央行应该也确实主要根据自身经济利益选择货币政策。

column1: But proposals to coordinate policies internationally for mutual benefit are fair.
column2: 但为了共同利益进行国际政策协调的方案也是公平的。
