column1: Raghuram Rajan, the governor of the Reserve Bank of India, has recently called for the advanced economies’ central banks to take emerging-market countries’ interests into account via international cooperation.
column2: 印度储备银行行长拉古兰·拉詹（Raghuram Rajan）最近呼吁发达经济体央行通过国际合作顾及新兴市场国家的利益。

column1: ECB foreign-exchange intervention would fare well in this regard.
column2: 从这个角度讲，欧洲央行的汇率干预能起到很好的作用。

column1: This year, the emerging economies are worried about a tightening of global monetary policy, not the policy loosening that three years ago fueled talk of “currency wars.”
column2: 今年，新兴经济体担心的是全球货币政策的紧缩，而不是三年前助长“货币战争”论的政策宽松。

column1: As the Fed tapers its purchases of long-term assets, including US treasury securities, it is a perfect time for the ECB to step in and buy some itself.
column2: 随着美联储逐渐退出其长期资产（包括美国国债）买入计划，欧洲央行站出来购买美国国债正当其时。

column1: Britain’s Populist Fantasies
column2: 英国的民粹主义幻想

column1: LONDON – The election of Jeremy Corbyn as the new leader of the British Labour Party is a reminder that life is rich with paradox.
column2: 伦敦 — — 杰瑞米·柯比当选为英国工党新领袖提醒我们生活到处充满了悖论。

column1: Globalization – the web of travel, technology, trade, and information that binds the world ever more closely together – is hardly a new phenomenon.
column2: 全球化 — — 即旅行、技术、贸易和信息网络使世界更加紧密地联系在一起 — — 已经不再是什么新闻。

column1: But politics in many developed democracies has lately been disrupted by populist insurgencies seeking to exit this shared reality.
column2: 但不少发达民主国家政治近来都遭到拒绝承认这一共同现实的民粹主义叛乱分子的破坏。

column1: What these groups do not seem to recognize is that the alternative they wish for is a fantasy.
column2: 上述群体似乎并未意识到他们所心仪的选择仅仅是个幻觉。

column1: From Syriza in Greece to the National Front in France, voters across Europe are being encouraged to believe in a virtual reality shaped by prejudice and uninformed nostalgia.
column2: 从希腊激进左翼联盟到法国国民阵线，民粹主义者鼓励欧洲选民相信由偏见和无知的留恋构成的一个虚拟现实。

column1: In the United States, this mood first emerged several years ago, fueling the rise of the Tea Party and now enabling the splenetic presidential campaigns of Donald Trump and other Republican candidates who promise to seal America off from the twenty-first century.
column2: 几年前这种情绪在美国的首次出现助长了茶党崛起，现在又导致了唐纳德·特朗普和承诺将美国与21世纪隔绝的其他共和党候选人怨气冲天的总统竞选。

column1: (The promise is to some extent literal: By building walls along the country’s northern and southern borders, the candidates would defend the American dream from outside contamination.)
column2: （某种程度上这是个实际承诺：通过在美国南北边境线上修建隔离墙，候选人将捍卫美国梦想不受外来污染。 ）

column1: The United Kingdom is the latest victim of this fantasy-driven populism.
column2: 英国是上述幻想民粹主义的最新受害者。

column1: On the right, we have already suffered the rise of the anti-European, anti-immigrant UK Independence Party, led by the cigarette-smoking, beer-swilling joker Nigel Farage, in whom Britain has found its own version of Silvio Berlusconi, if you can imagine such a thing.
column2: 英国现在已经被迫面对反欧洲、反移民的英国独立党的崛起，想象一下，该党领导人是英国版的西尔维奥·贝卢斯科尼，也就是抽着烟卷、喝着啤酒的小丑奈杰尔·法拉奇。

column1: Now the British left has embraced a similar folly.
column2: 现在英国左翼也已经出现了类似的愚蠢行为。

column1: The Labour Party’s defeat in May’s general election brought about the resignation of its leader, Ed Miliband, a courteous and intelligent figure who, having abandoned the middle ground once controlled by former Prime Minister Tony Blair, had failed to convince even his own party that he could run the country.
column2: 工党五月大选失败导致其领导人、聪明知礼的米利班德辞职，米利班德放弃了前首相布莱尔把持的中立地带，甚至无法说服所在政党自己具备管理国家的能力。

column1: The campaign to choose his successor proceeded throughout the summer.
column2: 整个夏天都在竞选其继任者。

column1: On the whole, the search was a pretty dismal business.
column2: 总体而言，寻找候选人的过程非常痛苦。

column1: Three respectable, if uninspiring, former ministers vied for the position, but struggled to find a compelling message that connected the party of the left with modern Britain.
column2: 三名德高望重却缺乏亮点的前部长争夺这一职位，但却很难找到令人信任的口号把左翼党派和现代英国联系在一起。

column1: Unsure of the right approach, they wavered somewhere between moderation and left-wing nonsense.
column2: 因为拿不准正确道路，他们在中庸和左翼胡言乱语间来回摇摆。

column1: Such indecisiveness was not a problem for Corbyn, whose principal distinction in more than three decades in parliament has been voting against his own party more than 500 times on the grounds that its proposals were not socialist enough.
column2: 对柯比来说优柔寡断不是问题，他30多年议会生涯最主要的与众不同之处就在于因为提案不够社会化而投票反对自己的政党。

column1: In fact, Corbyn made it onto the ballot only because a few MPs wanted to show that the Labour Party welcomed debate.
column2: 事实上，柯比进入表决阶段仅仅因为少数几位议员想向外界表明工党对争论持欢迎态度。

column1: But his passionate advocacy of old-fashioned socialism quickly caught on, breathing new life – and drawing tens of thousands of new members – into a party that had been losing adherents in droves.
column2: 但他对老式社会主义的狂热宣传却迅速流行 — — 令成千上万新党员对已失去众多追随者的政党趋之若鹜。

column1: So what exactly are Corbyn’s proposals?
column2: 那么柯比的建议究竟是什么？

column1: At home, he would nationalize industries, especially in energy, and raise taxes, especially on business and the wealthy.
column2: 他在国内提倡尤其是能源等行业国有化和对企业和富裕群体提高税收。

column1: Any semblance of fiscal prudence would go out the window, with cuts in health, welfare, and education spending being reversed.
column2: 任何形式的财政审慎都会被彻底抛弃，并且逆转削减医疗、福利和教育支出。

column1: Trade unions would regain the power they enjoyed before Margaret Thatcher’s reforms in the 1980s.
column2: 工会将得到20世纪80年代玛格丽特-撒切尔改革之前曾经有过的权力。

column1: And public-sector workers would become the principal beneficiaries of the country’s spending programs.
column2: 而且公共部门从业人员将成为国内支出计划的主要受益者。

column1: In foreign policy, Corbyn would slash defense spending and abandon the UK’s nuclear deterrent.
column2: 外交政策方面，柯比将削减国防开支和放弃英国核威慑。

column1: He would blame virtually anything that went wrong in the world on America, which is, in his view, morally equivalent to Russia.
column2: 他会将世界上发生的一切问题都归咎于在他看来在道德上可与俄罗斯等量齐观的美国。

column1: If a leader like the late Hugo Chávez, the architect of Venezuela’s “socialist revolution,” emerges, Corbyn would probably be on the next plane to meet him.
column2: 如果像已故的委内瑞拉“社会主义革命”设计者雨果·查韦斯那样的领导人出现，柯比很可能会登上下一班飞机去会见他。

column1: Despite his radical views, Corbyn won the battle to lead Labour – and hence Britain’s parliamentary opposition, with nearly 60% of the vote.
column2: 尽管观点激进，但柯比赢得了工党领导权 — — 也因此拥有了英国议会反对党近60%的选票。

column1: But Labour will not win a general election under Corbyn – a reality that has caused some Conservatives to respond to his victory as though they had won the lottery.
column2: 但工党不会在柯比的领导下赢得大选 — — 某些保守党人也因此在他获胜后表现得像是中了彩票。

column1: In my view, however, no good will come from this insurrection for anyone.
column2: 但在我看来，这样的混乱对任何人都没有好处。

column1: First, Corbyn will not be swept out of his job by an early display of public distaste and hostility.
column2: 首先，柯比不会因为刚开始出现的公众厌恶和敌意就丢掉工作。

column1: On the contrary, at the outset, he may be able to galvanize many alienated young voters against a government that has earned wary respect but is not much liked.
column2: 相反，从一开始他就可能鼓动很多难以融入社会的年轻选民反对赢得了谨慎尊重但却不为人喜爱的政府。

column1: Second, without effective and responsible opposition, governments can become arrogant, careless, and too focused on their own supporters.
column2: 其次，如果缺少负责有效的反对势力，政府可能变得傲慢、粗心和过度关注自己的支持者。

column1: In this case, leaders of the Conservative Party’s far-right component are likely to think that they can dispense with offering disciplined support to Prime Minister David Cameron and his policies, because Labour can never win under Corbyn, anyway.
column2: 如果是这样，保守党极右翼部分领导人可能认为可以无需为首相戴维·卡梅伦及其政策提供无条件的支持，因为反正工党也不可能在柯比的领导下胜出。

column1: Third, at some time over the next year, the UK will face a referendum over its membership in the European Union.
column2: 第三，明年某个时候，英国将为是否保留欧盟成员国资格进行全民公投。

column1: While no one knows the position Corbyn will take on this issue, one can speculate that he, like some of the trade-union bosses who support him, might decide that the EU is a rich man’s club, thereby precluding the much-needed cross-party consensus in favor of continued membership.
column2: 虽然没人知道柯比在这个问题上的立场，但却可以推测他像支持他的某些工会老板一样，或许会将欧盟视为富人俱乐部，从而破坏保留欧盟成员国资格所迫切需要的跨党派的共识。

column1: Fourth, Corbyn, who shares many of the political views of the Scottish nationalists, will make it more difficult to manage the question of Scotland’s place in the UK.
column2: 第四，与许多苏格兰民族主义者有着相同政治观点的柯比将加大英格兰管理苏格兰地位问题的难度。

column1: Making common cause with the nationalists in policy matters will complicate the question of how best to deal with their constitutional aspirations.
column2: 在政策问题上与民族主义者站在一起将使处理其宪法诉求的问题进一步复杂化。

column1: Fifth, there is a danger that the Conservative government, faced with irrational populist forces on both the left and the right, will shrink from its duty to stand up for good values and good sense.
column2: 第五，保守党政府面对荒谬的左右翼民粹主义势力从原来的行使职能退而坚持正确价值观的危险性始终存在。

column1: But it is vital that, amid all the make-believe, there are still those who hammer home the simple truth that, no matter how much people wish for it, a country cannot decide simply to stop the world and get off.
column2: 但在一切乱象之下，重要的是仍有人坚持一个最简单的真理：即无论人们抱有多么迫切的愿望，一个国家也无法决定让世界停止运转，让自己下车。

column1: Corbyn’s election underscores how many Britons are refusing to accept reality.
column2: 柯比的当选表明有太多英国人拒绝接受现实。

column1: It is up to Cameron to end their dangerous reverie.
column2: 卡梅伦必须结束他们危险的遐想。

column1: Taking Corbynomics Seriously
column2: 严肃对待科尔宾经济学

column1: LONDON – Fiscal austerity has become such a staple of conventional wisdom in the United Kingdom that anyone in public life who challenges it is written off as a dangerous leftist.
column2: 伦敦—在英国，财政紧缩已成为传统智慧的一大标志，任何敢于在公开挑战这一智慧的人都会被扣上危险的左派的帽子。

column1: Jeremy Corbyn, the current favorite to become the next leader of Britain’s Labour Party, is the latest victim of this chorus of disparagement.
column2: 目前最有希望成为英国工党下一任领导人的杰里米·科尔宾（Jeremy Corbyn）便是这一“全民鄙视链”的最新受害者。

column1: Some of his positions are untenable.
column2: 他的一些立场确实站不住脚。

column1: But his remarks on economic policy are not foolish, and deserve proper scrutiny.
column2: 但他对经济政策的评论并不愚蠢，应该引起恰当的仔细思考。

column1: Corbyn has proposed two alternatives to the UK’s current policy of austerity: a National Investment Bank, to be capitalized by canceling private-sector tax relief and subsidies; and what he calls “people’s quantitative easing” – in a nutshell, an infrastructure program that the government finances by borrowing money from the Bank of England.
column2: 科尔宾提出了两个取代英国当前紧缩政策的方案：一是成立一家国家投资银行，通过取消私人部门税收优惠和补贴筹集资本；二是实施他所谓的“人民的量化宽松 ” — —概而言之，即政府从英格兰银行借钱进行基础设施建设。

column1: The first idea is neither extreme nor new.
column2: 第一个方案既不极端，也不新鲜。

column1: There is a European Investment Bank, a Nordic Investment Bank, and many others, all capitalized by states or groups of states for the purpose of financing mandated projects by borrowing in the capital markets.
column2: 目前我们已经有了欧洲投资银行、挪威投资银行和其他许多投资银行，它们的资本来自国家或国家集团，目的是通过从资本市场借钱为指定项目融资。

column1: The rationale for this type of institution derives from what that great socialist theorist Adam Smith called the state’s responsibility for the “erection and maintenance” of those “public works and institutions,” which, while of great advantage to society, would not profit private enterprise.
column2: 成立这类机构的理由可以追溯到伟大的社会主义理论家亚当·斯密所谓的国家有对那些“公共工程和机构”负有“兴建和维护”的责任，这些公共工程对社会非常有利，但无法令私人企业盈利。

column1: In other words, the state should always have an investment function.
column2: 换句话说，国家永远都应该承担投资功能。

column1: Delegating that function to a dedicated institution may have advantages for the presentation of the public accounts.
column2: 将这一功能委托给专门的机构有利于在公共账户上有所体现。

column1: Today’s particular economic circumstances provide a second reason for establishing a National Investment Bank.
column2: 今天特殊的经济环境为成立国家投资银行提供了第二个理由。

column1: In slump or even semi-slump conditions, a higher-than-normal proportion of private savings are held in cash or its nearest equivalent (short-term treasury bills).
column2: 在萧条或近乎萧条的环境下，比平常时期更高比例的私人存款亿现金或现金等价物（短期国债）持有。

column1: A National Investment Bank could draw out these “idle savings” by issuing bonds for infrastructure development.
column2: 国家投资银行可以通过发行基础设施开发债券利用这些“闲置存款 ” 。

column1: Offering a small premium on government securities, such bonds would likely attract long-term investors like pension funds, which otherwise face zero or even negative real returns.
column2: 相对政府债券，这类债券提供较小的溢价，有望吸引退休基金等长期投资者，否则这类投资者将面临零甚至负实际回报。

column1: For example, with a fiscal outlay of €21 billion ($23.3 billion), the European Investment Bank is set to finance investments worth at least €315 billion by 2017.
column2: 比如，在财政支出只有210亿欧元的情况下，到2017年，欧洲投资银行需要为至少3,150亿欧元的投资项目融资。

column1: “People’s quantitative easing” is a more unorthodox – and a more interesting – version of this idea.
column2: “人民的量化宽松”是比较非正统 — — 也比较有趣 — — 的观点。

column1: Under conventional quantitative easing (QE), the central bank buys government securities from banks or corporations and relies on the extra cash that it “prints” to stimulate private spending.
column2: 在传统量化宽松下，央行从银行或公司买入政府债券，并依靠它所“印”的新增现金刺激私人支出。

column1: But studies suggest that much of this money goes into speculative activity, risking asset bubbles, rather than being channeled into productive investment.
column2: 但研究表明这笔资金大量流入了投机活动，有可能引起资产泡沫，而没有被引入生产性投资。

column1: An alternative would be to distribute the central bank’s newly issued money directly to housing associations, local councils, or national or regional investment banks – any organization that could carry out infrastructure projects.
column2: 一个替代方案是直接将央行新发货币分配给住房协会、地方委员会或国家或地区投资银行 — — 只要是能进行基础设施投资的组织。

column1: This is what Corbyn proposes.
column2: 这就是科尔宾的方案。

column1: This idea of monetary financing of fiscal deficits (borrowing from the central bank, rather than from the bond markets) has a reputable pedigree.
column2: 这一用货币给财政赤字融资的想法（从央行而不是债券市场借钱）由来已久。

column1: In a lecture to the Cass Business School in February 2012, Adair Turner, former Chairman of the UK Financial Services Authority, proposed it as an option if further borrowing from the markets were politically or financially impossible.
column2: 2012年2月，在卡斯商学院（Cass Business School）的演讲中，英国金融服务局前主席阿代尔·特纳（Adair Turner）指出，如果进一步从市场借钱在政治或金融上不可行，那么这也不失为一个选择。

column1: Corbyn’s proposal, unlike orthodox monetary financing, would not add to the national debt – a major advantage.
column2: 科尔宾的方案不同于正统货币融资，它不会增加国民债务 — — 这是其主要优点。

column1: Orthodox QE – let’s call it “monetization one” – is intended to be reversed, with taxation used to raise the money to redeem the government bonds held by the central bank.
column2: 正统量化宽松 — — 让我们称之为“货币化一号 ” — —是有逆���操作的打算的，用税收筹集资金回购央行所持有的政府债券。

column1: The expectation of future tax hikes could drive people to save part of the new money, rather than spend it.
column2: 未来税收增加的预期可能导致人们将一部分新增资金储蓄起来而不是花掉。

column1: Unorthodox QE (“monetization two”) avoids this problem, because the central bank’s borrowing will not be repaid; central-bank assets net out against government liabilities.
column2: 非正统量化宽松 （ “ 货币化二号 ” ） 能避免这一问题，因为央行的借款不需要偿付；央行资产冲抵政府负债。

column1: That is why it should not be excluded a priori.
column2: 因此不应该先验地将它排除在外。

column1: There is a strong case for monetization two in the eurozone, which faces zero growth and deflation.
column2: 有很好的理由认为面临零增长和通货紧缩的欧元区应该实施货币化二号。

column1: Indeed, while the QE program unveiled by the European Central Bank in January consists mainly of sovereign-debt purchases, the ECB will also buy debt issued by the European Commission and the European Investment Bank – key elements of monetization two.
column2: 事实上，尽管欧洲央行在1月所实施的量化宽松计划主要是买入主权债务，但欧洲央行也会购买欧盟委员会和欧洲投资银行发行的债务 — — 这正是货币化二号的关键要素。

column1: It will thus help to finance infrastructure investment.
column2: 因此，这有助于为基础设施融资。

column1: But it is hardly the case that the UK economy, currently growing at close to 3% a year, needs a further QE program of any kind right now.
column2: 但英国经济并非如此，目前英国经济增长率每年不到3 % ， 需要立刻采取任何形式的进一步量化宽松。

column1: The government can borrow all it wants from the bond markets at near-zero interest rates.
column2: 政府可以以近零利率从债券市场借到任何它想借的资金。

column1: Outsourcing such borrowing power to a National Investment Bank is merely a way to signal that any additional borrowing will be used for investment, not for current spending.
column2: 将这一借款权外包给国家投资银行只是一个释放信号的办法，表明任何新增借款都会被用于投资，而不会被用于当前支出。

column1: There are two solid arguments for activating such an institution in the UK today.
column2: 有两个有根据的理由应该在英国成立这样一个机构。

column1: First, the share of private investment in GDP is still below its pre-crash level of around 11% of GDP.
column2: 首先，私人投资占GDP的比重仍低于危机前水平（约为11 % ） 。

column1: This suggests that investors lack confidence in the durability of the recovery.
column2: 这表明投资者对于复苏能否持续缺少信心。

column1: Second, depending on the institution’s mandate, a state-led investment program offers a way to rebalance the British economy away from private speculative activity to long-term investment in sustainable growth, and away from the south-east to the midlands and the north of England.
column2: 其次，依托该机构取得的权限，国家领导的投资项目提供了一条英国经济再平衡之路，从私人投机性活动向可持续增长的长期投资转型；从东南向中部和北英格兰转型。

column1: In short, it offers a way to address the problem of “private affluence and public squalor” that John Kenneth Galbraith identified in the 1950s.
column2: 简言之，它提供了一个办法解决约翰·肯尼斯·加尔布雷斯（John Kenneth Galbraith）在20世纪50年代所发现的 “私人丰裕而公共穷酸”的问题。

column1: Corbyn should be praised, not castigated, for bringing to public attention these serious issues concerning the role of the state and the best ways to finance its activities.
column2: 科尔宾将这些事关国家角色以及国家行为最佳融资办法的严肃的问题摆在了公共面前，他应该因此受到赞扬而不是苛责。

column1: The fact that he is dismissed for doing so illustrates the dangerous complacency of today’s political elites.
column2: 他为此去职，这一事实表明了当今政治精英的危险的自负。

column1: Millions in Europe rightly feel that the current economic order fails to serve their interests.
column2: 数百万欧洲人正确地感觉到当前经济秩序已不再符合他们的利益。

column1: What will they do if their protests are simply ignored?
column2: 如果反对被完全忽视，他们会怎么做？

column1: Jeremy Lin and the Political Economy of Superstars
column2: 林书豪与超级巨星的政治经济学

column1: CAMBRIDGE – The biggest news around Cambridge in recent weeks has been Jeremy Lin, the Harvard economics graduate who has shocked the National Basketball Association by rising overnight from “nowhere” to become a genuine star, leading a losing New York Knicks team to an unlikely string of victories.
column2: 发自剑桥 — — 剑桥这几个星期的大新闻都是关于林书豪的，这位哈佛经济学毕业生仿佛在一夜之间从无名小卒崛起成为真正的超级巨星，不但令整个美国国家篮球联盟（NBA）为之一振，也为弱旅纽约尼克斯队带来了一连串的胜利。

column1: Lin’s success is delicious, partly because it contradicts so many cultural prejudices about Asian-American athletes.
column2: 林书豪的成功之所以如此令人刮目相看，在很大程度上是因为他打破了人们对亚裔美籍运动员的文化偏见。

column1: Flabbergasted experts who overlooked Lin have been saying things like “he just didn’t look the part.”
column2: 那些原本忽视林书豪的专家们纷纷说“他看上去不像那种（能成名的）人 。 ”

column1: Lin’s obvious integrity and graciousness has won him fans outside the sport as well.
column2: 而林书豪那种溢于言表的诚恳谦和也为他赢得了许多赛场之外的粉丝。

column1: The whole world has taken note, with Lin being featured on the cover of Sports Illustrated for two consecutive issues. The NBA, which has been trying to build brand recognition and interest in China, is thrilled.
column2: 当他连续两期登上《体育画报》的封面时，全世界也为之瞩目，也令致力于在中国树立品牌形象以及关注度的NBA大喜过望。

column1: I confess to being a huge Lin fan.
column2: 坦白说，我也是林书豪的粉丝。

column1: Indeed, my teenage son has been idolizing Lin’s skills and work ethic ever since Lin starred on the Harvard team.
column2: 事实上，我儿子早在林书豪为哈佛大学队打球的时候就对他的球技和职业道德崇拜不已。

column1: But, as an economist observing the public’s seething anger over the “one percenters,” or individuals with exceptionally high incomes, I also see a different, overlooked facet of the story.
column2: 但在以一个经济学家身份观察公众对那“1%的富人”或是收入极高者不断升温的愤怒之时，我也发现了这个成功故事中某些与众不同且被忽视的事实。

column1: What amazes me is the public’s blasé acceptance of the salaries of sports stars, compared to its low regard for superstars in business and finance.
column2: 令我吃惊的是公众对体育明星的高昂薪水具有某种近乎漠不关心的认同，却对那些商业或者金融界翘楚评价很低。

column1: Half of all NBA players’ annual salaries exceed $2 million, more than five times the threshold for the top 1% of household incomes in the United States.
column2: 大多数NBA篮球名星的年薪都超过200万美元，比进入那1%高收入美国家庭的门槛值还高5倍。

column1: Because long-time superstars like Kobe Bryant earn upwards of $25 million a year, the average annual NBA salary is more than $5 million.
column2: 由于象科比·布莱恩特这样的超级明星每年都有近2500万美元进账，因此NBA球员的平均年薪已经超过500万美元。

column1: Indeed, Lin’s salary, at $800,000, is the NBA’s “minimum wage” for a second-season player.
column2: 相比之下林书豪的年薪只有80万美元，对于一个第二年打NBA的球员来说只算是“最低工资 ” 。

column1: Presumably, Lin will soon be earning much more, and fans will applaud.
column2: 不难想象，林书豪的工资肯定会大涨，而粉丝们也会对此大加赞许。

column1: Yet many of these same fans would almost surely argue that CEOs of Fortune 500 companies, whose median compensation is around $10 million, are ridiculously overpaid.
column2: 但这些粉丝中的许多人都肯定会质疑那些花红中位数在1000万美元左右的世界五百强企业CEO们，认为他们收取了极不合理的报酬。

column1: If a star basketball player reacts a split-second faster than his competitors, no one has a problem with his earning more for every game than five factory workers do in a year.
column2: 如果一名篮球运动员的动作能比他的对手快那么零点几秒，没人会质疑他打一场球的收入比5名工厂工人的年薪还多。

column1: But if, say, a financial trader or a corporate executive is paid a fortune for being a shade faster than competitors, the public suspects that he or she is undeserving or, worse, a thief.
column2: 但如果一个金融交易员或者一个企业主管能令自己的企业比竞争者领先一步，公众却怀疑他/她根本不够格领这份高薪，甚至将其视为小偷。

column1: Economists have long studied the economics of superstars in fields where a company can lever enormously the decisions of a small number of individuals, making them valuable in a way that someone who can, say, chop down trees like the legendary Paul Bunyan, is not.
column2: 经济学家们一直都在研究那些经济界巨子，在某些领域中一个企业可以将一小批人的决策极度放大，并使之取得一种即便是传说中的伐木巨人保罗·班扬（Paul Bunyan）这样的个体都无法实现的价值。

column1: But the political economy of what levels of income differences countries will tolerate remains uncharted territory.
column2: 但对各国究竟可以容忍何种程度的收入差距的政治经济学研究却依然是一片空白。

column1: Of course, there is a certain logic to the public’s disdain for superstar compensation outside of professional sports and entertainment.
column2: 当然，公众对体育娱乐之外的高收入者巨额花红的鄙视背后也有一个较为确定的逻辑。

column1: This is especially the case in some areas of finance that are essentially zero-sum games, in which one person’s gain is another’s loss.
column2: 尤其是在某些本质上是零和博弈，一个人赚的钱必定来自他人损失的金融领域。

column1: There are other areas, such as technology, in which someone like Apple’s late founder, Steve Jobs, arguably delivers real innovation and quality, rather than just employing lawyers and lobbyists to maintain a monopoly position.
column2: 还有其他领域也是例外，比如科技，就像苹果公司已故的创立者史蒂夫·乔布斯那样能为公众传递货真价实的创新和高质量，而不是雇佣一帮律师和国会游说者来维持自己的垄断地位。

column1: As a basketball fan, I would not describe the sport as a zero-sum game, even though one team wins and one team loses.
column2: 作为一个篮球迷，我不会将这项运动视为一种零和博弈，即便某一支队的赢球必然是构筑在另一支队的输球之上的。

column1: The best players have huge creative flair. But so do some “street ball” players who excel in slam-dunk theatrics; perhaps because they are not tall enough to compete, they make almost nothing.
column2: 那些最顶尖的球员确实拥有极大的创造性天赋，但其实一些擅长扣篮表演的“街球”运动员也有；或许他们的身高无法跟他人竞争，所以也赚不到什么钱。

column1: Do fans tolerate outsize sports incomes because players are role models?
column2: 那么粉丝们是否因为球员所起到的模范作用而容忍他们的巨额收入？

column1: Many certainly are, but not all high-paid sports celebrities are exemplary citizens.
column2: 在这方面当然有许多球员以身作则，但不是所有高薪体育明星都是模范公民。

column1: Michael Vick, a star quarterback in the US National Football League, served time in prison for running a vicious dog-fighting operation, and arrests of players on charges ranging from illegal possession of drugs and weapons to domestic battery have been a regular occurrence.
column2: 比如美国国家橄榄球联盟（NFL）的明星四分卫迈克尔·维克就由于组织残忍的斗狗比赛而入狱，还经常有一些球员因非法持有毒品/武器或者家庭暴力而被捕。

column1: And, back on the field or court, serious infractions occur all the time.
column2: 此外某些严重犯规事件在运动场上也时有发生。

column1: Think of Zinedine Zidane’s infamous head butt in the 2006 football World Cup.
column2: 回想2006年世界杯上齐达内对对手的那一记著名的冲顶。

column1: In the NBA itself, a star player, Ron Artest, was suspended for the remainder of the 2004 season after going into the stands and brawling with heckling fans during a game. (Artest has now changed his name to Metta World Peace, perhaps in response.)
column2: 还有NBA自己的明星球员罗恩·阿泰斯特（Ron Artest）曾因在2004赛季的一场比赛中冲上观众席与球迷扭打而遭停赛 — — 他如今将自己的名字改成爱·世界和平（Metta World Peace ） ， 或许是为了改过自新吧。

column1: Moreover, sports teams surely lobby governments as aggressively as any big business.
column2: 此外，体育运动队对政府的游说肯定跟任何大企业一样无所不用其极。

column1: Professional sport is a legislated monopoly in most countries, with top teams extracting free stadiums and other privileges from host cities.
column2: 在大多数国家职业体育都是一个合法垄断的行业，那些著名球队都能从所在城市得到免费运动场或者其他特权。

column1: Indeed, Lin’s story, it should be remembered, grew out of a huge labor dispute between the NBA’s billionaire owners and its millionaire players over division of the league’s nearly $4 billion in annual revenues – more than many countries’ national income.
column2: 事实上，请一定要记住林书豪的故事是在NBA亿万富翁球队老板和百万富翁球员之间关于如何分配每年40亿美元收入的争端中凸显出来的 — — 这笔钱可比许多国家的年度GDP还要高。

column1: As the late University of Chicago economist Sherwin Rosen postulated, globalization and changing communication technologies have increasingly made the economics of superstars important in a variety of fields.
column2: 正如已故芝加哥大学经济学家舍温·罗森（Sherwin Rosen）所假设的那样，全球化和信息交流技术的变革逐渐令明星经济在许多领域变得重要。

column1: That is certainly true in sports and entertainment, but it is also the case in business and finance.
column2: 这在体育和娱乐方面肯定是没错的，但在商业和金融方面其实也是如此。

column1: I wish Lin a long and successful career as a superstar, though he will have already had a huge cultural impact even if his success proves meteoric.
column2: 我希望林书豪能有一个持久而光辉的职业生涯，虽然他的迅速串红已经带来了巨大的文化冲击。

column1: One can hope that, as Asian-Americans continue to break barriers in other arenas – they remain under-represented among corporate CEOs, for example – these rising superstars will be greeted with similar acclaim.
column2: 我们可以预计，随着亚裔美国人继续在其他竞技场上冲破重重障碍 — — 比如担任企业CEO方面 — — 这些崛起的超级巨星们也会的到同样的赞誉。

column1: If the public is not happy about high superstar incomes, the obvious remedy is to improve the tax system, including for powerful sports-team owners, many of whom benefit from huge tax breaks in their day jobs. Who knows?
column2: 如果公众对这些超级明星的高收入感到不满意，最明显的应对方法就是改善税务系统，其中包括许多财鸿势大的运动队老板，谁知道他们中的许多人每天从巨额逃税中赚取了多少好处呢？

column1: With a more level playing field, superstars outside sports and entertainment might find themselves a bit better appreciated.
column2: 可见如果能建立一个更公正平等的赛场，体育和娱乐界之外的明星都会发现自己得到了更多的赞赏。

column1: Food for All
column2: 人皆有食

column1: LONDON – With food prices having doubled in the past decade, food security is back on the international agenda.
column2: 伦敦 — — 随着过去十年里食品价格翻了一番，粮食安全问题又重新提上了国际议程。

column1: How can the world produce more to feed the next billion people?
column2: 世界怎样才能提高产量再养活10亿人？

column1: How can agricultural yields be raised?
column2: 如何才能提高农业产量？

column1: What is the best way to develop aquaculture?
column2: 怎样以最佳方式发展水产养殖？

column1: Unfortunately, this focus on the supply side misses half the problem.
column2: 遗憾的是，关注供应并没有意识到问题的全部。

column1: The world already produces more than twice the number of calories that the human population requires.
column2: 全球卡路里产量已经两倍于人类的需求。

column1: An estimated one-third of global food production is wasted.
column2: 据测算全球粮食产量的三分之一遭到了浪费。

column1: In poor countries, food is lost due to inadequate storage and gaps in the supply chain (for example, a lack of refrigeration); in rich countries, food is also wasted in the supply chain, and consumers throw a lot of food away.
column2: 贫困国家损失粮食是因为仓储能力匮乏和供应链衔接不善（比方说缺少冷藏设备 ） ； 富裕国家供应链也同样浪费粮食，而且消费者也扔掉大量的食物。

column1: Moreover, in many cases, it is poverty, not lack of food in the market, that drives hunger and nutritional deficiency.
column2: 此外，许多时候导致饥饿和营养不良的是贫困，而不是市场上粮食匮乏。

column1: Millions of people simply cannot afford to buy the food that they need, which could still be the case if supply were increased.
column2: 成百上千万人根本买不起所需的食物，就算供应量增加情况可能也还是这样。

column1: Fixing the demand side to get nutritious food to the poor – particularly to the mothers and children who are most vulnerable – is one of the most pressing food-security imperatives.
column2: 最迫切的粮食安全任务是整顿粮食需求，让穷人、特别是最脆弱的母亲���儿童得到有营养的食物。

column1: A broad range of initiatives can contribute to a solution.
column2: 解决问题可以采取一系列举措。

column1: For example, micro-level food security can be enhanced through programs that deliver free meals to vulnerable population groups.
column2: 比方说，向弱势群体免费提供餐食的计划可以改善微观层面的粮食安全。

column1: Schemes that provide free meals to schoolchildren not only help to feed the young; they also create an incentive for parents to keep their children in the classroom.
column2: 为学童提供免费餐食的计划不仅能养活年轻人；还能鼓励家长让他们的孩子留在课堂上。

column1: Initiatives like these are especially successful when complemented with programs that provide access to clean water, energy, safe cooking stoves, and so on.
column2: 类似的举措辅之以推广洁净水、能源、安全厨灶等方面的计划将会尤其成功。

column1: Action to reduce diarrhea – so that children retain the nutritional value of what they eat – is another part of the solution.
column2: 另外一种办法是采取行动控制痢疾（这样儿童才能吸收他们摄入的营养 ） 。

column1: Of course, in very poor countries and regions, where people cannot afford to buy food on world markets, the supply side should not be neglected.
column2: 当然，在民众无力在世界市场购买粮食的非常贫困的国家和地区，供应方面的问题不应被忽视。

column1: Boosting yields of locally grown staple foods (rather than cash crops) would increase self-sufficiency and strengthen resilience when international food prices are high.
column2: 提高当地种植的主食作物（而非经济作物）的产量能够提高自给率，让当地民众更能抵御高企的国际粮价。

column1: At the same time, higher agricultural production must be balanced against the associated ecological and social costs.
column2: 同时，必须对提高农业产量及相关生态社会成本进行综合考量。

column1: Output in South America, Southeast Asia, and Central Africa currently is being raised mainly by clearing tropical forests, grasslands, and wetlands.
column2: 南美、东南亚、非洲和中非目前主要通过砍伐热带森林、破坏草原和湿地来提高粮食产量。

column1: This approach contributes to climate change, interrupts hydrological cycles, and causes soil degradation, all of which undermine our planet’s ability to produce food in the long term.
column2: 这种方法导致气候变化、破坏水循环、造成土壤退化，从而使我们这个星球长期粮食生产能力遭受破坏。

column1: If current trends continue, the majority of the world’s remaining species will be extinct by the end of the century, and it is food production, above all other factors, that has driven the decline.
column2: 如果任由目前的趋势继续下去，世界多数现存的生物物种将在本世纪末灭绝，而造成这种局面的虽然也有其他因素，但最主要的还是粮食产量。

column1: More than 80% of all endangered birds and mammals are threatened by unsustainable land use resulting from agricultural expansion.
column2: 农业扩张造成的不可持续的土地利用导致80%以上的濒危鸟类和哺乳动物受到威胁。

column1: The lesson is clear: We should focus our attention on making production more efficient, reducing waste, and addressing the problem of unsustainable consumption.
column2: 应该吸取的教训显而易见：我们要重点提高粮食生产效率、减少浪费，并杜绝不可持续的粮食消费。

column1: Reducing food waste could save more than $250 billion worldwide – the equivalent of 65 million hectares of agricultural land use – by 2030.
column2: 减少粮食浪费到2030年可以在全球范围内节约2500多亿美元，相当于6500万公顷的农地产量。

column1: Building a temperature-controlled supply chain with 30,000 tons of modern storage in China would cost more than $100 million a year for the next 20 years.
column2: 在中国建成温控供应链及30,000吨现代仓储设施需要在今后20年内每年保持1亿美元的投入。

column1: Many developing countries simply do not have the money for such up-front investment.
column2: 许多发展中国家根本无力进行这样的先期投资。

column1: But, with the right focus and much more modest resources, they could dramatically improve the quality of grain silos where more than 30% of food – typically located close to the rural poor – spoils to the point of being unfit for human consumption.
column2: 但只要关注重点恰当，他们可以用少得多的资源大幅提高粮仓质量，避免超过30%的粮食 — — 往往靠近那些贫困的农村人口 — — 变质到不适合人类食用。

column1: There are already some positive trends that should be capitalized on globally.
column2: 已经出现了一些积极趋势应当在全球范围内加以利用。

column1: In the past few years, households in the United Kingdom have cut their food waste by 21% and the food industry has trimmed its waste streams by 8%.
column2: 过去几年内英国家庭的粮食浪费率降低了21 % ， 食品业废物流则降低8 % 。

column1: The public is more willing to forgo cosmetic perfection: “ugly” fruit and vegetables are the fastest-growing sector of the UK’s fresh-produce market, last year saving 300,000 tons of produce that would otherwise have been wasted for being the wrong shape or size.
column2: 公众愿意放弃关注外表的完美 ： “ 丑陋”水果和蔬菜是英国整个生鲜市场增长最快的部门，仅去年一年就节约了300,000吨农副产品，本来这些产品可能因为形状或大小不够完美而被浪费掉。

column1: Much anxiety is directed toward growing demand for meat and dairy products in China and India.
column2: 不少人焦虑中国和印度不断增长的肉类及奶制品需求。

column1: But per capita meat consumption in the United States and Europe is still more than three times higher than in either country.
column2: 但美欧的人均肉类消费量仍然是这两个国家的三倍还多。

column1: In addition to eating less meat, production of it needs to be more resource-efficient.
column2: 除了少吃肉外，肉类生产的资源效率也有待提高。

column1: In the past, cattle, sheep, and goats fed on grass and other energy sources unavailable to humans, while pigs and chickens fed on waste, thus contributing overall to total food availability.
column2: 过去牛、绵羊和山羊吃的草和其他能源人类都无法利用，猪鸡则以废物为食，从而有利于提高整体粮食供应量。

column1: Now one-third of all arable land is used to grow crops to feed livestock, not to grow staple crops for people.
column2: 现在三分之一的耕地都用来种植庄稼、喂养牲畜，不再用于人类主食的耕种。

column1: The rich buy this food to feed their animals, outbidding the poor who want to buy it to feed their children.
column2: 富人购买这些粮食来饲养他们的动物，比想要养活自己子女的穷人出价还高。

column1: The United Nations Environment Program estimates that using more by-products and waste to feed livestock could liberate enough food on the world market to feed an additional three billion people.
column2: 联合国环境计划署预测利用更多副产品及废物喂养牲畜可以在世界市场上腾出足够的粮食额外养活30亿人口。

column1: The Pig Idea campaign calls for an end to legislation in the European Union and some US states prohibiting the use of food waste to feed pigs and chickens because of the risk of animal diseases.
column2: 猪思想运动呼吁废止欧盟及美国某些州以可能导致动物生病为由禁止用餐厨垃圾饲喂猪鸡的法案。

column1: These risks can be managed effectively through proper treatment systems (as in Japan and South Korea).
column2: 相关风险可以通过恰当的治疗系统得到控制（就像日本和韩国一样 ） 。

column1: The environmental, economic, and social benefits would be enormous.
column2: 由此带来的环境、经济和社会效益将十分巨大。

column1: The earth is capable of feeding everyone.
column2: 地球有能力养活所有的物种。

column1: Failing to address problems affecting supply and demand amounts to grotesque mismanagement and a crime against the world’s poor, the planet’s other species, and future generations.
column2: 解决不了影响供需的问题就等同于荒诞可笑的管理不善甚至是对穷人、地球其他物种和子孙后代的犯罪。

column1: Donald Trump’s Federal Reserve
column2: 特朗普的美联储

column1: CAMBRIDGE – With the appointment of Jerome Powell as the next Chair of the United States Federal Reserve Board, Donald Trump has made perhaps the most important single decision of his presidency.
column2: 坎布里奇—特朗普任命杰罗姆·鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）为下一任美联储主席，这也许是他担任总统以来所做的最重要的决定。

column1: It is a sane and sober choice that heralds short-term continuity in Fed interest-rate policy, and perhaps a simpler and cleaner approach to regulatory policy.
column2: 这是一个理智清醒的选择，表明美联储的货币政策在短期将保持延续性，也表明美联储监管政策或将更加简单清晰。

column1: Although Powell is not a PhD economist like current Fed Chair Janet Yellen and her predecessor, Ben Bernanke, he has used his years as an “ordinary” governor at the Fed to gain a deep knowledge of the key issues he will face.
column2: 尽管鲍威尔不如现任美联储主席耶伦（Janet Yellen）和她的前任伯南克（Ben Bernanke）那样是一位拥有博士学位的经济学家，但凭借多年担任美联储“普通”理事的经验，他积累了关于他将面对的重要问题的深度知识。

column1: But make no mistake: the institution Powell will now head rules the global financial system.
column2: 但不要搞错了：鲍威尔现在将要执掌的机构，主宰着全球金融体系。

column1: All other central bankers, finance ministers, and even presidents run a distant second.
column2: 所有其他央行行长、财政部长甚至国家首脑，主宰力都远不如他。

column1: If that seems hyperbolic, it is only because most of us don’t really pay attention to the Fed on a day-to-day basis.
column2: 如果说这看上去有些夸张，那只是因为我们大部分人其实并没有日常紧盯着美联储。

column1: When the Fed gets it right, price stability reigns, unemployment remains low, and output hums along.
column2: 当美联储所做正确，物价就保持稳定，失业保持低位，产出源源不断。

column1: But “getting it right” is not always easy, and when the Fed gets it wrong, the results can be pretty ugly.
column2: 但“所做正确”未必容易，而当美联储所做错误，结果也相当糟糕。

column1: Famously, the Fed’s efforts to tame a stock-market bubble in the late 1920s sparked the Great Depression of the 1930s.
column2: 著名的例子有20世纪20年代末美联储熄灭股市泡沫的措施引发了30年代的大萧条。

column1: (Fortunately, of the candidates Trump was considering for the Fed post, Powell is the one least likely to repeat this mistake.)
column2: （幸运的是，在特朗普考虑过的美联储主席人选中，鲍威尔是最不可能重蹈这一覆辙的。

column1: And when the Fed printed mountains of money in the 1970s to try to dull the pain of that decade’s oil shocks, it triggered an inflationary surge that took more than a decade to tame.
column2: ）20世纪70年代，美联储海量印钞，试图以此平息这个十年中石油冲击所带来的阵痛，结果引发了通胀飙升，又花了十多年才把通胀遏制住。

column1: At times, the rest of the world seems to care more about Fed policy than Americans do.
column2: 在很多时候，世界其他国家比美国人更加关注美联储的政策。

column1: Little wonder: perhaps more than ever, the US dollar lies at the heart of the global financial system.
column2: 这并不奇怪：美元在全球金融体系中的核心地位也许比以往任何时候都更加稳固。

column1: This is partly because much of world trade and finance is indexed to the dollar, leading many countries to try to mimic Fed policies to stabilize their exchange rates.
column2: 这部分是因为世界贸易和金融大部分与美元挂钩，导致许多国家要跟在美联储的政策后亦步亦趋以稳定汇率。

column1: Powell will face some extraordinary challenges at the outset of his five-year term.
column2: 在他的五年任期伊始，鲍威尔就将面临一些重大挑战。

column1: By some measures, stock markets look even frothier today than they did in the 1920s.
column2: 从某些角度衡量，今天的股市比20世纪20年代泡沫更甚。

column1: With today’s extraordinarily low interest rates, investors seem ever more willing to assume greater risk in search of return.
column2: 在当今极低的利率环境下，投资者似乎更加愿意为了回报而承受更大风险。

column1: At the same time, despite a strongly growing US and global economy, inflation remains mystifyingly low.
column2: 与此同时，尽管美国和全球经济都在强劲增长中，通胀仍然令人困惑地低迷。

column1: This has made it extremely difficult for the Fed to normalize policy interest rates (still only 1%) so that it has room to cut them when the next recession hits, which it inevitably will.
column2: 这使得美联储的政策利率（仍只有1 % ） 正常化变得极其困难。 而只有实现了政策利率正常化，美联储才有空间在下一次衰退来临时（这是无法避免的）削减利率。

column1: (The odds of a recession hitting in any given year are around 17%, and that seems like a good guess now.)
column2: （任何给定年份发生衰退的概率为17 % ， 而现在衰退概率很高。 ）

column1: If Powell and the Fed cannot normalize interest rates before the next recession, what will they do?
column2: 如果鲍威尔和美联储无法在下一次衰退前实现利率正常化，他们该怎么办？

column1: Yellen insists that there is nothing to worry about; the Fed has everything under control, because it can turn to alternative instruments.
column2: 耶伦坚持认为没什么好担心的；美联储一切尽在掌握，因为它还有另类工具可用。

column1: But many economists have come to believe that much of this is smoke and mirrors.
column2: 但许多经济学家相信这些基本上都是骗人的东西。

column1: For example, so-called quantitative easing involves having the Fed issue short-term debt to buy up long-term government debt.
column2: 比如，所谓的量化宽松就是让美联储发行短期债务去买长期政府债务。

column1: But the US Treasury owns the Fed, and can carry out such debt purchases perfectly well by itself.
column2: 但美国财政部拥有美联储，它大可以自己完成这类债务购买。

column1: Some argue for “helicopter money,” whereby the Fed prints money and hands it out.
column2: 一些人认为可以“直升机撒钱 ” ， 即美联储印钱然后发钱。

column1: But this, too, is smoke and mirrors.
column2: 这也是骗人的把戏。

column1: The Fed has neither the legal authority nor the political mandate to run fiscal policy; if it tries to do so, it runs the risk of forever losing its independence.
column2: 美联储既没有法定权力，也没有政治授权来负责财政政策；如果它要这样做的话，就有可能永远失去独立性。

column1: Given that monetary policy is the first and best line of defense against a recession, an urgent task for the new chair is to develop a better approach.
column2: 货币政策是衰退的第一道也是最有效的一道防线，因此，新主席的一个紧迫任务是制定更好的方针。

column1: Fortunately, good ideas exist, and one can only hope that Powell will quickly move to create a committee to study long-term fixes.
column2: 幸运的是，好主意是有的，我们只能寄希望于鲍威尔能够迅速成立一个委员会研究长期方案。

column1: One idea is to raise the Fed’s inflation target.
column2: 一个主意是提高美联储的通胀目标。

column1: But this would be problematic, not least because it would breach a decades-long promise to keep inflation around 2%.
column2: 但这会带来问题，因为会打破几十年来将通胀保持在2%左右的承诺。

column1: Moreover, higher inflation would induce greater indexation, ultimately undermining the effectiveness of monetary policy.
column2: 此外，更高的通胀将引来更大的指数化，最终影响货币政策的效果。

column1: Paving the way for effective negative-interest-rate policy is a more radical – but by far the more elegant – solution.
column2: 为有效的负利率政策铺路是更加激进，但也是到目前为止最文雅的方案。

column1: Bank regulation is also part of the Fed’s mandate.
column2: 银行监管也属于美联储的权限范围。

column1: The 2010 Dodd-Frank financial-reform legislation, which has spawned 30,000 pages of rules, has been a boon for lawyers.
column2: 规则厚达30,000页的2010年多德-弗兰克（Dodd-Frank）金融改革立法让律师乐开了花。

column1: But the massive compliance costs ultimately fall on small and medium-size businesses.
column2: 但巨大的合规成本最终要落到中小企业头上。

column1: It would be far better simply to require banks to raise much more of their resources in equity markets instead of through bonds.
column2: 简单地要求银行加大从股市而非债券募集资源是一个更好的办法。

column1: That way, shareholders, not taxpayers, would take the big hit in a crisis.
column2: 如此，当危机来临时，受影响的将是股东而非纳税人。

column1: I have not mentioned the elephant in the room: the threat to the Fed’s independence posed by a president seemingly intent on challenging all institutional norms.
column2: 我还没有提到房间中的大象：一位貌似要挑战一切制度规范的总统给美联储的独立性带来的威胁。

column1: When President Richard Nixon was intent on being re-elected in 1972, he put heavy pressure on then-Fed Chair Arthur Burns to “juice” the economy.
column2: 1972年，尼克松总统寻求连任时，他向时任美联储主席伯恩斯（Arthur Berns）大举施压，要他“水灌”经济。

column1: Nixon was re-elected, but inflation soared and growth collapsed.
column2: 尼克松成功连任了，但通胀飙升，增长崩溃。

column1: No one should be wishing for a replay – even if Nixon eventually was impeached.
column2: 没人想要重新体验这一过程 — — 即使尼克松最终还是被弹劾了。

column1: Jihad or Murder?
column2: 圣战还是谋杀？

column1: It is remarkable that some of the most critical concepts of Muslim religious terminology have now become part of the international language of current affairs.
column2: 穆斯林宗教词汇中一些最关键的概念成为国际时事的常用词是一个令人瞩目的现象。

column1: Questions drawn from Islamic theology are discussed freely by the world public, engaging specialists and non-specialists, Muslims and non-Muslims.
column2: 从伊斯兰神学中抽出的问题在世界公众中被广泛讨论，吸引了专家和大众，穆斯林和非穆斯林。

column1: Theological disputation has moved far from Islam’s religious academies.
column2: 神学的争论早已不局限在伊斯兰宗教学府之中。

column1: For example, the term jihad, commonly translated as “holy war,” has become nearly ubiquitous.
column2: 例如 ， “ jihad”一词，通常被译作“圣战 ” ， 现在已经可说是无处不在了。

column1: Though conceived in early Muslim history as a means of spreading God’s word, Muslim scholars today distinguish between two kinds of jihad – one being an internal struggle against temptation, and the other a physical conflict against an aggressor who threatens the survival or the fundamental rights of a Muslim community.
column2: 虽然在它最早出现在穆斯林历史上时，意指一种传播神谕的方式。 当今的穆斯林学者们将两种“jihad”区分开来—一种是抗拒诱惑的内心斗争，而另一种则是针对威胁穆斯林社会的生存或根本权利的入侵者的斗争。

column1: In this context, there is widespread rejection of the fundamentalists’ use of the term.
column2: 在这种情况下，原教旨主义者对该词的使用普遍不被认同。

column1: Numerous Muslim scholars have raised their voices to challenge the terrorists’ defense of suicide bombings or attacks on civilians, offering long citations from centuries of religious jurisprudence.
column2: 无数的穆斯林学者都从几个世纪以来的宗教法律中引经据典，高声质问恐怖分子对其自杀式炸弹和对平民的攻击的辩护。

column1: In itself, this approach represents a worthy expression of collective conscience in opposition to the terrorists.
column2: 这种质问本身就是反对恐怖分子的集体良知的可贵表现。

column1: But many among the public and in the media want more.
column2: 但公众和媒体要求的还要更多。

column1: Muslim intellectuals are being encouraged to press the religious argument against fundamentalist violence in order to deprive the terrorists of their most fearsome and potent arguments.
column2: 穆斯林知识分子们被鼓励以宗教理论来驳斥原教旨主义的暴力，从而使恐怖分子失去最可怕和有力的理论支持。

column1: If Muslim scholars can somehow disprove these arguments, it is thought, then the terrorists’ ability to sustain their violent underground will be reduced.
column2: 人们认为如果穆斯林的学者能够推翻他们的论点，那么恐怖分子们维持其暴力地下活动的能力就会减弱。

column1: Is this right?
column2: 果真如此吗？

column1: A quick survey of the history of religious conflict shows that theological controversies have never been resolved by theological arguments.
column2: 对宗教冲突的历史进行一个快速的调查就会发现神学争论从来就不是神学争端的解决之道。

column1: Looking more closely, one finds that while these controversies were often framed in religious terms, they were not at all about religion.
column2: 进一步仔细考察，我们会发现这些以宗教语汇表达的争议其实与宗教根本没有关系。

column1: The range of opposing interpretations of religious texts is virtually unlimited, and disputes are seldom resolved by rational argument.
column2: 对宗教经典相互矛盾的诠释可以是无休止的，而这些争端极少能通过理性辩论来解决。

column1: In earlier times, such controversies were decided by political authorities, which used military force to impose one particular point of view at the expense of all others.
column2: 在早期，这样的争议要由政治权威来评判。 当权者使用武力，以压制其他观点为代价来树立某种观点。

column1: Muslim history is full of such cases.
column2: 穆斯林的历史中，这样的例子不胜枚举。

column1: Recently, when Saddam Hussein invaded Kuwait, he found scholars who raised theological arguments on his behalf.
column2: 当萨达姆·侯赛因最近一次入侵科威特时，他御用了一些提出神学观点为他代言的学者。

column1: The coalition confronting him had no difficulty finding religious arguments that led to precisely the opposite conclusion.
column2: 与他对抗的联军也毫不费力地找到了相应的神学论点，从而得出正好相反的结论。

column1: Today, it is clear that fundamentalists and their supporters are completely closed off to even the most elaborate theological refutation of their views, even when produced by distinguished religious authorities.
column2: 当今，非常清楚的一点就是原教旨主义者及其支持者们对驳斥他们观点的，哪怕是最详尽的神学论述也完全充耳不闻。 即便是这些驳斥来自于德高望重的宗教权威，情况也是如此。

column1: The first reflex of the fundamentalists is to withdraw from the mainstream, to build around themselves a shell that is impervious to any logic other than their own.
column2: 原教旨主义者们的第一反应就是从主流退却，并将自己包裹在一层外壳当中，使任何与己相左的逻辑都无法穿透。

column1: The most essential questions that humans face today – those that engender the deepest conflicts – have nothing to do with theology.
column2: 人类当今面临的最本质的一些问题—那些引发最深层次冲突的问题—都与神学无关。

column1: They concern disputes over territory, political power, definitions of rights, and distribution of wealth.
column2: 与之相关的是领土争端、政治权力、权力定义和财富分配。

column1: The means of discussing these questions is known to all and is expressed in all religions and all languages.
column2: 探讨这些问题的方式人尽皆知，在所有的宗教和语言中也有所表达。

column1: The evils most deeply resented – in all societies – are injustice, despotism, corruption, and poverty.
column2: 最令人痛恨的邪恶—在任何社会之中—都是不公正、专制、腐败和贫困。

column1: We all understand what these mean, and how certain people must live with them on a daily basis.
column2: 我们都明白这些意味着什么，也知道人们如何在日常生活中免不了要为其所困。

column1: Why, then, do we follow the fundamentalists to the very heart of their madness?
column2: 那么，为什么我们还要跟随原教旨主义者到他们疯狂的根源呢？

column1: Allowing them to frame these problems in religious terms legitimizes the perspective that they are attempting to impose, particularly in their own societies.It also allows them to camouflage their very worldly thirst for power.
column2: 允许他们将这些问题宗教化，就使那些他们一直企图强加于人的观点合法化了。 这在他们各自的社会中更是如此。

column1: Repeatedly, the Muslim religious establishment has been urged to issue statements denying fundamentalists the right to use religious terms like jihad.
column2: 国际社会反复敦促穆斯林宗教组织发布声明，剥夺原教旨主义者使用“圣战”一类宗教词汇的权利。

column1: But experience has proven that this approach leads nowhere.
column2: 但经验告诉我们这样的做法不会有结果。

column1: In fact, debates about the use of religious terms lend credibility to fundamentalist efforts to apply these ideas to conditions in the modern world.
column2: 事实上，关于使用宗教词汇的辩论反倒为原教旨主义者们在现代世界的条件下使用这些理念提供了可信度。

column1: Such debates concede that these religious concepts are generally valid, even when, as in the fundamentalists’ case, they simply do not apply.
column2: 这样的辩论承认即便是在不适用于原教旨主义者的情况下，这些宗教理念通常还是有效的。

column1: As a result, the entire discussion could easily backfire.
column2: 最终，整场讨论的结果很可能会适得其反。

column1: Invariably, fundamentalists dismiss religious critiques of their views as evidence that religious authorities have been corrupted by hostile influences.
column2: 原教旨主义者总是将对他们观点的批评作为宗教权威被敌对势力腐化的证据而置之不理。

column1: In this way, the terrorists oppose the “purity” and “authenticity” of their arguments to the compromises presumably forced upon religious establishments.
column2: 如此一来，恐怖分子们就能将自己观点的“纯粹”和“真实”作为反驳被认为是强加于宗教组织的妥协的论点。

column1: Speaking to Muslims exclusively in their own religious terms also excludes them from broad ethical frameworks that defend essential human values, most notably the protection of innocent civilians.
column2: 仅用穆斯林自己的宗教语汇和他们沟通还会将他们从更广泛的道德伦理框架中排除出去。 这些框架捍卫着基本的人类价值观，其中最明显的就是保护无辜平民。

column1: These values are the foundation upon which all religious and cultural traditions rest.
column2: 这些价值观是所有宗教和文化传统的立身之本。

column1: To be sure, it is important to understand the discourse of those who are making war on societies – their own societies first and foremost.
column2: 为了确认一点，了解那些向社会宣战的人的观点就尤为重要。 他们身处的社会总是首当其冲。

column1: But adopting the terrorists’ interpretation of events conceals the reality of this conflict.
column2: 但接受恐怖分子对这些事件的诠释就会掩饰这场冲突的真相。

column1: Instead of fighting on behalf of political and religious liberty, we risk engaging in a conflict with the false images that the terrorists have created.
column2: 我们会冒在恐怖分子制造的假象影响下，卷入这场冲突的风险，而不会为政治和宗教自由而战。

column1: Worse still, we would bring this conflict into our own societies, where different religious and cultural traditions are now inextricably mingled.
column2: 更糟糕的是，我们会将这场冲突带���我们自己的社会当中，而在我们的社会里，不同宗教以及文化传统已经不可分离地混合了。

column1: There is simply no need to look to theology to call a crime by its proper name.
column2: 我们完全没有必要为了给某种罪行定名而求助于神学。

column1: The revulsion provoked by the murder of innocents is deeply felt by all, and it is reprehensible by any standard, religious or not.
column2: 所有人对谋杀无辜者的行为都深恶痛绝。 这样的行为不论是以宗教还是非宗教的标准来看，都应受到谴责。

column1: It may even be that religious language does not adequately express the repulsion we all feel toward the terrorists’ actions.
column2: 宗教词汇甚至还不足以表达我们对恐怖主义行径的厌恶。

column1: No feeling of victimhood can justify, under any conditions, such crimes against innocents, and no theology can accept the negation of the human essence that we all share.
column2: 在任何情况下，任何受害者的情感也不能成为对无辜者施暴的借口。 任何的神学都不能接受对我们共有的人性本质的否定。

column1: Big Data for Poor Students
column2: 穷学生的大数据

column1: WASHINGTON, DC – Countries need skilled and talented people to generate the innovations that underpin long-term economic growth.
column2: 华盛顿—国家需要高技能人才产生推动长期经济增长的创新。

column1: This is as true in developed as it is in developing economies.
column2: 发达国家和发展中国家莫不如此。

column1: But it will not happen without investment in education and training.
column2: 但这只有通过教育和培训投资才能实现。

column1: If we are to end poverty, reduce unemployment, and stem rising economic inequality, we must find new, better, and cheaper ways to teach – and on a vast scale.
column2: 如果我们想终结贫困、减少失业、阻止经济不平等性升高，我们就需要找到更新、更好、更便宜并且是大规模庞的教学方式。

column1: This goal may seem to be beyond even wealthier countries’ means; but the intelligent collection, analysis, and use of educational data could make a big difference.
column2: 这一目标或许连富国都难以实现；但聪明地收集、分析和利用教育数据可以带来大不同。

column1: And, fortunately, we live in an age in which information technology gives us the right tools to broaden access to high-quality, affordable education.
column2: 此外，幸运的是，在我们生活的时代，信息科技给了我们合适的工具拓展了获得高质量、可负担教育的途径。

column1: Big data – high-volume, complex data sets that businesses use to analyze and predict consumer behavior – can provide teachers and companies with unprecedented amounts of information about student learning patterns, helping schools to personalize instruction in increasingly sophisticated ways.
column2: 大数据 — — 企业用来分析和预测消费者行为的大量复杂数据集 — — 可以为教师和公司提供前所未有的关于学生学习方式的信息，帮助学校以日渐成熟的方式实现个性化教学。

column1: The World Bank Group and its private-sector lending arm, the International Finance Corporation (IFC), are trying to harness this potential to support national education systems.
column2: 世界银行集团及其私人贷款部门国际金融公司（IFC）正在试图将这一潜能用于支持国民教育体系。

column1: A recently launched initiative, called the Systems Approach for Better Education Results (SABER), collects and shares comparative data on educational policies and institutions from countries around the world.
column2: 最新推出的改善教育的系统方法（Systems Approach for Better Education Results ，SABER）计划收集和共享各国教育政策和机构的可比数据。

column1: In the private sector, the ability to collect information about teacher-student interaction, and interaction between students and learning systems, can have a profound impact.
column2: 在私人部门，收集师生互动和学生-学习系统互动信息的能力能带来深远影响。

column1: In Kenya, for example, Bridge International Academies is using adaptive learning on a large scale.
column2: 比如，在肯尼亚，布里奇国际研究院（Bridge International Academies，BIA）正在大规模使用适应性学习。

column1: An IFC client founded by three American entrepreneurs, Bridge runs 259 nursery and primary schools, with monthly tuition averaging $6.
column2: BIA是一家由三家美国企业建立的IFC客户机构，运营着259家幼儿园和小学，平均月度学费为6美元。

column1: It is a massive learning laboratory for students and educators alike.
column2: 这是面向学生和教育者的大规模学习实验。

column1: Bridge tests different approaches to teaching standard skills and concepts by deploying two versions of a lesson at the same time in a large number of classrooms.
column2: BIA测试教授标准技能和概念的不同方法。 它在大量班级同时部署两个版本的课程。

column1: The lessons are delivered by teachers from standardized, scripted plans, via tablets that also track how long the teachers spend on each lesson.
column2: 课程由教师根据标准��书面教案讲授，并通过平板电脑追踪教师每个版本的授课时间。

column1: Exam results are recorded on the teacher’s tablet, with more than 250,000 scores logged every 21 days.
column2: 考试结果保存在教师的平板电脑中，每21天会录入250,000多项分数。

column1: From these data, Bridge’s evaluation team determines which lesson is most effective and distributes that lesson throughout the rest of the Academy’s network.
column2: 从这些数据中，BIA评估团队分析出哪个版本的课程最有效，并在BIA网络中的其他学校推广这个版本的课程。

column1: We know that a host of issues can cause a student’s performance to decline – scorching summer heat in classrooms without air conditioning, problems at home, or poor-quality teachers, to name a few.
column2: 我们知道，一系列问题可能造成学生表现下降 — — 夏季无空调教室的高温、家庭问题、教师质量欠佳，等等。

column1: But when one gathers results on a large scale, variables flatten out, and the important differences emerge.
column2: 但当你大规模收集结果时，变量就会扁平化，重要的区别会浮现出来。

column1: That is the great value of big data.
column2: 这就是大数据的重大意义。

column1: Another case is SABIS, a provider of K-12 education in the United States, Europe, Asia, the Middle East, and North Africa.
column2: 另一个例子是SABIS。 SABIS在美国、欧洲、亚洲、中东和北非提供K-12教育。

column1: SABIS mines large data sets to ensure high standards and enhance academic performance for more than 63,000 students.
column2: SABIS挖掘大数据以确保高标准，增进63,000多名学生的学习成绩。

column1: Continuous tracking of annual student academic performance yields more than 14 million data points that are used to shape instruction, achieve learning objectives, and ensure consistency across the company’s network of schools in 15 countries.
column2: 对学生年度学习成绩的持续追踪产生了1,400多万个数据点，这些数据点被用来确定教学方案、实现学习目标以及确保公司分布在15个国家的学校网络的一致性。

column1: Knewton, an adaptive learning platform that personalizes digital courses using predictive analytics, is another company at the forefront of the data revolution.
column2: Knewton公司是另一家居于数据革命前列的公司。 该公司是一家适应性学习平台，用预测分析实现数字资源的个性化。

column1: With tailored content and instruction, even classrooms without private-school resources can provide individual learning.
column2: 有了量身定做的内容和说明，即便不具备私立学校资源的学校也可以提供个体学习。

column1: As a result, teachers spend their time in the most effective way possible – solving problems with students – instead of delivering undifferentiated lessons.
column2: 结果，教师可以将时间用在效果最好的方式上 — — 与学生一起解题 — — 而不是无差别地授课。

column1: These benefits do not come without risk.
column2: 这些好处并不是没有风险的。

column1: We are only beginning to grapple with how big data’s tremendous potential for learning can be harnessed while protecting students’ privacy.
column2: 我们才刚刚开始领会大数据可以在保护学生隐私的基础上提供多么大的学习潜力。

column1: In some cases, data-collection technology is outpacing our ability to decide how it should be collected, stored, and shared.
column2: 在一些情形中，数据收集技术已经超越了我们确定数据应该如何收集、储存和共享的能力。

column1: No matter how rigorously data are secured, there is still a need for a clear licensing structure for its use.
column2: 无论数据保护的力度多大，我们都需要明确的许可制度规范数据的使用。

column1: In many developing countries, there are no regulations for data privacy at all.
column2: 在许多发展中国家，根本没有关于数据隐私方面的监管措施。

column1: The interface between data and education holds the promise of new educational products for improved learning, with large potential benefits, especially for the poor.
column2: 数据和教育之间的接口是新教育产品的关键，这些新教育产品可以改善学习效果，带来巨大的好处，特别是对穷国来说。

column1: To realize those benefits – and to do so responsibly – we must ensure that data collection is neither excessive nor inappropriate, and that it supports learning.
column2: 要实现这些好处 — — 并且以负责任的方式实现 — — 我们必须确保数据收集恰到好处并且支持学习。

column1: The private sector, governments, and institutions such as the World Bank Group need to formulate rules for how critical information on student performance is gathered, shared, and used.
column2: 私人部门、政府和世界银行集团等机构需要制定关于如何收集、共享和使用学生表现方面的关键数据的规则。

column1: Parents and students deserve no less.
column2: 这是家长和学生应得的。

column1: From War to Work
column2: 从战争到就业

column1: OXFORD – There is no denying that conflict has far-reaching negative effects, including on employment.
column2: 牛津 — — 不可否认冲突对包括就业形势在内的方方面面都能产生深远的负面影响。

column1: But the prevailing understanding of the relationship between conflict and employment does not fully recognize the complexity of this relationship – a shortcoming that undermines effective employment policies in fragile states.
column2: 但对冲突和就业关系的普遍理解却并未充分体现其中的复杂性 — — 这样的缺陷阻碍了脆弱国家制定有效的就业政策。

column1: The conventional wisdom is that conflict destroys jobs.
column2: 传统观点是冲突对就业起损害作用。

column1: Moreover, because unemployment can spur more conflict, as unemployed young people find validation and economic rewards in violent movements, job creation should be a central part of post-conflict policy.
column2: 不仅如此，失业年轻人在暴力活动中寻找自我价值和经济回报可能使失业引发进一步冲突，因此创造就业机会应当是后冲突期的核心政策。

column1: But, while this certainly sounds logical, these assumptions, as I detailed in a 2015 paper, are not necessarily entirely accurate.
column2: 尽管这听上去完全合乎逻辑，但我在2015年一篇论文中提到这些假设并不一定是完全准确的。

column1: The first assumption – that violent conflicts destroy jobs – ignores the fact that every conflict is unique.
column2: 第一种假设 — — 即暴力冲突破坏就业 — — 忽略了每一次冲突都各有特色。

column1: Some, like the 2008-2009 Sri Lankan civil war, are concentrated in a relatively small area, leaving much of the country – and thus the economy – unaffected.
column2: 有些，比如2008到2009年的斯里兰卡内战集中在相对较小的区域，从而导致该国大部分地区（以及经济）并未受到影响。

column1: Even endemic conflicts, like the recurrent conflicts in the Congo, might not have a major impact on net employment.
column2: 就连刚果那样不间断的地方性冲突也有可能不对就业状况造成重要影响。

column1: After all, the jobs that are lost in, say, the public sector or among commodity exporters may be largely offset by new jobs in government and rebel armed forces, informal production substituting for imports, and illegal activities like drug production and smuggling.
column2: 毕竟，在公共部门或产品出口商那里丧失的工作机会可以很大程度上在政府及反叛力量的新增就业机会那里得到补偿。 非正规生产代替进口，此外，新增就业机会还部分来源于毒品生产和走私等非法活动。

column1: Likewise, the second assumption – that unemployment is a major cause of violent conflict – misses crucial nuances.
column2: 同样，第二种假设 — — 即失业是暴力冲突的主要原因 — — 并没有考虑到关键的微妙之处。

column1: For starters, the formal sector accounts for just a fraction of total employment in most conflict-affected countries.
column2: 首先，正规行业在绝大多数受冲突影响的国家仅占就业总体份额的一小部分。

column1: The majority of working people are in the informal sector, often engaged in low-status, low-productivity, and low-incomes activities that can, just like unemployment, generate dissatisfaction and potentially motivate young people to join violent movements.
column2: 绝大多数就业人口都集中在非正规行业，往往从事低社会地位、低生产率和低收入的工作。 这样的工作就像失业一样，可以带来不满并有可能促使年轻人参加暴力活动。

column1: Given this, simply expanding formal-sector employment is not enough, unless it also improves the situation of young people in low-income informal-sector jobs.
column2: 有鉴于此，除非同时改善在低收入非正规行业就业的年轻人处境，否则仅仅扩大正规行业就业还远远不够。

column1: Yet post-conflict employment policies almost invariably neglect the informal sector.
column2: 但后冲突时期，就业政策几乎无一例外地忽视非正规行业的作用。

column1: Worse, new regulations – such as the ban on commercial biking in Freetown, Sierra Leone – sometimes block productive informal activities undertaken by youth.
column2: 更糟的是，新出台法规 — — 如塞拉利昂禁止在弗里敦开展商业自行车业务 — — 有时还会对年轻人在非正规行业的有效就业起阻碍作用。

column1: But even a focus on the informal sector is insufficient, as research has shown that poverty and marginalization are not, on their own, enough to cause conflict.
column2: 但即使关注非正规行业也还远远不够，因为研究表明贫困和边缘化本身并不足以引发冲突。

column1: If they were, most poor countries would be in conflict most of the time.
column2: 如果贫困和边缘化是冲突的充分条件，那么多数贫困国家绝大部分时间都将在冲突中度过。

column1: And that is not even remotely the case.
column2: 但实际情况却远不是这样的。

column1: Violent conflict occurs when leaders are motivated to mobilize their followers for it.
column2: 只有领袖鼓励追随者诉诸武力才会引发暴力冲突。

column1: That motivation can stem from a variety of sources, among the most common being exclusion from power.
column2: 上层动机可能来源于方方面面，其中最常见的莫过于统治权被剥夺。

column1: In that case, leaders will appeal to a common identity – for example, religion in the case of contemporary conflicts in the Middle East, or ethnicity in many African conflicts – to mobilize followers.
column2: 在那种情况下，领导层会利用某种共同身份来动员追随者 — — 如中东地区现代冲突中这种共同身份是宗教、而非洲许多冲突的共同身份则是种族。

column1: Of course, more than a shared identity alone is needed for mobilization to occur.
column2: 当然，需要比共同身份更多的因素才能成功地动员冲突。

column1: People will generally respond only if they already have grievances – in particular, if they feel that their group faces discrimination in access to resources and jobs.
column2: 人们一般在已经心存怨愤的情况下才会去响应武力号召 — — 尤其当他们感觉所属团体在资源和就业方面面临被歧视的状况。

column1: In this sense, employment is relevant, but what matters is not the absolute level of employment so much as the distribution of good jobs among religious or ethnic groups.
column2: 从这个意义上讲，就业与冲突具有相关性，但重要的却不是绝对的就业水平，而是好工作在不同宗教或种族团体之间的分配状况。

column1: In other words, simply creating more jobs, without regard to their allocation, may not ease tensions; if imbalances persist, job creation may even make things worse.
column2: 换句话说，仅仅创造更多就业机会而不考虑机会的分配或许对缓解紧张局势没有帮助；如果不平衡局面持续存在，就业机会的创造本身甚至可能使情况更糟。

column1: Yet post-conflict employment policies almost always neglect so-called “horizontal inequalities.”
column2: 但后冲突阶段的就业政策几乎总是忽视所谓的“横向不平等 ” 。

column1: For example, employment policies did little to reduce the strong regional imbalances and discrimination within regions that persisted in Bosnia and Herzegovina after the war there in the 1990s.
column2: 举例来说，20世纪90年代波斯尼亚和黑塞哥维那的战后就业政策在减少地区严重不平衡和歧视方面并未发挥多大作用。

column1: Given these failings, it is not surprising that employment policies’ net effects are often very small relative to the size of the problem.
column2: 鉴于存在上述缺陷，就业政策的净影响相对问题而言往往规模较小也就不足为怪了。

column1: In both Kosovo and Bosnia and Herzegovina, job creation was thought to be central to post-conflict peacekeeping efforts.
column2: 在科索沃、波斯尼亚和黑塞哥维那，后冲突维和工作的核心都是创造就业机会。

column1: Yet, in Kosovo, unemployment stood at 45% six years after its war ended.
column2: 但在科索沃，战争结束6年后失业率仍高达45 % 。

column1: In Bosnia, new programs generated just 8,300 jobs, while 450,000 people were demobilized; 20 years after the end of the conflict, the unemployment rate stood at 44%.
column2: 而在波斯尼亚，新计划仅仅创造了8，300个就业机会，而复原人数则高达450，000之多；冲突结束20年后，失业率仍在44%的位置居高不下。

column1: There is one example of a successful post-crisis employment policy.
column2: 后危机就业政策有一个成功的例子。

column1: Nepal’s government sought to expand opportunities in the informal sector after the country’s civil war, implementing programs focused on building infrastructure, issuing micro-credit, and providing technology assistance, targeting the most deprived regions and castes.
column2: 即尼泊尔政府在内战结束后曾寻求拓展非正式行业机会，并全力落实针对最贫困地区和阶层的以建设基础设施、发放小额贷款和提供技术援助为重点的政策。

column1: Recognizing the role that caste and ethnic tensions and discrimination played in fueling the conflict, the government designed employment schemes specifically for rural areas, along the same lines as India’s employment scheme, with 100 days of work per household guaranteed.
column2: 出于对阶层、种族紧张和歧视在助长冲突方面所起作用的认识，尼泊尔政府专门为农村地区设计了就业计划，该计划借鉴了印度计划的成功经验，保证为每户提供100天的工作量。

column1: The programs were supported by the Nepalese government and external donors, and focused on poorer regions and villages (and, within them, on the poorest castes).
column2: 上述计划得到尼泊尔政府和国外捐助者的支持，重点保障贫困地区和村庄（以及其中最贫困阶层）的实施工作。

column1: The period immediately following a conflict is a delicate one.
column2: 冲突刚刚结束的这段时期非常微妙。

column1: Leaders must make the most of that time, ensuring that every policy they pursue is as effective as possible.
column2: 领导人必须充分利用这段时间，确保实施的每项政策都尽可能有效。

column1: When it comes to employment, that means designing programs that reflect how people actually spend their working lives, as well as addressing the real grievances generating tensions.
column2: 具体到就业问题，这意味着设计出反映人们实际工作生活的就业计划，并解决造成紧张关系的现实不满因素。

column1: Otherwise, they risk allowing, if not encouraging, a relapse into organized violence.
column2: 否则，他们即使没有鼓励、也是在默许国家重新陷入到有组织的暴力当中。

column1: Jobless Recoveries and Manic Policies
column2: 失业性复苏和政策狂躁症
发自芝加哥 — — 在2001年以及最近的这次衰退中，美国都实施了堪称工业时代以来最为宽松的货币和财政政策。

column1: CHICAGO – Monetary and fiscal policies in the United States, both in this recession and the recession of 2001, have been among the most accommodating in the industrial world. As I write, Congress is working on yet another “jobs” bill. Indeed, John Taylor of Stanford University attributes the recent financial crisis to excessively stimulatory monetary policy towards the end of Alan Greenspan’s tenure as head of the US Federal Reserve.
column2: 就在本文落笔之时，国会还在制定另外一份“就业”法案。 事实上，斯坦福大学经济学教授约翰·泰勒教授将最近这场经济危机归因于艾伦·格林斯潘作为美联储主席任期即将届满而推行的过度刺激性货币政策。

column1: Why is US policy so accommodating?
column2: 那美国的政策为何会如此宽松呢？

column1: A central reason is that the nature of US economic recoveries has changed.
column2: 这主要是因为美国经济的本质已经发生了转变。

column1: From 1960 until 1991, US recoveries were typically rapid. From the trough of recessions, recovery to pre-recession output levels took less than two quarters on average, and employment recovered within eight months.
column2: 在1960年到1991年间美国的经济复苏速度都相当快，那时从衰退的最低点恢复到衰退前产出水平平均只要不到2个季度，而就业在八个月以内就恢复到原来水平了。

column1: But the recoveries from the recessions of 1991 and 2001 were different.
column2: 但1991年和2001年的复苏则截然不同。

column1: For example, in 2001, it took just one quarter for output to recover, but 38 months for jobs to come back. The current recovery appears to be similarly slow in creating jobs.
column2: 在2001年，产出水平只花了1个季度就恢复原状，但就业率却整整拖了38个月才回到原点，而当前的复苏在恢复就业方面似乎也同样缓慢无比。

column1: Some economists argue that, unlike past recoveries, when workers who were temporarily laid off were rehired, job losses starting in 1991 were more permanent.
column2: 有些经济学家认为，在以往的复苏中工人只是临时退出工作岗位，而现今职位的流失则是长期性的。

column1: Unemployed workers had to find jobs in new industries, which took more time and training.
column2: 失业的工人必须在新的行业找工作，而这也要耗费更多时间和培训。

column1: Others suggest that the Internet has made it easier for firms to hire quickly.
column2: 另一些经济学家则认为互联网使得企业的招聘变得更容易了。

column1: So, rather than hire in panic at the first sign of a recovery for fear that they will be unable to do so later and lose sales, firms would rather make sure that the recovery is well established before adding workers.
column2: 因此与其在复苏初露端倪之时因为害怕以后招不到人影响销售而一窝蜂地去抢人，倒不如在确认真正复苏之后再增加人手。

column1: Regardless of the true explanation, the US is singularly unprepared for jobless recoveries.
column2: 但不管真正的解释究竟是什么，奇怪的是，美国似乎没有还准备好如何应对这种失业性复苏。

column1: Typically, unemployment benefits last only six months.
column2: 政府一般只发放6个月的失业补助。

column1: Moreover, because health-care benefits are often tied to jobs, an unemployed worker also risks losing access to affordable health care.
column2: 此外，由于健康医疗补助往往都是跟就业联系在一起的，因此一个失业工人同时也面对着承担不起医疗保障费用的风险。

column1: Short-duration benefits may have been appropriate when recoveries were fast and jobs plentiful, because the fear of losing benefits before finding a job may have given workers an incentive to look harder.
column2: 在复苏迅速而且职位充足的情况下，短期的补贴是很管用的，因为那种在找到工作前失去补助金的恐惧将促使工人努力去找工作。

column1: But, with few jobs being created, a positive incentive has turned into a source of great anxiety.
column2: 但在只有少量职位产生的情况下，这种正面激励将摇身一变成为极大的焦虑。

column1: Even those who have jobs fear that they could lose them and be cast adrift.
column2: 即便是那些在职的人也会担心因为失去工作而生活无着。

column1: Politicians ignore popular anxiety at their peril.
column2: 政客们往往会忽略了公众这种担忧对他们的危害。

column1: President George H.W. Bush is widely believed to have lost his re-election bid, despite winning a popular war in Iraq, because he seemed out of touch with public hardship following the 1991 recession.
column2: 许多人认为美国前总统老布什之所以在赢得了一场人气极高的伊拉克战争之后还输掉了连任，就是因为他似乎对1991年衰退中民众的苦况麻木不仁。

column1: That lesson has been fully internalized.
column2: 这个教训也被很多人记住了。

column1: Economic recovery is all about jobs, not output, and politicians are willing to push for economic stimulus, both fiscal (tax cuts or government spending) and monetary (lower short-term interest rates), until jobs start reappearing.
column2: 经济复苏说的是就业，而不是产出，因此政客们都愿意推行经济刺激政策，不管是财政上的（比如减税或者是政府支出）还是货币上的（调低短期利率 ） ， 直到职位又重新出现了为止。

column1: In theory, this is what democracy is all about – policy responding to the needs of the people.
column2: 理论上，这就是民主的真谛 — — 政策是以民众的需要为指向的。

column1: In practice, though, public pressure to do something quickly enables politicians to run roughshod over the usual checks and balances on government policy making.
column2: 不过在实践上来说，公众那种要求立刻见效的压力令到政客可以罔顾政府政策制定中的利益制衡原则来推行政策。

column1: Long-term spending and tax policies are enacted under the shadow of an emergency, with the party that happens to be in power at the time of the downturn getting to push its pet agenda.
column2: 长期的政府支出和税收政策常常以救火的名义出台，那些恰好在衰退时期执政的政党则借机夹带私货。

column1: Much of what is enacted as stimulus has little immediate effect on job creation, but does have an adverse long-term effect on government finances.
column2: 许多以刺激名义推出的政策其实并不能立刻产生职位，却对政府财政有着长期的负面作用。

column1: For example, the 2009 stimulus package enacted by the Obama administration had many billions of dollars devoted to cancer research, though such research employs few people directly and is spent over a long time horizon – far beyond that of even a prolonged recovery.
column2: 比如奥巴马政府在2009年推出的一揽子刺激计划将数百亿美元投向了癌症研究计划，即便这些研究根本雇用不了多少人，且财政支付的时间跨度很长 — — 甚至比一个长期复苏所持续的时间还要长。

column1: Equally deleterious to economic health is the recent vogue of cutting interest rates to near zero and holding them there for a sustained period.
column2: 此外同样对经济有害的还有最近流行的所谓将利率降到接近零并维持一段时期的呼声。

column1: It is far from clear that near-zero short-term interest rates (as compared to just low interest rates) have much additional effect in encouraging firms to create jobs when powerful economic forces make them reluctant to hire.
column2: 而接近零的短期利率（相对于仅仅是低利率）究竟在强大的经济力量迫使企业踌躇于招工之时能起到多少激励作用还是一笔糊涂帐。

column1: But prolonged near-zero rates can foster the wrong kinds of activities.
column2: 但长期施行近于零的利率将催生错误的行为。

column1: For example, households and investment managers, reluctant to keep money in safe money-market funds, instead seek to invest in securities with longer maturities and higher credit risk, so long as they offer extra yield.
column2: 比如家庭主妇和投资经理都会不愿意将钱放在安全的货币市场基金上，转而投资于到期日更长且信用风险更高的证券上，只要这些东西能提供更高的回报就行。

column1: Likewise, money fleeing low US interest rates (and, more generally, industrial countries) has pushed up emerging-market equity and real-estate prices, setting them up for a fall (as we witnessed recently with the flight to safety following Europe’s financial turmoil).
column2: 同样，因低美元利率（以及总体上各工业国家）出逃的货币将推高新兴市场的股市和楼市，最终引发暴跌（正如我们最近看见的欧洲金融动荡中的资金避险行为那样 ） 。

column1: Moreover, even if corporations in the US are not hiring, corporations elsewhere are.
column2: 此外，即便美国本土的公司没有动静，其他地区的企业却在招人。

column1: Brazil’s unemployment rate, for example, is at lows not seen for decades.
column2: 巴西的失业率目前正维持在数十年以来的最低水平。

column1: If the Fed were to accept the responsibilities of its de facto role as the world’s central banker, it would have to admit that its policy rates are not conducive to stable world growth.
column2: 如果美联储想要承担自己事实上作为世界央行所负有的责任的话，那它也就必须承认自己的政策利率是无助于世界稳定增长的。

column1: Policy would still be accommodative if the Fed maintained low interest rates rather than the zero level that was appropriate for a panic.
column2: 而如果美联储放弃更适用于恐慌时期的近零利率而选择维持一个低利率的话，政策依然是属于宽松的。

column1: And this would give savers less of an incentive to search for yield, thus avoiding financial instability.
column2: 但这将减少储户将钱取出来追求回报的冲动，从而避免金融不稳定。

column1: Politicians will not sit quietly, however, if the Fed attempts to raise rates.
column2: 美联储想提高利率的话，政客们可不会坐以待毙的。

column1: Their thinking – and the Fed’s – follows the misguided calculus that if low rates are good for jobs, ultra-low rates must be even better.
column2: 他们的思维 — — 以及美联储的 — — 遵循一条错误的计算方式，那就是如果低利率有利于刺激就业的话，更低的利率就能刺激更多就业。

column1: Emerging studies on the risk-taking and asset-price inflation engendered by ultra-low policy rates will eventually convince Fed policymakers to change their stance.
column2: 在由极低政策利率所引发的高风险行为和资产价格通胀方面不断涌现的研究将最终说服美联储的政策制定者去改变他们的立场。

column1: But, if politicians are to become less anxious about jobs, perhaps we need to start discussing whether jobless recoveries are here to stay, and whether the US safety net, devised for a different era, needs to be modified.
column2: 但如果政客们能对就业问题不那么急功近利的话，或者就是我们开始讨论失业性复苏会否持续，而只为过去某个特定时期所设计的美国社会安全网是否需要改革的时候了。

column1: Profiles in Peacemaking
column2: 维和人物介绍

column1: NEW YORK – Fifty years ago, President John F. Kennedy did the seemingly impossible.
column2: 纽约 — — 五十年前，美国总统约翰·F·肯尼迪完成了看似不可能完成的任务。

column1: At the height of the Cold War, he moved the two nuclear superpowers, the United States and the Soviet Union, toward peace.
column2: 他让美苏两个超级核大国在冷战高潮期实现了向和平的过渡。

column1: The lessons of Kennedy’s act of leadership – one of the greatest of modern times – are directly relevant today.
column2: 肯尼迪的领导艺术在现代史上极其伟大，他留给我们的经验教训在当前仍有着直接的意义。

column1: I recount this remarkable story in a new book, To Move the World.
column2: 我在新著《推动世界》中对这个不平凡的故事进行了描述。

column1: To many, war between the two superpowers seemed inevitable.
column2: 当时很多人认为两个超级大国间的战争不可避免。

column1: The Cuban missile crisis in October 1962 created a global air of fear and pessimism, and certainly the belief that the US and the Soviet Union could not be reconciled.
column2: 1962年10月的古巴导弹危机让全球笼罩着悲观和恐惧，人们因此认定美苏之间的矛盾不可调和。

column1: Kennedy knew better.
column2: 肯尼迪更有眼光。

column1: He understood that much of the dangerous tension stemmed from each side’s hardliners, who acted as if peace were impossible.
column2: 他了解危险的紧张局势大多来自两国的强硬派，他们的所作所为就好像和平是不可能的。

column1: Their actions on one side would provoke the other side’s hardline response, fueling an upward spiral of distrust that strengthened the extremes in both camps.
column2: 一方的举动会激起对方的强烈反应，并因此导致双方阵营极端势力的不信任越来越根深蒂固。

column1: The “experts” of that era spoke of the balance of nuclear power.
column2: 那个时代的“专家”谈论的是核权力平衡。

column1: They believed that neither side would use nuclear weapons, owing to the fear of retaliation.
column2: 他们认为双方都不会使用核武器，因为他们害怕报复。

column1: But Kennedy recognized something far more dangerous: Accidents, misjudgments, bluffs, provocation by hardliners, or tactical mistakes could easily throw either side into panic.
column2: 但肯尼迪意识到有些因素更加危险：事故、误判、虚张声势、强硬派挑衅或者战术失误都很容易让一方陷入恐慌之中。

column1: In the Cuban missile crisis, the US and the Soviet Union stumbled to the precipice of nuclear war, not because of any desire for one (except among a few hothead extremists), but because of a series of miscalculations and pressure exerted by hardliners.
column2: 在古巴导弹危机中，美苏迷迷糊糊就来到了核战争的悬崖边上，不是因为他们希望如此（少数暴躁的极端份子除外 ） ， 而是因为一系列的误判和强硬派施压。

column1: Following the crisis, Kennedy was determined to pull back from the precipice for good.
column2: 危机过后，肯尼迪决心要永远脱离核战争的悬崖。

column1: In his extraordinary “Peace Speech” of June 10, 1963, he suggested to Americans that there was a way to make peace with the Soviet Union.
column2: 在1963年6月10日非同寻常的“和平讲话”中，他告诉美国人有办法可以实现美苏和平。

column1: Rather than issuing a list of demands, Kennedy did something far more interesting and unusual: he called upon Americans to reconsider their own attitudes about war and peace.
column2: 肯尼迪并没有简单地提出要求，而是采取了更耐人寻味也更非同寻常的举措：他呼吁美国人重新思考自己对战争与和平的态度。

column1: “First: Let us examine our attitude toward peace itself,” Kennedy said.
column2: “首先，我们需要审视自己的和平观 ， ” 肯尼迪说。

column1: “Too many of us think it is impossible.
column2: “太多人认为这不可能。

column1: Too many think it unreal.
column2: 太多人认为这不现实。

column1: But that is a dangerous, defeatist belief.
column2: 但这是必将导致失败的危险信念。

column1: It leads to the conclusion that war is inevitable, that mankind is doomed, that we are gripped by forces we cannot control.
column2: 它让我们相信战争不可避免，人类注定难逃劫数，支配我们的是我们无法控制的因素。

column1: We need not accept that view.
column2: 我们不该接受这种观点。

column1: Our problems are manmade; therefore, they can be solved by man.”
column2: 问题是人为的，因此可以由人类自己解决 。 ”

column1: Kennedy diagnosed the problem succinctly: “We are both caught up in a vicious and dangerous cycle in which suspicion on one side breeds suspicion on the other, and new weapons beget counter-weapons.”
column2: 肯尼迪言简意赅地给出了对问题的判断 ： “ 我们都陷入到危险的恶性循环之中，一方的怀疑引起对方的怀疑，新武器很快招来反制武装 。 ”

column1: And his assessment of its solvability was equally concise: “[B]oth the United States and its allies, and the Soviet Union and its allies, have a mutually deep interest in a just and genuine peace and in halting the arms race.”
column2: 他对解决方法的评估也同样简单明了 ： “ 真实公正的和平及终止军备竞赛与美国及其盟国和苏联及其盟国双方的深层次利益相互吻合 。 ”

column1: Kennedy’s speech provoked a highly positive response from his Soviet counterpart, Nikita Khrushchev, who called in the US envoy and told him that the speech was the finest by any American president since Franklin Roosevelt.
column2: 肯尼迪讲话引起苏联总统赫鲁晓夫的积极响应，赫鲁晓夫召见美国特使，告诉他这是继富兰克林·罗斯福之后美国总统最精彩的讲话。

column1: Within a few weeks, both sides had agreed to the Partial Nuclear Test Ban Treaty.
column2: 短短几周内，双方已经就《部分禁止核试验条约》达成一致。

column1: Five years later, the first treaty led to a second, and even more important, agreement: the Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty.
column2: 五年后，第一份条约引出第二份条约，最终带来了最重要的《核不扩散条约》的签署。

column1: Kennedy had proved a powerful truth.
column2: 肯尼迪证实了一个永恒的真理。

column1: “[H]istory teaches us that enmities between nations, as between individuals, do not last forever,” he said.
column2: “历史告诉我们国家和个人之间的仇恨不会永远不发生变化。

column1: “However fixed our likes and dislikes may seem, the tide of time and events will often bring surprising changes in the relations between nations and neighbors.”
column2: 无论我们的好恶看似多么不可改变，时事大潮往往会带来邻国间关系出人意料的变化 。 ”

column1: That lesson applies powerfully today.
column2: 这条真理今天同样适用。

column1: The US is again caught in a spiral of distrust and uncertainty with other countries (and the same is true of countless conflicts around the world that do not involve the US).
column2: 美国再次与其他国家陷入不信任不确定的漩涡之中（全世界没有美国参与的无数冲突同样也是这样的状况 ） 。

column1: America’s conflict with Iran is one such powerful case; others include its conflicts with Cuba and North Korea, and also the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, in which the US is deeply engaged as a supporter of Israel.
