column2: 美国与伊朗的冲突就是有力的证明。 此外还包括美国与古巴和朝鲜的冲突，还有以巴冲突，美国作为以色列的支持者已经深陷其中。

column1: In all of these cases, many people consider hatred and conflict inevitable, owing to a fundamental clash of values and interests.
column2: 很多人认为在所有这些冲突中，因为基本价值观及利益互相碰撞，仇恨和矛盾是不可避免的。

column1: But this is rarely the case.
column2: 但这种观点基本是错误的。

column1: Even though the US and Iran are in a spiral of distrust, for example, there could be grounds for reestablishing a far healthier bilateral relationship.
column2: 以美国和伊朗为例，即使缺乏相互信任，同样不乏重建健康双边关系的理由。

column1: To be sure, the two sides are now dangerously divided.
column2: 可以肯定，双方正处在危险的分裂之中。

column1: Their conflict has spilled over into Syria, where the US is now planning to arm the rebellion against President Bashar al-Assad in no small part because his regime is aligned with Iran.
column2: 美伊冲突已蔓延至叙利亚，很大程度上因为巴沙尔·阿萨德总统政权支持伊朗，美国现在正计划武装反对派对抗阿萨德。

column1: Syria’s civil war is therefore increasingly a proxy fight between Iran and the US (and other anti-Iranian countries), with Syrians dying in massive numbers as victims of somebody else’s conflict.
column2: 叙利亚内战因此日渐沦为伊朗和美国（和其他反伊国家）间的代理战争，导致大批叙利亚人沦为第三方冲突的牺牲者。

column1: Now that the Iranian people have elected a new president, Hassan Rowhani, the opportunity for a new peace overture is at hand.
column2: 现在伊朗民众选择哈桑·鲁哈尼担任新总统，新和平提议的机会近在眼前。

column1: Yes, there are important matters to discuss, notably Iran’s nuclear ambitions; but several countries in Iran’s neighborhood already possess nuclear weapons, threatening the entire region.
column2: 当然，很多重要问题需要讨论，尤其是伊朗的核野心；但伊朗周边几个国家已经掌握核武器，对整个区域构成威胁。

column1: US President Barack Obama should take the next steps, both with Iran and with other countries (including North Korea and Cuba).
column2: 美国总统奥巴马在伊朗和他国（包括朝鲜和古巴）问题上应该采取后续步骤。

column1: A decade of US secret and not-so-secret wars, drone attacks, and covert operations is enough.
column2: 十年的美国秘密战争、无人机袭击和隐蔽行动已经足够。

column1: We now urgently need US leadership that envisions peace rather than war as the solution.
column2: 我们现在迫切需要美国领导人用和平而不是战争的手段来解决相关冲突。

column1: Fifty years ago, Kennedy showed that peace could be achieved even in the most difficult circumstances.
column2: 五十年前，肯尼迪向世人证明即使在最艰苦的环境下也可以实现和平。

column1: His courage, vision, eloquence, and political skills provide a model and inspiration for the US and other countries today.
column2: 他的勇气、远见、口才和政治技巧今天仍在为美国和其他国家提供灵感和模式。

column1: Then, as now, the path to peace must always be preferred to the dead end of war.
column2: 我们必须优先选择通往和平之路，而不是通往战争的死胡同，这一点在当时和现在并没有什么不同。

column1: The Mosquito Menace
column2: 蚊子的威胁

column1: STANFORD – Mosquito-borne diseases kill millions of people annually, and cause suffering for many more.
column2: 斯坦福—蚊子传播的疾病每年要多走数百万人的生命，因此受苦的人数更要多得多。

column1: In 2012, there were an estimated 207 million cases of malaria, leading to some 627,000 deaths.
column2: 2012年，据估计有2.07亿人罹患疟疾，其中造成627,000人死亡。

column1: Dengue fever is a leading cause of illness and death in the tropics and subtropics, with as many as 100 million people infected each year.
column2: 登革热是热带和亚热带的主要致死病因，每年感染的人数更是高达1亿人。

column1: And there are an estimated 200,000 cases of yellow fever annually, leading to 30,000 deaths worldwide.
column2: 此外，每年还有约200,000人罹患黄热病，造成全球30,000人死亡。

column1: It takes only one bite from a disease-carrying mosquito to transmit a debilitating or deadly infection – and mosquitoes breed and multiply with astonishing speed.
column2: 染上令人痛苦甚至致命的疾病只需要被携带病菌的蚊子叮上一口，而蚊子以令人咋舌的速度繁殖和增加着。

column1: Given that there are no vaccines or drug treatments for illnesses like dengue fever and West Nile virus, and that treatments for diseases like malaria are difficult to access in many at-risk areas, more effective mechanisms for controlling mosquito populations are desperately needed.
column2: 对于登革热等疾病和西尼罗河病毒，目前还没有疫苗或药物可以治疗，而对疟疾等疾病的治疗在许多高风险地区也难以获得，因此我们急需更有效的措施控制蚊子数量。

column1: The good news is that a promising new technology is ready for field-testing.
column2: 好消息是，一项极有希望的新技术已经进入了实地测试。

column1: It is now up to government agencies to facilitate its development.
column2: 现在，需要政府机构促进它的发展。

column1: Today, the dominant method for reducing insect populations – the so-called “sterile insect technique” (SIT) – relies on radiation to sterilize males, which are then released into infested areas to mate.
column2: 如今，减少昆虫数量的主要手段 — — 所谓的“不育昆虫技术 ” （ SIT）主要依靠射线让雄性昆虫不育，然后将它们放回昆虫滋生区域和雌性昆虫交配。

column1: But this approach, which has been used since the middle of the last century, has not been effective with mosquitoes, owing to their fragility.
column2: 但这一自上个世纪中叶以来就开始使用的办法对蚊子不管用，因为雄蚊子生命力太差。

column1: Advances in molecular biology offer analogous – but far more sophisticated – solutions.
column2: 分子生物学的进步提供了类似 — — 但远为成熟 — — 的办法。

column1: Using molecular genetic-engineering techniques, the British company Oxitec has created a new way to control the mosquito species that transmits dengue fever.
column2: 英国的Oxitec公司通过分子基因工程技术创造了控制传播登革热的蚊子种群的新方法。

column1: Male mosquitoes are bred in the laboratory with a specific genetic mutation.
column2: 雄蚊在实验室中繁殖，它们带有一个特别的基因突变。

column1: As a result, their offspring produce high levels of a protein that prevents their cells from functioning normally, causing them to die before reaching maturity.
column2: 于是它们的后代会大量产生一种让其细胞无法正常运转的蛋白质，使它们在成熟之前就死去。

column1: Male mosquitoes do not bite, so their release presents no health risk, and, because their progeny die, no genetically engineered mosquitoes persist in the environment.
column2: 雄蚊不会咬人，因此释放它们不会造成健康风险，而由于它们不会有子孙后代，大自然中也不会有转基因蚊子出现。

column1: If the males are released over a period of several months, this would, in theory, result in a marked reduction in the mosquito population.
column2: 理论上，如果在为期几个月的时间里持续释放雄蚊，蚊子数量就会大量降低。

column1: All that is needed now is to determine whether it works in practice.
column2: 现在需要知道的是在实践中这是否管用。

column1: Scientific research to develop products like irradiated sterile insects or the Oxitec mosquitoes proceeds progressively from more to less contained conditions – from the laboratory to confined trials to limited field trials.
column2: 开发受辐射因而不育的蚊子或Oxitec蚊子这样的产品的科学研究是在限制越来越少的环境中推进的 — — 从实验室到限制测试再到有限实地测试。

column1: Now that Oxitec has conducted promising field trials in the Cayman Islands, Malaysia, and Brazil, it is preparing to conduct trials in other countries, including the United States.
column2: 现在，Oxitec已在开曼群岛、马来西亚和巴西进行了令人振奋的实地测试，准备在包括美国在内的其他国家展开测试。

column1: Such trials are always appropriately controlled and monitored to ensure that they are safe and effective, with government regulation providing an extra safeguard.
column2: 这些测试会一直受到适当的控制和监控，以确保安全性和有效性，政府监管则提供了进一步的保障。

column1: In order to determine the appropriate level of oversight, government bodies would presumably conduct a science-based risk analysis.
column2: 为了确定监督的适当水平，政府机构会预先进行基于科学的风险分析。

column1: When it comes to genetic engineering, however, science seems to matter less than politics.
column2: 但是，对于基因工程，这与其说是科学问题，不如说是政治问题。

column1: The fact is that molecular genetic engineering is more precise and predictable than older, cruder techniques like irradiation.
column2: 事实上，分子基因工程比更陈旧、更粗糙的技术（比如辐射）更精确、更可预测。

column1: But, while SIT remains unregulated in most places, the regulatory reviews of genetically engineered living organisms have tended to be drawn out and excessive worldwide, with politics delaying – and sometimes even preventing – approvals.
column2: 但是，尽管SIT在许多地区不受管制，但对基因工程活体实验的监管审查总是有过度之嫌，全世界都是如此，政治拖延 — — 有时甚至是阻碍 — — 了批准。

column1: As a result, research and development in genetic engineering is more expensive, discouraging investment and hampering innovation.
column2: 因此，基因工程的研发总是更昂贵，阻碍了投资和创新。

column1: This is all the more problematic in the case of mosquito control, given the urgency of the problem.
column2: 在蚊子控制问题上尤其如此，而这一问题又是十万火急。

column1: The World Health Organization’s Special Program for Research and Training in Tropical Diseases has called upon regulatory agencies to emphasize “science-based, case-by-case targeted requirements with a degree of practical parsimony,” instead of relying on “a precautionary approach that can require data to address all theoretical risks.”
column2: 世界卫生组织热带疾病研究和培训计划要求监管机构强调“基于科学的、具体案例具体分析的、带有一定程度实践谨慎性的定向要求”取代依赖“需要数据解决所有理论风险的预防性方法 ” 。

column1: In other words, regulators should consider these innovations’ public-health costs and benefits, and expedite their review.
column2: 换句话说，监管者应该考虑创新的公共卫生成本和效益，并加快审查。

column1: Given the degree of suffering caused by mosquito-borne diseases, government leaders must not subject genetic-engineering solutions for controlling them to the same kinds of political and populist headwinds that have impeded the approval of genetically engineered agricultural products.
column2: 蚊子传播的疾病造成着巨大的痛苦，政府领导人决不能让基因工程解决办法如同转基因农产品那样陷入政治和民粹主义阻力。

column1: Only with pragmatic, fact-based regulation can the world realize genetic engineering’s full disease-fighting potential.
column2: 只有务实的、基于事实的监管才能让世界认识到基因工程在疾病控制方面的全部潜力。

column1: Israel’s Neglected Peace Dividend
column2: 以色列忽视的和平红利

column1: TEL AVIV – Twenty years after the Oslo Accords, the prospects for a comprehensive Israeli-Palestinian peace deal are dimmer than ever.
column2: 特拉维夫—奥斯陆协定距今已有二十年，全面的以色列-巴勒斯坦和平协定前景从未如此暗淡过。

column1: Indeed, roughly a half-million Israeli settlers in the occupied territories (including East Jerusalem) make the creation of a contiguous Palestinian state an almost impossible mission.
column2: 事实上，约五十万占领区（包括东耶路撒冷）以色列定居者意味着建立相邻的巴勒斯坦国几乎是个不可能的任务。

column1: So, is the renewed vigor of US President Barack Obama’s administration in the quest for peace too little, too late?
column2: 因此，美国总统奥巴马政府的重新要求和平看来是太晚、太微不足道了？

column1: Israeli Prime Minister Binyamin Netanyahu claims that his government has no preconditions for resuming negotiations with the Palestinians.
column2: 以色列总理内塔尼亚胡声称，他的政府没有为重启与巴谈判设置先决条件。

column1: Meanwhile, his housing minister, Uri Ariel (himself a settler and a member of the annexationist Jewish Home party), unleashes a new wave of settlement expansion that threatens to link the 1967 border with the Jordan Valley, thus bisecting Palestinian territory.
column2: 与此同时，他的住房部长艾利尔（Uri Ariel，他本人也是占领区定居者，也是兼并主义政党犹太家园党（Jewish Home）党员）发动了新一轮定居扩张潮，骎骎然欲将1967年边境与约旦河谷连接起来，从而将巴勒斯坦领土一分为二。

column1: Netanyahu’s own insistence on “ironclad” security arrangements is a euphemism for an Israeli presence in the Jordan Valley – and no return to the “Auschwitz borders” of 1967.
column2: 内塔尼亚胡自己也坚持“坚不可摧”的安全安排，这无非是以色列出现在约旦河谷 — — 并且再也不回1967年“奥斯维辛边界”的委婉说法。

column1: Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas is too weak and too burdened by his rivalry with the hard-line Islamist Hamas – which rules in Gaza – to allow himself the political luxury of departing from the core demands of Palestinian nationalism.
column2: 巴勒斯坦总统阿巴斯太弱、受到太多的掣肘 — — 来自他的竞争对手和走强硬路线的加沙地带控制着哈马斯 — — 因此没有政治上的空间置巴勒斯坦民族主义的核心要求于不顾。

column1: Nor does Netanyahu, an ideologue who is visibly uncomfortable with his forced support of the two-state idea, truly have a governing coalition for peace.
column2: 内塔尼亚胡也是如此，作为显而易见不满于被迫支持两国方案的空想家，他其实并没有追求和平的执政联盟。

column1: Thus, US Secretary of State John Kerry will require great deal of creativity to reconcile Netanyahu’s position and the Palestinian precondition, recently reiterated by Abbas’s close associate Nabil Shaath, that Israel must agree to negotiate on the basis of the 1967 borders.
column2: 因此，美国国务卿科里将要求拿出大量创造性调和内塔尼亚胡的立场和巴勒斯坦的先决条件 — — 阿巴斯的亲信沙斯（Nabil Shaath）最近重申，以色列必须同意在1967年边界基础上的谈判。

column1: Mahmoud Al-Habbash, the Palestinian minister of religious affairs, even went so far as to demand “assurances that the talks won’t fail,” because if they do, a new intifada would surely erupt.
column2: 巴勒斯坦宗教事务部长哈巴什（Mahmoud Al-Habbash）甚至要求“保证谈判不会失败 ” ， 因为如若谈判失败，几乎肯定将导致新一轮动乱爆发。

column1: Moreover, Kerry’s peace drive is taking place in a regional environment that is not amenable to a negotiated resolution of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.
column2: 此外，科里推动和平的努力所处的地区环境并非以巴冲突的谈判解决方案所能稳定。

column1: The Arab Spring has turned bloody and unpredictably turbulent, further diminishing the odds for peace in Palestine.
column2: 阿拉伯之春演变成了流血和未曾预料到的混乱，这进一步降低了巴勒斯坦和平的可能。

column1: Nor does the election of Hassan Rowhani, a relative moderate, to Iran’s presidency improve Kerry’s chances.
column2: 相对温和的鲁哈尼当选伊朗总统也无助于增加科里的胜机。

column1: Rowhani’s victory is certainly good news for Iranians, and it may lead to a more civilized dialogue between the Islamic Republic and the international community.
column2: 鲁哈尼的胜利对伊朗人来说显然是个好消息，也有可能引出伊朗和国际社会的更加文明的对话。

column1: But Rowhani’s presidency can hardly be expected to change Iran’s strategic objectives.
column2: 但鲁哈尼的总统任期几乎无望改变伊朗的战略目标。

column1: Iran will continue its nuclear program, fight for the survival of Bashar al-Assad’s regime in Syria, seek to maintain its vital alliance with key regional proxies such as Hezbollah, and defend Palestine and al-Quds (Jerusalem).
column2: 伊朗将继续其核计划，为巴沙尔·阿萨德的叙利亚政权而斗争，寻求维持与真主党等关键地区代理人的联盟，并捍卫巴勒斯坦和圣城（耶路撒冷 ） 。

column1: If Assad defeats his opponents with the help of Hezbollah and Iran, his survival is bound to be perceived as a victory for the regional “axis of resistance” to Israel.
column2: 如若巴沙尔在真主党的帮助下打败反对者，他的转危为安将注定成为该地区“反以轴心”的胜利。

column1: And a permanent Iranian presence in Syria would make a war between Israel and Iran practically unavoidable.
column2: 伊朗在叙利亚的持久身影也将使以色列和伊朗之间的战争变得实际不可避免。

column1: Palestine would then be relegated to an obscure corner of the international agenda.
column2: 届时，巴勒斯坦将被沦为该地区的一个不起眼的角落。

column1: Complicating matters further, America’s wars in Iraq and Afghanistan have limited its regional clout.
column2: 让局面更急复杂的事，美国的伊拉克和阿富汗战争限制了其地区实力。

column1: The US now faces an unpredictable Middle East that is writing its own history as well – or as badly – as it can.
column2: 美国目前面对这一个不可预测的中东，后者正在尽力打造其自身历史上最好 — — 或者最坏 — — 的时代。

column1: Syria’s internal conflict has now become a Sunni-Shia sectarian war that is spreading across the region.
column2: 叙利亚内战已成为逊尼派-什叶派之间的宗派之战，并在全地区蔓延。

column1: The Sunni clerics who have just declared a jihad against “the Iranian regime, Hezbollah, and its sectarian allies” are the voice of millions across the Muslim world.
column2: 逊尼派神职人员刚刚宣布要对“伊朗政权、真主党及其宗派盟军”开战圣战，这是穆斯林世界几百万人民的声音。

column1: Furthermore, waves of Syrian refugees are threatening the sustainability of the Jordanian monarchy, already roiled by profound internal cleavages.
column2: 此外，大批叙利亚难民正在威胁约旦��主制的可持续性，目前约旦已然在深刻的内部冲突中摇摇欲坠。

column1: Hezbollah has drawn Lebanon into the Syrian conflict, setting up a showdown between Shia and Sunni at home.
column2: 真主党将黎巴嫩拖入了叙利亚冲突，在自家后院掀起了什叶派和逊尼派的大决斗。

column1: A similar scenario is already unfolding in Iraq.
column2: 伊拉克也在出现类似的情景。

column1: Turkey, a responsible regional power, has so far resisted being drawn into the Syrian quagmire, but its effects can be seen in the rising tensions between the country’s Sunni majority and the Shia Alevi sect.
column2: 而土耳其作为负责任的地区大国，到目前为止顶住了压力，没有卷入叙利亚乱局，但叙利亚冲突的影响可以在该国逊尼派多数人口和什叶派阿拉维派冲日益激烈的紧张中一窥端倪。

column1: Inertia is not an adequate response in an era of revolutionary change.
column2: 对于这个革命性变化的时代，光靠惯性是不够的。

column1: Unfortunately, Israel is missing a coherent regional strategy.
column2: 不幸的是，以色列正在错失一贯的地区战略。

column1: Netanyahu, always on the defensive, does not view Middle East turmoil as a trigger for a proactive strategy that would use a solution to the Palestinian problem as leverage for broader positive change in the region.
column2: 内塔尼亚胡从不采取攻势，他不认为中东乱局是前瞻性战略的触发器，借助形成巴勒斯坦问题的解决方案为该地区带来更广泛的积极变化。

column1: America, burdened by the cost of its Middle East troubles, eager to refocus on Asia, and no longer in need of Arab oil, can allow itself to leave the region to its destiny.
column2: 被中东羁绊甚深的美国急切地意欲将注意力转向亚洲，也不再需要阿拉伯的石油，它大可以脱身于中东地区之外，让后者自己决定命运。

column1: Israel is part of the region and has a strong interest in helping to shape its future.
column2: 以色列是中东地区的一部分，也有强大的利益帮助决定中东的未来。

column1: Israel has traditionally strived to forge alliances with the region’s minorities – Kurds, Persians, Maronites, and others.
column2: 传统上，以色列致力于与地区少数派结盟 — — 库尔德人、波斯人、马龙派（Maronite）等。

column1: Now is the time for a major shift to an alliance with the region’s overwhelming Sunni majority.
column2: 如今，以色列应该转变方向与在中东占压倒多数的逊尼派结盟。

column1: Israel should follow Obama, whose recent decision to arm the Syrian rebels, though belated and still ill-defined, is a choice for the Sunni alliance.
column2: 以色列应该追随奥巴马 — — 后者最近决定武装叙利亚反对派，尽管这姗姗来迟且没有成熟计划，但算得上是在选择与逊尼派结盟。

column1: Israel should play an active role in the fall of Assad as a way to undermine the region’s “Shia crescent” and isolate its leader, Iran.
column2: 以色列应该在推翻巴沙尔、打破中东地区的“什叶新月”并鼓励其领袖伊朗的过程中扮演积极角色。

column1: Assad’s defeat would break the “axis of resistance,” choke off Hezbollah’s arms supplies, and drive a permanent wedge between Turkey and Iran.
column2: 巴沙尔的倒台将打破“反以轴心 ” ， 切断真主党的武器供应，并在土耳其和伊朗之间打入一枚永久的楔子。

column1: A solution to the Palestinian problem would serve such a strategy.
column2: 巴勒斯坦问题的解决方案可以充当这一战略。

column1: It would strengthen Israel’s relations with Egypt, help to stabilize Jordan (a vital and friendly buffer state), and remove a major source of tension with Turkish Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdoğan’s Islamist government.
column2: 它能强化以色列与埃及的关系，帮助稳定约旦（关键的、友好的缓冲国 ） ， 并移除与土耳其总理埃尔多安的伊斯兰政府的一大主要冲突源。

column1: Most important, it would undermine Iran’s efforts to make inroads into the Arab world under the pretext of defending Palestine and Holy Jerusalem.
column2: 最重要的是，它能破坏伊朗打着捍卫巴勒斯坦和圣城耶路撒冷的旗号作恶阿拉伯世界的图谋。

column1: Goodbye, Johnny
column2: 再见，约翰尼

column1: PARIS – What better send-off for a rocker than Saturday’s vast, silent concert on the steps of a church?
column2: 巴黎—对一位摇滚乐手来说，还有什么送别方式比教堂台阶上的巨型静默音乐会更好的呢？

column1: And what better farewell to a great performer than the one delivered by the immense crowd chanting around a body that seemed to have arranged, from the great beyond, this last demonstration of enthusiasm and love?
column2: 对一位表演者来说，还有什么告别方式比众人围绕遗体吟唱，好像这是事先安排好的展示热情和爱的方式一样更好的呢？

column1: Herein lies the beguiling feature of the funeral of Johnny Hallyday, France’s national singer: his ability to stage-manage his destiny, right up the final hour, and the star power that his being retained even in death.
column2: 这就是法国国民歌手约翰尼·阿利代的葬礼：他就是能够这样指挥自己的命运，哪怕是在最后的时刻，他拥有的巨星实力在他身后仍能经久不衰。

column1: The costume he chose for his last performance was oblong and white.
column2: 他给自己的最后表演选择的装扮是一个白色的长方形。

column1: Nothing remained of his swaying hips and his howls, or of the pale eyes perpetually on the verge of laughing or crying (you never knew which).
column2: 他再也不能摇摆臀部，发出吼声，他的睡眼朦胧的眼睛再也无法做出似笑非笑，似哭非哭的表情（你永远不知道是哪一种 ） 。

column1: And yet there he was, charisma and presence, the spell of a shaman inviting you one last time to dance the eternal chorus in the aura of his mystery and his smile.
column2: 但他的魅力和仪态仍在，就像一位巫师那样召唤你最后一次在他的神秘光环和他的微笑中跳一曲永恒之歌。

column1: And there was the spirit of France: young and old, the French president and two of his predecessors, the novelists Philippe Labro and Daniel Rondeau, celebrities, artists, fans from 50 years ago wearing Apache fringe, a remembrance of the striking miners of Lorraine, the words of Jacques Prévert, tears shed by ordinary people.
column2: 这就是法国精神：老人和少年，法国总统和他的两位前任，小说家菲利普·拉布罗（Philippe Labro）和丹尼尔·隆多（Daniel Rondeau ） ， 名流，艺术家，穿戴阿帕奇（Apache）流苏的50多年前的歌迷，洛林罢工矿工的追忆，雅克·普雷威特（Jacques Prévert）的辞赋，普通人流下的眼泪。

column1: And all of them seemed to be under Hallyday’s influence still: The great actor who was suddenly starkly human and at a loss.
column2: 而所偶这些似乎都仍在受到阿利代的影响：突然间沦落为不完整的凡人的伟大表演者。

column1: The old, unsentimental crooner with a tear on his cheek.
column2: 面无表情的老歌手脸上流下清泪。

column1: The column of bikers that descended the Champs-Elysées, which never wore its funereal name so well.
column2: 沿着爱丽舍宫鱼贯骑行的车手们，从未将葬礼的名字打扮得如此出色。

column1: There was the Place de la Madeleine, too.
column2: 还有玛德莲广场（Place de la Madeleine ） 。

column1: Usually so staid and cold, it echoed to the rhythm of strings with the swing of the Louisiana bayous at one moment, and at the next with the memory of the concert at the Olympia, so close but a half-century away, where the saturnine firebrand upended ten thousand hearts.
column2: 它总是如此沉着冷静，这一刻，弦韵与路易斯安纳河口的摇曳遥相呼应，下一刻，又让人想起奥林匹亚的演唱会，它好像近在眼前，实则已经过去了半个世纪，忧郁的火把让一万颗心神魂颠倒。

column1: Here was an upwelling of emotion the likes of which France had not seen since the funerals of Victor Hugo and Edith Piaf, since the catafalque of Jean Jaurès went up the Rue Soufflot.
column2: 这种升华的情绪，自从雨果和琵雅芙（Edith Piaf）的葬礼以来，自从饶勒斯（Jean Jaurès）的灵车通过苏福洛路（Rue Soufflot）以来，从未在法国的葬礼上出现过。

column1: A million mourners were left not knowing whether to cry, sing, throw chairs around, request an encore, or light candles.
column2: 一百万哀悼者走上街头，不知道应该哭泣，歌唱，丢椅子（throw chairs around ） ， 要求“再来一曲 ” ， 还是点燃蜡烛。

column1: Disappearing in a final parade of passion and energy, of restlessness and quiet rebellion, of inner fissures and desire for harmony, was someone who had spent his life trying not to survive.
column2: 在激情和能量的最后游行中，在不安定和静悄悄的叛逆中，在内心的分裂和和谐的渴望中，那个毕生追逐不要生存的人消失了。

column1: And on that day, he was so well mourned that his absence seemed like part of a show, somehow making us forget that he was no longer with us.
column2: 在这一天，他极尽哀荣，他的告别就像是一场表演，让我们忘记了他已经不再与我们同在。

column1: Abiding in each of us was the Johnny that moved us all: the youth spent with a traveling act, like Gautier’s Captain Fracasse; the father, a character out of Modiano, who, between bouts of drinking, pawned the gifts given to him by his abandoned son.
column2: 感动我们所有人的约翰尼仍住在我们心中：一直在旅行的男人，就像戈蒂埃（Gautier）的弗朗卡司船长（Captain Fracasse ） ； 莫迪亚诺（Modiano）的“呼儿将出换美酒”的父亲角色。

column1: And then there was the ’60s rocker with the eyes of a sad wolf and cheekbones hewn by Giacometti, the Catcher in the Rye mood, and a melancholy so intensely hopeless that it seemed to condemn him to live on the edge of every form of excess.
column2: 还有60年代的摇滚歌手们，他们的眼睛就像悲狼，他们颧骨像是被贾科梅蒂（Giacometti）切削过，他们的情绪像是《麦田里的守望者 》 ， 他们抑郁到绝望，好像在控诉他的生活各种不知节制。

column1: He was the consummate artist of the French scene, a chameleon beamed out on satellite TV, dripping with fake sweat and real glitz, an artist who, like a novelist, confessed as a way of lying.
column2: 他是法国舞台上的完美艺术家，卫星频道上光芒四射的变色龙，流着假汗水，闪耀真光芒，一位像小说家那样用谎言的方式坦白自己的艺术家。

column1: Hallyday was the child of a generation that watched American GIs enter Paris and that invented for itself an American ascendance.
column2: 阿利代是看着美国大兵进入巴黎、产生美国支配一切的感情的那一代人的孩子。

column1: America was cigarettes, Levi’s, and Coca-Cola.
column2: 美国就是烟草，是李维斯，是可口可乐。

column1: But it was also the languor of the blues, Nashville, and the green light that he saw gleaming at dawn after nights soaked in alcohol and amphetamines.
column2: 但它也是慵懒的蓝调，是纳什维尔（Nashville ） ， 是他在浸透着酒精和安非他命的长夜尽头所看到的隐隐闪现的绿光。

column1: When this distraught colossus of sorrow, the unsleeping and suicidal cowboy, offered his body in sacrifice to the camera and to the mob of entranced fans, he struck François Mauriac as a Mephistophelean figure.
column2: 这个哀伤到发狂的巨匠、警醒的自杀牛仔（suicidal cowboy ） ， 将自己牺牲的遗体献给了镜头和着迷的“粉丝”群，此时，他击中了作为反派人物的弗朗索瓦·莫亚力克（François Mauriac ） 。

column1: Here was the hero, motley and scarred, whose glory seemed like a wound, whose victories were stigmata, and who, from metamorphosis to metamorphosis, embodied what is wrongly called pop or variety but that was, in him, more like fallen greatness or the lament of a cleverly disguised poet.
column2: 这个英雄百衲衣，刀疤脸，他的光荣就像是一个伤口，他的胜利就像是圣痕（stigmata ） ， 他从变态走向变态（from metamorphosis to metamorphosis ） ， 表达着被错误地称为流行或变体（variety ） ， 但对他来说更像是坠落的伟大（fallen greatness）或对巧妙掩饰的诗人的哀叹的东西。

column1: And, at the end, there was King Lear triumphant, the wax face with the periwinkle gaze, survivor of an era whose heroes perished before the age of 30, one who knew that his survival was a miracle.
column2: 在这方面，有一个得意洋洋的李尔王，一张长着一双蔓长春花色的眼睛的蜡色的脸，他从英雄不到30岁便凋零的时代存活下来，知道他活下来是一个奇迹。

column1: And then, finally, there were those near-deaths in the manner of Bossuet (“Johnny is dying!
column2: 终于，他以波苏哀（Bossuet）的方式濒临死亡 （ “ 约翰尼快死了！

column1: Johnny is dead!”): he would always revive, right up to the very last time, when he lived again in Paris for a few hours under a cold December sun.
column2: 约翰尼死了 ！ ” ） ： 他会永远活着，直到最后一刻，他在寒冷的12月的太阳下，在巴黎复活几个小时。

column1: The Vatican of literature that is the Swedish Academy has, with the Nobel coronation of Bob Dylan, rescued song from its canonical hell.
column2: 文学的圣殿瑞典科学院授予鲍勃·迪伦（Bob Dylan）诺贝尔奖，将歌曲从规范的地狱中救出。

column1: In the case of Johnny Hallyday, it is perhaps not too farfetched to believe that this man of sphinx-like mystery is now, like Baudelaire, “a block of granite surrounded by vague fear” whose “fierce nature sings only to the rays of the setting sun.”
column2: 对于约翰尼·阿利代来说，认为这个高深莫测的神秘人现在就像波德莱尔那样，成为“一块花岗石，周围是模糊的恐惧 ” ， 其“暴脾气只为夕阳引吭高歌”恐怕亦不为过。

column1: The Immorality of Boris Johnson and Donald Trump
column2: 鲍里斯·约翰逊和唐纳德·特朗普的不道德行为

column1: LONDON – In a 2013 press conference, then-recently inaugurated Pope Francis famously said that, when it comes to sexual orientation, including past homosexual acts, “who am I to judge?”
column2: 伦敦 — — 在2013年的一次新闻发布会上，当时刚刚继任的弗朗西斯教皇尽人皆知地表示，如果说到性取向，包括过去的同性恋行为 ， “ 我有什么资格去评判别人 ？ ”

column1: Should we take a similarly non-judgmental approach to the past personal behavior of our political leaders?
column2: 我们是否应当用同样非评判性的态度去对待政治领袖过去的个人行为？

column1: The question is acutely relevant today in both the United States and the United Kingdom.
column2: 这个问题在今天的美国和英国都十分重要。

column1: US President Donald Trump, who has already reached the height of political power in his country, and former UK Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson, who aspires to keep rising in the ranks, have in common not just their crude nationalism, but also their apparent inability to control their sexual appetites.
column2: 美国总统唐纳德·特朗普已经登上了该国政治权力的巅峰，而一心渴望步步高升的前英国外交大臣鲍里斯·约翰逊与特朗普相同的不仅是粗暴的民族主义，而且上述两人显然都无法控制自己的性欲。

column1: Trump’s extramarital affairs are common knowledge, despite hefty pay-offs intended to silence his sexual partners, such as the adult film performer and stripper known as Stormy Daniels.
column2: 尽管特朗普不惜重金意在使性伴侣保持沉默，比如成人电影明星兼脱衣舞女斯托米·丹尼尔斯，但特朗普的婚外情依旧人尽皆知。

column1: Though Trump is far from the first US president with a long record of adultery, he stands out for the crudeness of his remarks about women, including the infamous “grab ’em by the pussy” comment, exposed during the campaign.
column2: 尽管特朗普远不是第一位长期通奸的美国总统，但若论对女性的粗暴评论恐怕无人能出其右，包括在竞选期间爆出臭名昭著的“抓住她们屁股”的粗鄙丑闻。

column1: As for Johnson, reports are circulating that his wife has kicked him out over an affair.
column2: 至于约翰逊，有报道称他因为婚外情而被妻子赶出了家门。

column1: While this is hardly his first – nor even the first time he has been given the boot – there are questions now about whether this will hurt his political ambitions, which many believe were the main motivation behind his decision to act as a leader of the campaign to withdraw the UK from the European Union.
column2: 但这一次对他来讲并非初犯 — — 甚至不是他第一次因此被赶出家门 — — 现在已经有人开始质疑这是否会损害他的政治野心，许多人认为恰恰是因为这样的野心他才决定成为英国脱欧运动的领导人。

column1: But is it appropriate to judge political leaders based on their sex lives, as many have been wont to do?
column2: 但就像许多人一直想做的那样，基于性生活来对政治领袖进行评判是否合适？

column1: The answer, in my opinion, is no.
column2: 在我看来，答案是否定的。

column1: Of course, actions like sexual harassment or assault should inform our assessment of a leader.
column2: 勿庸置疑，性骚扰或攻击行为理应成为我们对领导人评价的一部分。

column1: But while Trump has faced such accusations, Johnson has not.
column2: 但尽管特朗普曾经面临这样的指控，而约翰逊却从未有过这样的先例。

column1: And, ultimately, we do not elect people to political office because we want them to act as standard bearers for our subjective, varied, and evolving definitions of morality.
column2: 而且归根结底，我们选举某人担任政治职务并不是因为希望他们成为我们主观、多变而且不断发展的道德标准的践行者。

column1: Someone who has been unfaithful to his or her spouse can be a skilled leader, just as a faithful wife or husband can be a poor one.
column2: 对配偶不忠的人可能是一位伟大的领导者，就像忠实的妻子或丈夫也可能成为一位糟糕的领导人。

column1: Nonetheless, there are plenty of other problems with the leadership of both Trump and Johnson, who resigned from his post as foreign secretary in July over his opposition to the compromises that Prime Minister Theresa May’s government decided it would be willing to make in the Brexit negotiations with the EU.
column2: 尽管如此，特朗普和约翰逊的领导还存在不少其他问题，后者于今年7月辞去了其外交大臣的职务，因为他反对特雷莎·梅首相领导的政府在与欧盟进行的脱欧谈判中采取的妥协姿态。

column1: While Johnson has some rhetorical skill – which he has been using with increasing vigor to whip up support for a “hard Brexit” – the general view is that he was a hopeless diplomat, always preferring a cheap joke to a serious brief.
column2: 尽管约翰逊有一定的演说技巧 — — 他一直利用这些技巧来煽动对英国“硬脱欧”的支持 — — 但外界普遍认为他是一个毫无希望的外交官，总是喜欢用廉价的笑话来取代严肃的发布会。

column1: During his stint as foreign secretary, Johnson was a near-constant cause of embarrassment for the UK, with gaffe after gaffe leaving Britain’s friends abroad with their heads in their hands.
column2: 在任职外交大臣期间，约翰逊不断令英国感到尴尬，他一次又一次的失态令英国的外国盟友痛苦地捂住脑袋。

column1: Since leaving that position, Johnson has not cleaned up his act.
column2: 离任外交大臣后，约翰逊也没有改变他的行为。

column1: Just last month, he made the Islamophobic declaration that Muslim women wearing niqabs resemble “bank robbers” and “letter boxes.”
column2: 就在上个月，他还在宣扬伊斯兰恐惧情绪，称蒙着面纱的穆斯林妇女令人联想起“银行抢劫犯”和“邮桶”的样子。

column1: Soon after, Johnson described May’s EU negotiating position as being tantamount to wrapping “a suicide vest around the British constitution” and handing the detonator to the EU.
column2: 此后不久，约翰逊形容梅的脱欧谈判立场相当于“为英国宪法披上自杀式炸弹背心 ” ， 并将引爆装置交给欧盟。

column1: The comment was tasteless, to put it mildly, not least because 22 people (including children) were killed by a suicide bomber at a concert in Manchester last year.
column2: 哪怕是从最善意的角度，他的评论也极其乏味，尤其因为在去年曼彻斯特举行的一场音乐会上，一名自杀式炸弹袭击者杀害了22人（其中也包括儿童 ） 。

column1: Such statements are clearly not befitting of a British political leader, much like many of the racially charged and otherwise incendiary comments (not to mention actions) that Trump has made.
column2: 就像特朗普许多种族主义及其他煽动性言论（更不要说行动）一样，这样的言论显然不符合英国领导人的形象要求。

column1: But these leaders’ failures run even deeper.
column2: 但这些领导人的失败其实更为深入。

column1: To understand them, it is worth looking at three reputable leaders who died this summer: former United Nations Secretary-General Kofi Annan, former British Foreign Secretary and NATO Secretary-General Peter Carrington, and US Senator John McCain.
column2: 要想理解这一点，只需回顾一下今年夏天故去的三位备受尊敬的领导人：前联合国秘书长科菲·安南、前英国外交大臣兼北约秘书长彼得·卡林顿，还有美国参议员约翰·麦凯恩。

column1: Having worked with Annan and for Carrington, I can vouch for their grace, honor, and commitment to truth.
column2: 因为有幸曾与安南共事并曾为卡林顿工作，我可以为他们的魅力、荣耀以及对真理的执着做出证明。

column1: McCain plainly had the same qualities, not to mention a level of personal bravery far beyond what is expected of most of us (though it should be noted that Carrington was also a war hero).
column2: 麦凯恩显然具有相同的品质，更不用说其个人的英勇程度远超我们多数人（应当指出的是卡林顿本人也是战斗英雄 ） 。

column1: These leaders’ combination of honor and commitment to truth – two attributes that are intrinsically connected – is nowhere to be seen in Trump or Johnson.
column2: 这些领导人的荣誉和对真理的承诺 — — 这两种性格特征从本质上具有相互联系 — — 在特朗普或约翰逊身上根本无迹可寻。

column1: No one would suggest that political leaders must respond to every question they are asked with entirely frank answers.
column2: 没有人会要求政治领袖必须完全坦诚地回答每一个提问。

column1: That would be to expect behavior far above and beyond what is normal.
column2: 这种要求所包含的期待远远高于和超过正常水平。

column1: Dealing with life’s predicaments sometimes demands, to borrow the language of former UK Cabinet Secretary Robert Armstrong, that we are somewhat economical with the truth.
column2: 面对生活的困境有时需要，借用前英国内阁大臣罗伯特·阿姆斯特朗的话讲，我们要对真理有节制的使用。

column1: But there is a big difference between some economizing, as even honorable leaders like McCain and Carrington have surely done, and being a serial liar, as is the case with Trump and Johnson.
column2: 但某种程度上有所节制 — — 就像麦凯恩和卡林顿等令人尊敬的领导人也曾做过的那样 — — 和像特朗普及约翰逊那样成为一名连环骗子之间有着很大的不同。

column1: Trump typically says whatever is in his short-term interest, though sometimes it seems that he does not even know what the truth is.
column2: 特朗普所说的话往往都符合他的短期利益，尽管有时看上去他对真相怎样完全不知情。

column1: Even his own lawyer is reputed to have described him as a liar.
column2: 就连他自己的律师都将他形容为骗子。

column1: Yet Trump’s dishonesty runs even deeper: his entire nationalist political platform is based on the mendacious notion that America needs to be made great again.
column2: 但特朗普的不诚实表现层次更深：他的整个民族主义政治纲领都是基于美国需要再次伟大的虚假理念。

column1: Yet America was great before Trump, and his behavior – riding roughshod over international agreements, trashing allies, and pursuing protectionist trade measures – will only undermine that greatness by, among other things, depleting the country’s formidable stock of soft power.
column2: 而美国早在特朗普上台之前就是伟大的，而他的所作所为 — — 粗暴对待国际协议、践踏盟友以及采取保护主义贸易措施 — — 只会破坏美国的伟大，并且耗尽该国强大的软实力储备。

column1: Similarly, Johnson’s Brexit campaign was based entirely on deception, crackpot economics, and vainglorious wishful thinking.
column2: 同样，约翰逊的脱欧运动完全基于欺骗、狂想经济和自负的一厢情愿。

column1: A healthy democracy depends on an honest exchange of ideas and opinions, against a background of shared respect for facts and truth.
column2: 在共同尊重事实和真相的基础上，健康的民主制度取决于诚实的思想和意见交换。

column1: The moral case against Trump and Johnson is not that they have been unfaithful to their wives, but rather that they subvert these conditions by lying relentlessly to the people they are supposed to represent.
column2: 特朗普和约翰逊违反道德准则不在于他们背叛了他们的妻子，而在于他们肆无忌惮地向本应该代表的民众撒谎而破坏了这些条件。

column1: What Good Is an Arab Military Alliance?
column2: 阿拉伯军事同盟有什么益处？

column1: LONDON – The framework nuclear agreement that Iran and the P-5 (China, Britain, France, Russia, and the United States) plus Germany recently reached represents progress on one major security challenge in the Middle East.
column2: 伦敦 — — 不久前达成的伊朗和P-5（中、英、法、俄、美）集团加德国的核框架协议代表我们在中东主要安全问题上取得了进步。

column1: But, as some Arab countries move to establish a joint military force, another security question is emerging: Will such an alliance leave the region better or worse off, particularly given today’s growing Sunni-Shia divide?
column2: 但阿拉伯国家组建联合军队又带来另一个安全隐患：这样的联盟将对地区产生何种影响，尤其考虑到今天不断加剧的逊尼-什叶派分裂？

column1: A nine-country Saudi-led coalition, which includes Egypt, the United Arab Emirates, Kuwait, and Jordan, is already carrying out airstrikes against the Iran-backed Houthi rebels in Yemen – an effort that Iran’s Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei recently declared will end with the Saudis’ “noses [being] rubbed to the soil.”
column2: 以沙特为首的九国联军，包括埃及、阿联酋、科威特和约旦已经在对伊朗支持的也门胡塞叛军发动空袭 — — 伊朗最高领袖哈梅内伊日前宣称沙特将在这场行动中“摔个狗啃泥 ” 。

column1: Yet Egypt’s president, General Abdel Fattah el-Sisi, has indicated that the coalition’s mandate may be extended beyond Yemen.
column2: 但埃及总统阿卜杜勒 - 法塔赫·塞西将军已经表示联军的授权可能不仅局限在也门境内。

column1: But what is that mandate?
column2: 但授权内容究竟是什么？

column1: A few objectives can be excluded from the start.
column2: 某些目标可以在一开始就可以排除。

column1: For example, post-conflict democratization cannot be the goal, given that Arab regimes lack the credentials or knowhow to craft democracies, and their militaries are neither willing nor able to assist in the process.
column2: 比方说目标不会是战后民主化，因为阿拉伯政权不具备建设民主政权的资质或知识，且军队既不能也不愿从旁协助。

column1: Similarly, humanitarian intervention can be ruled out, owing not only to most Arab regimes’ lack of experience and inglorious human-rights records, but also because none of the official statements related to the founding of the joint force have remotely suggested that upholding human rights was ever a concern.
column2: 此外，人道主义干预也可以排除，因为多数阿拉伯政权不仅缺乏经验且有不光彩的人权纪录，还因为与组建联军相关的官方声明丝毫没有提及捍卫人权是他们所关注的问题。

column1: Stabilization might be an objective, but only if the relevant governments can agree on shared threats and how to address them.
column2: 稳定局势或许是目的之一，但前提是相关政府能就共同威胁和应对方式达成一致。

column1: They could, for example, take the classic “balance of power/terror” approach, by intervening to undermine the more powerful actor in a conflict, force it to the negotiating table, and dictate the terms of any compromise, thereby ensuring that they benefit from the newly created status quo.
column2: 比方说，他们可以采用经典的“权力/恐怖均势”之道，通过干预破坏冲突中较强一方的实力，迫使其坐到谈判桌前，并且制定妥协条件，从而确保他们能从最新形成的现状中受益。

column1: But the rise of Arab military coalitions raises serious concerns, not least because the history of Arab-led military interventions – unlike those carried out by the West in places like Bosnia, Kosovo, and even Libya – does not contain any promising precedent.
column2: 但阿拉伯军事联盟的崛起引发了严重关切，这不仅因为以阿拉伯为首的军事干预史从未有过成功的先例 — — 不像西方在波斯尼亚、科索沃甚至利比亚等地进行的军事干预。

column1: Such interventions were usually aimed at empowering a proxy political force over its military and political rivals, instead of averting humanitarian disaster or institutionalizing a non-violent conflict-resolution mechanism following a war.
column2: 上述干预措施通常目的是协助代理政治势力战胜其军事政治对手，而不是为避免人道主义灾难或在战后建设非暴力的冲突解决机制。

column1: Egypt’s military intervention in Yemen in the 1960s is a case in point.
column2: 20世纪60年代埃及军事干预也门就是一个很好的例子。

column1: By late 1965, Egyptian President Gamel Abdel Nasser had sent 70,000 troops in Yemen to support a republican coup against royalist forces.
column2: 到1965年末，埃及总统纳赛尔派遣70，000部队到也门支持反对皇家军队的共和党政变。

column1: Despite using prohibited chemical weapons against Yemeni guerillas from 1963 to 1967 – a first in an intra-Arab conflict – Egypt failed to achieve its objectives.
column2: 尽管从1963到1967年对也门游击队使用了违禁的化学武器 — — 这是阿拉伯内部冲突中首次使用化学武器 — — 埃及依然未能达到自己的目的。

column1: On top of its military humiliation, Egypt’s international reputation suffered, with the United Nations General Assembly condemning the Egyptian forces’ use of banned chemical weapons against villages that supported the monarchy.
column2: 埃及不仅在军事上遭受屈辱，国际声誉也同样遭受损害，联合国大会谴责埃及军队使用违禁化学武器对付那些支持君主制的村落。

column1: The adventure also took a heavy economic toll; by 1965, Egypt had run up a foreign debt of nearly $3 billion, forcing it to add a “defense tax” to finance the Yemen war.
column2: 此次冒险行动也付出了沉重的经济代价；到1965年，埃及所借外债已接近30亿美元，迫使其出台所谓“国防税”来为也门战争筹集经费。

column1: The Syria-dominated “Arab Deterrent Force” did not fare much better when it intervened in Lebanon’s civil war in the 1980s, failing either to end the brutal fighting or to secure vulnerable Palestinian refugees.
column2: 20世纪80年代叙利亚主导“阿拉伯威慑部队”干预黎巴嫩内战的情况也并未好到哪去，既未能结束那场残酷的战争，也未能保护弱势的巴勒斯坦难民群体。

column1: After 1982, when the Lebanese government failed to extend the ADF’s mandate, it turned into a purely Syrian military force – one that ended up committing some of the worst atrocities against Palestinian factions and refugees in the so-called “War of the Camps” in 1985.
column2: 1982年黎巴嫩政府未能延续“阿拉伯威慑部队”授权后，该部队演变成一支纯粹的叙利亚部队 — — 这支部队随后在1985年所谓“难民营战争”中上演了针对巴勒斯坦派别和难民的最恐怖的屠杀行为。

column1: Brief and less complex interventions were also unsuccessful in ending violent crises – and in some cases even exacerbated them.
column2: 时间较短且不那么复杂的干预也未能成功结束暴力危机 — — 在某些情况下甚至令危机进一步加剧。

column1: A clear example is the recent Egyptian airstrikes in Libya, which have not only undermined the UN-led peace process in a deeply divided country, but have also empowered the most extreme elements.
column2: 最近埃及空袭利比亚就是明显的实例，埃及的空袭不仅破坏了这个严重分裂国家由联合国主导的和平进程，并且使某些最极端份子借此扩充势力。

column1: Of course, history is not a definitive guide to the future; an Arab-led intervention today could turn out very differently.
column2: 当然，单凭历史并不能确定未来的走势；今天由阿拉伯主导的干预可能取得不同的效果。

column1: But there is little to indicate that it will; indeed, despite hundreds of Saudi airstrikes on Houthi-controlled military bases and seaports, the rebels continue to advance.
column2: 但事情向这个方向发展的证据并不充分；事实上，尽管沙特对胡塞控制的军事基地和港口进行了数百次空袭，但叛军推进的势��并未得到遏制。

column1: If emerging Arab military coalitions are to avoid the mistakes of past interventions, their members must reconsider their approach, including the structural deficiencies that contributed to past failures.
column2: 如果新成立的阿拉伯军事联盟想要避免过去干预行动的错误，各成员国必须重新思考自己的做法，包括哪些结构性缺陷曾经导致失利。

column1: Many factors affect the outcome of a military intervention in a civil war, especially if it involves a ground offensive.
column2: 尤其当涉及地面进攻时，将有诸多因素影响对内战的军事干预。

column1: In particular, Arab leaders should focus on revising the processes by which national-security policy is formulated, improving civil-military relations, providing the relevant training in peacekeeping and peace-building, reforming the political culture, and addressing socio-psychological complexes.
column2: 阿拉伯国家领导人尤其应注重修改国家安全政策的制定程序、改善军民关系、提供维和及和平建设等相关培训、改革政治文化并解决社会心理层面的复杂问题。

column1: If Arab leaders fail to overcome these deficiencies, the latest Arab force could become the Middle East’s newest source of anti-democratic, sectarian-based instability, potentially intensifying the Sunni-Shia conflict.
column2: 如果阿拉伯领导人未能克服上述缺陷，新组建的阿拉伯联军可能演变为加剧逊尼什叶派冲突的中东最新的反民主宗派势力。

column1: That is the last thing the region needs.
column2: 中东地区最不希望看到这样的结果。

column1: Joking about Science
column2: 科学的玩笑

column1: ITHACA, NEW YORK – An apocryphal story sometimes heard among physicists concerns a toast, proposed by his Cambridge University colleagues, to J. J. Thomson’s discovery of the electron in 1897: “To the electron: may it never be of use to anyone!”
column2: 纽约伊萨卡 — — 在自然科学家中间有时会听到一则杜撰的故事，讲的是剑桥大学同事在举杯祝贺1897年J. J.

column1: Pure mathematicians supposedly tell a similar joke about their profession.
column2: 汤姆生发现电子时说 ： “ 为电子干杯：预祝它永远不会对任何人有用 ！ ” 据说纯数学家也经常对自己的职业开同样的玩笑。

column1: Why should it be considered witty to celebrate the uselessness of knowledge?
column2: 为什么人们会把庆祝知识无用看作一种诙谐的态度？

column1: I witnessed a similar attitude from a cosmologist when I participated in a radio show a few years ago: the host remarked to him that his research “has virtually no practical applicability,” to which he quickly replied, “I’m proud of that, yes.”
column2: 几年前，我在参与一档广播节目时曾亲眼目睹一位宇宙学家抱有同样的态度：当主持人说他的研究“几乎没有任何实际用处”时，他很快回答说 ， “ 是这样，我感到非常骄傲 。 ”

column1: These jokes all seem to rely on the same assumption: everyone thinks that knowledge, especially scientific knowledge, should be useful.
column2: 这些玩笑似乎有赖于同样一种假设：所有人都认为知识，特别是科学知识，应该有某种用处。

column1: So it’s funny to boast that one’s own brand of knowledge, whether experimental physics, mathematics, or cosmology, is useless.
column2: 因此不管是实验物理学、数学或宇宙学，吹嘘自己的知识无用显得非常好笑。

column1: But the joke wouldn’t work if there were not at the same time another widely shared assumption that scientific knowledge has a value independent of any practical use.
column2: 但如果不是同时有另外一种假设公认科学知识的价值不依赖于任何实际用途的话，这样的玩笑恐怕也站不住脚。

column1: After all, it would not be funny if a charity dedicated to famine relief celebrated its own ineffectiveness; practical value in that case would be paramount, because it would be the only real reason for the charity to exist.
column2: 毕竟，如果某家致力于赈济饥荒的慈善机构庆贺自己效率低下，将不会有人因此感到好笑。 那种情况下实际价值是重中之重，因为它是慈善机构存在的唯一真正理由。

column1: So, even though potential usefulness is the reason why governments devote so much money to scientific research, people really expect more from science than that.
column2: 因此，就算潜在的实用性是政府投入巨资进行科研的原因所在，人们对科学的实际期待却有所不同。

column1: On this view, science also has a quite different, higher aim: understanding the natural world.
column2: 从这个角度看，科学还有理解自然世界这样一个截然不同的更高目标。

column1: Einstein may have drawn US President Franklin Roosevelt’s attention to the possibility of making nuclear weapons, but he is chiefly remembered for his profound ideas about the nature of the universe.
column2: 爱因斯坦用来吸引美国总统富兰克林·罗斯福的或许是制造核武器的可能性，但他为世人所铭记还是因为有关宇宙自然的深邃理念。

column1: More recent scientific gurus, such as Carl Sagan and Stephen Hawking, have presented a similar image to the public.
column2: 更近的科学权威，比如卡尔·萨根和斯蒂芬•霍金，也有着与爱因斯坦相似的公众形象。

column1: Science from this perspective is about natural philosophy, an enterprise that seeks to acquire deep understanding of the world regardless of whether that knowledge can be put to use.
column2: 从这个角度看，科学也就是自然哲学，它追求对世界更深刻的理解，而不关心这些知识能否付诸应用。

column1: Jokes also betray a certain uneasiness about the apparent contradictions that they reveal. In this case, the uneasiness derives from a fundamental uncertainty about which of the two faces of science, natural philosophy or instrumentality, represents its true character. Is science really about understanding the world, with instrumentality being a matter of fortuitous spin-offs?
column2: 这样的玩笑也在某种程度上暴露出对显而易见矛盾的不安和局促。 此时此地，这种不安来源于人们对于自然哲学和功用性这两个侧面究竟哪一面能代表科学真正属性的疑惑。

column1: Or is it really about putting the natural world to human uses, with natural philosophy being little more than a language to account for why certain techniques work?
column2: 科学难道真是为了理解世界，而实用性不过是一条偶然的岔路？ 还是科学的真正含义是让自然世界为人类所用，而自然哲学则不过是一种语言，可以解释为什么某些技术能够发挥作用？

column1: The nineteenth century invented the familiar terms “pure” and “applied” science as a way of reconciling these alternative understandings.
column2: “纯科学”和“应用科学”这两个耳熟能详的名词出现在19世纪，上述两种不同的理解也因此实现了统一。

column1: Pure science, as the name suggests, is presented as the “real thing,” untainted by practical considerations and rooted in properly conducted empirical and theoretical investigation of nature.
column2: 纯科学就像这个名称所表现的那样，被人们理解为“核心问题 ” ， 它没有被有关实际的考量所沾染，以来自自然的正确的经验和理论调查为根基。

column1: Applied science takes the knowledge provided by pure science and puts it to work.
column2: 应用科学则是把纯科学提供的知识运用到实践中去。

column1: But that straightforward picture bears little resemblance to the complexities of real scientific activity: if applied science involved nothing more than the application of the results of pure science, there would be no need for “research and development” departments in manufacturing corporations, or research laboratories at chemical or electronics companies.
column2: 但这种直截了当的描述并不能表现出实际科学活动的复杂性：如果应用科学仅限于把纯科学的成果付诸应用，那么制造企业就没有必要设立“研究与发展部 ” ， 化工或电子企业也没有必要设立科研实验室。

column1: The instrumental achievements of science would depend solely on the scraps falling from the pure scientist’s table.
column2: 科学的实用成就将完全取决于从纯科学家桌上漏下的碎屑。

column1: In fact, the two faces of science are much more intimately interwoven – less like faces than like two ingredients of a thoroughly stirred mixture.
column2: 实际上，科学的两个侧面关系更加紧密 — — 与其说是它们是不同的侧面还不如说是彻底混合在一起的两种成份更妥当。

column1: “Truth and utility,” wrote Francis Bacon, the early seventeenth-century English philosopher and statesman, “are the very same things.”
column2: 十七世纪早期英国哲人兼政治家弗兰西斯·培根写道 ， “ 求真和致用其实是一回事 。 ”

column1: In other words, the truth of beliefs about the world is guaranteed only by the capacity of those beliefs to be turned into actions that produce the practical outcomes that human beings desire.
column2: 换句话讲，只有有能力将信仰转化为人类所期望的实际结果才能保障与世界相关的信仰的真实。

column1: What we understand as the instrumentality of science was, for Bacon, nothing but the other side of the scientific coin.
column2: 在培根看来，我们心目中的科学的实用性不过是硬币的另外一面而已。

column1: Where the poet John Keats wrote “Beauty is truth, truth beauty,” Bacon might have said, “Utility is truth, truth utility”—as long as we take “utility” in a very broad sense.
column2: 诗人约翰·济慈曾经写道“美即是真，真即是美 ， ” 而只要我们从广义的角度理解“致用 ” ， 培根或许会说“致用即求真，求真即致用 ” 。

column1: But we don’t believe Bacon, either.
column2: 但我们也不能盲从培根。

column1: Like Bacon, we value utility because it seems to lend credibility to the claims that science makes about the nature of the world – science is true because it works.
column2: 像培根一样，我们因致用能增加科学的可信度而看重致用 — — 科学因致用而真实。

column1: But, at the same time, we won’t allow science to be reduced to practical utility, because that would destroy its intellectual status, as well as the intellectual status of scientists themselves, and would prevent science from giving explanations.
column2: 但与此同时，我们又不能允许将科学等同于实际应用，因为这样就破坏了科学和科学家们的思想地位，从而妨碍科学对自然现象做出解释。

column1: So science must retain its claim to being natural philosophy, too.
column2: 因此科学仍必须保持其自然哲学的本来面目。

column1: Sometimes we believe that science is natural philosophy, and sometimes we believe that science is instrumentality.
column2: 有时我们认为科学是一种自然哲学，有时又认为科学即应用。

column1: But in fact it’s both simultaneously, neither “pure” nor “applied.”
column2: 但实际上科学同时兼具两者的特性，既非“纯粹”又非“应用 ” 。

column1: If we could acknowledge that, we wouldn’t be joking about it.
column2: 如果我们认识到这一点，就不会再开这样的玩笑了。

column1: Finishing Off Hunger
column2: 结束饥饿

column1: ROME – At least 842 million people worldwide suffer from chronic hunger – a nearly 1.5% decrease from the 854 million estimated for 2010-2012.
column2: 罗马 — — 虽然比2010-2012年估算的8.54亿人减少近1.5 % ， 但世界仍有至少8.42亿人常年忍饥挨饿。

column1: Clearly, while some progress has been made, the world still has a long way to go to eradicate under-nutrition.
column2: 很明显虽然已经取得了一定进展，但根除营养不良还有很多工作要做。

column1: As world leaders attempt to determine the best way forward, a report published jointly this year by the Food and Agriculture Organization, the International Fund for Agricultural Development, and the World Food Program, can serve as an important resource. “The State of Food Insecurity in the World" (SOFI 2013) provides updated estimates of under-nutrition and progress toward achieving the hunger targets set by the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and the World Food Summit (WFS).
column2: 在世界领导人试图确定最佳方案过程中，世界粮农组织、国际农业发展基金和世界粮食计划署今年发表的一份联合报告可以作为重要资源加以利用。 《2013年世界粮食不安全状况》报告（SOFI 2013）估测了最新的营养不良状况，以及实现千年发展目标（MDGs）和世界粮食首脑会议（WFS）设定的消除饥饿目标的最新进展。

column1: Progress on the MDGs has been uneven.
column2: 千年发展目标的进展状况很不均衡。

column1: While many countries in the developing world – home to 827 million of the world's undernourished (compared to 838 million in 2010-2012) – have moved toward halving, by 2015, the share of hungry people relative to 1990, the average rate of decline is inadequate to meet the target in the next two years.
column2: 尽管营养不良人口占8.27亿的众多发展中国家（2010-2012年这一数字为8.38亿）到2015年可能实现饥饿人口占比较1990年减半，但平均下降速度距两年后实现目标还相去甚远。

column1: The more ambitious WFS target of halving the total number of hungry people worldwide is even more distant, with the number of undernourished people having fallen by only 17% since 1990-1992.
column2: 世界粮食首脑会议全球饥饿人口减半的宏伟目标更加遥不可及， 1990-1992年来只减少了17%的营养不良人口。

column1: As SOFI 2013 points out, progress toward eradicating hunger and undernourishment has slowed since 2000, when food prices began to rise, following almost a half-century of decline.
column2: 正如《2013年世界粮食不安全状况》报告所指出的那样，2000年来消除饥饿和营养不良的步伐有所放缓，粮价在经历近半个世纪的下降后开始重拾升势。

column1: Although rapid economic growth has boosted per capita incomes in much of the developed world, income gains are not spread evenly, leaving hundreds of millions of people to face higher food prices without sufficient increases in income.
column2: 虽然经济快速增长提振了许多发达国家的人均收入，但增收状况并不均匀，导致数亿人在没有充分增收的情况下面临更高的粮价。

column1: The World Bank originally defined its “dollar a day" extreme-poverty threshold principally in terms of the amount of food one needed to purchase to avoid hunger.
column2: 世行起初主要是以避免挨饿所需购买的粮食来界定其“每天一美元”的极端贫困线。

column1: But subsequent adjustments – such as to $1.25 per day for 2005 – appear to have lost this link.
column2: 但此后所进行的调整（比方说2005年的每天1.25美元）却似乎不再坚持这一原则。

column1: Today's extreme-poverty line is inadequate to avoid being undernourished – in Nicaragua, for example.
column2: 今天的极端贫困线已经不足以避免营养不良的状况 — — 以尼加拉瓜为例。

column1: Although the share of people living in extreme poverty in 1990 was halved by 2010, progress will have to accelerate considerably to halve the prevalence of under-nutrition by 2015.
column2: 虽然1990年已经实现了极端贫困人口减半，但2015年要想实现营养不良减半的目标其进展还需要大大加快。

column1: Meanwhile, despite declining expatriate employment and incomes in the last half-decade, remittances have helped to fight poverty, reduce hunger, improve diets, and increase agricultural investment.
column2: 同时，尽管过去五年里外籍人士的就业和收入均有所下降，但汇款在消除贫困、减少饥饿、改善饮食和增加农业投资等领域都有很大帮助。

column1: Globally, remittances amount to nearly three times the size of official development assistance, which has been an easy target for budget cuts by rich countries in recent years.
column2: 全球汇款金额为官方发展援助额的三倍，近年来官方发展援助已成为富国削减预算的重灾区。

column1: The SOFI 2013 report also describes the persistent and marked disparities among regions.
column2: 《2013年世界粮食不安全状况》报告还描述了地区间的持续显著差异。

column1: East and Southeast Asia and Latin America – which have experienced particularly rapid economic growth in recent decades – have fared the best in terms of reducing hunger.
column2: 近数十年来经济发展尤其迅速的东亚、东南亚和拉美在减少饥饿方面的进展最为显著。

column1: Sub-Saharan Africa has, after a quarter-century of economic stagnation, made some progress over the last decade, but it maintains the highest rate of under-nutrition worldwide.
column2: 撒哈拉以南非洲地区在四分之一世纪的经济停滞后终于在过去10年取得了进步，但那里的营养不良率仍然是全世界最高的。

column1: Gains in South Asia and North Africa have been modest, while conditions in West Asia have actually worsened.
column2: 南亚和北非的进展一直不大，而西亚的状况反而有所恶化。

column1: Hunger and undernourishment (which reflects only dietary energy supply) often coexist.
column2: 饥饿和营养不良（仅反映膳食能量供应）往往同时存在。

column1: But, in most places, under-nutrition rates – as indicated by, say, the proportion of stunted children – are much higher than estimates for the prevalence of undernourishment.
column2: 但在多数地区，比如说发育迟缓儿童比例所表示的营养不良率却往往远高于估计的营养不良人数。

column1: That is why nutrition-enhancing interventions in agriculture, schools, health care, water supplies, and elsewhere – especially targeting women and young children – are needed.
column2: 这说明为什么特别要针对妇女和儿童在农村、学校、医疗、供水和其他领域开展强化营养介入举措。

column1: Efforts to ensure sustainable and inclusive economic growth are also vital.
column2: 确保持续及包容性经济增长的努力也至关重要。

column1: With the protracted economic slowdown of the last half-decade spreading to even the most resilient areas of the developing world, achieving full employment is unlikely in most countries, at least in the foreseeable future.
column2: 随着过去五年的长期经济增长放缓蔓延到甚至是最具活力的发展中国家，至少在可以预见的将来，实现充分就业在多数国家是不太可能的。

column1: But much can still be done to improve workers' employment prospects, and thus their ability to acquire the nourishment that they and their families need.
column2: 但改善工人就业前景、并由此提高他们保障家人营养的能力仍有很多工作要做。

column1: In many cases, comprehensive reforms aimed at inducing sufficient agricultural investment and providing adequate social protection could facilitate major reductions in poverty and hunger.
column2: 很多情况下，以引导充足农业投资和提供充分社会保护为目的的全面改革可以显著减少贫困和饥饿。

column1: This includes ensuring that people have reliable access to potable water and adequate sanitation.
column2: 其中包括确保民众获取可靠的饮用水和足够的卫生设施。

column1: With the right design, the contribution of social-protection measures to reducing malnutrition would increase substantially.
column2: 如果设计得当，以减少营养不良为目的的社会保护措施的贡献将会显著提高。

column1: For example, certain benefits could be conditional on prenatal and postnatal nutrition measures targeting mothers and pre-school children.
column2: 比方说，可以为母亲及学龄前儿童等特殊群体制定产前产后的营养补充措施。

column1: Well-designed school meal programs have enabled children to overcome hunger – including the “hidden hunger" caused by micronutrient deficiencies.
column2: 精心设计的学校供餐方案已成功使儿童摆脱饥饿 — — 其中也包括因微量营养素缺乏引发的“隐性饥饿 ” 。

column1: Related food-procurement policies have spurred the emergence of cooperatives of small family farmers practicing sustainable agriculture.
column2: 相关食品采购政策刺激成立了可持续耕作的家庭小型农场合作社。

column1: Such measures – together with initiatives to enhance poor people's incomes – also help to spur rural development, stimulate markets, and promote job creation.
column2: 上述措施以及提高穷人收入计划同样有利于促进农村发展、刺激市场和创造就业机会。

column1: A long-term political commitment to eradicating hunger and undernourishment – backed by decisive action – holds the key to improving health outcomes and supporting sustainable, inclusive economic growth worldwide.
column2: 在果断行动的支持下，消除饥饿和营养不良的长期政治承诺已成为改善健康状况、支持全球经济持续、包容增长的关键所在。

column1: A good start has been made; now it is time to finish the job.
column2: 我们已经取得了良好的开端；现在应该再接再厉、实现目标。

column1: Deconstructing the Euro
column2: 解构欧元

column1: PARIS – In January, Chris Williamson, Chief Economist at the economics research firm Markit, called France “the new sick man of Europe.”
column2: 巴黎—1月，经济研究公司Markit首席经济学家克里斯·威廉森（Chris Williamson）将法国称为“欧洲新病夫 ” 。

column1: With near-zero GDP growth, rising unemployment, and mounting public debt – not to mention counter-productive austerity policies – it is difficult to argue otherwise.
column2: 法国GDP增长几乎为零，失业不断增加，公债水平节节攀升 — — 更不用说反生产性的紧缩政策了 — — 这让你很难反驳他的观点。

column1: Given France’s profound importance to Europe’s economic and political stability, this poses a major threat to the entire European project.
column2: 由于法国对欧洲经济和政治稳定具有很重要的作用，因此这对整个欧洲工程来说都是个重大威胁。

column1: Recent developments confirm Williamson’s diagnosis.
column2: 最新发展态势验证了威廉森的论断。

column1: French business activity sank to a seven-month low in December.
column2: 12月，法国商业活动降至七个月低点。

column1: While tax revenues increased by €32 billion ($44 billion) last year, the government deficit fell by a mere €8 billion and public debt increased from 89% of GDP to more than 93%.
column2: 尽管去年税收收入增加了320亿欧元，但政府赤字只减少了80亿欧元，公债水平从占GDP的89%上升到93 % 。

column1: Meanwhile, unemployment rose from 9.5% to 10.5%.
column2: 与此同时，失业率从9.5%增加到10.5 % 。

column1: The obvious conclusion is that austerity is not the answer.
column2: 显而易见，紧缩不是答案。

column1: Indeed, France must abandon its current policies, for its own – and the rest of Europe’s – sake.
column2: 事实上，法国必须放弃现有政策，这对它自己和对欧洲其他国家都好。

column1: France’s problems, like those of the eurozone’s other troubled economies, stem from the fact that the euro’s exchange rate does not align with member countries’ economic positions.
column2: 和其他欧元区麻烦经济体一样，法国的问题来源于欧元汇率与成员国的经济状况不相符这一事实。

column1: As a result, these countries’ virtual exchange rates vis-à-vis Germany are critically overvalued, inasmuch as wages in these countries have risen more quickly, and labor productivity more slowly, than in Germany.
column2: 结果是这些国家的实际对德国汇率被大大高估，因为这些国家工资增长更快而劳动生产率增长更慢。

column1: Given that the implicit nominal exchange rates are fixed “forever” within the euro, these countries have accumulated major deficits relative to Germany.
column2: 由于隐含名义利率通过欧元被“永远”固定了，因此这些国家积累起相对德国的巨大赤字。

column1: Likewise, the deficit countries’ exchange rates are overvalued relative to third countries like the United States and Japan, while Germany’s currency is undervalued, because the euro’s exchange rate is determined by the balance of payments of the eurozone as a whole, which Germany’s massive surplus distorts.
column2: 类似地，赤字国的汇率相对第三国（如美国和日本）也处于高估状态，而德国货币则处于低估状态，因为欧元汇率由欧元区总体收支平衡决定，而欧元区总体收支平衡因为德国的巨大盈余而存在扭曲。

column1: In short, the euro exchange rate is too weak for equilibrium in Germany and too strong for equilibrium in France and the other less competitive eurozone economies.
column2: 简言之，欧元汇率对德国来说低于均衡水平，而对法国和其他竞争力较弱的欧元区经济体来说则高于均衡水平。

column1: The eurozone’s weaker economies thus face a dilemma: either expand in line with productive potential, thereby incurring external deficits, or enforce austerity, eliminating external deficits by squeezing imports.
column2: 因此，欧元区疲软经济体面临一个两难：要么按生产潜力水平扩张，这意味着外部赤字；要么加强紧缩，通过挤出进口消除外部赤字。

column1: Under pressure from Germany, they have so far pursued the latter option.
column2: 在德国的压力下，它们选择了后者。

column1: The current “competitive austerity” trend is irrational, first and foremost, because, by undermining domestic demand, it directly controverts the currency union’s fundamental principle that a large domestic market should act as a buffer against external demand shocks.
column2: 当前的“竞争性紧缩”趋势是不理性的，首先，这破坏了内需，直接与货币联盟的基本原则 — — 庞大的国内市场应该成为抵御外部需求冲击的缓冲相悖。

column1: This is causing everyone to suffer – even Germany.
column2: 这造成了所有国家的损失，包括德国。

column1: Indeed, from 2007 to 2012, Germany’s exports to other eurozone countries declined by 9%, from €432 billion to €393 billion.
column2: 事实上，从2007年到2012年，德国对其他欧元区国家出口下降了9 % ， 从4,320亿欧元减少到3,930亿欧元。

column1: But this is not the only threat that austerity poses to Germany’s hard-won prosperity.
column2: 但紧缩给德国好不容易赢得的繁荣所造成的威胁不止于此。

column1: The euro has also caused Germany’s business cycle to diverge from those of the less competitive economies, while prohibiting customized monetary policies.
column2: 欧元还造成德国商业周期与竞争力较低经济体的脱节，并且让合适的货币政策无从实施。

column1: And the common monetary policy that all are being forced to pursue is intensifying deflationary pressures in the weaker countries, while increasing inflationary pressures in Germany.
column2: 而被迫采取的共同货币政策加剧了疲软国的通缩压力，同时也增加了德国的通胀压力。

column1: Furthermore, populations in the eurozone’s stagnant economies are increasingly demanding that Germany change its policies, increasing wages and implementing measures aimed at boosting consumption and discouraging savings.
column2: 此外，欧元区停滞经济体的人民日益需要德国改变其政策，提高工资并实施旨在提振消费、抑制储蓄的过时。

column1: While responding to such demands would help to ease political tensions across the eurozone, they would face strong opposition within Germany.
column2: 尽管响应这一需要有助于缓解整个欧元区的政治紧张，但在德国国内会引起强烈反对。

column1: Similarly, resolving the crises that will inevitably emerge from the current rigid exchange-rate system will ultimately require Germany to agree either to debt write-offs or to large-scale government-bond purchases by the European Central Bank, which would flood the eurozone with liquidity.
column2: 类似地，要解决当前的僵化汇率体系所必然会导致的危机，最终需要德国同意债务减记或欧洲央行大量买入政府债券（这会向欧元区注入大量流动性 ） 。

column1: Either outcome would run contrary to Germany’s interests and preferences, making it as unfair an approach as austerity.
column2: 这两个结果都与德国的利益和偏好相悖，因此和紧缩一样有失公允。

column1: What the eurozone needs is a solution that does not force any one country or group of countries to bear the brunt of the adjustment – and that means a controlled segmentation of the currency union.
column2: 欧元区需要这样的解决方案：它不会强迫任何一个或一些国家承受调整的主要成本。 这意味着对货币联盟做有控制的分割。

column1: Contrary to popular belief, this could be done in a way that reinvigorates the European ideal, rather than reviving the parochial nationalism of the past.
column2: 与流行的见解不同，这可以通过一种刺激欧洲理想而不会让过去的狭隘民族主义死灰复燃的方式实现。

column1: The key is to ensure that it arises from the European Union’s economic and political core.
column2: 关键在于它来自欧盟经济和政治核心。

column1: Specifically, Germany, Europe’s greatest economic power, and France, the intellectual progenitor of European unification, should announce their simultaneous exit from the euro and re-adoption of the Deutsche Mark and the franc.
column2: 具体而言，欧洲最强大的经济体德国和欧洲统一思想的发源地法国应该同时宣布退出欧元区，从新采用德国马克和法郎。

column1: This would trigger the immediate revaluation of the Deutsche Mark – and possibly of the franc – relative to the euro.
column2: 这会立刻导致德国马克（可能还包括法郎）对欧元的升值。

column1: For their part, other EU member countries would have to decide whether to retain the euro in its truncated form or revert to their own national currencies, possibly pegging them to the revived Deutsche Mark or franc.
column2: 其他欧盟成员国则需要决定留在缩编后的欧元区还是重新采用其自身的国家货币，并可能盯住重新启用的德国马克或法郎。

column1: Regardless of their decision, the price competitiveness of the eurozone’s weaker economies would improve considerably.
column2: 无论做出什么选择，欧元区疲软经济体的价格竞争力都会得到极大改善。

column1: Of course, France and Germany would need to implement interim arrangements to safeguard their banking systems’ stability.
column2: 当然，法国和德国需要实施过渡性安排以保证银行系统的稳定。

column1: Moreover, they would have to negotiate with the ECB and other European governments a plan for managing euro-denominated debts.
column2: 此外，它们还需要和欧洲央行和其他欧洲政府谈判，制定管理欧元计价债务的计划。

column1: A period of monetary uncertainty, as European economies adjusted to the new environment, would be unavoidable.
column2: 在欧洲经济体适应性环境的过程中，一定时期的货币不确定性是不可避免的。

column1: But that would be far better than the economic and political impasse in which the eurozone is now trapped.
column2: 但这也比欧元区目前所身处的经济和政治僵局强得多。

column1: Latin America’s Ukraine
column2: 拉丁美洲的乌克兰

column1: MEXICO CITY – By all indications, the international community has resigned itself to Russian President Vladimir Putin’s Crimean “land grab,” as US Vice-President Joe Biden has called it.
column2: 墨西哥城—从各种指标看，国际社会已经顺从于俄罗斯总统普京的“土地掠夺 ” （ 美国副总统拜登语 ） 。

column1: Once Putin decided he wanted to assume the consequences of his acts, there was very little the United States, the European Union, or the United Nations could do.
column2: 一旦普京决定采取行动，美国、欧盟或联合国便束手无策。

column1: Latin America, meanwhile, is experiencing the opposite problem.
column2: 与此同时，拉丁美洲正在经历相反的问题。

column1: Though the region’s countries have the means to stop the growing political, economic, and human-rights catastrophe in Venezuela, they lack the will, while the rest of the world’s attention to Ukraine has removed any pressure on them to act.
column2: 尽管该地区各国有办法阻止委内瑞拉的政治、经济和人权状况继续恶化，但却缺乏意愿 ， ， 而世界其他地区的目光纷纷对准了乌克兰，这也让它们没有压力采取行动。

column1: In Ukraine, the US and the EU seem to have decided on a sensible course of action – or, rather, on a realistic two-track response – that is unlikely to produce spectacular results, but is certainly preferable to passivity.
column2: 在乌克兰，美国和欧盟似乎决定采取明智动作 — — 或者说基于现实考虑的两手准备 — — 这一动作不可能产生令人瞩目的结果，但显然比不作为更好。

column1: First, the sanctions imposed so far – visa cancellations, asset seizures or freezes, and the like – will not give Sevastopol back to Ukraine, but they will eventually bite, at least in certain Russian business sectors.
column2: 首先，目前所采取的制裁措施 — — 取消签证、资产没收或冻结等 — — 并不能让塞瓦斯托波尔回归乌克兰，但终究会起到作用，至少对俄罗斯的某些商业部门会起到作用。

column1: Whether this unites the oligarchs, or divides them, and whether it forces them to take their money out of Russia, or bring it back home, cannot be predicted.
column2: 这些制裁会团结还是分裂寡头、会迫使他们将资金转出还是转回俄罗斯都无法预料。

column1: But uncertainty is far better than knowing acquiescence.
column2: 但不确定性总比明知故犯的缄默好得多。

column1: There are simply no alternatives right now, and applying the entire gamut of sanctions from the outset would leave the EU and the US without further options.
column2: 目前并无其他替代方案可用，而从外部全方位开启制裁也让欧盟和美国没有了进一步的选择。

column1: Second, and much more important, a tacit anti-appeasement ultimatum has been issued to the Kremlin: additional expansion in Ukraine will lead to much stronger and more painful sanctions.
column2: 其次也是更重要的是，美国和欧盟向克里姆林宫发出了无声的反绥靖最后通牒：继续在乌克兰扩张将导致更强更痛苦的制裁。

column1: This may or may not work, but the decisions and announcements at least have the merit of existing, thereby demonstrating the willingness of the G-7 and others to uphold principles and values to which Russia is, in theory, also committed.
column2: 这也许能奏效，也许不能，但这些决定和声明至少有其价值，从而说明了七国集团和其他国家愿意捍卫理论上俄罗斯也做出过承诺的原则和价值。

column1: Clearly, the world’s democracies lack perfect options, given everyone’s eminently reasonable reluctance to resort to force.
column2: 显然，世界民主国家没有完美选择，因为每个国家都有充分的理由不寻求诉诸武力。

column1: Given Ukraine’s location, history, and the potential for trouble, the international community’s greater attention to the crisis there than to the disaster unfolding in Venezuela is not surprising.
column2: 从乌克兰的区位、历史和造成麻烦的潜力看，国际社会更多地关注那里而不是正在委内瑞拉展开的灾难并不令人奇怪。

column1: But it is not appropriate, either.
column2: 但对于后者的关注实在太少。

column1: Recent events in Venezuela imply as many perils and unforeseen, perverse consequences as in Ukraine, and the international community, as well as most Latin American democracies, should be paying much more attention.
column2: 委内瑞拉最近发生的事件的风险性、不可预见性和严重性不亚于乌克兰，而国际社会（以及大部分拉丁美洲民主国家）应该给予更多关注。

column1: For starters, there is energy security.
column2: 首先，这事关能源安全。

column1: Venezuela has some of the world’s largest oil and gas reserves, and is a major exporter (though smaller than ten years ago).
column2: 委内瑞拉拥有世界最大石油和天然气储量之一，也是主要油气出口国（尽管出口规模较十年前有所下降 ） 。

column1: And, for better or for worse, it is a key supplier to certain countries.
column2: 此外，不论好坏，它是一些国家的关键能源供给国。

column1: Nearly all of the Caribbean, Central America, and some Gulf ports in the United States depend on Venezuelan low-sulfur crude oil for their power plants, refineries, and balance-of-payments positions.
column2: 几乎所有加勒比地区和中美洲以及部分美国墨西哥湾区港口依赖委内瑞拉低硫原油用于发电、精炼和实现收支平衡。

column1: Cuba is the most dramatic case of dependence: Without subsidized Venezuelan petroleum and the enormous sums paid for the Castros’ doctors – some excellent, some fraudulent – the island’s economy would sink, causing a wave of Cubans to leave, as has occurred repeatedly over the past half-century.
column2: 古巴对委内瑞拉的依赖最大：如若没有受补贴的委内瑞拉汽油和给卡斯特罗医生（有些是名医，有些则是骗子）的巨额医疗费，古巴经济就将陷入萧条，促使一大批古巴人逃离，这在过去五十年中发生过多次。

column1: This time, though, the consequences for Florida and Mexico could be graver than before.
column2: 但这一次，佛罗里达和墨西哥将受到比以往更大的影响。

column1: But what happens in Venezuela matters for other reasons as well.
column2: 但委内瑞拉形势之所以重要，还有其他原因。

column1: Targeted repression, imprisonment of opposition leaders, press censorship, shortages, inflation, and wanton violence – Caracas is one the world’s most dangerous cities – have created a situation that appears untenable in the medium term.
column2: 定向压迫、关押反对派领导人、新闻审查、短缺、通货膨胀和暴力肆虐 — — 加拉加斯已成为世界上最危险的城市之一 — — 从中期看，局面已难以为继。

column1: The harsh economic and security measures that Venezuela needs to emerge from its current debacle cannot be implemented without some form of consensus, which requires an end to repression and polarization.
column2: 委内瑞拉需要严厉的经济和安全措施才能克服当前的障碍，这些措施只能在取得一定形式的共识的情况下才能实施，而取得共识又需要结束镇压和极端化。

column1: Unfortunately, none of this seems likely if left exclusively in the hands of Venezuelans, who have failed repeatedly over the past 15 years to find solutions to their dilemmas.
column2: 不幸的是，如果完全由委内瑞拉人民自行处理，镇压和极端化就不可能结束，因为在过去15年中，委内瑞拉人从未找到过走出困境的办法。

column1: Some have suggested a papal mediation; others have advocated intervention by a group of Latin American former presidents.
column2: 一些人建议采用宗教斡旋；也有人建议让由拉美国家前总统组成的小组进行干预。

column1: The problem is that no Latin American government, with the exception of Panama, wants to dirty its hands.
column2: 问题在于，除了巴拿马以外，没有一个拉美国家政府愿意染指。

column1: The three that count because of their size – Argentina, Brazil, and Mexico – are all frightened of the consequences: Brazil that its companies will lose contracts, Mexico that the Venezuelans will finance opposition to their energy reforms, and Argentina of losing an ally that knows too much.
column2: 三个有影响力的大国 — — 阿根廷、巴西和墨西哥 — — 都有各自担心的结果：巴西担心其公司会失去合同；墨西哥担心委内瑞拉会为其能源改革反对者提供融资；而阿根廷担心失去知道得太多的盟友。

column1: The other two conceivably relevant countries – Colombia and Chile – refuse to get involved for different reasons.
column2: 另外两个据信关系也比较大的国家 — — 哥伦比亚和智利出于不同的原因拒绝牵涉其中。

column1: Colombia needs President Nicolás Maduro’s cooperation to sustain negotiations with the FARC guerrillas; the new Chilean president, Michelle Bachelet, has always had a soft spot for Chavismo and its antics.
column2: 哥伦比亚需要委内瑞拉总统马杜罗的合作维持与FARC游击队的谈判；而智利新总统巴切莱特的软肋一直是查韦斯主义及其作态。

column1: In the case of Crimea, the deaths of hundreds of demonstrators in Kyiv and the possible Russian takeover of eastern Ukraine has called into question principles such as non-intervention.
column2: 在克里米亚事件中，有数百人在基辅的示威中丧生，而俄罗斯有可能吞并东乌克兰，这使得不干预原则大有问题。

column1: Not in Latin America: the number of students in Venezuela that are killed by government-sponsored paramilitary groups is still viewed as nobody’s business but the Venezuelans’, even though the country is a party to every regional instrument of international human-rights law.
column2: 而拉丁美洲并非如此：被征服支持的准军事集团杀害的数百名学生被认为只是委内瑞拉的内政，尽管该国加入了所有地区国际人权法机构。

column1: And no outside mediation is feasible without a minimum of censure or criticism of Maduro’s extremism, even if the opposition takes its lumps, too, for some of its factions’ radical, occasionally subversive stances.
column2: 而任何外部调停都会遭到马杜罗极端主义的谴责和抨击，尽管反对派也在忍气吞声，因为反对派的一些派系持有激进的破坏性立场。

column1: Paradoxically, whereas the Western powers are probably powerless in Ukraine, Latin America’s major players could exert great influence in Venezuela.
column2: 矛盾的是，西方强国或许在乌克兰问题上无能为力，但拉丁美洲大国可以向委内瑞拉施加很大的影响力。

column1: Economic sanctions on Russia may eventually hurt, and the Kremlin may desist from further encroachment; but the Ukrainian crisis is largely impervious, in the short term, to outside involvement.
column2: 对俄罗斯的经济制裁或许最终会形成伤害，克里姆林宫可能停止进一步的侵略；但乌克兰危机在短期几乎不可能由外部干预。

column1: In Venezuela, the danger is just as great for everybody, and addressing it is much cheaper and easier.
column2: 委内瑞拉的危险不下于乌克兰，而解决委内瑞拉问题比乌克兰成本低得多，也容易得多。

column1: But doing so requires what most Latin American governments sorely lack: vision and courage.
column2: 但解决委内瑞拉问题需要大部分拉丁美洲国家非常欠缺的东西：远见和勇气。

column1: Brazil’s Cautious Voters
column2: 巴西的谨慎选民

column1: MEXICO CITY – Brazil has been in the global spotlight this year, and not always for the right reasons.
column2: 墨西哥城—今年以来，巴西一直是全球的焦点，不过原因并不总是光彩的。

column1: Following the 2013 riots over the amount of money being spent on the 2014 soccer World Cup, protests continued up to, and even during, the tournament in June.
column2: 继2013年爆发针对2014年世界杯花费太多问题的骚乱后，示威活动一直持续到6月份，甚至世界杯举办期间都没有停息。

column1: There were dire – though ultimately misplaced – predictions about chaotic conditions for participants, and then, of course, the catastrophic performance of the home team.
column2: 关于参赛者情况混乱的悲观预言时不时出现 — — 尽管最终被证明是杞人忧天，当然还有随后东道主噩梦般的表现。

column1: Now, the costs of the soccer jamboree, coming on top of the country’s ongoing economic slowdown, are coming home to roost.
column2: 如今，足球狂欢的代价开始显露，令正处于经济减速中的巴西雪上加霜。

column1: Several analysts have concluded that Brazil’s bubble has burst, and that the so-called “country of the future” will remain stuck in the present.
column2: 一些分析师认为巴西的泡沫已经破裂，所谓的“未来之国”将依然困顿于当下。

column1: Economic uncertainty is also dramatically affecting Brazilian politics.
column2: 经济不确定性也在大大地影响着巴西政治。

column1: And a once placid, even predictable, presidential election campaign has been thrown into disarray by the death of the Brazilian Socialist Party candidate, Eduardo Campos, in an airplane crash in August.
column2: 而曾经平稳甚至可预期的总统选战因为8月份社会党（Socialist Party）候选人爱德华多·坎波斯（Eduardo Campos）飞机失事遇难而变得扑朔迷离。

column1: Campos’s running mate, Marina Silva, was then nominated to take his place.
column2: 随后，坎波斯的竞选搭档玛琳娜·席尔瓦（Marina Silva）被提名为候选人顶替坎波斯。

column1: A presidential candidate four years ago who ran on a green, socially conservative, but strongly pro-democratic platform, Silva received nearly 20 million votes.
column2: 席尔瓦四年前就是总统候选人，经营着一个绿色、社会保守但坚定支持民主的平台。 她获得了近2,000万选票。

column1: Her ties to Brazil’s huge evangelical churches, and her unwillingness to break with them on issues such as abortion, same-sex marriage, and drug policy, alienate many voters.
column2: 她与巴西庞大的福音教派的关系，以及她的不愿与他们在堕胎、同性婚姻和毒品政策等问题上决裂让她失去了许多选票。

column1: Nonetheless, she has rapidly overtaken Aécio Neves, the Social Democratic Party (PSDB) candidate, as the main challenger to Dilma Rousseff, the incumbent President and Workers’ Party (PT) candidate.
column2: 尽管如此，他很快就超过了社会民主党（Social Democratic Party）候选人艾西奥·尼维斯（Aécio Neves ） ， 成为现任总统、工党（Worker’s Party）候选人罗塞夫的主要挑战者。

column1: A run-off between the two women, following the October 5th first round, seems inevitable, as opinion polls give neither close to 50% of the vote.
column2: 在10月5日的首轮投票后，两位女性之间的斗争看起来已是不可避免，因为民调显示两人都不太可能获得50%的选票。

column1: Though competent and tough, Rousseff faces voter fatigue after 12 years of PT rule, which many will remember, perhaps unfairly, for corruption scandals and the national team’s 7-1 drubbing by Germany in this year’s World Cup.
column2: 罗塞夫有能力也有韧劲，但她面临着工党执政十二年后的选民疲劳，许多人能记住的（尽管这不太公平）也许只有腐败丑闻以及巴西国家队在世界杯上被德国队以7比1血洗。

column1: But it is the government’s dismal economic record over the past four years that is causing the biggest problems for Rousseff’s campaign.
column2: 但过去四年政府拙劣的经济记录才是影响罗塞夫选情的最大问题。

column1: At the same time, Silva will not be able to win the run-off without an enthusiastic and persuasive endorsement from Neves and the PSDB.
column2: 与此同时，如果没有尼维斯和社会民主党的既热情又有说服力的支持，席尔瓦也无法胜出。

column1: Fortunately for Silva, the PSDB is highly critical of the PT administration, especially the foreign policy of Rousseff’s predecessor, Luis Inácio Lula da Silva.
column2: 对席尔瓦而言，幸运的是社会民主党对工党政府持严厉批判态度，特别是对罗塞夫前任卢拉的外交政策。

column1: PSDB-allied diplomats and former senior officials strongly have opposed the PT’s support for Latin America’s authoritarian regimes (particularly in Cuba and Venezuela), its futile insistence on a permanent seat on the United Nations Security Council, and its excessive embrace of non-aligned, anti-imperialist positions.
column2: 社会民主党阵营的外交官和前高级官员强烈反对工党对拉丁美洲极权政权（特别是古巴和委内瑞拉）的支持、对联合国安理会常任理事国席位徒劳无益的执着以及对不结盟反帝国主义立场的过分坚守。

column1: A Silva victory would herald change in domestic and foreign policy alike.
column2: 席尔瓦的胜利将预示着国内和外交政策的变化。

column1: But perhaps its most remarkable impact would be cultural.
column2: 但也许最令人瞩目的影响在于文化。

column1: Though she would not be the first woman president (Rousseff broke the gender barrier) or the first from humble origins (Lula broke that taboo), she would be the first mulatto – darker-skinned than traditional Brazilian political leaders – to hold the office.
column2: 尽管她不是第一任女总统（罗塞夫打破了性别壁垒 ） ， 也不是第一任出身卑微的总统（卢拉打破了这一禁忌 ） ， 但她将是第一任混血总统 — — 比传统巴西政治领袖肤色更深。

column1: Just as Lula’s 2002 election signified a sea of change in a highly class-conscious, socially stratified society, Silva’s election would shake up the racial order in a country – and indeed continent – where racism has not been eradicated.
column2: 正如2002年卢拉的当选预示着一个具有高度阶级意识、阶层分化明显的社会的大转变，席尔瓦的当选将颠覆这个至今仍未消灭种族主义的国家 — — 事实上是大陆 — — 的种族秩序。

column1: Indeed, in a country that has been proud of its supposedly non-racist nature, there has been no Afro-Brazilian politician of significant stature for a century.
column2: 事实上，在这个以自称的不带种族色彩特征为豪的国家，一百年来从未有非洲裔巴西人政治家赢得崇高地位。

column1: Despite the excitement aroused by her candidacy, however, Silva is unlikely to win.
column2: 尽管席尔瓦成为候选人引起了高涨的热情，但席尔瓦获胜可能性很小。

column1: Since Latin America’s democratization in the 1980s, only two incumbents have lost – Daniel Ortega in Nicaragua (who was not really elected the first time) and Hipólito Mejía in the Dominican Republic.
column2: 自20世纪80年代拉丁美洲开始民主化以来，只有两位在任者输掉了选举 — — 尼加拉瓜的奥尔特加（他第一次也不是真正靠选举上台的）和多米尼加共和国的梅西亚。

column1: More than a dozen incumbents have won re-election, more or less democratically.
column2: 十多位在任者都或多或少地通过民主方式赢得了连任。

column1: The incumbent’s advantage in Latin America owes much to the feeble regulations restricting the government’s use of the state apparatus for campaign purposes.
column2: 拉丁美洲的在任者之所以获得如此优势，很大程度上是因为对政府动用国家机器为竞选造势的限制很小。

column1: The scope for abuse of power, public money, the media, and most state institutions available to sitting presidents makes it almost impossible to defeat them.
column2: 在任总统可以大规模滥用权力、公共资金、媒体和大部分国家机构，这使得他们几乎不可战胜。

column1: Ultimately, Brazilians may just be too unsure about handing power to Silva, who has become a media phenomenon but remains an unknown quantity.
column2: 最终，巴西人或许无法下定决心将权力交给席尔瓦 — — 尽管她已经成为媒体的宠儿，但资质仍有待观察。

column1: Rousseff will probably be re-elected, not so much on the strength of her record as because voters fear the unfamiliar.
column2: 罗塞夫也许能够连任 — — 与其说因为她的执政记录，不如说因为选民害怕不熟悉的对象。

column1: That would be a pity.
column2: 这将是一件憾事。

column1: After all, most new political challengers appear unprepared for the top job until they are in power.
column2: 毕竟，大部分新政治挑战者在赢得权力之前都没有做好问鼎最高宝座的准备。

column1: But Brazilians may feel that they have already broken enough political barriers and taboos in recent years, and that Silva would represent one too many.
column2: 但巴西人也许觉得近几年中他们已经打破了足够多的政治禁忌，少一个席尔瓦无关紧要。

column1: Mexico’s Second Revolution
column2: 墨西哥的二次革命

column1: MEXICO CITY – Mexico, a stagnant and violence-plagued country in recent years, finally began to overcome its malaise in 2013, thanks to an activist president and a coalition of political parties determined to move the country forward.
column2: 墨西哥城 — — 多亏身为政党活动家的总统和决心推动国家进步的政党，近年来经济停滞、饱受暴力之困的国家​​墨西哥终于开始在2013年走出低迷境况。

column1: But, alongside substantive changes, there is considerable uncertainty and hyperbole.
column2: 但在出现实质性变化的同时也不乏不确定和夸张。

column1: It could hardly be otherwise.
column2: 几乎肯定会出现这种现象。

column1: The situation resembles that of 20 years ago – almost to the day.
column2: 现在的情况与20年前何其相似 — — 几乎就是20年前的同一天。

column1: When the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) among Mexico, Canada, and the United States entered into force on January 1, 1994, it seemed that Mexico was poised for a true takeoff.
column2: 1994年1月1日墨西哥、加拿大和美国达成北美自由贸易协定（NAFTA）时，墨西哥似乎正面临着真正的腾飞。

column1: But a series of events – the Zapatista uprising in Chiapas, the assassinations of a presidential candidate and the incoming president’s chief aide, and the collapse of the currency – shook Mexico that year, underscoring the depth of the challenges it faced.
