column2: 但之后发生的一系列事件 — — 恰帕斯州爆发萨帕塔起义、总统候选人及其即将上任的首席助理被暗杀再加之货币崩溃 — — 那一年的系列事件沉重打击了墨西哥，并凸显出这个国家所面临的挑战。

column1: NAFTA brought with it a spectacular increase in Mexican exports, as well as a dramatic shift in their composition.
column2: 北美自由贸易协定不仅令墨西哥出口显著增加，还使出口构成发生了戏剧性的改变。

column1: But it proved to be a great disappointment in terms of foreign investment inflows and economic growth, which has averaged 2.6% per year over the last two decades – slower than Peru, Chile, Colombia, Brazil, and Uruguay.
column2: 但在外资流入及经济增长领域该协定的效果却令人失望。 20年来墨西哥2.6%的年均增长率排在秘鲁、智利、哥伦比亚、巴西和乌拉圭之后。

column1: As a result, Mexico’s income gap with the US and Canada has barely narrowed.
column2: 结果是墨西哥与美国加拿大的收入差距几乎没有缩小。

column1: Thus, President Enrique Peña Nieto’s task since taking office one year ago has been to ensure that the promise of major change in Mexico finally translates into sustained economic growth, improved living standards, and faster convergence with the US and Canada.
column2: 因此，总统恩里克·佩尼亚·涅托上任一年来的任务是确保墨西哥发生重大变革的承诺最终带来经济持续增长、人民生活水平提高以及加速追赶美国和加拿大。

column1: While both the foreign and local press refer generally to “reforms,” or lump together education, labor, financial, fiscal, energy, telecommunications, and political reforms, there are significant differences among them.
column2: 虽然国外和当地媒体都爱谈论“改革 ” ， 也称为教育、劳动、金融、财政、能源、电信和政治等领域的综合改革，但他们之间却有着非常显著的差别。

column1: Some consider all of the changes that have taken place in Mexico this year to be equally important.
column2: 有人认为今年墨西哥方方面面的改革同等重要。

column1: Others have mused that Peña Nieto’s administration sometimes seems intent on announcing reforms, regardless of their content, the time necessary to implement them, or their actual impact on Mexican society.
column2: 还有人认为佩尼亚·涅托内阁有时似乎着意于宣布改革，但却忽略了改革内容、推进时间或改革对墨西哥社会的实际影响。

column1: In fact, a clear distinction can be drawn between two subsets of legislative achievements: those that, while not meaningless, are incomplete, superficial, or essentially maintain the status quo, and those that will change Mexico (if all goes well).
column2: 事实上，立法成就可以明确划分为两个部分：一部分虽然并非毫无意义，但改革内容片面、肤浅、或者说从本质上维持现状，而如果一切进展顺利，另一部分则能让墨西哥的现状发生变化。

column1: The changes in how teachers are evaluated and their labor rights (wrongly described as an education reform), together with changes to tax and telecommunications legislation, belong to the first category; energy and political reforms belong to the second.
column2: 教师评估方式及其劳工权利（错误地被描述为教育改革）改革连同税收和电信法规改革均属于第一大类；而能源和政治改革则属于后者。

column1: Energy reform opens up electricity generation and oil exploration, extraction, and refining to private foreign or domestic investment through licenses, concessions, production sharing, or profit sharing.
column2: 能源改革借助许可、特许、产品分成或利润共享等方式向国外私营及国内投资公司开放发电、石油勘探、开采和冶炼业务。

column1: The oil workers’ union has been banished from the board of directors of Pemex, the national oil company, and new contracts for shale oil and gas, together with deep-water prospecting and drilling, will be signed with a government agency, not with Pemex.
column2: 石油工人工会已被逐出墨西哥石油公司（Pemex）董事会，很快就将与政府机构、而非墨西哥石油公司签订新的页岩油气及深海勘察钻探合同。

column1: Once the myriad legal and political obstacles are cleared, Mexico will be able to increase oil and gas production, drive down the price of electricity, and stimulate growth in an otherwise lethargic economy. One hopes that 12 years of obstruction by Peña Nieto’s Institutional Revolutionary Party (PRI) will not mean that these reforms are too little, too late.
column2: 一旦多如牛毛的法律及政治障碍得以清除，墨西哥就能增加石油天然气产量、压低电价并刺激死气沉沉的经济���人们希望佩尼亚·涅托的革命制度党（PRI）12年来的阻挠不会使上述改革来得太少太迟。

column1: The second crucial reform is political.
column2: 第二次关键改革是在政治领域。

column1: For the first time since the early 1920’s, Mexican legislators and mayors will be allowed to seek reelection to consecutive terms.
column2: 20世纪20年代以来，墨西哥议员和市长将首次被允许寻求竞选连任。

column1: While no panacea, reelection is one of the most important instruments of accountability in a democracy, and Mexico has been deprived of it for nearly a century.
column2: 虽然没有包治百病的灵丹妙药，但连任是民主国家责任制的重要工具，而连任在墨西哥已经近一个世纪不被允许。

column1: The same is true of ballot initiatives, referenda, and independent candidacies, all of which were non-existent until the recent reform.
column2: 类似的还有公民投票、全民公决和独立候选人制度，直到最近这次改革之前根本不存在这些民主工具。

column1: For the first time since Mexico left behind 70 years of authoritarian rule, the country has a political and electoral framework that resembles those found in all modern democracies.
column2: 在长达70年的专制统治后，民主国家所具备的政治和选举架构首次在墨西哥建立。

column1: Both reforms are incomplete and may not be sufficient to jump-start the economy and mobilize a singularly passive civil society.
column2: 这两次改革都还没有完成，或许不足以启动经济发展和动员消极被动的民间团体。

column1: Because Pemex, unlike the Brazilian and Colombian state-owned oil companies, will not be listed on the New York or Mexico City stock exchanges, internal reform will be postponed or half-baked.
column2: 墨西哥石油公司不像巴西和哥伦比亚的国有石油公司那样可以在纽约或墨西哥城证券交易所上市，因此可能导致其内部改革有些草率和延迟。

column1: Moreover, it will be years before any oil actually begins to flow from the deep waters of the Gulf of Mexico, and how much shale oil and gas actually exists in northeastern Mexico is unknown.
column2: 此外，墨西哥湾深海水域开始实际产油可能还需要等几年，而且墨西哥东北部页岩油气的蕴藏量也依然是未知数。

column1: Nor is it certain that foreign investment (or tourism) will increase, given the country’s current levels of violence, crime, and human-rights violations.
column2: 鉴于墨西哥目前的暴力、犯罪和侵犯人权行为，外资（或旅游）的增加也具有不确定性。

column1: Likewise, restrictions and ambiguities continue to plague the institutional arrangements sought by the framers of the country’s political and electoral reforms.
column2: 同样，限制和歧义继续困扰着该国政治及选举改革策划者的制度安排。

column1: Reelection is permitted only for candidates nominated by the same party for which they originally ran, and the enabling legislation for independent candidates, ballot initiatives, and referenda remains unclear.
column2: 只有代表最初提名政党竞选的候选人才被允许竞选连任，独立候选人、公民投票和全民公决的授权法律仍不甚明确。

column1: Most important, the government appears to be backtracking on a commitment to allow a binding referendum on the opening of the oil sector and other “transcendent” issues.
column2: 最重要的是，政府似乎背弃了一项允许就石油部门开放及其他“超验”问题进行决定性公投的承诺。

column1: Its reluctance is understandable, because voters are evenly divided on the issue, and no one will invest a cent in Mexican oil or gas if the recently approved constitutional amendment on Pemex can be overturned in 2015, as the opposition claims will happen.
column2: 政府勉为其难的态度可以理解，因为选民在这个问题上的态度几乎平分秋色，如果不久前批准的墨西哥石油公司宪法修正案真能如反对派所言在2015年被推翻，那么没有人愿意对墨西哥的石油天然气进行一分钱的投资。

column1: But curtailing democracy in order to modernize the energy sector is not a good idea.
column2: 但为实现能源现代化而遏制民主也不是一个好主意。

column1: Finally, skepticism persists with regard to the Mexican economy’s capacity to achieve sustainable 4-5% annual economic growth – the bare minimum needed to ensure long-term prosperity.
column2: 最后，很多人仍然怀疑墨西哥经济能否持续实现4-5%的年度经济增长 — — 这样的增长速度是确保长期繁荣所必须的。

column1: Deficient education, infrastructure, security, and courts, together with endemic corruption and scant entrepreneurial dynamism, militate against excessive optimism.
column2: 妨碍过度乐观的包括教育、基础设施、安全及法律资源短缺，再加上地方腐败和缺乏创业活力。

column1: NAFTA 20 years ago, and Peña Nieto’s reforms now, are necessary but insufficient conditions for progress.
column2: 20年前的北美自由贸易协定和今天的佩尼亚·涅托改革都是进步的必要而非充分条件。

column1: More is needed, and what is needed is not necessarily attainable.
column2: 进步需要付出更多努力，而需要的东西并不一定能成为现实。

column1: The Middle East and the Return of History
column2: 中东和历史的回归

column1: BERLIN – Ever since Francis Fukuyama argued, more than two decades ago, that the world had reached the end of history, history has made the world hold its breath.
column2: 柏林—自二十年前弗朗西斯·福山（Francis Fukuyama）提出世界已达到历史的终结以来，历史便让世界扼住了它的呼吸。

column1: China’s rise, the Balkan wars, the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001, the wars in Afghanistan and Iraq, the global financial crisis of 2008, the “Arab Spring,” and the Syrian civil war all belie Fukuyama’s vision of the inevitable triumph of liberal democracy.
column2: 中国崛起、巴尔干战争、2011年9月11日恐怖袭击、阿富汗和伊拉克战争、2008年全球金融危机 、 “ 阿拉伯之春”以及叙利亚内战都与福山所看到的自由民主的胜利不可阻挡的趋势背道而驰。

column1: In fact, history could be said to have come full circle in the space of a quarter-century, from the fall of communism in Europe in 1989 to renewed confrontation between Russia and the West.
column2: 事实上，从1989年欧洲共产主义失败到俄罗斯和西方冲突重燃，可以说历史在四分之一个世纪的时间里完成了一个完整的循环。

column1: But it is in the Middle East that history is at work on a daily basis and with the most dramatic consequences.
column2: 但在中东，历史每一天都在发挥作用，并产生最具戏剧性的结果。

column1: The old Middle East, formed out of the remains of the Ottoman Empire after World War I, is clearly falling apart, owing, in no small part, to America’s actions in this conflict-prone region.
column2: 由一战后的奥斯曼帝国诸部组成的旧中东显然已经分崩离析，其中美国在这个冲突频发地区的行为要占很大原因。

column1: The United States’ original sin was its military invasion of Iraq in 2003 under President George W. Bush.
column2: 美国的原罪是小布什总统在2003年发动的入侵伊拉克的战争。

column1: The “neoconservatives” in power at the time were oblivious to the need to fill the power vacuum both in Iraq and the region following the removal of Saddam Hussein.
column2: 当时掌权的“新保守派”忘却了填补伊拉克和中东地区在推翻萨达姆·侯赛因后留下的权力真空的需要。

column1: President Barack Obama’s hasty, premature military withdrawal constituted a second US failure.
column2: 奥巴马总统的撤军也操之过急，构成了美国的第二个失败。

column1: America’s withdrawal, nearly coinciding with the outbreak of the Arab Spring and the eruption of the Syrian civil war, and its persistent passivity as the regional force for order, now threatens to lead to the disintegration of Iraq, owing to the rapid advance of the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, including its capture of the country’s second-largest city, Mosul.
column2: 美国的撤军与阿拉伯之春和叙利亚内战的爆发几乎同时，而其作为地区秩序维持力量所表现出来的持续的消极性如今有可能导致伊拉克分裂 — — 伊拉克和叙利亚伊斯兰国（ISIS）迅速崛起，并且已经打下了伊拉克第二大城市摩苏尔。

column1: Indeed, with ISIS in control of most of the area northwest of Baghdad, the border between Iraq and Syria has essentially ceased to exist.
column2: 事实上，ISIS已经控制了巴格达西北的大部分地区，伊拉克和叙利亚的边境实际上已不复存在。

column1: Many of their neighbors’ borders may also be redrawn by force.
column2: 两国的邻国边界也有可能被武力重新勾画。

column1: An already massive humanitarian disaster seems certain to become worse.
column2: 已然爆发的大规模人道主义灾难几乎肯定会继续恶化。

column1: Should ISIS succeed in establishing a permanent state-like entity in parts of Iraq and Syria, the disintegration of the region would accelerate, the US would lose its “global war on terror,” and world peace would be seriously threatened.
column2: 如果ISIS成功地在伊拉克和叙利亚诸部建立永久的类似国家的实体，那么中东地区分崩离析之势将会加速，美国将输掉“全球反恐战争 ” ， 世界和平也将受到严重威胁。

column1: But even without an ISIS terror state, the situation remains extremely unstable, because the Syrian civil war is proving to be highly contagious.
column2: 但即使没有ISIS恐怖主义国家，局面也非常不稳，因为叙利亚内战极有可能会蔓延开去。

column1: In fact, “civil war” is a misnomer, because events there have long entailed a struggle between Saudi Arabia and Iran for regional predominance, powered by the age-old conflict between Islam’s Sunni majority and Shia minority.
column2: 事实上，���叙利亚冲突是“内战”有些不妥，因为叙利亚局势长期以来一直包含着沙特阿拉伯与伊朗的地区主宰权斗争，而其背后则是历史悠久的伊斯兰教逊尼派多数和什叶派少数之间的冲突。

column1: The Kurds form another unstable component of the Ottoman legacy.
column2: 库尔德人构成了奥斯曼帝国昔日领土上的另一个不稳定因素。

column1: Divided among several Middle Eastern countries – Iran, Iraq, Syria, and Turkey – the Kurds have been fighting for their own state for decades.
column2: 库尔德人散布于多个中东国家 — — 伊朗、伊拉克、叙利亚和土耳其 — — 几十年来一直在为建立自己的国家而斗争。

column1: Nonetheless, they have shown great restraint in northern Iraq since Saddam’s fall, contenting themselves with building up their autonomous province both economically and politically – to the point that it is independent in all but name, with a strong and experienced army in the Peshmerga militia.
column2: 尽管如此，自萨达姆倒台以来，他们在伊拉克北部表现出极大的克制，满足于建立经济和政治上的自治省 — — 即获得除表面名义之外的所有独立实质，包括一支强大且经验丰富的自由斗士（Peshmerga）军。

column1: The advance of ISIS and its capture of Mosul have now resolved, in one fell swoop, all territorial disputes between the central government and the Kurdish regional government in favor of the latter, particularly regarding the city of Kirkuk.
column2: 如今，ISIS的崛起以及拿下摩苏尔以秋风扫落叶之势解决了伊拉克中央政府与库尔德地区政府之间的领土纠纷，库尔德人大获全胜，特别是在基尔库克（Kirkuk ） 。

column1: Following the Iraqi army’s retreat, the Peshmerga promptly took over the city, giving the Kurdish north ample oil and gas reserves.
column2: 在伊拉克军队撤出后，自由斗士军马上占领了该市，给北部库尔德人地区带来充足的石油和天然气储备。

column1: Moreover, neighboring Iran and Turkey, as well as the US, will urgently need the Peshmerga’s support against ISIS.
column2: 此外，相邻的伊朗和土耳其以及美国都迫切需要自由斗士军支持对抗ISIS。

column1: Thus, an unexpected window of opportunity has opened for the Kurds to achieve full independence, though their dependence on good relations with both Turkey and Iran for access to global markets will moderate their political ambitions.
column2: 因此，库尔德人获得了一个意料之外的获得完全独立的机会窗口，尽管他们必须与土耳其和伊朗搞好关系才能进入全球市场的局面制约了他们的政治雄心。

column1: Moreover, with its invasion of Iraq, the US opened the door to regional hegemony for Iran and initiated a dramatic shift in its own regional alliances, the long-term effects of which – including the current nuclear negotiations with the Iranian government – are now becoming apparent.
column2: 此外，在入侵伊拉克的过程中，美国开启伊朗的地区霸权之门，也给其地区盟友带来了剧变，长期影响 — — 包括目前与伊朗政府进行的核谈判 — — 正在日益显现。

column1: Both sides are fighting the same jihadists, who are supported by America’s supposed allies, the Sunni-ruled Gulf states.
column2: 双方在打同一批圣战主义者，而后者得到了美国的盟友 — — 海湾逊尼派国家的支持。

column1: Though the US and Iran remain opposed to official cooperation, the wheels have been set in motion, with direct bilateral talks becoming routine.
column2: 尽管美国和伊朗仍然反对正式合作，但车轮已经在转动，直接双边谈判已成为常态。

column1: One key question for the future is whether Jordan, which plays a key function in the region’s equilibrium, will survive the geopolitical shifts unscathed.
column2: 关于未来的一个关键问题是在地区均衡中扮演关键角色的约旦是否能在地缘政治变化中安然无恙。

column1: If it does not, the entire balance of power in the traditional Middle East conflict between Israel and the Palestinians could collapse.
column2: 如果答案是否定的，那么整个以色列-巴勒斯坦传统中东冲突实力平衡将崩溃。

column1: The consequences would most likely be far-reaching, if difficult to assess in advance.
column2: 后果的影响难以估量，但很有可能极为深远。

column1: For Europe, developments in the Middle East pose two major risks: returning jihadi fighters who threaten to bring the terror with them, and a spillover of their extremist ideas to parts of the Balkans.
column2: 对欧洲来说，中东发展趋势带来了两大风险：圣战主义者带着恐怖主义卷土重来；以及他们的极端思想蔓延到巴尔干地区。

column1: In the interest of their own security, the European Union and its member states will be compelled to pay much closer attention to southeastern Europe than they have until now.
column2: 处于自身安全利益，欧盟及其成员国将被迫比如今更紧密地关注东南欧。

column1: Putin’s Reality Check for Europe
column2: 普京的欧洲现实检验

column1: BERLIN – For far too long, the West has harbored illusions about Vladimir Putin’s Russia – illusions that have now been shattered on the Crimean peninsula.
column2: 柏林—长久以来，西方一直对普京的俄罗斯抱有幻想 — — 如今，这一幻想在克里米亚半岛被一举击碎。

column1: The West could (and should) have known better: Ever since his first term in office as Russian president, Putin’s strategic objective has been to rebuild Russia’s status as a global power.
column2: 西方本可以（也应该）更好地知道，自第一次任俄罗斯总统以来，普京的战略目标就一直是重塑俄罗斯全球霸权的地位。

column1: To this end, Putin used Russia’s energy exports to recover gradually the territories lost when the Soviet Union collapsed a generation ago.
column2: 在这方面，普京用俄罗斯的能源出口逐渐恢复了二十五年前苏联解体造成的领土损失。

column1: Ukraine has been at the heart of this strategy, because, without it, the aim of a revived Russia is unachievable.
column2: 乌克兰是这一战略的核心，因为没有乌克兰，复苏的俄罗斯就无法实现其目标。

column1: So Crimea was just the first target; the next will be eastern Ukraine and persistent destabilization of the country as a whole.
column2: 因此克里米亚只是第一个目标；下一个将是乌克兰东部以及乌克兰作为一个整体国家的永久动荡。

column1: Before our eyes, the post-Soviet international system in Eastern Europe, the Caucasus, and Central Asia is being overthrown.
column2: 在我们眼里，东欧、高加索和中亚的后苏联时代国际体系正在被推翻。

column1: Nineteenth-century concepts of international order, based on zero-sum balance-of-power considerations and spheres of interest, are threatening to supersede modern norms of national self-determination, the inviolability of borders, the rule of law, and the fundamental principles of democracy.
column2: 十九世纪的国际秩序概念 — — 以零和实力平衡考虑和利益圈为基础 — — 有可能正在取代国家自决权的现代范式、国界的不可侵犯性、法治精神以及民主的基本原则。

column1: As a result, this upheaval will have a massive impact on Europe and its relations with Russia, for it will determine whether Europeans live by twenty-first-century rules.
column2: 结果，乌克兰剧变将对欧洲及其对俄关系造成巨大影响，因为它将决定欧洲是否能生活在二十一世纪的规则下。

column1: Those who believe that the West can adapt to Russian behavior, as Putin’s Western apologists suggest, risk contributing to further strategic escalation, because a soft approach will merely embolden the Kremlin.
column2: 有人（如普京的西方辩护者）认为西方可以适应俄罗斯的行为，这有可能导致进一步的战略升级，因为软方针只能让克里姆林宫变本加厉。

column1: Indeed, whether or not its leaders acknowledge it, the European Union is now in direct conflict with Russia over its enlargement policy since the end of the Cold War.
column2: 事实上，不管其领导人是否承认，如今欧盟自冷战结束以来的扩大政策已经与俄罗斯形成了直接冲突。

column1: That is because Russia’s re-emergence as a global power requires not just the reintegration of lost Soviet territories, but also direct access to Europe and a dominant role there, especially in Eastern Europe.
column2: 正因如此，俄罗斯重新崛起为全球霸权不但需要重获失去的苏联领土，还需要进军欧洲并在欧洲起到主导作用，特别是在东欧。

column1: So a fundamental strategic struggle is now a given.
column2: 因此，基本战略斗争现在已经开始了。

column1: From a Western perspective, willful confrontation makes little sense, because the EU and Russia are and will continue to be neighbors.
column2: 从西方角度看，故意对抗是毫无意义的，因为欧盟和俄罗斯现在是、将来也是邻居。

column1: Looking ahead, Russia will need the EU even more than vice versa, because in its Far East and in Central Asia, China is emerging as a rival of entirely different dimensions.
column2: 放眼未来，俄罗斯需要欧盟更甚于欧盟需要俄罗斯，因为在远东和中亚，中国正在崛起为一个各方面完全不同的对手。

column1: Moreover, Russia’s rapid demographic decline and enormous modernization deficit imply the need for a joint future with Europe.
column2: 此外，俄罗斯人口的快速下降以及巨大的现代化赤字意味着它的未来与欧洲息息相关。

column1: But seizing this opportunity is possible only on the basis of the rule of law, not of force, and must be guided by the principles of democracy and national self-determination, not great-power politics.
column2: 但要抓住这一机会必须建立在法治精神而不是武力的基础上，并且必须以民主原则和国家自决权而不是实力政治为指导。

column1: Instead, Putin has now triggered a lasting crisis.
column2: 相反，普京已经触发了持续危机。

column1: The West’s response will be a new containment policy, mainly taking the form of economic and diplomatic measures.
column2: 西方的反应是新的遏制政策，即采取经济和外交手段。

column1: Europe will reduce its energy dependence on Russia, review its strategic alignment and priorities, and scale back investment and bilateral cooperation.
column2: 欧洲将降低其对俄罗斯的能源依赖，重新审视其战略一致性和低昂务之急，并收回投资和双边合作。

column1: In the short term, Putin seems to have greater leverage, but the weakness of his position will soon become apparent.
column2: 在短期，似乎是普京尽占上风，但他的处境的弱点很快就会暴露。

column1: Russia is completely dependent, economically and politically, on its commodity and energy exports, which go primarily to Europe.
column2: 俄罗斯在经济上和政治上完全依赖于其大宗商品和能源出口，而主要出口地就是欧洲。

column1: Lower European demand and an oil price that no longer suffices to sustain Russia’s budget stand to hobble the Kremlin very quickly.
column2: 欧洲需求的减少和无法充分支持俄罗斯预算的油价必将很快让克里姆林宫深感掣肘。

column1: Indeed, there is reason to believe that Putin may have overplayed his hand.
column2: 事实上，有理由认为普京的做法已经过犹不及。

column1: The collapse of the Soviet Union at the beginning of the 1990’s was caused not by the West, but by a wave of secession, as nationalities and minorities, seeing the party-state weakened, seized the opportunity to break free.
column2: 20世纪90年代初的苏联解体不是西方造成的，而是由一系列脱离造成的，而脱离是因为民主主义者和少数族裔看到了党国已经变弱，于是抓住机会脱离苏联。

column1: Today’s Russia has neither the economic nor the political strength to regain and integrate the lost Soviet territories, and any attempt by Putin to press on with his plan would impoverish its people and lead to further disintegration – a bleak prospect.
column2: 如今，俄罗斯在经济上和政治上都没有强到可以重新获得并统一失去的苏联领土的程度，而普京计划的实施将让俄罗斯人民陷入贫穷，造成进一步的离心离德 — — 前景黯淡。

column1: Europeans have reason to be worried, and they now have to face the fact that the EU is not just a common market – a mere economic community – but a global player, a cohesive political unit with shared values and common security interests.
column2: 欧洲有理由担忧，并且现在不得不面对一个现实，即欧盟不仅仅是一个共同市场，一个经济共同体，它也是一个全球行动者，一个团结的、拥有共同价值和安全利益的政治单元。

column1: Europe’s strategic and normative interests have thus re-emerged with a vengeance; in fact, Putin has managed, almost singlehandedly, to invigorate NATO with a new sense of purpose.
column2: 欧洲的战略和规范利益因此意外地重新浮现；事实上，普京几乎凭借一己之力让北约有了新的使命感。

column1: The EU will have to understand that it is not acting in a vacuum in its eastern and southern neighborhood, and that, for the sake of its own security interests, the conflicting interests of other powers there cannot simply be ignored or, worse, accepted.
column2: 欧盟需要认识到它不是在东部和南部周边真空中行动，并且出于其自身安全利益考虑，那里的其他大国的冲突利益绝不容忽视（甚至不容接受 ） 。

column1: The EU’s enlargement policy is not merely some expensive, expendable annoyance; it is a vital component of the EU’s security and outward projection of power.
column2: 欧盟的扩张政策并不只是一些昂贵、消耗性质的聒噪；而是欧盟安全和外向实力工程的关键要素。

column1: Safety comes with a price tag.
column2: 安全是有代价的。

column1: Perhaps now there will be a reassessment in the United Kingdom of the costs of an EU exit.
column2: 或许如今英国将重新评估退出欧盟的代价。

column1: And maybe there will be a realization on the Continent that European unification must move forward more quickly, because the world – and Europe’s neighborhood in particular – has turned out to be not as peaceful as many, above all the Germans, perceived it to be.
column2: 也许欧洲大陆将意识到欧洲统一必须更快地向前迈进，因为世界 — — 特别是欧洲周边 — — 并不像许多人（特别是德国人）认为的那样安全。

column1: The EU peace project – the original impetus for European integration – may have worked too well; after more than six decades of success, it had come to be considered hopelessly outdated.
column2: 欧洲安全工程 — — 欧洲一体化的原始动力 — — 可能运转得太好了；在六十多年的成功后，它也许已经彻底过时了。

column1: Putin has provided a reality check.
column2: 普京提供了一次现实检验。

column1: The question of peace in Europe has returned, and it must be answered by a strong and united EU.
column2: 欧洲的和平问题回来了，并且必须由一个强大而统一的欧盟来面对。

column1: The Middle East in the Arab Winter
column2: 阿拉伯冬天里中东

column1: BERLIN – Travel broadens the mind, goes the old saying.
column2: 柏林 — — 古语说：旅行可以开阔思路。

column1: This is especially true for the Middle East.
column2: 这句话尤其适用于中东。

column1: But travel there nowadays can be extremely disorienting; indeed, developments that were impossible to contemplate just a few months ago are becoming reality.
column2: 但今时今日去那里旅行让人异常迷惑；事实上，短短几个月前还无法想象的事态目前正在发生。

column1: The youth revolt that began in Tunis and Cairo in 2010-2011 has come to an end (at least for the time being), though the region has been changed fundamentally by it.
column2: 2010-2011年始于突尼斯和开罗的青年起义已经结束（至少目前暂时结束 ） ， 但这次起义已经彻底改变了中东地区的格局。

column1: The victory of counter-revolution and power politics, as in Egypt, has only seemed to restore the old order; the current regime’s political foundations are simply too brittle.
column2: 埃及反革命及强权政治获胜似乎不过是恢复了旧有的秩序；现政权的政治基础实在过于薄弱。

column1: Equally noticeable has been the permanent shift in the region’s political-strategic axis.
column2: 该地区政治战略轴心的永久性改变同样引人注目。

column1: Iran, with its nuclear and hegemonic ambitions, is the current center, while the old center – the Israeli-Palestinian conflict – has been marginalized, giving rise to entirely new alliances of interests.
column2: 拥有核野心及霸权抱负的伊朗成为当前的核心，而以巴冲突代表的原有核心已经边缘化，缔造出全新的利益联盟。

column1: Saudi Arabia and Israel (which have no formal diplomatic relations) are united against Iran – and against the possibility of a US-Iranian détente.
column2: （并未建立正式外交关系的）沙特和以色列共同反对伊朗 — — 反对美伊关系出现缓和的可能性。

column1: Ideologically, the central conflict between Iran and its neighbors is based on the sectarian conflict between Sunni and Shia Islam.
column2: 意识形态上，逊尼和什叶派穆斯林的教派冲突是伊朗及其邻国核心冲突的起源。

column1: The devastating Syrian civil war is already being fought along these lines; given signs of a military and political stalemate, those lines could become the basis of a permanent division of the country, as in Bosnia.
column2: 由此引发了毁灭性的叙利亚内战；由于已经显露出军事政治僵局的迹象，上述问题可能像在波斯尼亚那样造成国家的永久性分裂。

column1: If this happens, Iraq, Lebanon, and Jordan would not be left unaffected.
column2: 如果这种情况真的出现，伊拉克、黎巴嫩和约旦肯定无法置身事外。

column1: The old Anglo-French Middle East mapped out by the Sykes-Picot Agreement in May 1916 would be gone for good.
column2: 1916年5月赛克斯-皮科协定描绘的英法划界中东的原有格局将一去不复返。

column1: Moreover, the Kurdish issue has reappeared – and could indirectly influence and re-radicalize the Palestinian question.
column2: 另外库尔德问题又再次出现 — — 这可能间接影响到巴勒斯坦问题，导致局面重新激化。

column1: Unfortunately, there is not much evidence that an Israeli-Palestinian settlement based on a two-state solution will preempt this development.
column2: 不幸的是，没有多少证据表明基于双边谈判的以巴方案能够防止这样的情况出现。

column1: Then there is the question of the long-term consequences of Al Qaeda’s rebirth in the form of Sunni jihadism in Syria, Yemen, and North and East Africa.
column2: 再有就是基地组织以逊尼圣战主义的名义在叙利亚、也门、北非和东非地区重生，以及由此带来的长期后果。

column1: The Gulf monarchies are trying to ride this tiger militarily against Iran.
column2: 海湾君主国在与伊朗的军事对抗中已经势成骑虎。

column1: But what will happen when they one day find themselves in the role of the sorcerer’s apprentice?
column2: 如果有一天他们发觉自己扮演了魔法师学徒的角色将会怎样？

column1: Will this fanatical wind blow back to the Arab peninsula?
column2: 这股狂热之风是否将吹回阿拉伯半岛？

column1: And could these societies’ domestic institutions withstand such an attack?
column2: 上述国家的国内机构能否经得起这样的破坏？

column1: Throughout the Middle East, most of the political elite remain trapped within a worldview defined by power politics and nineteenth-century notions of sovereignty.
column2: 中东地区多数政治精英今天仍受到强权政治和十九世纪主权观念造就的世界观的束缚。

column1: Their strategic watchwords are national rivalry, balance, and hegemony – concepts that offer no solution for the future of the region’s nations and states.
column2: 他们的战略口号是国家竞争、平衡和霸权 — — 这些概念无法造就地区民族和国家未来的前途。

column1: Intraregional economic cooperation, which is essential to achieving sustained growth and social development, much less a regional security framework to ensure peace and stability, remains an alien idea.
column2: 迄今为止他们依然对实现持续增长和社会发展、以及确保和平稳定的地区安全架构所必不可少的区域经济合作概念非常生疏。

column1: In essence, the Middle East is experiencing a crisis of modernization.
column2: 中东本质上正在经历一场现代化危机。

column1: The rebellious youth who led popular demands for change are lying low (or have been rounded up); but, given the intellectual paralysis of the region’s rulers (and large parts of the opposition), an even more violent eruption can be expected.
column2: 引领民众改革要求的叛逆的年轻人正在暂避风头（或者遭到围捕 ） ； 但因为地区统治者（和多数反对派）的精神瘫痪，爆发更猛烈的抗议行动是早晚的事。

column1: As in the past, Egypt will play a guiding role for the entire region (whether it wants to or not).
column2: （无论本身情愿与否 ， ） 埃及将一如既往地引领整个地区。

column1: The region’s modernization crisis is being compounded by the partial withdrawal of an exhausted force for order, the United States.
column2: 筋疲力尽的美国维和部队部分撤离加剧了中东地区的现代化危机。

column1: This is fueling tremendous anxiety in the region and has contributed to the overthrow of existing alliances and the search for new ones.
column2: 美国撤军助长了该地区的焦虑情绪，加速了原有联盟的解体和新联盟的构成。

column1: President Barack Obama has ended America’s ruinous wars in Iraq and Afghanistan.
column2: 奥巴马总统结束了美国在伊拉克和阿富汗的毁灭性战争。

column1: Above all, it was the war in Iraq – and thus former President George W. Bush and his neoconservative advisers – that brought Iran to its current position of strategic strength.
column2: 归根结底，让伊朗拥有目前战略地位的恰恰是前总统乔治·W·布什及其新保守主义顾问发动的伊拉克战争。

column1: Yet it is Obama who is now regarded as weak in the Middle East.
column2: 但现在奥巴马却在中东背负软弱的恶名。

column1: Obama is heavily criticized for not having intervened militarily in Syria, even though his threat to do so subsequently forced President Bashar al-Assad’s government to surrender its chemical weapons.
column2: 尽管奥巴马的军事干预威胁后来迫使巴沙尔·阿萨德总统政府交出了化学武器，但他仍因未进行军事干预叙利亚而遭到严厉的批评。

column1: Likewise, far from strengthening Iran further, Obama has pushed the Islamic Republic into a corner by leading the global push for strict economic sanctions.
column2: 同样，由奥巴马发起领导的全球性的严厉经济制裁运动不但遏制了伊朗实力进一步增长，而且迫使伊斯兰共和国陷入困境。

column1: To be sure, many aspects of Obama’s policy in the region are worth criticizing – above all, the defensive attitude with which his administration presents it.
column2: 奥巴马在诸多领域的地区政策无疑都值得探讨 — — 其中尤以美国政府采取防御性态度最值得批评。

column1: But, rather than weakness, what America’s traditional allies in the Middle East fear most is far-reaching change in the status quo.
column2: 但最让美国在中东的传统盟友害怕的却并非软弱，而是当前现状发生意义深远的变革。

column1: And Obama’s policy does indeed appear to be aiming for precisely that: a nuclear détente with Iran, an end to Syria’s civil war by means of a regional security architecture, and a two-state solution to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.
column2: 而奥巴马的政策似乎恰恰以此为目标：在核问题上与伊朗缓和关系、建立区域安全架构结束叙利亚内战和敦促双边解决以巴冲突。

column1: It is a policy that sounds almost utopian, given the enormous inertial force of the region’s problems.
column2: 考虑到区域问题的巨大惯性，这种政策似乎颇有些乌托邦的味道。

column1: But if, against all expectations, Obama succeeds, his accomplishment will be historic.
column2: 但如果奥巴马出人预料地取得了成功，他将取得历史性的成就。

column1: And if he fails?
column2: 可如果他失败呢？

column1: The Middle East will continue its slide into mayhem – perversely befitting the upcoming centenary of World War I’s outbreak.
column2: 中东局势将与近在眼前的一战爆发百周年纪念日极不相称地持续动荡。

column1: Europe’s Act in Ukraine’s Tragedy
column2: 乌克兰悲剧中的欧洲行动

column1: BERLIN – Grand political strategy and everyday experience often have a lot in common.
column2: 柏林 — — 宏观政治战略和日常经验往往有很多共同之处。

column1: Try, for example, to swallow a salami whole, and you will probably choke to death.
column2: 比方说，如果你想吞下一整根意大利香肠，很可能会被噎住。

column1: In the world of high politics, people behave no differently: they slice their salami before consuming it.
column2: 高层政坛的所作所为也非常相似：先把香肠切成片再吃。

column1: If they cannot achieve an objective immediately, they approach it patiently, step by step.
column2: 如果不能马上达到目的，那就耐心地分步行事。

column1: Today, the Kremlin is employing such “salami tactics” vis-à-vis Ukraine.
column2: 今天，克里姆林对乌克兰采取的就是这种“香肠策略 ” 。

column1: Before our eyes, a tragedy in several acts is unfolding, in which the players and their aims are clear.
column2: 一部多幕悲剧正在我们面前上演，演员及其目标都十分明确。

column1: What is not known is how many more acts this sad political spectacle will have, and thus when – and how – it will end.
column2: 我们不知道的是这部政治悲剧还会上演多少幕，因此也不知道它将在什么时候以何种方式结尾。

column1: The first act began in the fall of 2013, when then-Ukrainian President Viktor Yanukovych duped the European Union and its leaders by refusing to sign a long-planned association agreement.
column2: 这部戏的第一幕发生在2013年的秋天，时任乌克兰总统亚努科维奇欺骗了欧盟及其领导人，拒绝签署一份长期策划的入盟协议。

column1: Instead, he chose to have Ukraine enter a customs union with Russia, in exchange for a pile of cash and cheap oil and natural gas.
column2: 相反，他选择让乌克兰加入俄罗斯关税同盟，以换取大笔的现金和廉价的石油天然气。

column1: Russian President Vladimir Putin seemed to have achieved his political aim, namely to bring Ukraine, which had been drifting toward Europe throughout the post-Soviet period, firmly back into the Kremlin’s sphere of influence.
column2: 俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔·普京似乎已实现了自己的政治目的，那就是把整个后苏联时代一直向欧洲靠拢的乌克兰强硬地拉回到克里姆林的势力领域。

column1: The second act was staged by the Ukrainian people, who, in the west of the country and on the Maidan in Kyiv, rebelled against Yanukovych’s effort to align their country more closely with Russia.
column2: 乌克兰民众是第二幕的主角，在乌克兰西部和基辅的独立广场，他们抗议亚努科维奇让乌克兰靠拢俄罗斯的努力。

column1: After three months of protests, the uprising led to Yanukovych’s ouster, temporarily derailing Putin’s plan to vassalize Ukraine peacefully.
column2: 三个月的抗议活动后，民众起义导致亚努科维奇下台，普京和平吞并乌克兰的计划暂时脱轨。

column1: It was not NATO, the EU, or the United States that acted to block Ukraine’s shift eastwards. Yanukovych was chased from power by a significant majority of Ukrainians themselves.
column2: 阻止乌克兰向东靠拢的不是北约、欧盟或者美国，是绝大多数乌克兰民众将亚努科维奇赶到台下。

column1: The third act was born of Putin’s domestic political situation, and resulted in a stopgap solution that led to Russia’s poorly disguised armed invasion, and then annexation, of Crimea.
column2: 普京面临的国内政治局势催生了第三幕，并最终导致了俄罗斯对克里米亚欲盖弥彰的武装入侵和吞并。

column1: Without Crimea’s annexation, Putin faced domestic political disaster and a premature end to his dream of reenacting Ivan the Great’s “gathering of the Russian lands” and restoring Russia’s global power.
column2: 如果不吞并乌克兰，普京将面临国内政治灾难，以及他再次上演伊凡大帝“重整俄国河山”及恢复俄罗斯全球势力梦想的提前终结。

column1: But Putin’s aim has never been Russian control only of Crimea; he has always wanted all of Ukraine, because he fears nothing more than a successful, democratic, modern neighbor that undermines by example the authority of his own “managed democracy.”
column2: 但普京的目标从来不止停留在控制克里米亚；他一直想把乌克兰整个收入囊中，因为他担心没有什么比一个实实在在成功、民主、现代化的邻国更能破坏他自己所谓 “管理民主” 权威。

column1: So now we have reached the tragedy’s fourth act, in which Russia attempts to grab eastern Ukraine, and the West responds.
column2: 因此我们看到了悲剧的第四幕，即俄罗斯试图攫取乌克兰东部，而西部对此做出了反应。

column1: Annexing eastern Ukraine – and thus splitting the country in two – by force has much less support, even among Russian-speakers, than the operation in Crimea.
column2: 武力吞并东乌克兰 — — 并借此分裂国家 — — 的支持率即使在讲俄语的民众中也远低于克里米亚行动。

column1: The aim of Russia’s covert military intervention there is to destabilize Ukraine in the long term by using stage-managed “unrest” to delegitimize the May 25 presidential election in the short term, thereby preventing consolidation of the post-Yanukovych political order.
column2: 俄国秘密军事干预的目的是破坏乌克兰的长期稳定，短期内利用阶段化管理的“动乱”来破坏5月25日的总统选举，并借此防止后亚努科维奇时代政治秩序的巩固。

column1: The task for the West is to stabilize Ukraine by economic and political means and contain Russian expansionism.
column2: 西方国家的任务是以经济政治手段稳定乌克兰并遏制俄罗斯的扩张势头。

column1: The Kremlin, not surprisingly, is seeking to make any Western response as expensive and uncomfortable as possible, by implementing its destabilization strategy before our eyes, step by step, hoping that a frustrated Europe and America will one day throw in the towel.
column2: 毫无疑问，克里姆林想竭尽全力让西方的任何举措尽可能地昂贵和难受，通过在我们眼前分步实施其破坏性战略，俄罗斯寄希望于沮丧的欧洲和美国有一天会主动认输。

column1: It is foreseeable that neither Russia nor the West will be strong enough to achieve its aims fully in Ukraine.
column2: 可以预见无论是俄罗斯还是西方都没有强大到能在乌克兰完全实现自己的目的。

column1: It would therefore be sensible for both sides to try, together with the Ukrainians, to reconcile their interests.
column2: 因此，明智的做法是双方和乌克兰民众一道尝试调和自身的利益。

column1: But that would require Putin to abandon his strategic ambitions, which he will never do so long as he can continue to slice the salami.
column2: 但这就需要普京放弃自己的战略野心，但只要他能继续实行“香肠切片”战略，他就永远不甘心这样做。

column1: Dulling Putin’s knife and ending the Ukraine crisis peacefully depends largely on the EU.
column2: 钝化普京的利刃及和平结束乌克兰危机大半取决于欧盟的表现。

column1: Sanctions will not impress Putin (he and his cronies are isolating Russia economically and financially more effectively than most sanctions could); peaceful yet tangible political steps within Europe will.
column2: 制裁措施不会打动普京（他和他的亲信从经济和金融领域孤立俄罗斯的效果比绝大多数制裁措施更加有效 ） ； 但欧洲内部和平而切实的政治措施却可以收到这样的效果。

column1: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk has made the right suggestion here: prompt establishment of a European energy union, starting with the market for natural gas and including joint external representation and a common pricing policy.
column2: 波兰总理图斯克已就此提出了正确的建议：推动成立欧洲能源联盟，从天然气市场开始，逐渐采取联合对外代表和共同定价政策。

column1: This step, combined with further differentiation among supplier countries and progress toward implementing renewable-energy technologies, would invert the balance of power between the EU (Russia’s most important customer for oil and natural gas) and the Kremlin.
column2: 上述步骤加之供应国进一步差异化及推动可再生能源技术进步，可以扭转欧盟（俄罗斯最重要的石油天然气客户）和克里姆林之间的权力平衡局面。

column1: If, at the same time, Poland resolved to join the euro at the earliest possible opportunity, Putin’s challenge to Eastern Europe would receive a powerful and completely peaceful answer.
column2: 如果同时波兰决意尽早加入欧元区，就等于和平但有力地回击了普京对东欧地区的挑战。

column1: And Poland would assume the role of a major player at the center of an increasingly integrated Europe.
column2: 而波兰将在日益一体化的欧洲中心扮演越来越重要的角色。

column1: It has largely been Germany that has opposed integrating Europe’s energy and natural gas markets.
column2: 基本上只有德国反对欧洲能源和天然气市场一体化。

column1: After the tragedy in Ukraine, no one in Berlin will be able to defend this stance, particularly given that Germany’s leaders do not want to confront Russia through sanctions.
column2: 乌克兰悲剧发生后，特别是在德国领导人不愿采取制裁措施对抗俄国的情况下，柏林再没有人能为这一立场进行辩护。

column1: There will no longer be any room for excuses about why an energy union should be rejected.
column2: 再也没有任何借口能拒绝能源联盟的建立。

column1: Everyone knows now what this communality called Europe is about.
column2: 人人都知道欧洲所谓的共同属性是什么。

column1: To borrow from Aesop’s “The Braggart”: Hic Rhodus, hic salta!
column2: 借用伊索寓言“自吹自擂的人”中的一句话： Hic Rhodus, hic salta！

column1: Enough said, Europe.
column2: 欧洲已经说得够多了。

column1: Now show us!
column2: 现在必须采取行动！

column1: The Great War’s Long Shadow
column2: 大战的长期阴影

column1: BERLIN – This year marks the centennial of the outbreak of World War I, which is reason enough to reflect on what this seminal European catastrophe teaches us today.
column2: 柏林—今年是第一次世界大战爆发一百周年，光是这一理由便已足以让我们反思这场欧洲的灾难对今天的意义。

column1: Indeed, the Great War’s consequences for international relations and the global system of states continue to be felt.
column2: 事实上，一战对国际关系和全球国家体系所造成的后果至今仍能感受到。

column1: So, have we learned anything from the policy failures of governments, institutions, and international diplomacy that occurred in the summer of 1914?
column2: 那么，我们从1914夏天所发生的政府、制度和国际外交方面的政策失误中学到了什么？

column1: Large parts of the northern hemisphere continue to struggle with the legacies of the great European empires – Habsburg, Russian, and Ottoman – that collapsed in WWI’s wake, or whose decline, like that of the British Empire, was initiated by the war and sealed by its even bloodier sequel a generation later.
column2: 北半球的大部分地区仍在欧洲大帝国 — — 哈布斯堡、沙俄和奥斯曼 — — 因为一战而崩溃所造成的后果中挣扎，更有一些帝国 — — 如大英帝国 — — 因为一战而衰落，并且因为二十多年后的另��场更加血腥的战争而板上钉钉。

column1: The resulting fracture zones – in the Balkans and the Middle East, for example – are the source of some of today’s gravest risks to regional and even world peace.
column2: 由此所造成的分裂区 — — 如巴尔干半岛和中东 — — 成为当今地区乃至世界和平的最大风险源。

column1: After the Cold War’s end and the collapse of the Russian Empire’s Soviet successor, war returned to the Balkans under very similar conditions to those that prevailed in the period before 1914, with aggressive nationalism ultimately reconfiguring the disintegrating Yugoslavia as six separate states.
column2: 冷战结束以及沙俄帝国的后继者苏联解体后，战争回到了巴尔干半岛，因为那里的情况变得与1914年前极为相似，最后，激进的民族主义把南斯拉夫打散重组为六个独立国家。

column1: Of course, Serbian President Slobodan Milošević, whose call for a “Greater Serbia” triggered the war, was not alone: For a moment, Europe was in danger of reverting to the confrontation of 1914, with France and the United Kingdom supporting Serbia, and Germany and Austria favoring Croatia.
column2: 当然，以提出“大塞尔维亚”而引发战争的塞尔维亚总统米洛舍维奇（Slobodan Milošević）并不孤独：有一段时间，欧洲大有重回1914年冲突之势，法国和英国支持塞尔维亚，德国和奥地利站在克罗地亚一边。

column1: Fortunately, there was no relapse, because the West had learned its lessons from historical mistakes.
column2: 幸运的是，故态没有复萌，因为西方从历史错误中汲取了教训。

column1: Today, three factors loom large in the avoidance of disaster: the United States’ military presence in Europe, the progress of European integration, and Europe’s abandonment of great-power politics.
column2: 如今，三大因素有助于有效地避免灾难：美国在欧洲的驻军、欧洲一体化进程以及欧洲放弃了大国政治。

column1: Yet there is no point in fooling oneself: Only as long as the Balkan countries believe in the European Union and the benefits of membership will today’s precarious peace in the region become permanent.
column2: 但我们也不能自欺欺人：只有巴尔干国家相信欧盟并因为加入欧盟而获益，今天在该地区如履薄冰的和平才能持久。

column1: No such hope currently exists for the Middle East, whose contemporary political borders were largely established by Britain and France during WWI, when the diplomats Mark Sykes and François Georges-Picot negotiated the division of the Ottoman Empire.
column2: 中东则不存在这样的希望。 当代中东的政治边界大体由英国和法国在一战期间划定，双方外交官赛克斯（Mark Sykes）和皮科（François Georges-Picot）商议了分割奥斯曼帝国的计划。

column1: Likewise, the creation of Israel harks back to the 1917 Balfour Declaration, whereby the subsequent British mandatory power in Palestine supported the establishment of a national home for the Jewish people.
column2: 类似地，以色列的建立可以追溯到1917年巴尔福宣言（Balfour Declaration ） ， 后来巴勒斯坦英国托管政权据此支持为犹太人建立一个国家。

column1: The Middle East created back then is, more or less, the Middle East today.
column2: 当时所建立起来的欧洲或多或少地就是今天的欧洲。

column1: Yet we are now witnessing its disintegration, because the Sykes-Picot design always implied a strong external hegemonic power (or two) able and willing to maintain stability by channeling (or suppressing) the region’s numerous conflicts.
column2: 但如今我们正在目睹中东的分崩离析，因为赛克斯-皮科方案需要一个（或两个）强大的外部霸权能够也愿意通过疏导（或镇压）该地区的众多冲突维持稳定。

column1: Great Britain and France, the first hegemonic powers, were succeeded by the US and the Soviet Union – and, finally, by the US alone.
column2: 一开始的霸权是英国和法国，后来是美国和苏联，最后只剩下美国一个。

column1: America’s misadventure in Iraq, its exhaustion as a world power, and its unwillingness to maintain its previous level of commitment to the region have rendered the Sykes-Picot structure untenable, because no other external force for order is available.
column2: 美国在伊拉克的出师不利、其作为世界超级大国的衰落以及其不愿维持如同过去那样的对中东地区的干涉程度导致赛克斯-皮科结构不再能够维持下去，因为再无其他外部势力或秩序可用。

column1: The resulting vacuum has been filled by various currents of political Islam, terrorism, protest movements, uprisings, secession attempts by national or religious minorities, and aspiring regional hegemons (Iran and Saudi Arabia).
column2: 填补由此造成的真空的是如今一波又一波的政治伊斯兰教、恐怖主义、反抗运动、起义、民主或宗教少数派的分裂活动以及雄心勃勃的地区霸权（伊朗和沙特阿拉伯 ） 。

column1: Indeed, the partial withdrawal of the US implies that the end of the enforced stability of the old Middle East will not spare the Sykes-Picot borders.
column2: 事实上，美国的局部撤退意味着旧中东的强迫稳定的结束不会仅限于赛克斯-皮科边界。

column1: Developments in Syria and Iraq already suggest as much, and the future of Lebanon and Jordan has become increasingly uncertain.
column2: 叙利亚和伊拉克的局面已经证明了这一点，黎巴嫩和约旦的未来也变得越来越不确定。

column1: One of the few positive features of the region is that no global power rivalries are currently playing out there.
column2: 极少数积极特征之一是目前该地区不存在世界级大国的对立。

column1: But the regional struggle for mastery between Iran and Saudi Arabia (with Israel as a third actor) could prove to be all the more dangerous, given the prevailing – and deeply entrenched – mindset of traditional power politics.
column2: 但是，考虑到主流的、根深蒂固的传统实力政治思维，伊朗和沙特阿拉伯（以色列则是第三方）质检的霸权之争可能十分危险。

column1: Institutions and traditions supporting cooperative conflict resolution hardly exist in the region.
column2: 支持合作性冲突解决方案的制度和传统在该地区几乎不存在。

column1: The memory of 1914 may trigger the most concern in East Asia, where all the ingredients of a similar disaster have accumulated: nuclear weapons, the rise of China as a global power, unresolved territorial and border disputes, the division of the Korean Peninsula, historical resentments, an obsession with status and prestige, and hardly any cooperative conflict-resolution mechanisms.
column2: 对1914年的记忆可能引发亚洲最大的隐忧，在亚洲，爆发类似于一战的灾难的所有要素都已经积累起来：核武器、中国崛起为全球强国、悬而未决的领土和边境纠纷、朝鲜半岛的分裂、历史恩怨，对地位和特权的着迷，以及缺乏任何合作性冲突解决机制。

column1: Distrust and power politics are the order of the day.
column2: 不信任和实力政治就是当前的秩序。

column1: And yet there are grounds for optimism in East Asia.
column2: 但对于东亚同样存在了管理有。

column1: The world has changed dramatically since the summer of 1914.
column2: 世界从1914年夏天以来已有了显著的变化。

column1: At the time, the world’s population was two billion; now it is seven billion.
column2: 当时，世界人口只有二十亿；如今是七十亿。

column1: This, together with the communications revolution, has created even more interdependencies and has forced more cooperation upon governments – as has the continued presence of the US as a stabilizer in the region, which has proved to be indispensable.
column2: 这一点加上通信革命已经造成更大的相互依赖型，并迫使各国更多地建立政府间的合作 — — 比如美国一直作为稳定器存在于该地区，其作用被证明是不可或缺的。

column1: Moreover, while nuclear weapons pose a continuing danger, they also inhibit the risk of war as a means of power politics by making mutual destruction a certainty.
column2: 此外，尽管核武器代表了永久性威胁，但也因为让互相毁灭成为笃定之事而降低了将战争作为实力政治手段的风险。

column1: Military technology, the mindset of politicians and citizens, the structure of international diplomacy, and much more have changed in the century since WWI erupted.
column2: 军事技术、政治家和人民的思维、国际外交结构以及其他诸多因素改变了自一战爆发以来的这个世纪。

column1: And, yes, we have even learned a few things from history, which has made the world safer.
column2: 是的，我们甚至从历史中学到了一些教训，这让世界变得更加安全。

column1: But, lest we forget: in the summer 1914, most actors regarded the impending disaster as an impossibility.
column2: 但是，我们不能忘记，在1914年夏天，大部分行动方也认为即将到来的灾难是不可能事件。

column1: Europe’s Ukrainian Blunder
column2: 欧洲在乌克兰问题上严重失策

column1: BERLIN – The European Union has probably never experienced anything like it before: Ukrainian President Viktor Yanukovych’s government pretended to negotiate an association agreement, only to back out at the last minute.
column2: 柏林—欧盟可能从未遇到过这样的经验：乌克兰总统亚努科维奇的政府装作与欧盟谈判加入协定，直到最后一刻突然反悔。

column1: EU leaders felt duped; in Moscow, however, the mood was celebratory.
column2: 欧盟领导人有被骗的感觉，而在莫斯科，则是群情激动。

column1: As we now know, Yanukovych’s real motivation for the negotiations was to raise the price that Russia would have to pay to keep Ukraine in its strategic orbit.
column2: 现在我们知道，亚努科维奇谈判的真正动机是提高俄罗斯拉拢乌克兰的出价。

column1: Only a few days later, Yanukovych and Russian President Vladimir Putin announced a Russian loan worth $15 billion, a cut in natural-gas prices, and various trade agreements.
column2: 几天后，亚努科维奇和俄罗斯总统普京宣布俄罗斯将向乌克兰提供价值150亿美元的贷款、降低天然气价格，并签订一系列贸易协议。

column1: From Yanukovych’s point of view, this agreement made sense in the short run: the gas deal would help Ukraine survive the winter, the loan would help keep it from defaulting on its debt, and the Russian market, on which the economy depends, would remain open.
column2: 从亚努科维奇的角度看，这一协议在短期相当有效：天然气协议有助于乌克兰度过严冬，贷款有助于避免债务违约，而乌克兰经济所依靠的俄罗斯市场也将保持大门敞开。

column1: In the medium term, however, by rejecting the EU and embracing Russia, Ukraine faces the risk of losing its independence – on which the post-Soviet order in Europe depends.
column2: 但是，从中期看，拒绝欧盟、投入俄罗斯怀抱的乌克兰有可能丧失其独立性，而这一独立性也是后苏联时代欧洲秩序的基础。

column1: In terms of its strategic orientation, Ukraine is a divided country.
column2: 从战略方向角度看，乌克兰已经陷入分裂。

column1: Its eastern and southern regions (especially Crimea) want to return to Russia, whereas its western and northern regions insist on moving toward Europe.
column2: 东部和南部（特别是克里米亚）希望回归俄罗斯，而西部和北部坚持倒向欧洲。

column1: For the foreseeable future, this domestic conflict can be resolved, if at all, only with a lot of violence involved, as the ongoing mass protests in Kyiv suggest.
column2: 在可预见的未来，这一国内冲突只有通过暴力才可能得到解决，基辅的大规模游行示威已经说明了这一点。

column1: But no sensible person can seriously desire such an outcome.
column2: 但没有任何理由去追求这一结果。

column1: Ukraine needs a peaceful, democratic solution, and this will be found only within the status quo.
column2: 乌克兰需要和平、民主的解决方案，而这唯有在现状框架内才能找到。

column1: The EU’s behavior demands explanation.
column2: 欧盟的行动需要扩大。

column1: Yanukovych had always been the Kremlin’s ally.
column2: 亚努科维奇一直是克里姆林宫的盟友。

column1: Indeed, his election in 2010 marked the end of Ukraine’s pro-European Orange Revolution, which had defeated his effort to steal the presidential election in 2004 and keep Ukraine in the Russian camp.
column2: 事实上，2010年亚努科维奇当选总统标志着乌克兰亲欧洲的橙色革命的结束。 2004年的橙色革命挫败了他窃取总统宝座、将乌克兰引向俄罗斯阵营的图谋。

column1: So why did the EU press for an association agreement, without being able to offer Ukraine anything comparable to what Russia offered?
column2: 那么，欧盟为什么还要在无法提供能与俄罗斯相媲美的条件的情况下与乌克兰展开入盟谈判呢？

column1: The answer can be found in the relationship between Europe and Russia.
column2: 答案可以在欧洲和俄罗斯的关系中寻找。

column1: With the collapse of the Soviet Union, Russia not only lost its status as a world power; within Europe, it was forced to withdraw toward a frontier that it had extended westward since Peter the Great – ultimately to the Elbe and Thuringia.
column2: 苏联解体后，俄罗斯不但失去了欧洲超级大国地位，也被迫从彼得大帝以来不断向西扩张、一度曾到达易北河和图林根的版图上退却。

column1: After Putin succeeded Boris Yeltsin as President of the Russian Federation, he followed three strategic goals, which he continues to pursue: an end to post-Soviet Russia’s strategic submission to the West; reestablishment of sovereignty over most of the ex-Soviet republics, or at least enough control over them to stop NATO’s eastward expansion; and gradual recovery of Russia’s status as a global power.
column2: 普京接替叶利钦成为俄罗斯联邦总统后一直在追求三大战略目标：停止自苏联解体以来对西方的屈服；重新建立对大部分前苏联共和国的主权，或至少获得足够的控制权阻止北约东扩；以及逐渐恢复俄罗斯全球超级大国的地位。

column1: These goals were not to be enforced by the Red Army, but by Russia’s economic potential, especially a strategic energy policy supported by vast oil and natural-gas reserves.
column2: 这些目标的推动力量不是红军，而是俄��斯的经济实力，特别是倚靠巨量石油和天然气储量的战略性能源政策。

column1: This would require securing control over these resources. It would also require establishing new export routes to Europe that, by circumventing Ukraine, would make the country vulnerable to blackmail, because a cutoff of gas supplies to it would no longer trouble Europe.
column2: 这就需要确保对这些资源的控制，此外还需要建立新的对欧出口模式 — — 绕过乌克兰，让乌克兰处于非常被动的局面，因为切断对乌供气不会影响到欧洲。

column1: The ultimate goal would be to regain Russian control over the Ukrainian pipeline network.
column2: 其最终目标是让俄罗斯重新获得对乌克兰管网的控制。

column1: At that point, Ukraine could be coaxed into joining Putin’s “Eurasian Union,” a Russian alternative to the EU aimed at keeping ex-Soviet countries within Russia’s sphere of influence.
column2: 然后就可以引诱乌克兰加入普京的“欧亚联盟 ” （ Eurasian Union，俄罗斯提出的与欧盟抗衡的联盟，旨在保持俄罗斯对前苏联国家的控制 ） 。

column1: Apart from using the Nord Stream and South Stream pipelines to disconnect Ukraine from Russian energy exports to Europe, the Kremlin successfully blocked European access to the hydrocarbon-rich Caspian Sea and Central Asia.
column2: 除了用北方（Nord Stream）和南方（South Stream）管网将乌克兰与俄罗斯对欧能源出口分离，克里姆林宫还成功地阻止了欧洲与富于能源的里海和中亚的联系。

column1: Virtually the only way that countries like Azerbaijan, Turkmenistan, and Kazakhstan can export their output to the West is via Russia’s pipeline network.
column2: 阿塞拜疆、土库曼斯坦和哈萨克斯坦等国家只有通过俄罗斯的管网才能向西方出口能源。

column1: The sole exception, the Baku–Tbilisi–Ceyhan (BTC) oil pipeline from Azerbaijan to Turkey, was pushed through by the United States; Europe has done nothing similar.
column2: 唯一的例外是阿塞拜疆到土耳其的巴库-第比利斯-杰伊汉（BTC）石油管道，该管道为美国所设，欧洲在这方面毫无作为。

column1: None of this is exactly a secret in Western capitals; on the contrary, Putin’s ultimate goal – a far-reaching revision of the post-Cold War strategic order in Europe – has become increasingly clear as Russia has moved closer to achieving it.
column2: 这些对西方国家都不是秘密；相反，普京的最终目标 — — 改变后冷战时代的欧洲战略秩序 — — 也随着俄罗斯向这一目标的步步逼近而变得日渐清晰。

column1: But neither the EU nor the US has been willing or able (so far) to formulate an effective response.
column2: 但不管是欧盟还是美国，都不愿或不能（到目前为止）予以有效应对。

column1: The EU’s Ukraine initiative was supposed to be an attempt to provide such an answer.
column2: 欧盟的乌克兰计划将试图提供一个解决方案。

column1: Europe played for high stakes, because if Ukraine does lose its independence in one way or another, European security will be at risk – a risk nowhere more keenly felt than in Poland and the Baltic states.
column2: 欧洲的赌注很大，因为如果乌克兰以某种方式失去其独立性，欧洲的安全就将告急 — — 尤其是波兰和波罗的海国家。

column1: With Yanukovych’s rejection of the association agreement, the EU has lost its bet.
column2: 亚努科维奇拒绝入盟协议意味着欧盟已经输掉了这场豪赌。

column1: Putin cannot be faulted for skillfully pursuing his interpretation of Russian interests.
column2: 普京追求俄罗斯的利益无可厚非。

column1: The blame for the outcome in Ukraine falls squarely on the EU’s leaders, who represented European interests so badly.
column2: 乌克兰局面的急转直下完全是欧盟领导人的责任，他们根本没有代表欧洲利益。

column1: Grand gestures and paper-thin statements cannot mask Europe’s neglect of its own strategic interests, which will not be helpful in its relations with Russia.
column2: 装腔作势和文过饰非无法掩盖欧洲队其自身战略利益的忽视，也无助于其与俄罗斯的关系。

column1: If Europeans want to change this, they will have to invest in their interests and devise an effective approach to ensure that these investments pay off.
column2: 如果欧洲人想改变这一局面，就必须投资于自身利于，并以有效的方式确保这些投资获得回报。

column1: This is true not only with respect to Ukraine.
column2: 不仅在乌克兰问题上是如此。

column1: At the end of 2013, Russian diplomacy can look back on a year of impressive successes: Syria, the interim nuclear agreement with Iran, and now Ukraine’s rejection of Europe.
column2: 在2013年行将结束之际，回顾一整年，俄罗斯外交硕果累累：叙利亚、伊朗临时核协议，最近又有乌克兰拒绝欧洲。

column1: Whether Europe’s leaders see the connections and understand the consequences remains a serious question.
column2: 欧洲领导人是否看到了其中的联系、明白其中的后果仍然是个严重的问题。

column1: That fact alone gives rise to considerable concern.
column2: 这一事实就足以引起巨大的担忧。

column1: Defusing Iran
column2: 接触伊朗的风险

column1: BERLIN – On February 18, crucial negotiations over Iran’s nuclear program began in Vienna between Iran and the five permanent members of the United Nations Security Council plus Germany (the P5+1).
column2: 柏林 — — 2月18日，联合国安理会五大常任理事国加德国（P5+1）与伊朗间就伊朗核计划的关键谈判在维也纳开始。

column1: The alternative to the talks is a further nuclear buildup by Iran, followed by additional international sanctions and, eventually, another war in the Middle East, which no one believes can resolve the problem.
column2: 谈判的替代方案是任由伊朗核问题继续发酵，进一步加码国际制裁并最终引发又一场中东战争。 没有人认为这种方法能够解决问题。

column1: So, can a comprehensive agreement that respects Iran’s right to civilian nuclear energy, while allaying the international community’s fears of weaponization, be achieved?
column2: 那么，究竟能否签署一项尊重伊朗民用核能权、同时又能缓解国际社会对核能武器化担忧的全面协议？

column1: The interim agreement reached last November in Geneva reflected the West’s de facto acceptance that Iran is entitled to carry out limited low-grade uranium enrichment within the framework of the Non-Proliferation Treaty (NPT).
column2: 去年十一月在日内瓦达成临时协议，这表明西方在事实上承认了伊朗在核不扩散条约（NPT）框架内进行有限度低级铀浓缩的权利。

column1: The West released about $7 billion of frozen Iranian funds and relaxed some sanctions (in particular, on crude oil and auto parts), while Iran agreed to a quasi-freeze of its nuclear program.
column2: 西方解冻了约70亿美元被冻结的伊朗资金，此外还放宽了某些制裁限制（尤其是在原油和汽车零部件领域 ） ， 而伊朗则同意对其核计划采取准冻结措施。

column1: That created the basis for a lasting agreement. But realizing that potential will be difficult.
column2: 虽然这项进展为最终订立持久协议打下了基础，但将这种可能性变为现实还需要经过艰苦的努力。

column1: First and foremost, a mountain of mutual distrust will need to be overcome.
column2: 首先，双方需要解决相互不信任的问题。

column1: The West and Israel do not believe that Iran’s nuclear program is meant to serve merely civilian aims.
column2: 西方和以色列并不相信伊朗的核计划仅仅服务于民用目的。

column1: Otherwise, why would Iran invest billions of dollars in a program that is almost tailor-made for military purposes, including long-distance delivery systems?
column2: 否则伊朗怎么会为一项几乎纯粹为军事目的服务的计划投资数十亿美元，其中还包括研制远程运输系统？

column1: The Iranian leadership, for its part, remains convinced that the United States still seeks to bring about regime change.
column2: 而伊朗领导人仍然相信美国依旧以政��更迭为目的。

column1: From Iran’s perspective, accepting an American hand extended in a spirit of conciliation could turn it into a fist.
column2: 从伊朗的角度看，美国以调停为目的伸出的手可能演变为重拳出击。

column1: Moreover, any compromise would be fiercely contested within both camps, possibly leading to serious domestic political conflict.
column2: 此外，任何妥协都可能在两方阵营引发严重的争议，甚至可能导致严重的国内政治冲突。

column1: And even if both sides’ current leaderships are sincere, will this hold true for their successors?
column2: 而且就算双方目前领导人本着真诚的态度，他们的继任者是否也能如此？

column1: The absence of trust between Iran and the West leads directly to the second obstacle to a comprehensive agreement: verification and monitoring.
column2: 伊朗和西方间欠缺信任也直接导致了达成全面协议的另一个障碍：那就是核查和监测措施。

column1: The central issue in these negotiations, around which everything else revolves, concerns Iran’s “breakout capability” – the time it would need, within the framework of any agreement with the West, to renege and build a nuclear weapon.
column2: 谈判中的一切都围绕伊朗“突破能力”这一核心问题。 具体来讲，就是伊朗在西方协议框架下会用多长时间背信弃义制造出核武器。

column1: How much supervision will be required not just to verify compliance but also to detect any possible attempt at a breakout?
column2: 如何监管才能确保伊朗遵守协议规定，并发现可能突破的蛛丝马迹？

column1: The technical questions are complex, and the proverbial devil really is in the countless details.
column2: 技术问题的确复杂，众所周知魔鬼也的确藏在无数细节中。

column1: But prospects for a deal will hinge on resolving three broad issues.
column2: 但能否达成协议将取决于能否解决三大问题。

column1: The first two issues reflect the two paths toward the bomb: uranium enrichment and plutonium production.
column2: 前两个问题反映了制造核弹的两条必由之路：铀浓缩和钚制造。

column1: Any workable agreement will require Iran to renounce uranium enrichment above the 5% level needed for a civilian nuclear-power program; accept limits on enrichment volumes, the number of centrifuges, and technology; agree to forgo reprocessing; and address operations at the heavy-water reactor in Arak.
column2: 任何可行的协议都要求伊朗放弃高于民用核能项目要求的5%以上的铀浓缩计划;伊朗还必须接受提取数量上的限制，离心机的数量和技术；同意放弃后处理并妥善处理阿拉克重水反应堆的操作。

column1: The third issue concerns supervision and monitoring, which for quite some time would probably have to go beyond that agreed in the Additional Protocol to the NPT and include certain military installations.
column2: 第三个问题与督促和监测机制有关，它在特定时间内很可能会超出双方同意的不扩散条约附加议定书的范畴，并包含某些特定的军事设施。

column1: Indeed, the duration the agreement will be of vital importance.
column2: 事实上，协议的持续时间在这里至关重要。

column1: The West wants it to be implemented for as long as possible, while Iran would prefer a very short timeframe within which to achieve its central objectives: a comprehensive and lasting repeal of international sanctions and recognition as an NPT non-military nuclear power.
column2: 西方希望持续的时间越长越好，而伊朗则希望在短时间内达到其全面永久废除国际制裁和跻身不扩散核武器条约非军用有核国家的核心目标。

column1: That raises another important question: Does US President Barack Obama really have a domestic mandate for negotiating a comprehensive repeal of the sanctions?
column2: 由此又引出了另外一个重要问题：那就是美国总统奥巴马是否真的能在全面废止制裁措施的谈判中说话算数？

column1: Here, we are brought back to the central issue in this process: technical questions, though important, are still only an expression of the underlying political conflicts and animosities.
column2: 这里我们又重新回到整个过程的核心：技术问题无论多重要，仍始终不过是表达了潜在的仇恨和政治冲突。

column1: These are the real factors driving the confrontation that the Vienna negotiations are meant to defuse over the next six months.
column2: 这些才是今后六个月维也纳谈判想要化解对抗的真正驱动因素。

column1: And the current regional and sectarian confrontation in the Middle East affects the nuclear negotiations directly.
column2: 而当前的中东地区和宗派对抗才是核谈判的直接影响因素。

column1: All of the relevant players – including those, like Saudi Arabia and Israel, that are not sitting at the table but whose presence is very much felt – are clinging to their initial positions.
column2: 包括像沙特和以色列在内的所有相关势力虽然没有直接坐到谈判桌前，但他们的影响力却是切实存在的。 这些国家都坚持他们最初的立场。

column1: The US does not want Iran to become a military nuclear power or gain regional predominance; above all, the Americans do not want another Middle East war.
column2: 美国不希望伊朗成为军事核国家或占据地区优势；毕竟美国人不希望中东再燃战火。 但伊朗则力争成为（非军事？

column1: Iran, however, wants to become a (non-military?) nuclear power and shape a region in which it is heavily involved militarily (in Syria, Lebanon, and Iraq).
column2: ）核国家，在本国大量驻军的地区（叙利亚、黎巴嫩和伊拉克）扮演举足轻重的角色。

column1: Europe shares the US position, but is more flexible.
column2: 欧洲与美国有着相似的立场，但欧洲人的态度却更加灵活。

column1: Saudi Arabia, a Sunni power, wants to stop Shia Iran from becoming an emerging or, worse still, a military nuclear power in the Gulf, and has taken the opposite side in Syria, Lebanon, and Iraq.
column2: 逊尼派强国沙特希望阻止伊朗成为海湾地区新兴核力量甚至是军事核力量，并且在叙利亚、黎巴嫩和伊拉克都采取了与伊朗对立的态度。

column1: Israel opposes Iran’s becoming a military nuclear power – or even a nuclear-threshold state – and is willing to try to prevent this by military means.
column2: 以色列则反对伊朗成为军事核力量 — — 甚至于基本核力量 — — 而且不惜使用武力达到自己的目标。

column1: To achieve a sustainable compromise that all sides accept (even if with gritted teeth), the negotiations must be accompanied by diplomatic steps aimed at building trust both in the region and beyond.
column2: 为了实现各方都能接受的长期妥协（就算其中有人在咬牙切齿 ） ， 谈判就必须辅之以在区域内外建立信任的外交步骤。

column1: Europe is very well versed in such processes and should put its experience to good use.
column2: 欧洲人非常熟悉这样的过程，应该很好利用自身经验完成这样的任务。

column1: Iran must decide whether it wants to follow the North Korean route to international isolation, or some variation on the Chinese route to integration into the global economy.
column2: 伊朗必须决定是否要追随朝鲜的国际孤立线路，还是采取某种类似于中国的方式融入全球经济的范畴。

column1: It must also understand that its relationship with both Israel and Saudi Arabia will affect the negotiations, either positive or negatively.
column2: 它还必须明白与以色列和沙特阿拉伯的关系会影响到谈判结果，而这种影响不是正面就是负面的。

column1: And the West – the US, Europe, and, more than any other country, Israel – will have to get used to the idea of living with an Iranian civilian nuclear-power program, while limiting Iran’s capacity to become an emerging military nuclear power.
column2: 而西方（美国和欧洲，尤其是以色列）一定要接受与伊朗民用核计划共存的思想，同时限制伊朗成为新兴的核军事强国。

column1: As the very different examples of the Soviet Union and China show, the Iranian regime might someday collapse or change fundamentally – probably when hardly anyone expects it.
column2: 虽然两者差别很大，但苏联和中国的例子都表明伊朗政权或许会在某天崩溃或发生根本变化 — — 很可能是在任何人都没有预料到时候。

column1: Until then, we must do our best to defuse the nuclear time bomb together.
column2: 在此之前，我们必须竭尽全力共同化解伊朗这颗核定时炸弹的威胁。

column1: Emerging Economies on Their Own
column2: 自谋生路的新兴市场

column1: NEW YORK – There was a remarkable similarity between European Central Bank President Mario Draghi’s statement after a recent meeting of the ECB Governing Council and US Federal Reserve Chair Janet Yellen’s first testimony to Congress: both asserted that their policy decisions would take into account only domestic conditions.
column2: 发自纽约 — — 欧洲央行行长马里奥·德拉吉（Mario Draghi）最近在与欧洲央行管理委员会开会后发表的声明和美联储主席珍妮特·耶伦首次国会听证中的言论极为相似 — — 两者都宣称自己的政策决策只会考虑国内状况。

column1: In other words, emerging-market countries, though subject to significant spillover effects from advanced economies’ monetary policies, are on their own.
column2: 换言之，那些新兴市场国家虽然承受了来自发达经济体货币政策的极大溢出效应，但也只能自谋生路了。

column1: This confirms what emerging-country authorities have known for a while.
column2: 其实新兴国家政府要就意识到了这一点，只是现在才最终得到确认而已。

column1: In 2010 – following the Fed’s announcement of a third round of quantitative easing – Brazilian Finance Minister Guido Mantega accused advanced countries of waging a global “currency war.”
column2: 2010年时 — — 就在美联储宣布进行第三轮量化宽松政策之后 — — 巴西财政部长吉多·曼特加（Guido Mantega）就指责发达经济体发动了一场全球性“货币战争 ” 。

column1: After all, advanced economies’ policies were driving large and volatile capital flows into the major emerging markets, pushing up their exchange rates and damaging their export competitiveness – a phenomenon that Brazilian President Dilma Rousseff later referred to as a “capital tsunami.”
column2: 毕竟发达国家的政策正驱使大量短期资本流入各大新兴市场国家，导致后者汇率上涨并削弱其出口竞争力 — — 巴西总统迪尔玛·罗塞夫最后将这一现场称之为“资本海啸 ” 。

column1: Recently, the impact of the advanced economies’ withdrawal of monetary stimulus has been just as strong.
column2: 最近发达经济体退出货币刺激政策所造成的影响也同样严重。

column1: Since last May, when the Fed announced its intention to begin tapering its asset purchases, capital has become less accessible and more expensive for emerging economies – a shift that has been particularly painful for countries whose large current-account deficits leave them dependent on foreign finance.
column2: 自去年五月美联储宣布有意缩减资产收购规模以来，新兴市场国家的资金获取渠道不断缩窄，融资成本日渐上升 — — 这对那些拥有大额经常帐户赤字并因此依赖国际融资的国家来说尤为痛苦。

column1: In response, Raghuram Rajan, Governor of the Reserve Bank of India, has called advanced-country policies “selfish,” declaring that “international monetary cooperation has broken down.”
column2: 对此印度储备银行行长拉古兰·拉贾（Raghuram Rajan）回应说发达国家的政策相当“自私 ” ， 并宣称“国际货币合作体系已经崩溃 。 ”

column1: To be sure, emerging economies have plenty of their own problems to address.
column2: 无可否认，新兴经济体自身都存在着许多亟待解决的问题。

column1: But there is no denying that these countries have been victims of advanced economies’ monetary policies, which have increased capital-flow volatility over the last three decades.
column2: 但也不能否认这些国家确实成为了发达国家货币政策的受害者，而这些政策在过去30年中令资金流的波动性不断增大。

column1: According to the International Monetary Fund’s April 2011 World Economic Outlook, though the volatility of capital flows has increased worldwide, it is higher in emerging market economies than in advanced economies.
column2: 根据国际货币基金组织发布的《2011年4月实际经济展望 》 ， 虽然资本流动的波动性在全球范围内都有所上升，但新兴经济体的上升幅度要比发达经济体要大。

column1: Boom-bust financial cycles are driven largely by shocks generated in advanced economies, but they are key determinants of emerging markets’ business cycles.
column2: 经济兴衰周期主要都是由发达经济体产生的冲击所驱动，但它们又是新兴市场国家商业周期关键决定者。

column1: Moreover, the spillover effects of advanced economies’ monetary policies extend beyond financial shocks.
column2: 此外，发达经济体货币政策的溢出效应已经超出了金融冲击的范畴。

column1: Emerging economies are also suffering from the effects of developed countries’ external imbalances – particularly the eurozone’s swelling current-account surplus.
column2: 新兴经济体同时也遭到了发达经济体外部失衡状况的影响 — — 尤其是欧元区不断膨胀的经常帐户盈余。

column1: In the last few years, the deficit economies of the eurozone’s periphery – and, more recently, Italy – have undertaken massive external adjustments, while Germany and the Netherlands have sustained their large surpluses.
column2: 在过去几年中，位处欧元区核心圈外的逆差经济体 — — 比如说最近的意大利 — — 都实施了大规模的外部调整，同时德国和荷兰还依然维持着自身的大额顺差。

column1: As a result, the burden of offsetting the eurozone’s rising surplus has fallen largely on emerging economies, contributing to their growth slowdown.
column2: 因此冲抵欧元区大额顺差的责任就主要落在了新兴经济体身上，导致后者增长放缓。

column1: Such spillover effects are precisely what international policy cooperation – such as the “mutual assessment process” that the G-20 established in 2009 – was supposed to prevent.
column2: 这些溢出效应正是国际政策合作机制 — — 例如G20集团2009年建立的“多方评估进程 ” — —原本所要避免的状况。

column1: The IMF has created an elaborate system of multilateral surveillance of major countries’ macroeconomic policies, including the “consolidated multilateral surveillance reports,” the spillover reports for the so-called “systemic five” (the US, the United Kingdom, the eurozone, Japan, and China), and the “external sector reports” assessing global imbalances.
column2: 国际货币基金组织创设了一个复杂精密的系统来对主要国家的宏观经济政策进行多边监控，其中包括“整合性多边监察报告 ” ， 以及对所谓“五大系统关键国（美、英、欧、日、中 ） ” 的溢出效应报告，还有评估国际贸易失衡状况的“外部部门报告 ” 。

column1: But this system has proved to be utterly ineffective in preventing spillovers – not least because the Fed and the ECB simply ignore it.
column2: 但这一系统最终被证明在防范溢出效应方面极为低效 — — 特别是因为美联储和欧洲央行对此根本不屑一顾。

column1: Given that the US dollar and the euro are the top two international reserve currencies, spillovers should be considered the new normal.
column2: 考虑到美元和欧元分别是世界前两大储备货币，溢出效应应该被视为一种新的常态。

column1: Adding insult to injury, the $1.1 trillion appropriations bill for federal-government operations agreed last month by the US Congress does not include any money to recapitalize the IMF, the main instrument of international monetary cooperation.
column2: 更糟糕的是，美国国会去年批准的1.1万亿联邦政府年度支出预算案并未包含任何拨付给国际货币基金组织的资金，而后者却是国际货币合作机制的主要工具。

column1: That decision represents yet another setback for IMF reforms aimed at increasing the influence of emerging economies.
column2: 那个决定意味着国际货币基金组织旨在增加新兴经济体影响力的改革遭遇了又一次失败。

column1: Given the considerable benefits that stable and prosperous emerging countries bring to the world economy – exemplified by the role that they played in propping up global growth in the wake of the recent crisis – it is in everyone’s interest to change the status quo.
column2: 考虑到稳定而繁荣的新兴经济体国家为世界经济带来的巨大好处 — — 例如在最近一连串危机之后催动全球增长中所扮演的角色，对现状的改变符合所有人的利益。

column1: The G-20 and the IMF’s International Monetary and Financial Committee must work to align reality with the rhetoric of macroeconomic-policy cooperation.
column2: G20集团和国际货币基金组织下属的国际货币和金融委员会必须把宏观经济政策合作机制的宗旨和现实达成一致。

column1: For that, the recent statements by Draghi and Yellen should be treated as ground zero.
column2: 为此，德拉吉和耶伦最近的言论应当被视为一个基点。

column1: Revoking America’s Exorbitant Privilege
column2: 废除美国的过度特权

column1: NEW YORK – The ongoing political stalemate in the United States holds two major implications for the international monetary system.
column2: 纽约—美国没完没了的政治僵局给国际货币体系带来了两大影响。

column1: The better-known consequence has been deepening uncertainty about the US dollar, the main global reserve currency, and US Treasury securities, supposedly the world’s “safest” financial asset.
column2: 为人所熟知的后果是深化了主要全球储备货币 — — 美元和号称世界“最安全”金融资产的美国国债的不确定性。

column1: Not surprisingly, the major investors in US Treasuries, China and Japan, have expressed alarm.
column2: 毫不奇怪，美国国债的主要投资者中国和日本纷纷拉响警报。

column1: Simply put, the global economy has at its center a dysfunctional political regime that generates recurrent threats of default on the world’s major reserve asset.
column2: 简言之，全球经济的核心占据着一个无法正常运转的政治机制，这套机制时不时发出世界主要储备资产违约的风险。

column1: The second implication is further postponement of the International Monetary Fund’s 2010 quota and governance reforms, which would double member countries’ contributions and modestly increase major emerging economies’ voting power.
column2: 第二个影响是国际货币基金组织（IMF）的2010年配额和治理改革被进一步推迟，这项改革将倍增成员国的出资额，并略微提高主要新兴经济体的投票权。

column1: Prior to its approval by the IMF Board in December 2010, the reform, agreed at the G-20 Seoul Summit, had been hailed as a “historic” breakthrough.
column2: 在2010年12月被IMF理事会批准之前，已在G-20首尔峰会上达成一致的这一改革方案被称为“历史性”突破。

column1: But history has stalled without approval by the US, which has an effective veto over major IMF decisions.
column2: 但没有美国的批准 — — 该国拥有IMF重大决策的实际否决权，历史将停滞不前。

column1: The threat of a US default may well end in a political agreement to raise the US government’s debt ceiling, as occurred in 2011.
column2: 美国违约的风险很有可能因为关于提高美国政府债务上限形成了政治一致而结束，这一幕在2011年就发生过。

column1: But, whatever the outcome, the latest episode makes it abundantly clear that our globalized world deserves a better international monetary system than the current “non-system” that evolved in an ad hoc manner after the collapse in the early 1970’s of the initial Bretton Woods arrangements.
column2: 但是，无论结果如何，最近的债务上限之争充分表明，我们的全球化的世界应该有一套更好的国际货币体系。 当前的“无体系”实际上是20世纪70年代初布雷顿森林体系崩溃后的权宜之计。

column1: The need to overhaul the international monetary and financial system was one of the basic lessons of the global financial crisis.
column2: 修正国际货币和金融体系的需要是全球金融危机最根本的教训之一。

column1: While there have been major, albeit incomplete, reforms of international finance, efforts in 2009 and 2010 to reform the international monetary system – including the proposed changes at the IMF – have led to no significant action.
column2: 国际金融方面已经有了重大（尽管有欠全面）的改革，但2009年和2010年改革国际货币体系的努力 — — 包括IMF的变革方案 — — 并未带来重大行动。

column1: The reform proposals came from diverse quarters: the governor of the People’s Bank of China; a commission convened by the United Nations General Assembly on reform of the international monetary and financial system, headed by the Nobel laureate Joseph E. Stiglitz; and the French Palais Royal Initiative, led by former IMF Managing Director Michel Camdessus.
column2: 改革方案来自各个方向：中国人民银行行长、联合国大会召集的以诺贝尔经济学奖获得者斯蒂格利茨（Joseph Stiglitz）为首的国际货币和金融体系改革委员会，以及以前IMF总裁康德苏（Michel Camdessus）为首的法国王宫倡议（French Palais Royal Initiative ） 。

column1: There have been myriad academic contributions to the debate as well.
column2: 学界也纷纷为这一话题出谋划策。

column1: The first element of reform should be to give a greater role to the only true international money that the world now has: the IMF’s Special Drawing Rights, created in 1969 as the result of another dollar crisis.
column2: 改革的第一要素应该是给予当今世界唯一真正的国际货币 — — 始创于1969年美元危机后的IMF特别提款权（SDR ） — —更大的角色。

column1: The establishment of SDRs was accompanied by a commitment, included in the IMF Articles of Agreement, to “making the special drawing right the principal reserve asset in the international monetary system” (Article VIII, Section 7 and Article XXII).
column2: SDR的创立伴随着一项承诺，并写入了IMF协定章程中 ： “ 让特别提款权成为国际货币体系的主要储备资产 ” （ 第八条第7款和第二十二条 ） 。

column1: But this commitment has remained a dead letter, except for periodic emissions of SDRs during crises, including the equivalent of $250 billion in 2009.
column2: 但这一承诺至今形同虚设，SDR只是在危机爆发时发放过几次，包括2009年所发放的相当于2500亿美元的SDR。

column1: The IMF Articles of Agreement should be amended to allow more flexible use of SDRs, replicating the way central banks operate.
column2: IMF协定章程应该作出修订以允许更灵活地使用SDR，复制中央银行的操作方式。

column1: That is, SDRs could be created during global recessions and withdrawn during booms.
column2: 也就是说，SDR应该在全球衰退期间创造，在全球繁荣期间收回。

column1: They should be the major source of IMF financing as well, replacing quota subscriptions or lending to the Fund by member countries (potentially making the IMF a purely SDR-based institution, as proposed decades ago by the late IMF economist Jacques Polak).
column2: SDR还应该成为IMF的主要资源，取代成员国的配额认购和IMF贷款（这有望使IMF成为纯粹的基于SDR的机构，如同已故的IMF经济学家波拉克（Jacques Polak）几十年前所建议的那样 ） 。

column1: The simplest approach would be for countries to “deposit” the SDRs that they receive at the IMF, which could then lend them to countries and invest the remainder in sovereign bonds.
column2: 最简单的方法是各国将它们得到的SDR“储蓄”在IMF，IMF将这些SDR贷给各国并将剩下部分投资于主权债券。

column1: This should be combined with a more active role for the IMF – rather than the G-20 – as the true instrument of global macroeconomic policy coordination.
column2: 此外，IMF — — 而不是G-20 — — 应该扮演更积极的角色，成为真正的全球宏观经济政策协调工具。

column1: One essential (and generally agreed) goal of such coordination should be to reduce global imbalances like those caused in recent years by the European Union’s rising external surplus, which has forced many emerging economies to run growing deficits.
column2: 一个根本性（也被广泛接受的）协调目标应是减少类似于近几年来因欧盟外部盈余增加从而迫使许多新兴经济体赤字抬头而造成的失衡。

column1: Because other global currencies – the dollar, the euro, and increasingly the renminbi – would continue to coexist with the SDRs as global reserve assets, another essential element of global macroeconomic cooperation should be defining the particular obligations of countries (or regions) issuing reserve currencies.
column2: 由于其他全球货币 — — 美元、欧元，人民币也日渐跻身其中 — — 将继续与SDR共存作为全球储备资产，因此，另一个全球宏观经济合作的根本性要素应该是定义发行储备货币的各国（或各地区）的具体义务。

column1: Still another element of international monetary reform is better management of the global exchange-rate system (or, again, “non-system”), which should aim at avoiding currency “manipulation” – but only after defining precisely what that means.
column2: 国际货币改革的另一项要素是更好地管理全球汇率体系（或者说也是“无体系 ” ） ，此项改革的目标应该是避免货币“操纵 ” — —但必须明确定义什么是操纵。

column1: It should also reduce the high levels of exchange-rate volatility – “a tax on international specialization,” as the economist Charles Kindleberger once put it – that we have seen in recent years, including among major currencies.
column2: 改革还应该降低近几年来出现的剧烈的汇率波动水平 — — 经济学家金德尔伯格（Charles Kindleberger）称之为“国际专业化税 ” — —包括主要货币对在内。

column1: Long-term global-finance discussions have also made clear that, under certain conditions, regulation of capital flows (“capital-flow management measures,” in current IMF terminology) are warranted on “macroprudential” grounds – an understanding accepted by the G-20 at its 2011 Cannes meeting and by the IMF last year.
column2: 长期全球金融讨论还明确地表明，在一定条件下，资本流监管（用当前IMF术语讲，叫“资本流管理措施 ” ） 必须有“宏观审慎”基础，这一点在2011年的G-20戛纳峰会被接受，IMF也在去年接受了它。

column1: Last but not least, the international monetary system requires governance reform, which includes giving a stronger voice to emerging and developing countries.
column2: 最后，国际货币体系需要治理改革，包括给予新兴和发展中国家更大的话语权。

column1: Aside from the final adoption of the 2010 reforms and the forthcoming 2014 quota debates, the changes should include those recommended by the Stiglitz Commission, the Palais Royal Initiative, and the 2009 Committee on IMF Governance Reform headed by Trevor Manuel, among others.
column2: 除了最后采纳2010年的改革和即将到来的2014年配额争论外，还应该包括斯蒂格利茨委员会、王宫倡议和以曼努埃尔（Trevor Manuel）等人为首的2009年IMF治理改革委员会提出的变化。

column1: One central element of these proposals is to eliminate, once and for all, the veto power of any individual country.
column2: 这些议案的一个核心要素是一劳永逸地取消任何单个国家的否决权。

column1: With the world waiting anxiously for some of America’s political leaders to behave like adults, the cost of maintaining the current non-system has become all too obvious.
column2: 全世界正在焦急地等待美国政治领导人向成年人那样行动，维持无体系现状的成本早已一目了然了。

column1: After the Dollar
column2: 美元之后

column1: NEW YORK – It is symbolic that the recent BRICS summit in Fortaleza, Brazil, took place exactly seven decades after the Bretton Woods Conference that created the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank.
column2: 纽约—最近在巴西福塔雷萨（Fortaleza）举行的金砖国家峰会具有象征意义，其召开正逢建立了国际货币进组织和世界银行的布雷顿森林会议七十周年。

column1: The upshot of the BRICS meeting was the announcement of the New Development Bank, which will mobilize resources for infrastructure and sustainable development projects, and a Contingent Reserve Arrangement to provide liquidity through currency swaps.
column2: 金砖国家峰会的一个重要成果是宣布成立新开发银行为基础设施和可持续发展工程动员资源，以及建立一个应急储备安排（Contingent Reserve Arrangement）以通过货币互换提供流动性。

column1: The Bretton Woods Conference marked one of history’s greatest examples of international economic cooperation.
column2: 布雷顿森林会议是历史上国际经济合作最伟大的范例之一。

column1: And, while no one can say yet whether the BRICS’ initiatives will succeed, they represent a major challenge to the Bretton Woods institutions, which should respond.
column2: 而尽管没人能说金砖国家的最近举动能够成功，但它们构成了对布雷顿森林机构的重大挑战，后者应该有所回应。

column1: Rethinking the role of the US dollar in the international monetary system is a case in point.
column2: 反思美元在国际货币体系中的作用是其中的应有之义。

column1: One key feature of the Bretton Woods system was that countries would tie their exchange rates to the US dollar.
column2: 布雷顿森林体系的一个关键特征是各国将汇率与美元绑定。

column1: While the system was effectively eliminated in 1971, the US dollar’s central role in the international monetary system has remained intact – a reality that many countries are increasingly unwilling to accept.
column2: 尽管该体系在1971年已事实解体，但美元在国际货币体系中的核心地位并未受到动摇 — — 许多国家日益不愿接受这一现实。

column1: Dissatisfaction with the dollar’s role as the dominant global reserve currency is not new.
column2: 不满于美元首要全球储备货币地位并非新鲜事。

column1: In the 1960s, French Finance Minister Valéry Giscard d’Estaing famously condemned the “exorbitant privilege” that the dollar’s status bestowed upon the United States.
column2: 20世纪60年代，法国财政部长德斯坦（Valéry Giscard d’Estaing）就有过著名的批评，他称美元的地位让美国拥有了“过度特权 ” 。

column1: The issue is not merely one of fairness.
column2: 这一问题并不只是公平问题。

column1: According to the Belgian economist Robert Triffin, an international monetary system based on a national currency is inherently unstable, owing to the resulting tensions among the inevitably divergent interests of the issuing country and the international system as a whole.
column2: 根据比利时经济学家特里芬（Robert Triffin）的理论，基于国家货币的国际货币体系具有内在不稳定性，因为这必然会导致货币发行国利益于国际体系整体利益的冲突。

column1: Triffin issued his warning more than 50 years ago, but it has recently gained traction, as China’s rise has made the world increasingly disinclined to tolerate the instability caused by a dollar-denominated system.
column2: 特里芬在50多年前就提出了这一警告，但直到最近才获得重视，中国的崛起让世界越来越不愿意忍受美元计价体系带来的不稳定性。

column1: The solution, however, lies not in replacing the dollar with the renminbi, but in strengthening the role of the world’s only truly global currency: the IMF’s Special Drawing Rights.
column2: 但是，解决方案并不在于用人民币取代美元，而在于强化世界唯一的全球货币 — — IMF的特别提款权（Special Drawing Rights，SDR）的作用。

column1: Following the creation of SDRs in 1969, IMF members committed to make them “the principle reserve asset in the international monetary system,” as stated in the Articles of Agreement.
