column2: SDR建立于1969年，IMF成员国承诺让SDR成为“国际货币体系的主要储备资产 ” ， 这一点写入了IMF章程。

column1: But the peculiar way in which SDRs were adopted limited their usefulness.
column2: 但SDR的特殊实施方式限制了它的用途。

column1: For starters, the separation of the IMF’s SDR account from its general account made it impossible to use SDRs to finance IMF lending.
column2: 首先，IMF的SDR与其总账是隔离的，这意味着SDR不能用于为IMF贷款提供资金。

column1: Furthermore, though countries accrue interest on their holdings of SDRs, they have to pay interest on the allocations they receive.
column2: 此外，尽管各国所持有的SDR都能获得利息，但也必须为得到的配额支付利息。

column1: In other words, SDRs are both an asset and a liability, functioning like a guaranteed credit line for the holder – a sort of unconditional overdraft facility.
column2: 换句话说，SDR既是资产也是负债，起作用就像是持有者所获得的信用配额保证 — — 一种无条件的透支便利。

column1: Nonetheless, SDRs have proved to be useful.
column2: 尽管如此，SDR仍起着作用。

column1: After initial allocations in 1970-1972, more were issued to increase global liquidity during major international crises: in 1979-1981, in 1997, and, in particular, in 2009, when the largest issue – the equivalent of $250 billion – was made.
column2: 1970—1972年首次分配后又多次在主要国际危机期间增发以提高全球流动性：1979—1981年、1997年、2009年莫不如此，特别是2009年，增发量高达2,500亿美元。

column1: While developed countries, including the US and the United Kingdom, have drawn on their allocations, the major users have been developing and, in particular, low-income countries.
column2: 尽管美国和英国等发达国家已充分利用了它们的配额，但主要使用者一直是发展中特别是低收入国家。

column1: In fact, this is the only way in which developing countries (China aside) share in the creation of international money.
column2: 事实上，这是发展中国家（中国除外）唯一的参与国际货币创造的方式。

column1: Several estimates indicate that, given the additional demand for reserves, the world could absorb annual allocations of $200-300 billion or even more.
column2: 一些测算表明，考虑到对储备的新增需求，世界每年可以吸收2,000—3,000亿美元甚至更多的配额。

column1: This has prompted many – including People’s Bank of China Governor Zhou Xiaochuan; the United Nations-backed Stiglitz Commission; the Palais-Royal Initiative, led by former IMF Managing Director Michel Camdessus; and the Triffin International Foundation – to call for changes to the international monetary system.
column2: 这促使许多人呼吁改变国际货币体系，包括中国人民银行行长周小川、联合国支持的斯蒂格利茨委员会（Stiglitz Commission ） 、 前IMF总裁康德苏（Michel Camdessus）领衔的皇宫倡议（Palais Royal Initiative）和特里芬国际基金会（Triffin International Foundation）等。

column1: In 1979, the IMF economist Jacques Polak, who had been part of the Dutch delegation at the Bretton Woods conference, outlined a plan for doing just that.
column2: 1979年，IMF经济学家波拉克（Jacques Polak，他是布雷顿森林会议荷兰代表团成员）就提出了一项这样做的计划。

column1: His recommendations include, first and foremost, making all of the IMF’s operations in SDRs, which would require ending the separation of the IMF’s SDR and general accounts.
column2: 他的计划中最重要的内容是让IMF的所有操作都通过SDR进行，这要求结束将SDR与IMF总账分离的做法。

column1: The simplest way to fulfill this vision would be to allocate SDRs as a full reserve asset, which countries could either use or deposit in their IMF accounts.
column2: 实现这一目标的最简单的办法是将SDR作为完全储备资产进行配置，各国可以使用它，也可以将它存在自己的IMF账户中。

column1: The IMF would use those deposits to finance its lending operations, rather than having to rely on quota allocations or “arrangements to borrow” from members.
column2: IMF将使用这些存款为其贷款项目提供资金，而不是依靠配额分配或来自成员国的“借贷安排 ” 。

column1: Other provisions could be added.
column2: 还可以加入其他内容。

column1: To address developing countries’ high currency demands, while enhancing their role in the creation of international money, a formula could be created to give them a larger share in SDR allocations than they now receive.
column2: 要满足发展中国家高企的货币需求，同时强化他们在国际货币创造中的作用，可以创造一套模式让它们获得比现在所得到的更大的SDR配额比例。

column1: The private use of SDRs could also be encouraged, though that would likely be met with strong opposition from countries currently issuing international reserve currencies, especially the US.
column2: SDR的私人用途也可以鼓励，尽管可能受到当前国际货币储备发行国特别是美国的反对。

column1: Keeping SDRs as pure “central-bank money” would eliminate such opposition, enabling them to complement and stabilize the current system, rather than upend it.
column2: 将SDR作为纯粹的“央行货币”能消除这一番队，让SDR完胜和稳定当前体系而不是动摇它。

column1: Just as the Bretton Woods framework restored order to the global economy after WWII, a new monetary framework, underpinned by a truly international currency, could strengthen much-needed economic and financial stability.
column2: 正如布雷顿森林框架在二战后重建了国际经济秩序，以真正的国际货币为基础的新的货币安排能够强化当前所急需的经济和金融稳定。

column1: Everyone – even the US – would benefit from that.
column2: 所有人 — — 包括美国 — — 都能从中获益。

column1: Waste Not, Want Not
column2: 无浪费，无欲求

column1: ROME – Every year, we waste or lose 1.3 billion metric tons of food – one-third of the world’s annual food production.
column2: 罗马—我们每年要浪费13亿吨的粮食 — — 相当于世界粮食年产量的三分之一。

column1: The sheer scale of the number makes it almost impossible to grasp, no matter how one approaches it.
column2: 这个规模之大是很难想象的，不管你用什么方法。

column1: Try to imagine 143,000 Eiffel Towers stacked one on top of another, or a pile of 10 trillion bananas.
column2: 你可以试想143 000座彼此重叠的埃菲尔铁塔，或者10万亿根香蕉组成的大堆。

column1: The figure is all the more unfathomable, given that, alongside this massive wastage and loss, 840 million people experience chronic hunger on a daily basis.
column2: 还有更加难以想象的数字。 在如此大规模浪费和损失的情况下，仍有8.4亿人经历着长期的每日饥饿。

column1: Many millions more suffer from “silent hunger” – malnutrition and micronutrient deficiencies.
column2: 更有千百万人遭受着“静默的饥饿 ” — —营养不良和微量元素缺乏。

column1: For the more economically minded, here is another number: food wastage and loss, expressed in producer prices, costs roughly $750 billion per year.
column2: 从经济上看，还有另外一个数字：用生产者价格计算，粮食浪费和损失每年造成约7500亿美元损失。

column1: If we were to consider retail prices and the wider impacts on the environment, including climate change, the figure would be much higher.
column2: 如果我们把零售价格和更广泛的环境冲击（如气候变化）考虑在内，这个数字还要大得多。

column1: In an era of austerity, it is difficult to understand how such a massive hemorrhage of resources could be neglected.
column2: 在紧缩年代，很难理解如此大规模的资源渗漏会被忽视。

column1: In fact, in some places, the volume of food wastage is rising.
column2: 事实上，在一些地区，粮食浪费量还在增长。

column1: Now a new report by the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization focuses on another troubling aspect of the problem: the negative consequences for the environment and the natural resources on which we rely for our survival.
column2: 眼下，联合国粮农组织的一份最新报告关注了这一问题的另一个棘手方面：对我们所赖以生存的环境和自然资源所造成的消极后果。

column1: When food is lost or wasted, the energy, land, and water resources that went into producing it are squandered as well.
column2: 当粮食损失或被浪费时，生产粮食所投入的能源、土地和水资源也随之东流了。

column1: At the same time, large amounts of greenhouse gases are released into the atmosphere during production, processing, and cooking.
column2: 与此同时，在生产、加工和烹饪过程中有大量温室气体排入���气。

column1: From any perspective – ethical, economic, environmental, or in terms of food security – we simply cannot tolerate the annual wastage of 1.3 billion tons of food.
column2: 从伦理、经济、环境以及粮食安全等诸多角度看，我们绝对不能容忍每年浪费13亿吨粮食。

column1: This is why serious reduction of food loss and wastage is one of the five elements of UN Secretary General Ban Ki-moon’s “Zero Hunger Challenge” and a major focus of the UN High Level Task Force on Global Food Security.
column2: 大幅减少粮食损失和浪费成为联合国秘书长潘基文的“零饥饿挑战 ” （ Zero Hunger Challenge）的五大要素之一以及联合国高级别全球粮食安全工作组（UN High Level Task Force on Global Food Security）的主要关注点之一，原因就在于此。

column1: We are working together within the UN system and with a broad coalition of other partners to ensure universal access to adequate food all year round; eliminate childhood stunting; make all food systems sustainable; and eradicate rural poverty.
column2: 我们在联合国系统内共同合作，与其他合作伙伴组成广泛的同盟以确保人人都能全年获得充足的粮食、消灭儿童发育迟缓、让所有粮食体系变得可持续、并根除农村贫困。

column1: Next week, the Global Green Growth Forum in Copenhagen will allow for a deeper look at this issue.
column2: 下周，哥本哈根全球绿色增长论坛（Global Green Growth Forum）将让我们根深度地检视这一问题。

column1: There is much that can be done.
column2: 我们可以做很多事。

column1: For starters, food loss and wastage needs to be seen as a cross-cutting policy issue, rather than a lifestyle choice to be left in the hands of individual consumers and their consciences.
column2: 首先，粮食损失和浪费需要被视为跨越性政策问题，而不只是个人消费者及其良心决定的生活方式选择问题。

column1: The world needs to wake up to the need for policies that address all stages of the food chain, from production to consumption.
column2: 世界需要警醒 — — 我们需要针对包括从生产到消费的整个粮食链的所有阶段的政策。

column1: Food loss – on farms, during processing, transport, and at markets – undermines food security in most developing countries, where post-harvest losses can reach as high as 40% of production.
column2: 粮食损失 — — 在地头、在加工过程中、在运输期间、在市场交易中 — — 威胁着大部分发展中国家的粮食安全，收获后损失可能高达产量的40 % 。

column1: Investment in infrastructure for transport, storage, and marketing of food is badly needed, as are programs to train farmers in best practices.
column2: 粮食运输、存储和营销方面的基础设施投资严重不足，农民也急需培训以了解最佳行动方式。

column1: In developed countries, food-retailing practices require a rethink.
column2: 在发达国家，粮食零售行为也需要反思。

column1: For example, rejection of food products on the basis of aesthetic concerns is a major cause of wastage.
column2: 比如，因审美观念而拒绝粮食生产是极大的浪费源。

column1: Some supermarkets have already begun relaxing standards on fruit appearance, selling “misshapen” items at reduced prices and helping to raise awareness that ugly does not mean bad.
column2: 一些超级市场已开始放松对水果外观的标准，以折扣价售卖“畸形”水果，这有助于让人们了解丑并不意味着差。

column1: More approaches like this – and concerted efforts to find markets or uses for surplus food – are needed.
column2: 我们需要更多的类似行为以及共同寻找剩余粮食的市场和用途。

column1: Businesses and households alike should monitor where and how they waste food and take corrective steps, because prevention of wastage is even more important than recycling or composting.
column2: 企业和家庭应该监控他们在哪些环节浪费了那些粮食，并采取矫正措施，因为预防浪费甚至比回收或堆肥更重要。

column1: Yes, 1.3 billion tons is a mindboggling figure.
column2: 是的，13亿吨是一个令人咋舌的数字。

column1: But these simple steps are easy enough to grasp – and within reach for everyone.
column2: 但这些简单措施很容易掌握，并且人人可以做到。

column1: The world confronts many seemingly intractable problems; food wastage is one issue that we all can do something about now.
column2: 世界面临着诸多看似棘手的问题；粮食浪费是我们可以人人做起、从现在做起的问题。

column1: Argentina’s Griesafault
column2: 阿根廷的葛里萨违约

column1: NEW YORK – On July 30, Argentina’s creditors did not receive their semiannual payment on the bonds that were restructured after the country’s last default in 2001.
column2: 纽约—7月30日，阿根廷债权人没有收到该国2001年违约后经历重组的债券的半年利息。

column1: Argentina had deposited $539 million in the Bank of New York Mellon a few days before.
column2: 几天前，阿根廷在纽约梅隆银行（Bank of New York Mellon）存入了5.39亿美元。

column1: But the bank could not transfer the funds to the creditors: US federal judge Thomas Griesa had ordered that Argentina could not pay the creditors who had accepted its restructuring until it fully paid – including past interest – those who had rejected it.
column2: 但该银行无法把这笔钱转给债权人：美国联邦法官葛里萨（Thomas Griesa）判决，在连本带息足额偿付拒绝重组的债权人之前，阿根廷不能偿付接受重组的债权人。

column1: It was the first time in history that a country was willing and able to pay its creditors, but was blocked by a judge from doing so.
column2: 这是历史上第一次由国家愿意也有能力支付债权人，却被法官阻挠。

column1: The media called it a default by Argentina, but the Twitter hashtag #Griesafault was much more accurate.
column2: 媒体称之为阿根廷违约，但Twitter标签更加正确 — — “葛里萨违约 ” （ #Griesafault ） 。

column1: Argentina has fulfilled its obligations to its citizens and to the creditors who accepted its restructuring.
column2: 阿根廷履行了其对国民和接受重组的债权人的义务。

column1: Griesa’s ruling, however, encourages usurious behavior, threatens the functioning of international financial markets, and defies a basic tenet of modern capitalism: insolvent debtors need a fresh start.
column2: 但葛里萨的裁决却在鼓励高利贷行为，威胁了国际金融市场的运行，也践踏了现代资本主义的一条基本原则：资不抵债的债务人需要从新开始。

column1: Sovereign defaults are common events with many causes.
column2: 主权违约是一个常见现象，原因多种多样。

column1: For Argentina, the path to its 2001 default started with the ballooning of its sovereign debt in the 1990s, which occurred alongside neoliberal “Washington Consensus” economic reforms that creditors believed would enrich the country.
column2: 就阿根廷而言，2001年的违约起因是20世纪90年代积累了太多的主权债务，而这又是拜“华盛顿共识”所赐。 债权人相信，新自由主义的华盛顿共识经济改革能让阿根廷走向富裕。

column1: The experiment failed, and the country suffered a deep economic and social crisis, with a recession that lasted from 1998 to 2002.
column2: 这场实验以失败告终，阿根廷也经历了深刻的经济和社会危机，衰退从1998年一直持续到2002年。

column1: By the end, a record-high 57.5% of Argentinians were in poverty, and the unemployment rate skyrocketed to 20.8%.
column2: 最终，创纪录的57.5%的阿根廷人陷入贫困，失业率也一飞冲天，达到了20.8 % 。

column1: Argentina restructured its debt in two rounds of negotiations, in 2005 and 2010.
column2: 阿根廷通过两轮谈判（2005年和2010年）重组了债务。

column1: More than 92% of creditors accepted the new deal, and received exchanged bonds and GDP-indexed bonds.
column2: 92%的债权人接受了新协议，并获得了与GDP挂钩的替换债券。

column1: It worked out well for both Argentina and those who accepted the restructuring.
column2: 对阿根廷和接受重组的债权人来说，这一新协议相当成功。

column1: The economy soared, so the GDP-indexed bonds paid off handsomely.
column2: 阿根廷经济实现了腾飞，GDP挂钩债券的偿付情况也非常不错。

column1: But so-called vulture investors saw an opportunity to make even larger profits.
column2: 但所谓的兀鹫投资者看到了攫取更大利润的机会。

column1: The vultures were neither long-term investors in Argentina nor the optimists who believed that Washington Consensus policies would work.
column2: 这些“兀鹫”既非阿根廷长期投资者，亦非认为华盛顿共识能够奏效的乐观派。

column1: They were simply speculators who swooped in after the 2001 default and bought up bonds for a fraction of their face value from panicky investors.
column2: 他们无非是投机客，在2001年违约时猛冲下来，以面值的几分之一从恐慌的投资者手中收购债券。

column1: They then sued Argentina to obtain 100% of that value.
column2: 然后，他们把阿根廷告上法庭，要求获得100%的债券价值。

column1: NML Capital, a subsidiary of the hedge fund Elliot Management, headed by Paul Singer, spent $48 million on bonds in 2008; thanks to Griesa’s ruling, NML Capital should now receive $832 million – a return of more than 1,600%.
column2: 对冲基金艾略特管理公司（Elliot Management）旗下的NML资本公司在保罗·辛格（Paul Singer）的带领下于2008年花了4,800万美元购买这些债券；根据葛里萨的裁决，NML资本公司现在应该获得8.32亿美元 — — 回报超过1,600 % 。

column1: The figures are so high in part because the vultures seek to earn past interest, which, for some securities, includes a country-risk premium – the higher interest rate offered when they were issued to offset the larger perceived probability of default.
column2: 如此高的回报部分是因为兀鹫投资者要求获得过去的利息，而对一些证券来说，其中需要包含国家风险溢价 — — 当违约概率较高时，债券发行就必须提供更高的利率作为补偿。

column1: Griesa found that this was reasonable.
column2: 葛里萨认为这是合理的。

column1: Economically, though, it makes no sense.
column2: 但是，从经济上讲，这毫无意义。

column1: When a country pays a risk premium on its debt, it means that default is a possibility.
column2: 当一国为其债务支付风险溢价时，这意味着违约成为可能。

column1: But if a court rules that a country always must repay the debt, there is no default risk to be compensated.
column2: 但如果法庭裁决一国永远必须偿付债务，就不存在需要补偿的违约风险。

column1: Repayment on Griesa’s terms would devastate Argentina’s economy.
column2: 根据葛里萨的要求实行偿付会毁掉阿根廷经济。

column1: NML Capital and the other vultures comprise just 1% of the creditors, but would receive a total of $1.5 billion.
column2: MNL资本公司和其他兀鹫投资者只占债权人的1 % ， 但总共可以获得15亿美元。

column1: Other holdouts (6.6% of total creditors) would receive $15 billion.
column2: 其他坚持抵制的债权人（占债权人数量的6.6 % ） 可以获得150亿美元。

column1: And, because the debt restructuring stipulated that all of the creditors who accepted it could demand the same terms as holdouts receive, Argentina might be on the hook for $140 billion more.
column2: 而由于债务重组规定所有者接受方案的债权人都可以要求与坚持抵制的债权人相同的条件，因此阿根廷可能会因此多付出1,400亿美元。

column1: Every Argentine might thus owe more than $3,500 – more than one-third of average annual per capita income.
column2: 这样一来，每个阿根廷都背上了3,500多美元的债务 — — 相当于人均收入的三分之一以上。

column1: In the United States, applying the equivalent proportion would mean forcing every citizen to pay roughly $20,000 – all to line the pockets of some billionaires, intent on wringing the country dry.
column2: 若是在美国，这相当于强迫每位公民付出约20,000美元，而这笔钱几乎全部流入了少数企图榨干这个国家的亿万富翁的腰包。

column1: What’s more, the existence of credit default swaps creates the possibility of further gains for the vultures.
column2: 不仅如此，信用违约互换（CDS）的存在使得兀鹫投资者还有进一步获利的可能。

column1: A CDS insures against a default, paying off if the bonds do not. They can yield substantial returns, regardless of whether the bonds are repaid – thus reducing their holders’ incentive to achieve an agreement.
column2: CDS相当于违约保险，在债券无法偿付时赔偿持有人，它可以产生巨大的回报，不管债券是否被偿付 — — 从而刺激持有人达成协议。

column1: In the run-up to July 30, the vultures conducted a scare campaign.
column2: 7月30日，兀鹫投资者发动了一场恐吓行动。

column1: A second default in 13 years would be a big setback for Argentina, they claimed, threatening the country’s fragile economy.
column2: 他们说，13年后的第二次违约将是阿根廷的一次重大退步，威胁到脆弱的国家经济。

column1: But all of this presumed that financial markets would not distinguish between a default and a Griesafault.
column2: 但他们的论断有一个前提：金融市场无法区分违约和葛里萨违约。

column1: Fortunately, they did: Interest rates for different categories of Argentine corporate loans have not reacted to the event.
column2: 幸运的是，金融市场有这个能力：不同类型的阿根廷公司贷款的利率并未对此事件产生反应。

column1: In fact, borrowing costs on July 30 were lower than the average for the whole year.
column2: 事实上，7月30日的借贷成本低于全年平均水平。

column1: Ultimately, though, the Griesafault will carry a high price – less for Argentina than for the global economy and countries needing access to foreign financing.
column2: 但是，最终葛里萨违约会带来高昂代价 — — 相对于阿根廷，全球经济和需要外国融资的国家受影响更大。

column1: America will suffer, too.
column2: 美国也会蒙受损失。

column1: Its courts have been a travesty: As one observer pointed out,it was clear that Griesa never really fathomed the issue’s complexity.
column2: 美国法院已经成了嘲弄对象。 一位观察家指出，显然葛里萨根本不明白此事的复杂性。

column1: The US financial system, already practiced at exploiting poor Americans, has extended its efforts globally.
column2: 大肆掠夺美国穷人的美国金融体系要把触手伸向全球。

column1: Sovereign borrowers will not – and should not – trust the fairness and competence of the US judiciary.
column2: 主权债务人不会 — — 也不应该 — — 相信美国司法的公平和胜任能力了。

column1: The market for issuance of such bonds will move elsewhere.
column2: 这些债券的发行市场会转向别处。

column1: Debeaking the Vultures
column2: 切掉兀鹫之喙

column1: NEW YORK – In the midst of the ongoing dispute between Argentina and the “vulture funds” that hold its bonds, a broad consensus has emerged concerning the need for sovereign-debt restructuring mechanisms (SDRMs).
column2: 纽约—在阿根廷与持有其债券的“兀鹫基金”之间闹得不可开交之际，一个共识已经浮现：我们需要主权债务重组机制（SDRM ） 。

column1: Otherwise, US Federal Judge Thomas P. Griesa’s ruling that Argentina must pay the vultures in full (after 93% of other bondholders agreed to a restructuring) will give free rein to opportunistic behaviors that sabotage future restructurings.
column2: 否则，美国联邦法官托马斯·葛里萨（Thomas P. Griesa）的裁决 — — 阿根廷必须足额偿付兀鹫（尽管93%的其他债券持有者同意重组 ） — —将让机会主义者肆无忌惮地阻挠未来重组。

column1: Most recently, the International Capital Market Association (ICMA) recommended new terms for government bonds.
column2: 最近，国际资本市场协会（International Capital Market Association，ICMA）建议对政府债券采取新条款。

column1: Though the ICMA’s proposal leaves unresolved the hundreds of billions of bonds written under the old terms, the new framework says in effect that Griesa’s interpretation was wrong, and recognizes that leaving it in place would make restructuring impossible.
column2: 尽管ICMA的建议保留了数千亿已发行债券的旧条款，但新框架事实上宣判了葛里萨的裁决是错误的，并认为让该裁决继续存在下去将让重组无从进行。

column1: The ICMA’s proposed contractual terms clarify the pari passu clause that was at the heart of Griesa’s muddle-headed ruling.
column2: ICMA所建议的合约条款明确了作为葛里萨糊涂裁决核心的平等权利条款。

column1: The intent of the clause – a standard component of sovereign-bond contracts – was always to ensure that the issuing country treated identical bondholders identically.
column2: 该条款是主权债券合约的标准组成部分，其初衷总是为了确保发行无差别地对待相同的债券持有人。

column1: But it has always been recognized that senior creditors – for example, the International Monetary Fund – are treated differently.
column2: 但人们总是认为高级债权人 — — 比如国际货币基金组织（IMF）能受到区别对待。

column1: Griesa did not seem to grasp the common understanding of the clause.
column2: 葛里萨似乎没有抓住对该条款的普遍理解。

column1: After Argentina defaulted on its sovereign debt in 2001, vulture funds bought defaulted bonds in the secondary market at a fraction of their face value, and then sued for full payment.
column2: 在2001年阿根廷对其主权债务违约后，兀鹫基金在二级市场以面值的几分之一买入违约的债券，然后起诉要求足额偿付。

column1: According to Griesa’s interpretation of pari passu, if Argentina paid the interest that it owed to creditors that accepted the restructuring, it had to pay the vultures in full – including all past interest and the principal.
column2: 根据葛里萨对权利平等条款的解释，如果阿根廷向接受重组的债券人偿付利息，就必须足额偿付兀鹫 — — 包括之前的所有本息。

column1: The vultures’ business was enabled in part by litigation over the so-called champerty defense – based on a longstanding English common-law doctrine, later adopted by US state legislatures, prohibiting the purchase of debt with the intent of bringing a lawsuit.
column2: 兀鹫之所以能如此行事，部分是拜所谓的帮诉辩护（champerty defense）诉讼所赐 — — 其基础是由来已久的英国普通法概念，随后被美国州立法机关所采纳，禁止以打官司为目的购买债券。

column1: Argentina is simply the latest victim in the vultures’ long legal battle to change the rules of the game to permit them to prey on poor countries seeking to restructure their debts.
column2: 阿根廷只是最新的受害者 — — 长期以来，兀鹫一直在进行法律斗争改变游戏规则，以使他们能掠食试图重组债务的穷国。

column1: In 1999, in Elliot Associates, LP v. Banco de la Nacion and the Republic of Peru, the Second Circuit Court of Appeals determined that the plaintiff’s intent in purchasing the discounted debt was to be paid in full or otherwise to sue.
column2: 1999年，在艾略特联合工作四诉秘鲁共和国国民银行案（Elliot Associates, LP v. Banco de la Nacion and the Republic of Peru）中，第二巡回上诉法院裁决原告购买折价债务的意图是为了获得足额偿付，否则原告就会上诉。

column1: The court then ruled that Elliot’s intent, because it was contingent, did not meet the champerty requirement.
column2: 因此，法院裁定艾略特公司的意图 — — 因其具有或有性 — — 不符合帮诉条件。

column1: Though some other courts accepted the Second Circuit’s narrow reading of the champerty defense, the vultures were not satisfied and went to the New York state legislature, which in 2004 effectively eliminated the defense of champerty concerning any debt purchase above $500,000.
column2: 尽管其他一些法院接受了第二巡回法院关于帮诉辩护的狭义解读，但兀鹫并没有就此满足，而是来到纽约州立法机关。 2004年，纽约州立法机关事实上取消了金额超过500,000美元的所有债务购买行为的帮诉辩护。

column1: That decision contradicted understandings according to which hundreds of billions of dollars of debt had already been issued.
column2: 这一决定有悖于数千亿美元已发行债务所根据的理解。

column1: Investors who acquire defaulted sovereign debt at huge discounts should not expect repayment in full; the discount is an indication that the market does not expect that, and it is only through litigation that one could hope to receive anything close to it.
column2: 以巨大折价买入违约主权债务投资者不应该期待足额偿付；折价已经表明市场并不期待能够如此，只有诉讼才有可能让投资者接近这一目标。

column1: An important change in the legal framework, such as the elimination of the champerty defense, is de facto a change in “property rights,” with the debtors losing, and creditors who purchase the bonds intending to sue if they are not paid what they want – the vultures – gaining.
column2: 法律框架的重要变化，比如取消帮诉辩护，实际上是一种“产权”变化，债务人受损，购买债券以便为了得不到想要的偿付时起诉的债权人 — — 即兀鹫 — — 获益。

column1: The vultures were thus unjustly enriched, doubly so with the novel and unjustified interpretation of the pari passu clause.
column2: 因此，兀鹫大发不义之财，因为对平等权利条款的不公平的“奇葩”解释让利润翻番。

column1: Will so-called collective-action clauses (CACs) – another aspect of the ICMA “reform” aimed at debeaking the vultures – save the day?
column2: 所谓的集体行动条款（collective-action clauses ） — —ICMA旨在打击兀鹫的“改革”的另一个重要方面 — — 能力挽狂澜吗？

column1: In many countries, CACs stipulate that if, say, two-thirds of the investors accept a company’s (or a country’s) restructuring proposal, the other investors are bound to go along.
column2: 在许多国家，集体行动条款规定，如果（比如）三分之二的投资者接受某公司（或某国）的重组方案，其他投资者也必须遵守。

column1: This mechanism prevents speculative holdouts from holding up the restructuring process and demanding ransom.
column2: 该机制阻止了投机性强硬派劫持重组程序、要求赎回。

column1: But CACs do not exist for sovereign debt written in many jurisdictions, leaving the field open for the vultures.
column2: 但很多司法辖区所发行的主权债务中不含集体行动条款，这给兀鹫的行动创造了条件。

column1: Moreover, CACs are no panacea.
column2: 此外，集体行动条款也不是万灵丹。

column1: If they were, there would be no need for domestic bankruptcy law, which spells out issues like precedence and fair treatment.
column2: 如果是的话，就不需要国内破产法了，破产法的存在就是为了避免效仿先例和公平对待。

column1: But no government has found CACs adequate for resolving domestic restructuring.
column2: 但没有一个政府发现集体行动条款已足以解决国内重组。

column1: So why should we think that they would suffice in the much more complex world of sovereign-debt restructurings?
column2: 既然如此，我们又怎么能认为它们能胜任于复杂得多的主权债务重组问题呢？

column1: In particular, CACs suffer from the problem of “aggregation.”
column2: 特别是，集体行动条款受“加总”问题的困扰。

column1: If a CAC required, say, 75% of the holders of each bond class, vultures could buy 26% of only one bond class and block the entire restructuring.
column2: 如果集体行动条款要求（比如）每种债券级别都有75%多数的持有者，那么兀鹫只要买入一种债券类别的26 % ， 就可以阻挠整个重组。

column1: The recent Greek debt restructuring had to confront this issue.
column2: 最近的希腊债务重组就不得不面临这一问题。

column1: The ICMA’s new framework seems to provide a way out: The supermajority would be defined by the acceptance of the aggregate principal amount of outstanding debt securities of all of the affected series.
column2: ICMA的新框架似乎提供了解决之道：绝对多数由所有受影响序列的未偿还债务政权的总本金数量决定。

column1: The supermajority’s decisions would be binding on all other investors.
column2: 所有其他投资者都必须遵守绝对多数的决定。

column1: But this, too, poses a problem: The more junior creditors could vote to have themselves treated in the same way as more senior creditors.
column2: 但这也存在一个问题：多数低级债权人可以投票使自己获得与多数高级债权人同样的地位。

column1: What recourse would the senior creditors then have?
column2: 那么，高级债权人能获得什么索偿权呢？

column1: In bankruptcy court, they would have grounds for objecting, and the judge would have to weigh the equities.
column2: 在破产法庭，他们有反对权，法官将根据他们的要求权衡。

column1: These issues are especially important in the context of sovereign-debt restructurings, because the claimants to a country’s resources include not only formal creditors; others, too – for example, pensioners – might not be paid if bondholders are paid in full.
column2: 这些问题在主权债务重组中特别重要，因为对某国的索偿权的主张者不但包括正式债权人；如果债券持有人获得足额偿付，其他人 — — 比如退休者 — — 也可能无法获得偿付。

column1: Chapter 9 of the US Bankruptcy Code (which applies to public entities) recognizes these rights – unlike Griesa and the vultures.
column2: 美国破产法第九章（适用于公共实体）承认这些权利 — — 这与葛里萨和兀鹫不同。

column1: Today, the international community faces two challenges.
column2: 如今，国际社会面临两大挑战。

column1: One is to deal with the hundreds of billions of dollars of debt written under the old terms, which cannot be restructured under Griesa’s ruling.
column2: 一是处置根据旧条款发行的数千亿美元债务，它们无法根据葛里萨的裁决重组。

column1: The second is to decide on the terms that should be imposed in the future.
column2: 二是决定应在未来采用的条款。

column1: The investing community has made a serious proposal.
column2: 投资界提出了严肃的方案。

column1: But changes of this magnitude must be based on discussions among creditors and debtor governments – and more is needed than tweaking the terms of the agreements.
column2: 但这种程度的变化必须基于债权人和债务人政府之间的讨论 — — 也不是光在协议条款问题上扯皮就行的。

column1: An initiative at the United Nations to encourage the establishment of SDRMs is receiving the support of prominent academic economists and practitioners.
column2: 联合国鼓励建立主权债务重组机制的计划受到了著名经济学者和实践家的支持。

column1: Global efforts are good first steps to remedy the damage to international financial markets that the US courts have inflicted.
column2: 全球努力是弥补美国法院所造成的国际金融市场伤害的可喜的第一步。

column1: For the sake of a healthy global economy, the vultures must be grounded.
column2: 为了全球经济的健康，不能放纵兀鹫肆虐。

column1: Stagnation by Design
column2: 人造停滞

column1: NEW YORK – Soon after the global financial crisis erupted in 2008, I warned that unless the right policies were adopted, Japanese-style malaise – slow growth and near-stagnant incomes for years to come – could set in.
column2: 纽约—2008年，全球金融危机爆发不久，我警告说除非采取正确的政策，否则将会出现日本式问题 — — 多年的经济增长缓慢和收入近乎停滞。

column1: While leaders on both sides of the Atlantic claimed that they had learned the lessons of Japan, they promptly proceeded to repeat some of the same mistakes.
column2: 尽管大西洋两岸的领导人纷纷表示已经吸取了日本的教训，但他们仍在积极地重复相同的错误。

column1: Now, even a key former United States official, the economist Larry Summers, is warning of secular stagnation.
column2: 如今，甚至前美国高级官员、经济学家萨默斯（Larry Summers）也在警告长期停滞。

column1: The basic point that I raised a half-decade ago was that, in a fundamental sense, the US economy was sick even before the crisis: it was only an asset-price bubble, created through lax regulation and low interest rates, that had made the economy seem robust.
column2: 我在五年前所提出的的基本要点是，从根本上说，美国经济在危机之前便已出现问题：它只是一个被宽松的监管和低利率资产价格泡沫，经济只是看起来强健。

column1: Beneath the surface, numerous problems were festering: growing inequality; an unmet need for structural reform (moving from a manufacturing-based economy to services and adapting to changing global comparative advantages); persistent global imbalances; and a financial system more attuned to speculating than to making investments that would create jobs, increase productivity, and redeploy surpluses to maximize social returns.
column2: 在表面之下，诸多问题正在发酵：不平等性日益增加、结构性改革（从基于制造业的经济转向服务业并适应全球比较优势的变化）的需要得不到满足、持续的全球失衡；以及金融系统更习惯于投机而不是创造就业岗位、提高生产率和利用盈余实现社会回报最大化的投资。

column1: Policymakers’ response to the crisis failed to address these issues; worse, it exacerbated some of them and created new ones – and not just in the US.
column2: 决策者对危机的反应并没有纠正这些问题；更糟糕的是，反而加剧了其中一些问题并创造了新的问题 — — 不仅美国是如此。

column1: The result has been increased indebtedness in many countries, as the collapse of GDP undermined government revenues.
column2: 结果是随着GDP暴降影响了政府岁入，许多国家负债水平增加。

column1: Moreover, underinvestment in both the public and private sector has created a generation of young people who have spent years idle and increasingly alienated at a point in their lives when they should have been honing their skills and increasing their productivity.
column2: 此外，公共和私人部门的投资不足让一代年轻人在应该打磨技能、提高生产率的时期荒废并日益疏远着。

column1: On both sides of the Atlantic, GDP is likely to grow considerably faster this year than in 2013.
column2: 在大西洋两岸，今年GDP增长有望大大快于2013年。

column1: But, before leaders who embraced austerity policies open the champagne and toast themselves, they should examine where we are and consider the near-irreparable damage that these policies have caused.
column2: 但是，在采取紧缩政策领导人开香槟庆祝之前，他们应该考察一下我们的现状并看看这些政策所导致的几乎不可挽回的伤害。

column1: Every downturn eventually comes to an end.
column2: 任何衰退终究有结束的一天。

column1: The mark of a good policy is that it succeeds in making the downturn shallower and shorter than it otherwise would have been.
column2: 好政策的标志是它能让衰退期变得更浅、更短。

column1: The mark of the austerity policies that many governments embraced is that they made the downturn far deeper and longer than was necessary, with long-lasting consequences.
column2: 许多政府所亲爱去的紧缩政策的标志是它们让衰退变得比必要程度深得多、长得多，而且还造成了长期后果。

column1: Real (inflation-adjusted) GDP per capita is lower in most of the North Atlantic than it was in 2007; in Greece, the economy has shrunk by an estimated 23%.
column2: 大部分北大西洋国家的实际（经通胀调整的）GDP低于2007年；在希腊，经济收缩幅度估计达到了23 % 。

column1: Germany, the top-performing European country, has recorded miserly 0.7% average annual growth over the last six years.
column2: 表现最出色的欧洲国家德国在过去六年里年均增长率也只有0.7 % 。

column1: The US economy is still roughly 15% smaller than it would have been had growth continued even on the moderate pre-crisis trajectory.
column2: 美国经济规模仍比增长延续危机前温和水平的情形小15 % 。

column1: But even these numbers do not tell the full story of how bad things are, because GDP is not a good measure of success.
column2: 但这些数字也不能充分说明事情到底有多坏，因为GDP不是一个衡量成功的好指标。

column1: Far more relevant is what is happening to household incomes.
column2: 更相关的指标是家庭收入情况。

column1: Median real income in the US is below its level in 1989, a quarter-century ago; median income for full-time male workers is lower now than it was more than 40 years ago.
column2: 美国中位实际收入比1989年（即二十五年前）的水平还要低；全职男性员工中位收入还不如40多年前的水平。

column1: Some, like the economist Robert Gordon, have suggested that we should adjust to a new reality in which long-term productivity growth will be significantly below what it has been over the past century.
column2: 经济学家戈登（Robert Gordon）等人指出，我们应该对新的现实做出反应 — — 长期生产率增长将远低于过去一个世纪。

column1: Given economists’ miserable record – reflected in the run-up to the crisis – for even three-year predictions, no one should have much confidence in a crystal ball that forecasts decades into the future.
column2: 经济学家的预测向来靠不住 — — 哪怕是预测短短三年，这在此次危机过程中已经尽显无疑 — — 因此对于几十年后的未来，我们不能对水晶球抱有多大信心。

column1: But this much seems clear: unless government policies change, we are in for a long period of disappointment.
column2: 但有一点是显而易见的：除非政府政策有所变化，否则我们将迎来长期失望。

column1: Markets are not self-correcting.
column2: 市场不是自我纠正的。

column1: The underlying fundamental problems that I outlined earlier could get worse – and many are.
column2: 我早前所列举的基本问题可能会进一步恶化 — — 其中许多确实恶化了。

column1: Inequality leads to weak demand; widening inequality weakens demand even more; and, in most countries, including the US, the crisis has only worsened inequality.
column2: 不平等性让需求萎靡不振；加剧的不平等性让需求更加萎靡不振；而在包括美国在内的许多国家，危机正是恶化了不平等性。

column1: The trade surpluses of northern Europe have increased, even as China’s have moderated.
column2: 北欧的贸易盈余有所增加，虽然中国贸易盈余有所减少。

column1: Most important, markets have never been very good at achieving structural transformations quickly on their own; the transition from agriculture to manufacturing, for example, was anything but smooth; on the contrary, it was accompanied by significant social dislocation and the Great Depression.
column2: 最重要的是，市场从不擅长自动快速实现结构转型；比如，从农业到制造业的转型是非常不平滑的；而是伴随着巨大的社会动荡和大萧条。

column1: This time is no different, but in some ways it could be worse: the sectors that should be growing, reflecting the needs and desires of citizens, are services like education and health, which traditionally have been publicly financed, and for good reason.
column2: 这次也不会不一样，但从某种程度上说可能更加糟糕：应该出现增长的部门 — — 因为它们反映了人民的需要和渴望 — — 是教育和健康等服务部门，在传统上，这些部门都是由公共资金支撑的，其中的道理不言自明。

column1: But, rather than government facilitating the transition, austerity is inhibiting it.
column2: 但是，政府不但没有协助转型，还通过紧缩制约了它。

column1: Malaise is better than a recession, and a recession is better than a depression.
column2: 停滞比衰退好，衰退又比萧条好。

column1: But the difficulties that we are facing now are not the result of the inexorable laws of economics, to which we simply must adjust, as we would to a natural disaster, like an earthquake or tsunami.
column2: 但我们目前所面临的困难不是无情的经济定律 — — 对于经济定律，我们只能适应，就像对地震和海啸等自然灾难那样。

column1: They are not even a kind of penance that we have to pay for past sins – though, to be sure, the neoliberal policies that have prevailed for the past three decades have much to do with our current predicament.
column2: 我们目前所面临的困境甚至也算不上因为过去的罪恶而不得不付出的苦行 — — 尽管平心而论，过去三十年所流行的新自由主义政策与当前困境关系很大。

column1: Instead, our current difficulties are the result of flawed policies.
column2: 相反，我们当前的困难是政策缺陷带来的。

column1: There are alternatives.
column2: 我们有不同的政策可用。

column1: But we will not find them in the self-satisfied complacency of the elites, whose incomes and stock portfolios are once again soaring.
column2: 但在精英自我满足的自鸣得意中 — — 他们的收入和股票组合又开始飙涨了 — — 我们无法看到不同的政策。

column1: Only some people, it seems, must adjust to a permanently lower standard of living.
column2: 看起来只有一部分人必须作出调整以适应持久的生活水平下降。

column1: Unfortunately, those people happen to be most people.
column2: 不幸的是，这部分人正好是大部分人。

column1: The Innovation Enigma
column2: 创新之谜

column1: NEW YORK – Around the world, there is enormous enthusiasm for the type of technological innovation symbolized by Silicon Valley.
column2: 纽约—环顾世界，人们对以硅谷为象征的科技创新有着无尽的热情。

column1: In this view, America’s ingenuity represents its true comparative advantage, which others strive to imitate.
column2: 在这些人看来，美国的聪慧代表着它的真正比较优势，其他国家都在尽力模仿。

column1: But there is a puzzle: it is difficult to detect the benefits of this innovation in GDP statistics.
column2: 但在这里有一个迷：很难看出这种创新对GDP统计数字的贡献。

column1: What is happening today is analogous to developments a few decades ago, early in the era of personal computers.
column2: 今天所发生的事情与几十年前个人电脑时代肇始时有几分相似。

column1: In 1987, economist Robert Solow – awarded the Nobel Prize for his pioneering work on growth – lamented that “You can see the computer age everywhere but in the productivity statistics.”
column2: 1987年，因在增长方面的开创性贡献而荣获诺贝尔奖的经济学家罗伯特·索洛（Robert Solow）哀叹 ： “ 电脑时代的印记随处可见，就是在生产率数据中看不到 。 ”

column1: There are several possible explanations for this.
column2: 对于这一点，可能的原因有好几个。

column1: Perhaps GDP does not really capture the improvements in living standards that computer-age innovation is engendering.
column2: 也许GDP并不真正能够体现电脑时代的创新所带来的生活水平的提高。

column1: Or perhaps this innovation is less significant than its enthusiasts believe.
column2: 或者这一创新并没有热烈支持者所认为的那么意义重大。

column1: As it turns out, there is some truth in both perspectives.
column2: 事实表明，两者兼而有之。

column1: Recall how a few years ago, just before the collapse of Lehman Brothers, the financial sector prided itself on its innovativeness.
column2: 不妨回忆一下，几年前，雷曼兄弟倒闭前夕，金融部门以创新而自负。

column1: Given that financial institutions had been attracting the best and brightest from around the world, one would have expected nothing less.
column2: 金融机构吸引着全世界最优秀、最聪明的人才，你还能期待什么呢？

column1: But, upon closer inspection, it became clear that most of this innovation involved devising better ways of scamming others, manipulating markets without getting caught (at least for a long time), and exploiting market power.
column2: 但是，近距离的检视表明，金融创新大部分无非是更好地蒙骗他人、操纵市场而不被抓住（或者在相当长的时间里不被抓住）以及利用市场权力。

column1: In this period, when resources flowed to this “innovative” sector, GDP growth was markedly lower than it was before.
column2: 在此期间，资源纷纷流入这一“创新”部门，而GDP增长比此前显著地降低了。

column1: Even in the best of times, it did not lead to an increase in living standards (except for the bankers), and it eventually led to the crisis from which we are only now recovering.
column2: 即使在最佳时期，它也没有提高生活水平（银行家除外 ） ， 最终还导致了我们至今仍在尽力摆脱的危机。

column1: The net social contribution of all of this “innovation” was negative.
column2: 这一“创新”的净社会贡献是负数。

column1: Similarly, the dot-com bubble that preceded this period was marked by innovation – Web sites through which one could order dog food and soft drinks online.
column2: 类似地，前一次互联网泡沫也打着创新的幌子，尽是些可以让你在线订购狗粮和软饮料的网站。

column1: At least this era left a legacy of efficient search engines and a fiber-optic infrastructure.
column2: 这次创新潮好歹还留下了管用的搜索引擎和光纤基础设施。

column1: But it is not an easy matter to assess how the time savings implied by online shopping, or the cost savings that might result from increased competition (owing to greater ease of price comparison online), affects our standard of living.
column2: 但很难说在线购物所节省的时间，或者竞争的提高（因为上网比较价格比以前方便了很多）所节省的成本在多大程度上影响了我们的生活水平。

column1: Two things should be clear.
column2: 有两点应该澄清。

column1: First, the profitability of an innovation may not be a good measure of its net contribution to our standard of living.
column2: 首先，创新的盈利能力并不是衡量其对我们的生活水平的净贡献的耗指标。

column1: In our winner-takes-all economy, an innovator who develops a better Web site for online dog-food purchases and deliveries may attract everyone around the world who uses the Internet to order dog food, making enormous profits in the process.
column2: 在赢家通吃的经济中，开发出更好的在线狗粮购买和递送网站的创新者可能把全世界所有用互联网订购狗粮的用户都吸引过去，在此过程中赚取大笔利润。

column1: But without the delivery service, much of those profits simply would have gone to others.
column2: 但若没有递送服务，这笔利润的大部分将流入他人的腰包。

column1: The Web site’s net contribution to economic growth may in fact be relatively small.
column2: 网站对经济增长的净贡献事实上可能相对很小。

column1: Moreover, if an innovation, such as ATMs in banking, leads to increased unemployment, none of the social cost – neither the suffering of those who are laid off nor the increased fiscal cost of paying them unemployment benefits – is reflected in firms’ profitability.
column2: 此外，如果一项创新，如银行ATM机，增加了失业，则这一社会成本 — — 不管是被裁员者所遭遇的困难还是给他们发放失业救济增加的财政负担 — — 并不会体现在企业的盈利能力中。

column1: Likewise, our GDP metric does not reflect the cost of the increased insecurity individuals may feel with the increased risk of a loss of a job.
column2: 类似地，我们的GDP数字也不会反映个体因丢掉工作风险增加而感受到了不安全感。

column1: Equally important, it often does not accurately reflect the improvement in societal wellbeing resulting from innovation.
column2: 同样重要的是，它通常无法准确反映创新所带来的社会福利改善。

column1: In a simpler world, where innovation simply meant lowering the cost of production of, say, an automobile, it was easy to assess an innovation’s value.
column2: 在更简单的世界中，创新无非意味着降低（比如汽车的）生产成本，评估创新的价值就比较容易。

column1: But when innovation affects an automobile’s quality, the task becomes far more difficult.
column2: 但如若创新影响的是汽车的质量，则评估其价值就比较困难了。

column1: And this is even more apparent in other arenas: How do we accurately assess the fact that, owing to medical progress, heart surgery is more likely to be successful now than in the past, leading to a significant increase in life expectancy and quality of life?
column2: 其他领域就更加如此了：我们如何准确地评现在估心脏手术因为医学进步而比过去增加的成功率，从而极大地增加了寿命预期、改善了生命质量这一事实？

column1: Still, one cannot avoid the uneasy feeling that, when all is said and done, the contribution of recent technological innovations to long-term growth in living standards may be substantially less than the enthusiasts claim.
column2: 但是，你无法摆脱一种不安感，即，当一切都说到做尽时，最新的科技创新对长期生活水平增长的贡献可能远远不如拥趸所宣称的。

column1: A lot of intellectual effort has been devoted to devising better ways of maximizing advertising and marketing budgets – targeting customers, especially the affluent, who might actually buy the product.
column2: 大量知识创新被用在了构思更好的最大化广告和影响预算的办法上 — — 将目标定位在实际可能购买产品的客户，特别是生活丰裕人群。

column1: But standards of living might have been raised even more if all of this innovative talent had been allocated to more fundamental research – or even to more applied research that could have led to new products.
column2: 但如果创新天才用在更基本的研究上，或者用在能带来新产品的应用性更强的研究上，生活水平或许能得到更多的提升。

column1: Yes, being better connected with each other, through Facebook or Twitter, is valuable.
column2: 是的，通过Facebook和Twitter更好地与他人互联是很有价值的。

column1: But how can we compare these innovations with those like the laser, the transistor, the Turing machine, and the mapping of the human genome, each of which has led to a flood of transformative products?
column2: 但我们如何将这类创新与激光、晶体管、图灵机和人类基因组图谱这样的创新相比？ 后四者都带来了如潮水般的变革型产品。

column1: Of course, there are grounds for a sigh of relief.
column2: 当然，我们也有理由不必瞎操心。

column1: Although we may not know how much recent technological innovations are contributing to our wellbeing, at least we know that, unlike the wave of financial innovations that marked the pre-crisis global economy, the effect is positive.
column2: 尽管我们可能不知道最近的科技创新能给我们的福利形成多大贡献，但我们至少知道它们不是代表危机前全球经济的金融创新，它们的效果至少是正数。

column1: Reforming China’s State-Market Balance
column2: 改革中国的国家-市场平衡

column1: BEIJING – No country in recorded history has grown as fast – and moved as many people out of poverty – as China over the last thirty years.
column2: 北京—在有记录的历史中，没有一个国家可以向过去三十年中的中国那样增长得如此之快、将如此之多的人口带出贫困。

column1: A hallmark of China’s success has been its leaders’ willingness to revise the country’s economic model when and as needed, despite opposition from powerful vested interests.
column2: 中国的成功的一大标志是其领导人愿意在需要时改变经济模式，即使面对强大的既得利益。

column1: And now, as China implements another series of fundamental reforms, such interests are already lining up to resist.
column2: 如今，当中国再次实施根本性改革时，既得利益又要竭力阻止了。

column1: Can the reformers triumph again?
column2: 改革派能够再次取胜吗？

column1: In answering that question, the crucial point to bear in mind is that, as in the past, the current round of reforms will restructure not only the economy, but also the vested interests that will shape future reforms (and even determine whether they are possible).
column2: 要��答这一问题，一个需要铭记的关键点是，和过去一样，当前的改革重构的将不止是经济，还包括将决定未来改革面貌（甚至决定是否会发生未来改革）的既得利益。

column1: And today, while high-profile initiatives – for example, the government’s widening anti-corruption campaign – receive much attention, the deeper issue that China faces concerns the appropriate roles of the state and the market.
column2: 如今，尽管高姿态的措施 — — 比如扩大反腐运动 — — 吸引了大量注意力，但中国面临的更深层次的问题是国家和市场的合适角色问题。

column1: When China began its reforms more than three decades ago, the direction was clear: the market needed to play a far greater role in resource allocation.
column2: 三十年前中国开始改革开放时，方向是明确的：市场应该在资源配置中起到远比现状更大的作用。

column1: And so it has, with the private sector far more important now than it was.
column2: 结果也是如此，如今私人部门比昔日重要不知凡几。

column1: Moreover, there is a broad consensus that the market needs to play what officials call a “decisive role” in many sectors where state-owned enterprises (SOEs) dominate.
column2: 此外，一个广泛的共识是市场应该在许多国有企业主导的部门扮演官方所谓的“基础性作用 ” 。

column1: But what should its role be in other sectors, and in the economy more generally?
column2: 但在其他部门以及作为整体的经济中，市场应该扮演什么作用？

column1: Many of China’s problems today stem from too much market and too little government.
column2: 当今中国的许多问题源自市场太多而政府太少。

column1: Or, to put it another way, while the government is clearly doing some things that it should not, it is also not doing some things that it should.
column2: 或者换句话说，尽管政府显然做了一些不该做的事，但也有一些应该做的事没做。

column1: Worsening environmental pollution, for example, threatens living standards, while inequality of income and wealth now rivals that of the United States and corruption pervades public institutions and the private sector alike.
column2: 比如，环境污染的恶化威胁到生活水平，而收入和财富不平等已可以与美国相提并论，腐败在公私机构和部门中横行。

column1: All of this undermines trust within society and in government – a trend that is particularly obvious with respect to, say, food safety.
column2: 所有这些都破坏了社会内部的信任和公众对政府的信任 — — 这在（比如）食品安全问题上表现的淋漓尽致。

column1: Such problems could worsen as China restructures its economy away from export-led growth toward services and household consumption.
column2: 随着中国的经济结构向出口拉动型增长专线服务和家庭消费，这些问题可能进一步恶化。

column1: Clearly, there is room for growth in private consumption; but embracing America’s profligate materialist life-style would be a disaster for China – and the planet.
column2: 显然，私人消费有增长的空间；但采取美国式的物质享乐生活方式对中国（以及全世界）来说将是一场灾难。

column1: Air quality in China is already putting peoples’ lives at risk; global warming from even higher Chinese carbon emissions would threaten the entire world.
column2: 中国的空气质量已经威胁到人民的生命；中国不断增加的碳排放导致的全球变暖威胁着整个世界。

column1: There is a better strategy.
column2: 有更好的战略。

column1: For starters, Chinese living standards could and would increase if more resources were allocated to redress large deficiencies in health care and education.
column2: 首先，如果更多的资源被用于解决巨大的医疗和教育不足，中国人的生活水平可以也将会有所提高。

column1: Here, government should play a leading role, and does so in most market economies, for good reason.
column2: 在这方面，政府应该起到领导作用，许多最“市场”的经济体也是如此，理由很充分。

column1: America’s privately-based health-care system is expensive, inefficient, and achieves far worse outcomes than those in European countries, which spend far less.
column2: 美国的基于私人的医疗制度昂贵、低效，效果比花钱少得多的欧洲国家低得多。

column1: A more market-based system is not the direction in which China should be going.
column2: 基于市场的医疗制度不是中国应该努力的方向。

column1: In recent years, the government has made important strides in providing basic health care, especially in rural areas, and some have likened China’s approach to that of the United Kingdom, where private provision is layered atop a public base.
column2: 近几年来，政府在提供基本医疗方面（特别是农村地区）做出了巨大的努力，一些人认为中国的方法类似于英国，即在公共供给的基础上加上私人供给。

column1: Whether that model is better than, say, French-style government-dominated provision may be debated.
column2: 这一模式是否优于（比如）法国式的政府主导供给还有待讨论。

column1: But if one adopts the UK model, the level of the base makes all the difference; given the relatively small role of private health-care provision in the UK, the country has what is essentially a public system.
column2: 但如果你采取了英国模式，那么基础水平将决定最后结果的差异；英国的私人医疗供给程度相对较低，从本质上说是一套公共制度。

column1: Likewise, though China has already made progress in moving away from manufacturing toward a service-based economy (the GDP share of services exceeded that of manufacturing for the first time in 2013), there is still a long way to go.
column2: 类似地，尽管中国在从基于制造的经济向基于服务的经济转变方面已经取得了不少进展（2013年，服务业占GDP比重第一次超过了制造业 ） ， 但还有很长的路要走。

column1: Already, many industries are suffering from overcapacity, and efficient and smooth restructuring will not be easy without government help.
column2: 许多行业已经遭遇了产能过剩，没有政府的帮助，高效平滑的重组决非易事。

column1: China is restructuring in another way: rapid urbanization.
column2: 中国正在以另一种方式重组：快速城镇化。

column1: Ensuring that cities are livable and environmentally sustainable will require strong government action to provide sufficient public transport, public schools, public hospitals, parks, and effective zoning, among other public goods.
column2: 确保城市宜居、环境可持续需要政府花大力气提供充足的公共交通、公共学校、公共医院、公园和有效的区划以及其他公共品。

column1: One major lesson that should have been learned from the post-2008 global economic crisis is that markets are not self-regulating.
column2: 2008年全球经济危机的一个主要教训是市场并不是自我监管的。

column1: They are prone to asset and credit bubbles, which inevitably collapse – often when cross-border capital flows abruptly reverse direction – imposing massive social costs.
column2: 市场很难阻挡资产和信用泡沫，而泡沫必然会破裂 — — 通常在跨境资本流动突然转向是发生 — — 造成巨大的社会成本。

column1: America’s infatuation with deregulation was the cause of the crisis.
column2: 美国沉迷于去监管化是危机的起源。

column1: The issue is not just the pacing and sequencing of liberalization, as some suggest; the end result also matters.
column2: 这一问题并不像一些人所指出的那样仅仅是决定自由化节奏和顺序的问题；最终结果也十分重要。

column1: Liberalization of deposit rates led to America’s savings and loan crisis in the 1980’s.
column2: 存款利率自由化导致了美国20世纪80年代的储贷危机。

column1: Liberalization of lending rates encouraged predatory behavior that exploited poor consumers.
column2: 贷款利率自由化助长了掠夺贫穷消费者的行为。

column1: Bank deregulation led not to more growth, but simply to more risk.
column2: 银行去监管话没有带来更多增长，只是带来了更多风险。

column1: China, one hopes, will not take the route that America followed, with such disastrous consequences.
column2: 我们希望中国不会重蹈美国的覆辙，发生如此灾难性的后果。

column1: The challenge for its leaders is to devise effective regulatory regimes that are appropriate for its stage of development.
column2: 中国领导人的挑战是设计有效的监管制度，与其发展阶段相适应。

column1: That will require the government to raise more money.
column2: 这需要政府筹集更多资金。

column1: Local governments’ current reliance on land sales is a source of many of the economy’s distortions – and much of the corruption.
column2: 目前，地方政府依赖卖地是许多经济扭曲（以及腐败）的源头。

column1: Instead, the authorities should boost revenue by imposing environmental taxes (including a carbon tax), a more comprehensive progressive income tax (including capital gains), and a property tax.
column2: 相反，当局应该通过征收环境税（包括碳税 ） 、 采取更全面的累进所得税（包括资本利得税）和物业税增加收入。

column1: Moreover, the state should appropriate, through dividends, a larger share of SOEs’ value (some of which might be at the expense of these firms’ managers.)
column2: 此外，国家应该获得国有企业的更大比例的价值（一些国有企业管理者将因此遭受损失 ） ， 这可以通过分红实现。

column1: The question is whether China can maintain rapid growth (though somewhat slower than its recent breakneck pace), even as it reins in credit expansion (which could cause an abrupt reversal in asset prices), confronts weak global demand, restructures its economy, and fights corruption. In other countries, such daunting challenges have led to paralysis, not progress.
column2: 问题在于中国能否在遏制信用扩张（可能导致资产价格的突然逆转 ） 、 面临全球需求疲软、实现经济结构重组和打击腐败的同事维持快速增长（尽管略慢于最近的高速 ） 。

column1: The economics of success is clear: higher spending on urbanization, health care, and education, funded by increases in taxes, could simultaneously sustain growth, improve the environment, and reduce inequality.
column2: 成功的经济学是明确的：以征税为筹资手段提高城镇化、医疗和教育的支出可以同时实现维持增长、改善环境和降低不平等性。

column1: If China’s politics can manage the implementation of this agenda, China and the entire world will be better off.
column2: 如果中国的政治能够设法实施这一日程，那么中国和全世界都将受益。

column1: Democracy in the Twenty-First Century
column2: 二十一世纪民主论

column1: NEW YORK – The reception in the United States, and in other advanced economies, of Thomas Piketty’s recent book Capital in the Twenty-First Century attests to growing concern about rising inequality.
column2: 纽约—美国和其他发达经济体对托马斯·皮克提（Thomas Piketty）的近著《二十一世纪资本论 》 （ Capital in the Twenty-First Century）的反应彰显出人们对不平等性恶化的日益担忧。

column1: His book lends further weight to the already overwhelming body of evidence concerning the soaring share of income and wealth at the very top.
column2: 他的书为已有压倒性证据添砖加瓦，证明了收入和财富正在急剧地向最顶层集中。

column1: Piketty’s book, moreover, provides a different perspective on the 30 or so years that followed the Great Depression and World War II, viewing this period as a historical anomaly, perhaps caused by the unusual social cohesion that cataclysmic events can stimulate.
column2: 此外，皮克提的书还提供了新的视角审视大萧条和第二次世界大战之后的三十来年，将这段时间视为历史的异常期，其出现的原因也许是灾难性事件能够刺激不同寻常的社会凝聚力。

column1: In that era of rapid economic growth, prosperity was widely shared, with all groups advancing, but with those at the bottom seeing larger percentage gains.
column2: 在这个经济高速增长的时代，繁荣被广泛分享，所有群体都在进步，但位于��层的人群改善比例最大。

column1: Piketty also sheds new light on the “reforms” sold by Ronald Reagan and Margaret Thatcher in the 1980s as growth enhancers from which all would benefit.
column2: 皮克提还提出了新的视角审视罗纳德·里根和玛格丽特·撒切尔在20世纪80年代所实施的“改革 ” ， 他们的改革带来了让所有人受益的增长提振。

column1: Their reforms were followed by slower growth and heightened global instability, and what growth did occur benefited mostly those at the top.
column2: 随之而来的是增长的减速和全球不平等性的高企，而增长所带来的好处大部分给顶层人群拿走了。

column1: But Piketty’s work raises fundamental issues concerning both economic theory and the future of capitalism.
column2: 但皮克提的著作给经济学理论和资本主义的未来都提出了根本性问题。

column1: He documents large increases in the wealth/output ratio.
column2: 他记录了财富/产出比的大幅上升。

column1: In standard theory, such increases would be associated with a fall in the return to capital and an increase in wages.
column2: 在标准经济学理论中，这类上升应该伴随着资本回报的下降和工资的增长。

column1: But today the return to capital does not seem to have diminished, though wages have.
column2: 但眼下资本回报似乎并未下降，倒是工资下降了。

column1: (In the US, for example, average wages have stagnated over the past four decades.)
column2: （比如，在美国，过去四十年来平均工资一直停滞不前。 ）

column1: The most obvious explanation is that the increase in measured wealth does not correspond to an increase in productive capital – and the data seem consistent with this interpretation.
column2: 最显而易见的解释是测得的财富增长并不同步于生产性资本的增加 — — 数据也与这一解释相符。

column1: Much of the increase in wealth stemmed from an increase in the value of real estate.
column2: 财富的增加有很大一部分来自房地产价值的升高。

column1: Before the 2008 financial crisis, a real-estate bubble was evident in many countries; even now, there may not have been a full “correction.”
column2: 2008年金融危机前，房地产泡沫在许多国家显而易见；甚至现在或许也不曾得到完全的“修正 ” 。

column1: The rise in value also can represent competition among the rich for “positional” goods – a house on the beach or an apartment on New York City’s Fifth Avenue.
column2: 房地产价值的上升也体现了富人的“地位”商品竞争 — — 争相购买海滨别墅或纽约第五大道公寓。

column1: Sometimes an increase in measured financial wealth corresponds to little more than a shift from “unmeasured” wealth to measured wealth – shifts that can actually reflect deterioration in overall economic performance.
column2: fenp2052有时测得金融财富的增长无非是因为一些“未测得”财富变成了测得财富 — — 这一变化实际上可能反映了总体经济绩效的恶化。

column1: If monopoly power increases, or firms (like banks) develop better methods of exploiting ordinary consumers, it will show up as higher profits and, when capitalized, as an increase in financial wealth.
column2: 如果垄断实力提高，或企业（如银行）发展出更好的掠夺不同消费者的办法，就会表现出更高的利润，如果对此资本化，就表现出金融财富的增加。

column1: But when this happens, of course, societal wellbeing and economic efficiency fall, even as officially measured wealth rises.
column2: 但是，当这一幕发生时，显然社会福利和经济效率将下降，即使官方测得财富增加了。

column1: We simply do not take into account the corresponding diminution of the value of human capital – the wealth of workers.
column2: 我们根本就不会记录与之相应的人力资本价值 — — 工人的财富 — — 的下降。

column1: Moreover, if banks succeed in using their political influence to socialize losses and retain more and more of their ill-gotten gains, the measured wealth in the financial sector increases.
column2: 此外，如果银行成功地利用政治影响力实现成本社会化，同时留存越来越多的不当得利，那么金融部门的测得财富就会增加。

column1: We do not measure the corresponding diminution of taxpayers’ wealth.
column2: 我们不会测量相应的纳税人财富的下降。

column1: Likewise, if corporations convince the government to overpay for their products (as the major drug companies have succeeded in doing), or are given access to public resources at below-market prices (as mining companies have succeeded in doing), reported financial wealth increases, though the wealth of ordinary citizens does not.
column2: 类似地，如果公司说服政府给其产品支付过高价格（大型制药公司在这方面做得相当成功 ） ， 或者能够以抵御市场价格获得公共资源（矿业公司在这方面做得相当成功 ） ， 报告金融财富就会增加，尽管普通公民财富的下降不会被记录。

column1: What we have been observing – wage stagnation and rising inequality, even as wealth increases – does not reflect the workings of a normal market economy, but of what I call “ersatz capitalism.”
column2: 我们所观察到的现象 — — 工资停滞和不平等性恶化，尽管财富在增加 — — 并非正常的市场经济的作用结果，而是我所谓的“伪资本主义”作用的结果。

column1: The problem may not be with how markets should or do work, but with our political system, which has failed to ensure that markets are competitive, and has designed rules that sustain distorted markets in which corporations and the rich can (and unfortunately do) exploit everyone else.
column2: 问题后续不是市场应该如何作用或实际如何作用，而在于我们的政治制度，这套制度无法确保市场的竞争性，其所涉及的规则维持了市场的扭曲性，让公司和富人能够（不幸的是，他们确实这么做了）掠夺其他所有人。

column1: Markets, of course, do not exist in a vacuum.
column2: 当然，市场并不是存在于真空中的。

column1: There have to be rules of the game, and these are established through political processes.
column2: 必须有游戏规则，而游戏规则是通过政治过程建立的。

column1: High levels of economic inequality in countries like the US and, increasingly, those that have followed its economic model, lead to political inequality.
column2: 在美国 — — 追随其经济模式的国家也正在日益变得这样 — — 经济不平等性高企导致了政治不平等性。

column1: In such a system, opportunities for economic advancement become unequal as well, reinforcing low levels of social mobility.
column2: 在这样的制度中，经济进步的机会也变得不平等，进一步降低了社会流动性。

column1: Thus, Piketty’s forecast of still higher levels of inequality does not reflect the inexorable laws of economics.
column2: 因此，皮克提的预测 — — 不平等性程度还会继续加剧 — — 所反映的并非不可撼动的经济学定律。

column1: Simple changes – including higher capital-gains and inheritance taxes, greater spending to broaden access to education, rigorous enforcement of anti-trust laws, corporate-governance reforms that circumscribe executive pay, and financial regulations that rein in banks’ ability to exploit the rest of society – would reduce inequality and increase equality of opportunity markedly.
column2: 简单地改变 — — 包括提高资本利得税和遗产税、增加教育普及支出、严格执行反垄断法律、约束高管薪酬的公司治理改革、遏制银行掠夺社会其他部门的能力的金融监管等 — — 就能显著降低不平等性，增加机会平等性。

column1: If we get the rules of the game right, we might even be able to restore the rapid and shared economic growth that characterized the middle-class societies of the mid-twentieth century.
column2: 如果我们为游戏设置正确的规则，甚至有望重塑快速且被各群体所共享的经济增长，就像二十世纪中叶中产阶级社会那样。

column1: The main question confronting us today is not really about capital in the twenty-first century. It is about democracy in the twenty-first century.
column2: 我们今天所面临的主要问题其实并非关于二十一世纪的资本，而是关于二十一世纪的民主。

column1: Creating a Learning Society
column2: 打造学习型社会

column1: NEW YORK – Citizens in the world’s richest countries have come to think of their economies as being based on innovation.
column2: 纽约—最发达国家的公民已开始认为他们的经济建立在创新的基础上。

column1: But innovation has been part of the developed world’s economy for more than two centuries.
column2: 但创新成为发达世界经济的一部分已有两个多世纪的历史。

column1: Indeed, for thousands of years, until the Industrial Revolution, incomes stagnated.
column2: 事实上，几千年来，直到工业革命前，收入一直处于停滞状态。

column1: Then per capita income soared, increasing year after year, interrupted only by the occasional effects of cyclical fluctuations.
column2: 工业革命后，人均收入开始激增，一年更比一年高，只是时常会受到周期性波动的干扰。

column1: The Nobel laureate economist Robert Solow noted some 60 years ago that rising incomes should largely be attributed not to capital accumulation, but to technological progress – to learning how to do things better.
column2: 60年前，诺贝尔经济学奖获得者罗伯特·索洛（Robert Solow）指出，收入的提高主要不是来自资本积累，而是来自技术进步 — — 即学习如何将事情做得更好。

column1: While some of the productivity increase reflects the impact of dramatic discoveries, much of it has been due to small, incremental changes.
column2: 尽管生产率的提高部分反映了重大发现的影响，但大部分都要归因于渐进的小变革。

column1: And, if that is the case, it makes sense to focus attention on how societies learn, and what can be done to promote learning – including learning how to learn.
column2: 果真如此的话，就应该将注意力集中在社会如何学���以及如何促进学习上 — — 包括学习如何学习。

column1: A century ago, the economist and political scientist Joseph Schumpeter argued that the central virtue of a market economy was its capacity to innovate.
column2: 一个世纪前，经济学家兼政治学家约瑟夫·熊彼特（Joseph Schumpeter）指出，市场经济的最大好处是其创新能力。

column1: He contended that economists’ traditional focus on competitive markets was misplaced; what mattered was competition for the market, not competition in the market.
column2: 他认为，传统上经济学家关注竞争市场，这是个错误；真正重要的是为创造市场而竞争，而不是在市场中竞争。

column1: Competition for the market drove innovation.
column2: 为创造市场而竞争推动了创新。

column1: A succession of monopolists would lead, in this view, to higher standards of living in the long run.
column2: 根据这一观点，从长期看，前赴后继的垄断者能带来生活水平的提高。

column1: Schumpeter’s conclusions have not gone unchallenged.
column2: 熊彼特的结论受到了挑战。

column1: Monopolists and dominant firms, like Microsoft, can actually suppress innovation.
column2: 垄断者和主导且 — — 如微软等 — — 实际上可能抑制创新。

column1: Unless checked by anti-trust authorities, they can engage in anti-competitive behavior that reinforces their monopoly power.
column2: 除非受到反垄断当局制约，否则它们可能采取反竞争行为以强化垄断力。

column1: Moreover, markets may not be efficient in either the level or direction of investments in research and learning.
column2: 此外，市场在决定研究和学习投资水平或方向方面未必有效。

column1: Private incentives are not well aligned with social returns: firms can gain from innovations that increase their market power, enable them to circumvent regulations, or channel rents that would otherwise accrue to others.
column2: 私人激励与社会回报并不完美匹配：企业可以从增强器市场实力的创新中获益，使它们能够绕过监管或将本可能流向他人的租引导到自己囊中。

column1: But one of Schumpeter’s fundamental insights has held up well: Conventional policies focusing on short-run efficiency may not be desirable, once one takes a long-run innovation/learning perspective.
column2: 但熊彼特的一个基本洞见是成立的：从长期创新/学习角度看，关注短期效率的传统政策或许并不值得追求。

column1: This is especially true for developing countries and emerging markets.
column2: 对于发展中国家和新兴市场而言尤其如此。

column1: Industrial policies – in which governments intervene in the allocation of resources among sectors or favor some technologies over others – can help “infant economies” learn.
column2: 产业政策 — — 政府干预资源在各部门间的配置或优待某些技术 — — 有助于“婴儿经济体 ” （ infant economy）学习。

column1: Learning may be more marked in some sectors (such as industrial manufacturing) than in others, and the benefits of that learning, including the institutional development required for success, may spill over to other economic activities.
column2: 一些部门（如工业生产部门）的学习可能会胜过其他部门，而学习的好处，包括成功所必须的制度发展 — — 可能溢出到其他经济活动中。

column1: Such policies, when adopted, have been frequent targets of criticism.
column2: 当采取这些政策时，往往会招来批评。

column1: Government, it is often said, should not be engaged in picking winners.
column2: 人们常说，政府不应该主动去挑选赢家。

column1: The market is far better in making such judgments.
column2: 在这方面，市场的判断要好得多。

column1: But the evidence on that is not as compelling as free-market advocates claim.
column2: 但这方面的证据并不如自由市场鼓吹者宣称的那样令人信服。

column1: America’s private sector was notoriously bad in allocating capital and managing risk in the years before the global financial crisis, while studies show that average returns to the economy from government research projects are actually higher than those from private-sector projects – especially because the government invests more heavily in important basic research.
column2: 美国私人部门在全球金融危机前几年的配置资本和管理风险水平之低已是众所周知，而研究表明，经济得自政府研究项目的平均回报其实要高于私人部门项目 — — 特别是因为政府投资更偏向重要的基础研究。

column1: One only needs to think of the social benefits traceable to the research that led to the development of the Internet or the discovery of DNA.
column2: 只要想一想催生了互联网的发展和DNA的发现的研究就能一窥端倪。

column1: But, putting such successes aside, the point of industrial policy is not to pick winners at all.
column2: 但是，除却这些成功不谈，产业政策的要点决非挑选赢家。

column1: Rather, successful industrial policies identify sources of positive externalities – sectors where learning might generate benefits elsewhere in the economy.
column2: 相反，成功的产业政策要识别具有正外部性的资源 — — 即本部门学习可能给经济的其他部门带来好处的部门。

column1: Viewing economic policies through the lens of learning provides a different perspective on many issues.
column2: 从学习的角度看待经济政策让我们能用不同的目光审视许多问题。

column1: The great economist Kenneth Arrow emphasized the importance of learning by doing.
column2: 著名经济学家肯尼斯·阿罗（Kenneth Arrow）强调干中学（learning by doing）的重要性。

column1: The only way to learn what is required for industrial growth, for example, is to have industry.
column2: 比如，学习产业成长的必要基础的唯一办法是拥有该产业。

column1: And that may require either ensuring that one’s exchange rate is competitive or that certain industries have privileged access to credit – as a number of East Asian countries did as part of their remarkably successful development strategies.
column2: 而这需要有高竞争力的汇率或者某些产业拥有获得信用的特权 — — 这正是许多东亚国家取得巨大成功的发展战略的要点。

column1: There is a compelling infant economy argument for industrial protection.
column2: 婴儿经济体有一个很强大的产业保护理由。

column1: Moreover, financial-market liberalization may undermine countries’ ability to learn another set of skills that are essential for development: how to allocate resources and manage risk.
column2: 此外，金融市场自由化可能破坏一国学习发展所必须的技能组合的能力，即如何配置资源和管理风险。

column1: Likewise, intellectual property, if not designed properly, can be a two-edged sword when viewed from a learning perspective.
column2: 类似地，知识产权如能得到合理设计，可以成为学习角度看来的双刃剑。

column1: While it may enhance incentives to invest in research, it may also enhance incentives for secrecy – impeding the flow of knowledge that is essential to learning while encouraging firms to maximize what they draw from the pool of collective knowledge and to minimize what they contribute.
column2: 它能够强化研究投资激励，但也可能强化保密激励 — — 阻止学习的关键知识的流动并鼓励企业尽可能在集体知识总量中占取最大份额、贡献最小力量。

column1: In this scenario, the pace of innovation is actually reduced.
column2: 在这一情形中，创新的速度实际上可能受到削弱。

column1: More broadly, many of the policies (especially those associated with the neoliberal “Washington Consensus”) foisted on developing countries with the noble objective of promoting the efficiency of resource allocation today actually impede learning, and thus lead to lower standards of living in the long run.
column2: 更广地看，许多打着促进当今资源配置效率的冠冕堂皇的口号强加给发展中国家的政策（特别是与新自由主义“华盛顿共识”相关的政策）实际上在阻碍学习，从而导致长期生活水平下降。

column1: Virtually every government policy, intentionally or not, for better or for worse, has direct and indirect effects on learning.
column2: 几乎所有政府政策 — — 不管有意还是无意，好还是差 — — 都会对学习造成直接和间接的影响。

column1: Developing countries where policymakers are cognizant of these effects are more likely to close the knowledge gap that separates them from the more developed countries.
column2: 决策者认识到这一影响的发展中国家更有可能弥补让它们与发达国家产生区别的知识差距。

column1: Developed countries, meanwhile, have an opportunity to narrow the gap between average and best practices, and to avoid the danger of secular stagnation.
column2: 与此同时，发达国家有机会缩小一般实践和最佳实践之间的差别，避免长期停滞的危险。

column1: South Africa Breaks Out
column2: 南非的爆发

column1: NEW YORK – International investment agreements are once again in the news.
column2: 纽约—国际投资协定再一次成为新闻。

column1: The United States is trying to impose a strong investment pact within the two big so-called “partnership” agreements, one bridging the Atlantic, the other the Pacific, that are now being negotiated. But there is growing opposition to such moves.
column2: 美国正在试图在两份大型的所谓“合作伙伴”协定中纳入强大的贸易契约，其中一个协定联系大西洋，另一个联系太平洋，目前都在谈判中。

column1: South Africa has decided to stop the automatic renewal of investment agreements that it signed in the early post-apartheid period, and has announced that some will be terminated.
column2: 南非决定不再为后种族隔离时代早期签署的投资协定自动更新，并且宣布一些投资协定将会终结。

column1: Ecuador and Venezuela have already terminated theirs.
column2: 厄瓜多尔和委内瑞拉已经终结了它们的投资协定。

column1: India says that it will sign an investment agreement with the US only if the dispute-resolution mechanism is changed.
column2: 印度表示只有在争议解决机制做出改变后才会与美国签署投资协定。

column1: For its part, Brazil has never had one at all.
column2: 而巴西则没有签署贸易协定。

column1: There is good reason for the resistance.
column2: 如此抵制，其来有自。

column1: Even in the US, labor unions and environmental, health, development, and other nongovernmental organizations have objected to the agreements that the US is proposing.
column2: 即使在美国，工会和环保、健康、发展和其他非政府组织也在反对美国正在推行的协定。

column1: The agreements would significantly inhibit the ability of developing countries’ governments to protect their environment from mining and other companies; their citizens from the tobacco companies that knowingly purvey a product that causes death and disease; and their economies from the ruinous financial products that played such a large role in the 2008 global financial crisis.
column2: 这些协定会极大地制约发展中国家政府保护其环境不受矿业和其他公司伤害、其人民不受有意识地推销致病致死产品的烟草公司的伤害、以及其经济不受在2008年全球金融危机中扮演重要角色的破坏性金融产品伤害的能力。

column1: They restrict governments even from placing temporary controls on the kind of destabilizing short-term capital flows that have so often wrought havoc in financial markets and fueled crises in developing countries.
column2: 这些协定甚至还限制政府，使其难以采取针对破坏性短期资本流的临时性管制，这类资本流经常造成发展中国家金融市场浩劫、助长危机。

column1: Indeed, the agreements have been used to challenge government actions ranging from debt restructuring to affirmative action.
column2: 事实上，这些协定被利用来制约从债务重组到平权行动的各种政府行为。

column1: Advocates of such agreements claim that they are needed to protect property rights.
column2: 这些协定的支持者宣称需要靠它们来保护产权。

column1: But countries like South Africa already have strong constitutional guarantees of property rights.
column2: 但南非等国家已经建立了强大的宪法产权保护。

column1: There is no reason that foreign-owned property should be better protected than property owned by a country’s own citizens.
column2: 外国���有的产权没有道理应该获得比本国公民所有产权更好的保护。

column1: Moreover, if constitutional guarantees are not enough to convince investors of South Africa’s commitment to protecting property rights, foreigners can always avail themselves of expropriation insurance provided by the Multilateral Investment Guarantee Agency (a division of the World Bank) or numerous national organizations providing such insurance.
column2: 此外，如果宪法保护仍不足以说服南非投资者信任南非的产权保护承诺，那么外国人还可以投保没收险，多边投资担保机构（Multilateral Investment Guarantee Agency，世界银行的一个分支）和其他多个国家组织提供这种保险。

column1: (Americans, for example, can buy insurance from the Overseas Private Investment Corporation.)
column2: （比如，美国可以向海外私人投资公司（Overseas Private Investment Corporation）购买这种保险。 ）

column1: But those supporting the investment agreements are not really concerned about protecting property rights, anyway.
column2: 但支持投资协定者并不真关心产权保护。

column1: The real goal is to restrict governments’ ability to regulate and tax corporations – that is, to restrict their ability to impose responsibilities, not just uphold rights.
column2: 他们的真正目标是限制政府对公司进行监管和课税的能力 — — 也就是说，不仅要保护权利，还要限制政府施加义务的能力。

column1: Corporations are attempting to achieve by stealth – through secretly negotiated trade agreements – what they could not attain in an open political process.
column2: 公司试图通过公开政治流程无法提供的地下途径实现这一点 — — 如秘密贸易协定谈判。

column1: Even the notion that this is about protecting foreign firms is a ruse: companies based in country A can set up a subsidiary in country B to sue country A’s government.
column2: 即使是这事关保护外国企业的概念也只是一条诡计：以A国为总部的公司可以在B国开设分公司起诉A国政府。

column1: American courts, for example, have consistently ruled that corporations need not be compensated for the loss of profits from a change in regulations (a so-called regulatory taking); but, under the typical investment agreement, a foreign firm (or an American firm, operating through a foreign subsidiary) can demand compensation!
column2: 比如，美国法院一直判定不必因为监管变化导致的利润损失（所谓的监管征收）赔偿公司；但是，在典型的投资协定中，外国企业（或者通过外国分公司经营的美国企业）可以要求赔偿！

column1: Worse, investment agreements enable companies to sue the government over perfectly sensible and just regulatory changes – when, say, a cigarette company’s profits are lowered by a regulation restricting the use of tobacco.
column2: 更糟糕的是，投资协定让公司能够因为完全合理合规的变化起诉政府 — — 比如当某香烟公司利润因为监管规则限制烟草的使用而利润下降时。

column1: In South Africa, a firm could sue if it believes that its bottom line might by harmed by programs designed to address the legacy of official racism.
column2: 在南非，企业若认为其利润因为旨在纠正官方种族主义遗留问题的计划而受损，就可以提起诉讼。

column1: There is a long-standing presumption of “sovereign immunity”: states can be sued only under limited circumstances.
column2: 关于“主权豁免”的推定由来已久：国家只有在极为有限情形中可以被提起诉讼。

column1: But investment agreements like those backed by the US demand that developing countries waive this presumption and permit the adjudication of suits according to procedures that fall far short of those expected in twenty-first-century democracies.
column2: 但美国所支持的投资协定要求放弃这一推定，允许根据与21世纪民主要求差距甚远的先例的裁定诉讼。

column1: Such procedures have proved to be arbitrary and capricious, with no systemic way to reconcile incompatible rulings issued by different panels.
column2: 这些先例早已被证明是武断的、反复无常的，缺少协调不同方面给出的不相容规则的系统性办法。

column1: While proponents argue that investment treaties reduce uncertainty, the ambiguities and conflicting interpretations of these agreements’ provisions have increased uncertainty.
column2: 支持者指出投资条约能减少不确定性，但这些协定条款的模糊性和解读的冲突性实际上增加了不确定性。

column1: Countries that have signed such investment agreements have paid a high price.
column2: 签署了这类投资协定的国家为此付出了沉重代价。

column1: Several have been subject to enormous suits – and enormous payouts.
column2: 一些国家诉讼缠身，并付出了巨额赔付。

column1: There have even been demands that countries honor contracts signed by previous non-democratic and corrupt governments, even when the International Monetary Fund and other multilateral organizations have recommended that the contract be abrogated.
column2: 协定要求签署国尊重在非民主时期的腐败政府所签署的契约，即便IMF和其他多边机构建议废除这些契约。

column1: Even when developing-country governments win the suits (which have proliferated greatly in the last 15 years), the litigation costs are huge.
column2: 即使发展中国家赢得诉讼（在过去15年中，这样的案例很多 ） ， 法律成本也极其高昂。

column1: The (intended) effect is to chill governments’ legitimate efforts to protect and advance citizens’ interests by imposing regulations, taxation, and other responsibilities on corporations.
column2: 其（有意造成的）结果是制约了政府通过对公司施加监管、税收和其他责任来保护和促进公民利益的合法努力。

column1: Moreover, for developing countries that were foolish enough to sign such agreements, the evidence is that the benefits, if any, have been scant.
column2: 此外，对不慎签署了这类协定的发展中国家而言，证据表明利（如果有的话）大于弊。

column1: In South Africa’s review, it found that it had not received significant investments from the countries with which it had signed agreements, but had received significant investments from those with which it had not.
column2: 在南非看来，它并未从签署了协定的国家那里获得多少投资，反而从未签署协定的国家中获得了大量投资。

column1: It is no surprise that South Africa, after a careful review of investment treaties, has decided that, at the very least, they should be renegotiated.
column2: 毫不奇怪，南非在再三权衡投资条约后决定至少应该进行重新谈判。

column1: Doing so is not anti-investment; it is pro-development.
column2: 这样做并不是反投资；而是支持发展。

column1: And it is essential if South Africa’s government is to pursue policies that best serve the country’s economy and citizens.
column2: 而如果南非政府意在推行最适合本国经济和国民的政策，这样做更是必不可少的。

column1: Indeed, by clarifying through domestic legislation the protections offered to investors, South Africa is once again demonstrating – as it has repeatedly done since the adoption of its new Constitution in 1996 – its commitment to the rule of law.
column2: 事实上，通过国内立法明确对投资者的保护，南非再一次证明了 — — 自1996年采取新宪法以来已经有过多次先例 — — 其对法治精神的坚持。

column1: It is the investment agreements themselves that most seriously threaten democratic decision-making.
column2: 投资协定本身才是民主决策的最大威胁。

column1: South Africa should be congratulated.
column2: 南非应该获得掌声。

column1: Other countries, one hopes, will follow suit.
column2: 我们希望其他国家也能效而仿之。

column1: A Light Unto Cities
column2: 照向城市的光

column1: NEW YORK – Last month, a remarkable gathering occurred in Medellín, Colombia.
column2: 纽约—上个月，在哥伦比亚麦德林发生了一场令人瞩目的集会。

column1: Some 22,000 people came together to attend the World Urban Forum and discuss the future of cities.
column2: 大约22,000人聚集于此参加世界城市论坛（World Urban Forum ） ， 讨论城市的未来。

column1: The focus was on creating “cities for life” – that is, on promoting equitable development in the urban environments in which a majority of the world’s citizens already live, and in which two thirds will reside by the year 2050.
column2: 论坛中心议题是创造“生活之城 ” ， 即促进城市环境下的公平发展。 目前，世界大部分人民生活在城市中，到2050年，城市居民比例将超过三分之二。

column1: The location itself was symbolic: Once notorious for its drug gangs, Medellín now has a well-deserved reputation as one of the most innovative cities in the world.
column2: 会议地点本身便具有象征意义：麦德林曾经以贩毒黑帮闻名于世，现在大可跻身于最具创精神城市之列。

column1: The tale of the city’s transformation holds important lessons for urban areas everywhere.
column2: 麦德林的故事可以作为所有城市地区的重要经验。

column1: In the 1980’s and 1990’s, cartel bosses like the infamous Pablo Escobar ruled Medellín’s streets and controlled its politics.
column2: 在20世纪八九十年代，大名鼎鼎的帕博罗·埃斯科巴（Pablo Escobar）等卡特尔老板统治者麦德林的街头、掌握着麦德林的政治。

column1: The source of Escobar’s power was not just the hugely profitable international cocaine trade (fueled by demand in the United States), but also extreme inequality in Medellín and Colombia.
column2: 埃斯科巴权力的源泉不仅来自国际可卡因贸易的巨大利润（受美国需求推动 ） ， 也来源于麦德林和哥伦比亚的极端不平等。

column1: On the steep Andean slopes of the valley that cradles the city, vast slums, virtually abandoned by the government, provided a ready supply of recruits for the cartels.
column2: 麦德林坐落于陡峭的安第斯山谷，在这里，位数庞大的贫民被政府所抛弃，从而为卡特尔提供了大量人力资源。

column1: In the absence of public services, Escobar won the hearts and minds of Medellín’s poorest with his largesse – even as he terrorized the city.
column2: 在缺乏公共服务的情况下，埃斯科巴用他的慷慨赢得了麦德林贫民的心 — — 即便他对麦德林实施着恐怖统治。

column1: One can hardly recognize those slums today.
column2: 如今，你很难看到贫民窟的存在。

column1: In the poor neighborhood of Santo Domingo, the city’s new Metrocable system, consisting of three lines of aerial gondolas, serves residents hundreds of vertical feet up a mountainside, ending their isolation from the city center.
column2: 在圣多明各（Santo Domingo）的贫穷社区，政府架设了三条悬空式城市铁轨，为居住在数百英尺高的半山腰的居民提供通勤，使他们不再与市中心隔离。

column1: The commute is now minutes, and the social and economic barriers between the informal settlements and the rest of the city are on their way to being broken down.
column2: 如今，通勤时间可以用分钟计算，地下定居点和麦德林其他地区之间的社会和经济壁垒正在被消除。

column1: The problems of the city’s poor neighborhoods have not been erased, but the benefits that the infrastructure improvements have brought are brilliantly evident in the well-kept houses, murals, and soccer fields perched near the gondola stations.
column2: 麦德林贫穷社区的问题并没有被根治，但基础设施改善带来了巨大的好处 — — 在城铁站周边，整洁的房屋、壁画和足球场随处可见。 城铁只是麦德林最具代表性的工程。

column1: The cable cars are only the most iconic of the projects for which Medellín last year won Harvard University’s Veronica Rudge Green Prize in Urban Design, the most prestigious award in the field.
column2: 去年，麦德林赢得业内最富盛名的哈佛大学维罗妮卡·拉齐绿色城市设计奖（Veronica Rudge Green Prize in Urban Design ） 。

column1: Beginning with the mayoralty of Sergio Fajardo (now the governor of Medellín’s department, Antioquia), who took office in 2004, the city has made major efforts to transform its slums, improve education, and promote development.
column2: 从塞尔吉奥·法亚尔多（Sergio Fajardo，现为麦德林所在的安提奥奎亚（Antioquia）省省长）2004年出任市长以来，麦德林在改变贫民窟、改善教育和促进发展方面做出了巨大的努力。
