column1: (The current mayor, Aníbal Gaviria, has affirmed his commitment to continuing on this path.)
column2: （现任市长阿尼巴尔·加维里亚（Aníbal Gaviria）也承诺将继续沿着这一方向努力。 ）

column1: Medellín constructed avant-garde public buildings in areas that were the most run down, provided house paint to citizens living in poor districts, and cleaned up and improved the streets – all in the belief that if you treat people with dignity, they will value their surroundings and take pride in their communities.
column2: 麦德林在最破败的地区建设了一批后现代风格的公房，为生活在贫困区的市民提供住房，并对道路做了清洁和改善 — — 麦德林这样做的信条是，如果你给予人民尊严，他们就会珍视环境并以社区为荣。

column1: And that faith has been more than borne out.
column2: 这一信条得到了验证。

column1: Throughout the world, cities are both the locus and the focus of society’s major debates, and for good reason.
column2: 放眼全世界，城市是社会主要争议的中心和焦点，这可谓名符其实。

column1: When individuals live in close quarters, they cannot escape major societal problems: growing inequality, environmental degradation, and inadequate public investment.
column2: 当个体挨得很近生活时，就无法摆脱主要社会问题：不平等性增加、环境恶化以及公共投资不足。

column1: The forum reminded participants that livable cities require planning – a message at odds with prevailing attitudes in much of the world.
column2: 论坛提醒与会者，宜居城市需要规划，这与世界大部分地区流行的观点相悖。

column1: But without planning and government investment in infrastructure, public transportation and parks, and the provision of clean water and sanitation, cities won’t be livable.
column2: 但若不进行规划和基础设施、公共交通和公园的政府投资、不提供清洁水源和卫生服务，城市就不可能宜居。

column1: And it is the poor who inevitably suffer the most from the absence of these public goods.
column2: 而这些公共品的缺失影响最大的难免是穷人。

column1: Medellín holds some lessons for America, too.
column2: 麦德林也给美国带来了一些教训。

column1: Indeed, recent research shows how inadequate planning has fueled economic segregation in the United States, and how poverty traps have formed in cities without public transportation, owing to a shortage of accessible jobs.
column2: 事实上，最新研究表明，规划不充分导致美国经济隔离加剧，缺乏公共交通的城市由于易得职位的短缺而陷入了贫穷陷阱。

column1: The conference went beyond this, emphasizing that “livable cities” are not enough.
column2: 此次会议的意义不止于此，会议强调 ， “ 宜居城市”不是终点。

column1: We need to create urban areas in which individuals can flourish and innovate.
column2: 我们需要居民可以发展和创新的城市地区。

column1: It is no accident that the Enlightenment – which led in turn to the fastest and largest increases in living standards in human history – unfolded in cities.
column2: 启蒙运动 — — 它反过来引领了人类历史上最快、最大的生活水平提升 — — 出现在城市中不是偶然。

column1: New thinking is a natural consequence of high population density, provided the right conditions are met – conditions that include public spaces in which people can interact and culture can thrive, and a democratic ethos that welcomes and encourages public participation.
column2: 新思想是高人口密度的自然结果，只要满足正确的条件 — — 这些条件包括人们可以互动、文化可以繁荣的公共空间以及欢迎和鼓励公共参与的民主氛围。

column1: A key theme of the forum was the emerging consensus on the need for environmentally, socially, and economically sustainable development.
column2: 论坛的一个中心主题是新出现的共识：我们需要环境、社会和经济可持续的发展。

column1: All of these aspects of sustainability are intertwined and complementary, and cities provide the context in which this is most clear.
column2: 这三大可持续性是相辅相成的，城市提供了最显而易见的显例。

column1: One of the biggest obstacles to achieving sustainability is inequality.
column2: 阻止实现可持续性的最大障碍之一是不平等性。

column1: Our economies, our democracies, and our societies pay a high price for the growing gap between the rich and poor.
column2: 我们的经济、我们的民主和我们的社会为贫富差距的不断扩大付出了高昂的代价。

column1: And perhaps the most invidious aspect of the widening income and wealth gap in so many countries is that it is deepening inequality of opportunity.
column2: 也许众多国家收入和财富差距加剧最危险的方面在于机会不平等的深化。

column1: Some cities have shown that these widely observed patterns are not the result of immutable economic laws.
column2: 一些城市已经证明，这些被广泛观察到的模式并非永恒的经济定律的结果。

column1: Even in the advanced country with the most inequality – the US – some cities, like San Francisco and San Jose, are comparable to the best-performing economies in terms of equality of opportunity.
column2: 即使在不平等性最大的发达国家 — — 美国，也有旧金山和圣何塞等在机会平等方面可以与表现最优秀经济体相媲美的城市。

column1: With political gridlock afflicting so many national governments around the world, forward-thinking cities are becoming a beacon of hope.
column2: 政治僵局困扰着世界范围内许多国家的政府，在这样的情况下，前瞻性城市就成了希望的灯塔。

column1: A divided US seems incapable of addressing its alarming increase in inequality.
column2: 分裂的美国似乎无法纠正其值得警惕的不平等性加剧问题。

column1: But in New York City, Mayor Bill de Blasio was elected on the promise of doing something about it.
column2: 但在纽约市，比尔·德布拉西奥（Bill de Blasio）市长因为承诺努力改变这一点而当选。

column1: While there are limits to what can be done at the local level – national taxation, for instance, is far more important than municipal taxes – cities can help ensure the availability of affordable housing.
column2: 尽管地方层面的作为具有局限性 — — 比如，国税比市政税重要得多 — — 但城市可以帮助确保平价房的可获得性。

column1: And they have a special responsibility to provide high-quality public education and public amenities for all, regardless of income.
column2: 城市也在向不论收入如何的全体市民提供高质量公共教育和公共康乐设施方面具有特别责任。

column1: Medellín and the World Urban Forum have shown that this is not just a pipe dream.
column2: 麦德林和世界城市论坛证明，这不仅仅是白日梦。

column1: Another world is possible; we need only the political will to pursue it.
column2: 新世界是可能存在的；我们需要的只是追求新世界的政治意愿。

column1: Advanced Malaise
column2: 发达国家之恙

column1: NEW YORK – Economics is often called the dismal science, and for the last half-decade it has come by its reputation honestly in the advanced economies.
column2: 纽约—经济学常常被称为忧郁的科学，对于过去五年的发达经济体来说，这一称谓名符其实。

column1: Unfortunately, the year ahead will bring little relief.
column2: 不幸的是，刚刚到来的新的一年也不会有多少改变。

column1: Real (inflation-adjusted) per capita GDP in France, Greece, Italy, Spain, the United Kingdom, and the United States is lower today than before the Great Recession hit.
column2: 如今，法国、希腊、意大利、西班牙、英国和美国的实际（经通胀调整的）人均GDP比大衰退来临前更低。

column1: Indeed, Greece’s per capita GDP has shrunk nearly 25% since 2008.
column2: 事实上，希腊的人均GDP比2008年低了近25 % 。

column1: There are a few exceptions: After more than two decades, Japan’s economy appears to be turning a corner under Prime Minister Shinzo Abe’s government; but, with a legacy of deflation stretching back to the 1990’s, it will be a long road back.
column2: 也有少数例外：在经历了二十多年的停滞后，日本经济在首相安倍晋三政府的带领下扭转了局面；但是，通缩从20世纪90年代就开始困扰日本，走出通缩还有很长的路要走。

column1: And Germany’s real per capita GDP was higher in 2012 than it was in 2007 – though an increase of 3.9% in five years is not much to boast about.
column2: 2012年，德国的实际人均GDP高于2007年，尽管五年增长3.7%实在没什么好值得骄傲的。

column1: Elsewhere, though, things really are dismal: unemployment in the eurozone remains stubbornly high and the long-term unemployment rate in the US still far exceeds its pre-recession levels.
column2: 但是，在其他地区，情况名符其实地令人忧郁：欧元区失业率仍居高不下，美国的长期失业率仍高于衰退前水平。

column1: In Europe, growth appears set to return this year, though at a truly anemic rate, with the International Monetary Fund projecting a 1% annual increase in output.
column2: 在欧洲，增长有望在今年回归，尽管速度将非常缓慢，国际货币基金组织（IMF）的产出增长预测是1 % 。

column1: In fact, the IMF’s forecasts have repeatedly proved overly optimistic: the Fund predicted 0.2% growth for the eurozone in 2013, compared to what is likely to be a 0.4% contraction; and it predicted US growth to reach 2.1%, whereas it now appears to have been closer to 1.6%.
column2: 事实上，IMF的预测总是过于乐观：它预测今年欧元区能增长0.2 % ， 实际上可能是0.4%的衰退；它预测美国经济能增长2.1 % ， 实际上是近1.6 % 。

column1: With European leaders wedded to austerity and moving at a glacial pace to address the structural problems stemming from the eurozone’s flawed institutional design, it is no wonder that the continent’s prospects appear so bleak.
column2: 欧洲领导人纷纷祭出通缩，而纠正欧元区有缺陷的制度设计所造成的结构性问题的速度又极为缓慢，因此欧洲大陆前景如此凄惨并不令人意外。

column1: But, on the other side of the Atlantic, there is cause for muted optimism.
column2: 但是，在大西洋另一端，我们有理由保持适度乐观。

column1: Revised data for the US indicate that real GDP grew at an annual pace of 4.1% in the third quarter of 2013, while the unemployment rate finally reached 7% in November – the lowest level in five years.
column2: 修正后的美国数据表明2013年前三季度实际GDP增长年率为4.1 % ， 而失业率在11月终于降到了7 % — —五年来的最低水平。

column1: A half-decade of low construction has largely worked off the excess building that occurred during the housing bubble.
column2: 五年的低开工数大致消除了房地产泡沫期间产生的过剩建筑。

column1: The development of vast reserves of shale energy has moved America toward its long-sought goal of energy independence and reduced gas prices to record lows, contributing to the first glimmer of a manufacturing revival.
column2: 巨量页岩能源储量的开发让美国有望实现长期追求的能源自给目标，也让天然气价格降到了历史最低点，帮助制造业初现复苏曙光。

column1: And a booming high-tech sector has become the envy of the rest of the world.
column2: 而繁荣的高技术部门也让世界其他地区艳羡不已。

column1: Most important, a modicum of sanity has been restored to the US political process.
column2: 最重要的是，美国政坛也恢复了一点清醒。

column1: Automatic budget cuts – which reduced 2013 growth by as much as 1.75 percentage points from what it otherwise would have been – continue, but in a much milder form.
column2: 自动预算削减 — — 它可能让2013年增长降低了1.75个百分点 — — 在继续进行，但比以前温和了许多。

column1: Moreover, the cost curve for health care – a main driver of long-term fiscal deficits – has bent down.
column2: 此外，医疗成本曲线 — — 长期财政赤字的主因 — — 也在往下走。

column1: Already, the Congressional Budget Office projects that spending in 2020 for Medicare and Medicaid (the government health-care programs for the elderly and the poor, respectively) will be roughly 15% below the level projected in 2010.
column2: 国会预算办公室预测，2020年联邦医疗保险（Medicare）和医疗补助（Medicaid，两者分别是针对老人和穷人的政府医疗计划）支出将2010年所预测的水平低大约15 % 。

column1: It is possible, even likely, that US growth in 2014 will be rapid enough to create more jobs than required for new entrants into the labor force.
column2: 有可能，甚至可以说有极大的可能，2014年美国增长速度将能够创造足够的就业岗位容纳劳动力市场新晋大军而有余。

column1: At the very least, the huge number (roughly 22 million) of those who want a full-time job and have been unable to find one should fall.
column2: 至少庞大的寻找全职工作而不得的人群（大约2200万人）会有所缩小。

column1: But we should curb our euphoria.
column2: 但我们应该克制乐观情绪。

column1: A disproportionate share of the jobs now being created are low-paying – so much so that median incomes (those in the middle) continue to decline.
column2: 目前所创造的就业岗位中有很大一部分是低薪职位，以至于中位收入（在收入分配中位于正中）继续下跌。

column1: For most Americans, there is no recovery, with 95% of the gains going to the top 1%.
column2: 对大部分美国人来说，根本不存在复苏，95%的利益都流入了最顶层1%手中。

column1: Even before the recession, American-style capitalism was not working for a large share of the population.
column2: 即使在衰退前，美国式资本主义已然不利于很大一部分人口。

column1: The recession only made its rough edges more apparent.
column2: 衰退只是让这一现象变得清晰可见。

column1: Median income (adjusted for inflation) is still lower than it was in 1989, almost a quarter-century ago; and median income for males is lower than it was four decades ago.
column2: 中位收入（经通胀调整后）仍低于近四分之一个世纪前的1989年水平；而男性中位收入更是比四十年前还要低。

column1: America’s new problem is long-term unemployment, which affects nearly 40% of those without jobs, compounded by one of the poorest unemployment-insurance systems among advanced countries, with benefits normally expiring after 26 weeks.
column2: 美国的新问题是长期失业，如今这一问题影响着近40%的失业者，而美国的失业保险又是发达国家中最差的，失业救济通常只能领26周。

column1: During downturns, the US Congress extends these benefits, recognizing that individuals are unemployed not because they are not looking for work, but because there are no jobs.
column2: 在衰退期间，美国国会扩大了失业救济，认识到个体之所以失业不是因为不找工作，而是因为没有工作可做。

column1: But now congressional Republicans are refusing to adapt the unemployment system to this reality; as Congress went into recess for the holidays, it gave the long-term unemployed the equivalent of a pink slip: as 2014 begins, the roughly 1.3 million Americans who lost their unemployment benefits at the end of December have been left to their own devices.
column2: 但如今国会共和党拒绝根据现实调整失业制度，随着国会因假期休会，长期失业者也收到了遗弃通知书：2014年伊始，大约130万在12月底失去失业救济的美国人处于自生自灭的状态。

column1: Happy New Year.
column2: 新年快乐。

column1: Meanwhile, a major reason that the US unemployment rate is currently as low as it is, is that so many people have dropped out of the labor force.
column2: 与此同时，如今美国失业如此之低的一个主要原因是大量人口退出了劳动力大军。

column1: Labor-force participation is at levels not seen in more than three decades.
column2: 劳动力参与率处于三十多年未见的低水平。

column1: Some say that this largely reflects demographics: an increasing share of the working-age population is over 50, and labor-force participation has always been lower among this group than among younger cohorts.
column2: 有人说这主要是人口因素造成的：越来越多的工作年龄人口超过了50岁，而该人群的劳动力参与率总是比更年轻人群低。

column1: But this simply recasts the problem: the US economy has never been good at retraining workers.
column2: 但这只是换了一个问题：美国经济从来不善于留住员工。

column1: American workers are treated like disposable commodities, tossed aside if and when they cannot keep up with changes in technology and the marketplace.
column2: 美国工人就像是可处置的商品，如果不能适应技术和市场的变化就会被扫地出门。

column1: The difference now is that these workers are no longer a small fraction of the population.
column2: 现在的区别是，这类工人不再是人口的一小撮。

column1: None of this is inevitable.
column2: 所有这些都不是不可避免的。

column1: It is the result of bad economic policy and even worse social policy, which waste the country’s most valuable resource – its human talent – and cause immense suffering for affected individuals and their families.
column2: 这是坏经济政策和更坏的社会政策的结果，坏政策浪费了美国最宝贵的资源 — — 人的才能，而受到影响的个人和他们的家庭遭到了严重伤害。

column1: They want to work, but the US economic system is failing them.
column2: 他们希望工作，但美国的经济制度让他们工作无望。

column1: So, with Europe’s Great Malaise continuing in 2014 and the US recovery excluding all but those at the top, count me dismal.
column2: 因此，看到欧洲带着大问题走进2014年，而美国的复苏只适用于最顶层人群时，我实在是忧郁不可自胜。

column1: On both sides of the Atlantic, market economies are failing to deliver for most citizens.
column2: 在大西洋两岸，市场经济没能惠及大部分公民。

column1: How long can this continue?
column2: 这一状况会持续多久？

column1: The Great Malaise Drags On
column2: 大萎靡的拖累

column1: NEW YORK – There’s something dismal about writing year-end roundups in the half-decade since the eruption of the 2008 global financial crisis.
column2: 纽约—给2008年爆发的全球金融危机写一个五年总结是令人抑郁的。

column1: Yes, we avoided a Great Depression II, but only to emerge into a Great Malaise, with barely increasing incomes for a large proportion of citizens in advanced economies.
column2: 是的，我们避免了大萧条II，但进入了大萎靡（Great Malaise ） ， 发达经济体的大部分人收入几乎没有增长。

column1: We can expect more of the same in 2014.
column2: 2014年也将如此。

column1: In the United States, median incomes have continued their seemingly relentless decline; for male workers, income has fallen to levels below those attained more than 40 years ago.
column2: 在美国，中位收入继续着残酷的跌势；男性员工的收入水平已经回到了四十年前。

column1: Europe’s double-dip recession ended in 2013, but no one can responsibly claim that recovery has followed.
column2: 欧洲的二次探底在2013年结束了，但但凡有点理性的人都不会说随后就能迎来复苏。

column1: More than 50% of young people in Spain and Greece remain unemployed.
column2: 西班牙和希腊有一半以上的年轻人仍处于失业状态。

column1: According to the International Monetary Fund, Spain can expect unemployment to be above 25% for years to come.
column2: 根据国际货币基金组织（IMF）的数据，西班牙今后几年的失业率预计都将在25%以上。

column1: The real danger for Europe is that a sense of complacency may set in.
column2: 欧洲的真正危险在于自满情绪开始涌现。

column1: As the year passed, one could feel the pace of vital institutional reforms in the eurozone slowing.
column2: 在今年，我们可以感到欧元区关键的制度性改革节奏正在放慢。

column1: For example, the monetary union needs a real banking union – including not just common supervision, but also common deposit insurance and a common resolution mechanism – and Eurobonds, or some similar vehicle for mutualizing debt.
column2: 比如，欧元区需要真正的银行联盟（不仅要有共同监督，也要有共同存款保险和共同清算机制）和欧元债券（或类似的债务共同化机制 ） 。

column1: The eurozone is not much closer to implementing either measure than it was a year ago.
column2: 对于这两点，欧元区和一年前相比没有多少进步。

column1: One could also sense a renewed commitment to the austerity policies that incited Europe’s double-dip recession.
column2: 你还可以感到把欧洲带入二次探底衰退的紧缩政策又卷土重来了。

column1: Europe’s continuing stagnation is bad enough; but there is still a significant risk of another crisis in yet another eurozone country, if not next year, in the not-too-distant future.
column2: 欧洲的持续停滞已经够糟糕的了；但仍有很大的可能在新的欧元区国家爆发新的危机，就算不是明年，恐怕也不会遥远。

column1: Matters are only slightly better in the US, where a growing economic divide – with more inequality than in any other advanced country – has been accompanied by severe political polarization.
column2: 美国的情况也只是略好。 在美国，日益严重的经济差距 — — 其不平等程度为发达国家之最 — — 伴随着严重的政治两极分化。

column1: One can only hope that the lunatics in the Republican Party who forced a government shutdown and pushed the country to the brink of default will decide against a repeat performance.
column2: 我们只能希望迫使政府关门、让美国走向违约悬崖的共和党狂人们不会一再如此。

column1: But even if they do, the likely contraction from the next round of austerity – which already cost 1-2 percentage points of GDP growth in 2013 – means that growth will remain anemic, barely strong enough to generate jobs for new entrants into the labor force.
column2: 但即使他们真的不再如此，新一轮紧缩所可能造成的衰退 — — 目前紧缩已经造成2013年1—2个百分点的GDP增长损失 — — 也意味着增长将继续萎靡，无法创造足够的就业岗位吸收新晋劳动力。

column1: A dynamic tax-avoiding Silicon Valley and a thriving hydrocarbon sector are not enough to offset austerity’s weight.
column2: 充满活力的避税硅谷和繁荣的能源部门并不足以抵消紧缩的影响。

column1: Thus, while there may be some reduction of the Federal Reserve’s purchases of long-term assets (so-called quantitative easing, or QE), a move away from rock-bottom interest rates is not expected until 2015 at the earliest.
column2: 因此，尽管美联储购买长期资产（所谓的量化宽松，简称QE）的手笔可能有所减小，但利率告别历史低位可能不会遭遇2015年。

column1: Ending low-interest-rates now would not be sensible, though QE has probably benefited the US economy only slightly, and may have raised risks abroad.
column2: 现在就结束低利率肯定是不明智的，尽管QE给美国经济带来的好处可能极为有限，在海外还提高了风险。

column1: The tremors in global financial markets set off by discussions earlier in 2013 of tapering QE highlighted the extent of interdependence in the global economy.
column2: 2013年早些时候关于逐渐减少QE的讨论引起了全球金融市场动荡，这凸显出全球经济相互依赖的程度。

column1: Just as QE’s introduction fueled currency appreciation, announcing its eventual end triggered depreciation.
column2: 正如QE的引入助长了货币升值，宣布其最终结束触发了贬值。

column1: The good news was that most major emerging countries had built up large foreign-exchange reserves and had sufficiently strong economies that they could withstand the shock.
column2: 好消息是大部分主要新兴国家建立了庞大的外汇储备和足够强劲的经济，能够抵御冲击。

column1: Still, the growth slowdown in emerging economies was disappointing – all the more so because it is likely to continue through 2014.
column2: 尽管如此，新兴经济体的增长放缓令人失望 — — 特别是考虑到2014年可能延续这一趋势。

column1: Each country produced its own story: India’s downturn, for example, was attributed to political problems in New Delhi and a central bank worried about price stability (though there was little reason to believe that raising interest rates would do much about the price of onions and the other items underlying Indian inflation).
column2: 每个国家都有每个国家的故事：比如，印度的减速被归因于新德里的政治问题和担心物价稳定的央行（尽管很少有证据证明提高利率能大大影响洋葱和其他决定印度通胀的物品的价格 ） 。

column1: Social unrest in Brazil made it clear that, despite remarkable progress in reducing poverty and inequality over the past decade, the country still has much to do to achieve broadly shared prosperity.
column2: 巴西的社会动荡明确地表明，尽管该国在过去十年中在减贫和减少不平等方面取得了令人瞩目的进步，但实现广泛共享的繁荣仍然任重道远。

column1: At the same time, the wave of protest showed the growing political clout of the country’s expanding middle class.
column2: 与此同时，示威潮表明巴西崛起的中产阶级政治力量日增。

column1: China’s decelerating growth had a significant impact on commodity prices, and thus on commodity exporters around the world.
column2: 中国增长的减速对商品价格形成了严重冲击，全球商品出口国也因此受到影响。

column1: But China’s slowdown needs to be put in perspective: even its lower growth rate is the envy of the rest of the world, and its move toward more sustainable growth, even if at a somewhat lower level, will serve it – and the world – well in the long run.
column2: 但中国的减速要真确地予以解读：其减速后的增长率仍然令世界其他国家艳羡，并且正在朝可持续增长迈进（虽然增长水平降低了 ） ， 从长期看，这有利于中国，也有利于世界。

column1: As in previous years, the fundamental problem haunting the global economy in 2013 remained a lack of global aggregate demand.
column2: 和前几年一样，2013年困扰全球经济的根本性问题仍然是全球总需求不足。

column1: This does not mean, of course, that there is an absence of real needs – for infrastructure, to take one example, or, more broadly, for retrofitting economies everywhere in response to the challenges of climate change.
column2: 当然，这并不意味着缺少真实需求 — — 比如在基础设施方面以及更广泛的调整各国经济以适应气候变化挑战方面。

column1: But the global private financial system seems incapable of recycling the world’s surpluses to meet these needs.
column2: 但全球私人金融系统似乎无法利用全球盈余来满足这些需求。

column1: And prevailing ideology prevents us from thinking about alternative arrangements.
column2: 而主流思想则阻止了我们考虑其他安排。

column1: We have a global market economy that is not working.
column2: 我们的全球市场经济运转出现了问题。

column1: We have unmet needs and underutilized resources.
column2: 我们的需求没有得到满足，资源没有得到充分利用。

column1: The system is not delivering benefits for large segments of our societies.
column2: 当前体系没有为社会中的许多群体带来好处。

column1: And the prospect of significant improvement in 2014 – or in the foreseeable future – seems unrealistic.
column2: 2014年（或者可预见的未来）发生重大改进的可能性也不现实。

column1: At both the national and global levels, political systems seem incapable of introducing the reforms that might create prospects for a brighter future.
column2: 不管在国家还是在全球层面，政治制度都不足以引入可以带来更光明的未来前景的改革。

column1: Maybe the global economy will perform a little better in 2014 than it did in 2013, or maybe not.
column2: 或许全球经济在2014年会比2013年略有进步，或许不会。

column1: Seen in the broader context of the continuing Great Malaise, both years will come to be regarded as a time of wasted opportunities.
column2: 但从持续大萎靡的更广的角度看，今明两年都将被视为浪费机会之年。

column1: American Delusions Down Under
column2: 美国妄想症贻害无穷

column1: NEW YORK – For better or worse, economic-policy debates in the United States are often echoed elsewhere, regardless of whether they are relevant.
column2: 纽约—不管是好是坏，美国经济政策争论常常在未必有关系的别国引起回响。

column1: Australian Prime Minister Tony Abbott’s recently elected government provides a case in point.
column2: 澳大利亚总理阿伯特的新当选政府就提供了这样一个例子。

column1: As in many other countries, conservative governments are arguing for cutbacks in government spending, on the grounds that fiscal deficits imperil their future.
column2: 和其他许多国家一样，保守派政府认为要削减政府支出，以免财政赤字威胁国家的未来。

column1: In the case of Australia, however, such assertions ring particularly hollow – though that has not stopped Abbott’s government from trafficking in them.
column2: 但是，在澳大利亚，这一主张显得特别空洞，但这并没有阻止阿伯特政府推行它。

column1: Even if one accepts the claim of the Harvard economists Carmen Reinhart and Kenneth Rogoff that very high public debt levels mean lower growth – a view that they never really established and that has subsequently been discredited – Australia is nowhere near that threshold.
column2: 即使你同意哈佛经济学家莱因哈特（Carmen Reinhart）和罗格夫（Kenneth Rogoff ） ， 认为高公债水平意味着低增长 — — 这一观点从来没有真正提出过，并且随后就被推翻了 — — 澳大利亚也远远没有达到阈值水平。

column1: Its debt/GDP ratio is only a fraction of that of the US, and one of the lowest among the OECD countries.
column2: 其债务/GDP 之比只有美国的几分之一，为经合组织最低水平之一。

column1: What matters more for long-term growth are investments in the future – including crucial public investments in education, technology, and infrastructure.
column2: 影响长期增长的重要因素是未来投资 — — 包括教育、科技和基础设施等方面的关键公共投资。

column1: Such investments ensure that all citizens, no matter how poor their parents, can live up to their potential.
column2: 这些投资确保所有公民，不管家庭出身是穷是富，都能实现自己的潜能。

column1: There is something deeply ironic about Abbott’s reverence for the American model in defending many of his government’s proposed “reforms.”
column2: 阿伯特奉美国模式为圭臬，顽固坚持他的政府所提出的“改革 ” ， 这看起来相当讽刺。

column1: After all, America’s economic model has not been working for most Americans.
column2: 毕竟，美国经济模式对大部分美国人也不灵光。

column1: Median income in the US is lower today than it was a quarter-century ago – not because productivity has been stagnating, but because wages have.
column2: 如今，美国中位收入还不如二十五年前 — — 不是因为生产率没有增长，而是因为工资停滞不前。

column1: The Australian model has performed far better.
column2: 澳大利亚模式的表现远好于美国。

column1: Indeed, Australia is one of the few commodity-based economies that has not suffered from the natural-resource curse.
column2: 事实上，澳大利亚是极少数逃脱自然资源魔咒的大宗商品经济体之一。

column1: Prosperity has been relatively widely shared.
column2: 相对而言，其经济增长被广大国民所分享。

column1: Median household income has grown at an average annual rate above 3% in the last decades – almost twice the OECD average.
column2: 过去十年中位家庭收入年均增长率超过3 % ， 是经合组织平均水平的近两倍。

column1: To be sure, given its abundance of natural resources, Australia should have far greater equality than it does.
column2: 平心而论，考虑到丰富的自然资源，到达利亚的平等性应该更加出色。

column1: After all, a country’s natural resources should belong to all of its people, and the “rents” that they generate provide a source of revenue that could be used to reduce inequality.
column2: 毕竟，一国的自然资源应属于全体人民，这些自然资源所产生的“租”提供了可用于降低不平等性的收入。

column1: And taxing natural-resource rents at high rates does not cause the adverse consequences that follow from taxing savings or work (reserves of iron ore and natural gas cannot move to another country to avoid taxation).
column2: 而对自然资源租课以高额税率并不会产生对储蓄或工作课税所引起的消极后果（铁矿石和天然气储量不可能为了避税而转移到他国 ） 。

column1: But Australia’s Gini coefficient, a standard measure of inequality, is one-third higher than that of Norway, a resource-rich country that has done a particularly good job of managing its wealth for the benefit of all citizens.
column2: 但澳大利亚的基尼系数（衡量不平等程度的指标）比挪威高三分之一。 同为资源丰富国的挪威在管理国家财富以使全民受益方面做得非常出色。

column1: One wonders whether Abbott and his government really understand what has happened in the US?
column2: 你或许会感到奇怪，阿伯特及其政府真的明白美国发生了什么吗？

column1: Does he realize that since the era of deregulation and liberalization began in the late 1970s, GDP growth has slowed markedly, and that what growth has occurred has primarily benefited those at the top?
column2: 他意识到自20世纪79年代末开始去监管化和自由化以来，GDP增长显著放缓，并且增长果实主要被最顶尖人群攫取了吗？

column1: Does he know that prior to these “reforms,” the US had not had a financial crisis – now a regular occurrence around the world – for a half-century, and that deregulation led to a bloated financial sector that attracted many talented young people who otherwise might have devoted their careers to more productive activities?
column2: 他知道在这些“改革”之前，美国已有半个世纪没有经历过金融危机（眼下金融危机倒成了全球范围内见怪不怪之事了 ） ， 并且去监管化导致了金融部门不断坐大、吸引了本应将职业生涯贡献给生产率更高的活动的年轻才俊吗？

column1: Their financial innovations made them extremely rich but brought America and the global economy to the brink of ruin.
column2: 他们的金融创新给自己带来了巨富，但却将美国和全球经济推向了毁灭边缘。

column1: Australia’s public services are the envy of the world.
column2: 澳大利亚的公共服务令全世界艳羡。

column1: Its health-care system delivers better outcomes than the US, at a fraction of the cost.
column2: 其医疗体系比美国效果更好，而成本只有美国的几分之一。

column1: It has an income-contingent education-loan program that permits borrowers to spread their repayments over more years if necessary, and in which, if their income turns out to be particularly low (perhaps because they chose important but low-paying jobs, say, in education or religion), the government forgives some of the debt.
column2: 澳大利亚拥有基于收入的教育贷款机制，允许借款人在必要时延长还款年限，如果他们的收入非常低（也许是因为他们选择了重要但低薪的工作，如教育或宗教方面的工作 ） ， 政府还可以豁免一些债务。

column1: The contrast with the US is striking.
column2: 澳大利亚与美国可谓对比鲜明。

column1: In the US, student debt, now in excess of $1.2 trillion (more than all credit-card debt), is becoming a burden for graduates and the economy.
column2: 在美国，学生债务目前已超1.2万亿美元（比信用卡债务还要高 ） ， 成为毕业生和经济的一大负担。

column1: America’s failed financial model for higher education is one of the reasons that, among the advanced countries, America now has the least equality of opportunity, with the life prospects of a young American more dependent on his or her parents’ income and education than in other advanced countries.
column2: 美国的机会平等状况在发达国家中垫底，与其他发达国家相比，美国年轻人的生活前景更多地取决于父母亲的收入和教育，之所以如此，失败的高等教育金融模式难辞其咎。

column1: Abbott’s notions about higher education also suggest that he clearly does not understand why America’s best universities succeed.
column2: 阿伯特的高等教育观也表明，他完全不知道为什么美国顶尖大学能获得成功。

column1: It is not price competition or the drive for profit that has made Harvard, Yale, or Stanford great.
column2: 让哈佛、耶鲁和斯坦福名垂世界的并不是价格竞争或逐利。

column1: None of America’s great universities are for-profit-institutions.
column2: 美国顶尖大学都不是营利组织。

column1: They are all not-for-profit institutions, either public or supported by large endowments, contributed largely by alumni and foundations.
column2: 它们都是非盈利组织，或者是公立学校，或者拥有庞大的捐赠（主要来自校友和基金会 ） 。

column1: There is competition, but of a different sort.
column2: 竞争是存在的，但是另一种竞争。

column1: They strive for inclusiveness and diversity.
column2: 美国顶尖大学竞争的是包容性和多样性。

column1: They compete for government research grants.
column2: 它们竞争政府研究补助。

column1: America’s under-regulated for-profit universities excel in two dimensions: the ability to exploit young people from poor backgrounds, charging them high fees without delivering anything of value, and the ability to lobby for government money without regulation and to continue their exploitative practices.
column2: 美国不受监管的盈利性大学在两方面很在行：一是剥削出身贫寒的年轻人，向他们征收高额学费，而提供的教学内容毫无价值；二是游说政府给它们不受监管的拨款，继续从事剥削行动。

column1: Australia should be proud of its successes, from which the rest of the world can learn a great deal.
column2: 澳大利亚应该为它的成功而骄傲，世界其他国家能够从澳大利亚身上学到很多教益。

column1: It would be a shame if a misunderstanding of what has happened in the US, combined with a strong dose of ideology, caused its leaders to fix what is not broken.
column2: 不能理解美国所发生的事情而又被意识形态所蒙蔽，以至于其领导人向根本不必纠正之处开刀，这将是澳大利亚之祸。

column1: Europe’s Austerity Zombies
column2: 欧洲的紧缩僵尸

column1: NEW YORK – “If the facts don’t fit the theory, change the theory,” goes the old adage.
column2: 纽约 — “ 如果事实和理论不符，那么就改理论 ， ” 老话如是说。

column1: But too often it is easier to keep the theory and change the facts – or so German Chancellor Angela Merkel and other pro-austerity European leaders appear to believe.
column2: 但往往保持理论改变事实才更容易 — — 或者说，德国总理默克尔和其他支持紧缩的欧洲领导人是这么认为的。

column1: Though facts keep staring them in the face, they continue to deny reality.
column2: 尽管频繁被事实打脸，他们仍拒绝接受现实。

column1: Austerity has failed.
column2: 紧缩失败了。

column1: But its defenders are willing to claim victory on the basis of the weakest possible evidence: the economy is no longer collapsing, so austerity must be working!
column2: 但紧缩的辩护者仍要以极其脆弱的证据宣布胜利“经济不再崩溃，因此一定是紧缩见效了！

column1: But if that is the benchmark, we could say that jumping off a cliff is the best way to get down from a mountain; after all, the descent has been stopped.
column2: 但如果以此为准，我们可以说跳下悬崖是最好的下山方式；毕竟，下坡之势被止住了。

column1: But every downturn comes to an end.
column2: 但所有的衰退总有重点。

column1: Success should not be measured by the fact that recovery eventually occurs, but by how quickly it takes hold and how extensive the damage caused by the slump.
column2: 成功不能用复苏终于发生这一事实来衡量，而应该用复苏多快、衰退创造的伤害多大来衡量。

column1: Viewed in these terms, austerity has been an utter and unmitigated disaster, which has become increasingly apparent as European Union economies once again face stagnation, if not a triple-dip recession, with unemployment persisting at record highs and per capita real (inflation-adjusted) GDP in many countries remaining below pre-recession levels.
column2: 从这些标准看，紧缩是一场彻头彻尾的灾难。 我们日益明确地看到，欧盟经济体再次面临着停滞甚至三次探底，失业高居创纪录的水平，许多国家的人均真实（经通胀调整的） GDP仍低于衰退前水平。

column1: In even the best-performing economies, such as Germany, growth since the 2008 crisis has been so slow that, in any other circumstance, it would be rated as dismal.
column2: 即使在德国等表现最好的经济体，2008年以来的增长也变得非常缓慢，若是换作其他时期，只能用凄凉来形容。

column1: The most afflicted countries are in a depression.
column2: 受冲击最大的国家则陷入了萧条。

column1: There is no other word to describe an economy like that of Spain or Greece, where nearly one in four people – and more than 50% of young people – cannot find work.
column2: 除此之外你找不到其他词汇来形容西班牙和希腊的经济了 — — 每四个人中就有一个无法找到工作，年轻人的这一比例更是超过50 % 。

column1: To say that the medicine is working because the unemployment rate has decreased by a couple of percentage points, or because one can see a glimmer of meager growth, is akin to a medieval barber saying that a bloodletting is working, because the patient has not died yet.
column2: 说解药正在起效，因为失业率下降了几个百分点或者能够看到一丁点儿微弱的增长迹象，就好比是中世纪理发师宣布放血疗法起了效果，因为病人还没有死一样。

column1: Extrapolating Europe’s modest growth from 1980 onwards, my calculations show that output in the eurozone today is more than 15% below where it would have been had the 2008 financial crisis not occurred, implying a loss of some $1.6 trillion this year alone, and a cumulative loss of more than $6.5 trillion.
column2: 从1980年以来欧洲温和增长出发，我测算今天的欧元区产出比2008年不发生金融危机的情形要低15%以上，这意味着光是在今年，损失就高达1.6万亿美元，累计损失则超过6.5万亿美元。

column1: Even more disturbing, the gap is widening, not closing (as one would expect following a downturn, when growth is typically faster than normal as the economy makes up lost ground).
column2: 更令人担忧的是，这一缺口还在扩大而不是缩小（按理说缺口应该减小，因为随着经济收复失地，增长通常要快于常态 ） 。

column1: Simply put, the long recession is lowering Europe’s potential growth.
column2: 简言之，长期衰退正在拖累欧洲的潜在增长。

column1: Young people who should be accumulating skills are not.
column2: 理应积累技能的年轻人没有这样做。

column1: There is overwhelming evidence that they face the prospect of significantly lower lifetime income than if they had come of age in a period of full employment.
column2: 压倒性证据表明，与充分就业时期进入劳动力市场的轻型相比，他们面临着显著更低的终身收入。

column1: Meanwhile, Germany is forcing other countries to follow policies that are weakening their economies – and their democracies.
column2: 与此同时，德国正在强迫其他国家跟进削弱经济 — — 以及民主的政策。

column1: When citizens repeatedly vote for a change of policy – and few policies matter more to citizens than those that affect their standard of living – but are told that these matters are determined elsewhere or that they have no choice, both democracy and faith in the European project suffer.
column2: 如果公民一再将选票投给政策变革 — — 并且很难找出比影响人民生活水平的政策对人民的影响更大的政策了 — — 却被告知此事由其他国家决定，他们别无选择，那么民主和对欧洲工程的信任都将遭到打击。

column1: France voted to change course three years ago.
column2: 三年前，法国人把选票投给了改变道路。

column1: Instead, voters have been given another dose of pro-business austerity.
column2: 但他们得到的却是又一波有利于商业的紧缩。

column1: One of the longest-standing propositions in economics is the balanced-budget multiplier – increasing taxes and expenditures in tandem stimulates the economy.
column2: 经济学中历史最悠久的一个理论是平衡预算乘数 — — 同时增加税收和支出能刺激经济。

column1: And if taxes target the rich, and spending targets the poor, the multiplier can be especially high.
column2: 而如果课税目标是富人而支出目标是穷人，该乘数将非常大。

column1: But France’s so-called socialist government is lowering corporate taxes and cutting expenditures – a recipe almost guaranteed to weaken the economy, but one that wins accolades from Germany.
column2: 但法国的所谓社会主义（socialist）政府却在降低公司税、削减支出 — — 这一组合几乎肯定会削弱经济，但它得到了德国的赞扬。

column1: The hope is that lower corporate taxes will stimulate investment.
column2: 人们寄希望于更低的公司税能刺激投资。

column1: This is sheer nonsense.
column2: 纯属无稽之谈。

column1: What is holding back investment (both in the United States and Europe) is lack of demand, not high taxes.
column2: 拖累投资（不管在美国还是在欧洲）的是缺少需求，而不是高税率。

column1: Indeed, given that most investment is financed by debt, and that interest payments are tax-deductible, the level of corporate taxation has little effect on investment.
column2: 事实上，由于大部分投资通过债务融资，而利息偿付可以抵扣应税项目，因此公司税水平对投资几乎没有影响。

column1: Likewise, Italy is being encouraged to accelerate privatization.
column2: 类似地，意大利被鼓励加快私有化。

column1: But Prime Minister Matteo Renzi has the good sense to recognize that selling national assets at fire-sale prices makes little sense.
column2: 但总理伦齐明智地认识到以跳楼价出售国家资产无济于事。

column1: Long-run considerations, not short-run financial exigencies, should determine which activities occur in the private sector.
column2: 长期考虑而不是短期金融之急才是决定私人部门行为的因素。

column1: The decision should be based on where activities are carried out most efficiently, serving the interests of most citizens the best.
column2: 决策应该基于哪些活动效率最高、最能符合大多数人民的利益。

column1: Privatization of pensions, for example, has proved costly in those countries that have tried the experiment.
column2: 比如，试水养老金私有化的国家无不发现代价沉重。

column1: America’s mostly private health-care system is the least efficient in the world.
column2: 美国的医疗体系私有化程度最高，但效率堪称全世界最低。

column1: These are hard questions, but it is easy to show that selling state-owned assets at low prices is not a good way to improve long-run financial strength.
column2: 这些问题很困难，但很容易看到，低价出售国有资产不是改善长期金融健康的好办法。

column1: All of the suffering in Europe – inflicted in the service of a man-made artifice, the euro – is even more tragic for being unnecessary.
column2: 更加悲剧的是，欧洲的所有苦难 — — 为了有利于人为造成的阴谋欧盟服务 — — 根本毫无必要。

column1: Though the evidence that austerity is not working continues to mount, Germany and the other hawks have doubled down on it, betting Europe’s future on a long-discredited theory.
column2: 尽管紧缩没有奏效的证据一天比一天多，但德国和其他鹰派仍在加倍下注，根据早已站不住脚的理论赌欧洲的未来。

column1: Why provide economists with more facts to prove the point?
column2: 为什么还要为经济学家提供更多事实证明这一点呢？

column1: Rethinking Pharmaceutical Business Models
column2: 反思医药商业模式

column1: ZURICH – The world’s health needs are changing dramatically.
column2: 苏黎世 — — 世界健康需求正在发生着巨大的改变。

column1: Demographic trends, shifting patterns of disease, and strained public funding are placing new burdens on health-care systems.
column2: 人口趋势、不断变化的疾病模式和紧张的公共资源正在给医疗卫生系统造成新的负担。

column1: For developed and developing countries alike, the new demands cannot be met if health care continues to operate in the same way.
column2: 发达国家和发展中国家一样，如果继续以原有模式运营医疗保健行业将无法满足新的需求。

column1: What is required are new business models that spread risks, take a broader view of health, and address the needs of the world’s poorest people.
column2: 这就需要全新商业模式来分散风险、从更广阔的视角看待医疗卫生行业并满足全世界贫困民众的需求。

column1: Demographic changes will present significant challenges for countries’ long-term health planning.
column2: 人口结构改变将为各国长期健康规划带来重大的挑战。

column1: By 2050, the number of people worldwide who are 60 or older will exceed the number of children under 15.
column2: 到2050年，全世界60岁以上人口的数量将超过 15岁以下儿童。

column1: Moreover, an additional three billion people will join the global middle class over the next two decades, altering the types of health issues that countries will face, and the way health care is financed.
column2: 此外，今后二十年内还将有三十亿人进入全球中产阶级行列，从而改变国家面临的健康问题和医疗保健的资金来源。

column1: At the same time, non-communicable diseases, such as cancer, heart disease, and diabetes, are rising, while previously deadly conditions, such as HIV/AIDS, are now more treatable and have been deemed chronic diseases.
column2: 同时，癌症、心脏疾病、糖尿病等非传染性疾病愈演愈烈，而HIV/艾滋病等曾经的致命疾病因为已经可以得到治疗而成为新的慢性病。

column1: Keeping up with these changes would be difficult in the best of times.
column2: 即使在黄金时期适应这样的变化也非常困难。

column1: But a stagnant global economy is straining health-care budgets to the breaking point.
column2: 但停滞不前的全球经济正将医疗保健预算推向崩溃的边缘。

column1: Governments, insurers, and other health-care payers are becoming ever more concerned about getting value for money.
column2: 政府、保险公司和其他为医疗保健业掏钱的人对性价比的关注度正越来越高。

column1: In response, pharmaceutical companies and policymakers are looking for innovative ways to reduce these pressures, not just by developing new drugs, but also by rethinking how the industry operates.
column2: 因此，制药公司和决策者都在探索新方法来缓解压力，其中不仅涉及新药研发，还涉及对行业运营方式的重新思考。

column1: My company, for one, has tested three business models that have shown encouraging results.
column2: 比方说我公司就已经试验了三种商业模式并取得了令人鼓舞的成果。

column1: One involves risk sharing, in which the user pays for the drug only if his treatment turns out to be successful.
column2: 其中一种涉及到风险分担机制，只有治疗见效的患者才需要支付药品费用。

column1: If it is not, the pharmaceutical company refunds the cost.
column2: 反之制药公司将接受退款。

column1: We have used risk-sharing programs in Germany, where we cooperate with two major payers on the pricing for Aclasta, an osteoporosis treatment.
column2: 我们已经在德国执行了风险分担计划，与两家重要支付主体就治疗骨质疏松药物密固达的定价进行了合作。

column1: If a patient suffers a bone fracture after treatment (signifying that the drug has not worked), Novartis repays the cost.
column2: 如果患者治疗后发生骨折（这显示该药没起作用 ） ， 那么诺华公司需要将收取的款项退还给患者。

column1: The payer benefits from this system, because risk sharing minimizes the cost of failure.
column2: 付费方从这一体制中受益，因为风险分担最大限度地降低了失败的成本。

column1: The pharmaceutical firm gains as well, because the effective guarantee underpins public confidence in its products.
column2: 制药企业同样也是赢家，因为有效保障增强了公众对其产品的信心。

column1: The risk-sharing model has limitations, though.
column2: 但风险分担模式亦有其局限性。

column1: Some payers find that the system is too complex, especially when trying to define a successful outcome, and that they must wait too long for refunds.
column2: 有些付费方发现这项制度尤其在确定治疗是否成功时显得过于复杂，而且他们要等太长时间才能拿到退款。

column1: Nevertheless, risk sharing is a good starting point from which to develop a fairer and more efficient business model – and one that can be refined or simplified over time.
column2: 尽管如此，风险分担仍不失为一个制��公平有效商业模式的不错起点 — — 这一模式可以随着时间推移逐步得到细化或简化。

column1: A second business model brings patients, payers, and health-care professionals together to provide an integrated program to complement treatment for a specific illness.
column2: 第二种商业模式让患者、付费方和医疗专业人士合作建立补充治疗特定疾病的医疗计划。

column1: In Brazil, for example, our Vale Mais Saúde program uses this approach to treat chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), a potentially fatal lung condition forecast to be the world’s third biggest killer by 2030.
column2: 以巴西为例，我们的Vale Mais Saúde医疗计划利用这种方法来治疗慢性阻塞性肺病（COPD ） ， 有预测认为这种潜在的致命肺病到2030年可能成为世界第三大杀手。

column1: In addition to providing Onbrez Breezhaler, a daily treatment to improve lung function in COPD patients, the program provides a comprehensive treatment package covering all symptoms.
column2: 除提供改善慢性肺阻塞患者肺功能的日常治疗外，该计划还针对所有症状提供一揽子治疗。

column1: Patients can receive discounted flu vaccines, nicotine replacement therapies, help in enrolling in pulmonary rehabilitation sessions, and health information sent to their homes.
column2: 患者能够以折扣价得到流感疫苗、接受尼古丁替代疗法、报名听取肺部康复课程并获得上门健康信息服务。

column1: These interventions alleviate symptoms, prevent other illnesses from exacerbating them, and help patients continue their normal daily activities.
column2: 这些干预措施能够缓解症状，防止其他疾病导致症状加剧，并帮助患者延续正常的日常活动。

column1: But it is in the poorest countries with the least developed health-care systems and weakest infrastructure that new business models are needed the most.
column2: 但最需要全新商业模式的恰恰是医疗保健制度最落后、基础设施也最薄弱的贫困国家。

column1: In the past, corporate philanthropy has gone some way to help, but such an approach is neither sustainable nor scalable.
column2: 过去，企业慈善在这方面做过一些有益的尝试，但这种方法既不可持续也很难推广。

column1: If companies are to make a significant difference, they must find ways to work with existing health-care systems over the long term.
column2: 如果公司要想取得显著变化，他们必须找到长期适应现有医疗保健制度的方法。

column1: One way to do this is through social ventures.
column2: 一种方法是通过社会企业。

column1: For example, our Arogya Parivar (or “Healthy Family”) program reaches millions of India’s poorest citizens.
column2: 比方说，我们的Arogya Parivar（即“健康家庭 ” ） 计划服务于数百万最贫困的印度民众。

column1: It is organized around four principles: awareness, acceptability, availability, and adaptability.
column2: 这项计划的基石是宣传、接受性、有效性和适应性。

column1: Arogya Parivar raises general public awareness of health issues by training educators to teach disease prevention and treatment in villages, helping some 2.5 million rural inhabitants in 2012 alone.
column2: Arogya Parivar计划通过开展农村疾病预防治疗教育培训培养公众健康意识，仅2012年一年就为250万农村居民提供了帮助。

column1: The program reaches more than 45,000 local doctors through a network of 90 medical distributors, ensuring that medicines are available in 28,000 of India’s remotest pharmacies.
column2: 该计划通过下属90家医疗分销商网络覆盖超过45,000名当地医生，确保为28,000家印度最偏远的药房提供药物。

column1: To ensure affordability, especially to those on a daily wage, we sell smaller, over-the-counter doses.
column2: 为保证普通百姓，尤其是工薪阶层能买得起药，我们出售小包装非处方药物。

column1: The program is also flexible, adapting medicines, packaging, and training according to the different health and cultural needs of India’s diverse communities.
column2: 这项计划也相当灵活，根据印度不同群体的健康和文化需求来调整药品、包装和培训内容。

column1: These three examples demonstrate that, with innovative thinking, we can meet the world’s changing health needs.
column2: 这三个例子表明通过创新思维，我们能够满足全球不断变化的健康需求。

column1: Pharmaceutical companies are doing what they can – but they need help.
column2: 制药企业都在竭尽全力，但他们需要帮助。

column1: Most important, governments, payers, and physicians must come together to test, support, and roll out the best and most cost-effective ideas.
column2: 最重要的是，政府、支付公司和医生必须同心协力，试验、支持并推广性价比最高的优秀理念。

column1: Only then can we improve the health of all people, rich and poor alike, regardless of where they live.
column2: 这样我们才能改善全民健康状况，不管他们在哪里生活，也不管他们是穷是富。

column1: A Healthier, Wealthier Africa
column2: 更健康、更富有的非洲

column1: ZURICH – The BRIC countries (Brazil, Russia, India, and China) have long been the focus of emerging-market investors.
column2: 苏黎世—金砖四国（巴西、俄罗斯、印度和中国）一直是新兴市场投资者关注的焦点。

column1: But it is in Africa, a region with the world’s second-fastest growth, where the next big business opportunities lie.
column2: 但增长速度位居世界第二的非洲地区才是下一个大商业机会的所在地。

column1: In about one-third of the continent’s 55 countries, annual GDP growth is above 6%, and Sub-Saharan Africa grew at an estimated 5.1% pace in 2013.
column2: 非洲大陆55个国家中有大约三分之一年GDP增长率超过6 % ， 2013年撒哈拉以南非洲地区预计增长率为5.1 % 。

column1: Foreign investors report that their return on investment in Africa is higher than in any other emerging region.
column2: 外国投资者报告其在非洲的投资回报率比其他任何新兴地区都要高。

column1: By 2040, the continent’s working-age population will total an estimated 1.1 billion people, providing businesses with a larger labor pool than even China or India.
column2: 到2040年，非洲大陆的工作适龄人口预计将达到11亿人，成为比中国和印度更大的劳动力储备大军。

column1: Moreover, economic expansion is taking place not just in urban centers, but in small towns and villages as well.
column2: 此外，经济扩张并不局限于城市中心，小村镇也在增长。

column1: However, Africa also faces major challenges.
column2: 但是，非洲也面临着重大挑战。

column1: One of the biggest concerns is inadequate health care.
column2: 最大的担忧之一是医疗不足。

column1: Preventable and treatable diseases plague the population.
column2: 可预防和可治愈疾病困扰着大量人口。

column1: Life expectancy is 14 years below the global average.
column2: 非洲预期寿命比全球平均水平低14岁。

column1: Nearly one in 20 adults in the 15-49 age group in Sub-Saharan Africa lives with HIV – roughly six times the global average.
column2: 撒哈拉以南非洲地区的15—49岁年龄段人口中每20人就有一人携带艾滋病毒 — — 大概是全球水平的六倍。

column1: Every minute, an African child dies from malaria.
column2: 每一分钟都有一名非洲儿童死于疟疾。

column1: Africa’s rapid economic growth and urbanization are also creating new health challenges.
column2: 非洲的快速经济增长和城市化也在造成新的健康挑战。

column1: Non-communicable diseases are projected to become the most common causes of death by 2030.
column2: 据估计，到2030年，非传染性疾病将成为最大的死因。

column1: The number of diabetes cases, for example, is expected nearly to double over the next two decades.
column2: 比如，糖尿病人数量预计会在未来二十年里翻一番。

column1: If left unaddressed, the dual burden of communicable and non-communicable diseases could jeopardize Africa’s economic potential.
column2: 如果放任问题发展，传染性和非传染性疾病的双重压力可能压垮非洲的经济潜力。

column1: To avoid this, three critical areas of health care must be addressed: technology, infrastructure, and education.
column2: 为了避免这一幕，必须解决好医疗领域的三个关键问题：技术、基础设施和教育。

column1: Africa has witnessed some remarkable technological leaps.
column2: 非洲已经有了一些令人瞩目的技术进步。

column1: A decade ago, telecoms infrastructure was almost non-existent.
column2: 十年前，通信基础设施基本上不存在。

column1: Today, one in six people owns a mobile phone, the benefits of which go far beyond easy communication.
column2: 如今，每六个人就拥有一部移动电话，移动电话带来的好处远远不止于通信的便捷。

column1: Africa has pioneered the use of mobile banking, with local players like M-Pesa and global corporations like Citi demonstrating how new technology can provide vital financial services to the unbanked population.
column2: 非洲是移动银行的先锋，M-Pesa等本地公司和花旗银行等跨国公司证明了新技术可以为无法接触到银行的人口提供至关重要的金融服务。

column1: Mobile money and digital wallets accessed on cellphones eliminate the need for physical cash in rural areas, where financial services are limited and carrying large amounts of cash is risky.
column2: 可以通过手机操作的移动支付和数字钱包消除了在农村地区携带实体现金的需要。 由于金融服务的缺乏，在非洲农村地区携带大笔现金是很危险的。

column1: Joining this mobile-phone revolution, Novartis is working with five African governments and private-sector partners to improve drug distribution and monitor the supply of anti-malaria medicines in rural areas, using text messaging and electronic mapping.
column2: 诺华制药公司也加入了这场移动电话革命，与五个非洲国家的政府和私人部门合作使用手机短信和电子地图改善药品分销和监测疟疾药物在农村地区的供应情况。

column1: Previously, patients would travel to distant health clinics only to find that the medicines that they needed were no longer in stock.
column2: 此前，病人必须长途跋涉前往诊所买药，并且时常遇到所需药品没有库存的情况。

column1: Now, thanks to the SMS for Life project, vital medicines can be quickly redistributed to where they are most needed.
column2: 如今，有了“生命短信 ” （ SMS for Life）项目的支持，关键药品可以迅速地分配给最需要的地区。

column1: A second crucial aspect of improving Africa’s health care is infrastructure.
column2: 改善非洲健康状况的第二个关键领域是基础设施。

column1: Good rail lines, roads, and ports allow products and services to be distributed widely at lower cost, and to benefit from economies of scale.
column2: 良好的铁路、公路和港口能让产品和服务以低廉的成本得到广泛的分销，并能获得规模经济带来的好处。

column1: This is an essential component of any country’s economic development.
column2: 这对于任何一个国家的经济发展来说都是必不可少的。

column1: And nowhere are the benefits more evident than in the provision of health care.
column2: 而非洲更是从医疗供���中获益最大的地区。

column1: Fortunately, several companies are rising to the challenge.
column2: 幸运的是，一些公司正在应对这一挑战。

column1: Coca-Cola, for example, is contributing its supply-chain expertise to map out health facilities and implement stock-management software to support the distribution of bed nets, contraceptives, anti-AIDS drugs, and vaccines to remote villages.
column2: 比如，可口可乐正在改善其供应链的专业水平，优化医疗设施布局，改善库存管理软件，从而支持面向偏远村庄的蚊帐、避孕药、艾滋病治疗药和疫苗的分配。

column1: Meanwhile, Novartis is piloting a “social venture” business model to give poor people in remote villages access to vital medicines that are packaged in small, affordable doses.
column2: 与此同时，诺华制药公司正在试验一套“社会创业”模式，让偏远村庄的穷人也能获得廉价的小包装必须药物。

column1: Finally, education is one of the most powerful tools for reducing poverty and generating sustainable, inclusive economic growth.
column2: 最后，教育是消除贫困、产生可持续的包容性经济增长的最有力的武器。

column1: But, given limited resources and few teachers, too many children are being left behind.
column2: 但是，由于教育和教师资源的局限，太多儿童输在了起跑线上。

column1: Public-private partnerships are helping to change this.
column2: 公私合作正在改变这一状况。

column1: The IT company Cisco, for example, works with NGOs to connect communities and help students develop skills in information and communications technology.
column2: 比如，IT行业的思科公司与非政府组织合作建立了社区之间的联系并帮助学生发展信息和通信技术方面的技能。

column1: Poor education also affects health.
column2: 拙劣的教育也影响健康。

column1: Although Africa accounts for one-seventh of the world’s population, it bears one-quarter of the global disease burden, yet has a mere 2% of the world’s doctors.
column2: 尽管非洲拥有世界七分之一的人口，但却承受了全球四分之一的疾病负担，只拥有全世界2%的医生。

column1: Unsurprisingly, many health problems stem from ignorance about diseases and basic hygiene.
column2: 毫不奇怪，许多健康问题源自对疾病和基本卫生知识的无知。

column1: So Novartis has formed a partnership with the Earth Institute, the United Nations, and private-sector groups to train and deploy by 2015 a million community health workers in Sub-Saharan Africa to deliver basic treatment and preventive care, and to track disease outbreaks.
column2: 因此，诺华制药公司与地球研究所（Earth Institute ） 、 联合国和私人部门集团建立了合作伙伴关系，致力于到2015年在撒哈拉以南非洲地区培训和部署一百万社区健康工作者提供基本治疗和预防措施并追踪疾病的爆发。

column1: The idea is that local people will learn how to support their communities, rather than rely on handouts, and thereby lift themselves out of poverty permanently.
column2: 这一方案的构想是让本地人学到如何支持他们的社区，而不是依赖宣传，从而让他们本身永远摆脱贫困。

column1: Africa is increasingly showing signs of its promise, but innovative solutions to improve its people’s health are essential if the continent is to approach its potential.
column2: 非洲正在日益显示出未来的活力，但如果这片大陆要实现它的潜力，就必须有创新型方案来改善其人民的健康。

column1: This will require more than philanthropy: it will demand new commercial models that solve health-care issues, help the economy to grow, and benefit those who invest in Africa’s future.
column2: 这不光光是慈善问题：这需要新的商业模式来解决健康问题、刺激经济增长并让投资非洲未来的人获益。

column1: Putin’s Calculus
column2: 普京的如意算盘

column1: CAMBRIDGE – By most accounts, Russian President Vladimir Putin has been the winner in the Ukraine crisis, at least so far.
column2: 坎布里奇 — — 多数人认为至少到目前为止，俄罗斯总统普京一直是乌克兰危机的赢家。

column1: His annexation of Crimea, which Nikita Khrushchev arbitrarily transferred to Ukraine in 1954, has been widely applauded at home, and he has largely shrugged off Western governments’ responses.
column2: 他吞并1954年赫鲁晓夫强制移交给乌克兰的克里米亚的举动在国内赢得了广泛赞誉，他也在很大程度上对西方政府的反应嗤之以鼻。

column1: But, from a longer-term perspective, Putin’s victory is not quite so certain.
column2: 但从更长远的角度来看，普京能否取得最终胜利仍然是未知数。

column1: The current crisis in Ukraine began with President Viktor Yanukovych’s decision to reject a European Union Association Agreement, opting instead for a deal with Russia that included desperately needed financing.
column2: 乌克兰目前这场危机始于维克托·亚努科维奇总统拒绝签署欧盟联合协议，转而选择与俄罗斯签订包括其迫切需要的融资条款在内的协议的决策。

column1: This outraged Ukrainians in the country’s more pro-EU western regions, spurring protracted popular protests that ultimately toppled Yanukovych’s corrupt but democratically elected government.
column2: 此举激怒了亲欧盟西部地区的乌克兰人，引发了长时间的民众抗议活动，最终推翻了虽由民主选举产生但却腐败的亚努科维奇政府。

column1: But not all Ukrainians were averse to pursuing closer ties with Russia.
column2: 但并非所有乌克兰人都不愿与俄罗斯建立更紧密的关系。

column1: Indeed, Yanukovych’s decision pleased many Russian speakers in Ukraine’s eastern and southern regions.
column2: 实际上，乌克兰东部和南部众多讲俄语的民众对亚努科维奇的决策非常满意。

column1: And it was to Russia that Yanukovych turned when, after months of peaceful demonstrations in Kyiv, violence broke out and demonstrators were killed, spurring him to flee Ukraine.
column2: 亚努科维奇在基辅长达数月的和平示威引发暴力活动并打死示威者后逃离乌克兰向俄罗斯求助。

column1: For his part, Putin not only provided sanctuary for Yanukovych and refused to recognize the new government in Kyiv; he began to help organize – and incite – resistance among Crimea’s ethnic Russian majority.
column2: 普京不仅为亚努科维奇提供庇护，而且拒绝承认基辅新政府；他开始协助组织 — — 和煽动 — — 克里米亚主要民族俄罗斯族的抵抗运动。

column1: By deploying Russian troops (often masked and without insignias) from the Black Sea Fleet’s base in Sevastopol, which Russia had leased from Ukraine, Putin was able to take control of the peninsula with no loss of life.
column2: 普京从向乌克兰租借的塞瓦斯托波尔黑海舰队基地部署俄军（往往并不佩戴俄军标识 ） ， 不费一兵一卒就掌握了对半岛的控制。

column1: When Western leaders expressed outrage over the forced changes to European borders, Putin remained unfazed, citing NATO’s use of force in Kosovo 15 years ago, and their subsequent support for its formal secession from Serbia, as an example of their hypocrisy.
column2: 当西方领导人表达对俄国强制改变欧洲边界的愤慨时，普京丝毫不为所动，他援引15年前北约在科索沃动武及其后支持科索沃正式脱离塞尔维亚的例子，来证明北约的虚伪性。

column1: The West shot back with targeted sanctions against a few high-level Russian officials, to which Putin responded with sanctions of his own, barring entry to selected Western politicians.
column2: 西方国家实施了���某些俄罗斯高官的针对性制裁，而普京则以禁止某些西方政客进入俄罗斯的制裁措施回敬。

column1: All in all, a few Russian banks have had their accounts frozen; some shipments of sensitive goods have been halted; and the ruble and the Russian stock market have suffered losses.
column2: 总之，有几家俄国银行的账户遭到了冻结；某些批次的敏感货物停运；卢布和俄罗斯股市也遭受了损失。

column1: But the overall impact of the West’s response has been moderate.
column2: 但西方制裁措施产生的影响相对温和。

column1: The West’s reluctance to intensify sanctions stems largely from European countries that retain strong economic ties with Russia.
column2: 西方不愿加大制裁力度主要因为某些欧洲国家与俄国有着很强的经济联系。

column1: While the United States – which trades little with Russia – and the EU have vowed to develop a framework for additional sanctions, to be activated if Putin sends forces into eastern Ukraine, designing them in a way that does not hurt Europe will not be easy.
column2: 虽然对俄贸易稀少的美国会同欧盟发誓要制定进一步制裁框架并在普京派军进入东乌克兰的情况下予以实施，但要找到不损害欧洲利益的制裁方法其实并不容易。

column1: Nonetheless, Russia has paid a high price for its actions in terms of its international standing.
column2: 尽管如此，俄国在国际地位方面付出了惨重的代价。

column1: The goodwill and soft power generated by the Sochi Olympics were immediately depleted, and Russia has now been all but expelled from the G-8.
column2: 索契冬奥会带来的声誉和软实力即刻烟消云散，俄国目前就差被八国集团赶出门去。

column1: In the United Nations General Assembly, Russia had to face an embarrassing vote in which 100 countries condemned its actions.
column2: 俄罗斯被迫在联大面临一轮尴尬的投票，有100个国家对它的行为表示谴责。

column1: And, at the end of the nuclear security summit in The Hague, US President Barack Obama cited Russia as a regional power whose aggressive policies toward its neighbors displayed weakness.
column2: 而且在海牙核安全峰会结束时，美国总统奥巴马公开表示俄罗斯身为地区强国对邻国采取的激进政策将其弱点暴露在光天化日之下。

column1: Does any of this matter to Putin?
column2: 这些措施普京究竟在不在意？

column1: The answer depends on what his objectives are.
column2: 答案取决于他的目的到底是什么。

column1: If, as some observers claim, Putin’s aggressive actions stem from feelings of insecurity, he has had mixed success.
column2: 如果真如某些观察家所言是内心的不安全感造成了普京的侵略，那么他的成败很难说得清楚。

column1: By this account, Putin feared diminished influence in a neighboring country with which Russia shares deep historical ties.
column2: 按照这种解释，普京害怕在与俄有深刻历史渊源的国家降低影响力。

column1: But, despite Russia’s obvious influence among eastern Ukraine’s Russophones, the overall impact of the annexation of Crimea has been to reduce Russia’s influence in the country, while reinvigorating Putin’s bête noire, NATO.
column2: 但尽管俄国对东乌克兰俄罗斯族的影响显而易见，但吞并克里米亚总体而言导致俄罗斯对乌克兰的影响力降低，而且还重新激起了北约对普京的厌恶情绪。

column1: Putin may also have worried that a successful revolution in Ukraine might encourage a revival of the protests that caused him so much trouble in 2012, when he re-assumed the presidency from Dmitri Medvedev.
column2: 普京或许还担心乌克兰革命成功可能重新激起抗议活动，类似活动曾在2012年他从梅德韦杰夫手中接任总统时给他带来过很多问题。

column1: In the wake of his annexation of Crimea, Putin’s domestic approval rating has soared, and the chances that any protest would succeed in genuinely undercutting – much less toppling – his administration are very low.
column2: 吞并克里米亚后普京的国内支持率飙升，任何抗议活动真正破坏 — — 更不用说推翻其政府的可能性非常之低。

column1: Others claim that Putin’s primary motivation was to restore Russia’s global “great power” status.
column2: 还有人认为恢复俄国的全球“大国”地位才是普京的主要目的。

column1: After all, Putin, a former KGB agent in East Germany, has lamented the Soviet Union’s dissolution as “the greatest geopolitical disaster of the twentieth century.”
column2: 毕竟普京曾经是东德的克格勃特工，他曾感叹苏联解体是“二十世纪最大的地缘政治灾难 ” 。

column1: In fact, Putin often has been described as angry with the West, beset by a sense of betrayal and humiliation from what he perceives as unfair treatment of Russia.
column2: 事实上，有人说普京对西方怀着满腔愤怒，因为俄罗斯遭受不公平待遇而感觉遭到背叛和羞辱。

column1: For Putin, gestures like including Russia in the G-8, the G-20, and the World Trade Organization, and inviting a Russian ambassador to NATO discussions in Brussels, could not make up for NATO’s expansion to Russia’s borders, the placement of anti-ballistic missile sites in Eastern Europe, or the dismemberment of Serbia.
column2: 在普京看来，邀请俄国加入八国集团、二十国集团、世贸组织、以及邀请俄大使参与布鲁塞尔北约会议等表面姿态均不足以弥补北约向俄罗斯边境扩张、在东欧部署反弹道导弹，或者肢解塞尔维亚的实际行动。

column1: The overthrow of Libya’s Colonel Muammar el-Qaddafi and ongoing efforts to undercut the Kremlin’s client, Syrian President Bashar al-Assad, have only made matters worse.
column2: 推翻利比亚上校卡扎菲和持续破坏克里姆林代言人叙利亚巴沙尔·阿萨德总统只能让情况进一步恶化。

column1: If status was an important motive for Putin’s actions in Crimea, the West’s response may have a greater impact than many now believe.
column2: 如果地位问题是普京开展克里米亚行动的主要动机，那么西方应对之策的影响可能会比现在很多人认为的要大。

column1: Before the Winter Games in Sochi (where the G-8 was scheduled to meet in June), Putin cited increased soft power as an important goal for Russia – an objective that his use of hard power in Ukraine has made much more difficult to achieve.
column2: 索契冬奥会前（八国集团原定于六月召开会议 ） ， 普京曾提出增强软实力是俄罗斯的重要目标 — — 他在乌克兰动用武力导致提高软实力的难度明显加大。

column1: In this sense, Obama’s declaration that Russia is a regional power acting out of weakness, no less than Russia’s suspension from the G-8, may have hit Putin where he is most vulnerable.
column2: 从这个意义上讲，奥巴马宣布俄国是因为脆弱而采取行动的地区强国，正如将俄国开除出八国集团一样，可能恰恰命中了普京的薄弱之处。

column1: His actions in Ukraine have undoubtedly brought Russia tangible gains in the short term.
column2: 普京在乌克兰的行动无疑为俄国带来了短期效益。

column1: But they also imply less obvious costs. It remains to be seen whether Putin’s bold move was worth it.
column2: 但同时也付出了不那么明显的成本，普京的大胆举动是否值得还有待观察。

column1: 1914 Revisited?
CAMBRIDGE – This year marks the hundredth anniversary of a transformative event of modern history.
column2: 美国剑桥—今年是现代史上具有转折意义的事件的一百周年纪念。

column1: World War I killed some 20 million people and ground up a generation of Europe’s youth. It also fundamentally changed the international order in Europe and beyond.
column2: 第一次世界大战夺走了大约2000万人的生命，摧毁了一整代欧洲青年，也根本性地改变了欧洲和世界的国际秩序。

column1: Indeed, WWI destroyed not only lives, but also three empires in Europe – those of Germany, Austria-Hungary, and Russia – and, with the collapse of Ottoman rule, a fourth on its fringe.
column2: 事实上，一战不但摧毁了无数生命，也摧毁了三个欧洲帝国 — — 日耳曼、奥匈和沙俄，奥斯曼土耳其帝国的崩溃可以算边缘的第四个。

column1: Until the Great War, the global balance of power was centered in Europe; after it, the United States and Japan emerged as great powers.
column2: 在这场大战前，全球实力平衡的中心在欧洲；之后，美国和日本崛起成为新超级大国。

column1: The war also ushered in the Bolshevik Revolution of 1917, prepared the way for fascism, and intensified and broadened the ideological battles that wracked the twentieth century.
column2: 大战还带来了1917年布尔什维克革命，酝酿了法西斯，也加剧和扩大了困扰二十世纪的意识形态之争。

column1: How could such a catastrophe happen?
column2: 如此灾难是如何发生的？

column1: Shortly after the war broke out, when German Chancellor Theobald von Bethmann-Hollweg was asked to explain what happened, he answered, “Oh, if I only knew!”
column2: 大战爆发没多久，德国总理贝特曼-赫尔维格（Theobald von Bethmann-Hollweg）在解释发生了什么事时说 ： “ 哦，我要是知道就好了 ！ ”

column1: Perhaps in the interest of self-exoneration, he came to regard the war as inevitable.
column2: 也许出于自我开脱的目的，他认为大战是不可避免的。

column1: Similarly, the British Foreign Minister, Sir Edward Grey, argued that he had “come to think that no human individual could have prevented it.”
column2: 类似地，英国首相格雷爵士（Sir Edward Grey）指出他“认为没有人类能够事先阻止它的发生 。 ”

column1: The question we face today is whether it could happen again.
column2: 今天，我们面对的问题是它会不会再次发生。

column1: Margaret MacMillan, author of the interesting new book The War that Ended Peace, argues that, “it is tempting – and sobering – to compare today’s relationship between China and the US with that between Germany and Britain a century ago.”
column2: 在饶有兴味的新书《结束和平的战争 》 （ The War that Ended Peace）中，麦克米伦（Margaret MacMillan）指出 ， “ 将今天的中美关系和一个世纪前的德英关系作对比引人入胜、使人警醒 。 ”

column1: After drawing a similar comparison, The Economist concludes that “the most troubling similarity between 1914 and now is complacency.”
column2: 在做了类似的比较后 ， 《 经济学人 》 （ The Economist）做出的结论是“1914年和现在最令人警惕的相似之处是自满 。 ”

column1: And some political scientists, such as John Mearsheimer of the University of Chicago, have argued that, “to put it bluntly: China cannot rise peacefully.”
column2: 一些政治家，如芝加哥大学的梅尔西梅尔（John Mearsheimer）指出“坦率地说就是，中国不可能和平崛起 。 ”

column1: But historical analogies, though sometimes useful for precautionary purposes, become dangerous when they convey a sense of historical inevitability.
column2: 但历史相似性尽管有益于预防，但若揭示出某种历史必然性也是危险的。

column1: WWI was not inevitable.
column2: 一战不是不可避免的。

column1: It was made more probable by Germany’s rising power and the fear that this created in Great Britain.
column2: 德国实力的增强以及由此造成的英国的担心让大战可能性增加了。

column1: But it was also made more probable by Germany’s fearful response to Russia’s rising power, as well as myriad other factors, including human errors.
column2: 但同样增加了大战可能性的还有德国对沙俄实力增加的恐慌性反应以及包括人为失误在内的其他诸多因素。

column1: But the gap in overall power between the US and China today is greater than that between Germany and Britain in 1914.
column2: 但今天美国和中国之间的实力总差距比1914年的德国和英国更大。

column1: Drawing contemporary lessons from 1914 requires dispelling the many myths have been created about WWI.
column2: 从1914年汲取教训需要解构许多关于一战的神话。

column1: For example, the claim that it was a deliberate preventive war by Germany is belied by the evidence showing that key elites did not believe this.
column2: 比如，说一战是德国故意引发的预防性战争是错误的，有证据证明德国精英并不这么认为。

column1: Nor was WWI a purely accidental war, as others maintain: Austria went to war deliberately, to fend off the threat of rising Slavic nationalism.
column2: 说一战纯粹是意外战争也是错误的：奥地利有战争意图，为的是阻止塞尔维亚民族主义的日趋高涨。

column1: There were miscalculations over the war’s length and depth, but that is not the same as an accidental war.
column2: 战争的长度和深度都被错误估计了，但这并不能证明这是意外战争。

column1: It is also said that the war was caused by an uncontrolled arms race in Europe.
column2: 还有人说，一战是由失控的欧洲军备竞赛引起的。

column1: But the naval arms race was over by 1912, and Britain had won.
column2: 但海军军备竞赛在1912年就以英国的胜利告终了。

column1: While there was concern in Europe about the growing strength of armies, the view that the war was precipitated directly by the arms race is facile.
column2: 尽管当时在欧洲也存在关于军队力量日益增加的担忧，但认为战争是军备竞赛的直接产物仍是错误的。

column1: Today’s world is different from the world of 1914 in several important ways.
column2: 当今世界与1914年存在诸多重要不同。

column1: One is that nuclear weapons give political leaders the equivalent of a crystal ball that shows what their world would look like after escalation.
column2: 其中之一是核武器就相当于政治领袖手上的水晶球，透过它可以看到战争升级后的世界会是怎样一片焦土。

column1: Perhaps if the Emperor, the Kaiser, and the Czar had had a crystal ball showing their empires destroyed and their thrones lost in 1918, they would have been more prudent in 1914.
column2: 也许如果皇帝、凯撒和沙皇也有水晶球，并且看到了1918年将是帝国末日，他们将失去皇位，那么他们在1914年就会更加谨慎。

column1: Certainly, the crystal-ball effect had a strong influence on US and Soviet leaders during the Cuban missile crisis.
column2: 毫无疑问，水晶球效应在古巴导弹危机期间对美国和苏联领导人形成了重要影响。

column1: It would likely have a similar influence on US and Chinese leaders today.
column2: 对今天的美国和中国领导人也是如此。

column1: Another difference is that the ideology of war is much weaker nowadays.
column2: 另一个不同是如今的战争意识形态要弱得多。

column1: In 1914, war really was thought to be inevitable, a fatalistic view reinforced by the Social Darwinist argument that war should be welcomed, because it would “clear the air” like a good summer storm.
column2: 1914年，战争确实被认为是不可避免的，这个致命观点因为社会达尔文主义信条而被强化了。 社会达尔文主义认为，战争是值得欢迎的，因为它就像夏季风暴一样能“让空气清新 ” 。

column1: As Winston Churchill wrote in The World Crisis:
column2: 丘吉尔在《世界危机 》 （ The World Crisis）中写道：

column1: “There was a strange temper in the air.
column2: “空气中有股奇怪的味道。

column1: Unsatisfied by material prosperity, the nations turned fiercely toward strife, internal or external.
column2: 各国对物质繁荣还不满足，热衷于内部和外部争吵。

column1: National passions, unduly exalted in the decline of religion, burned beneath the surface of nearly every land with fierce, if shrouded, fires.
column2: 因宗教衰落而高涨的国民热情正在几乎每一篇土地下面猛烈地燃烧着，只不过火苗被掩盖了。

column1: Almost one might think the world wished to suffer.
column2: 我们几乎可以确定，世界想吃点苦头。

column1: Certainly men were everywhere eager to dare.”
column2: 显然各地的男人们都渴望冒险 。 ”

column1: To be sure, nationalism is growing in China today, while the US launched two wars after the September 11, 2001, attacks.
column2: 诚然，如今中国的民族主义也在日益高涨，而美国在2001年9月11日后发动了两场战争。

column1: But neither country is bellicose or complacent about a limited war.
column2: 但中美都不是好斗国家，也不会满足于有限战争。

column1: China aspires to play a larger role in its region, and the US has regional allies to whose defense it is committed.
column2: 中国志在扩大地区影响，而美国在该地区拥有盟友并作出了防务承诺。

column1: Miscalculations are always possible, but the risk can be minimized by the right policy choices.
column2: 误算的可能永远存在，但其风险可以通过正确的政策选择来最小化。

column1: Indeed, on many issues – for example, energy, climate change, and financial stability – China and the US have strong incentives to cooperate.
column2: 事实上，在许多问题上 — — 比如能源、气候变化和金融稳定 — — 中国和美国都有很大的合作动机。

column1: Moreover, whereas Germany in 1914 was pressing hard on Britain’s heels (and had surpassed it in terms of industrial strength), the US remains decades ahead of China in overall military, economic, and soft-power resources.
column2: 此外，1914年的德国给英国造成了极大压力（并在工业优势方面超越了英国 ） ， 而如今美国在总体军事、经济和软实力资源方面仍领先中国数十年。

column1: Too adventuresome a policy would jeopardize China’s gains at home and abroad.
column2: 太冒险的政策将毁掉中国所取得的国内外进展。

column1: In other words, the US has more time to manage its relations with a rising power than Britain did a century ago.
column2: 换句话说，今天的美国比一百年前的英国有更多的时间处理其与崛起新势力的关系。

column1: Too much fear can be self-fulfilling.
column2: 太多恐慌将演变为自我实现。

column1: Whether the US and China will manage their relationship well is another question.
column2: 美国和中国能否管理好它们的关系是另一个问题。

column1: But how they do so will be dictated by human choice, not some ironclad historical law.
column2: 但这一问题将由人为选择决定，而不是由亘古不变的历史法则决定。

column1: Among the lessons to be learned from the events of 1914 is to be wary of analysts wielding historical analogies, particularly if they have a whiff of inevitability.
column2: 在从1914年汲取教训的同时也要警惕历史相似论，特别是在这引起不可避免论时。

column1: War is never inevitable, though the belief that it is can become one of its causes.
column2: 战争永远不是不可避免的，尽管认定其不可避免可能成为战争爆发的原因。

column1: The Old World’s New Roles
column2: 旧世界的新角色

column1: CAMBRIDGE – China’s rise has raised many questions for the West, with some wondering whether it is set to usurp a struggling Europe’s global leadership role.
column2: 美国剑桥—中国崛起给西方造成了很多问题，一些人担心中国是否意在夺取举步艰难的欧洲的全球领导角色。

column1: As one columnist put it, “there is nothing much European governments can do in East Asia, save serve as marketing managers for their domestic businesses.”
column2: 某专栏作家指出 ， “ 欧洲政府在东亚没什么事可干，无非是为本国企业当好营销经理 。 ”

column1: With neither the diplomatic weight nor the military heft to make an impression in the region, Europe had better leave the heavy lifting to the United States.
column2: 欧洲既没有外交分量，也没有军事实力可以在东亚留下痕迹，最好还是把重点放在美国身上。

column1: But this does not have to be the case.
column2: 但事实并非如此。

column1: For Europe, the implications of China’s rise are far-reaching, beginning with the United States’ strategic “pivot” toward Asia.
column2: 对欧洲来说，中国崛起的影响是深远的，其起始点是美国战略性“转向”亚洲。

column1: After more than 70 years as a top US priority, Europe is beginning to lose its privileged position in the eyes of American policymakers.
column2: 欧洲身为美国最重要着眼点已有70多年，但在美国决策者眼中，它正在失去这一超然地位。

column1: Moreover, European sales of high-tech dual-use products that complicate America’s security role in Asia is bound to create friction.
column2: 此外，欧洲销售与美国在亚洲的安全角色相冲突的高科技军民两用产品也必然会造成摩擦。

column1: Nonetheless, warnings that the Atlantic partnership is eroding are unduly dire.
column2: 尽管如此，关于大西洋合作伙伴关系正在销蚀毫无疑问是言过其实的。

column1: Tellingly, US President Barack Obama’s administration has replaced the term “pivot,” which implies a turn away from something, with “rebalancing.”
column2: 很能说明问题的是，美国总统奥巴马政府已经将隐含离开含义的“转向”一词替换为“再平衡 ” 。

column1: This change reflects a recognition that China’s increasing economic dominance does not negate the importance of the European Union, which remains the world’s largest economic entity and a leading source of economic innovation, not to mention values like the protection of human rights.
column2: 这一变化反映出美国认为中国经济主宰力的增加并非欧盟重要性的对立面，欧盟仍是世界最大经济实体，也是经济创新的主要源泉，更不用说人权保护方面的价值了。

column1: This is not to say that Asia’s rise will not demand adjustments.
column2: 这并不是说亚洲的崛起不需要调整。

column1: When the Industrial Revolution began, Asia’s share of the global economy began to decline from more than 50% to just 20% by 1900.
column2: 当工业革命开始时，亚洲占全球经济比重也开始从50%以上下降至1900年的只占20 % 。

column1: By the second half of this century, Asia is expected to recover its former economic dominance – that is, account for 50% of global output – while lifting hundreds of millions of people out of poverty.
column2: 到本世纪下半叶，预计亚洲将恢复此前的经济���导地位，即占全球产出的50 % ， 同时让数亿人摆脱贫困。

column1: This power shift – perhaps the most consequential of the twenty-first century – implies serious risks.
column2: 这一实力变迁 — — 也许是二十一世纪最重要的事件 — — 隐含着严重的风险。

column1: Historians often warn that the fear and uncertainty generated by the emergence of new powers like China can trigger serious conflict, like that which Europe experienced a century ago, when Germany overtook the United Kingdom in industrial production.
column2: 历史学家经常警告，中国等新强国的出现所造成的恐慌和不确定性可能引发严重冲突，就像一个世纪前德国在工业生产上赶超英国时欧洲所经历的那样。

column1: With Asia riven by territorial disputes and historical tensions, maintaining a stable security balance will not be easy.
column2: 面对饱受领土争端和历史恩怨纠缠的亚洲，保持稳定的安全平衡并非易事。

column1: But there are levers in place that can help.
column2: 但我们也可以找到支点以供利用。

column1: In the 1990s, when US President Bill Clinton’s administration was considering how to respond to China’s increasing economic might, some urged a policy of containment.
column2: 20世纪90年代，美国总统克林顿政府考虑如何应对不断增长的中国经济实力，有人敦促采取遏制政策。

column1: Clinton rejected that advice: It would have been impossible to forge an anti-China alliance, given the enduring desire of China’s neighbors to maintain good relations with it; more important, such a policy would have guaranteed future enmity with China.
column2: 克林顿拒绝了这一建议：建立反中同盟是不可能的，因为中国的邻国向来有与中国搞好关系的强烈愿望；更重要的是，这一政策不啻于让中国彻底成为未来敌人。

column1: Instead, Clinton chose a policy that could be called “integrate and insure.”
column2: 相反，克林顿选择了可以称之为“融合与确保 ” （ integrate and insure）的政策。

column1: While China was welcomed into the World Trade Organization (WTO), America revived its security treaty with Japan.
column2: 中国被接纳为世贸组织成员国，而美国则修订了与日本的安保条约。

column1: If China pursues a “peaceful rise,” its neighbors will focus on building strong economic relationships with it.
column2: 如果中国追求“和平崛起 ” ， 其邻国将专注于建立与中国的密切经济联系。

column1: If it throws its weight around – which some say is implied by its recent actions on the Indian border and in the East and South China Seas – its neighbors will seek to balance its power, with an American naval presence offering backup.
column2: 如果它向周边耀武扬威 — — 有人认为其最近在中印边界和东海和南海的动作便属此类 — — 其邻国就会追求实力平衡，而美国海军的身影将为它们提供底气。

column1: Where does Europe fit into this picture?
column2: 欧洲在这一局势中处于什么地位？

column1: For starters, it should monitor and restrain sensitive exports to avoid making the security situation more dangerous for the US.
column2: 首先，它应该监控和克制敏感出口，以避免让安全局势变得对美国更加危险。

column1: Even in trading terms, Europe has an interest in regional stability and secure sea lanes.
column2: 即使在贸易条件方面，地区稳定和安全的海路也有利于欧洲的利益。

column1: Furthermore, Europe can contribute to the development of the norms that shape the security environment.
column2: 此外，欧洲能够帮助发展决定安全环境的范式。

column1: For example, Europe can play an important role in reinforcing a universal interpretation of the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea, rather than China’s idiosyncratic version – especially given that the US has not even ratified the treaty.
column2: 比如，欧洲可以在执行联合国海洋法公约（United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea）的普通解释而非中国提出的特殊解释方面起到重要作用 — — 特别是在美国尚未签署该条约的情况下。

column1: Contrary to the claims of some analysts, China is not a revisionist state like Nazi Germany or the Soviet Union, eager to overthrow the established international order.
column2: 与一些分析家的观点相反，中国并非类似纳粹德国或苏联那样的修正主义国家，它并不急于推翻现有国际秩序。

column1: Indeed, it is not in China’s interest to destroy international institutions – such as the United Nations, the WTO, and the International Monetary Fund – that have helped to facilitate its rise.
column2: 事实上，破坏在其崛起过程中起到促进作用的国际机构 — — 如联合国、世贸组织和国际货币基金组织 — — 不符合中国利益。

column1: Given Europe’s leading roles in such institutions, it can help China gain the multilateral legitimacy that it seeks, in exchange for responsible behavior.
column2: 由于欧洲在这些机构中扮演着领导角色，因此它可以帮助中国获得其所追求的多边合法性，以换取中国的负责任的行为。

column1: Though China is not attempting to upend the global order, it is now undergoing a profound – and destabilizing – transformation.
column2: 尽管中国并不试图颠覆全球秩序，但眼下它正在经历一场深远的 — — 也是破坏性的 — — 转型。

column1: With the rise of transnational issues like climate change, terrorism, pandemics, and cyber crime – brought about by rapid technological progress and social change – power is being diffused not among states, but among a wide range of non-governmental entities.
column2: 在气候变化、恐怖主义、传染病和网络犯罪等跨国问题上 — — 快速的科技进步和社会变革是造成这些问题的原因 — — 实力并不是在国家间分布的，而是在非政府实体间分布的。

column1: Addressing these challenges will require broad international cooperation, with China, the US, and Europe each playing an important role.
column2: 解决这些挑战要求广泛的国际合作，中国、美国和欧洲都可以扮演重要角色。

column1: Finally, there is the question of values.
column2: 最后还有价值问题。

column1: Europe, together with the US, has already resisted Chinese (and Russian) demands for greater Internet censorship.
column2: 欧洲，以及美国，拒绝了中国（和俄罗斯）加强互联网审查的要求。

column1: And European countries like Norway and Germany have willingly taken economic hits in the name of human rights.
column2: 挪威和德国等欧洲国家也愿意以人权为名采取经济打击。

column1: While it is impossible to predict how Chinese politics will evolve, other countries’ experiences suggest that political change often occurs when per capita income reaches roughly $10,000.
column2: 预测中国政治会如何演进是不可能的，但其他国家的经验表明政治变革通常发生在人均收入达到10,000美元左右水平的时候。

column1: If such change does occur, Europe will have an opening to promote its core values even more effectively.
column2: 如果这一变革真的发生，欧洲将有机会更有效地推广其核心价值。

column1: Whether China’s economic interest in an impartial world order based on the rule of law will lead to greater protection of individual rights remains to be seen.
column2: 中国在基于法治精神的公平世界秩序中的经济利益能否带来个人权利的更大保护还有待观察。

column1: Only China will decide that.
column2: 只有中国能够决定着一点。

column1: But Europe can make a strong case.
column2: 但欧洲可以起重要作用。

column1: Duties Without Borders
column2: 不分国界的责任

column1: CAMBRIDGE – More than 130,000 people are said to have died in Syria’s civil war.
column2: 美国剑桥—据说已有130,000多人在叙利亚内战中丧生。

column1: United Nations reports of atrocities, Internet images of attacks on civilians, and accounts of suffering refugees rend our hearts.
column2: 联合国的暴行报告、互联网上关于袭击平民的图片以及流离失所的难民的口述让我们揪心。

column1: But what is to be done – and by whom?
column2: 但我们可以做些什么呢？ 又由谁来做呢？

column1: Recently, the Canadian scholar-politician Michael Ignatieff urged US President Barack Obama to impose a no-fly zone over Syria, despite the near-certainty that Russia would veto the United Nations Security Council resolution needed to legalize such a move.
column2: 最近，加拿大学者型政治家迈克尔·伊格纳提夫（Michael Ignatieff）敦促美国总统奥巴马在叙利亚设置禁飞区，但俄罗斯几乎肯定会否决这一措施合法化所必须的联合国安理会决议。

column1: In Ignatieff’s view, if Syrian President Bashar al-Assad is allowed to prevail, his forces will obliterate the remaining Sunni insurgents – at least for now; with hatreds inflamed, blood eventually will flow again.
column2: 伊格纳提夫认为，如果放任叙利亚总统巴沙尔·阿萨德继续统治，他的部队将击溃省下的逊尼派起义军 — — 至少现在是如此，而仇恨会蔓延，流血终将再次发生。

column1: In an adjoining article, the columnist Thomas Friedman drew some lessons from the United States’ recent experience in the Middle East.
column2: 在一篇类似的文章中，专栏作家托马斯·弗里德曼（Thomas Friedman）从了美国最近在中东的经验中总结了几个要点。

column1: First, Americans understand little about the social and political complexities of the countries there.
column2: 首先，美国人对中东国家的社会和政治复杂性所知甚少。

column1: Second, the US can stop bad things from happening (at considerable cost), but it cannot make good things happen by itself.
column2: 其次，美国可以停止坏事的发生（要付出很大的代价 ） ， 但好事是不会自己发生的。

column1: And, third, when America tries to make good things happen in these countries, it runs the risk of assuming responsibility for solving their problems.
column2: 第三，当美国试图让这些国家发生好事时，就要承担解决这些国家问题的责任的风险。

column1: So what are a leader’s duties beyond borders?
column2: 因此，领导人超越国界的责任在哪里？
