column1: The problem extends far beyond Syria – witness recent killings in South Sudan, the Central African Republic, Somalia, and other places.
column2: 这一问题的意义远不止于叙利亚 — — 放眼全球，南苏丹、中非共和国、索马里和其他很多地方都在发生杀戮。

column1: In 2005, the UN General Assembly unanimously recognized a “responsibility to protect” citizens when their own government fails to do so, and in 2011 it was invoked in UN Security Council Resolution 1973, authorizing the use of military force in Libya.
column2: 2005年，联合国大会一致通过了在政府无作为时对人民的“保护责任 ” ， 2011年这一责任被联合国安理会1973号决议援引，授权对利比亚动武。

column1: Russia, China, and others believe that the principle was misused in Libya, and that the guiding doctrine of international law remains the UN Charter, which prohibits the use of force except in self-defense, or when authorized by the Security Council.
column2: 俄罗斯、中国和其他国家认为这一原则在利比亚滥用了，国家法的指导思想仍应是联合国宪章，而宪章禁止在除自卫或得到安理会授权之外的情形中使用武力。

column1: But, back in 1999, when faced with a Russian veto of a potential Security Council resolution in the case of Kosovo, NATO used force anyway, and many defenders argued that, legality aside, the decision was morally justified.
column2: 但是，1999年，尽管俄罗斯否决了科索沃问题的潜在安理会决议，但北约仍然使用了武力，许多人为此辩护说，抛开法律问题不谈，这一决定是合乎道德的。

column1: So which arguments should political leaders follow when trying to decide the right policy to pursue?
column2: 那么，在决定什么政策值得追求时，政治领袖应该考虑哪些因素？

column1: The answer depends, in part, on the collectivity to which he or she feels morally obliged.
column2: 答案部分取决于他认为在道德上负有义务的集体。

column1: Above the small-group level, human identity is shaped by what Benedict Anderson calls “imagined communities.”
column2: 在小团体水平之上，人的身份由本尼迪克特·安德森（Benedict Anderson）所谓的“想象的共同体”决定。

column1: Few people have direct experience of the other members of the community with which they identify.
column2: 很少有人拥有其所认同的社会的其他成员所拥有的直接经验。

column1: In recent centuries, the nation has been the imagined community for which most people were willing to make sacrifices, and even to die, and most leaders have seen their primary obligations to be national in scope.
column2: 在近几个世纪中，国家便是大部分人甘愿作出牺牲甚至献身的想象的共同体，大部分领导人的首要义务是代表国家利益。

column1: In a world of globalization, however, many people belong to multiple imagined communities.
column2: 但是，在一个组织的世界中，许多人同时属于很多想象的共同体。

column1: Some – local, regional, national, cosmopolitan – seem to be arranged as concentric circles, with the strength of identity diminishing with distance from the core; but, in a global information age, this ordering has become confused.
column2: 其中一些 — — 地方的、地区的、国家的、世界的 — — 被认为是核心圈，身份的强度随其与核心的距离的增长而缩小；但是，在全球信息时代，这一秩序变得不那么清晰了。

column1: Today, many identities are overlapping circles – affinities sustained by the Internet and cheap travel.
column2: 徐进，众多身份属于互相重叠的圈子 — — 以互联网和廉价旅行维系的亲密关系。

column1: Diasporas are now a mouse click away.
column2: 天涯若比邻耳。

column1: Professional groups adhere to transnational standards.
column2: 专业团体往往基于跨国标准。

column1: Activist groups, ranging from environmentalists to terrorists, also connect across borders.
column2: 活动团体 — — 从环保分子到恐怖分子 — — 也进行着跨境联系。

column1: As a result, sovereignty is no longer as absolute and impenetrable as it once seemed.
column2: 因此，主权已不再像从前那样绝对和不可逾越。

column1: This is the reality that the UN General Assembly acknowledged when it recognized a responsibility to protect endangered people in sovereign states.
column2: 联合国大会在承认其保护主权国家危险之中的人民的责任时也承认了这一现实。

column1: But what moral obligation does this place on a particular leader like Obama?
column2: 但对于像奥巴马这样的特殊领袖，道德义务在此处有何作用？

column1: The leadership theorist Barbara Kellerman has accused former US President Bill Clinton of the moral failure of insularity for his inadequate response to the genocide in Rwanda in 1994.
column2: 领导力理论家芭芭拉·克莱曼（Barbara Kellerman）指责美国前总统克林顿在对1994年卢旺达种族屠杀事件应对不力中存在偏隘的道德失职。

column1: In one sense, she is right.
column2: 从某种程度上说，她是正确的。

column1: But other leaders were also insular, and no country responded adequately.
column2: 但其他领导人也偏隘了，没有一个国家采取了有力的应对措施。

column1: Had Clinton tried to send American troops, he would have encountered stiff resistance in the US Congress.
column2: 如果克林顿尝试派兵，他将在美国国会遇到重大阻力。

column1: Coming so soon after the death of US soldiers in the 1993 humanitarian intervention in Somalia, the American public was in no mood for another military mission abroad.
column2: 当时，年美国士兵刚刚在在索马里人道干预中伤亡惨重，美国公众没有想法再进行海外军事任务。

column1: So what should a democratically elected leader do in such circumstances?
column2: 那么，民选领导人在这样的环境下应该如何做？

column1: Clinton has acknowledged that he could have done more to galvanize the UN and other countries to save lives in Rwanda.
column2: 克林顿承认他本可以更大力度地敦促联合国和其他国家拯救卢旺达人的生命。

column1: But good leaders today are often caught between their personal cosmopolitan inclinations and their more traditional obligations to the citizens who elected them.
column2: 但今天的优秀领导人往往会在个人的世界主义倾向和对选举他们的人民的更加传统的义务之间难以抉择。

column1: Fortunately, insularity is not an “all or nothing” moral proposition.
column2: 幸运的是，偏隘并不是一种“非此即彼”的道德命题。

column1: In a world in which people are organized in national communities, a purely cosmopolitan ideal is unrealistic.
column2: 在一个人民根据国家社区组织的世界中，纯粹的世界主义理想是不现实的。

column1: Global income equalization, for example, is not a credible obligation for a national political leader; but such a leader could rally followers by saying that more should be done to reduce poverty and disease worldwide.
column2: 比如，全球收入平等对国家政治领袖来说就不是一个可信的义务，但同样是这位领袖，他可以声称应该做更多事减少全世界的贫困和疾病，以此招徕追随者。

column1: As the philosopher Kwame Anthony Appiah has put it, “Thou shalt not kill is a test you take pass-fail. Honor thy father and thy mother admits of gradations.”
column2: 哲学家科瓦姆·安东尼·阿皮亚（Kwame Anthony Appiah）指出 ： “ ‘汝不可杀人’是及格测试 ， ‘ 尊重你的父母’是承认等级 。 ”

column1: The same is true of cosmopolitanism versus insularity.
column2: 世界主义和偏隘之间也是如此。

column1: We may admire leaders who make efforts to increase their followers’ sense of moral duties beyond borders; but it does little good to hold leaders to an impossible standard that would undercut their capacity to remain leaders.
column2: 我们敬仰试图增加追随者超越国界的道德责任感的领袖；但以会影响到领袖地位的难以企及的标准要求领袖也是于事无补的。

column1: As Obama wrestles with determining his responsibilities in Syria and elsewhere, he faces a serious moral dilemma.
column2: 在竭力权衡其在叙利亚和其他地方的责任时，奥巴马面临着严重的道德困境。

column1: As Appiah says, duties beyond borders are a matter of degree; and there are also degrees of intervention that range from aid to refugees and arms to different degrees of the use of force.
column2: 正如阿皮亚所说，跨国责任是程度问题；干预也有程度，从援助难民、武器援助到不同程度的使用武力。

column1: But even when making these graduated choices, a leader also owes his followers a duty of prudence – of remembering the Hippocratic oath to first of all, do no harm.
column2: 但即使是在做出这些成熟的选择时，领袖也对其追随者负有审慎责任 — — 时刻铭记“首先不要伤害”的希波克拉底誓言。

column1: Ignatieff says Obama already owns the consequences of his inaction; Friedman reminds him of the virtue of prudence.
column2: 伊格纳提夫说，奥巴马已经领教了不作为的后果；而弗里德曼则提醒他审慎的美德。

column1: Pity Obama.
column2: 可怜的奥巴马。

column1: Safeguarding Cyberspace
column2: 捍卫网络空间

column1: CAMBRIDGE – Brazil recently hosted NETmundial, the first global conference on Internet governance, attended by 800 representatives of governments, corporations, civil-society organizations, and technologists.
column2: 坎布里齐 — — 巴西最近举办了互联网管理领域首届全球会议NETmundial，有800名政府、企业、民间社会组织和技术界代表与会。

column1: Based on the notion of “multi-stakeholderism,” the meeting produced a 12-page “outcomes” document.
column2: 在“多利益相关者”的理念基础上，此次会议拿出了一份12页的“成果”文件。

column1: Nonetheless, at the end of the conference, there was still no consensus on global cyber governance.
column2: 然而会议结束时，仍然没有就全球网络治理问题达成共识。

column1: Many governments continued to advocate traditional United Nations voting procedures for making global decisions, and defend their right to control domestic cyber activities.
column2: 许多政府主张继续沿用联合国表决的传统程序进行全局决策，捍卫政府控制国内网络活动的权利。

column1: In a sense, this is not surprising.
column2: 从某种意义上讲，这并不值得大惊小怪。

column1: After all, though the Internet is a complex, fast-evolving, and all-encompassing global resource, it has not been around for very long.
column2: 毕竟，虽然互联网是种复杂、发展迅速且包罗万象的全球资源，但它的历史还不是很长。

column1: While the World Wide Web was conceived in 1989, it was only in the last 15 years that the number of Web sites burgeoned, and Internet technology began to transform global supply chains.
column2: 虽然万维网的构想起源于1989年，网站数量突飞猛进、互联网科技开始改变全球供应链还仅仅是近15年的事。

column1: Since 1992, the number of Internet users has exploded from one million to nearly three billion. Just like that, the Internet became a substrate of economic, social, and political life.
column2: 从1992年起，网民数量从一百万激增到近30亿，互联网成为经济、社会和政治生活的基石。

column1: In its early days, the Internet was often characterized as the ultimate egalitarian conduit of free-flowing information – a harbinger of the end of government controls.
column2: 成立初期的互联网往往被定义为信息自由流动的终极平等主义管道 — — 亦即结束政府控制的先驱。

column1: But the reality is that governments and geographical jurisdictions have always played a central role in regulating the Internet – or at least have tried.
column2: 但现实状况却是政府和地域管辖机构一直在互联网监管中发挥着核心作用 — — 至少他们力求如此。

column1: Ultimately, however, the Internet poses a major governance challenge, exemplified in ongoing efforts to understand the implications of ubiquitous mobility and the collection and storage of “big data.”
column2: 但归根结底，互联网构成了重大的治理挑战，这既体现在努力理解流动性无所不在的影响，也体现在“大数据”的存储和搜集。

column1: The governance challenge stems from the fact that cyberspace is a combination of virtual properties, which defy geographical boundaries, and physical infrastructure, which fall under sovereign jurisdictions.
column2: 治理挑战源于网络空间是虚拟资产的组合，它既不存在地域界限，也不属于物理基础设施，因此不归属主权司法辖区管理。

column1: Control of the physical layer can have both territorial and extraterritorial effects on the virtual layers.
column2: 物理层的控制可以对虚拟层产生域内和域外效力。

column1: At the same time, attacks can be launched from the low-cost virtual realm against the physical domain, where resources are scarce and expensive.
column2: 同时可以从低成本的虚拟领域对资源稀缺而昂贵的实体领域发动攻击。

column1: The Internet began as a small village of known users, where an authentication layer of code was unnecessary and the development of norms was simple.
column2: 互联网用户开始时都相互认识，因此无需进行代码验证，制定规则也并非难事。

column1: But then it grew, and everything changed.
column2: 但随着互联网发展壮大一切不再像起初那样容易。

column1: Though cyberspace offered the advantages of access to information and easy communication to a growing number of people, it became a breeding ground for crime, hacker attacks, and threats to governments.
column2: 虽然网络空间让越来越多人掌握了信息获取及沟通便捷的优势，但它也逐渐成为滋生犯罪、黑客攻击的温床，并威胁到政府的利益。

column1: Efforts to limit the risks incurred in this volatile environment have focused on creating private networks and “walled gardens” (closed platforms) – cyber equivalents to the seventeenth-century enclosures that were used to solve that era’s “tragedy of the commons.”
column2: 人们一般通���创建私有网络和“围墙花园 ” （ 即封闭平台）来控制环境动荡所带来的风险 — — 这与17世纪解决“平民悲剧”的圈地运动何其相似。

column1: But this raises the risk of fragmentation, which, if allowed to go far enough, could curtail the Internet’s economic benefits.
column2: 但这样做增加了“隔离”的风险，如果任由这种趋势发展下去，可能会影响互联网的经济效益。

column1: Given that security is a traditional function of the state, some observers believe that growing insecurity will lead to a greater role for governments in cyberspace.
column2: 鉴于安全是政府的一项传统职能，一些观察家认为越来越多的不安全因素会导致各国政府在网络空间中更为活跃。

column1: Indeed, accounts of cyber war may be exaggerated, but cyber espionage is rampant, and more than 30 governments are reputed to have developed offensive capabilities and doctrines for the use of cyber weapons.
column2: 事实上，宣扬网络战争可能有些夸大其辞，但网络间谍活动的确非常猖獗，30多个国家政府被认为具备了网络武器应用的学说和攻击力。

column1: Ever since the Stuxnet virus was used to disrupt Iran’s nuclear program in 2009-2010, governments have taken the threat posed by cyber weapons very seriously.
column2: 自从2009-2010年震网病毒被用于破坏伊朗核计划后，各国政府开始认真对待网络武器所造成威胁。

column1: Governments also want to protect their societies from what comes through the Internet.
column2: 政府还希望保护本国社会不受互联网内容的损害。

column1: For example, China’s government has not only created a “Great Firewall” of software filters; it also requires that companies take responsibility for censoring their public content.
column2: 比方说中国政府不仅建成了用于软件过滤的“长城防火墙 ” ； 还要求企业承担起审查公共内容的职责。

column1: And, if China is attacked, it has the capacity to reduce its Internet connections.
column2: 而且在受到攻击的情况下，中国有能力减少其互联网连接。

column1: But China’s government – and others that practice Internet censorship – still want to reap the economic benefits of connectivity.
column2: 但中国政府和其他实施互联网审查的机构却不愿放弃联网带来的经济效益。

column1: That tension leads to imperfect compromises.
column2: 这样的紧张状况最终导致了不完美的妥协。

column1: A similar tension exists in the effort to create international Internet-governance norms.
column2: 在创建国际互联网治理规范领域也存在相似的紧张态势。

column1: While authoritarian countries like China and Russia seek “information security,” including the kind of overt censorship that would be prohibited in countries like the United States, Western democracies pursue “cyber security.”
column2: 中国和俄罗斯等专制国家寻求的所谓“信息安全”也包括美国和西方民主国家追求“网络安全”的公开审查制。

column1: This divergence was starkly apparent in 2012, at a conference convened in Dubai by the UN’s International Telecommunications Union (ITU).
column2: 联合国国际电信联盟（ITU）在迪拜召开的会议毫不掩饰地体现了这种分歧。

column1: Though the meeting was ostensibly about updating telephony regulations, the underlying issue was the ITU’s role in Internet governance.
column2: 虽然会议的表面议题是更新电话章程，但国际电信联盟在互联网治理中的作用才是根本性问题。

column1: Authoritarian regimes and many developing countries believe that their approach to sovereignty, security, and development would benefit from the multilateral processes that the ITU employs.
column2: 独裁政权和许多发展中国家认为其主权、安全和发展策略将受益于国际电信联盟采用的多边程序。

column1: But democratic governments fear that these processes are too cumbersome, and would undercut the flexibility of the “multi-stakeholder” approach, which stresses the involvement of the private and non-profit sectors, as well as governments.
column2: 但民主政府却担心上述程序过于繁琐，并且会影响到强调政府和私有及非营利部门参与并重的“多方利益攸关者”策略的灵活性。

column1: The vote in Dubai was 89 to 55 against the “democratic” governments.
column2: 迪拜投票的结果是“民主政府”以55对89票落败。

column1: This outcome raised concerns about a crisis in Internet governance – concerns that the recent conference in Brazil alleviated, but only slightly.
column2: 投票结果凸显了对互联网治理危机的担忧 — — 这种担忧在最近的巴西会议上有所缓解，但却远没有消失。

column1: Stayed tuned.
column2: 请您一定继续关注。

column1: There are many more conferences scheduled on cyber governance – and a lot more work to be done.
column2: 今后还将召开很多互联网治理方面的会议 — — 要做的工作还有很多。

column1: Obama the Pragmatist
column2: 务实者奥巴马

column1: CAMBRIDGE – Last month, in his address to the graduating cadets at the US Military Academy at West Point, President Barack Obama stated that some of America’s most costly mistakes since World War II were the result not of restraint, but of a “willingness to rush into military adventures without thinking through the consequences.”
column2: 美国剑桥—上个月，在为西点军校的毕业军官所做的演讲中，美国总统奥巴马提到美国在二战后所犯的一些代价高昂的错误不是因为克制，而是因为“总是在未经仔细考量后果前就匆忙采取军事行动 。 ”

column1: Though Obama may be right, the speech did little to mollify critics who have accused him of passivity and weakness, particularly regarding Syria and Ukraine.
column2: 奥巴马也许是对的，但这次演讲并不能使批评他消极而孱弱的人（尤其是在叙利亚和乌克兰问题上）有所收敛。

column1: This frustration can be blamed partly on the impossibly high expectations that Obama set in his early speeches, in which he inspired voters with promises of systemic transformation.
column2: 这一尴尬情形的部分原因在于奥巴马在其先前的演讲中建立了太高的期望 — — 他对选民承诺会带来系统性变革。

column1: Unlike most candidates, Obama maintained this transformational rhetoric even after it secured him his victory in the 2008 campaign.
column2: 与大部分候选人不同，奥巴马在确保了2008年大选再胜后并未改变“变革”的口号。

column1: Indeed, a series of addresses in the first year of his presidency raised expectations even higher, by establishing the goal of a nuclear-weapons-free world, promising to revamp America’s approach to the Middle East, and pledging to “bend history in the direction of justice.”
column2: 事实上，他在就任总统的第一年所做的一系列演讲提出了无核武器世界的目标，承诺改变美国的中东方针，还承诺“掰正历史的方向，朝正义前进 ” ， 这些内容进一步提高了人们对他的期望。

column1: It is often said that democratic politicians campaign in poetry and govern in prose.
column2: 人们常说，民主政客在竞选时是诗人，治国时只会写流水账。

column1: But there is no reason to believe that Obama was being disingenuous about his objectives.
column2: 但没有理由认为奥巴马因为他的目标而与众不同。

column1: His vision simply could not withstand the recalcitrant and difficult world that confronted him; so he had to adjust.
column2: 他的愿景根本不能对抗他所面临的顽抗者和艰难时世；因此他必须做出调整。

column1: After just one year in office, the man who had promised transformational leadership became a “transactional” leader – pragmatic to a fault.
column2: 在成为总统一年后，这位承诺要成为变革型领袖的人倒成了“事务型”领袖 — — 务实有余而变革不足。

column1: And, despite what his critics say, this was a positive development.
column2: 而不管批评者怎么说，这是一个积极的变化。

column1: While vowing to use force when America’s vital interests are at stake and rejecting pessimistic projections of national decline, Obama has – unlike his predecessor, George W. Bush – relied more heavily on diplomacy than force.
column2: 尽管奥巴马誓言会在事关美国关键利益时使用武力，并且拒绝接受美国衰落的消极预测，但他与前任小布什不同，他更多��依赖外交而不是武力。

column1: For this, his critics have accused him of failing to promote American values and retreating into isolationism.
column2: 在这方面，他的批评者指责他没有推广美国价值，并且在向孤立主义退缩。

column1: But restraint is not isolationism.
column2: 但克制不是孤立主义。

column1: No one accused President Dwight Eisenhower of isolationism when he accepted a stalemate in the Korean War, refused to intervene at Dien Bien Phu, resisted recommendations from senior military officers regarding islands near Taiwan, watched the Red Army invade Hungary, or refused to back allies in the Suez Canal crisis.
column2: 没人会因为艾森豪威尔接受了朝鲜战争的僵局、拒绝干预奠边府、对高级军官关于台湾周边岛屿的献策视而不见、坐视红军侵入匈牙利或在苏伊士危机中拒绝支持盟友而被指责为孤立主义。

column1: Nor did those who now disparage Obama’s measured response to Russian President Vladimir Putin’s recent annexation of Ukrainian territory call Bush an isolationist for his weak response to Putin’s invasion of Georgia in 2008.
column2: 今天诋毁奥巴马对俄罗斯普京最近吞并乌克兰林土的行为采取谨慎反应的人也不会因为布什在2008年对普京入侵格鲁吉亚反应不够强硬而称其为孤立主义者。

column1: In fact, Obama’s response to Russia’s aggression in Ukraine reflects his long-term vision.
column2: 事实上，奥巴马对俄罗斯入侵乌克兰行为的反应体现了他的长期愿景。

column1: Though Putin has gained possession of Crimea, he has lost access to some of the resources that he needs to achieve his goal of restoring Russia’s former glory as a great power – and has reinvigorated NATO in the process.
column2: 尽管普京拥有了克里米亚，但也不再能够获得实现其重塑俄罗斯昔日超级大国荣光所必须的某些资源，也让北约重新获得了动力。

column1: Effective foreign policymaking requires an understanding of not only international and transnational systems, but also the intricacies of domestic politics in multiple countries. It also demands recognition of just how little is known about “building nations,” particularly after revolutions – a process that should be viewed in terms of decades, not years.
column2: 有效的外交决策不但需要理解国际和跨国体系，也需要厘清各个国家的国内政治，还要求认识到关于“建国”我们是多么无知，特别是在革命之后（革命是一个应该用几十年而不是几年的视界去看待的过程 ） 。

column1: In 1789, few observers in Paris would have predicted that a Corsican would lead French forces to the banks of the Nile within ten years.
column2: 1789年，几乎所有巴黎观察者都没有料到一个科西嘉人会在十年内率领法军挺近尼罗河沿岸。

column1: And foreign intervention in the French Revolution only fanned nationalist flames.
column2: 对法国大革命的外国干预的唯一效果是煽动了民族主义之火。

column1: In such a complex and uncertain context, prudence is critical, and bold action based on a grandiose vision can be extremely dangerous.
column2: 在如此复杂和不确定的环境下，审慎至关重要，基于眼高于手的鲁莽行动是极度危险的。

column1: This is what advocates of a more muscular approach to today’s revolutions in the Middle East often forget.
column2: 要求对今天的中东革命采取更强硬方针的人常常忘记这一点。

column1: Of course, it makes sense for US leaders to nudge events at the margins in an effort to advance democratic values in the long term.
column2: 当然，美国领导人在外围推进事件发展，从而在长期推广民主价值是有意义的。

column1: But attempting to direct revolutions that they do not fully understand would be a mistake, with potentially serious negative consequences for all parties involved.
column2: 但试图左右尚不能完全理解的革命的方向是一个错误，可能会对相关各方都造成严重的消极后果。

column1: In fact, in the twentieth century, US presidents who pursued transformational foreign policies were neither more effective nor more ethical.
column2: 事实上，在二十世纪，追求变革型外交政策的美国总统收效并不大，也并不显得更道德。

column1: Woodrow Wilson’s bet on the Versailles Treaty of 1919 contributed to the disastrous isolationism of the 1930’s.
column2: 威尔逊对1919年凡尔赛条约的赌注导致了20世纪30年代损失惨重的孤立主义。

column1: And the bets that John F. Kennedy and Lyndon Johnson made in Vietnam had devastating consequences, some of which are still being felt today.
column2: 而肯尼迪和约翰逊对越南的赌注带来了灾难性后果，贻害至今。

column1: More recently, George W. Bush – who famously declared that he did not play “small ball” – attempted to transform the Middle East with his “freedom agenda.”
column2: 更近一些有小布什，他有一句名言，说自己不会玩“小手段 ” （ small ball ） ， 并试图根据他的“自由日程”改变中东。

column1: More than a decade later, the US is still struggling to withdraw from the conflicts that he initiated.
column2: 十多年后，美国却在挣扎着从他发起的冲突中抽身。

column1: Obama’s foreign-policy mistakes, by contrast, have had only modest repercussions.
column2: 相反，奥巴马的外交政策错误，只是略有影响。

column1: To use Obama’s own baseball metaphor, aiming for achievable singles and doubles is often a more effective strategy than swinging wildly in an effort to hit a home run, only to strike out.
column2: 用奥巴马本人的棒球比喻来说，追求可以实现的上一垒和二垒安打常常比在实现本垒打和被震出局之间大幅波动更有效。

column1: Of course, a game-winning home run is exciting.
column2: 当然，打出杀死比赛的本垒打是令人振奋的。

column1: But a foreign-policy “victory” is not quite as straightforward – and the stakes are far higher.
column2: 但外交政策“胜利”并不像棒球比赛那样简单 — — 代价要高昂得多。

column1: President George H. W. Bush understood this.
column2: 老布什就知道这一点。

column1: A transactional leader, he famously stated that he did not do “the vision thing.”
column2: 作为事务性领导人，他提出了著名的不做“愿景这件事”的原则。

column1: But, like Eisenhower, he steered the US through multiple crises, overseeing one of the more successful periods of US foreign policy in the last half-century.
column2: 但与艾森豪威尔一样，他领导美国度过了许多危机，他在任期间是美国在过去五十年中外交政策最成功的时期。

column1: Of course, some of the criticism of Obama’s speech was valid.
column2: 当然，对奥巴马的批评中不乏有理有据者。

column1: But much of it was just partisan politics.
column2: 但大部分只不过是党派政治。

column1: To be constructive, the debate about Obama’s foreign policy must account for twentieth-century US history.
column2: 关于奥巴马的外交政策的建设性争论必须放在二十世纪美国史的背景下考虑。

column1: In foreign policy, as in medicine, leaders must “first do no harm.”
column2: 外交政策就像一台机器，领导人必须“首先不要造成伤害 ” 。

column1: Obama understands that.
column2: 奥巴马明白这一点。

column1: One hopes that the relentless uninformed criticism that his pragmatic policies have elicited does not drive his successor to revert to a risky transformational approach.
column2: 我们希望其务实政策所导致的冷酷的一边倒的批评不会让其继任者回归危险的变革型方针。

column1: Governance in the Information Age
column2: 信息时代的治理

column1: ABU DHABI – As the year comes to an end, it is only natural to ask what might lie ahead.
column2: 阿布扎比—随着岁末的来临，一个很自然的问题是明年会怎样。

column1: But, instead of asking what may lie ahead in 2014, let us jump to mid-century.
column2: 但是，现在我们不问2014年会怎样，而是跳到世纪中叶。

column1: What will governance look like in 2050?
column2: 2050年的治理会怎样？

column1: That is what the World Economic Forum (WEF) asked at a recent meeting in Abu Dhabi that focused on the future of governance under three potential scenarios arising from the ongoing information revolution.
column2: 这就是最近的世界经济论坛（WEF）阿布扎比会议所提出的问题。 这次会议集中讨论了信息革命所带来的三种潜在情景中的未来治理。

column1: With that revolution already marginalizing some countries and communities – and creating new opportunities for others – the question could hardly be more timely.
column2: 这场革命已经让一些国家和社区边缘化了 — — 也为其他国家和社区创造了新机会 — — 因此提出这一问题可以说正逢其时。

column1: The first scenario that participants considered is a world ruled by so-called “megacities,” where governance is administered largely by major urban agglomerations.
column2: 第一种情景是，参与者考虑一个有所谓“特大城市”主宰的世界，治理主要由大型都市圈来管理。

column1: The second possibility is a world in which strong central governments use big data to fortify their control.
column2: 第二种可能是强大的中央政府使用大数据来加强控制。

column1: And, in the third scenario, central governments are fundamentally weak, with markets – and the enterprises that dominate them – providing almost all services.
column2: 而在第三种情景中，中央政府从根本上十分脆弱，市场 — — 以及主宰市场的企业 — — 提供几乎所有服务。

column1: Each of these scenarios is an extrapolation of a current trend.
column2: 这些情景都是当前趋势的外推。

column1: While all of them could be beneficial in some respects, they also have features that, if left unchecked, could lead to dystopian outcomes.
column2: 从不同角度看，这三种情景都有有利的一面，但如果不仔细检视，也都可能导致反乌托邦结果。

column1: Policymakers should already be implementing policies aimed at guiding trends like urbanization, the rise of big data, and the grouping of people into narrow communities, often based on their relationship to the market.
column2: 决策者应该已在实施旨在指导城镇化、大数据崛起和将人群编入（通常基于关系和市场的）小社区的政策。

column1: The goal should be to take advantage of these trends’ potential benefits, while ensuring that they do not undermine other critical aspects of governance.
column2: 目标应该是利用这些趋势的潜在好处，同时确保它们不会破坏治理的其他关键方面。

column1: For example, although megacities have the potential to create new opportunities for workers and businesses, they cannot solve universal problems like climate change or manage the production and protection of national and global public goods.
column2: 比如，尽管大都市有望为工人和企业创造新机会，但它们无法解决气候变化等全球性问题，也无法管理国家和全球层面公共品的生产和保护。

column1: Likewise, while the use of big data has substantial problem-solving potential, important questions remain about who owns, who controls, and who regulates the use of the data.
column2: 类似地，尽管大数据具有巨大的解决问题的潜力，但仍存在重要问题：谁拥有、控制和监管大数据的运用？

column1: The notion of a “datocracy” incites fear of an Orwellian “e-1984.”
column2: “数据民主”的概念带来了奥威尔式的“电子1984”恐慌。

column1: Indeed, the recent revelations about National Security Agency surveillance programs barely scratch the surface of the issue.
column2: 事实上，最新披露的国家安全局监控计划最多只能算冰山一角。

column1: After all, the use of big data is not confined to governments and corporations; anonymous criminal groups can easily abuse the information, too.
column2: 毕竟，大数据的运用不受政府和公司的约束；匿名犯罪团伙也可以轻易地滥用信息。

column1: Finally, while individual choice within markets is often the most efficient way to allocate resources, markets do not produce a sufficient supply of public goods.
column2: 最后，尽管市场中的个人选择通常是资源配置最高效的方式，但市场无法提供充足的公共品。

column1: Indeed, there are some goods that the private sector is simply unable to provide.
column2: 事实上，有一些商品私人部门根本无法提供。

column1: This system may seem acceptable to those within the “gated communities” that benefit from it, but what about all those left outside?
column2: 这套体系对于处于从中获利的“封闭社区”者来说可以接受，但“封闭社区”之外的人怎么办？

column1: The WEF’s Global Agenda Council on the Future of Government, of which I am a part, has considered ways in which information technology can improve governance and reduce feelings of alienation among the governed.
column2: WEF的未来政府全球日程委员会（Global Agenda Council on the Future of Government，我也参与其中）考虑了信息技术改善治理、减弱被治理者的疏离感的方法。

column1: The most effective initiatives, the council observed, often arise from partnerships between government and the private sector.
column2: 委员会观察到，最有效的方案通常来自政府和私人部门的合作。

column1: For example, in Kenya, a private company developed a mobile-payments system that allows users to transfer money using cell phones, effectively creating a banking system much more quickly than the government could have done.
column2: 比如，在肯尼亚，一家私人公司开发了一套移动支付系统，该系统允许用户使用手机转账，事实上创造了远比政府所能提供的更快捷的银行系统。

column1: Once the system was privately created, the government was able to use it to provide additional services.
column2: 一旦这一系统被私人部门创造出来，政府也可以使用它来提供更���的服务。

column1: As a result, a Kenyan farmer in a remote district can now obtain information about crop prices or transfer funds, without having to travel long distances and wait in lines.
column2: 于是，如今肯尼亚偏远地区的农民能够获得关于作物价格或转移支付资金的信息而不必长途跋涉和排长队。

column1: While such initiatives cannot solve the problem of inequality, they can help to relieve some of its most damaging effects.
column2: 尽管这类方案无法解决不平等性问题，但它们有助于减轻不平等性问题最严重的后果。

column1: At a time of rapid social change and relentless technological advancement, efforts to improve governance – at the local, national, or international level – will require careful thought and experimentation, in order to determine how to balance inclusive decision-making with the ever-evolving needs of markets.
column2: 现时代，社会变化日新月异，技术进步层出不穷，改善治理的努力 — — 不管在地方、国家还是国际层面 — — 需要谨慎的思考和实验，以确定如何平衡包容性决策和不断演化的市场需求。

column1: As the American diplomat Harlan Cleveland once asked, “How will we get everybody in on the act, and still get some action?”
column2: 美国外交家克利夫兰（Harlan Cleveland）曾提出一个问题 ： “ 我们如何让所有人都动起来，然后仍能产生行动 ？ ”

column1: Consider international institutions.
column2: 考虑国际机构。

column1: Today, the world is organized into some 200 countries; in all likelihood, it will be in 2050 as well.
column2: 如今，整个世界被分为200多个国家；无论如何，2050年也将是如此。

column1: But only 16 governmental entities account for two-thirds of the world’s income and two-thirds of its population.
column2: 但16个政府实体就占据了世界收入的三分之二和人口的三分之二。

column1: Many have advocated the use of “double majorities” – which require a majority of votes according to two separate criteria, population and economic output – to elicit action from a manageable number of states while enhancing weaker states’ influence in decision-making.
column2: 许多人助长应该采取“双重多数 ” — —根据人口和经济产出这两个独立的标准衡量的多数票 — — 从可管理数量的国家中产生行动，同时增强弱国对决策的影响力。

column1: But, though the G-20 has moved in this direction, the approach to setting a global agenda remains flawed.
column2: 但是，尽管G-20正在朝这一方向努力，其设置全球日程的方式仍是有缺陷的。

column1: Indeed, it seems to be most effective in times of crisis; in more normal times, as we have seen, the G-20 struggles to get things done.
column2: 事实上，这一方式在危机时期最有效；但在正常时期我们看到，G-20难以很难产生什么成果。

column1: Moreover, even if the double-majority system helps to empower some weaker states, it does not account for the role of the world’s smallest countries in global decision-making processes.
column2: 此外，即使双重多数制度有助于增强弱国权力，它也并未考虑世界最小国家在全球决策程序中的角色。

column1: Although these countries represent a small share of the global population, they comprise a significant majority of the total number of countries.
column2: 尽管这些国家只占据了世界人口的极小部分，但它们组成了国家数量的极大部分。

column1: One potential solution would be for states to represent each other, as occurs in the International Monetary Fund.
column2: 一个潜在解决方案时让国家代表彼此，就像在国际货币基金组织（IMF）中那样。

column1: But the IMF’s experience exposes significant challenges in implementation.
column2: 但IMF的经验暴露出实施方面的巨大挑战。

column1: World leaders have not yet figured out how to reconcile the moral conviction that all people are equal with the simple fact that all countries are not.
column2: 世界领袖还没有指出，如何让人人平等的道德结论与所有国家并不平等这一简单事实协调起来。

column1: In a global information age, governance systems capable of addressing fundamental issues like security, welfare, liberty, and identity will require coalitions that are small enough to function efficiently and a decision concerning what to do about those who are underrepresented.
column2: 在全球信息时代，能解决安全、福利、自由和身份等根本问题的治理制度需要足够小因此能有效运转的联盟以及关注可以为未得到代表的群体做些什么的决定。

column1: Obviously, all of this calls for a lot more investigation.
column2: 显然，所有这些都要求更多的研究。

column1: Exploring potential future scenarios, as the WEF has done, is an important step in the right direction.
column2: 如WEF那样探索潜在未来情景是这一方向的重要一步。

column1: Japan’s Self-Defense Defense
column2: 日本的自卫防御

column1: CAMBRIDGE – Since the end of World War II, Japan has been ruled by an American-written “peace constitution,” Article 9 of which prohibits war and limits Japanese forces to self-defense.
column2: 美国剑桥—二战结束以来，日本一直由美国起草的“和平宪法”治理，其中的第九条禁止日本参与战争，也限制了日本的自卫力量。

column1: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe is now seeking legislation to enable Japan to reinterpret the constitution to include “collective self-defense,” whereby the country would enhance its security cooperation with other countries, particularly its closest ally, the United States.
column2: 如今，首相安倍晋三正在寻求立法让日本重新解释宪法，纳入“集体自卫权 ” ， 使日本能够强化与其他国家，特别是其最紧密盟友美国的联系。

column1: Critics view this as a radical departure from seven decades of pacifism.
column2: 批评者认为这严重偏离了七十年来的和平主义。

column1: But Abe’s central objectives – improving Japan’s ability to respond to threats that do not amount to armed attack; enabling Japan to participate more effectively in international peacekeeping activities; and redefining measures for self-defense permitted under Article 9 – are actually relatively modest.
column2: 但安倍的核心目标 — — 提高日本响应未达到武装袭击程度的威胁的能力并重新定义宪法第九条所允许的自卫措施 — — 实际上相对比较温和。

column1: Fears that the move would lead to Japanese involvement in distant US wars are similarly overblown.
column2: 担心这一举动会导致日本卷入遥远的美国战争同样有过分渲染之嫌。

column1: Indeed, the rules have been carefully crafted to prohibit such adventures, while allowing Japan to work more closely with the US on direct threats to Japanese security.
column2: 事实上，精心修改后的规则禁止这样的动作，尽管它允许日本就直接的安全威胁与美国开展更紧密的合作。

column1: It is not difficult to see why Abe is pursuing broader rights to self-defense.
column2: 不难看出为何安倍要追求更广泛的集体自卫权利。

column1: Japan lies in a dangerous region, in which deep-rooted tensions threaten to erupt at any moment.
column2: 日本位于一个危险的地区，该地区有着根深蒂固的紧张局势，随时可能爆发冲突。

column1: Given that East Asia, unlike Europe after 1945, never experienced full reconciliation among rivals, or established strong regional institutions, it has been forced to depend on the US-Japan Security Treaty to underpin regional stability.
column2: 与1945年后的欧洲不同，东亚的诸对立国家从未有过完全的妥协，也没有建立地区机构，而一直依靠美日安保条约（US-Japan Security Treaty）维持地区稳定。

column1: When US President Barack Obama’s administration announced its “rebalancing” toward Asia in 2011, it reaffirmed the 1996 Clinton-Hashimoto Declaration, which cited the US-Japan security alliance as the foundation for stability – a prerequisite for continued economic progress – in Asia.
column2: 2011年，美国总统奥巴马政府宣布将“重返”亚洲时重申了1996年克林顿-桥本宣言（ Clinton-Hashimoto Declaration ） 。 该宣言将美日安全同盟称为亚洲稳定的基础和持续经济进步的先决条件。

column1: That declaration served the larger goal of establishing a stable, albeit uneven, triangular relationship among the US, Japan, and China.
column2: 这一宣言服务于一个更大的目标：在美国、日本和中国之间建立一个不完全平均但稳定三角关系。

column1: Subsequent US administrations have upheld this approach, and opinion polls show that it retains broad acceptance in Japan – not least owing to close cooperation on disaster relief following the Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami of 2011.
column2: 随后的几届美国政府都坚持这一方针，而民调显示这在日本人中间也有很高的接受度 — — 不仅是因为2011年东北地震和海啸后的紧密救灾合作。

column1: But Japan remains extremely vulnerable.
column2: 但日本仍然十分脆弱。

column1: The most immediate regional threat is North Korea, whose unpredictable dictatorship has invested its meager economic resources in nuclear and missile technology.
column2: 最紧迫的地区威胁来自朝鲜，其不可预测的独裁统治将十分有限的军事资源用于核技术和导弹技术。

column1: A longer-term concern is the rise of China – an economic and demographic powerhouse whose expanding military capacity has enabled it to take an increasingly assertive stance in territorial disputes, including with Japan in the East China Sea.
column2: 更长期的忧虑是中国崛起。 这个经济和人口超级大国正在扩张军力，使其得以在领土争端中采取日益强硬的立场，包括与日本在东海的岛屿争端。

column1: China’s territorial ambitions are also fueling tensions in the South China Sea, where sea-lanes that are vital to Japanese trade are located.
column2: 中国的领土野心也助长了南海的紧张局势，而南海航线对日本贸易来说至关重要。

column1: Complicating matters further is the fact that China’s political evolution has failed to keep pace with its economic progress.
column2: 让局面更加复杂的事中国的政治演化跟不上经济进步的步伐。

column1: If the Chinese Communist Party feels threatened by a public frustrated with insufficient political participation and enduring social repression, it could slip into competitive nationalism, upending the already-delicate regional status quo.
column2: 如果中共因为公众对政治参与不足和长期社会压迫的不满而感到威胁，就可能滑向竞争性民族主义，颠覆已然摇摇欲坠的地区现状。

column1: Of course, if China becomes aggressive, Asian countries like India and Australia – which are already disturbed by China’s assertiveness in the South China Sea – will join Japan in the effort to offset China’s power.
column2: 当然，咄咄逼人的中国将使印度和澳大利亚等亚洲国家 — — 它们已经因为中国在南海的独断专行而愤懑不已 — — 将加入日本，一起遏制中国的实力。

column1: But, as things stand, a strategy of containment would be a mistake.
column2: 但是，就目前情况而言，遏制战略将是一个错误。

column1: After all, the best way to engender enmity is to treat China as an enemy.
column2: 毕竟，最容易点燃敌意的做法正是将中国作为敌人对待。

column1: A more effective approach, spearheaded by the US and Japan, would focus on integration, with a hedge against uncertainty.
column2: 一个更有效的方针是由美国和日本牵头，注重一体化并规避不确定性。

column1: American and Japanese leaders must shape the regional environment in such a way that China has incentives to act responsibly, including by maintaining strong defense capabilities.
column2: 美国和日本领导人必须引导地区环境以使中国有动力负责任地行动，维持强大的防御实力是办法之一。

column1: Meanwhile, the US and Japan must rethink the structure of their alliance.
column2: 与此同时，美国和日本必须反思联盟结构。

column1: While the expected revisions to Japan’s defense framework are a positive development, many Japanese still resent the lack of symmetry in the alliance obligations.
column2: 尽管预期中的日本防务框架调整是积极的发展动态，但许多日本人仍不满于联盟义务的不对等性。

column1: Others chafe at the burden of US bases, particularly on the island of Okinawa.
column2: 也有人不满于美军基地（特别是冲绳基地）的负担。

column1: A longer-term goal should thus be for the US gradually to transfer its bases to Japanese control, leaving American forces to rotate among them.
column2: 因此，更长期的目标应该是美国逐渐将军事基地转交给日本人控制，而美军则在周围巡航。

column1: In fact, some bases – notably, Misawa Air Base north of Tokyo – already fly Japan’s flag, while hosting American units.
column2: 事实上其中一些军事基地 — — 特别是东京以北的三泽空军基地 — — 尽管仍驻扎着美军，但已经竖起了日本旗帜。

column1: But the process must be handled carefully.
column2: 但这一过程必须小心控制。

column1: As China invests in advanced ballistic missiles, the fixed bases on Okinawa become increasingly vulnerable.
column2: 随着中国投资于先进弹道导弹，冲绳固定军事基地正在变得越来越脆弱。

column1: To avoid the perception that the US decided to turn the bases over to Japan just when their military benefits were diminishing, and to ensure that the move represented America’s recommitment to the alliance, a joint commission would have to be established to manage the transfer.
column2: 为了避免让人觉得美国出于军事利益日益消失才把军事基地转交给日本，也为了保证这样做代表了美国对美日同盟关系的重新承诺，必须建立联合委员会管理转交事宜。

column1: For Japan, becoming an equal partner in its alliance with the US is essential to securing its regional and global standing.
column2: 对日本来说，成为与日本平等的合作伙伴对于确保其地区和全球地位至关重要。

column1: To this end, Abe’s modest step toward collective self-defense is a step in the right direction.
column2: 在这方面，安倍朝向集体自卫权的温和步骤代表着正确方向。

column1: JFK Reconsidered
column2: 再论肯尼迪

column1: CAMBRIDGE – November 22 will mark the 50th anniversary of the assassination of President John F. Kennedy.
column2: 美国剑桥—11月22日是约翰·肯尼迪总统遇刺50周年纪念日。

column1: For people alive at the time, it was one of those events that are so shocking that you remember where you were when you heard the news.
column2: 对于生活在当时的人来说，这是一桩令人惊心动魄的事件，你能够清楚地记得听到这个消息时在干什么。

column1: I was getting off a train in Nairobi when I saw the dramatic headline.
column2: 我是在内罗毕下火车时看到这则爆炸新闻的标题的。

column1: Kennedy was only 46 when he was killed in Dallas by Lee Harvey Oswald, a disgruntled former Marine who had defected to the Soviet Union.
column2: 肯尼迪在达拉斯被刺是年仅46岁。 行刺者是一名变节投靠苏联的心怀不满的前海军军人，名叫奥斯瓦尔德（Lee Harvey Oswald ） 。

column1: Though his life had been plagued by illness, Kennedy projected an image of youth and vigor that added to the drama and poignancy of his death.
column2: 尽管饱受疾病困扰，但肯尼迪一直以年轻强壮的形象示人，这让他的死平添了几分戏剧性和悲壮。

column1: Martyrdom led many Americans to elevate Kennedy to the ranks of great presidents like George Washington and Abraham Lincoln; but historians have been more restrained in their evaluations.
column2: 殉难使得许多美国人把肯尼迪拔高到与乔治·华盛顿和亚伯拉罕·林肯等伟大总统相同高度；但历史学家的评价更加克制。

column1: Critics point to his sometimes reckless sexual behavior; to his scant legislative record; and to his failure to match words with deeds.
column2: 批评家指出，肯尼迪有时管不住裤裆；他的立法记录并不怎么样；许下的承诺也没有做到。

column1: While Kennedy spoke about civil rights, tax cuts, and reducing poverty, it was his successor, Lyndon Johnson, who used Kennedy’s martyrdom and his own far more impressive political skills to pass historic legislation in these areas.
column2: 尽管肯尼迪大谈公民权利、减税和消除贫困，但利用肯尼迪的殉难以及自身更令人印象深刻的政治技巧在这些领域取得历史性立法突破的乃是肯尼迪的继任者林登·约翰逊。

column1: A 2009 poll of 65 American presidential scholars rated JFK as the sixth most important president, while a recent survey of British experts on American politics put Kennedy in 15th place.
column2: 2009年对65位美国总统学者的调查将肯尼迪列为最重要总统第六名；而对英国美国政治专家的最新调查把肯尼迪排在第14名。

column1: Those are impressive rankings for a president who was in office for less than three years, but what did Kennedy really accomplish and how might history have been different if he had survived?
column2: 对于一位执政不到三年的总统来说，这样的位次令人印象深刻，但肯尼迪究竟完成了哪些功绩，如果他活下来，历史会有何不同？

column1: In my book Presidential Leadership and the Creation of the American Era, I divide presidents into two categories: those who are transformational in their objectives, pursuing large visions related to major changes; and transactional leaders, who focus more on “operational” issues – ensuring that the metaphorical trains run on time (and stay on the tracks).
column2: 在我的著作《总统领导力和美国时代的创建 》 （ Presidential Leadership and the Creation of the American Era）中，我将历届总统分成两类：一类总统追求转型（transformational）性目标，具有与大变革相关的大视野；另一类是事务性（transactional）领袖，专注于“操作性”问题 — — 保证火车按时启动（和停下 ） 。

column1: Because he was an activist and a great communicator with an inspirational style, Kennedy appeared to be a transformational president.
column2: 肯尼迪是一个活跃家，拥有极具启发力的伟大共同技巧，因此应该是转型性总统。

column1: He campaigned in 1960 on a promise to “get the country moving again.”
column2: 在1960年的选战中，他承诺“让美国重新启动 ” 。

column1: Kennedy’s inaugural address appealed to sacrifice (“Ask not what your country can do for you – ask what you can do for your country”).
column2: 肯尼迪的就职演说着眼于牺牲 （ “ 不要问你的国家能为你做什么，问问你能为你的国家做什么 ” ） 。

column1: He established programs like the Peace Corps and the Alliance for Progress with Latin America, and he set the United States on a path to landing a man on the moon by the end of the 1960’s.
column2: 他成立了和平部队（Peace Props）和与拉丁美洲的进步联盟（Alliance for Progress）等计划；他开启了探月计划，并在20世纪60年代末实现登月。

column1: But, despite his activism and rhetoric, Kennedy was a cautious rather than an ideological personality.
column2: 但是，尽管他积极活跃又长于辞令，却很谨慎而不具有思想人格。

column1: As the presidential historian Fred Greenstein put it, “Kennedy had little in the way of an overarching perspective.”
column2: 正如总统历史学家格林斯坦（Fred Greenstein）所指出的 ， “ 肯尼迪极少高瞻远瞩 ” 。

column1: Rather than being critical of Kennedy for not living up to his rhetoric, we should be grateful that in critical situations, he was prudent and transactional rather than ideological and transformational.
column2: 我们不应该批评肯尼迪行不如言，而应该欣赏肯尼迪能在批评环境中保持审慎，表现出事务性风格，而没有成为空想家和转型性总统。

column1: The most important achievement of Kennedy’s brief presidency was to manage the 1962 Cuban missile crisis and defuse what was probably the riskiest episode since the dawn of the nuclear age.
column2: 肯尼迪短暂的总统生涯的最重要成就是解决了1962年古巴导弹危机，平息了有核时代以来最危险的风波。

column1: Kennedy certainly can be blamed for the bungled Bay of Pigs invasion of Cuba and the subsequent Operation Mongoose – the covert CIA effort against the Castro regime that convinced the Soviet Union that its ally was under threat.
column2: 当然，你可以因为愚蠢的猪湾事件及随后的猫鼬计划（中央情报局针对卡斯特罗政权采取的秘密行动，这使得��联认定其盟友陷入了危险境地）而指责他。

column1: But Kennedy learned from his failure at the Bay of Pigs and created a careful process for managing the crisis that followed the Soviet Union’s placement of nuclear-armed missiles in Cuba.
column2: 但肯尼迪吸取了猪湾事件的失败教训，在苏联在古巴部署核武器后，他采取了谨慎的危机处理过程。

column1: Many of Kennedy’s advisers, as well as US military leaders, urged an air strike and invasion, which we now know might have led Soviet field commanders to use their tactical nuclear weapons.
column2: 肯尼迪的许多顾问和美国军方领导人敦促他采取空袭和入侵，现在我们知道，这有可能导致苏联指挥官动用战术核武器。

column1: Instead, Kennedy played for time and kept his options open as he negotiated a stand-down with the Soviet leader, Nikita Khrushchev.
column2: 相反，肯尼迪玩起了时间游戏，在与苏联领导人赫鲁晓夫谈判休整期间，他一直保持观点的开诚布公。

column1: Judging by Vice President Lyndon Johnson’s hawkish comments at the time, the outcome might have been far worse if Kennedy had not been president.
column2: 从副总统林登·约翰逊当时的鹰派评论看，如果总统不是肯尼迪，结果可能会糟糕得多。

column1: Moreover, Kennedy learned from the Cuban missile crisis as well; on June 10, 1963, he gave a speech aimed at easing Cold War tensions.
column2: 此外，肯尼迪也从古巴导弹危机吸取了教训；1963年6月10日，他发表了一次旨在平息冷战紧张局势的演讲。

column1: “I speak of peace, therefore, as the necessary rational end of rational men,” he said.
column2: “因此，我要说和平是理性人的必要的理性结局 ， ” 他说。

column1: While a presidential vision of peace was not new, Kennedy followed it up by negotiating the first nuclear arms-control agreement, the Limited Test Ban Treaty.
column2: 作为总统，肯尼迪的和平观并不新鲜，但他在和平观的指导下谈判了第一个和武器控制协定 — — 《部分禁止核试验条约 》 （ Limited Test Ban Treaty ） 。

column1: The great unanswered question about Kennedy’s presidency and how his assassination affected American foreign policy is what he would have done about the war in Vietnam.
column2: 关于肯尼迪总统生涯以及关于他的被刺如何影响美国外交政策的一个尚未有答案的大问题是他会对越南战争做些什么。

column1: When Kennedy became President, the US had a few hundred advisers in South Vietnam; he increased that number to 16,000.
column2: 当肯尼迪成为美国总统时，美国在南越有几百名顾问；他把这个数字扩大到了16 000人。

column1: Johnson eventually raised the number of US troops to more than 500,000.
column2: 约翰逊最终把美军数量提高到50多万人。

column1: Many Kennedy supporters claim that he would never have made such a mistake.
column2: 许多肯尼迪支持者声称他永远不会犯这样的错误。

column1: But he had supported a coup to replace South Vietnamese President Ngo Dinh Diem and left Johnson a deteriorating situation and a group of advisers who counseled against withdrawal.
column2: 但他曾支持推翻南越总统吴庭艳的政变，并且他留给约翰逊的是一个烂摊子和反对撤军的顾问团。

column1: Some fervent Kennedy supporters – for example, the historian Arthur Schlesinger, Jr. and Kennedy’s speechwriter, Theodore Sorensen – have written that Kennedy planned to withdraw from Vietnam after he won re-election in 1964, and claim that Kennedy told Senator Mike Mansfield that that was his plan.
column2: 一些肯尼迪的铁杆支持者 — — 比如历史学家小施莱辛格（Arthur Schlesinger, Jr . ） 和肯尼迪的笔杆子索伦森（Theodore Sorensen ） — —写道，肯尼迪计划在1964年连任后从越南撤军，他们还说，肯尼迪告诉曼斯菲尔德（Mike Mansfield）参议员，这就是他的计划。

column1: But skeptics point out that Kennedy always spoke publicly about the need to prevail in Vietnam.
column2: 但质疑者指出肯尼迪在公共场合一直都说必须在越南取胜。

column1: The question remains open.
column2: 这个问题仍旧是一桩公案。

column1: In my view, Kennedy was a good but not a great president.
column2: 在我看来，肯尼迪是个优秀的总统，但不是卓越的总统。

column1: What made him good was not merely his ability to inspire others, but his prudence when it came to complex foreign-policy decisions.
column2: 让他优秀的不仅仅是他能够启发他人的能力；而是他在面对复杂外交政策决定时的审慎。

column1: We are fortunate that he was more often transactional than transformational in foreign policy.
column2: 他在外交政策上往往显示出更多的事务性而不是转型性风格，此乃幸事。

column1: We are unfortunate that we lost him after only a thousand days.
column2: 他在担任总统1000天就离我们而去，此乃不幸。

column1: The Return of Japan
column2: 日本的回归

column1: TOKYO – “Japan is back!” Prime Minister Shinzo Abe declared during a visit to Washington, DC, earlier this year.
column2: 东京 — — 安倍晋三首相在年初访问华盛顿时曾向外界宣布 “日本回来了 ！ ”

column1: But, while Japan may be on the right track after two decades of economic stagnation, there is still much to be done to secure the country’s long-term future.
column2: 不过虽然日本有可能在二十年的经济停滞后重新走上了正轨，但确保国家的长远未来还有许多工作要做。

column1: In July, Abe’s Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) won control of both houses of parliament – a resounding electoral victory that amounts to the strongest political mandate any Japanese leader has received in many years.
column2: 7月，安倍所在的自由民主党（LDP）得到了议会两院的控制权 — — 这次彻底的选举胜利带来了多年以来日本领导人最强的政治权力。

column1: As a result, Abe seems likely to remain in power longer than his ineffectual predecessors, most of whom did not last more than a year.
column2: 因此安倍的掌权时间似乎会超过他徒劳无功的前任，他们中的多数人在任时间只有短短1年多。

column1: Meanwhile, Japan’s economy seems to be recovering from a generation of malaise, with this year’s annualized growth rate exceeding 3%.
column2: 此外，日本经济似有从一代人的萎靡不振中复苏的迹象，今年的年增长率超过3 % 。

column1: Moreover, following the triple shock of the earthquake, tsunami, and nuclear catastrophe in 2011, Japan has managed (at considerable cost) to replace the 25% of its energy supply that the disabled reactors at the Fukushima Daiichi plant provided.
column2: 不仅如此，在经过2011年地震、海啸及核灾难的三重打击之后，日本（付出极大代价）成功取代了曾由福岛第一核电站报废反应堆提供的25%的能源供应。

column1: The announcement that Tokyo will host the 2020 Olympic Games has also boosted public confidence.
column2: 东京将举办2020年奥运会的宣告也提振了公众信心。

column1: Skeptics worry that the economic progress may not last, arguing that the high growth rate is simply a reflection of loose monetary policy and fiscal stimulus – a strategy that inflation will render unsustainable.
column2: 持怀疑态度的人担心现在的经济进步可能不会持久，认为较高的增速不过是宽松货币政策和财政刺激的反映 — — 通胀最终会让这项策略不可持续。

column1: Abe’s supporters reply that the third “arrow” of “Abenomics” – productivity-enhancing structural reforms – has only now been removed from its quiver.
column2: 安倍的支持者则回应说安倍经济学的第三只“箭 ” — — 提高生产率的结构性改革 — — 现在不过刚刚抽出箭袋而已。

column1: They point to Abe’s ability to overcome resistance from small rice farmers, part of the LDP’s electoral base, to Japan’s participation in negotiations on the Trans-Pacific Partnership, which would open Japan’s economy to increased global competition.
column2: 他们指出安倍成功地克服了小稻农的阻力加入到跨太平洋伙伴关系谈判，该谈判会让日本经济面对更为剧烈的国际竞争，而稻农传统上一直是支持自民党的势力。

column1: Nevertheless, Japan faces serious long-term challenges.
column2: 尽管如此，日本面临的长期挑战依然严峻。

column1: First, with its birth rate well below replacement level, Japan’s population is aging and shrinking.
column2: 首先，因为出生率远低于正常的更新水平，日本人口一直呈现老龄化及萎缩态势。

column1: Offsetting this trend will require increased immigration and greater female labor-force participation – neither of which will be easy to bring about.
column2: 平衡这一态势需要更多吸收移民，并让更多女性加入劳动力队伍 — — 实现这两项目标中的哪项都很不容易。

column1: Japan has not traditionally been a country of immigration, and the World Economic Forum’s Global Gender Gap Report, which ranks 136 countries, has Japan in 105th place.
column2: 日本从传统上就不是移民国家，而世界经济论坛的全球性别差距报告总共统计了136个国家，其中日本排在第105位。

column1: But, of course, this can change – and Japan does have a history of successfully reinventing itself.
column2: 但毫无疑问这些都可以改变 — — 而日本的确有过成功自我重塑的历史。

column1: Perhaps the most critical question about Japan’s future concerns its relationship with its neighbors – North Korea, South Korea, and China.
column2: 事关日本未来最关键的问题或许是与朝鲜、韩国和中国的邻国关系。

column1: While recent polls suggest that Japan retains substantial soft power globally, this is not the case in its immediate neighborhood.
column2: 虽然最近的民意调查显示日本在全球范围内仍具有可观的软实力，但与相邻国家的状况却并非如此。

column1: Unlike Europe, where Germany overcame World War II’s legacy through its integration into the European Union, Northeast Asia remains burdened by history.
column2: 与德国通过加入欧盟克服二战的遗存影响不同，东北亚仍然背负着沉重的历史。

column1: According to its neighbors, Japan’s apologies for is past aggression are inadequate.
column2: 邻国一致认为日本没有足够的诚意为过去的侵略道歉。

column1: It does not help that some Korean and Chinese leaders have used anti-Japanese rhetoric to win domestic support.
column2: 某些朝中领导人利用抗日情绪赢得国内支持也加剧了这种情况。

column1: In Japan, the relentless criticism has triggered a nationalist backlash, spurring politicians to respond in kind during last year’s election campaign.
column2: 不留情面的批评在日本国内引发了民族主义的反弹，推动政界在去年的竞选活动中做出某种反应。

column1: For example, Abe threatened to rescind the official apologies issued by former leaders or officials for abuses and atrocities committed by Japan’s army during WWII, and stated his intention to visit the controversial Yasukuni Shrine, which honors not only Japan’s war dead, but also many of its war criminals.
column2: 比方说，安倍就曾威胁要收回前领导人或官员就日本二战侵害及暴行的正式道歉，并表示打算参拜备受争议的靖国神社，那里不仅供奉着日本的阵亡将士，同时还供奉着很多战犯。

column1: While Abe has not acted on these campaign statements, some observers remain convinced that he will visit Yasukuni at some point, further straining Japan’s relations with South Korea and China.
column2: 尽管安倍尚未采取行动兑现这些竞选承诺，但某些观察家仍然相信他将在某一时刻参拜靖国神社，从而导致日本与韩国和中国的关系进一步紧张化。

column1: Territorial disputes have exacerbated these tensions significantly.
column2: 领土争端显著加剧了上述紧张局势。

column1: China challenges Japanese control over more than seven square kilometers of islets – called the Senkaku Islands in Japan, and the Diaoyu Islands in China – in the East China Sea.
column2: 中国挑战日本对一座7个多平方公里小岛的控制权 — — 这座小岛地处中国东海，日本称之为尖阁列岛，而中国则称之为钓鱼岛。

column1: While the rival claims date back to the late nineteenth century, the latest flare-up – which has included widespread anti-Japanese demonstrations in China – was triggered in September 2012, when Japan’s government purchased three of the tiny islets from their private Japanese owner.
column2: 虽然针锋相对的主权之争可以追溯到19世纪末，但最新的事态升级 — — 包括中国举行大规模的反日游行 — — 触发点却是在2012年9月，因为日本政府从私人岛主手中收购了这些小岛中的三座。

column1: Then-Prime Minister Yoshihiko Noda said that he decided to purchase the islands for the Japanese central government to prevent Tokyo Governor Shintaro Ishihara from purchasing them with municipal funds.
column2: 时任首相野田佳彦称他决定由日中央政府购买这些小岛是为防止东京都知事石原慎太郎利用市属资金将其买下。

column1: Noda feared that Ishihara, who was well known for nationalist grandstanding, would try to occupy the islands or find other ways to use them to provoke China.
column2: 野田害怕以民族主义著称的石原会占领这些岛屿，或找其他方式利用它们来刺激中国。

column1: But Chinese officials viewed the move as proof that Japan was trying to disrupt the status quo.
column2: 但中国官员认为此举恰恰证明日本企图破坏现状。

column1: Some even claimed that Japan was trying to reverse the territorial outcome of WWII.
column2: 有人甚至声称日本正试图改变二战后的领土分配格局。

column1: The May 1972 transfer back to Japan of Okinawa, which the United States had administered, included the Senkaku Islands.
column2: 1972年5月原来由美国代管的冲绳归还给日本，尖阁列岛也在其中。

column1: A few months later, when China and Japan were working to normalize relations, Japanese Prime Minister Kakuei Tanaka asked Chinese Premier Zhou Enlai about the islets; Zhou responded that the dispute should be left to later generations, in order to avoid any delay of normalization.
column2: 几个月后，当中日两国实现关系正常化时，日本首相田中角荣曾询问中国总理周恩来这些岛屿的归属问题；周回应为避免延误关系正常化，所有争议应留给后代解决。

column1: As a result, both countries maintained their sovereignty claims.
column2: 两国因此都保持了主权要求。

column1: So, though Japan has administrative control, Chinese ships and planes frequently enter Japanese waters to assert China’s claim.
column2: 因此虽然日本手握行政控制权，中国的舰艇和飞机会频频进入日本领海，以显示中国的领土要求。

column1: While Japan’s security treaty with the US serves as a deterrent, there is always a danger of miscalculation.
column2: 虽然日美安全条约一直在发挥威慑力量，但误判形势的风险却始终没有消除。

column1: A quick resolution of the Senkaku Islands dispute (or of Japan’s lower-profile conflict with South Korea over the Korean-controlled Liancourt Rocks) is improbable, but Japan could be more proactive.
column2: 快速解决尖阁群岛争端（抑或没那么显眼的日本和韩国就韩属独岛的争端）是不可能的，但日本却可以更加主动。

column1: For example, by stating their willingness to take any territorial disputes to the International Court of Justice, Japanese authorities could help to dispel perceptions of militarism.
column2: 比方说，借声明愿意把任何领土争端交由国际法院仲裁，日本政府或许可以消除军国主义的名声。

column1: Furthermore, Japan should take the sovereign act of designating the Senkaku Islands as an international maritime preserve free of habitation or military use.
column2: 此外，日本应行使主权将尖阁群岛划为不允许居住或军事用途的国际海上保护区。

column1: China might not agree, but such a move might at least return the issue to the back burner, while reinforcing Japan’s image as a peaceful power.
column2: 中国可能不赞同这种做法，但此举可能至少能让领土争端回到次要位置，并同时巩固日本和平大国的形象。

column1: Japan and Northeast Asia need bold initiatives that focus on the future.
column2: 日本和东北亚地区需要采取着眼未来的大胆举措。

column1: It is time to give history a rest.
column2: 是时候让历史成为历史了。

column1: The Myth of Isolationist America
column2: 孤立主义美国的神话

column1: CAMBRIDGE – Is the United States turning inward and becoming isolationist?
column2: 美国剑桥—美国正在内向化和孤立主义化吗？

column1: That question was posed to me by a number of financial and political leaders at the recent World Economic Forum at Davos, and was heard again a few days later at the annual Munich Security Conference.
column2: 在最近的达沃斯世界经济论坛上，很多金融和政治领袖想我提出了这样一个问题，在几天后举行的慕尼黑安全会议上也是如此。

column1: In a strong speech at Davos, Secretary of State John Kerry gave an unambiguous answer: “Far from disengaging, America is proud to be more engaged than ever.”
column2: 在达沃斯，国务卿克里发表了强力演说，毫不含糊地指出 ： “ 美国绝没有减少参与，反而因为比从前更多地参与而自豪 。 ”

column1: Yet the question lingered.
column2: 但这一问题仍没有得到解答。

column1: Unlike the mood at Davos a few years ago, when many participants mistook an economic recession for long-term American decline, the prevailing view this year was that the US economy has regained much of its underlying strength.
column2: 在几年前的达沃斯，许多参与者都把经济衰退误认为美国的长期衰落，与此不同的是，今年的普遍感觉是美国经济重新获得了大部分基础优势。

column1: Economic doomsayers focused instead on previously fashionable emerging markets like Brazil, Russia, India, and Turkey.
column2: 经济末日论者转而关注此前的大热门巴西、俄罗斯、印度和土耳其等新兴市场。

column1: The anxiety about US isolationism is driven by recent events.
column2: 对美国孤立主义的担忧的背后是最近发生的一系列事件。

column1: For starters, there is America’s refusal (thus far) to intervene militarily in Syria.
column2: 首先，美国（到目前为止）拒绝对叙利亚进行军事干预。

column1: Then there is the coming withdrawal of US troops from Afghanistan.
column2: 其次是美国即将从阿富汗撤军。

column1: And President Barack Obama’s cancellation of his trip to Asia last autumn, owing to domestic political gridlock in the US Congress and the resulting government shutdown, made a poor impression on the region’s leaders.
column2: 此外，奥巴马在去年春天因为美国国会政治僵局及其导致的政府关门而取消了亚洲之行，这给地区领导人造成了不良的印象。

column1: Indeed, with Kerry’s time and travel focused on the Middle East, many Asian leaders believe that Obama’s signature foreign policy – strategic “rebalancing” toward Asia – has run out of steam, even as tension between China and Japan, evident in their leaders’ statements at Davos, continues to mount.
column2: 事实上，克里的精力和行程都集中在中东，这让很多亚洲领导人认为奥巴马的招牌外交政策 — — 战略性地转向亚洲、实现“再平衡 ” — —已是明日黄花，尽管中国和日本之间的紧张态势仍在发酵，从双方领导人在达沃斯的言论便可见一斑。

column1: Particularly egregious from the point of view of “Davos” was the recent refusal by Congress to approve the reform and refunding of the International Monetary Fund, even though a plan that added no significant burden to the American taxpayer had been agreed years earlier by the G-20 under Obama’s leadership.
column2: 在“达沃斯”视角看来，最令人担心的莫过于最近国会拒绝国际货币基金组织（IMF）的改革和再融资，尽管这一计划并没有给美国纳税人造成重大的额外负担，并且在几年前就已经得到了奥巴马所领导的G-20的同意。

column1: When I asked a prominent Republican senator why Congress had balked at keeping an American commitment, he attributed it to “sheer orneriness,” reflecting the mood of right-wing Tea Party Republicans and some left-wing Democrats.
column2: 我问一位显赫的共和党参议员，为何国会不让美国作出承诺，他表示这 “纯属故意刁难 ” ， 反映的是右倾的茶党共和党和一些左倾民主党的思维。

column1: Further evidence of American isolationism can be found in a recent opinion poll taken by the Pew Research Center and the Council on Foreign Relations.
column2: 更多的美国孤立主义证据可以从皮尤研究中心（Pew Research Center）和外交关系委员会（Council of Foreign Relations）的最新民调中看出。

column1: According to the survey, fifty-two percent of Americans believe that the US “should mind its own business internationally and let other countries get along the best they can on their own.”
column2: 这项调查表明，52%的美国人认为美国“应该以国际视角考虑其自身的商业，让其他国家自己决定最好的应对方式 ” 。

column1: About the same number said that the US is “less important and powerful” than it was a decade ago.
column2: 同样比例的美国人认为美国比几十年前“更加不重要、更加不强大”了。

column1: The problem with these perceptions – both at home and abroad – is that the US remains the world’s most powerful country, and is likely to remain so for decades.
column2: 这些感觉（不论在国内还是在国外）的问题在于美国仍是世界最强��的国家，并且可能在未来几十年中都是如此。

column1: China’s size and rapid economic growth will almost certainly increase its relative strength vis-à-vis the US.
column2: 中国的规模和快速经济增长几乎必然会增加它相对于美国的优势。

column1: But even when China becomes the world’s largest economy in the coming years, it will still be decades behind the US in terms of per capita income.
column2: 但即使中国在未来几年中成为世界最大经济体，其人均收入要想超过美国还需要几十年之久。

column1: Moreover, even if China suffers no major domestic political setback, projections based on GDP growth alone are one-dimensional and ignore US military and soft-power advantages. They also ignore China’s geopolitical disadvantages within Asia.
column2: 此外，即使中国不在爆发国内政治倒退，基于GDP一个维度的预测也忽视了美国的军事和软实力优势，也忽视了中国在亚洲的地缘政治劣势。

column1: America’s culture of openness and innovation will ensure its role as a global hub in an age when networks supplement, if not fully replace, hierarchical power.
column2: 美国的开放和创新文化将确保其在网络大大影响（如果不是完全取代的话）层级制权力的时代的全球枢纽地位。

column1: The US is well positioned to benefit from such networks and alliances, if American leaders follow smart strategies.
column2: 美国的地位让它十分便于从这样的网络和盟友关系中获益，只要美国领导人战略明智。

column1: In structural terms, it matters greatly that the two entities in the world with economies and per capita income similar to the US – Europe and Japan – are both American allies.
column2: 在结构性问题上，经济和人均收入与美国相近的两个经济体 — — 欧洲和日本 — — 都是美国的盟友，这十分重要。

column1: In terms of balance-of-power resources, that boosts America’s net position, but only if US leaders maintain these alliances and ensure international cooperation.
column2: 从实力平衡资源角度看，这有利于美国的净地位，但有一个前提 — — 美国领导人维持好这些同盟关系并确保国际合作。

column1: Decline is a misleading metaphor for today’s America, and Obama fortunately has rejected the suggestion that he should pursue a strategy aimed at managing it.
column2: 衰落是对当代美国的错误解读，所幸奥巴马没有接受关于他应该追求遏制美国衰落的战略。

column1: As a leader in research and development, higher education, and entrepreneurial activity, the US, unlike ancient Rome, is not in absolute decline.
column2: 作为研发、高等教育和创业活动方面的领袖，美国和古罗马不同，并没有绝对衰落。

column1: We do not live in a “post-American world,” but we also no longer live in the “American era” of the late twentieth century.
column2: 我们没有生活在“后美国世界 ” ， 但也不再生活在二十世纪末的“美国时代 ” 。

column1: In the decades ahead, the US will be “first” but not “sole.”
column2: 在未来几十年，美国将是“首要”的，而不是“唯一”的。

column1: That is because the power resources of many others – both states and non-state actors – are growing, and because, on an increasing number of issues, obtaining America’s preferred outcomes will require exercising power with others as much as over others.
column2: 这是因为其他国家和非国家行动者的实力源泉正在增长，也是因为在越来越多的问题上，取得美国所中意的结果将日益需要与其他行动者共同运用实力而不是凌驾于其他行动者运用实力。

column1: The capacity of US leaders to maintain alliances and create networks will be an important dimension of America’s hard and soft power.
column2: 美国领导人维持同盟、建立网络的能力将是美国硬软实力的一个重要维度。

column1: The problem for US power in the twenty-first century is not just China, but the “rise of the rest.”
column2: 美国在二十一世纪所面临的实力问题不仅仅是中国，而是“其他国家的崛起 ” 。

column1: The solution is not isolation, but a strategy of selectivity similar to what President Dwight Eisenhower advocated in the 1950’s.
column2: 解决办法不是孤立，而是艾森豪威尔总统在20世纪50年代所提倡的选择战略。

column1: A smart power strategy starts with a clear assessment of limits.
column2: 一个明智的战略始于对限度的明确评估。

column1: The preeminent power does not have to patrol every boundary and project its strength everywhere.
column2: 超然的实力并不一定要在任何边界上都突出、在每个问题上都建立优势。

column1: That is why Eisenhower prudently resisted direct intervention on the French side in Vietnam in 1954.
column2: 正因如此，艾森豪威尔审慎地拒绝在1954年越南战争中站在法国一边出手干预。

column1: Eisenhower was right about something else, too: America’s military strength depends on preservation of its economic strength.
column2: 艾森豪威尔还有一个正确的地方：美国的军事优势取决于捍卫其经济优势。

column1: Nation-building at home is not the isolation that critics fear; on the contrary, it is central to a smart foreign policy.
column2: 在国内的国家建设并不是批评者所担忧的孤立主义；相反，这是明智外交政策的核心。

column1: A smart strategy would avoid involvement of ground forces in major wars on the Asian continent.
column2: 明智的战略将避免派遣地面部队参与亚洲大陆上的大战。

column1: Yet such prudence is not the same as isolationism.
column2: 但这一审慎并不等同于孤立主义。

column1: The US needs to combine its soft- and hard-power resources better.
column2: 美国需要更好地结合其软实力和硬实力。

column1: As Obama said in his 2014 State of the Union address, “in a world of complex threats, our security depends on all elements of our power – including strong and principled diplomacy.”
column2: 奥巴马在2014年国情咨文中指出 ： “ 在充满复杂威胁的世界中，我们的安全取决于我们的实力的所有要素 — — 包括强势的有原则的外交 。 ”

column1: Eisenhower could have said that, and no one would accuse him of being an isolationist.
column2: 艾森豪威尔也会这样说，并且每人会因此指责他是孤立主义者。

column1: A Western Strategy for a Declining Russia
column2: 针对衰落的俄罗斯的西方战略

column1: CAMBRIDGE – The Aspen Strategy Group, a non-partisan group of foreign-policy experts that former US National Security Adviser Brent Scowcroft and I co-chair, recently wrestled with the question of how to respond to Russia’s actions in Ukraine.
column2: 美国剑桥—由前美国国家安全顾问布伦特·斯考克罗夫特（Brent Scowcroft）和我担任联职主席的无党派外交政策专家组织阿斯彭战略集团（Aspen Strategy Group）最近为了如何应对俄罗斯在乌克兰的行为而产生了争议。

column1: And now NATO is wrestling with the same question.
column2: 现在，北约也为了这一问题起了争议。

column1: While the West must resist Russian President Vladimir Putin’s challenge to the post-1945 norm of not claiming territory by force, it must not completely isolate Russia, a country with which the West has overlapping interests concerning nuclear security, non-proliferation, anti-terrorism, the Arctic, and regional issues like Iran and Afghanistan.
column2: 西方必须阻止俄罗斯总统普京对不使用武力主张领土权利这一1945年后规范的挑战，但也不能完全孤立俄罗斯，西方与俄罗斯在核安全、核不扩散、反恐、北冰洋以及伊朗和阿富汗等地区问题方面有着利益重叠。

column1: Moreover, simple geography gives Putin the advantage in any escalation of the conflict in Ukraine.
column2: 此外，地理形势决定了不管乌克兰冲突发生怎样的升级，普京都将拥有优势。

column1: It is natural to feel angry at Putin’s deceptions, but anger is not a strategy.
column2: 对于普京的欺骗，感到愤怒是人之常情，但愤怒不是战略。

column1: The West needs to impose financial and energy sanctions to deter Russia in Ukraine; but it also must not lose sight of the need to work with Russia on other issues.
column2: 西方需要实施金融和能源制裁以使俄罗斯不敢在乌克兰轻举妄动；但西方也不能无视与俄罗斯在其他问题上合作的需要。

column1: Reconciling these objectives is not easy, and neither side would gain from a new Cold War.
column2: 调和这些目标并不容易，而新冷战也不会令任何一方受益。

column1: Thus, it is not surprising that when it came to specific policy recommendations, the Aspen group was divided between “squeezers” and “dealers.”
column2: 因此，毫不奇怪，但涉及到具体的政策建议时，阿斯彭集团就分裂为“施压派”和“交易派 ” 。

column1: This dilemma should be put in long-term perspective: What type of Russia do we hope to see a decade from now?
column2: 这一困境应该放在长期环境中考察：十年后我们希望看到怎样的俄罗斯？

column1: Despite Putin’s aggressive use of force and blustery propaganda, Russia is a country in decline.
column2: 尽管普京滥用武力、大肆宣传，但俄罗斯终究是一个衰落中的国家。

column1: Putin’s illiberal strategy of looking East while waging unconventional war on the West will turn Russia into China’s gas station while cutting off its economy from the Western capital, technology, and contacts that it needs.
column2: 普京的偏执政策 — — 向东看，同时对西方发动非常规战争 — — 将把俄罗斯引向中国加油站，同时切断俄罗斯经济与其所需要的西方资本、技术和合同。

column1: Some of Russia’s opponents might welcome the country’s decline on the grounds that the problem will eventually solve itself.
column2: 一些俄罗斯的反对者可能乐于见到俄罗斯的衰落，他们认为问题终会自己解决。

column1: But that would be shortsighted.
column2: 但这是一种短视的观点。

column1: A century ago, the decline of the Austro-Hungarian and Ottoman Empires proved highly disruptive to the international system.
column2: 一个世纪前，奥匈帝国和奥斯曼帝国的衰落给国际体系造成了巨大的破坏。

column1: A gradual decline, like that of ancient Rome or eighteenth-century Spain, is less disruptive than a rapid one, but ultimately the best scenario would feature a recovering and rebalanced Russia over the next decade.
column2: 缓慢的衰落 — — 如古罗马和十八世纪的西班牙 — — 要比迅速衰落的破坏性小得多，但最终，最佳情形是未来十年俄罗斯以重新平衡的复苏面貌出现。

column1: The evidence of Russia’s decline is pervasive.
column2: 俄罗斯衰落的证据数不胜数。

column1: The rise in oil prices at the beginning of the century gave the economy an artificial boost, leading Goldman Sachs to include it among the world’s major emerging markets (one of the “BRICs,” along with Brazil, India, and China).
column2: 世纪初的油价上涨给俄罗斯经济带来了人为繁荣，以至于高盛公司将它列为世界主要新兴市场（与巴西、印度和中国共同组成了“金砖四国 ” ） 。

column1: Today, however, that growth has vanished.
column2: 但是，如今，如此增长早已不复存在。

column1: Russia’s GDP is about one-seventh the size of America’s, and its per capita income (in purchasing-power-parity terms) of $18,000 is roughly one-third that of the US.
column2: 俄罗斯GDP规模大约为美国的七分之一，而18,000美元的人均收入（以购买力平价衡量）大约为美国的三分之一。

column1: Oil and gas account for two-thirds of Russian exports, half of state revenues, and 20% of GDP, whereas high-tech exports represent only 7% of its manufactured exports (compared to 28% for the US).
column2: 石油和天然气占据了俄罗斯出口的三分之二、国家收入的一半和GDP的20 % ， 而高科技只占其制造业出口的7 % （ 美国为28 % ） 。

column1: Resources are allocated inefficiently across the economy, with a corrupt institutional and legal structure that impedes private investment.
column2: 经济��资源配置毫无效率，腐败的制度和法律结构阻碍着私人投资。

column1: Despite the attractiveness of traditional Russian culture and Putin’s calls to boost Russian soft power, his bullying behavior has sown mistrust.
column2: 尽管拥有极具吸引力的传统文化，普京也在要求振兴俄罗斯软实力，但其恃强凌弱的行径已经导致了不信任。

column1: Few foreigners watch Russian films, and no Russian university was ranked in the global top 100 last year.
column2: 俄罗斯电影鲜有外国观众，俄罗斯大学也在去年全球百强榜单上不见踪影。

column1: The likelihood of ethnic fragmentation is lower than in Soviet days, but it still remains a problem in the Caucasus.
column2: 民族分裂的可能性比苏联时期要小，但仍是高加索地区的一个问题。

column1: Non-Russians comprised half of the Soviet population; they now make up 20% of the Russian Federation and occupy 30% of its territory.
column2: 非俄罗斯族大约占苏联人口的一半；现在则占俄罗斯联邦人口的20 % ， 控制着30%的领土。

column1: The public health system is in disarray.
column2: 公共卫生体系混乱不堪。

column1: The birth rate is declining, mortality rates have increased, and the average Russian male dies in his early sixties.
column2: 出生率在下降，死亡率在上升，俄罗斯男性一般活不过六十出头。

column1: Mid-range estimates by United Nations demographers suggest that Russia’s population may decline from 145 million today to 121 million by mid-century.
column2: 联合国人口学家的中间估计表明，到本世纪中叶，俄罗斯人口将从今天的1.45亿下降1.21亿。

column1: But, though Russia at this point appears to be an industrial banana republic, many futures are still possible.
column2: 但是，尽管现在的俄罗斯似乎只是个工业香蕉共和国（banana republic ） ， 但其未来仍有巨大的可能。

column1: It has talented human resources, and some sectors, like the defense industry, can produce sophisticated products.
column2: 它拥有有才华的人力资源，在国防等领域更是能够制造出先进的产品。

column1: Some analysts believe that with reform and modernization, Russia would be able to surmount its problems.
column2: 一些分析师认为，在改革和现代化的推动下，俄罗斯能够克服这些问题。

column1: Former President Dmitri Medvedev, who worried that Russia would fall into the so-called middle-income trap rather than graduate to advanced-country status, laid out plans to do just that.
column2: 前总统梅德韦杰夫曾担心俄罗斯将陷入所谓的中等收入陷阱，无法迈入发达国家行列，而他列出的行动计划正是如此。

column1: But little has been implemented, owing to rampant corruption.
column2: 但由于无孔不入的腐败，实施方面几无进展。

column1: Under Putin, Russia’s post-imperial transformation has failed, and Russia remains pre-occupied with its place in the world and torn between its historical European and Slavophile identities.
column2: 在普京治下，俄罗斯后帝国主义转型宣布失败，俄罗斯仍然全神贯注于其在世界中的位置，在它的欧洲传统和斯拉夫身份之间摇摆。

column1: Putin lacks a strategy for Russia’s long-term recovery and reacts opportunistically – albeit sometimes successfully in the short run – to domestic insecurity, perceived external threats, and the weakness of his neighbors.
column2: 普京缺乏从俄罗斯的长远复苏着眼的战略，只是机会主义地对国内不安全形势、其所感受到的外部威胁以及邻国的疲弱做出反应 — — 尽管有时能够取得短期成功。

column1: Russia has thus become a revisionist spoiler of the international status quo – one that seeks to be a catalyst for other revisionist powers.
column2: 因此，俄罗斯成了国际现状的修正主义搅局者 — — 寻求成为其他修正主义势力的催化剂。

column1: But an ideology of anti-liberalism and Russian nationalism is a poor source of the soft power that the country needs to increase its regional and global influence.
column2: 但反自由主义和俄罗斯民族主义意识形态绝非俄罗斯增强其地区和全球影响力所需要的软实力的好源泉。

column1: Thus, the prospects that a Russian-led Eurasian Union can compete with the European Union are limited.
column2: 因此，俄罗斯领导的欧亚联盟要想与欧盟竞争十分困难。

column1: Whatever the outcome of Putin’s revisionism, Russia’s nuclear weapons, oil and gas, skills in cyber technology, and proximity to Europe, will give him the resources to cause problems for the West and the international system.
column2: 不管普京修正主义的结果如何，俄罗斯的核武器、石油和天然气、网络科技技能以及与欧洲紧邻的地理位置意味着他有充分的资源给西方和国际体系制造问题。

column1: Designing and implementing a strategy that contains Putin’s behavior while maintaining long-term engagement with Russia is one of the most important challenges facing the international community today.
column2: 设计并实施在遏制普京行为同时又保持与俄罗斯的长期关系的战略是当今国际社会所面临的最重要挑战之一。

column1: The Hazards Behind the Headlines
column2: 新闻头条背后的伤害

column1: LONDON – Not too long ago, the only journalists working in conflict areas who might be afforded protection were those working for wealthy, predominantly Western news organizations.
column2: 发自伦敦 — — 就在不久前，在冲突地区工作又能受到保护的只有那些为财力雄厚（且主要是西方）新闻机构工作的记者。

column1: These journalists would attend expensive courses run by former special forces personnel, who trained them to navigate hostile environments. They would be furnished with flak jackets and helmets, and given first aid kits.
column2: 这些记者会参加由前特种部队人员执教的昂贵课程以便在敌对环境中活动，还会配备防弹衣，头盔和急救包。

column1: But journalists elsewhere have rarely benefited from this culture of safety.
column2: 但其他地方的记者很少能受益于这种安全文化。

column1: From Mexico and Brazil to Pakistan and Somalia, journalists are often murdered with impunity.
column2: 从墨西哥，巴西到巴基斯坦，索马里，经常有记者遭到谋杀并最终不了了之。

column1: And more often than not, when the messenger is silenced, so is the message.
column2: 而通常情况下，当传递某一新闻的信使被捂住了嘴时，这个新闻也会是同等下场。

column1: For the last 15 years, the International News Safety Institute has been collating a list of journalists who have died on the job. What we have found is shocking: for every ten reporters killed, nine died while on assignment in their home country.
column2: 在过去15年中，国际新闻安全研究所一直在整理因工遇难的记者名单，并因此得出了令人震惊的发现：每十名遇难记者中往往有九名是在本国执行采访任务时身亡。

column1: Countless others have had to abandon their homes, jobs, and countries; and those who do stay often live in constant fear for their safety.
column2: 还有许多记者被迫逃离自己的住所，工作岗位和国家；而那些留下来的人常常会对自身安全忧虑不已。

column1: In places where corrupt regimes or militant groups want to control the flow of information, journalists have long had to risk being kidnapped or killed.
column2: 在腐败政权或军人集团想要控制信息流动的地方，记者长期以来都冒着被绑架或杀害的危险。

column1: But in recent years, this threat has become so great that some countries are now effectively no-go zones for international-media organizations.
column2: 但近年来这一威胁变得如此之大，以致某些国家已经沦为了国际媒体组织的禁地。

column1: Western correspondents are aware of these risks when they travel abroad to cover active war zones.
column2: 西方记者在出国报道战区新闻时是会提前意识到各类风险的。

column1: But now they confront similar dangers at home.
column2: 但如今他们在本国也会面临类似的危险。

column1: Wherever journalists work – whether online or offline – they need to be mindful of more physical, psychological, and digital risks than ever before.
column2: 只要记者是在工作（无论在线上还是线下 ） ， 他们都得留意比以往任何时候更多的身体，心理和数字风险。

column1: Terrorist attacks have affected news organizations, particularly in Europe, in unexpected ways.
column2: 恐怖袭击事件以意想不到的方式影响了新闻机构，尤其是在欧洲。

column1: Many of those who arrived first at the scene of the Manchester Arena bombing or the massacre at the Bataclan concert hall in Paris had not received the physical training for such eventualities, nor were they emotionally prepared to cover stories where they would be exposed to that degree of trauma.
column2: 那些首先到达曼彻斯特体育馆爆炸或巴黎巴塔克兰音乐厅大屠杀现场的记者们既没有接受过应付这类事件的体能训练，也未能在情绪上准备好去报道一个会将他们暴露于一定程度精神创伤的新闻事件。

column1: In response to these events, some newsrooms have started preparing for what they will do if a domestic terrorist attack directly affects their operations.
column2: 为了应对这些事件，一些新闻编辑部已经开始准备如果国内恐怖袭击直接影响其运作时的应对预案。

column1: Organizations – including the BBC, the Dutch public service broadcaster NOS, and others across Europe – have plans in place for journalists responding to incidents in their home cities or those directly targeting their newsrooms.
column2: 包括英国广播公司，荷兰公共服务广播公和和欧洲其他媒体在内的组织机构都制订了记者报道家乡城市或直接针对媒体本部的事件时的行动计划。

column1: Beyond bullets and bombs, journalists also face increasing psychological threats at home.
column2: 除了子弹和炸弹之外，记者也面临着越来越多的本土心理威胁。

column1: In July, a report I co-authored for the International News Safety Institute put a name to one such threat, a phenomenon known as “moral injury.”
column2: 7月份，由笔者与其他研究人员为国际新闻安全研究所共同撰写的一份报告将这类威胁定名为“道德伤害 ” 。

column1: The report, published by the Reuters Institute for the Study of Journalism at the University of Oxford, examined the impact of covering the recent refugee crisis in Europe on members of the media.
column2: 这份由牛津大学路透新闻学研究所发表的报告审视了欧洲近期难民危机对媒体报道者的影响。

column1: Reporting on a traumatic story, we found, can have a profound impact on one’s mental health.
column2: 我们发现，报道心理创伤性故事可能会对报道者的精神健康产生深远的影响。

column1: Our research noted that feelings of guilt and helplessness can be overwhelming when events “transgress personal moral and ethical values or codes of conduct.”
column2: 我们的研究指出，当事件“超越个人道德和价值观或行为准则”时，会令报道者产生压倒性的内疚和无助感。

column1: To guard against the risks of moral injury, we highlighted the importance of education, explaining that, “journalists need to understand that this is the ‘new’ terrain, part of the mental landscape of the profession.”
column2: 为了防范道德伤害的风险，我们强调了教育的重要性，解释说“记者需要了解到这是个‘新’领域，也是记者这一行业精神图景的一部分 。 ”

column1: Our report also suggested that organizations should look to provide support to those who needed it, bearing in mind that individuals respond to and recover from trauma in different ways.
column2: 我们的报告还建议各媒体机构应该为那些需要的人提供支持，同时考虑到每个人都会对创伤有着不同的回应和复原方式。

column1: In the US, journalists face another kind of psychological threat: harassment from their own government.
column2: 在美国，记者面临另一种心理威胁：本国政府的骚扰。

column1: Although journalists are protected by the First Amendment of the US Constitution, US President Donald Trump has nevertheless used his social-media bully pulpit to routinely vilify the entire news media.
column2: 虽然新闻工作者受到美国宪法第一修正案的保护，但美国总统特朗普仍然时常用自己的社交媒体欺侮平台来诋毁整个新闻媒体。

column1: Trump’s disdain for free speech mirrors that of authoritarian governments, from Turkey to the Philippines, where journalists have been arrested, imprisoned, and harassed in record numbers.
column2: 特朗普对自由言论的蔑视跟土耳其，菲律宾等国的独裁政府如出一辙，而在那些国家记者被拘留，监禁和骚扰的不在少数。

column1: Journalists are also increasingly vulnerable online, where anonymity has created a culture of trolling and harassment.
column2: 记者在网络也越来越脆弱，匿名性滋生出了一种散布谣言和骚扰的文化。

column1: Female journalists have had to bear the brunt of digital attacks, which can rapidly escalate into threats of sexual violence.
column2: 首当其冲遭遇这些网络袭击的是女性记者，而这些攻击可以迅速升级为性暴力威胁。

column1: In response, many journalists have abandoned social media, and others have left the profession of journalism altogether.
column2: 许多记者因此对社交媒体敬而远之，而其他人则彻底离开了新闻行业。

column1: The world is a risky place for journalists, which is precisely why we must do everything that we can to protect them.
column2: 这个世界对于记者而言是一个危险的地方，而这也正是我们必须尽全力保护他们的原因。

column1: Never before has the role of journalism been so important.
column2: 新闻工作的重要性也从未如此重要。

column1: In today’s noisy, confusing, multi-channel news landscape, where “fake news” is sold as fact, we need accountable, analytical, responsible reporting more than ever.
column2: 在今天这个嘈杂，混乱且多渠道，将“假消息”作为事实贩售的新闻图景中，我们比以往任何时候都需要实话实说，分析严谨且负责任的报告。

column1: A free press delivers truth, holds power to account, and calls out threats to liberty and justice.
column2: 自由的新闻界能提供真相，让权力问责，并揭露出那些对自由和正义的威胁。

column1: But the press can never be free if its members are not kept safe.
column2: 但如果连新闻界的成员都无法保证自己的安全，新闻就永远无法实现自由。

column1: Judgment Day for the Eurozone
column2: 欧元区审判日
