column1: MUNICH – Europe and the world are eagerly awaiting the decision of Germany’s Constitutional Court on September 12 regarding the European Stability Mechanism (ESM), the proposed permanent successor to the eurozone’s current emergency lender, the European Financial Stability Mechanism.
column2: 慕尼黑—欧洲和世界正在焦急地等待德国宪法法院9月12日对欧洲稳定性机制（ESM）的判决。 ESM是作为欧元区现行紧急贷款人欧洲金融稳定机制（EFSM）的永久性替代方案推出的。

column1: The Court must rule on German plaintiffs’ claim that legislation to establish the ESM would violate Germany’s Grundgesetz (Basic Law).
column2: 德国宪法法院必须就德国原告提出的成立ESM的立法决定违反了德国基本法的意见作出裁决。

column1: If the Court rules in the plaintiffs’ favor, it will ask Germany’s president not to sign the ESM treaty, which has already been ratified by Germany’s Bundestag (parliament).
column2: 如果裁决有利于原告，那么宪法法院将要求德国总统拒绝在已被德国议会批准的ESM条约上签字。

column1: There are serious concerns on all sides about the pending decision.
column2: 各方均对即将到来的裁决严重关注。

column1: Investors are worried that the Court could oppose the ESM such that they would have to bear the losses from their bad investments.
column2: 投资者担心德国宪法法院将反对ESM，因此他们将不得不承受坏投资带来的损失。

column1: Taxpayers and pensioners in European countries that still have solid economies are worried that the Court could pave the way for socialization of eurozone debt, saddling them with the burden of these same investors’ losses.
column2: 经济仍然坚挺的欧洲国家的纳税人和退休者担心宪法法院的裁决会扫清欧元区债务社会化的障碍，投资者的损失将因此由他们来承担。

column1: The plaintiffs represent the entire political spectrum, including the Left Party, the Christian Social Union MP Peter Gauweiler, and the justice minister in former Chancellor Gerhard Schröder’s Social Democratic government, Herta Däubler-Gmelin, who has collected tens of thousands of signatures supporting her case.
column2: 原告代表了整个德国政坛，包括左翼党、基督教社会联盟议员高威勒（Peter Gauweiler）和前总理施罗德的社会民主党政府司法部长道勒-格梅林（Herta Däubler-Gmelin ） ， 后者更是收集了数万人的支持签名。

column1: There is also a group of retired professors of economics and law, and another of “ordinary” citizens, whose individual complaints have been selected as examples by the Court.
column2: 还有一群退休经济学和法学教授，以及另外一批“普通”公民，后者的抱怨被德国宪法法院采纳为参考例子。

column1: The plaintiffs have raised several objections to the ESM.
column2: 原告提出了诸多反对ESM的原因。

column1: First, they claim that it breaches the Maastricht Treaty’s “no bail-out” clause (Article 125).
column2: 首先，他们诉称这违反了马斯特里赫特条约“不救援”条款（第125条 ） 。

column1: Germany agreed to relinquish the Deutsche Mark on the condition that the new currency area would not lead to direct or indirect socialization of its members’ debt, thus precluding any financial assistance from EU funds for states facing bankruptcy.
column2: 德国同意放弃德国马克是有条件的，那就是新货币区不能导致其成员国债务的直接或间接社会化，从而排除了任何动用欧盟资金对面临破产的国家进行金融援助的可能性。

column1: Indeed, the new currency was conceived as a unit of account for economic exchange that would not have any wealth implications at all.
column2: 事实上，新货币被认为仅仅是经济交换账户的单位，不具有任何财富效应。

column1: The plaintiffs argue that, in the case of Greece, breaching Article 125 required proof that its insolvency would pose a greater danger than anticipated when the Maastricht Treaty was drafted.
column2: 原告指出，在希腊的案例中，对马约第125条的违反需要有希腊破产将产生比马约起草时所预料到的情况更大的危险的证明。

column1: However, no such proof was provided.
column2: 但是，希腊案例并没有提供这类证明。

column1: Second, Germany’s law on the introduction of the ESM obliges Germany’s representative on the ESM Council to vote only after having asked the Bundestag for a decision.
column2: 其次，德国关于引入ESM的法律规定，德国代表在ESM委员会上的投票只有在要求德国央行作出决定后才能进行。

column1: According to the plaintiffs, this is not permissible under international law.
column2: 根据原告的说法，这是国际法所不允许的。

column1: If Germany had wished to constrain its governor’s authority in this way, it should have informed the other signatory states prior to doing so.
column2: 如果德国意��以此限制其官员的权力，那么它应该在如此行动之前通知其他签署国。

column1: On the other hand, Germany’s representative on the Governing Council is sworn to secrecy, which, the plaintiffs argue, precludes any accountability to the Bundestag.
column2: 另一方面，德国在ESM理事会的代表作过保密宣誓，原告指出，这使得德国央行的行为变得无法问责。

column1: Moreover, the plaintiffs claim that, while the ESM treaty is restrictive in granting resources to individual states, requiring a qualified majority vote, it does not specify the conditions under which losses are acceptable.
column2: 此外，原告还诉称，尽管ESM条约对于向个体国家提供资源做了限定，要求通过多数票授权，但并没有具体规定可接受损失的条件。

column1: Losses can result from excessive wages paid by the ESM Governing Council members to themselves, a dearth of energy in efforts to collect debts from countries that have received credit, or other forms of mismanagement.
column2: 损失可能产生于ESM向其理事会成员支付的工资过高、缺乏获得信用的国家讨债的动力，以及其他形式的管理不当。

column1: And, because Governing Council and Executive Board members enjoy immunity from criminal prosecution, misbehavior cannot be punished.
column2: 此外，由于ESM理事会和执行董事会成员享用刑事诉讼豁免权，他们的不当行为无法追究。

column1: If losses arise, they must be covered by the initial cash contribution of €80 billion ($100 billion), which then would be topped up automatically by all participating countries according to their capital shares.
column2: 如果产生了损失，那么必须用800亿欧元的初始筹集现金来弥补，而因此用掉的钱将自动由参与过根据各自的资本权重予以补足。

column1: If individual countries are no longer able to make the necessary contributions, others must do so on their behalf.
column2: 如果有的国家无力履行必要的资金提供义务，其他国家必须替它们完成。

column1: In principle, a single country might have to assume the entire burden of losses.
column2: 从理论上说，可能出现一个国家承担整个损失负担的情况。

column1: Such joint and several liability, the plaintiffs assert, contradicts the Court’s previous statements that Germany should not accept any financial commitments stemming from other states’ behavior.
column2: 原告指出，如此连带责任违反了德国宪法法院先前关于德国不应接受因他国而起的金融承诺的裁决。

column1: Worse, according to the plaintiffs, although the liability of any country vis-à-vis external partners is limited to that country’s share of capital, this limitation does not apply to other signatory states.
column2: 更糟糕的是，根据原告所诉，尽管任何国家对外部伙伴的债务被限制在该国资本权重之内，但这一限制并不适用于其他签署国。

column1: It is theoretically possible that a single country could be held liable for the ESM’s total exposure of €700 billion.
column2: 从理论上说，有可能出现一个国家不得不承担ESM所有风险暴露（7000亿欧元）的情况。

column1: Finally, the ESM cannot be considered on its own, but must be seen in the context of the total exposure amount, which includes the €1.4 trillion in bailout funds that have already been granted.
column2: 最后，ESM问题不能只从ESM本身着眼，而是必须考虑到总风险暴露规模，其中包括已经用出去的1.4万亿欧元援助资金。

column1: In particular, the Target2 credit drawn by the crisis-afflicted countries’ central banks, which already totals almost €1 trillion, should also be taken into consideration.
column2: 特别是，拨给危机影响国央行的Target2信用（总数已达近1万亿欧元）必须考虑在内。

column1: Nobody knows how the Constitutional Court will rule on these objections.
column2: 没人知道德国宪法法院将如何裁决这些反对。

column1: Most observers believe that the Court is unlikely to oppose the ESM treaty, though many expect the judges to demand certain amendments, or to ask Germany’s president to make his signature subject to certain qualifications.
column2: 大部分观察者认为德国宪法法院不可能反对ESM条约，但许多人预期最后判决将要求ESM条约进行一定的修改，或者要求德国总统必须在满足一定条件才能签字。

column1: It is good that the Court’s decisions cannot be forecast, and even better that the Court cannot be lobbied or petitioned.
column2: 裁决结果无法预测，这是件好事，特别是考虑到德国宪法法院不为游说和请愿所动。

column1: The European Union can be based only on the rule of law.
column2: 欧盟的唯一基石只能是法治精神。

column1: If those in power can break its rules on a case-by-case basis, the EU will never develop into the stable construct that is a prerequisite for peace and prosperity.
column2: 如果当权者可以在每一庄案例中破坏欧盟规则，那么欧盟将永远不可能发展成和平和繁荣所必须的稳定大厦。

column1: The OPEC Oil Embargo at 40
column2: 欧佩克石油禁运40年

column1: DENVER – Forty years ago, the United States and much of Europe learned difficult lessons about their dangerous addiction to fossil fuels.
column2: 丹佛 — — 四十年前，美国和欧洲绝大部分国家因为对化石燃料的危险依赖而得到了教训。

column1: Following Israel’s victory in the Yom Kippur War, the Arab members of the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) announced an oil embargo on Israel’s supporters.
column2: 继以色列赎罪日战争获得胜利后，石油输出国（欧佩克）组织阿拉伯成员国宣布对支持以色列的国家实行石油禁运。

column1: Developed countries, faced with the sudden cutoff of a key energy source and a major spike in world oil prices, felt powerless.
column2: 面对主要能源供应的突然中止及世界油价的大幅上涨，发达国家感到前所未有的力不从心。

column1: But, as it turned out, developed countries did have options for reducing their dependence on Arab oil.
column2: 但事实表明发达国家有能力降低对阿拉伯石油的依赖。

column1: They just had not recognized – or had not cared to recognize – the need for action until OPEC had them over a barrel.
column2: 他们只不过还没意识到 — — 也可能是不愿承认 — — 遭到欧佩克的石油绑架前有这个必要。

column1: While consumers waited in long lines – and even fought – to fill their gas tanks, governments attempted to encourage innovative solutions by, for example, raising efficiency requirements for automobiles and certain appliances, like refrigerators.
column2: 当消费者排长队等候 — — 甚至为了加满油箱而发生斗殴时，政府却在鼓励创新方案，比方说提高汽车和冰箱等某些电器的能效要求。

column1: In 1977, the US created the Department of Energy (DOE); a year later, it enacted the National Energy Act, which employed tools like industrial regulation and tax incentives to promote fuel efficiency and renewable energy.
column2: 美国能源部于1977年创立；一年后颁布了《国家能源法 》 ， 采用行业法规及税收优惠政策等工具来推动可再生能源发展、提高燃油效率。

column1: These efforts led to major improvements in energy efficiency.
column2: 上述努力极大地改善了能效。

column1: From 1973 to 1985, US energy consumption per dollar of GDP declined by 28% – five times faster than during the previous quarter-century, according to the DOE.
column2: 从1973年到1985年，美国单位美元GDP能耗下降28 % — —按照能源部的说法，比之前的25年速度快5倍。

column1: But the corresponding decline in demand caused the price of oil to plummet in 1986, ushering in a new era of cheap energy.
column2: 但由此带来的需求下降导致1986年石油价格暴跌，开启了廉价能源的新时代。

column1: This facilitated a two-decade-long economic boom, while reducing pressure on governments to sustain the momentum of progress toward greater energy efficiency.
column2: 由此促成了长达二十年之久的经济繁荣，同时大大缓解了政府继续保持能效进步的压力。

column1: But oil prices do not reflect the true costs of fossil-fuel consumption.
column2: 但石油价格并不反映化石燃料消费的真实成本。

column1: Beyond the economic and human costs of wars fought to maintain reliable oil supplies are the tremendous costs – which are set to rise substantially in the coming years – associated with human-induced climate change.
column2: 除为确保可靠石油供应而发动战争的经济和人力成本外还有与人类活动引起气候变化相关的重大成本 — — 今后若干年内此类成本一定会大幅提高。

column1: The recently released Fifth Assessment Report of the United Nations Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) provides further evidence that human-induced climate change is happening.
column2: 最近发布的联合国政府间气候变化专业委员会（IPCC）第五次评估报告进一步表明由人类活动引起的气候变化正在发生。

column1: Continued greenhouse-gas emissions on the massive scale of today would have devastating consequences, including more frequent and more intense weather events.
column2: 今天的持续大规模温室气体排放可能造成包括更频繁、更剧烈天气事件在内的灾难性后果。

column1: Reversing this trend demands urgent action.
column2: 扭转这种颓势需要采取紧急行动。

column1: As was true in the 1970’s, innovation is the key to effective solutions.
column2: 与20世纪70年代时一样，有效方案的关键依然是创新。

column1: But, unlike 40 years ago, governments cannot be expected to drive progress.
column2: 但不同于40年前的是这次不能再指望政府推动技术进步。

column1: In recent years, governments have clearly demonstrated their lack of willingness to pursue the kind of bold policies and regulatory action that are needed to curb climate change.
column2: 近年来，政府已经清楚地表明他们不愿执行遏制气候变化所需的大胆政策及监管行动。

column1: Indeed, since world leaders failed to achieve a climate-change agreement at the COP15 conference in Copenhagen in 2009, the issue has remained on the back burner, with policymakers focusing instead on containing the fallout of the global economic crisis.
column2: 其实从各国领导人未能在2009年的哥本哈根COP15会议上达成气候变化协议后，这个问题就一拖再拖，因为决策者都在全力关注遏制全球经济危机的后果。

column1: The recent budget gridlock in the US will only reinforce this approach.
column2: 美国最近的预算僵局只能让这样的局面进一步巩固。

column1: While many would welcome top-down solutions like those that emerged in the 1970’s, such outcomes are unlikely in the foreseeable future.
column2: 虽然不少人都欢迎20世纪70年代那样自上而下的方案，但在可以预见的未来不太可能实现这样的结果。

column1: Fortunately, there is another way.
column2: 幸运的是还有其他办法。

column1: Business-led innovation and market-based solutions can drive a decisive global shift from crippling fossil-fuel dependency to more efficient renewable-energy systems.
column2: 企业主导创新和市场化解决方案可以驱动从化石燃料依赖到更高效可再生能源系统决定性的全球转化。

column1: Rocky Mountain Institute’s Reinventing Fire analysis shows that such a future is possible, offering market-driven strategies for powering a US economy that is 158% larger in 2050 – without reliance on oil, coal, or nuclear energy.
column2: 落基山研究所的《革新之火》分析报告表明在不依赖石油、煤炭或核能的情况下，为2050年增长达158%的美国经济提供市场化能源战略是完全可能的。

column1: Swift and determined action to make buildings more energy-efficient, design automobiles that require little or no fossil fuels, and increase the share of renewable energy in the electricity supply could ensure that the substantially hotter and less pleasant world of 2050 that the IPCC warns against does not materialize.
column2: 迅速果断地采取建筑节能、设计少用或不用化石燃料汽车、提高可再生能源供电比重等行动可以确保IPCC警告过的2050年令人不快的炎热世界不会真的发生。

column1: Our livelihoods, not to mention those of future generations, should not be held hostage by our ongoing addiction to fossil fuels.
column2: 我们对于化石燃料的持续依赖不应威胁到自己和子孙后代的生存。

column1: Four decades ago, countries not only endured the immediate economic impact of the OPEC embargo; they leveraged the potential of the resulting oil shortages to spur innovation.
column2: 四十年前，各国不光承担了欧佩克禁运对经济的直接影响；他们还利用由此产生的石油短缺来刺激创新潜能。

column1: Today, the world needs the same kind of bold action – but this time, it is up to the market to provide it.
column2: 今天，世界同样需要这样的大胆行动 — — 但这次需要由市场来驱动。

column1: The Dred Scott of Climate Change?
column2: 气候变化的德雷德·斯科特案？

column1: WASHINGTON, DC – In 2015, 21 young people between the ages of 11 and 22 filed a major lawsuit against the US government for failing to limit the effects of climate change.
column2: 华盛顿—2015年，21位11—21岁间的年轻人对美国经济发起了诉讼，指责他们没能遏制气候变化的影响。

column1: In Juliana v. United States, the plaintiffs argue that because they will have to live with the repercussions of global warming for much longer than anyone else, on average, the government’s failure to protect the environment violates their constitutional rights to equal protection under the law and due process.
column2: 在朱莉安娜诉美国案（Juliana v. United States）中，控方认为，因为他们不得不比其他所有人承受全球变暖的影响更长时间，所以政府在保护环境方面的不力侵犯了他们收到法律和正当程序的平等保护的宪法权利。

column1: The philosopher Peter Singer points out that this case represents a historical turning point, because it addresses the rights of children and future Americans to a livable environment.
column2: 哲学家彼得·辛格（Peter Singer）指出，本案代表了一个历史转折点，因为它直指儿童和威力爱美国人获得适合生活的环境的权利。

column1: But the trial is about more than the environment; it will have far-reaching implications for intergenerational justice more broadly.
column2: 但裁决并不只是关乎环境；它将对更广泛的代际正义（intergenerational justice）造成深远影响。

column1: Consider the issue of public debt.
column2: 以公共债务问题为例。

column1: There have always been moral objections to one generation burdening the next with excessive debt, effectively limiting young people’s future liberty by impinging on their ability to form families, educate children, and create wealth.
column2: 对于某一代人把过度负债的负担甩给下一代人，影响到年轻人组建家庭、教育子女和积累财富的能力，大大限制他们的未来自由的做法，总是会产生道德反对。

column1: With US federal deficits rising toward $1 trillion a year, the issue is becoming cripplingly urgent.
column2: 美国联邦债务正在向每年1万亿美元靠拢，这一问题也变得越来越紧迫。

column1: In deciding Juliana v. United States, the Supreme Court must grapple with the fact that the US Constitution does not explicitly recognize future citizens.
column2: 在朱莉安娜诉美国案的裁决中，最高法院必须抓住一个事实，即美国宪法并未明确承认未来公民。

column1: While it was the first of many national constitutions to embody the Enlightenment principles that citizens are equal under the law and endowed with unalienable rights, it applies those principles only to living Americans.
column2: 法律面前人人平等，公民拥有不可剥夺的权利，美国宪法是第一批将这些启蒙运动原则写入其中的众多国家宪法之一，但这些原则只适用于活着的美国人。

column1: Future US citizens will have rights only after they are born.
column2: 未来美国公民只有当他们降生后，才能拥有权利。

column1: That might sound reasonable.
column2: 这听起来十分合理。

column1: But if the interests of future Americans are not protected, powerful actors today can drain resources from the not-yet-born.
column2: 但如果未来美国人的利益得不到保护，今天的强力行动者就可能从尚未出生的公民手中抢夺资源。

column1: The result is environmental degradation, unsustainable public debt, and generations of under-educated, unemployable people who will have difficulty raising their own children to become productive adults.
column2: 结果将是环境破坏、不可持续的公共债务，以及几代教育程度低、找不到工作的人难以将自己的孩子培养为有生产力的成年人。

column1: One modern country does recognize this risk in its constitution: Germany.
column2: 有一个现代国家在其宪法中承认了这一风险：德国。

column1: Article 20a of Germany’s Grundgesetz (Basic Law) stipulates that, “Mindful also of its responsibility toward future generations, the state shall protect the natural foundations of life and animals by legislation and, in accordance with law and justice, by executive and judicial action…”
column2: 德国宪法（基本法）第20条a款，规定 “国家亦须谨记对子孙后代的责任，应该通过立法以及通过与法律和争议相符的行政和司法行为，保护生命和动物的自然基础 … … ”

column1: By demonstrating that younger living citizens suffer more than their older counterparts from short-sighted fiscal and environmental policies, Juliana could be the first step toward recognizing a similar responsibility in the US.
column2: 朱莉安娜认为年轻的活着的公民比年长同胞承受短视的财政和环境政策的后果更多，这可能成为美国承认类似责任的第一步。

column1: It is a small step, but one that could have far-reaching implications for policy, especially at a time when the president and his administration are actively pursuing policies that effectively loot the next generation.
column2: 这是一小步 ， ， 但可能对政策产生深远影响，特别是在总统及其政府积极地推行洗劫下一代的政策的时候。

column1: And, indeed, US President Donald Trump’s administration has resisted the case at every turn.
column2: 而事实上，美国总统特朗普政府也确实在每一个回合都抵制这起案件。

column1: Earlier this year, a lower court ruled that the case could go to trial, and the trial was set to begin at the US District Court in Oregon, on October 29.
column2: 今年早些时候，一家较低级别法院裁定本案可进入庭审，并安排于10月29日在俄勒冈地方法院开庭。

column1: But in late September, Supreme Court Chief Justice John Roberts issued a temporary stay of the case to consider a request from the Justice Department to halt it altogether – a highly unusual move.
column2: 但在9月份，最高法院首席大法官约翰·罗伯茨（John Roberts）临时叫停该案，要求考虑司法部中止该案的要求 — — 这是极不寻常的举动。

column1: Fortunately, the Supreme Court decided to deny the government’s request and let the trial move forward.
column2: 幸运的是，最高法院否决了政府的要求，庭审可以继续进行。

column1: But the Trump administration is not giving up: it has now filed dismissal appeals with the US District Court in Oregon and the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals in San Francisco.
column2: 但特朗普政府没有放弃：上诉要求驳回俄勒冈地区法院和旧金山第九上诉巡回法院的起诉。

column1: Trump administration attorneys insist that the case is “nonjusticiable,” meaning that the courts are not the proper venue to resolve the issues in Juliana; even if this was not the case, they continue, the plaintiffs lack standing to sue.
column2: 特朗普政府的律师坚持该案“不可由法院裁决 ” ， 即法院不是解决朱莉安娜案问题的合理地点；即使并非如此，他们继续指出，控方也缺少起诉依据。

column1: The US federal courts from the district level up to the Supreme Court – all of which have already ruled that the case should go to trial – clearly disagree.
column2: 从地方法院到最高法院的美国联邦法院体系 — — 均裁定本案应该进入庭审 — — 予以明确回绝。

column1: There are parallels between Juliana v. United States and the Supreme Court’s infamous decision in Dred Scott v. Sandford.
column2: 朱莉安娜诉美国案与最高法院声名狼藉的德雷德·斯科特诉斯坦福案（Dred Scott v. Sandford）裁决有相似之处。

column1: Scott, a slave, sued for his and his family’s freedom in 1857 – eight years before the US Constitution’s 13th Amendment abolished slavery.
column2: 斯科特是一名奴隶，在1857年起诉要求还自己和家庭以自由 — — 此时距离美国宪法第十三修正案废除奴隶制还有八年。

column1: Chief Justice Roger B. Taney ruled that slaves and their descendants were “beings of an inferior order” who had “no rights which the white man was bound to respect.”
column2: 首席大法官罗杰·塔尼（Roger B. Taney）裁定奴隶及其后代是“劣等生物 ” ， 他们“没有白人所理应得到尊重的权利 。 ”

column1: Scott, therefore, had no standing to sue in federal court.
column2: 因此，斯科特没有资格在联邦法院发起诉讼。

column1: Will Kelsey Juliana, the chief plaintiff in the federal suit, also be denied?
column2: 联邦案件主控方凯尔西·朱莉安娜（Kelsey Juliana）也会被拒绝吗？

column1: Already, in the US Supreme Court’s comments about Juliana, there are echoes of Dred Scott.
column2: 在美国最高法院对朱莉安娜案的评价中，已经有了德雷德·斯科特案的影子。

column1: Ultimately, however, the Dred Scott ruling was out of touch not only with basic morality, but also with the growing economic and cultural power of the North and the direction of US history.
column2: 但说到底，德雷德·斯科特案的裁决既不符合基本道德，也不符合日益崛起的北方经济和文化实力以及美国历史的前进方向。

column1: That is what we are seeing today, both in the Trump administration’s claims that Juliana is nonjusticiable, and in US law’s antiquated failure to recognize future Americans’ rights to a livable environment, unburdened by excessive debt.
column2: 我们在今天也看到了这种情况，特朗普政府所谓的朱莉安娜案不可由法院裁决，以及美国法律落后于时代地不承认未来美国人拥有适合生活的环境、不必承担过重债务的权利，都是如此。

column1: Opponents of Juliana, including the politically influential energy industry, cynically hope that they can succeed in getting the case dismissed and put generational rights in the hands of a deeply divided – and, for powerful vested interests, pliable – Congress.
column2: 朱莉安娜案的反对者，包括政治影响力很强的能源业，犬儒地希望他们能够成功驳回案件，将代际权利交到深度分裂的 — — 以及符合权势既得利益的柔软易控的 — — 国会手中。

column1: Like the opponents of emancipation in the 1850s, they count success in terms of the few months or years they can continue to benefit from the Constitution’s lacunae.
column2: 就像19世纪50年代释放奴隶的反对者，他们对成功的算计是能够从宪法的漏洞中获益几个月或几年。

column1: And they may well be able to hold onto the past a little longer.
column2: 他们很可能能够将历史拖一会儿。

column1: When it came to abolishing slavery, the US trailed the United Kingdom by more than 30 years – a delay that only made matters worse in the mid-1800s.
column2: 在废奴问题上，美国落后英国30多年 — — 到了19世纪，这一拖延让情况进一步恶化。

column1: But the direction of history is clear.
column2: 但历史的方向是明确的。

column1: The tide is turning against permitting living citizens to exploit their children and grandchildren.
column2: 放任活着的公民剥削他们的子辈和孙辈是逆潮流而动。

column1: In this sense, whatever the outcome, Juliana v. United States is just the beginning.
column2: 从这个角度讲，不管朱莉安娜诉美国案结果如何，都将只是一个开始。

column1: Mandela’s Children
column2: 曼德拉的孩子

column1: NAIROBI – Before I knew that Nelson Mandela existed, I thought our then-leader, Kenyan President Daniel Toroitich arap Moi, was the world’s only statesman.
column2: 发自内罗毕 — — 在我知道有尼尔森·曼德拉这个人存在之前，我觉得自己国家的领袖，时任肯尼亚总统的丹尼尔·阿拉普·莫伊（Daniel Toroitich arap Moi）是世界上唯一的政治家。

column1: I was five years old, and no world existed for me outside Nairagie Enkare, my birthplace in rural Maasailand.
column2: 当时我才五岁，对我来说除了出生地 — — 马赛地（Maasailand）乡下的Nairagie Enkare地区 — — 之外的世界是一片空白。

column1: Moi was a mythical figure to me, because he didn’t live in Nairagie Enkare, yet he was always present through radio, a technology too complicated for a child like me to understand.
column2: 莫伊只是我心目中一个虚构的人物，因为他并不住在Nairagie Enkare地区，但他经常在收音机里出现，而收音机这种高科技对一个孩子来说实在太难理解了。

column1: Every newscast from the government-controlled radio station began with what “His Excellency, Holy President Daniel Toroitich arap Moi” had said or done.
column2: 来自政府电台的每一条新闻都是关于“尊敬而神圣的总统丹尼尔·阿拉普·莫伊”干了或说了些什么。

column1: He visited a school. He planted a tree.
column2: 他到哪儿访问了一所学校，又去哪儿种了一棵树。

column1: He helped a women’s group.
column2: 他扶助妇女组织。

column1: He attended church.
column2: 他进教堂作礼拜。

column1: He said agriculture was the backbone of our nation.
column2: 他说农业是我们国家的主心骨。

column1: He said we were fortunate to live in Kenya.
column2: 他说我们能生活在肯尼亚是很幸福的一件事。

column1: Throughout the day, the airwaves were filled with songs repeating the Father of the Nation’s message, and reminding Kenyans to follow in his footsteps.
column2: 一天到晚，电波里都充斥着一些传达国父教诲的歌曲，并提醒国民要追随他的脚步。

column1: Perhaps because what came over the radio was so predictable, people sought alternative news from the BBC Swahili Service.
column2: 或许以为早已对电台里的说辞滚瓜烂熟了，人们转而收听英国广播公司（BBC）的斯瓦西里语频道。

column1: On most evenings, at six o’clock, men gathered to listen at the homes of the few, like my father, who had radios.
column2: 每到晚上6点的时候，男人们就聚在那几个有电台的人家 — — 比如我家 — — 来收听节目。

column1: The news lasted only 30 minutes, so everyone had to be absolutely quiet.
column2: 新闻只会播放半个小时，因此每个人都必须保持极端安静。

column1: But, on February 11, 1990, the men began to say repeatedly, “He is free! He is free!
column2: 但在某一天（我后来才知道是1990年2月11日 ） ， 人们开始不断重复着一句话 ： “ 他自由了，尼尔逊·曼德拉自由了 ！ ”

column1: Nelson Mandela is free!”
I’m sure that my father and his friends had heard earlier from government radio that Mandela had been released, but they waited for verification from the BBC.
column2: 我确信父亲和他的朋友们早就在政府电台中听到了曼德拉获释的消息，但他们需要等BBC来确证这一点。

column1: They left before the news was over to go to a bar to celebrate.
column2: 还没等到新闻播完，他们就冲到一家酒吧开始了庆祝。

column1: When my father came home that night, he was singing praises for Mandela.
column2: 当我父亲当晚回到家的时候还高唱歌颂曼德拉的歌。

column1: I never asked my father who Mandela was.
column2: 不过我从来没问他曼德拉究竟是谁。

column1: The following year, I enrolled in school and began to learn that the world extended beyond Nairagie Enkare.
column2: 接着那年，我开始读书并发现原来世界不止是Nairagie Enkare那么大。

column1: My teachers explained to me why Mandela’s freedom, after 27 years in prison, meant so much to Africans – from big cities to small villages.
column2: 我的老师向我解释为何曼德拉在被囚禁27年后的获释对非洲人 — — 无论是城市居民还是乡野村夫 — — 来说是如此重要

column1: Europeans, I learned, had colonized Africa and stripped Africans of the right to self-governance.
column2: 我学到，欧洲人把非洲变成了殖民地并剥夺了非洲人的自治权。

column1: As African countries began to gain independence in the 1950’s, the white minority in South Africa was tightening its grip on power through a racial-segregation system known as apartheid. It was Mandela’s fight against apartheid that led to his imprisonment.
column2: 随着非洲国家自1950年代以来先后获得独立，在南非的白人少数派政府开始利用一套名为种族隔离的体制来维护自己的手中权力，而曼德拉正是因��抗这一体制入狱的。

column1: By 1980, black Africans had taken over governance in every country on the continent except South Africa.
column2: 在1980年，除了南非之外的所有非洲黑人都获得了自治权。

column1: Mandela’s release from prison ten years later moved Africa one step closer to absolute independence.
column2: 而曼德拉在十年后的获释则使非洲更进一步实现了一种近乎完全独立的状态。

column1: That mission was completed in 1994, when apartheid fell and South Africans chose Mandela as their first democratically elected president.
column2: 这个使命最终在1994年完成，种族隔离制度终于崩溃，南非人也将曼德拉选为本国首位民选总统。

column1: As I learned more about Mandela, I wondered how he had achieved the unimaginable, overcoming a 27-year ordeal to become the leader of Africa’s largest economy.
column2: 随着我对曼德拉了解越多，我就越想知道他是如何完成这个不可想象的任务，熬过了27年牢狱并最终成为非洲最大经济体的总统。

column1: And, just when I thought that he had already made his mark on history, he shocked the world by announcing that he would not seek re-election after the end of his first term in 1999.
column2: 而当我认为他已经创造了历史的时候，曼德拉却再次震惊了世界，宣布自己将不会在第一任总统任期结束后继续参选连任。

column1: I was 14 then, old enough to understand how unusual it was for an incumbent African president to retire willingly.
column2: 当时我14岁，已经可以明白一位大权在握的非洲总统能自愿退休是件极不寻常的事。

column1: In my own country, for example, people were beginning to wonder whether Moi would leave office in 2002, when his second term expired.
column2: 在我自己的国家肯尼亚，人们已经开始猜想莫伊总统究竟是否会在2002年第二任任期届满后退位。

column1: He had ruled Kenya for 13 years before a move in 1991 to reintroduce multi-party democracy paved the way for an election the following year.
column2: 在1991年重新引入多党民主制并决定在1992年举行大选之前莫伊已经统治了肯尼亚14年。

column1: Moi was allowed to run again, as long as he honored the constitutional two-term limit.
column2: 他被允许在新法令下重新参选，条件是要服从只可连任一届的宪法规定。

column1: I feel extremely fortunate and honored that the start of my formal education coincided with Mandela’s re-emergence in African politics.
column2: 我的求学生涯恰好与曼德拉在非洲政治的重新崛起重合，对此我感到非常荣幸。

column1: His patience, civility, and politics of reconciliation provided me a better example of democracy and good governance than any civics class could have done.
column2: 他的耐心，文雅以及和解政治都为我提供了一个民主和优秀治理和的绝佳范本，比所有公民教育都要更加生动和深刻。

column1: Mandela embodied the type of leader that Africans had in mind when they struggled for freedom from the European empires.
column2: 曼德拉正是那些为摆脱欧洲帝国统治而抗争的非洲人心目中的领袖。

column1: Africans wanted leaders who would reconcile and reunite them – leaders who would restore to them the dignity that colonialism had robbed.
column2: 他们希望有一个能促成各族和解并将所有人重新联合在一起的领袖 — — 一个能重新让他们找回被殖民主义夺去的自尊的人。

column1: Unfortunately for many African countries, freedom and independence ended up in the hands of a few who had tasted and become addicted to the repressive practices that Africans had spent decades fighting.
column2: 但不幸的是，在许多非洲国家自由和独立依然是一纸空文。 自由终结在了某些曾经遭受，抗争，但却最终沉迷于残酷镇压手段的暴君手里。

column1: They amassed untold wealth as hunger and disease ripped their societies apart and pushed more Africans deeper into poverty.
column2: 在他们聚敛巨额财富的同时饥饿与疾病却撕裂了非洲社会并将更多非洲人推向了贫穷的深渊。

column1: Indeed, more than two decades after Mandela walked through the prison gates, supposedly completing Africa’s struggle for freedom, “Big Men” in countries like Congo and Zimbabwe continue to cling to power against the will of their people.
column2: 事实上，就在曼德拉走过罗本岛监狱大门，宣告非洲自由斗争胜利20年后的今天，科特迪瓦和津巴布韦等国的“强人”却继续罔顾人民的意愿，紧抱着权力不放。

column1: Nevertheless, I am encouraged by the fact that, since Mandela left office, many African presidents – including Moi and Thabo Mbeki, Mandela’s successor – have adhered to their countries’ constitutions and left office without a fight.
column2: 但即便如此我还是保持乐观，因为许多非洲总统 — — 包括莫伊还有曼德莱的继任者姆贝基 — — 都能服从本国的宪法并平静地交出了权力。

column1: I am also hopeful that Mandela has inspired other young people like me to continue Africa’s liberation peacefully – the Mandela way.
column2: 我也希望曼德拉能激励其他像我这样的青年人继续走上和平解放非洲的道路 — — 这就是曼德拉路线。

column1: Jumpstarting Europe’s Economy
column2: 提振欧洲经济

column1: PARIS – Not so long ago, the notion of the European Central Bank handing out money to governments or directly to citizens – so-called “helicopter money” drops – would have seemed outlandish.
column2: 巴黎—不久前，欧洲央行向政府或直接向公民派钱的概念 — — 即所谓的“直升机撒钱 ” — —看上去还荒诞不经。

column1: But today a surprising number of mainstream economists and centrist politicians are endorsing the idea of monetary financing of stimulus measures in different forms.
column2: 但如今，令人意外地，大量主流经济学家和中间派政客支持不同形式的刺激计划货币融资的概念。

column1: This represents a much-needed change in the conversation – one that, at long last, finally puts the focus squarely on stimulating the demand side of the European economy.
column2: 这表明话语出现了急需的改变 — — 重点终于对准了刺激欧洲经济的需求端。

column1: After years of stagnant growth and debilitating unemployment, all options, no matter how unconventional, should be on the table.
column2: 在经历了多年的增长停滞和就业萎靡后，所有选项，不管它多么反常规，都应该摆上台面。

column1: The United Kingdom’s referendum decision to leave the European Union only strengthens the case for more stimulus and unconventional measures in Europe.
column2: 英国全民公决决定脱离欧盟，这进一步加强了欧洲加码刺激和非常规措施的理由。

column1: If a large majority of EU citizens is to support continued political integration, strong economic growth is critical.
column2: 要让绝大部分欧洲公民支持继续推进政治一体化，强劲的经济增长至关重要。

column1: As research by McKinsey Global Institute (MGI) shows, despite bold quantitative easing and record low interest rates – the ECB was the first major central bank to introduce negative interest rates in 2014 – anemic demand continues to hobble GDP growth throughout Europe.
column2: 麦肯锡全球研究所（MGI）的研究表明，尽管采取了激进的量化宽松和创纪录的低利率 — — 欧洲央行在2014年率先在主要央行中引入了负利率 — — 但萎靡的需求仍然拖累着整个欧洲的GDP增长。

column1: In several EU countries, more than a quarter of the population has been unemployed for close to a decade, and political discontent is boiling over into extremism.
column2: 在一些欧盟国家，超过四分之一人口已经接近十年找不到工作，政治不满也日益走向极端。

column1: The uncertainty and volatility in financial markets in the aftermath of the Brexit vote will further cripple demand.
column2: 金融市场在英国退出投票后的不确定性和波动将进步一制约需求。

column1: The wave of corporate investment that was supposed to be unleashed by a combination of fiscal restraint (to rein in government debt) and monetary easing (to generate ultra-low interest rates) has never materialized.
column2: 财政约束（遏制政府债务）和货币宽松（形成极低利率）的组合理应带来公司投资潮，但这一幕并未发生。

column1: Instead, European companies slashed annual investment by more than €100 billion ($113 billion) a year from 2008 to 2015, and have stockpiled some €700 billion of cash on their balance sheets.
column2: 相反，2008—2015年间欧洲公司的年投资规模减少了1,000亿欧元以上，而在资产负债表上囤积了大约7,000亿欧元现金。

column1: This is not surprising – businesses invest when they are confident about future demand and output growth.
column2: 这并不令人奇怪 — — 企业在它们对未来需求和产出增长充满信心时投资。

column1: Even before the Brexit vote, European and other global companies were not confident in Europe’s prospects.
column2: 即使在英国退出投票前，欧洲和其他全球公司对欧洲的前景也不抱信心。

column1: Now they are confronting elevated risks of a European recession and the real possibility that both the UK and the EU could break up if populist contagion takes hold.
column2: 如今，它们面临着欧洲衰退风险升级和民粹主义蔓延导致英国和欧盟解体的实实在在的可能性。

column1: Business investors hate uncertainty and the Brexit vote has created a dramatically more uncertain world in Europe and beyond.
column2: 商业投资者厌恶不确定性，而英国退出在欧洲内外造成了巨大的新增不确定性。

column1: Fiscal austerity and ultra-low interest rates have also proven ineffective at stimulating household demand – and they may be backfiring.
column2: 财政紧缩和极低利率也没能有效刺激家庭需求 — — 并且可能适得其反。

column1: When individuals cannot find decent yields, they may actually increase their savings to achieve their retirement goals.
column2: 当个人无法获得体面的收益率时，他们实际可能增加储蓄以实现退休目标。

column1: And in the typical European city, where land and affordable housing are in short supply, lower interest rates have been driving property prices higher rather than stimulating construction.
column2: 而在典型的欧洲城市，土地和平价房产供给短缺，降低利率进一步推高了房价，而不是刺激了建筑业。

column1: It’s well past time to acknowledge the limits of current policy.
column2: 承认当前政策的局限性良机已过。

column1: Under today’s precarious conditions, demand could certainly be better supported through strategies other than quantitative easing and ultra-low interest rates.
column2: 在眼下的危险情况中，需求显然更应该通过战略而不是量化宽松和极低利率来支持。

column1: Moreover, alternative approaches to stimulate private demand might have fewer undesirable distributional consequences, as MGI has discussed.
column2: 此外，如MGI所讨论的，刺激私人需求的其他方法可能产生更少的不良分配后果。

column1: Proponents of helicopter money – directly crediting citizens with central bank funds, or crediting national treasuries to finance infrastructure and other demand-generating activities – rightly argue that it has the advantage of putting money directly into the hands of those who will spend it.
column2: 直升机撒钱 — — 直接用央行资金授信给公民，或授信国家财政机关为基础设施和其他产生需求的活动融资 — — 的支持者正确地指出，它具有将钱直接送到会花钱的人手里的优点。

column1: An appropriately sized helicopter-money program might also raise inflation in a measured way, heading off the possibility of a Japanese-style deflationary trap.
column2: 规模合理的直升机撒钱计划还可以可控地提高通胀，避免日本式通缩陷阱的风险。

column1: Indeed, the boost to demand might give central banks the opening they need to move interest rates back toward historical norms.
column2: 事实上，需求提振可能让央行获得让利率回归历史正常水平所需要的机会。

column1: This could take the air out of incipient assets bubbles that might be forming and ease pressures on institutional investors who are struggling to find the yield they need to meet their insurance and pension commitments.
column2: 这可以扼杀萌芽之中的资产泡沫，缓解苦苦寻觅满足保险和退休金要求的收益率的机构投资者的压力。

column1: But a helicopter-money program – a fanciful idea when Milton Friedman proposed it in 1969 – would also be a radical departure for policymakers, requiring an abundance of caution about citizen and investor perception, confidence, and solid governance structures.
column2: 但直升机撒钱计划 — — 这一金融概念由弗里德曼（Milton Friedman）于1969年提出 — — 也将是决策者的一次严重的离经叛道，需要公民和投资者认知有充分的谨慎、信心和可靠的治理结构。

column1: And such an approach would cement the notion that central bank policy is “the only game in town,” relieving elected government leaders of their responsibility for pro-growth policies and the fiscal decisions they control.
column2: 这一方针将巩固央行政策是“唯一的游戏”的概念，让民选政府摆脱促增长政策的责任，解除它们的财政决定控制权。

column1: A less risky and time-tested route for stimulating demand would be a significant increase in public infrastructure investment funded by government debt.
column2: 一个风险较小、经历时间考验的刺激需求的方法是大幅增加政府债务融资的公共基础设施投资。

column1: It is well documented that Europe and the United States have underinvested in infrastructure.
column2: 大量证据表明欧洲和美国基础设施投资不足。

column1: From a macroeconomic perspective, infrastructure investment is a “twofer”– it strengthens productivity and competitiveness in the long run and, where there is unused capacity, it boosts demand, output, and employment with significant multiplier effects in the short run.
column2: 从宏观经济角度，基础设施是“买一送一 ” ： 它增强长期生产率和竞争力，同时，在存在产能过剩的地方，它以显著的短期乘数效应刺激需求、产出和就业。

column1: Yet governments across Europe have clamped down on infrastructure spending for years, giving precedence to fiscal austerity and debt reduction in the misguided belief that government borrowing crowds out private investment and reduces growth.
column2: 但整个欧洲的政府多年来都在遏制基础设施支出，在政府借贷挤出私人投资、降低增长的误导信念下，财政紧缩和减少债务才是重点。

column1: But the crowding-out logic applies only to conditions of full employment, conditions that clearly do not exist in most of Europe today.
column2: 但挤出逻辑只有在充分就业条件下才成立，而当今欧洲的大部分国家显然不是这样。

column1: In addition, infrastructure investment cannot be deferred forever.
column2: 此外，基础设施投资不可能永远推迟。

column1: A new reckoning is warranted, one that accounts for the full costs of underinvestment in terms of foregone employment and growth.
column2: 新的算计迟早会降临，考虑就业和增长损失等投资不足的全面成本。

column1: One way to break the stalemate is a change in public accounting standards.
column2: 打破僵局的一个办法是改变公共会计准则。

column1: Specifically, if governments were able to treat infrastructure investment just as companies treat capital expenditure – as balance-sheet assets that are depreciated over their lifecycle, rather than as one-off expenses – such investment could then be exempted from Europe’s deficit rules without opening the door to profligate spending or easing the pressure for credible plans for long-term fiscal-consolidation.
column2: 具体而言，如果政府可以如公司处理资本支出一样将基础设施投资 — — 作为资产负债表中的资产，按生命周期折旧，而不是一次性支出 — — 这些投资就可以免受欧洲财政规则约束，并且不会开启挥霍性支出的大门或缓解可信长期财政整合计划的压力。

column1: Of course, it would be crucial to improve the planning and oversight of infrastructure projects simultaneously, as MGI has argued.
column2: 当然，如MGI所指出的，同时改善基础设施项目的规划和监督至关重要。

column1: Fresh thinking about structural reform is needed, too.
column2: 关于结构改革的新鲜思维也必不可少。

column1: For decades, reform discussions in the EU have focused on reducing labor-market regulation, cutting red tape in product markets, privatizing state-owned enterprises, and lowering tax rates.
column2: 几十年来，欧盟改革讨论一直聚焦于减少劳动力市场监管、消除产品市场的官样文章、国有企业私有化以及降低税率。

column1: But reform should now work with the grain of efforts to bolster demand – for example, unleashing the silver economy, fostering digital education and innovation, and unlocking urban land markets to pave the way for much-needed investment in housing.
column2: 但如今，改革必须与辅之以刺激需求的措施 — — 比如解放银色经济、促进数字教育和创新、解放城市土地市场为急需的房地产投资扫清障碍等。

column1: Each of these options would require robust debate and deeper investigation.
column2: 这些选择的每一项都要求进行热烈的讨论和深层次的调查。

column1: But it’s clear that Europe needs a larger set of policy options.
column2: 但显然，欧洲需要更大规模的政策选择范围。

column1: Quantitative easing and ultra-low interest rates should no longer be the only arrows in the macroeconomic policy quiver.
column2: 量化宽松和极低利率不应该继续成为仅有的宏观经济政策工具。

column1: These tools, along with excessive fiscal austerity, may have higher costs in terms of foregone employment and growth – and rising political discontent – than “risky” alternative options.
column2: 它们与财政过度紧缩的结合所造成的代价 — — 以失去的就业和增长以及不断加剧的政治不满衡量 — — 可能比“高风险”替代选择更大。

column1: The Brexit vote is a canary in the coal mine for Europe’s economic policy makers.
column2: 对欧洲经济政策决策者而言，英国退出投票好比是煤矿里的金丝雀。

column1: Unconventional times require consideration of bold unconventional policy approaches.
column2: 非常规时期需要考虑激进的非常规政策方针。

column1: Jean-Claude Juncker’s Roadmap for European Disaster
column2: 容克的欧洲灾难路线图

column1: MUNICH – A group of hikers has lost its way.
column2: 慕尼黑—一群徒步旅行者迷了路。

column1: They want to get to a castle on a hill in the distance, but the path they are on seems to be leading in a different direction, and their leader’s only advice is to hurry up.
column2: 他们想去远处山上的城堡，但脚下的道路似乎方向错了，而领头人还在不断催他们快走。

column1: Today, the eurozone is in the same situation as those hikers.
column2: 今天的欧元区的状况就像是这样一群徒步旅行者。

column1: It has become increasingly clear that establishing the euro was the wrong path to take.
column2: 情况越来越清楚，引入欧元是一步错棋。

column1: The single currency caused an inflationary credit bubble in Southern Europe.
column2: 单一货币导致南欧出现通胀性信用泡沫。

column1: When the bubble burst, the region’s competitiveness was destroyed, and Northern Europe was called on to provide huge loan guarantees, public credit, and transfers.
column2: 泡沫破裂时，该地区的竞争力也随之毁灭，而北欧被要求提供巨额贷款担保、公共信用和转移支付。

column1: These measures have sustained the wrong relative prices that resulted from the bubble, and papered over the underlying problem.
column2: 这些措施维持了错误的相对价格 — — 这是这种错误的相对价格引起了泡沫 — — 也掩盖了根本问题。

column1: Meanwhile, the Schengen Agreement, which eliminated most border checks between European Union member states, has facilitated the ability of immigrants from the poorer parts of Asia and Africa to flock to Northern European welfare states in recent years.
column2: 与此同时，申根协定取消了大部分欧盟成员国之间的边检，便利了移民在近几年中从较穷的亚洲和非洲大量涌向北欧福利国家。

column1: In response to these events, European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker used his State of the Union address this month to call for even more countries to join the eurozone and the Schengen Area.
column2: 应对这些情况，欧盟委员会主席容克在本月的欧盟盟情咨文中号召更多国家加入欧元区和申根区。

column1: Juncker is the charismatic but confused guide who is leading our metaphorical group of hikers astray.
column2: 容克是一个很有魅力但头脑混乱的向导，正在引导我们这个隐喻中的徒步旅行团迷路。

column1: All non-euro EU member states, except Denmark are already legally obligated to work toward adopting the euro, by satisfying various “convergence criteria.”
column2: 所有非欧元欧盟成员国（除了丹麦 ） ， 都有法定义务致力于通过满足不同的“趋同标准 ” ， 逐步采用欧元。

column1: But Juncker obviously wants to accelerate that process, by loosening the eurozone membership criteria and providing financial incentives for new members to join.
column2: 但容克显然希望加速这一进程，放松欧元区成员资格标准，并提供金融激励刺激新成员加入。

column1: Given the eurozone’s past problems, this is an extremely dangerous proposition.
column2: 考虑到欧元区过去的问题，这一方案非常危险。

column1: If realized, it would probably fuel the same kind of destructive overheating that we have seen in Southern Europe.
column2: 如果实现的话，它有可能助推南欧所出现过的破坏性过热。

column1: In fact, Bulgarian, Croatian, and Romanian households have already loaded up on excessive debt in foreign currencies – primarily euros – in anticipation of joining the monetary union, and this has created substantial financial difficulties.
column2: 事实上，在预期加入欧洲货币联盟的情况下，保加利亚、克罗地亚和罗马尼亚家庭已经外币债台高筑 — — 主要是欧元债务 — — 而这带来了巨大的金融困难。

column1: Of course, it is understandable that Western banks that recklessly extended euro loans to these countries now want to give them euro printing presses.
column2: 当然，不难理解，鲁莽地想这些国家大肆发放欧元贷款的西方银行现在想把欧元印钞机也送给它们。

column1: That way, the debtor countries can reassure their creditors and repay their loans with self-printed cash if necessary, as Southern European countries have done for the last decade.
column2: 如此，债务国就可以保证在必要时用自己印的现金来偿还它们的贷款，就像南欧国家在过去十年中所做的那样。

column1: Providing Bulgaria, Croatia, and Romania with national euro printing presses would keep private credit flowing and enable foreign-currency loans to be rolled over.
column2: 向保加利亚、克罗地亚和罗马尼亚提供国家欧元印钞权将维持私人信用流，使外币贷款得以延期。

column1: But so much artificially cheap credit would also bloat state pensions, government wages, and social transfers.
column2: 但人为的廉价信用也将导致国家退休金、政府工资和社会转移支付膨胀。

column1: And this, in turn, would lead to overheating real-estate markets and domestic-wage increases, thus undermining international competitiveness.
column2: 而这反过来又将导致房地产市场过热和国内工资上涨，从而破坏国际竞争力。

column1: Normally, a country that finds itself in such a position would urgently devalue its currency.
column2: 通常，陷入这一状况的国家要采取紧急货币贬值。

column1: But, because euro membership precludes that option, financially sound Northern European countries would once again be called upon to help with European Central Bank loan guarantees and financial transfers, while tolerating the newly added eurozone members’ self-service with the printing press.
column2: 但欧元区成员国身份排除了这一选项，因此金融坚挺的北欧国家将再次被要求帮助欧洲央行贷款担保和金融转移支付，同时容忍新加入的欧元区成员国开动印钞机满足自我的做法。

column1: In short, Juncker’s plan to accelerate eurozone accession threatens to recreate in spades the chaos of the past decade, which started with a bubble in Southern Europe, and culminated in the Greek sovereign-debt crisis.
column2: 简言之，容克的计划 — — 加快欧元区加入流程 — — 有可能让过去十年的混乱重演，上一次混乱始于南欧的泡沫，在希腊主权债务危机中达到高潮。

column1: Juncker’s proposal to extend the Schengen Area to the east is similarly misguided, and seems to ignore the lessons of recent history.
column2: 容克的申根区东扩方案也有同样的误导作用，并且无视最新的历史教训。

column1: The unmanageable wave of immigration in 2015 showed that Europe has too few internal and external border controls.
column2: 2015年面临难民潮束手无策的情况表明，欧洲内部和外部的边境控制太少了。

column1: Juncker might like to think that immigration has since slowed, owing to the agreement that the EU reached with Turkey in early 2016.
column2: 容克也许在想，因为欧盟与土耳其在2016年年初达成了协议，此后移民流入速度有所放缓。

column1: But data from the European border-control authority Frontex indicate that the migration flows stalled once a fence was erected in Macedonia, at the behest of Austria and the Visegrád countries (the Czech Republic, Hungary, Poland, and Slovakia).
column2: 但欧盟边防局（Frontex）的数据显示，移民流系在奥地利和维谢格拉德国家（捷克、匈牙利、波兰和斯洛伐克）要求马其顿建立了隔离墙后才应声下降。

column1: Moreover, the Hungarian-Serbian border fence and Hungary’s ever-tightening controls at its border with Romania have also contributed to European stability.
column2: 此外，匈牙利-塞尔维亚边境墙和匈牙利日益收紧的罗马尼亚边境控制也有助于欧洲的稳定。

column1: But migrants are now crossing the Black Sea from Turkey to Bulgaria, and might come in even larger numbers if the EU membership negotiations with Turkey stall.
column2: 但现在移民从土耳其穿越黑海进入保加利亚，如果土耳其欧盟成员资格谈判陷入停顿，移民的数量可能会变得更加巨大。

column1: As a result, the rest of the EU should oppose any bid to eliminate existing border controls, which is exactly what would happen if Bulgaria and Romania were included in the Schengen Area.
column2: 因此，其他欧盟成员国应该反对一切取消现有边控措施的提案，而如果保加利亚和罗马尼亚被纳入申根区，这一幕必将成为现实。

column1: One can only wonder what is driving Juncker’s proposals.
column2: 不禁要问，是什么推动容克提出这样的提案。

column1: To be sure, the European Commission cannot neglect the interests of financial institutions in Paris, Luxembourg, and Frankfurt.
column2: 平心而论，欧盟委员会不可能无视巴黎、卢森堡和法兰克福的金融机构的利益。

column1: No one wants the ill-advised loans extended to Eastern European countries to fuel another bank crisis.
column2: 没人希望让不审慎的贷款扩大到东欧国家，助长又一场银行危机。

column1: But the result of Juncker having his way would be even worse.
column2: 但容克取得成功的结果将更加糟糕。

column1: An inflationary bubble in Eastern Europe, coupled with the dismantling of border controls, could destabilize the entire EU and create a fresh wave of economic migrants into Central Europe.
column2: 东欧的通胀性泡沫，加上边控的取消，可能动摇整个欧盟，导致新一波经济移民潮进入中欧。

column1: It is time for Europe’s trail guide to see reason, consult a compass, and get back on track.
column2: 欧洲的徒步旅行向导应该讲讲道理，看看罗盘，认清正确的道路。

column1: Europe’s Trade Victory in Washington
column2: 欧洲在华盛顿的贸易胜利

column1: WASHINGTON, DC – On July 25, when US President Donald Trump appeared in front of the White House with Jean-Claude Juncker, the president of the European Commission, their joint statement and spoken remarks surprised many.
column2: 华盛顿—7月25日，美国总统与欧盟委员会主席容克一起出现在白宫前时，他们的联合声明和言辞震惊了很多人。

column1: The two sides agreed “to work together toward zero tariffs, zero non-tariff barriers, and zero subsidies on non-auto industrial goods.”
column2: 双方同意 “共同致力于零关税、令非关税壁垒、零非汽车工业产品补贴 ” 。

column1: It seemed like a remarkable U-turn for Trump, who, until recently, was threatening the European Union with higher tariffs – and extolling the value of trade tariffs (which are essentially taxes on imported goods) more generally.
column2: 这对特朗普来说简直是一百八十度的大转弯，在此之前，特朗普一直威胁要对欧盟采取更高的关税 — — 还赞美关税的价值（本质上，关税就是对进口商品征税 ） 。

column1: He even called the EU a “foe” as recently as June.
column2: 在6月份，他还把欧盟称为 “敌人 ” 。

column1: Substantive follow-through on the joint US-EU statement would represent a major policy shift for the Trump administration.
column2: 美国-欧盟联合声明后的真正的后续动作将代表特朗普政府的重大政策转向。

column1: But this is no triumph for Trump; rather, he seems to have been outmaneuvered by adroit European diplomats.
column2: 但这并不是特朗普的胜利，相反，他似乎被欧洲外交官所智胜。

column1: It is always hard to know when Trump has actually changed a policy – or when he may change it again.
column2: 要弄清楚特朗普何时真正改变政策 — — 或者他何时再次改变 — — 向来很难。

column1: Still, it is worth noting that what Trump and Juncker announced was essentially a pledge to work toward exactly the kind of trade agreement that the Obama administration was negotiating with the Europeans from 2013 through the end of 2016.
column2: 尽管如此，值得注意，特朗普和容克所宣布的歧视是一项承诺：共同致力于奥巴马政府从2013年开始与欧洲谈判、一直谈到2016年的贸易协定。

column1: Work on that earlier version, known as the Transatlantic Trade and Investment Partnership (TTIP), was suspended following Trump’s inauguration.
column2: 此前的版本，即跨大西洋贸易和投资伙伴关系（TTIP ） ， 在特朗普上台后戛然而止。

column1: Restarting the TTIP negotiation is a big win for Juncker, in line with long-standing European objectives.
column2: 重启TTIP谈判对容克来说是一场大胜，符合欧洲的长期目标。

column1: It would also make it much harder for Trump to impose tariffs on European car imports – and German car companies’ stock prices rose sharply on the news.
column2: 这也使特朗普更加难以对欧洲汽车进口征收关税 — — 德国汽车公司股价也应声飙涨。

column1: It is also remarkable that Juncker managed to get Trump to emphasize working with the World Trade Organization to resolve issues regarding intellectual property rights.
column2: 还值得关注的是，容克成功地让特朗普强调与世贸组织合作解决知识产权权利相关的问题。

column1: Cecilia Malmström, the EU trade commissioner, has been stressing exactly this approach.
column2: 欧盟贸易委员塞西莉亚·马尔姆斯特伦（Cecilia Malmström）一直在强调这一方针。

column1: What did Trump get from the Europeans, other than a return to a trade negotiation straight out of the Obama era?
column2: 除了回归完全出自奥巴马时代的贸易谈判，特朗普还从欧洲得到了什么？

column1: Trump claimed, at the press conference and subsequently, that he won a pledge from Juncker to buy more natural gas and “a lot of soybeans.”
column2: 特朗普在记者招待会和随后宣称，他获得容克的承诺，要购买更多的天然气和“大量大豆 ” 。

column1: Some media coverage even suggested that the Europeans had made concessions.
column2: 一些媒体报道甚至表示，欧洲人做出了让步。

column1: But that interpretation does not fit the facts.
column2: 但这一解读不符合事实。

column1: Regarding potential US exports of liquefied natural gas (LNG) to Europe, the Europeans have long been keen to increase this trade.
column2: 在美国对欧洲的潜在液化天然气（LNG）出口问题上，欧洲人一直渴望促进这项贸易。

column1: The hold-up is US restrictions on energy exports.
column2: 障碍出在美国对能源出口的限制上。

column1: If there is any concession promised by the joint statement, it is from the Trump administration on this issue.
column2: 如果说联合声明中有什么让步的话，那也是特朗普政府在这个问题上做出了让步。

column1: This was made explicit in the fact sheet that the White House subsequently issued: “the United States will make it easier for the EU to purchase liquefied natural gas.”
column2: 白宫随后发布的情况说明证实了这一点 ： “ 美国将让欧盟更加方便地采购液化天然气 。 ”

column1: At the same time, Juncker does not buy soybeans – the European Commission has no such budget, and any such imports would ultimately be a private-sector decision.
column2: 与此同时，容克也没有买大豆 — — 欧盟没有这一预算，一切大豆进口交易说到底都是私人部门的决定。

column1: The price of soybeans has fallen sharply in recent months, owing to China’s imposition of tariffs on US soybeans, in retaliation to higher US tariffs on some Chinese exports.
column2: 最近几个月中，由于中国出于对美国提高一些中国出口产品的关税而对美国大豆征收关税，大豆价格急剧下跌。

column1: The price of US soybeans has fallen significantly more than has the price of Brazilian soybeans, as Brazil is not subject to the new Chinese tariff.
column2: 美国大豆的价格跌幅比巴西大豆还要大，因为巴西不受中国新关税政策影响。

column1: Given this, it makes sense that the European private sector will buy more US soybeans, regardless of what Juncker says or does.
column2: 因此，欧洲私人部门购买更多美国大豆是理性决定，不管容克说了或做了什么。

column1: US soybeans are already sold tariff-free in Europe, and, because China accounts for one-third of all US soybeans exports, there is plenty of product available.
column2: 美国大豆已经在欧洲实现免关税，而由于中国占了美国大豆出口量的三分之一，美国对欧大豆出口货源充足。

column1: But there was no European concession at the White House on this issue – just a clever restatement of market realities.
column2: 但在这个问题上，不存在欧洲对白宫的让步 — — 它只是对市场现实的明智声明。

column1: Furthermore, Europeans’ purchases of soybeans are less than a quarter of China’s.
column2: 此外，欧洲的大豆采购量还不到中国的四分之一。

column1: The soybean pledge has some superficial political appeal, as growers have found themselves caught in the crossfire of Trump’s trade war with China.
column2: 大豆承诺具有一些付钱的政治号召力，因为大豆种植者发现自己成了特朗普的对华贸易战的箭头。

column1: The cost is real, and the Trump administration recently promised up to $12 billion to help affected agribusinesses.
column2: 代价是实实在在的，特朗普政府最近也承诺拨款120美元帮助受影响的农业企业。

column1: However, this entire potential cost is due to the Trump administration’s disruptive policies and represents a scandalous waste of taxpayer money – an amount equal to about one-third of the entire annual budget of the US National Institutes of Health.
column2: 但是，全部潜在成本都要归因于特朗普政府的破坏性政策，也是对纳税人资金的可耻浪费 — — 其规模相当于美国国家卫生研究院（National Institutes of Health）年度总预算的三分之一。

column1: How many lives could be saved through the judicious use of that $12 billion for, say, public health programs?
column2: 如果能够合理地将这120亿美元应用于（比如）公共卫生计划的话，能够拯救多少生命？

column1: Meanwhile, the federal government’s budget deficit continues to increase – creating pressures for destructive future austerity.
column2: 与此同时，联邦政府的预算赤字在继续增加 — — 这造成了未来破坏性紧缩的压力。

column1: Trump holds himself out as a brilliant negotiator, and his supporters regard his trade policy as a perfect example of his success.
column2: 特朗普自视为出色的谈判家，他的支持者把他的贸易政策看成是他的成功的完美范例。

column1: But in his recent talks with the Europeans, Trump was clearly out of his depth.
column2: 但在最近与欧洲的谈判中，特朗普显然尽落下风。

column1: Europe’s Trade Coup
column2: 欧洲的贸易妙计

column1: BRUSSELS – All has gone quiet on the transatlantic trade front, with last month’s agreement between US President Donald Trump and European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker having dispelled fears of an all-out tariff war.
column2: 布鲁塞尔—跨大西洋贸易阵线上，一切静悄悄，上个月美国总统特朗普和欧盟委员会主席容克之间达成的协议打消了全方位关税战的担忧。

column1: The deal was surprising, but perhaps it shouldn’t have been.
column2: 该协议是一个惊喜，但也许并不应该如此。

column1: At the core of the agreement concluded by Juncker and Trump was the understanding that the European Union and the United States will “work together toward zero tariffs, zero non-tariff barriers, and zero subsidies on non-auto industrial goods,” with no new trade barriers in the meantime.
column2: 容克和特朗普所达成的协议的核心是欧盟和美国将“共同致力于非汽车工业产品零关税，零非关税壁垒和零补贴 ” ， 并不再制造新的贸易壁垒。

column1: But the potential for a free-trade agreement isn’t the point; what matters is the end to the escalation of tit-for-tat measures, set in motion by Trump’s decision to impose tariffs on US imports of European steel.
column2: 但自由贸易协定的潜力不在于此；重要的是因特朗普对美国进口品和欧洲钢铁征收关税的决定而引起的以牙还牙式升级的结束。

column1: The US president has the power to impose tariffs and other trade barriers unilaterally, in the interest of national security.
column2: 美国总统 有权单方面采取关税和其他贸易壁垒，只要符合国家利益。

column1: That is why Trump has been able to launch his own personal trade war, without so much as consulting the US Congress.
column2: 因此，特朗普能够发动自己的个人贸易战，而不必过多咨询美国国会。

column1: A full-scale trade agreement, however, would need congressional approval.
column2: 但全方位贸易协定需要国会批准。

column1: Given the myriad special interests that such a deal would mobilize, it is highly unlikely that any trade agreement – even one limited to industrial products – will materialize any time soon.
column2: 这样一个协议会牵扯到各种特殊利益集团，因此，在较短时期内，任何贸易协定都基本无法落实 — — 哪怕其范围只限于工业产品。

column1: Historically, the US has been able to conclude trade agreements only when a coalition of actors that would benefit from better export opportunities secured more votes than those who were vulnerable to import competition.
column2: 历史上，美国只有在多方行为人都能够从更好的出口条件中获益，从而确保能够获得比不愿看到进口竞争的人更多的选票的情况下，才能达成贸易协定。

column1: When trade is considered an economic issue, it is usually possible to assemble such a coalition, because the benefits of trade liberalization outweigh the costs.
column2: 当贸易被作为一个经济问题考虑时，就很容易形成多方获益联盟，因为贸易自由化的收益会大于成本。

column1: But this has often proved more difficult in the US than elsewhere, because trade plays a relatively small role in the US economy.
column2: 但这在美国往往比其他国家更难，因为贸易在美国经济中所扮演的角色相对较小。

column1: Goods exports may be Trump’s main focus, but the reality is that they account for less than 10% of GDP.
column2: 商品出口可能是特朗普的主要关注点，但现实是它们只占GDP的不到10 % 。

column1: Direct employment in exporting industries does not play a significant role in the US labor market.
column2: 出口行业的直接就业对于美国劳动力市场也无关紧要。

column1: In Europe, by contrast, exports account for more than 25% of GDP in most countries; in Germany, the figure exceeds 50%.
column2: 相反，欧洲大部分国家，出口占了GDP的25%以上；德国更是占了50%以上。

column1: When an economy is so dependent on trade, it becomes much easier to make the case for liberalization, which is why Europe has long been more enthusiastic than the US about a transatlantic free-trade agreement.
column2: 当一个经济体如此依赖贸易时，就会更容易接受自由化，正因如此，欧洲向来比美国更热衷于跨大西洋自由贸易协定。

column1: Negotiations for such an agreement – the Transatlantic Trade and Investment Partnership – stalled during President Barack Obama’s administration.
column2: 关于这样一个协定 — — 跨大西洋贸易和投资伙伴协定（TTIP ） — —的谈判在奥巴马总统执政期间陷入了停滞。

column1: Beyond the deal itself, Juncker apparently made a personal promise that the EU would buy more US agricultural products.
column2: 除了协议本身，容克显然还做出了一项个人承诺：欧盟将购买更多的美国农产品。

column1: This pledge is both empty and easy to fulfill.
column2: 这项承诺很空洞，也很容易实现。

column1: It is empty, because the European Commission has no budget to buy US soybeans or any means to impel EU consumers to do so.
column2: 说它空洞，是因为欧盟委员会没有预算购买美国大豆或采取任何手段迫使欧盟消费者这样做。

column1: It is easy to fulfill, because China has already imposed tariffs on US soybeans in retaliation for US tariffs on its exports, meaning that non-US soybean producers are now likely to shift their exports to the Chinese market, freeing up the EU market for US producers.
column2: 说它容易实现，是因为美国已对美国大豆征收关税，以作为美国对中国出口品征收关税的报复措施，这意味着非美国大豆种植户现在可以将转而对中国出口，释放出美国种植户的欧洲市场。

column1: The main impact of Chinese tariffs on US soybeans will thus be the redirection of global soybean flows.
column2: 因此，中国对美国大豆征收关税的主要影响是改变了全球大豆流向。

column1: But China’s role extends beyond soybeans.
column2: 但中国的角色不仅限于大豆。

column1: In fact, it is the trade dynamics with China that explain Trump’s willingness to reach an agreement with Juncker in the first place.
column2: 事实上，对华贸易动态可以解释特朗普为何愿意与容克达成协议。

column1: A tariff on imports to the US has a much greater impact if Chinese exporters are the only ones to encounter it.
column2: 对美国进口商品征收关税只针对中国出口商，那么其影响将大得多。

column1: A 25% duty on, say, aircraft engines from China would allow manufacturers elsewhere to gain market share, whereas if everyone had to pay the same tariff, the playing field would be unchanged.
column2: 比如，对来自中国的飞机发动机征收25%关税能够让世界其他国家的制造商赢得市场份额，而如果所有人都要付同样的关税，那么竞争环境并未改变。

column1: Ensuring that the EU does not face the same tariffs as China is particularly significant, because European suppliers are Chinese exporters’ main competitors in many industries.
column2: 确保欧盟不会面临与中国一样的关税意义尤其重大，因为欧盟供应商是中国出口商在许多行业内的主要竞争对手。

column1: Given that the EU also competes with the US in the Chinese market, European industry might actually gain (marginally) from a Sino-American trade war.
column2: 由于欧盟也需要和美国在中国市场上竞争，欧洲工业可能真能从中美贸易战中获取（边际）利益。

column1: So long as the US and China are battling it out on trade, the transatlantic truce represents a coup for Europe.
column2: 只要美国和中国在贸易问题上斗争，跨大西洋休战就是欧洲的妙计。

column1: The truce is not nearly as good for China.
column2: 休战对中国来说没有这么有用。

column1: While the country’s leaders have continued to pay lip service to free trade, they have so far proved unwilling to take into account the grievances of both the US and Europe.
column2: 中国领导人虽然口头上继续支持自由贸易，但到目前为止，他们并不愿意考虑美国和欧洲的怨气。

column1: If China wants allies in its trade war with the US, it will have to revise many domestic regulations and practices that constitute de facto discrimination against foreign competitors.
column2: 如果中国想要在与美国的贸易战中找到盟友，就必须大量修改构成针对外国竞争者的事实歧视的国内监管和做法。

column1: Thus, the EU-US deal has brought to the fore the real question China’s leaders face: whether to maintain strong government support for domestic industry.
column2: 因此，欧盟-美国协议将中国领导人面临的真正问题摆上了台面：是否保持政府对国内产业的强力支持。

column1: While protectionist measures might have been defensible 20 years ago, China’s economy is far more competitive today.
column2: 20年前，保护主义措施也许还有辩护的余地，但今天的中国竞争力早已非昨日可比。

column1: Whatever benefit China derives from such measures may well be outweighed by an escalating trade war– especially now that the EU is safe and China will have to face the US alone.
column2: 中国从这些措施中所得到的好处，很有可能大大低于贸易战升级所造成的损失 — — 特别是在欧盟已经安全，而中国需要独自面对美国的时候。

column1: How Much Europe Can Europe Tolerate?
column2: 欧洲可以容忍多少欧洲？

column1: CAMBRIDGE – This month the European Union will celebrate the 60th anniversary of its founding treaty, the Treaty of Rome, which established the European Economic Community.
column2: 坎布里奇—本月，欧盟将迎来其创始条约 — — 罗马条约签订60周年。 罗马条约建立了欧洲经济共同体。

column1: There certainly is much to celebrate.
column2: 当然，值得庆祝的方面很多。

column1: After centuries of war, upheaval, and mass killings, Europe is peaceful and democratic.
column2: 在经历了几个世纪的战争、动荡和大屠杀后，欧洲进入了和平与民主的时期。

column1: The EU has brought 11 former Soviet-bloc countries into its fold, successfully guiding their post-communist transitions.
column2: 欧盟将11个前苏联国家纳入它的阵营，成功地指引了它们的后共产主义转型。

column1: And, in an age of inequality, EU member countries exhibit the lowest income gaps anywhere in the world.
column2: 而在不平等性的时代，欧盟成员国的收入差距是全世界最小的。

column1: But these are past achievements.
column2: 但这些都是过去的成就。

column1: Today, the Union is mired in a deep existential crisis, and its future is very much in doubt.
column2: 如今，欧盟陷入了深刻的生存危机，其未来也颇可怀疑。

column1: The symptoms are everywhere: Brexit, crushing levels of youth unemployment in Greece and Spain, debt and stagnation in Italy, the rise of populist movements, and a backlash against immigrants and the euro.
column2: 症候随处可见：英国退欧、希腊和西班牙畸高的年轻人失业率、意大利的债务和停滞、民粹主义运动兴起，还有对移民和欧元的攻讦。

column1: They all point to the need for a major overhaul of Europe’s institutions.
column2: 所有这些都表明，欧洲的制度需要一场大修。

column1: So a new white paper on the future of Europe by European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker comes none too soon.
column2: 因此，欧盟委员会主席容克新发布的欧洲未来白皮书可谓正逢其时。

column1: Juncker sets out five possible paths: carrying on with the current agenda, focusing just on the single market, allowing some countries to move faster than others toward integration, narrowing down the agenda, and pushing ambitiously for uniform and more complete integration.
column2: 容克提出了五条可能的道路：坚持当前日程；只关注单一市场；允许其中一些国家比其他国家更快地走向一体化；精简日程；以及坚定推进统一和更全面的一体化。

column1: It’s hard not to feel sympathy for Juncker.
column2: 你很难不与容克感同身受。

column1: With Europe’s politicians preoccupied with their domestic battles and the EU institutions in Brussels a target for popular frustration, he could stick his neck out only so far.
column2: 欧洲政客被国内斗争缠住，难以分心，布鲁斯尔的欧盟机构成为群众失望的针对目标，因此，他只能昂首坚持到这一步。

column1: Still, his report is disappointing.
column2: 尽管如此，他的报告仍然令人失望。

column1: It sidesteps the central challenge that the EU must confront and overcome.
column2: 它回避了欧盟必须面临和克服的核心挑战。

column1: If European democracies are to regain their health, economic and political integration cannot remain out of sync.
column2: 欧洲民主国家想要恢复健康，就必须同步进行经济和政治一体化。

column1: Either political integration catches up with economic integration, or economic integration needs to be scaled back.
column2: 要么政治一体化赶上经济一体化，要么经济一体化退步匹配政治一体化。

column1: As long as this decision is evaded, the EU will remain dysfunctional.
column2: 这个决定一天不做出，欧盟就会保持一天混乱。

column1: When confronted with this stark choice, member states are likely to end up in different positions along the continuum of economic-political integration.
column2: 面临如此艰难的选择，欧盟成员国可能根据各自在政治-经济一体化连续统（continuum）中所处的位置而采取不同的立场。

column1: This implies that Europe must develop the flexibility and institutional arrangements to accommodate them.
column2: 这意味着欧洲必须形成灵活性和制度安排来协调它们。

column1: From the very beginning, Europe was built on a “functionalist” argument: political integration would follow economic integration.
column2: 从一开始，欧洲就建立在“功能论”的基础上：先经济一体化，再政治一体化。

column1: Juncker’s white paper opens appropriately with a 1950 quote from the European Economic Community founder (and French prime minister) Robert Schuman: “Europe will not be made all at once, or according to a single plan.
column2: 容克的白皮书在一开始恰如其分地引用了1950年欧洲共同体创始人（兼法国总理）罗伯特·舒曼（Robert Schuman）的话 ： “ 欧洲不是一天建成的，也不是根据一个计划建成的。

column1: It will be built through concrete achievements which first create a de facto solidarity.”
column2: 它需要经过扎实的成就简称，首先就是要建立事实上的凝聚力 。 ”

column1: Build the mechanisms of economic cooperation first, and this will prepare the ground for common political institutions.
column2: 先建立经济合作机制，从而为共同政治机构打好基础。

column1: This approach worked fine at first.
column2: 一开始，这一方针效果显著。

column1: It enabled economic integration to remain one step ahead of political integration – but not too far ahead.
column2: 它让经济一体化一直领先政治一体化一步，而又不至于过于领先。

column1: Then, after the 1980s, the EU took a leap into the unknown.
column2: 接着，到了20世纪80年代后，欧盟跃入了未知领域。

column1: It adopted an ambitious single-market agenda that aimed to unify Europe’s economies, whittling away at national policies that hampered the free movement not just of goods, but also of services, people, and capital. The euro, which established a single currency among a subset of member states, was the logical extension of this agenda.
column2: 它采取了一个雄心勃勃的单一市场日程，旨在统一欧洲各经济体，削平阻碍不仅仅是商品、也包括服务、人力和资本的自由流动的国家政策，于是，由部分成员国组成的共同货币区作为这一日程的应有之义而应运而生。

column1: This was hyper-globalization on a European scale.
column2: 这就是欧洲规模上的超全球化。

column1: The new agenda was driven by a confluence of factors.
column2: 新日程受多种因素合力的推动。

column1: Many economists and technocrats thought Europe’s governments had become too interventionist and that deep economic integration and a single currency would discipline the state.
column2: 许多经济学家和技术官僚认为欧洲各国政府过于干预主义，深刻的经济一体化和单一货币能在纪律上约束国家。

column1: From this perspective, the imbalance between the economic and political legs of the integration process was a feature, not a bug.
column2: 从这个角度出发，经济和政治一体化进程的失衡是一个特征，而不是一个缺陷。

column1: Many politicians, however, recognized that the imbalance was potentially problematic.
column2: 但是，许多政客认为这一失衡可能大有问题。

column1: But they assumed functionalism would eventually come to the rescue: the quasi-federal political institutions needed to underpin the single market would develop, given sufficient time.
column2: 但他们认为功能论最终能够力挽狂澜：只要时间足够，单一市场所需要的准联邦政治制度基础是可以发展出来的。

column1: The leading European powers played their part.
column2: 欧洲领导力量起到了作用。

column1: The French thought that shifting economic authority to bureaucrats in Brussels would enhance French national power and global prestige.
column2: 法国认为将经济大权让渡给布鲁塞尔的官僚能加强法国的国家实力和全球地位。

column1: The Germans, eager to gain France’s agreement to German reunification, went along.
column2: 德国渴望法国首肯其重新统一，对法国亦步亦趋。

column1: There was an alternative.
column2: 也曾有过其他道路。

column1: Europe could have allowed a common social model to develop alongside economic integration.
column2: 欧洲原本可以让随着经济一体化发展一个共同社会模式。

column1: This would have required integrating not only markets but also social policies, labor-market institutions, and fiscal arrangements.
column2: 这不但需要市场的一体化，还需要社会政策、劳动力市场制度和财政安排的一体化。

column1: The diversity of social models across Europe, and the difficulty of reaching agreement on common rules, would have acted as a natural brake on the pace and scope of integration.
column2: 整个欧洲社会模式的多元化，以及就共同规则达成一致的困难性，将成为一体化的节奏和范围的天然“刹车 ” 。

column1: Far from being a disadvantage, this would have provided a useful corrective regarding the most desirable speed and extent of integration.
column2: 这绝不是劣势，而是将提供很有用的纠错，以实现一体化最恰当的速度和程度。

column1: The result might have been a smaller EU, more deeply integrated across the board, or an EU with as many members as today, but much less ambitious in its economic scope.
column2: 结果可能是一个范围更小的欧盟，但一体化程度更加深化；或者一个成员数量和今天一样多的欧盟，但经济范围远远没有现在那么宏大。

column1: Today it may be too late to attempt EU fiscal and political integration.
column2: 时至今日，尝试欧盟财政和政治一体化或许已经太迟。

column1: Less than one in five Europeans favor shifting power away from the member nation-states.
column2: 只有不到五分之一的欧洲人支持民族国家成员国让渡权力。

column1: Optimists might say that this is due less to aversion to Brussels or Strasbourg per se than to the public’s association of “more Europe” with a technocratic focus on the single market and the absence of an appealing alternative model.
column2: 乐观者会说，这是与其说是因为厌恶布鲁塞尔或斯特拉斯堡本身，毋宁说是因为公众结成了一个“更加欧洲”的联盟，它有一个技术官僚的重点：单一市场和缺少有吸引力的替代模式。

column1: Perhaps emerging new leaders and political formations will manage to sketch out such a model and generate excitement about a reformed European project.
column2: 也许新出现的领导者和政治形式能够制定这样一个模式，并激发人们对改革欧洲工程的热情。

column1: Pessimists, on the other hand, will hope that in the corridors of power in Berlin and Paris, in some deep, dark corner, economists and lawyers are secretly readying a plan B to deploy for the day when loosening the economic union can no longer be postponed.
column2: 另一方面，悲观者将希望，在柏林和巴黎的权力走廊中，在某个深藏的阴暗角落，经济学家和律师们正在秘密准备一套B计划，等着在经济联盟的解体变得无法阻挡的时候使出。

column1: Making Sense of China’s Growth Model
column2: 理解中国增长模式

column1: SHANGHAI – Although China’s economy has expanded at a staggering pace over the last three decades, its growth model is now widely agreed to be exhausted.
column2: 上海—尽管中国经济在过去三十年来扩张迅猛，但如今人们广泛认为其增长模式已经达到了极限。

column1: Even China’s top leadership acknowledges the need for change – a belief that culminated in the far-reaching reform agenda presented two months ago at the Third Plenum of the Chinese Communist Party’s 18th Central Committee.
column2: 中国最高领导层也承认需要做出改变 — — 这一信念在十八大三中全会后所发布的意义深远的改革计划中尽显无疑。

column1: While not everyone agrees on exactly what the new growth model should look like, proposals do not differ drastically, given the prevailing consensus that the current model rests on an unsustainable foundation.
column2: 对于新增长模式的具体内容，人们还有一些分歧，但各种方案之间并无剧烈差异，因为当前模式建立在不可持续的基础之上已成为压倒性共识。

column1: On the demand side, many economists endorse a shift from investment-led to consumption-driven growth.
column2: 在需求端，许多经济学家认为应该从投资拉动转变为消费驱动型增长。

column1: Even more popular is the supply-side recommendation of a shift from extensive to intensive growth – that is, from a model based on capital accumulation to one propelled by gains in efficiency, measured by total factor productivity (TFP).
column2: 供给端的建议更是毫无异议 — — 从粗放型增长转变为集约型增长，即从基于资本积累的模式转变效率推动模式。 效率的衡量标准则是全要素生产率（TFP ） 。

column1: These recommendations are presumably influenced by Paul Krugman’s criticism in 1994 of Soviet-style extensive growth in East Asian economies (especially Singapore).
column2: 这些建议大概是受到了保罗·克鲁格曼（Paul Krugman）1994年对东亚经济体（特别是新加坡）的苏联式粗放型增长的批评的影响。

column1: At the time, Jeffery Sachs disagreed, asserting that the East Asian model included far more efficient market-based investment allocation than the Soviet model did, and thus was unique; nonetheless, the criticism stuck.
column2: 当时，杰弗里·萨克斯（Jeffery Sachs）提出过异议，他认为东亚模式的效率远胜于苏联模式的、因为在前者，市场分配投资要比计划者分配投资有效率的多；尽管如此，萨克斯仍遭到了诟病。

column1: It was not long before some Chinese economists began to categorize the growth pattern brought about three decades ago by Deng Xiaoping’s reforms as “extensive” – and thus problematic.
column2: 克鲁格曼的文章发表不久，一些中国经济学家开始将大约三十年前由邓小平改革带来的增长模式归类为“粗放型 ” ， 因而认定它有问题。

column1: A consensus has gradually emerged around this idea, with calls for a shift toward intensive, efficiency-driven growth intensifying since China’s GDP growth began to slow in 2011.
column2: 在这一观点周围逐渐形成了一种共识，呼吁向集约型、效率推动型增长转变，这一呼声在2011年中国GDP增长出现减速后更加高涨了。

column1: But empirical research reveals a fundamental problem with this argument: China’s TFP has grown at an average annual rate of nearly 4% since Deng’s reforms began.
column2: 但实证研究表明这一观点存在一个根本性的自相矛盾之处：自邓小平改革开始以来，中国TFP平均年增长率达到了近4 % 。

column1: If the United States’ economy, with a TFP growth rate of only 1-2% annually, is considered efficiency-driven, why is China’s not?
column2: 如果TFP年增长率只有1—2%的美国经济可认为是效率推动型，为什么中国不是？

column1: More important, if China’s TFP growth is expected to slow, as major drivers like the convergence effect wane, what does it mean to say that efficiency gains should propel China’s future growth?
column2: 更重要的是，如果随着趋同效应等主要推动力的减弱，预期中国未来的TFP增长将减缓而不是更高，那么说中国未来的增长要从因素驱动转变为主要由效率驱动该是什么意思呢？

column1: Consider the facts.
column2: 我们来看看事实。

column1: A conservative assessment by Louis Kuijs, working with the World Bank, shows that, from 1978 to 1994, China’s GDP grew by an average of 9.9% annually, labor productivity increased by 6.4%, TFP rose by 3%, and the capital-labor ratio increased by 2.9%.
column2: 世界银行的路易斯·库伊斯（Louis Kuijs）指出，从1978年到1994年，中国平均每年GDP增长9.9 % ， 劳动生产率增加6.4 % ， TFP提高3 % ， 劳动-资本比率增加2.9 % 。

column1: In the period from 1994 to 2009, annual GDP growth averaged 9.6%, labor productivity increased by 8.6%, TFP increased by 2.7%, and the capital-labor ratio rose by 5.5%.
column2: 从1994年到2009年，平均每年GDP增长9.6 % ， 劳动生产率增加8.6 % ， TFP提高2.7 % ， 资本-劳动比率增加5.5 % 。

column1: Similarly, Dwight Perkins and Tom Rawski found that from 1978 to 2005, China’s GDP grew by 9.5%, while capital investment grew by 9.6%, contributing 44.7% to GDP.
column2: 类似地，德怀特·珀金斯（Dwight Perkins）和汤姆·罗斯基（Tom Rawski）发现，从1978年到2005年，中国GDP年增长率为9.5 % ， 而资本投资增长率为9.6 % ， 贡献了44.7%的GDP增长。

column1: The share of tertiary graduates in the labor force rose to 2.7% by 2005, accounting for 16.2% of GDP growth.
column2: 2005年，拥有大学学历的劳动力占比增加到2.7 % ， 贡献了16.2%的GDP增长。

column1: And TFP grew by 3.8%, adding 40.1% to GDP growth.
column2: TFP增长率为3.8 % ， 贡献了40.1%的GDP增长。

column1: While capital has been the largest contributor to China’s GDP, the economy’s TFP performance has been impressive – something that cannot be explained by an extensive growth pattern.
column2: 资本是中国GDP增长率的最大贡献因素，这毋庸置疑。 但中国经济的TFP表现也令人印象深刻 — — 而这一现象却是无法用粗放型增长模式解释的。

column1: Indeed, Japan’s rate of TFP growth never reached such high levels, even at the country’s economic peak.
column2: 事实上，日本的TFP增长率即使在经济高峰期也从未达到过如此高的水平。

column1: Even Hong Kong – the East Asian economy with the best TFP performance – registered only 2.4% average annual TFP growth from 1960 to 1990.
column2: 甚至在东亚经济体中TFP表现最为出色的香港在1960年到1990年期间的平均年TFP增长率也只有2.4 % 。

column1: But annual TFP growth is not the only relevant figure. China’s TFP has contributed 35-40% to GDP growth, compared to an estimated 20-30% in East Asia’s “four tigers” (Hong Kong, Singapore, South Korea, and Taiwan).
column2: 而且，中国的TFP贡献了35—40%的GDP增长，而东亚“四小龙 ” （ 香港、新加坡、韩国和台湾）的这一比例估计只有20—30 % 。

column1: As for the Soviet Union, even in its best years, TFP accounted for only about 10% of GDP growth.
column2: 至于苏联，即使在最佳年份，TFP也只贡献了GDP增长的10%左右。

column1: Though China’s TFP contribution to GDP growth is much greater than in the other so-called “extensive” economies, it remains well below levels in the intensive US economy, where the figure exceeds 80% – a divergence that some might use to justify their refusal to define China’s economy as “efficiency-driven.”
column2: 有人可以质疑说，中国的TFP对GDP增长的贡献尽管远高于其他所谓的“粗放型”经济体，但仍低于集约型的美国经济。 美国经济的这一比例超过80 % — —有人或许会援引这一差异证明不能将中国经济归类为“效率驱动型”是合理的。

column1: But this argument ignores the fact that China has been experiencing double-digit annual GDP growth, owing largely to capital expansion, while America’s annual GDP growth has averaged only 2-3%.
column2: 但这一观点忽略了一个事实，即中国一直保持着两位数的GDP年增长率，而美国的年增长率平均只有2—3 % 。

column1: If transforming China’s growth pattern were simply a matter of increasing TFP’s contribution to GDP to US levels, China’s annual GDP growth would have to drop to below 5% – three percentage points lower than its potential growth rate.
column2: 如果那些希望中国增长模式转型的人只是希望让中国的TFP对GDP的贡献份额增加到美国的水平，那么中国年GDP增长率就应该降到5%以下 — — 比其潜在增长率低三个百分点。

column1: Given 8% GDP growth, TFP would have to grow 6.4% annually.
column2: 不然的话，若GDP增长率为8 % ， 则TFP必须每年提高6.4 % ， 从而使得TFP对GDP增长的贡献率达到80%的水平。

column1: This is almost certainly impossible, owing to the gradual diminution of the major drivers – including market-oriented economic reforms, the convergence effect on per capita income, and the adoption of foreign technologies – of China’s extraordinary TFP growth over the last 30 years.
column2: 但这几乎是不可能的任务，因为过去三十多年卓越TFP增长表现的主要发动机 — — 包括市场经济改革、人均收入的趋同效应和吸纳外国技术等 — — 在逐渐失去动力。

column1: All of this raises a simple question: Do extensive- or intensive-growth models really exist?
column2: 所有这些引出了一个简单问题：粗放型和集约型增长模式真的存在吗？

column1: Perhaps there is only fast versus slow, or extraordinary versus ordinary.
column2: 也许这只不过是快与慢、卓越与平庸之间的差别。

column1: According to this view, if a developing economy can realize extraordinary growth, it must be because it offers greater opportunities for capital expansion than a developed economy.
column2: 根据这一观点，如果某个发展中经济体实现了卓越的增长表现，其原因一定是它提供了比发达经济体更好的资本扩张机会。

column1: After all, investment opportunity is inversely proportional to per capita capital stock.
column2: 毕竟，投资机会与人均资本存量水平呈现反比关系。

column1: On this point, Krugman is right: such investment-fueled growth is achieved largely through perspiration, rather than inspiration.
column2: 在这一点上，克鲁格曼是正确的：如此投资驱动的增长大体上是通过汗水，而不是灵感实现的。

column1: But so what?
column2: 但那又怎么样？

column1: The fact that some of Asia’s most dynamic economies – including China, Japan, and the four tigers (Hong Kong, Singapore, South Korea, and Taiwan) – have experienced investment-propelled growth and improvements in TFP simultaneously can be explained by the fact that TFP gains increase investment returns, accelerating capital expansion further.
column2: 一些亚洲最有活力的经济体 — — 包括中国、日本和四小龙 — — 同时经历了投资驱动的增长和TFP改善，这一事实可以用TFP的改善提高了投资回报、进一步加速了资本扩张这一事实来解释。

column1: Though further analysis is needed to elucidate the long-term relationship between capital expansion and TFP, it is clear that the long-accepted theory that they cannot co-exist is seriously flawed.
column2: 尽管我们需要更进一步的分析澄清资本扩张和TFP之间的长期关系，但显然人们长期所接受的它们不可以共存的理论有严重缺陷。

column1: In short, when it comes to Asian economies, the dichotomy of extensive and intensive growth is a red herring.
column2: 简而言之，对于亚洲经济体，粗放增长和集约增长的二分法纯属刻舟求剑。

column1: A far more meaningful consideration is what drove these TFP gains; understanding that would enable China’s leaders to design a more effective plan for strengthening the economy’s long-term growth prospects.
column2: 更有意义的是考察什么推动了TFP增长，明白这一点这有助于中国领导人设计出更有效地增强中国经济长期前景的计划。

column1: Li’s Balancing Act
column2: 李克强的平衡手法

column1: SHANGHAI – Three years of persistent economic slowdown have rattled Chinese economists and policymakers.
column2: 上海—三年的持续经济减速让中国经济学家和决策者有些乱了方寸。

column1: Financial analysts are in a tizzy over whether GDP growth will fall below 7%, parsing official statements for clues as to whether and when the government will act.
column2: 金融分析师对于GDP增长是否会降到7%以下十分紧张，试图在官方陈述中挖掘政府是否会采取行动的蛛丝马迹。

column1: The government’s financial viziers seem none too alarmed.
column2: 政府财政部门似乎并没有感到多少警觉。

column1: Beneath this cool exterior, however, China’s leaders are very worried indeed.
column2: 但是，在平静的表面下，中国领导人实际上是相当忧虑的。

column1: As Liu Shijin, Vice Minister of the Development Research Center of the State Council, recently explained, the dilemma facing the authorities is that another massive stimulus plan to boost growth would mean more outstanding credit – a problematic approach, given the enormous debt and financial risks that local governments have accumulated.
