column2: 国务院发展研究中心副主任刘世锦最近解释说，当局面临的困难是再次实施大规模刺激计划提振增长将导致更多的未偿还信用 — — 考虑到地方政府已经积累了巨大的债务和金融风险，这一方法是有问题的。

column1: But an excessively sluggish economy poses its own risks.
column2: 但经济过度停滞不前也会带来风险。

column1: To be sure, China’s government was in a similar situation ten years ago.
column2: 平心而论，中国政府的处境与十年前有些相似。

column1: But the economy today is not performing as it was a decade ago.
column2: 但如今的经济表现不如十年前。

column1: China needs new solutions.
column2: 中国需要新办法。

column1: To varying degrees, China’s economy has long swung from short-term growth spurts, fueled by the over-issuance of currency and conventional credit expansion, to contraction, triggered by government action to prevent overheating.
column2: 从某种程度上说，中国经济早已从受货币超发和常规信用扩张刺激的短期增长井喷转变为由政府抑制过热的措施引发的收缩。

column1: Once the risks are under control, the government gradually restores growth-oriented policies.
column2: 一旦风险得到控制，政府会逐渐恢复增长导向政策。

column1: This “prosperity cycle” – sustained by the abundance of new investment opportunities that were available to neutralize mounting debt and financial risks – has long enabled China to avoid a hard landing.
column2: 长期以来，这一“繁荣周期 ” — —通过充足易得的新投资机会将日益积累的债务和金融风险中性化 — — 让中国得以避免硬着陆。

column1: A decade ago, when China was fighting deflation, the World Trade Organization came to its rescue, opening up massive new export markets.
column2: 十年前，中国的主要问题是通缩，世界贸易组织打开了巨大的新出口市场,成了中国的救星。

column1: More important, the huge dividend of the just-launched domestic housing reform had yet to pay off.
column2: 更重要的是，刚刚启动的国内住房改革还有巨大的红利可供收割。

column1: The resulting surge of new investment opportunities diminished the risks posed by idle capital and risky debt, while driving increases in investment efficiency and labor productivity.
column2: 由此带来的新投资机会的大量涌现抑制了闲置资本和高风险债务带来的风险，同时也推动了投资效率和劳动生产率的提高。

column1: But the latest round of deflation-fighting policies, together with the massive stimulus package that the government launched in the wake of the global economic crisis, has led to oversupply in the housing market and idle capital in the manufacturing sector.
column2: 但最近的反通缩政策加上政府在全球经济危机时所采取的大规模刺激计划导致了房地产市场的供给过度和制造业的闲置资本。

column1: Making matters worse, demand for Chinese exports in Europe and the United States has weakened considerably, and is not expected to rebound.
column2: 更糟糕的是，欧洲和美国对中国出口的需求大幅降低，并且在中长期看起来也反弹无望。

column1: All of this has diminished short-term investment opportunities in China, raising fears of a hard landing.
column2: 所有这些都抑制了中国的短期投资机会的出现，引起了硬着陆之忧。

column1: Of course, China still boasts tremendous investment potential in the long term, especially given the relatively low urbanization rate and the need for structural reform and industrial upgrading.
column2: 当然，从长期看，中国仍有巨大的投资潜力，特别是考虑到其相对较低的城镇化率以及结构性改革和产业升级的需要。

column1: In the interim, however, Premier Li Keqiang’s government must achieve a prudent balance between economic growth and financial risk.
column2: 但是，在中期，李克强总理的政府必须在经济增长和金融风险之间取得审慎的平衡。

column1: To that end, the government has adjusted its policy target from “economic recovery” to “growth stabilization,” expressing its willingness to accept declining GDP growth up to a certain point – probably 7%, or even lower – in order to keep financial risk under control.
column2: 在这方面，政府的政策目标已从“经济复苏”转为“稳增长 ” ， 表现出接受GDP增长降到一定程度 — — 可能是7%甚至更低 — — 以保持金融风险可控的意愿。

column1: But the balance itself is not the goal.
column2: 但平衡本身并非目标。

column1: In Li’s view, what the government really needs to do is buy time for structural adjustment and reform, which are critical to generating the next wave of investment opportunities.
column2: 在李克强看来，政府真正需要做的是为结构性调整和改革赢得时间，而后两者又是创造新一轮投资机会的关键。

column1: Li has even adopted a structural approach to stimulating economic growth.
column2: 李克强甚至在刺激经济增长的问题上持有结构性观点。

column1: For example, the mini-stimulus package that was unveiled last month diverts investment to railroads, agriculture, the smart grid, and other productive services.
column2: 比如，上个月实施的微刺激方案以铁路、农业、智能电网和其他生产性服务为投资目标。

column1: But maintaining this balance will not be easy.
column2: 但维持这一平衡并不容易。

column1: The first challenge will be to ensure that the real-estate market progresses into the adjustment and clearance phases.
column2: 第一个挑战是确保房地产市场向调整和清理阶段平稳发展。

column1: This will require cautious but continuous policy action.
column2: 这需要谨慎而持续的政策动作。

column1: The good news is that many local governments have recently loosened their grip on local real-estate markets, most likely following a central-government directive.
column2: 好消息是，许多地方政府已开始放松对本地房地产市场的控制，这很有可能是遵照了中央政府的指示。

column1: This could be the start of a virtuous circle, with price adjustments helping to clear up stock.
column2: 这或许是良性循环的开端，让价格调整帮助出清存货。

column1: The movement of the housing market into a clearance phase, without causing a panic or collapsing, would be a crowning achievement for Li’s tenure.
column2: 房地产市场向清理阶段运行而不引起恐慌或崩溃将是李克强执政生涯的一大成就。

column1: Another major challenge is managing credit risk.
column2: 另一个主要挑战是管理信用风险。

column1: This will require policies that reduce the rate of credit expansion, without putting so much pressure on local governments and state-owned enterprises that they turn to off-balance-sheet credit and the shadow-banking sector.
column2: 这需要能降低信用扩张速度的政策，并且不能给地方政府和国有企业太大压力导致它们转向表外信用和影子银行。

column1: Moreover, the government must revitalize the stock of local-government assets and credit by securitizing these portfolios.
column2: 此外，政府必须盘活地方政府资产存量和信用，这可以通过将其投资组合证券化实现。

column1: The problem is that China’s domestic capital market remains underdeveloped, owing to administrative restrictions, a non-diverse structure, and a lack of innovation – all of which means that progress in the short term is unlikely.
column2: 问题在于，拜行政限制、结构多元化不足和缺乏创新所赐，中国国内证券市场仍欠发达，而这三大问题在短期都很难取得进展。

column1: This highlights the need for structural reforms aimed at creating a more efficient, open, and competitive capital market, commensurate with the size of the economy.
column2: 这就凸显出旨在创造更有效、更开放、更具竞争性的、与经济规模相称的资本市场的结构性改革的必要。

column1: This would facilitate the production of innovative financial products, link monetary policy more closely with capital markets, and allow fixed assets to become liquid (and vice versa).
column2: 结构性改革有利于产生创新金融产品、加强货币政策与资本市场的联系、增加存货资产的流动性（反之亦然 ） 。

column1: A multi-tiered capital market and diverse financial products can help to free China from its excessive dependence on credit.
column2: 长期而言，多层次资本市场和多元化金融产品有助于让中国摆脱对信用的过度依赖。

column1: But that will require change in the way that the Chinese government manages the macroeconomy.
column2: 但这需要中国政府改变宏观经济管理模式。

column1: And that is a story for another day.
column2: 这是未来金融改革的重点。

column1: China’s Untapped Growth Potential
column2: 中国增长潜力未竟

column1: SHANGHAI – China’s economic slowdown, from a nearly 10% annual output gain in 2007 to below 8% today, has fueled widespread speculation about the economy’s growth potential.
column2: 上海—中国年产出增长率从2007年的近10%下降到如今的8 % ， 经济的减速让关于中国经济增长潜力的猜测四起。

column1: While it is impossible to predict China’s future growth trajectory, understanding the economy’s underlying trends is the best way to derive a meaningful estimate.
column2: 预测中国未来增长轨迹是不可能的，但理解中国经济的基本趋势是进行有意义的估计的最佳方法。

column1: Whereas short-term demand largely dictates an economy’s real growth rate, its potential growth rate is determined on the supply side.
column2: 短期需求大致上表明了一个经济体的实际增长率，但其潜在增长率由供给面决定。

column1: Some economists – citing indicators like investment ratios, industrial value-added, and employment – compare China to Japan in the early 1970’s.
column2: 一些经济学家引用投资比率、工业增加值和就业等指标比较中国和20世纪70年代初的日本。

column1: After more than two decades of sustained rapid growth, Japan’s economy slackened considerably in 1971, leading to four decades of annual growth rates averaging less than 4%.
column2: 1971年，在经历了二十多年的持续快速增长后，日本经济显著地放缓了脚步，此后四十年，年均增长率不到4 % 。

column1: This correlation is reinforced by the convergence hypothesis – the benchmark theory for estimating an economy’s potential growth rate – which states that a rapidly growing developing economy’s real growth rate will slow when it reaches a certain share of the per capita capital stock and income of an advanced economy.
column2: 趋同假说 — — 估算一国经济潜在增长率的基本理论 — — 认为快速增长的发展中经济体的实际增长率会在其人均资本存量和收入达到发达经济体的一定比例时出现放缓。 这一假说加强了这一相关性。

column1: According to the economists Barry Eichengreen, Donghyun Park, and Kwanho Shin, that share is about 60% of America’s per capita income (at 2005 international prices).
column2: 根据经济学家巴里·艾肯格林（Barry Eichengreen ） 、 朴东炫（Donghyun Park）和康镐炫（Kwanho Shin）的研究，这一比例大约是美国人均收入的60 % （ 以2005年国际价格计算 ） 。

column1: At first glance, the experiences of Asia’s most advanced economies – Japan and the four “Asian Tigers” (Hong Kong, Singapore, South Korea, and Taiwan) – seem to be consistent with this theory.
column2: 乍一看，亚洲最发达经济体 — — 日本和“亚洲四小龙 ” （ 香港、新加坡、韩国和台湾 ） — —都符合这一理论。

column1: In 1971-1973, Japan’s per capita GDP fell to roughly 65% of that of the United States in purchasing-power-parity terms, while the Asian Tigers experienced economic downturns of varying degrees when they reached roughly the same income level relative to Japan.
column2: 1971—1973年，按购买力平价计算的日本人均GDP落在美国的65%左右，而亚洲四小龙也在到达相对日本的类似收入水平时经历了不同程度的经济放缓。

column1: But Eichengreen, Park, and Shin also found that once this income level is reached, annual growth rates tend to fall by no more than two percentage points.
column2: 但艾肯格林、朴东炫和康镐炫还发现，一旦收入水平达到这一水平，年增长率的下降一般不会超过两个百分点。

column1: This means that GDP growth should have slowed gradually in Japan after 1971, instead of plummeting by more than 50%.
column2: 这意味着日本GDP增长应该在1971年后逐渐放缓，而不应该大幅降低超过50 % 。

column1: Likewise, given the remaining income gap with the US, the Asian Tigers should have grown faster than they have in the last two decades.
column2: 类似地，亚洲四小龙与美国仍然存在收入差距，因此在过去二十年中，它们本应增长得更快。

column1: But they each suffered a substantial slowdown (albeit less sharp than Japan’s).
column2: 但所有四小龙都经历了大幅放缓（尽管没有日本那么剧烈 ） 。

column1: These inconsistencies can be explained by external shocks – a point emphasized by Hideo Kobayashi in his book Post-War Japanese Economy and Southeast Asia.
column2: 这些不一致可以用外部冲击来解释 — — 小林英夫（Hideo Kobayashi）的著作《战后日本经济和东南亚 》 （ Post-War Japanese Economy and Southeast Asia）强调了这一点。

column1: During Japan’s economic boom, its total factor productivity (TFP, or the efficiency with which inputs are used) contributed about 40% to GDP growth.
column2: 在日本经济繁荣期，其全要素生产率（TFP，或投入的使用效率）贡献了40%的GDP增长。

column1: When growth plummeted, TFP fell even faster – a dramatic change that was clearly linked to the 1971 yen appreciation and the 1973 oil crisis.
column2: 当增长大幅降速时，TFP下降得更快 — — 这一戏剧性变化显然与1971年日元升值和1973年石油危机有关。

column1: From a microeconomic perspective, a sudden exchange-rate shock and sharp increase in oil prices impedes firms’ ability to adjust their technology and production methods to meet new cost conditions, eventually undermining TFP growth.
column2: 从微观经济学角度看，突发汇率冲击和石油价格暴涨妨碍了企业调整技术和生产方式从而适应新的成本条件的能力，最终伤害了TFP增长。

column1: Such a cost shock has a more prolonged effect than a negative demand shock.
column2: 这样的成本冲击具有比消极需求冲击更长的影响期。

column1: Without negative external shocks, exorbitant TFP growth would have declined gradually, as the returns from institutional adjustment, reallocation of resources, and technological catch-up naturally diminished, in accordance with the convergence hypothesis.
column2: 根据趋同假说，制度调整、资源再配置和技术赶超的回报会自然衰减，因此，如果没有消极外部冲击，过高的TFP增长会逐渐下降。

column1: External shocks also explain China’s GDP slowdown since 2007.
column2: 外部冲击还解释了中国GDP在2007年之后的减速。

column1: The renminbi’s gradual yet sustained appreciation against the US dollar is the cost shock’s main driver, but the demand shock that followed the 2008 global financial crisis aggravated the situation.
column2: 人民币逐渐而持续的对美元升值是成本冲击的主要推动力，但随2008年金融危机到来的需求冲击加重了困局。

column1: It is likely that TFP has declined substantially as China’s economy has slowed in response to these shocks.
column2: 有可能中国经济因为这些冲击而出现的减速导致了TFP大幅下降。

column1: Unlike Keynesians, who focus on demand shocks, followers of the Austrian economist Joseph Schumpeter view cost shocks as important potential catalysts for structural reform and industrial upgrading – both of which are needed to avoid falling into a low-growth rut in the long term.
column2: 与关注需求冲击的凯恩斯主义者不同，美国经济学家约瑟夫·熊彼特（Joseph Schumacher）的追随者认为成本冲击是结构性改革和产业升级的重要潜在催化剂，而结构性改革和产业升级又是避免陷入长期低增长陷阱之必须。

column1: In the short term, a cost shock devastates some economic activities, forcing companies either to shut down or move on to another line of business.
column2: 在短期，成本冲击会毁灭一些经济活动，迫使公司关门或转向其他业务。

column1: But what Schumpeter called “creative destruction” can facilitate the eventual emergence and expansion of new, more efficient firms.
column2: 但熊彼特所谓的“创造性破坏”能够有利于更高效的新企业的最终产生和扩张。

column1: The problem is that many country-specific factors, such as political concerns and pressure from vested interests, can impede this process.
column2: 问题在于许多国别因素 — — 比如政治顾虑和来自既得利益的压力 — — 可能阻碍这一过程。

column1: In this sense, China’s government is facing an important test.
column2: 从这个角度讲，中国政府正面临着重要考验。

column1: If it fails to take advantage of the opportunity provided by the cost shock and economic slowdown to implement the necessary structural reforms, China’s potential growth rate, as dictated by TFP, will never rebound fully.
column2: 如果政府不能利用成本冲击和经济减速带来的机会实施必要的结构性改革，中国的潜在增长率将如TFP所显示的那样永远无法完全恢复。

column1: Given that improving overall productivity is the best way to defend against cost shocks, the new round of structural reform should be aimed at creating conditions for economic transformation and upgrading.
column2: 改善总体生产率是抵抗成本冲击的最佳办法，因此新一轮结构性改革应该以创造经济转型和升级的条件为目标。

column1: The key is to establish a level playing field guided by market rules, reduce government intervention in the economy, and stop protecting inefficient businesses.
column2: 关键在于建立由市场规则引导的公平平台，减少政府对经济的干预，并停止保护低效率企业。

column1: Such efforts would go a long way toward increasing China’s potential growth rate.
column2: 这些举措将大大有利于增加中国的潜在增长率。

column1: Indeed, considering that China’s per capita income amounts to only about 10-20% of that of the US, with massive regional differentials within China, its growth potential, as dictated by the convergence hypothesis, is far from tapped.
column2: 事实上，考虑到中国人均收入只有美国的10—20 % ， 且国内地区差距巨大，从趋同假说看，其增长潜力还远远没有到头。

column1: But the degree to which it can fulfill this potential in the coming decades will depend largely on its TFP prospects.
column2: 但未来数十年中能在多大程度上实现这一潜力很大程度上取决于其TFP前景。

column1: In 2007, the economists Dwight Perkins and Thomas Rawski estimated that, in order for China’s economy to maintain a 9% growth rate and a 25-35% investment ratio until 2025, it would need to maintain an annual TFP growth rate of 4.3-4.8%.
column2: 2007年，经济学家德怀特·珀金斯（Dwight Perkins）和托马斯·罗斯基（Thomas Rawski）估算，中国要想在2025年之前维持9%的增长率和25—35%的投资比率，需要将年TFP增长率保持在4.3—4.8 % 。

column1: Given that China’s TFP growth has averaged 4% for more than 30 years, and is likely to slow in the coming decade, this scenario is improbable.
column2: 三十多年来，中国TFP平均增长率为4 % ， 并且可能在未来十年有所下降，因此这一情景可能无法实现。

column1: Maintaining 6% annual GDP growth with the same investment ratio would require annual TFP growth of only 2.2-2.7%.
column2: 维持6%的GDP年增长和相同的投资比率要求年TFP增长达到2.2—2.7%即可。

column1: With China’s productivity still well below that of developed countries, and allocational efficiency likely to improve in the next ten years as labor and capital are redistributed across the country, 3% TFP growth is feasible.
column2: 中国的生产率仍显著低于发达国家；而随着劳动力和资本在全国的重新分配，未来十年配置效率改进可期，因此，3%的TFP增长率是可行的。

column1: Aided by structural reforms, China’s economy could expand even faster, achieving 7-8% annual growth over the next ten years.
column2: 在结构性改革的助力下，未来十年中国经济可以扩张得更快，达到7—8%的年增长。

column1: Either way, convergence will remain swift.
column2: 无论如何，趋同都会保持快速。

column1: China’s High-Income Hopes
column2: 中国的高收入希望

column1: SHANGHAI – It is widely agreed that economic development means more than GDP growth.
column2: 上海—一个被广泛接受的观点是经济发展不仅仅意味着GDP增长。

column1: As China is now learning, one does not guarantee the other.
column2: 中国现在知道，增长和发展并非有此即有彼的关系。

column1: Unless China’s leaders upgrade the country’s growth strategy to stimulate technological progress and structural transformation, high-income status will continue to elude the world’s second-largest economy and most populous country.
column2: 除非中国领导人改革增长战略以刺激技术进步和制度转型，否则高收入将仍是这个世界第二大经济体和第一大人口国可望而不可及的成就。

column1: To be sure, China’s growth strategy – powered by investment in infrastructure, a massive increase in low-cost manufacturing exports, and technology transfers – has led to some structural change.
column2: 平心而论，中国的增长战略 — — 受基础设施、低成本制造业出口大规模增长和技术转移推动 — — 已经带来了可观的结构变化。

column1: As labor and capital moved from low-productivity sectors and regions to high-productivity activities, resource allocation became more efficient, real wages rose, and the economic structure was upgraded.
column2: 随着劳动力和资本从低生产率部门和地区转移到高生产率活动去，资源配置也变得更有效率，真实工资有所增长，经济结构也获得了升级。

column1: But the growth strategies that lift a poor country to middle-income levels cannot be counted upon to propel it to high-income status.
column2: 但让一个穷国步入中等收入行列的增长战略是无法继续执行同样的增长战略让这个国家实现高收入的。

column1: Indeed, there is no shortage of countries whose leaders have failed to recognize their strategies’ constraints and provide enough incentives to encourage the emergence of a new one, causing their economies to stagnate and leaving them stuck in the so-called “middle-income trap.”
column2: 事实上，有许多国家，其领导人没有认识到增长战略的约束条件并给予足够的激励鼓励新战略，结果导致经济陷入停滞，受困于所谓的“中等收入陷阱 ” 。

column1: Perhaps the most notable exceptions to this rule have been in East Asia, where four economies – South Korea, Taiwan, Hong Kong, and Singapore – responded to external crises and challenges by shifting their growth strategies.
column2: 也许这一规律最令人瞩目的例外就在亚洲，四个经济体 — — 韩国、中国台湾、中国香港和新加坡 — — 通过改变增长战略成功地应对了外部危机和挑战。

column1: For China, whose growth model has so far resembled that used by these economies before they attained middle-income status, a similar shift is urgently needed.
column2: 对中国来说，其步入中等收入行列前的增长战略一直效仿以上四个经济体，现在也迫切需要类似的转变。

column1: As the late Yale economist Gustav Ranis observed nearly 20 years ago, the key to successful and sustainable development is “avoiding the encrustation of ideas.”
column2: 已故的耶鲁经济学家古斯塔夫·拉尼斯（Gustav Ranis）在近20年前观察道，成功而可持续的发展的关键是“避免思维僵化 ” 。

column1: For Chinese policymakers, this means recognizing the need to abandon some of the fundamental ideas that underpinned the economy’s past growth, before they become so firmly encrusted that they jeopardize the country’s development prospects.
column2: 对中国决策者来说，这意味着认识到必须在一些作为中国经济过去增长基础的基本思维形成顽固惯性、破坏中国发展前景之前抛弃它们。

column1: The first problem is China’s enduring dependence on exports.
column2: 第一个问题是中国对出口战略的可能的长期依赖。

column1: In the early stages of economic development, almost all growth strategies boil down to trade strategies.
column2: 在经济发展的早期阶段，几乎所有增长战略都可以归结为贸易战略。

column1: But China’s export-led growth model has limits – and the country is reaching them.
column2: 但中国的出口拉动型增长模式存在极限，并且已肯快靠近那个极限。

column1: Unless change comes soon, the foreign-exchange regime and capital controls on which the model relies will become too deeply entrenched, and the window of opportunity for adjustment will be missed.
column2: 除非很快采取变化，否则作为这一模式的基础的外汇机制和资本管制将会变得过于根深蒂固，调整的机会窗口也会错失。

column1: Another risk is that China’s leaders continue to delay efforts to expand the services sector – including finance, insurance, wholesale and retail trade, and logistics – in the hope that the economy can continue to depend on manufacturing.
column2: 另一个风险是中国领导人可能继续推延开放服务部门的措施 — — 包括金融、保险、批发和零售贸易、物流等诸领域 — — 以期经济能继续依赖制造业。

column1: Given how difficult it can be to gain support for such efforts, especially compared to policies aimed at boosting manufacturing, liberalization and expansion of the services sector will require a strong commitment from China’s government.
column2: 开放服务部门的措施很难赢得支持，特别是与旨在提振制造业的政策相比，因此服务部门的自由化和开放需要中国政府的大决心。

column1: Here, Japan’s failure in opening up its services sector – which impeded its ability to adapt its economic structure to its declining demographic dividend – can provide much-needed motivation.
column2: 在这方面，日本曾经欲开放服务部门而失败，结果掣肘了其调整经济结构应对人口红利下降局面的能力，这给了中国所急需的鞭策。

column1: The final idea at risk of blocking further progress is that political transformation would undermine social order.
column2: 阻碍未来前景的最后一种思维是政治转型会破坏社会秩序。

column1: One of the East Asian economies’ major lessons for developing countries is that economic development leads to institutional transformation, not the other way around.
column2: 东亚经济体给发展中国家留下的主要智慧之一是经济发展会导致政治制度转变，而不是相反。

column1: In Taiwan and South Korea, for example, authoritarian governments after World War II compensated for the weakness of the rule of law by creating transitional institutional arrangements to facilitate GDP growth.
column2: 比如，在中国台湾和韩国，二战后的威权政府创造了过渡性制度安排来刺激GDP增长，以此弥补法制的不足。

column1: In this sense, China has a significant advantage.
column2: 在这方面，中国拥有巨大优势。

column1: Countries with weak government capacity have rarely managed to achieve high-income status.
column2: 相反，政府能力不够强的国家很少能够成功步入中等收入行列。

column1: But, as the description of these arrangements as “transitional” suggests, they cannot last indefinitely.
column2: 但是，顾名思义，这些“过渡性”安排无法永远持续下去。

column1: After 35 years of dependence on such arrangements, China must embrace the rule of law and establish a reliable, independent judicial system capable of facilitating the liberalization of the services sector, protecting intellectual-property rights, and underpinning a competitive market-based system.
column2: 中国依赖这一安排已逾35年，现在必须接受法制精神，建立能够刺激服务部门自由化、保护知识财产权利、成为竞争性市场经济制度基石的可靠而独立的司法体系。

column1: In short, the biggest risk to China’s continued development is not a crisis, but the failure of its political leaders and intellectual elites to recognize the need to transform a growth strategy that has proved successful so far.
column2: 简言之，中国后续发展的最大风险不是危机，而是政治领导人和知识精英有没有认识到扬弃到目前为止一直成功的增长战略的必要性。

column1: In fact, to the extent that a crisis could do more good than harm, warnings that the rapid credit expansion of recent years could trigger a debt crisis, or that the real-estate sector is on the verge of collapse, may not be as worrying as many believe.
column2: 事实上，危机或许利大于弊，因此警告近几年来的信用高速扩张可能引发债务危机，或者房地产部门眼看就要崩溃或许并不像许多人认为的那样令人担忧。

column1: Ideally, no such crisis would be needed.
column2: 在理想状况下，这样的危机并不需要。

column1: In this scenario, China’s economic slowdown since 2008, which could be viewed as China’s first modern growth crisis, would be sufficient to force China’s leaders to shift their focus from supporting double-digit annual GDP increases to restructuring the economy.
column2: 在这一情形中，中国经济从2008年开始减速，这可以视为中国的第一次现代增长危机，已足以迫使中国领导人将注意力从支持两位数的年GDP增长率转向重组经济结构。

column1: In fact, a consensus already appears to be emerging concerning the need to reduce China’s dependence on exports, expand trade in services, attract more foreign investment to its services sector, and accelerate the liberalization of exchange rates, interest rates, and cross-border capital flows – exemplified in the establishment of the Shanghai Pilot Free-Trade Zone last year.
column2: 事实上，关于降低中国的出口依赖、开放其服务贸易、吸引更多外资投资于服务部门以及加速汇率、利率和跨境资本流自由化的问题似乎已经有了共识，去年的上海自由贸易区试点就是明证。

column1: And, following the Third Plenum of the Chinese Communist Party’s 18th Central Committee last November, China’s leaders declared their commitment to allowing the market to play a greater role in shaping economic outcomes.
column2: 此外，在去年11月的中共十八大三中全会后，中国领导人承诺要让市场在决定经济结果中起到更大的作用。

column1: These are undoubtedly steps in the right direction.
column2: 毫无疑问，这些都是迈向正确方向的步骤。

column1: The question is whether China’s leaders will follow through on their declarations before it is too late.
column2: 问题在于中国领导人是否能在仍然来得及的时候兑现承诺。

column1: The ECB’s Leap into the Unknown
column2: 欧洲央行跃向未知

column1: FRANKFURT – The European Central Bank is in the middle of a big, risky experiment.
column2: 法兰克福—欧洲央行正在实施一项大型高风险实验。

column1: Key interest rates have remained close to zero for six years now.
column2: 如今，关键利率保持近零水平已有六年。

column1: Financial markets are flooded with liquidity.
column2: 金融市场充斥着流动性。

column1: Crisis management has resulted in major market distortions, with some segments’ performance no longer explainable by fundamental economic data.
column2: 危机管理导致了巨大的市场扭曲，一些细分市场的表现已不再能用经济基本面数据解释。

column1: The unintended consequences of this policy are increasingly visible – and will become increasingly tangible with the US Federal Reserve’s exit from post-2008 ultra-loose monetary policy.
column2: 这一政策的意外后果正变得日益清晰，随着美联储退出其2008年以来的极度宽松政策，其后果还会变的更加明确。

column1: And yet Europe’s crisis is far from over, as the decisions by the European Central Bank’s Governing Council in June and September demonstrate.
column2: 而欧洲危机还远未结束，欧洲央行管理委员会6月和 9月的决定说明了一切。

column1: This reflects two factors: too little ambition in carrying out essential balance-sheet corrections, and slow progress – negligible in France and Italy – in restructuring Europe’s national economies.
column2: 这反映出两个因素：实施关键性资产负债表修正的决定不够，以及欧洲各国政府重组进展缓慢（法国和意大利就是明证 ） 。

column1: The ECB’s decision to double down on monetary stimulus should thus be regarded as an act of desperation.
column2: 因此，欧洲央行决定将货币刺激加倍的决定应该被视为绝望的行动。

column1: Its key rate has been cut to 0.05%, the deposit rate is negative, and targeted longer-term refinancing operations are supposed to support bank lending.
column2: 其关键利率已下降至0.05 % ， 存款利率已为负值，定向长期再融资操作意在支持银行放贷。

column1: Moreover, the asset-backed securities market is to be revived by the purchase of ABSs.
column2: 此外，资产支持证券（ABS）市场将因购买ABS的计划而得到复苏。

column1: All of this is intended to flood the markets, expand the euro system’s balance sheet by €700 billion ($890 billion), and return to the balance-sheet volume recorded at the start of 2012.
column2: 所有这些都是为了提振市场、将欧元系统的资产负债表扩大7,000亿欧元，并使其回到2012年初创下的纪录水平。

column1: The expansion of the ECB’s balance sheet and the targeted depreciation of the euro should help to bring the eurozone’s short-term inflation rate close to 2% and thus reduce deflationary risks.
column2: 欧洲央行资产负债表的扩张以及欧元的定向贬值应该有助于让欧元区短期通胀率接近2 % ， 从而降低通缩风险。

column1: For the first time in its history, the ECB appears to be pursuing an exchange-rate target.
column2: 欧洲央行有史以来第一次开始追求汇率目标。

column1: As was the case for the Bank of Japan, the external value of the currency will become an important instrument in the framework of a new strategic approach.
column2: 和日本银行一样，货币的外部价值将成为新战略方针框架中的一个重要工具。

column1: Financial markets have applauded the ECB’s recent decisions.
column2: 金融市场非常欢迎欧洲央行的最新举措。

column1: Moreover, having “effectively thrown off all of the Maastricht Treaty restrictions that bound the bank to the model of the Deutsche Bundesbank,” as former Fed Chair Alan Greenspan put it, the ECB is prepared to break further taboos.
column2: 此外，如美联储主席艾伦·格林斯潘（Alan Greenspan）所指出的 ， “ 事实上抛弃了所有马斯特里赫特条约限制、不再受德意志联邦银行模式约束”的欧洲央行已准备好进一步打破更多禁忌。

column1: But for what purpose?
column2: 但其目的何在？

column1: Particularly by guaranteeing highly indebted countries’ sovereign bonds, the ECB has actually weakened the willingness to reform, particularly in the larger European Union countries, whose decrepit economic structures are an obstacle to potential growth, and where more room must be given to private initiative.
column2: 欧洲央行的行为，特别是担保高负债国家主权债券的行为，实际上削弱了改革意愿，特别是在过时的济结构已成为潜在增长障碍的欧盟中较大的国家以及必须给私人行动更大空间的领域。

column1: The ECB’s willingness to buy ABSs is especially risky and creates a new element of joint liability in the eurozone, with European taxpayers on the hook in the event of a loss.
column2: 欧洲央行愿意购买ABS，这已决定风险极高，并且给欧元区注入了新的共同债务因素，如若发生损失，将由欧洲纳税人买单。

column1: The ECB lacks the democratic legitimacy to take such far-reaching decisions, with potentially substantial redistributive effects, which implies an even greater risk to monetary-policy independence.
column2: 欧洲央行采取这些影响重大、具有巨大的潜在再分配效应（因此意味着更大的货币政策独立性风险）的决定缺少民主合法性。

column1: Indeed, the ECB already has been driven onto the defensive by the International Monetary Fund, the OECD, financial-market analysts, and Anglo-Saxon economists in the wake of feverish discussion of the risk of deflation in the eurozone.
column2: 事实上，在关于欧元区通缩风险的喧闹的争论中，欧洲央行在国际货币基金组织、经合组织、金融市场分析师和盎格鲁-撒克逊经济学家的攻势下相当被动。

column1: But what is the appropriate eurozone inflation rate, given de facto economic stagnation?
column2: 但在实际经济停滞的环境下，什么才是欧元区恰当的失业率？

column1: Should higher nominal (that is, inflation-driven) growth replace debt-driven growth?
column2: 应该用更高的名义（即通胀驱动的）增长代替债务驱动的增长吗？

column1: Europe must aim for sustainable, non-inflationary growth and the creation of competitive jobs.
column2: 欧洲必须将目标放在可持续、非通胀性的增长以及竞争性就业岗位的创造上。

column1: The current inflation rate of 0.3% is due to the significant decline in commodity prices and the painful but unavoidable adjustment of costs and prices in the peripheral countries.
column2: 当前0.3%的通货膨胀率是商品价格的大跌和外围国不可避免的痛苦的成本和价格调整的结果。

column1: Only Greece currently has a slightly negative inflation rate.
column2: 只有希腊当前通胀率略为负值。

column1: In other words, price stability reigns in the eurozone.
column2: 换句话说，价格稳定是欧元区的普遍现象。

column1: This strengthens purchasing power and ultimately private consumption.
column2: 这增强了购买力，最终有利于私人消费。

column1: The ECB has fulfilled its mandate for the present and the foreseeable future.
column2: 欧洲央行已经完成了当前和可预见未来的使命。

column1: There is no need for policy action in the short term.
column2: 短期没有采取政策动作的必要。

column1: It is, instead, the eurozone governments that must act.
column2: 反之，欧元区政府必须行动起来。

column1: But any clear division of tasks and responsibilities between governments and central banks has, it seems, been jettisoned.
column2: 但任何各个政府和央行之间的明确的任务和责任分割都被放弃了。

column1: Government action in many problem countries ultimately ends in finger pointing: “Europe,” the ECB, and Germany, with its (relatively) responsible policy, have all been scapegoats.
column2: 许多问题国家的政府行动最终沦为互相指责的 ： “ 欧洲 ” 、 欧洲央行、德国及其（相对）负责任的政策都成了替罪羊。

column1: Against this background, the ECB has yielded to immense political pressure, particularly from France and Italy, to loosen monetary policy further and weaken the exchange rate.
column2: 在这样的背景下，欧洲央行屈服于巨大的政治压力，特别是来自法国和意大利的压力，进一步放松了货币政策、贬值了汇率。

column1: But indulging the old political reflex of manipulating the exchange rate to create a competitive advantage will yield a short-term fix at best.
column2: 但沉溺于操纵汇率创造竞争优势的旧政治反射充其量只能算是短期解决方案。

column1: It will not eliminate the structural weaknesses of the countries in question.
column2: 它无法消除问题国家的结构性弱点。

column1: The ECB is moving ever farther into uncharted territory.
column2: 欧洲央行正在朝着未知领域越走越远。

column1: In view of the insufficient balance-sheet corrections in the private sector and inadequate structural reforms, macroeconomic demand-management tools will not work.
column2: 从私人部门资产负债表修正不充分和结构性改革不足的观点看，宏观经济需求管理工具是无效的。

column1: Despite the ECB’s aggressive approach, monetary policy in the absence of structural economic reform risks being ineffective.
column2: 尽管欧洲央行采取了积极政策，但没有结构型经济改革，货币政策也可能毫无效果。

column1: Simply put, more liquidity will not lead to more active bank lending until there is more transparency regarding the extent of non-performing loans and the relevant economies have become more flexible.
column2: 简言之，更多的流动性无法带来更活跃的银行贷款行为，除非不良贷款程度的透明度有所增加，并且相关经济体弹性变得更大。

column1: The ECB’s asset quality review and bank stress tests are expected to bring some clarity to the first question.
column2: 欧洲央行的资产质量检查和银行压力测试有望澄清第一个问题。

column1: Then, more lending will occur on acceptable terms – assuming that there is corresponding demand.
column2: 接着，就可以在可接受的条件上发生更多的贷款 — — 假设有相应需求的话。

column1: But the uncertainty regarding the extent and pace of economic reforms remains.
column2: 但与经济改革程度和节奏有关的不确定性仍然存在。

column1: The ECB’s recent decisions, with their focus on short-term effects, indicate that monetary policy is no longer targeted at the eurozone as a whole, but at its problem members.
column2: 欧洲央行最近的决定及其对短期影响的关注表明货币政策的目标已不再是欧元区整体，而是其问题成员国。

column1: Ad hoc decisions have replaced a feasible and principled medium-term strategy.
column2: 临时决定取代了可行、审慎的中期战略。

column1: The problems created by this approach will be compounded by the unavoidable conflicts of interest with monetary policy implied by the ECB’s assumption of its new financial-stability and banking-supervision roles.
column2: 欧洲央行认为它应该扮演新的金融稳定和银行监督者角色，据此采取的货币政策所带来的不可避免的利益冲突将让这一方针所造成的问题更加复杂。

column1: The first casualty will most likely be price stability.
column2: 首当其冲者很有可能是价格稳定性。

column1: The ECB’s Leap into the Unknown
column2: 欧洲央行跃向未知

column1: FRANKFURT – The European Central Bank is in the middle of a big, risky experiment.
column2: 法兰克福—欧洲央行正在实施一项大型高风险实验。

column1: Key interest rates have remained close to zero for six years now.
column2: 如今，关键利率保持近零水平已有六年。

column1: Financial markets are flooded with liquidity.
column2: 金融市场充斥着流动性。

column1: Crisis management has resulted in major market distortions, with some segments’ performance no longer explainable by fundamental economic data.
column2: 危机管理导致了巨大的市场扭曲，一些细分市场的表现已不再能用经济基本面数据解释。

column1: The unintended consequences of this policy are increasingly visible – and will become increasingly tangible with the US Federal Reserve’s exit from post-2008 ultra-loose monetary policy.
column2: 这一政策的意外后果正变得日益清晰，随着美联储退出其2008年以来的极度宽松政策，其后果还会变的更加明确。

column1: And yet Europe’s crisis is far from over, as the decisions by the European Central Bank’s Governing Council in June and September demonstrate.
column2: 而欧洲危机还远未结束，欧洲央行管理委员会6月和 9月的决定说明了一切。

column1: This reflects two factors: too little ambition in carrying out essential balance-sheet corrections, and slow progress – negligible in France and Italy – in restructuring Europe’s national economies.
column2: 这反映出两个因素：实施关键性资产负债表修正的决定不够，以及欧洲各国政府重组进展缓慢（法国和意大利就是明证 ） 。

column1: The ECB’s decision to double down on monetary stimulus should thus be regarded as an act of desperation.
column2: 因此，欧洲央行决定将货币刺激加倍的决定应该被视为绝望的行动。

column1: Its key rate has been cut to 0.05%, the deposit rate is negative, and targeted longer-term refinancing operations are supposed to support bank lending.
column2: 其关键利率已下降至0.05 % ， 存款利率已为负值，定向长期再融资操作意在支持银行放贷。

column1: Moreover, the asset-backed securities market is to be revived by the purchase of ABSs.
column2: 此外，资产支持证券（ABS）市场将因购买ABS的计划而得到复苏。

column1: All of this is intended to flood the markets, expand the euro system’s balance sheet by €700 billion ($890 billion), and return to the balance-sheet volume recorded at the start of 2012.
column2: 所有这些都是为了提振市场、将欧元系统的资产负债表扩大7,000亿欧元，并使其回到2012年初创下的纪录水平。

column1: The expansion of the ECB’s balance sheet and the targeted depreciation of the euro should help to bring the eurozone’s short-term inflation rate close to 2% and thus reduce deflationary risks.
column2: 欧洲央行资产负债表的扩张以及欧元的定向贬值应该有助于让欧元区短期通胀率接近2 % ， 从而降低通缩风险。

column1: For the first time in its history, the ECB appears to be pursuing an exchange-rate target.
column2: 欧洲央行有史以来第一次开始追求汇率目标。

column1: As was the case for the Bank of Japan, the external value of the currency will become an important instrument in the framework of a new strategic approach.
column2: 和日本银行一样，货币的外部价值将成为新战略方针框架中的一个重要工具。

column1: Financial markets have applauded the ECB’s recent decisions.
column2: 金融市场非常欢迎欧洲央行的最新举措。

column1: Moreover, having “effectively thrown off all of the Maastricht Treaty restrictions that bound the bank to the model of the Deutsche Bundesbank,” as former Fed Chair Alan Greenspan put it, the ECB is prepared to break further taboos.
column2: 此外，如美联储主席艾伦·格林斯潘（Alan Greenspan）所指出的 ， “ 事实上抛弃了所有马斯特里赫特条约限制、不再受德意志联邦银行模式约束”的欧洲央行已准备好进一步打破更多禁忌。

column1: But for what purpose?
column2: 但其目的何在？

column1: Particularly by guaranteeing highly indebted countries’ sovereign bonds, the ECB has actually weakened the willingness to reform, particularly in the larger European Union countries, whose decrepit economic structures are an obstacle to potential growth, and where more room must be given to private initiative.
column2: 欧洲央行的行为，特别是担保高负债国家主权债券的行为，实际上削弱了改革意愿，特别是在过时的济结构已成为潜在增长障碍的欧盟中较大的国家以及必须给私人行动更大空间的领域。

column1: The ECB’s willingness to buy ABSs is especially risky and creates a new element of joint liability in the eurozone, with European taxpayers on the hook in the event of a loss.
column2: 欧洲央行愿意购买ABS，这已决定风险极高，并且给欧元区注入了新的共同债务因素，如若发生损失，将由欧洲纳税人买单。

column1: The ECB lacks the democratic legitimacy to take such far-reaching decisions, with potentially substantial redistributive effects, which implies an even greater risk to monetary-policy independence.
column2: 欧洲央行采取这些影响重大、具有巨大的潜在再分配效应（因此意味着更大的货币政策独立性风险）的决定缺少民主合法性。

column1: Indeed, the ECB already has been driven onto the defensive by the International Monetary Fund, the OECD, financial-market analysts, and Anglo-Saxon economists in the wake of feverish discussion of the risk of deflation in the eurozone.
column2: 事实上，在关于欧元区通缩风险的喧闹的争论中，欧洲央行在国际货币基金组织、经合组织、金融市场分析师和盎格鲁-撒克逊经济学家的攻势下相当被动。

column1: But what is the appropriate eurozone inflation rate, given de facto economic stagnation?
column2: 但在实际经济停滞的环境下，什么才是欧元区恰当的失业率？

column1: Should higher nominal (that is, inflation-driven) growth replace debt-driven growth?
column2: 应该用更高的名义（即通胀驱动的）增长代替债务驱动的增长吗？

column1: Europe must aim for sustainable, non-inflationary growth and the creation of competitive jobs.
column2: 欧洲必须将目标放在可持续、非通胀性的增长以及竞争性就业岗位的创造上。

column1: The current inflation rate of 0.3% is due to the significant decline in commodity prices and the painful but unavoidable adjustment of costs and prices in the peripheral countries.
column2: 当前0.3%的通货膨胀率是商品价格的大跌和外围国不可避免的痛苦的成本和价格调整的结果。

column1: Only Greece currently has a slightly negative inflation rate.
column2: 只有希腊当前通胀率略为负值。

column1: In other words, price stability reigns in the eurozone.
column2: 换句话说，价格稳定是欧元区的普遍现象。

column1: This strengthens purchasing power and ultimately private consumption.
column2: 这增强了购买力，最终有利于私人消费。

column1: The ECB has fulfilled its mandate for the present and the foreseeable future.
column2: 欧洲央行已经完成了当前和可预见未来的使命。

column1: There is no need for policy action in the short term.
column2: 短期没有采取政策动作的必要。

column1: It is, instead, the eurozone governments that must act.
column2: 反之，欧元区政府必须行动起来。

column1: But any clear division of tasks and responsibilities between governments and central banks has, it seems, been jettisoned.
column2: 但任何各个政府和央行之间的明确的任务和责任分割都被放弃了。

column1: Government action in many problem countries ultimately ends in finger pointing: “Europe,” the ECB, and Germany, with its (relatively) responsible policy, have all been scapegoats.
column2: 许多问题国家的政府行动最终沦为互相指责的 ： “ 欧洲 ” 、 欧洲央行、德国及其（相对）负责任的政策都成了替罪羊。

column1: Against this background, the ECB has yielded to immense political pressure, particularly from France and Italy, to loosen monetary policy further and weaken the exchange rate.
column2: 在这样的背景下，欧洲央行屈服于巨大的政治压力，特别是来自法国和意大利的压力，进一步放松了货币政策、贬值了汇率。

column1: But indulging the old political reflex of manipulating the exchange rate to create a competitive advantage will yield a short-term fix at best.
column2: 但沉溺于操纵汇率创造竞争优势的旧政治反射充其量只能算是短期解决方案。

column1: It will not eliminate the structural weaknesses of the countries in question.
column2: 它无法消除问题国家的结构性弱点。

column1: The ECB is moving ever farther into uncharted territory.
column2: 欧洲央行正在朝着未知领域越走越远。

column1: In view of the insufficient balance-sheet corrections in the private sector and inadequate structural reforms, macroeconomic demand-management tools will not work.
column2: 从私人部门资产负债表修正不充分和结构性改革不足的观点看，宏观经济需求管理工具是无效的。

column1: Despite the ECB’s aggressive approach, monetary policy in the absence of structural economic reform risks being ineffective.
column2: 尽管欧洲央行采取了积极政策，但没有结构型经济改革，货币政策也可能毫无效果。

column1: Simply put, more liquidity will not lead to more active bank lending until there is more transparency regarding the extent of non-performing loans and the relevant economies have become more flexible.
column2: 简言之，更多的流动性无法带来更活跃的银行贷款行为，除非不良贷款程度的透明度有所增加，并且相关经济体弹性变得更大。

column1: The ECB’s asset quality review and bank stress tests are expected to bring some clarity to the first question.
column2: 欧洲央行的资产质量检查和银行压力测试有望澄清第一个问题。

column1: Then, more lending will occur on acceptable terms – assuming that there is corresponding demand.
column2: 接着，就可以在可接受的条件上发生更多的贷款 — — 假设有相应需求的话。

column1: But the uncertainty regarding the extent and pace of economic reforms remains.
column2: 但与经济改革程度和节奏有关的不确定性仍然存在。

column1: The ECB’s recent decisions, with their focus on short-term effects, indicate that monetary policy is no longer targeted at the eurozone as a whole, but at its problem members.
column2: 欧洲央行最近的决定及其对短期影响的关注表明货币政策的目标已不再是欧元区整体，而是其问题成员国。

column1: Ad hoc decisions have replaced a feasible and principled medium-term strategy.
column2: 临时决定取代了可行、审慎的中期战略。

column1: The problems created by this approach will be compounded by the unavoidable conflicts of interest with monetary policy implied by the ECB’s assumption of its new financial-stability and banking-supervision roles.
column2: 欧洲央行认为它应该扮演新的金融稳定和银行监督者角色，据此采取的货币政策所带来的不可避免的利益冲突将让这一方针所造成的问题更加复杂。

column1: The first casualty will most likely be price stability.
column2: 首当其冲者很有可能是价格稳定性。

column1: Justice for Srebrenica’s Dead
column2: 带给斯雷布雷尼察死难者的正义

column1: THE HAGUE – In 1993, atrocities committed against Slavic Muslims near the Bosnian silver-mining town of Srebrenica catalyzed demands to establish a tribunal to try political and military leaders accused of war crimes in the former Yugoslavia.
column2: 发自海牙 — — 在1993年，波黑塞族共和国军队侵入波斯尼亚银矿城市斯雷布雷尼察，并对当地斯拉夫族穆斯林所犯下了暴行，而这也引发人们要求建立特别法庭，审判相关军政领导人在前南斯拉夫地区所犯下的战争罪责。

column1: The new United Nations tribunal that was formed – nearly five decades after the final judgments were rendered at Nuremberg and Tokyo – became the forerunner of ad hoc courts to prosecute perpetrators of Rwanda’s genocide, Charles Taylor and his blood-diamond butchers in Sierra Leone, and the Khmer Rouge killers in Cambodia.
column2: 而当时为此而新设的联合国特别法庭 — — 在纽伦堡和东京审判结束了近半个世纪之后 — — 也开创了先河，为随后审判卢旺达大屠杀，追究利比里亚前军事独裁者查尔斯·泰勒以及他那帮塞拉利昂滴血钻石屠夫，以及审判柬埔寨红色高棉屠杀者提供了示范。

column1: The International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia (ICTY) also gave rise to the permanent International Criminal Court to try war criminals worldwide.
column2: 而这个前南斯拉夫问题国际刑事法庭（简称：前南法庭）同时也带动了常设国际刑事法庭的成立。

column1: Undeterred by the still-untested ICTY’s reach, Serb soldiers finally overran Srebrenica itself – despite its status as a “safe area” under UN protection – 15 years ago, on July 11, 1995, and proceeded to expel the town’s people and execute 7,600 captives.
column2: 但当时在新生的前南法庭面前，塞族士兵却一意孤行，最终在15年之前的1995年7月11日蹂躏了整个斯雷布雷尼察 — — 尽管该地是受联合国保护的“安全区 ” — —并驱逐了该镇的居民，还处决了7600名俘虏。

column1: Out of this massacre, however, the tribunal and foreign-backed war-crimes courts in Bosnia and Serbia have delivered the international justice effort’s most significant achievement to date.
column2: 而在这起大屠杀发生之后，特别法庭和外国在波斯尼亚和塞尔维亚设立的战争罪行法庭都成功地执掌了国际正义，这也是法庭迄今为止最重大的成就。

column1: With no media fanfare and limited arrest and investigative powers, and despite the foreign-policy and military “realists” who dismiss international justice as a pipedream, these judicial institutions have brought justice to Srebrenica’s dead and their survivors, and have demonstrated that justice can be delivered to victims in other conflict areas.
column2: 尽管没有媒体的推波助澜，尽管只有有限的拒捕和调查权，尽管那些将国际正义视为白日做梦的外交和军事“现实主义者”们不断冷嘲热讽，这些司法机关依然给斯雷布雷尼察事件的殉难者和生还者带来了正义，并昭示出正义是可以被带给其它地区的受害者的。

column1: It is an imperfect, unsatisfying justice, to be sure, but no more imperfect or unsatisfying than that dispensed by national courts.
column2: 虽然这种正义无疑算不上完美，也无法令人完全满意，像相对于那些国内法院的判决来说，已经足够完美，足够令人满意了。

column1: The ICTY ruled the Srebrenica massacre to be an act of genocide.
column2: 前南法庭将斯雷布雷尼察大屠杀判定为种族灭绝罪行。

column1: The tribunal and the local courts imprisoned 13 of those who gave the orders, as well as 17 execution-squad members; 11 more men, four of them leaders, are facing their reckoning.
column2: 法庭和地方法院将13名屠杀下令者以及17名屠杀小组的成员送入了大牢；另外还有11人，其中包括4名领导人，也陆续得到了应有的惩罚。

column1: On trial now are Radovan Karadžić, the Bosnian Serb political leader, and Jovica Stanišić, the police minister in Slobodan Milošević’s Serbia.
column2: 目前还在受审的是波斯尼亚塞族领导人拉多万·卡拉季奇，还有约维卡·斯塔尼希奇，他可是斯洛博丹·米洛舍维奇领导下的塞尔维亚前国家安全部部长。

column1: Of course, the Bosnian Serb commander, Ratko Mladić remains a fugitive.
column2: 当然，波斯尼亚塞族军事领导人拉特科·姆拉迪奇依然在逃。

column1: But Serbia’s authorities, facing economic turmoil, cannot harbor him much longer if the United States and the European Union exert adequate pressure.
column2: 但如果美国和欧盟施加足够压力的话，身陷经济困境的塞尔维亚当局不可能包庇此人太久。

column1: Serbia recently surrendered Mladić’s war-time diaries.
column2: 塞尔维亚最近还提交了姆拉迪奇的战时日记。

column1: The Srebrenica trials also yielded a soul-testing record of a crime whose gravity Serb political leaders, former UN officials, and others once shamefully denied.
column2: 斯雷布雷尼察审判的另一个成果，则是提供了一份关于一项严重罪行的震撼人心的记录，而这项罪行是那些塞族领导人，前联合国官员和其他人曾无耻地否认过的。

column1: Thanks to the ICTY, anyone can read the transcripts of intercepted calls to deliver more “packages” to the killing fields.
column2: 多亏有了前南法庭，人们可以看到那些要求“送更多‘包裹’到屠杀现场”的电话录音内容。

column1: A Serb district president, Miroslav Deronjić, testified that Karadžić told him: “Miroslav, those people there must be killed.”
column2: 以及一位叫米洛斯拉夫·德容季奇的塞族地方官员的证词 — — 当时卡拉季奇跟他说 ： “ 米洛斯拉夫，这些人必须杀掉 。 ”

column1: We know when, where, and to whom Mladić issued the kill order.
column2: 我们知道姆拉迪奇是在何时，何地以及向何人下达了屠杀命令。

column1: The tribunal’s Web site has video of an execution.
column2: 前南法庭的网站上还存有记录当时屠杀过程的录像资料。

column1: We know that a Serb truck driver rescued a boy who survived a firing squad and, crying for his father, crawled from a twisted scrum of bodies.
column2: 我们知道一个塞族卡车司机拯救了一个在处决中幸存，哭着找自己的爸爸，从死人堆中爬出来的小男孩。

column1: We know that a Serb officer defied Mladić and refused to order his men to partake in mass murder.
column2: 我们知道一名塞族军官反抗姆拉迪奇的命令，拒绝命令他的士兵参加屠杀。

column1: The ICTY is flawed, of course.
column2: 当然，前南法庭也是有缺陷的。

column1: Judges and attorneys have treated too many witnesses with condescension, as if the tribunal were doing them a favor.
column2: 法官和律师经常以傲慢的姿态去对待那些屠杀的见证者，似乎法庭所做的事对他们的恩赐。

column1: Judges have sentenced too many killers to absurdly lenient prison terms, diminishing any deterrent effect that the tribunal might generate.
column2: 法官们对大多的屠杀者都太过仁慈，没有从重判刑，削弱了法庭可能产生的巨大威慑力。

column1: And they threw the book at one of Mladić’s men who pled guilty and gave damning insider testimony, eliminating the prosecution’s leverage to obtain similar admissions.
column2: 他们还严惩了一名认罪并提供了关键内幕证词的姆拉迪奇身边人，削弱了检察官获取类似证词的能力。

column1: Prosecution officials also negligently incinerated personal effects of Srebrenica victims, as well as items discovered in Albania and other evidence, and then obfuscated to dodge a scandal.
column2: 检察官员同时还疏忽大意地销毁了斯雷布雷尼察受害者的随身物品以及在阿尔巴尼亚和其他地方发现的证物，后来又为了避免丑闻曝光，蓄意混淆视听。

column1: New rules and procedures, as well as better training, can minimize such failings.
column2: 而新的规则和程序，以及更良好的训练都可以尽量减少这些失误。

column1: But without the ICTY, impunity would have reigned for the murderers of Srebrenica and of less-renowned scenes of war crimes. Karadžić would still be flogging love potions in Belgrade.
column2: 但如果没有了前南法庭的话，斯雷布雷尼察以及其他更不为人知的战争罪行的凶手们就会逍遥法外，卡拉季奇这种人也依然会在贝尔格莱德作威作福。

column1: The retired generals would be tanning beside the Adriatic.
column2: 而那些退休将领们则在亚得里亚海边悠闲地晒着太阳。

column1: Overwhelming proof of Croatia’s complicity with Serbia in the dismemberment of Bosnia – something the media have also ignored – would never have emerged.
column2: 大量有关克罗地亚串通塞尔维亚分割波斯尼亚的证据 — — 有些是连媒体都忽略的 — — 也不会呈现在世人面前。

column1: And, following this anniversary of the massacre, it is safe to say that, without international justice, all of Srebrenica’s victims – including my brother-in-law’s father, Huso Čelik, and the others who are still missing – would still be moldering anonymously in mass graves.
column2: 而在屠杀发生15周年纪念之际，我们可以肯定地说，没有国际正义，所有斯雷布雷尼察的受害者 — — 包括我连襟的父亲，胡梭·塞里克以及其他依然失踪的人 — — 依然只会是万人坑中的无名枯骨。

column1: Their loved ones would be waiting still to gather at the town’s memorial cemetery, where, on this anniversary, they dropped to their knees, drew their hands over their eyes, and recited the funeral prayer to Allah for forgiveness of the living and the dead.
column2: 如今他们的亲人在该市的纪念公墓默默等待，在周年忌日之时，亲人们双膝下跪，双手掩面，背诵悼词，请求安拉宽恕这些活着和死去的人们。

column1: Justice Is Reconciliation
column2: 和解就是正义

column1: In South Africa, indeed around the world, we are raised on a strict diet of justice as retribution.
column2: 在南非，甚至整个世界，我们将伸张正义狭隘地理解为施以惩罚。

column1: With violent crimes on a shocking upsurge, with the hideous crimes of child rape and abuse on the increase, there are nowadays frequent calls – backed by wide public support – to restore capital punishment.
column2: 随着暴力犯罪令人震惊地大幅度增加，随着骇人听闻的强奸和虐待儿童罪行变得日益恶化，如今恢复死刑的呼声常常充盈于耳，而且得到了公众的广泛支持。

column1: Mercifully, South Africa’s Constitutional Court has ruled that the death penalty – which South Africans eliminated at the same time we were liberated from apartheid – is unconstitutional.
column2: 幸运的是，南非宪法法院已经裁定死刑不合乎宪法，这种刑罚在南非人民从种族隔离制度下解放出来的同时即被宣告废止。

column1: Sadly, in many places in the world, it seems that men and women have not advanced beyond the biblical admonition of “an eye for an eye” in their yearning for retribution.
column2: 令人悲哀的是，世界很多地方的男男女女似乎并没有摆脱圣经中“以眼还眼”的训诫，他们渴望对犯罪行为施以惩罚。

column1: Indeed, some Muslim countries amputate the hands of convicted thieves in public.
column2: 事实上在一些穆斯林国家，一旦法律认定盗窃罪名成立，窃贼甚至会被当众砍断双手。

column1: But that biblical adage was in fact invoked originally to curb blood feuds from claiming the innocent relatives of the person who committed the killing.
column2: 但“以眼还眼”的圣经谚语实际本来意在防止凶手的亲属在家族复仇中无辜丧命。

column1: “An eye for an eye” asks that the culprit should be the sole target, and not others, whose only crime was to be related to him.
column2: “以眼还眼”要求只把犯罪者本人作为目标，而不要波及无辜，如果说那些无辜者有罪，那么他们唯一的过错就是与罪犯沾亲带故。

column1: So the “eye for an eye” adage was not intended to mean what it has come to mean, namely that killing be paid for by another killing.
column2: 因此与最初相比 ， “ 以眼还眼”的含义已经发生了变化，变成了以杀戮来抗拒杀戮。

column1: Given the brutality of the apartheid era, that would have never worked in my homeland.
column2: 种族隔离时期的残忍暴行使得这种做法永远也不可能在我的国家获得成功。

column1: Some South Africans called for Nuremberg-type trials, especially for perpetrators of those atrocities that were designed to maintain the vicious apartheid system.
column2: 有些南非人要求举行纽伦堡那样的审判，特别要惩戒那些以维护邪恶的种族隔离制度为目的的施暴者。

column1: There were demands that the guilty be brought to book.
column2: 有人提出要对这些罪行展开审判。

column1: But we were fortunate in that Nuremberg was not really an option for us.
column2: 幸运的是，纽伦堡审判在南非根本行不通。

column1: Nuremberg happened because the Allies inflicted unconditional surrender on the Nazis and so could impose a so-called victor’s justice.
column2: 纽伦堡审判的前提是盟军迫使纳粹无条件投降，然后才能推行所谓胜利者的正义。

column1: In our case, neither the apartheid government nor the liberation movements could defeat each other. We had a military deadlock.
column2: 而在我们国内，无论种族隔离政府还是解放运动都无法彻底将对方打垮，于是形成了军事上的僵持局面。

column1: Moreover, in the case of Nuremberg, the prosecutors and judges could pack up their bags after the trial and leave Germany for their several homes.
column2: 不仅如此，在纽伦堡案例中，原告和法官都可以在审判结束后收拾行囊，离开德意志回到他们自己的国度。

column1: We had to make our homes in this, our common motherland, and learn to live with one another.
column2: 而我们的归宿却只能是这里，我们共同的祖国，因此我们必须学会和平共处。

column1: Such trials would probably have gone on nearly forever, leaving gaping wounds open. It would have been difficult to procure the evidence to get convictions.
column2: 这样的审判几乎可以无休止地往复下去，使得战争留下的伤口永远鲜血淋漓、无法愈合。

column1: We all know just how cunning bureaucrats can be in destroying incriminating evidence.
column2: 要想获得定罪的证据将非常困难，我们都知道那些官老爷们在销毁罪证方面有多么狡猾。

column1: So it was a mercy that our country chose to go the way of the Truth and Reconciliation Commission – granting amnesty in exchange for the truth.
column2: 因此，我们的国家选择追随“真理与和解委员会”的确是件幸事，这意味着只要承认真理，就可以赦免过去犯下的罪过。

column1: This was ultimately based on the principles of restorative justice and ubuntu.
column2: 这种做法的终极源泉是恢复性司法和“分享”原则。

column1: At the TRC hearings we were exposed to gruesome details about atrocities that were committed to uphold or to oppose apartheid.
column2: 在“真理与和解委员会”举办的听政会上，我们听到了骇人听闻的杀戮细节，而这些杀戮的目的有些是为了维护种族隔离制度，有些是为了反对它。

column1: “We gave him drugged coffee and shot him in the head and then we burned his body.
column2: “我们让他喝下了含有麻醉成分的咖啡，对准他的头部开枪，然后焚烧了尸体。

column1: As it takes 7 – 8 hours for a human body to burn, we had a braaivleis on the side, drinking beer and eating meat.”
column2: 因为人体需要7-8个小时才能烧成灰烬，我们就在燃烧的尸体边上开野餐会，吃烤肉、喝啤酒 。 ”

column1: How low men can sink in our inhumanity!
column2: 人性竟然可以沉沦到如此的地步！

column1: Each time such horrible stories were published, we had to remind ourselves that, yes indeed, the acts were demonic, but the perpetrators remained each a child of God.
column2: 每次这样的恐怖事件公诸于众，我们都不得不提醒自己：是的，这些罪行比魔鬼还要可怕，但它们的制造者却仍然是上帝的子孙。

column1: A monster has no moral responsibility and so cannot be held accountable; but even more seriously, designating someone a monster closes the door to possible rehabilitation.
column2: 魔鬼没有任何道德义务，因此也根本不可能承担责任，而更重要的是，把某个人划定为魔鬼就彻底排除了改造的可能性。

column1: Restorative justice and ubuntu are based firmly on the recognition of the fundamental humanity of even the worst possible offender.
column2: 承认最可怕的罪犯也有基本的人性是恢复性司法和“分享”原则赖以存在的坚实基础。

column1: We cannot give up on anybody.
column2: 我们不能放弃对任何人进行拯救。

column1: If it was true that people could not change, once a murderer always a murderer, then the whole TRC process would have been impossible.
column2: 如果人真的无法改变，一日杀人终身嗜血，那么“真理与和解委员会” 也就失去了存在的价值。

column1: It happened because we believed that even the worst racist had the capacity to change.
column2: 这个组织之所以存在，就因为我们相信即使是最顽固的种族主义分子也存在改造的可能性。

column1: And I think we in South Africa have not done badly; at least that is what the rest of the world seems to think of our transformation and the TRC process.
column2: 而且我认为南非在这方面做得不坏，至少世界其它国家对我们的改造与和解努力都比较认同。

column1: Because an “eye for an eye” can never work when communities are in conflict – reprisal leads to a counter-reprisal in the sort of blood spiral we are seeing in the Middle East.
column2: 因为“以眼还眼”在战争中永远不会发挥作用，报复之后是反报复，会使我们陷入中东那样的血腥循环而无力自拔。

column1: The type of justice South Africa practiced, what I call “restorative justice” is, unlike retribution, not basically concerned with punishment, it is not fundamentally punitive.
column2: 南非推行的正是我所谓的“恢复性司法 ” ， 它不同于报复，从本质上讲与惩戒无关。

column1: It sets high store by healing.
column2: 它看重修复。

column1: The offence has caused a breach in relations and this breach needs to be healed.
column2: 犯罪行为破坏了社会关系，这种破坏需要人为的修补。

column1: It regards the offender as a person, as a subject with a sense of responsibility and a sense of shame, who needs to be reintegrated into the community and not ostracised.
column2: 它把罪犯当成人来看待，把他们当做有责任感、有廉耻心的主体，我们要做的是把他们重新纳入社会，而不是就此排斥在外。

column1: There is a wealth of wisdom in the old ways of African society.
column2: 古老的非洲社会蕴藏着很多智慧。

column1: Justice was a communal affair and society set a high store by social harmony and peace.
column2: 他们认为司法是一项公共事务，而社会看重的是融洽与和谐。

column1: The belief was that a person is a person only through other persons, and a broken person needed to be helped to be healed .What the offence had disturbed should be restored, and the offender and the victim had to be helped to be reconciled.
column2: 他们相信人只有透过他人才能实现自我的完善，而破碎的人格需要别人的帮助才能够得以复原。 犯罪行为破坏的秩序需要得到恢复，而我们必须协助罪犯和受害者实现和解。

column1: Justice as retribution often ignores the victim and the system is usually impersonal and cold.
column2: 惩罚性的司法常常忽视受��者的存在，这样的制度冰冷、缺乏人情。

column1: Restorative justice is hopeful.
column2: 而恢复性的司法则充满了希望。

column1: It believes that even the worst offender can become a better person.
column2: 它相信即便是最恶劣的罪犯也能向好的方面发展。

column1: This does not mean being soft on crime.
column2: 这样做并不是对犯罪行为的姑息迁就。

column1: Offenders must realize the seriousness of their offences by the kind of sentences they get, but there must be hope, hope that the offender can become a useful member of society, after paying the price they owe to society.
column2: 犯罪分子必须通过审判意识到自身行为的严重后果。 但我们同样不能放弃希望，要让罪犯在付出必要的代价后，重新成为社会中有用的一员。

column1: When we act as if we really believe that someone can be better, is better, then they will often rise to our expectations.
column2: 如果我们本着信任的原则去为人处事，那么即使是犯罪分子也不会辜负我们的期望。

column1: Biomedicine in Reverse
column2: 生物医学逆风飞扬

column1: LA JOLLA, CALIFORNIA – Pundits have long predicted that biology would dominate the twenty-first century, just as physics dominated the twentieth century.
column2: 拉荷亚，加利福尼亚—权威人士早就预测，生物学将主宰二十一世纪，正如物理学主宰二十世纪。

column1: But biomedical research has yet to achieve the kind of productivity increases that accompanied the industrialization of combustion, electricity, and electronics.
column2: 但生物医学研究并为实现与伴随燃烧、电力和电子的产业化所出现的那种生产率提升。

column1: Will the “century of biology” turn out to be little more than a fantasy?
column2: “生物学的世纪”最后会成为镜花水月吗？

column1: The problem largely comes down to a decrease in biomedical research-and-development expenditure.
column2: 这一问题在很大程度上可以归结为生物医学研发支出的下降。

column1: As it stands, roughly $270 billion is invested in the field each year, producing an impressive half-million research publications, but only 20-30 new medicines.
column2: 目前，该领域每年的投资规模大约为2,700亿美元，产生令人瞩目的五十万项发表成果，但只能带来20—30种新药。

column1: The discrepancy between spending and output adheres to what has come to be known as “Eroom’s law” – Moore’s law in reverse.
column2: 支出和产出之间的矛盾符合所谓的“逆摩尔定律 ” 。

column1: Moore’s law observes the increase in computer processing power over time – specifically, that the number of transistors that can be placed cheaply on an integrated circuit doubles every 18-24 months.
column2: 摩尔定律是关于计算机处理能随时间增长而变化的定律，具体而言，在一块集成电路上所能廉价布置的晶体管数量每18—24个月会翻一番。

column1: By contrast, Eroom’s law charts the regress in new drug approvals, noting that the costs of developing a new medicine double roughly every nine years.
column2: 相反，逆摩尔定律是关于新药批准数量的，该定律指出，开发新药的成本大约每九年会翻一番。

column1: This phenomenon is rooted in high rates of drug failure and lengthening technology cycles.
column2: 这一现象的根源在于药品失败率极高以及技术周期极长。

column1: The probability that a drug entering clinical trials will gain approval from the US Food and Drug Administration has dropped from 23.9% in 1997 to 10.4% today.
column2: 进入临床试验的药品获得美国食品和药品监督局（Food and Drug Administration）批准的概率从1997年的23.9%下降至如今的10.4 % 。

column1: While the first recombinant insulin in the 1980’s took less than a decade from testing to approval, monoclonal antibodies and gene therapy took more than 20 years to reach the same milestone.
column2: 20世纪80年代，第一个合成胰岛素花了不到十年的时间走完了从测试到批准的过程，但单株抗体和基因疗法却用了20多年才抵达了同样的目的地。

column1: So far, pharmaceutical and biomedical research firms have responded to Eroom’s law by cutting R&D or moving it to less expensive sites in Asia, shifting their focus to less prevalent diseases, and sourcing innovation externally.
column2: 目前，药品和生物医学研究公司应对逆摩尔定律的办法是削减研发或将其转移至成本较低的亚洲、将研发焦点移向重要性较低的疾病，以及将创新外包了事。

column1: As a result, growth in biomedical R&D spending has declined from more than 9% annually in the early 2000’s to less than 3% today.
column2: 结果，生物医学研发支出增长率从本世纪之处的年均9%下降到现在的不到3 % 。

column1: But, while this strategy will moderate the impact of Eroom’s law, it will ultimately prove inadequate to sustain the industry.
column2: 但是，尽管这一战略缓和了逆摩尔定律的影响，但最终也无法维持整个行业。

column1: The industry’s ability to support R&D budgets has already led to the closure of more than 30 major research sites.
column2: 医药业支持研发预算的能力下降已导致30多家大型研究机构关闭。

column1: The United States bore the brunt of these closures, with biomedical R&D expenditure declining by more than $12 billion from 2007 to 2012.
column2: 美国是研究机构关闭的主要地区，从2007年到2012年，美国生物医学研发支出下降了120多亿美元。

column1: And Asia – where biomedical R&D is growing rapidly, but from a small base – is unlikely to pick up the slack.
column2: 而亚洲的生物医学研发虽然增长很快，但基数很低，不可能填补空白。

column1: Asian countries have tended to be reluctant to shoulder the cost of developing new medicines, with reimbursements falling far short of US levels, and their R&D productivity will not match that of the US and Europe for several more years.
column2: 亚洲国家一向不愿意承担开发新药的成本，新药研发回报远低于美国水平，研发生产率也比美国和欧洲落后多年。

column1: Moreover, biomedical research firms are abandoning certain diseases in order to avoid the large-scale trials that they require, focusing instead on “orphan diseases” like cystic fibrosis, which demand smaller clinical trials that have a higher probability of success, leading to drugs that can cost more than $100,000 annually per patient.
column2: 此外，生物医学研究公司正在放弃某些疾病以免去这些疾病所要求的大规模试验，而专注于囊包性纤维症等“孤儿病 ” （ orphan diseases ） ， 这些疾病只需要较小规模的临床试验，成功概率更高，而由此产生的新药每年要花费每位病人100,000多美元。

column1: But, with insurers and payers worldwide becoming increasingly vigilant about controlling costs, this business model’s long-term prospects are unclear.
column2: 但是，随着全球保险公司和支付人越来越关注成本控制，这一商业模式的长期前景并不乐观。

column1: Finally, while drugs are increasingly produced by small companies that larger pharmaceutical firms then acquire, funding for these start-ups is drying up.
column2: 最后，尽管药品日益由小公司生产，获得成功后再由大型制药公司收购，但这些创业企业的资金源正在枯竭。

column1: Likewise, universities – the main source of biomedical innovation – are facing dwindling budgets.
column2: 类似地，作为生物医学创新主要源泉的大学也在面临预算缩水问题。

column1: This year, funding for the US National Institutes of Health (NIH) – one of the world’s leading medical research centers – is a billion dollars lower than in 2012.
column2: 今年，美国国家卫生研究所（National Institutes of Health，NIH，世界领先的医学研究中心）的资金比2012年减少了十亿美元。

column1: Restoring funding for basic biomedical research appears to have lost favor with policymakers, because it does not offer immediate self-sustaining economic returns.
column2: 恢复对基础生物医学研究的拨款似乎并不受决策者待见，因为这无法立刻产生能自我维持的经济回报。

column1: And funding for basic research remains a low priority in emerging economies like China, where it accounts for less than 15 cents for every research dollar spent (compared to 35 cents in the US).
column2: 而在中国等新兴经济体，基础研究拨款的优先等级也很低，并且每1美元的研究投入只能产生15美分（美国是35美分 ） 。

column1: With no panacea in sight, several other solutions are gaining traction.
column2: 在看不见万灵丹的情况下，一些其他办法正在获得关注。

column1: To maximize investment, the public and private sectors are increasingly pooling resources.
column2: 为了实现投资最大化，公私部门正在日益集中资源。

column1: For example, under the Accelerating Medicines Partnership, the NIH and ten biopharmaceutical companies will fund a five-year effort to validate promising targets in three disease areas.
column2: 比如，在医学合作出金计划（Accelerating Medicines Partnership）中，NIH和十家生物制药公司将为一个五年计划提供资金，旨在在三种疾病领域实现承诺目标。

column1: Other initiatives include efforts in Alzheimer’s research to test competing drugs against one shared “placebo arm” in clinical trials, and in cancer research to test multiple therapies in a single trial and identify the most responsive patients.
column2: 其他项目包括在阿尔兹海默症研究中检测不同药品在临床试验中对同一“安慰剂”的对比效果，以及在癌症研究的单一试验中测试多种疗法和识别反应最强的患者。

column1: These pooled resources will be directed to a few high-priority diseases, identified through an evaluation of the marginal benefit of additional R&D. Japan’s focused strategy to champion stem-cell R&D should serve as a model for other countries.
column2: 这些���中起来的资源将被用于一些较紧迫的疾病，通过对研发增量的边际收益来评估。 日本集中资源推进干细胞研发的战略可以作为其他国家的榜样。

column1: At the same time, governments will have to implement policies aimed at guiding investment toward specific diseases.
column2: 与此同时，政府必须实施旨在引导针对具体疾病的投资的政策。

column1: For example, increased NIH funding, extended market exclusivity, and relaxed regulatory hurdles in the US resulted in a renaissance in antibiotic drug development.
column2: 比如，NIH拨款的增加、广阔的专属市场以及宽松的监管让美国的抗生素药物开发迎来了第二春。

column1: Society will also have to share the cost of drug development.
column2: 社会也必须共同承担药品开发的成本。

column1: Regulatory agencies worldwide may follow the United Kingdom’s lead in embracing adaptive licensing.
column2: 全球监管机构可以效仿英国的先例，实施适应性许可制度。

column1: Under this approach, drugs are conditionally approved and marketed, with the revenue generated following the conditional approval covering the costly trial for proving efficacy.
column2: 根据这一办法，药品被有条件批准和上市，用有条件批准后所获得的收入覆盖昂贵的药效验证试验。

column1: Such a scheme facilitates lower drug pricing, while overcoming the effect of Eroom’s law on investment in treatments for many diseases.
column2: 这一制度有助于降低药价，同时克服许多疾病治疗投资上逆摩尔定律。

column1: Whether these efforts will succeed in putting biomedical research on a more sustainable footing remains an open question.
column2: 这些方法能否让生物医学研究走上更加可持续的道路仍未可知。

column1: This could still turn out to be biology’s century.
column2: 本世纪或许仍然是生物学的世纪。

column1: But it is not a sure thing.
column2: 但这绝不是百分百确定的事情。

column1: Infrastructure’s Class of Its Own
column2: 基础设施应单独成一类

column1: BEIJING – After several months of disappointing economic indicators, China’s State Council has unveiled a “mini-stimulus” package, focused on social-housing construction and railway expansion.
column2: 北京—近几个月来，中国的经济指标令人失望，中国国务院抛出了集中于社会保障房和铁路建设的“迷你刺激”计划。

column1: The decision came a month after Premier Li Keqiang’s declaration that China had set its annual growth target at “around 7.5%” – the same as last year’s goal.
column2: 此前一个月，李克强总理宣布中国的年增长目标是“7.5%左右 ” ， 与去年持平。

column1: The implication is clear: While consumption-driven growth remains a long-term goal for China, infrastructure will continue – at least in the short term – to serve as a key driver of China’s economy.
column2: 言下之意是明确的：尽管消费推动型增长仍是中国的长期目标，但基础设施 — — 至少在短期 — — 依然是中国经济的重要推动力。

column1: Of course, China is not the only economy that depends on infrastructure investment to buttress economic growth.
column2: 当然，中国决非唯一一个依赖基础设施投资支持经济增长的经济体。

column1: The World Bank estimates that infrastructure investments accounted for nearly half of the acceleration in Sub-Saharan Africa’s economic growth in 2001-2005.
column2: 世界银行估算，2001—2005年，基础设施投资贡献了撒哈拉以南非洲地区经济增长加速的近一半。

column1: According to the Bank, a 10% increase in infrastructure investment is associated with GDP growth of 1%.
column2: 据世界银行的数据，基础设施投资增加10%将伴随GDP增长1 % 。

column1: Such investment also creates jobs, both in the short term, by creating demand for materials and labor, and in the long term, for related services.
column2: 这笔投资还能创造就业 — — 从短期看，是通过创造对原材料和劳动力的需求；从长期看，是通过创造对相关服务的需求。

column1: For example, every $100 million invested in rural road maintenance translates into an estimated 25,000-50,000 job opportunities.
column2: 比如，每1亿美元农村公路维持投���可以创造约25,000—50,000个就业机会。

column1: But these benefits are diluted in China, owing to its excessive reliance on public funding.
column2: 但这些好处在中国被稀释了，因为中国过度依赖公共融资。

column1: Indeed, in recent years, less than 0.03% of Chinese infrastructure investment – which amounted to roughly 9% of GDP – was derived from private capital.
column2: 事实上，在最近几年中，中国基础设施投资（约占GDP的9 % ） 中只有不到0.03%来自私人资本。

column1: This problem is not limited to China; of the 7.2% of GDP that Asian countries spend, on average, on infrastructure development, only about 0.2% is privately funded.
column2: 这不仅仅是中国的问题；平均而言，亚洲国家将GDP的7.2%花在了基础设施开发上，其中只有0.2%为私人供资。

column1: By contrast, in Latin America and the Caribbean, private capital finances, respectively, 1.9% and 1.6% of infrastructure investment.
column2: 相反，在拉丁美洲和加勒比地区，基础设施投资的私人资本融资比例分别为1.9%和1.6 % 。

column1: Discussions within the G-20 have produced two possible explanations for Asian countries’ inability to attract more private capital to infrastructure projects.
column2: 二十国集团的内部讨论就亚洲国家无法吸引更多私人资本投向基础设施项目的问题提出了两个解释。

column1: Most developing countries argue that the problem is rooted in the provision of capital, with investors preferring to fill their infrastructure portfolios with low-risk projects, and insurance companies and banks facing overly restrictive regulations.
column2: 大部分发展中国家认为问题的根源在于资本供给，投资者更喜欢投资低风险基础设施项目，而保险公司和银行业面临着过度严格的监管。

column1: OECD countries like Germany counter that the problem is the lack of investment-worthy assets; there are simply not enough bankable projects available.
column2: 德国等经合组织国家反驳说问题在于缺少值得投资的资产；即这只不过是可获得银行可接受的项目太少的缘故。

column1: In fact, both explanations are correct – but neither is complete.
column2: 事实上，两种解释都是正确的 — — 但都有失偏颇。

column1: It is time for Asia’s leaders to recognize that the lack of private funding for infrastructure projects cannot be reduced to one or even two problems, and to develop comprehensive solutions that account for the full scope of the challenge.
column2: 亚洲领导人应该认识到，私人基础设施项目融资的缺乏不是一两个问题那么简单，他们应该寻找全面的解决方案彻底解决这一挑战。

column1: This requires, first and foremost, abandoning the view that infrastructure assets fit into the paradigm of traditional asset classes like equity, debt, or real estate.
column2: 这首先需要抛弃一个观点，即基础设施资产可以按照股本、债务或不动产等传统资产类别范式归类。

column1: Infrastructure must be redefined as a new asset class, based on several considerations.
column2: 基础设施必须重新定义为新的资产类别，有几个方面需要考虑。

column1: For starters, there is the public-good element of many infrastructure projects, which demands contingent government obligations like universal coverage levels for basic services.
column2: 首先，许多基础设施项目包含公共品性质，这意味着或有政府义务，类似于基本服务的普遍覆盖。

column1: In order to make such projects more appealing to private investors, economic externalities should be internalized, and a link should be established between the internal rate of return, which matters to a commercial investor, and the economic rate of return, which matters to society.
column2: 要让这类项目产生对私人投资者的吸引力，经济外部性就必须内部化，内在回报率（商业投资者所关心的问题）和经济回报率（社会所关心的问题）之间必须建立联系。

column1: Moreover, innovative mechanisms to supply new assets to investors would be needed – and that requires the creativity found and priced by markets.
column2: 此外，需要向投资者提供新资产的创新机制 — — 而这需要市场来发现和定价创造力。

column1: To this end, private-sector sponsors must be given space to initiate valuable projects.
column2: 在这方面，私人部门出资者必须获得发起有价值的项目的空间。

column1: The new asset class would need its own standardized risk/return profile, accounting, for example, for the political risks that public-sector involvement may imply and for the lower returns from infrastructure relative to traditional private equity.
column2: 新资产类别需要有其自身的风险/回报特征，比如，需要考察公共部门参与所隐含的政治风险以及基础设施回报低于传统私人股权的风险。

column1: Moreover, the risks associated with the new asset class would change as projects progress from feasibility study to construction to operation, implying that each phase would attract different sources of funding.
column2: 此外，与新资产类别伴随而生的风险会随着项目从可信性研究演进到建设和经营而变化，这意味着每一阶段吸引的资金源不同。

column1: A clear understanding of this process would enable potential investors to assess projects more effectively, which is critical to encouraging them to put up financing.
column2: 清晰理解这一过程将使潜在投资者能够更有效地评估项目，而这是鼓励他们出钱的关键。

column1: Another important consideration is the considerable technical expertise that infrastructure investments demand, which makes them more complex than most assets.
column2: 另一个重要的考虑点是基础设施投资需要大量专家知识，这使得它们比大部分资产更复杂。

column1: Similarly, a specialized network of actors would be needed to ensure that intermediation of infrastructure transactions is efficient and cost-effective, instead of fragmented and slow, as it is now.
column2: 类似地，还需要行动方的专业化网络以确保基础设施交易中介效率高、成本低，而不是想现在那样分散且行动缓慢。

column1: For countries that lack China’s strong fiscal position, the need to attract private capital to infrastructure investment is obvious.
column2: 对于财政状况不如中国的国家来说，吸引私人资本参与基础设施投资的需要是显而易见的。

column1: With nearly 70% of Sub-Saharan Africa’s population lacking access to electricity and 65% of South Asians lacking access to basic sanitation, there is no greater imperative than to plan, fund, build, and maintain infrastructure assets.
column2: 撒哈拉以南非洲有70%人口无法得到电力，65%的南亚人没有基本卫生设施，规划、融资、建设和维护基础设施资产的需求极其迫切。

column1: But private investment in infrastructure remains vital even in countries like China, because it brings the power and dynamism of the market, which improves the allocation of capital and promotes transparency.
column2: 但基础设施私人投资对于中国这样的国家也是至关重要的，因为它能带来市场的力量和活力，从而改善资本配置、增加透明度。

column1: Indeed, more private-sector involvement would make the kind of scandals that have occurred in China’s railway sector far less likely.
column2: 事实上，更多私人部门的参与将让类似中国铁路部门腐败这样的丑闻可能性大幅下降。

column1: In short, redefining infrastructure as a new asset class is the only credible way to attract funding for infrastructure construction, and thus to boost long-term economic growth and the employment rate.
column2: 简言之，将基础设施重新定义为新资产类别是吸引基础设施建设融资、从而提振长期经济增长和就业率的唯一可行的办法。

column1: It is time for Asia’s leaders to step up.
column2: 亚洲领导人应该行动起来。

column1: The West’s Other Trump
column2: 西方的另一个特朗普

column1: BRUSSELS – In the second American presidential debate, Donald Trump promised that, if elected, he would appoint a special prosecutor to investigate Hillary Clinton.
column2: 布鲁塞尔—在第二场美国总统竞选辩论中，唐纳德·特朗普承诺如果当选将任命一位特别检察官调查希拉里·克林顿。

column1: “You’d be in jail,” Trump told her.
column2: “你会进监狱的 ， ” 特朗普对她说。

column1: Trump’s threat to politicize the justice system has received the backlash that it deserves; but, sadly, his cynicism is not unique to the United States.
column2: 特朗普的司法体系政治化威胁遭到了应有的口诛笔伐；但悲哀的是，他的犬儒主义并非美国所独有。

column1: The current Polish government, led by the Law and Justice (PiS) party, which came to power just under a year ago, has displayed a similar authoritarian streak, flouting legal conventions to further its own ends.
column2: 现任波兰政府在掌权快一年的法律与正义党（PiS）的领导下，表现出类似的极权主义特征，通过践踏法律推行自己的目标。

column1: PiS leader Jarosław Kaczyński has repeatedly called for an inquiry into former Polish Prime Minister and current European Council President Donald Tusk.
column2: PiS领导人雅罗斯瓦夫·卡钦斯基多次要求调查前波兰总理、现任欧洲理事会主席唐纳德·图斯克。

column1: Kaczyński holds Tusk’s former government partially responsible for the April 2010 plane crash in Smolensk, Russia, which killed 96, including Kaczyński’s twin brother, Polish President Lech Kaczyński.
column2: 卡钦斯基指责图斯克的前任政府要为2010年4月俄罗斯斯摩棱斯克坠机事件负有部分责任。 该事件导致96人死亡，包括卡钦斯基的双胞胎兄弟、波兰总统莱赫·卡钦斯基。

column1: The Polish government delegation was traveling to a commemoration of the 1940 massacre in Katyn, where Stalin ordered the murder of 22,000 Polish army officers, police officers, and intelligentsia and blamed Hitler for the crime.
column2: 遇难的波兰政府代表团前往斯摩棱斯克参加1940年卡廷大屠杀纪念活动。 在卡廷大屠杀中，斯大林下令杀害了22,000名波兰军官、警官和知识分子，并栽赃给希特勒。

column1: When the Cold War ended, the truth about the massacre finally came out, and was officially recognized by Russian President Boris Yeltsin.
column2: 冷战结束后，卡廷大屠杀真相大白，并由俄罗斯总统叶利钦予以正式承认。

column1: Jarosław Kaczyński and other PiS members maintain that Russia – with help from some Polish officials – was responsible for the plane crash, too.
column2: 雅罗斯拉夫·卡钦斯基和其他PiS党员认为俄罗斯 — — 在一些波兰官员的帮助下 — — 也要为坠机事件负责。

column1: They have relied on this bizarre conspiracy theory in their rise to power, despite having no evidence to support it.
column2: 他们依靠这个奇特的阴谋论上台，尽管根本没有证据支持他们的主张。

column1: Indeed, transcripts from the plane’s recovered cockpit voice recorder indicate that the plane crashed during a bad-weather landing.
column2: 事实上，复原的飞机驾驶舱录音表明，飞机是在糟糕天气下着陆时坠毁。

column1: Armed with his conspiracy theories, Kaczyński wants to deny Tusk a second term at the helm of one of the European Union’s three main governing institutions, saying, “Should such a person be at the head of the European Council?
column2: 卡钦斯基想借助阴谋论阻挠图斯克作为欧盟三大治理机构之一首脑的第二个任期，称“这样一个人可以担任欧洲理事会首脑吗？

column1: I have profound doubts.”
column2: 我表示深切的怀疑 。 ”

column1: Meanwhile, Poland’s right-wing media has fanned the flames, with one magazine recently depicting Tusk in handcuffs.
column2: 与此同时，波兰右翼媒体也在煽风点火，某杂志最近刊出图斯克戴手铐的漫画。

column1: Kaczyński’s anti-Tusk crusade is a Trump-worthy abuse of political power that foreshadows what life would be like for Trump’s political opponents if he were actually to win.
column2: 卡钦斯基的反图斯克运动是特朗普式政治权力的滥用，它预示了如果特朗普真的当选，他的政治对手命运会如何。

column1: It also reflects a broader, raging battle for Poland’s soul.
column2: 它也反映了更加宽泛和激烈的波兰心灵之战。

column1: Poland was once Central Europe’s post-Cold War democratic poster child.
column2: 波兰曾经是中欧后冷战时代民主榜样。

column1: But now the PiS is pursuing a wide-ranging power grab, seeking control of the country’s constitutional court, public media channels, and security services.
column2: 但如今，PiS正在追求权力一把抓，寻求控制波兰宪法法院、公共媒体频道和安全部门。

column1: Instead of cementing Poland’s strategic importance to NATO and its rightful place as a powerful, respected EU member state, the PiS has become obsessed with reversing modernity.
column2: PiS不去巩固波兰对北约的战略重要性，不去追求波兰作为受尊重的强大欧盟成员国的应有地位，而是沉迷于扭转现代性。

column1: As proof, one need look no further than the government’s assault on its own judiciary and democratic institutions, which is raising eyebrows in the US, Brussels, and across Europe.
column2: 要想证实这一点，只需要看看政府对其自身司法和民主制度的抨击，这已经引起了美国、布鲁塞尔和整个欧洲的不满。

column1: Poland is experiencing a constitutional crisis that began when PiS-backed Polish President Andrzej Duda refused to swear in three Constitutional Tribunal judges chosen by the previous parliament.
column2: 从PiS支持的波兰总统安德烈·杜巴拒绝在前任议会所选定的三位宪法法庭法官面前宣誓就职开始，波兰面临着一场宪政危机。

column1: The PiS then selected its own judges instead, while adopting legislation that essentially paralyzed the court.
column2: PiS随后用自己选择的法官替换之，同时实施了让宪法法庭基本瘫痪的立法。

column1: The court declared the PiS’s judicial rule changes unconstitutional, but the PiS-led government refused to publish the court’s decision, thereby blocking it from taking effect.
column2: 宪法法庭宣布PiS的司法规则修订违宪，但PiS领导的政府拒绝公布法庭裁决，从而阻止了它的生效。

column1: It is now all but impossible for the court to assess the constitutionality of the current parliament’s legislation, despite the Polish constitution’s explicit provision authorizing judicial review.
column2: 如今，宪法法庭根本无从评估本届议会立法的合宪性，尽管波兰宪法明文规定了授权司法审查。

column1: Now that the PiS’s actions have been universally condemned, it is holding out until the end of the year, when the current constitutional court president’s mandate expires.
column2: 由于PiS的行为受到了一致谴责，这一问题将搁置直至年底现任宪法法庭主席任期届满。

column1: After that, the PiS will appoint a friendlier president, who will no doubt dance to whatever tune it plays.
column2: 随后，PiS将任命一位更加友好的主席，毫无疑问，他将顺应PiS的要求。

column1: But a newly appointed president likely won’t end Poland’s constitutional crisis, because with valid court judgments from this summer remaining unpublished, there is now a black hole in Poland’s constitutional order.
column2: 但新任命主席可能无法结束波兰的宪政危机，因为由于今年夏天的那宗有法律效力的裁决不公布，波兰宪政秩序中产生了一个黑洞。

column1: The EU has started legal proceedings against Poland, and it is calling on the Polish government to work with opposition parties to reform the court.
column2: 欧盟已经开始针对波兰的法律程序，要求波兰政府与反对党合作改革宪法法院。

column1: If Poland doesn’t comply, the EU could ultimately strip it of its voting rights.
column2: 如果波兰不服从，欧盟可能剥夺其投票权。

column1: But it is unlikely that the EU or other international bodies will ensure a solution to the Polish political problem.
column2: 但欧盟或其他国际机构不可能保证找到波兰政治问题的解决办法。

column1: Only Poles can do that.
column2: 只有波兰人可以。

column1: In fact, huge protests against a recent bill that would have banned virtually all abortions (under penalty of imprisonment for up to five years) forced the government to back down and withdraw the proposed legislation.
column2: 事实上，反对一项新法案的大规模示威已经迫使波兰政府收回立法提案。 该法案将禁止几乎一切堕胎行为（堕胎行为将导致最多五年刑期的处罚 ） 。

column1: This marked a victory for Polish women, and it suggests that Poland is more progressive than Kaczyński would like to believe.
column2: 这标志着波兰女性的胜利，并且表明波兰比卡钦斯基所认为的更加进步。

column1: Still, while the government may have suffered one major public defeat, the PiS’s underlying ideological illiberalism remains intact.
column2: 但是，尽管波兰政府可能遭到重大公共挫折，作为PiS意识形态基础的反自由主义（illiberalism）仍然完好无损。

column1: That means Polish civil-society advocates will have to fight many more battles in the coming months to contain and reverse the PiS’s lawlessness.
column2: 这意味着波兰公民社会支持者必须在未来几个月中进行更多斗争以阻止和扭转PiS对法律的漠视。

column1: A Good German Idea for 2018
column2: 2018年的德国好概念

column1: ATHENS – By 2016, almost all Europeans had realized that radical policy and institutional reforms were essential to revive the European project.
column2: 雅典—2016年，几乎所有欧洲人都认识到，要复兴欧洲工程，必须采取果断政策和制度改革。

column1: Yet serious reform was impeded by the usual disagreement about what should be done – a dispute that Emmanuel Macron, France’s new president, once described as a “holy war” between German and French elites.
