column2: 但深度改革遇到了常见的障碍 — — 对应该怎么做产生了分歧，法国新总统马克龙曾经将这一分歧称为德国和法国精英之间的“神圣战争 ” 。

column1: The year just ended, highlighted by the election of a French president much to German Chancellor Angela Merkel’s liking, demonstrated that, ultimately, it does not really matter who rules in Berlin and in Paris, or how much they like each other.
column2: 在刚刚过去的一年里，法国选出了一位颇合德国总理默克尔胃口的总统，这表明，说到底，谁在柏林和巴黎主政，或者主政者彼此有多喜欢，其实都不重要。

column1: The “holy war” persists, even if the missiles with which each side demolishes the other’s proposals are now wrapped in diplomatic velvet.
column2: “神圣战争”在继续，虽然双方用来反驳对方的方案的导弹目前仍包裹着外交的天鹅绒。

column1: At the heart of this Franco-German war is the clash between two Rs: the German commitment to rectitude versus the French penchant for redistribution.
column2: 这场法德战争的核心是两个R之间的碰撞：德国坚持要公正（rectitude ） ， 而法国则更想要再分配（redistribution ） 。

column1: German officials greet every French government proposal by mentally computing its cost for German taxpayers.
column2: 德国官员表面欢迎每一项法国政府的方案，心里则在算计这给德国纳税人所带来的成本。

column1: And, behind every German counter-proposal, French officials see a ploy to hide behind rules and regulations so that the German elites can have their cake and eat it.
column2: 而在每一份德国的针锋相对的方案背后，法国官员看到了一个藏在规则和监管背后的诡计，即德国精英能够分得一杯羹。

column1: Europe’s continued slide into stagnation and disrepute is the natural outcome.
column2: 欧洲就在不断的分歧之间陷入了停滞，而名誉扫地只是自然而然的结果。

column1: Perhaps the German insistence on rectitude is right, although not in a sense that German officials will necessarily appreciate.
column2: 也许德国坚持公正并不错，只不过未必是在德国官员所欣赏的意义上。

column1: I could not, in good conscience, side credibly with any French, Italian, or Greek proponent of redistribution if their proposals violated the principles of rectitude.
column2: 凭良心说，我无法“无脑站边”任何法国、意大利或希腊所提出的再分配方案，如果这些方案有违公正原则的话。

column1: Doing what is right is, surely, superior to doing what is wrong, but expedient.
column2: 做正确的事当然要比作错误但权宜的事更重要。

column1: But then the question becomes: What is the right thing to do?
column2: 但是问题来了：什么是正确的事？

column1: And how can we agree on any answer, given our different interests, dispositions, and cultural backgrounds?
column2: 在我们的利益、配置和文化背景各不相同的情况下，如何就某个答案形成一致？

column1: One thing is certain: We will never find out what rectitude commands if we are driven solely by our “interests.”
column2: 有一点是确定的：如果我们只受我们的“利益”的驱使，那么我们永远无法理解公正的含义。

column1: Europe’s impasse is largely due to a standoff between opposing desires, objectives, and concerns: German fears of Greco-Latin rule-bending will always trump French fears of German empire-building, and vice versa.
column2: 欧洲的僵局主要是因为截然相反的愿望、目标和关注点导致的：德国担心希腊-拉丁的规则扭曲永远甚于法国担心德国的帝国缔造，反之亦然。

column1: But if prejudicial desires lead to a dead end, and fail to reveal the right course of action, where does the key to rectitude lie?
column2: 但如果存有偏见的愿望导致僵局，也无法揭示正确的行动，那么公正的关键又在于何处？

column1: “We should all do our duty” – a very German reply – merely displaces the disagreement to another plane, where we interminably debate competing duties.
column2: “我们都应该做好应尽之责 ” — —相当“德国”的回答 — — 这只不过是用一个分歧取代另一个分歧，互相的矛盾的职责之间同样存在无尽的扯皮。

column1: All madmen in authority, after all, believed they were doing their duty.
column2: 毕竟，掌权的疯子们都相信他们在尽自己的职责。

column1: So the question becomes: “How can I know what my duty entails?”
column2: 于是问题变成了 ： “ 我如何知道我的职责包含哪些 ？ ”

column1: A theist answer is equally unacceptable, given the monstrous crimes carried out by zealots convinced they were fulfilling their divine duty.
column2: 一神论的答案同样是不可接受的，因为认定自己在履行神赐责任的狂热分子犯下过滔天罪行。

column1: The best answer I have come across is German: Immanuel Kant’s, to be precise.
column2: 我所见过的最佳答案是德国的：准确的说，是康德的。

column1: For Kant, who struggled to re-define ethics in a new era of market societies, our duty can and must be deduced from our capacity for rationality.
column2: 康德苦心积虑想要在市场社会的新时代重新定义伦理，对他来说，我们的职责可以，也必须从我们的理性能力中衍生。

column1: Unlike personal tastes, which are fickle and offer no sure path to happiness or virtue, duties can be discerned by a logical mechanism common to all humans.
column2: 和个人品味不同 — — 个人品味可以轻易改变，无法提供通往快乐或美德之路 — — 职责可以通过所有人类所共有的逻辑机制领会。

column1: To be rational means more than being able to deploy your means efficiently in order to achieve your ends.
column2: 理性意味着你不仅仅能为了实现自己的目标而使用手段。

column1: All sorts of animals are good at matching available means to given ends.
column2: 对于给定的目标，所有动物都擅长用可用的手段来与之匹配。

column1: But humans are unique, Kant insists, because, unlike cats and dogs, we can pass rational judgment on our desires.
column2: 但人类是独特的，康德说，因为和猫狗不同，我们能够对我们的愿望进行道德评判。

column1: We can ask ourselves, “I like X, but should I?”
column2: 我们可以扪心自问 ， “ 我喜欢X，但这应该吗 ？ ”

column1: And we can say, “It is my duty to do Y, even though Y will probably lead to outcomes I dislike, given my expectations of what others will do.”
column2: 我们也可以说 ， “ 基于我对其他人会怎么做的预期，我有责任做Y，尽管Y有可能导致我不喜欢的结果 。 ”

column1: But if the mark of a rational person is a capacity to act on reasons transcending cost-benefit analysis, how can our rational duty be deduced impartially, free of the influence of personal interests or prejudices?
column2: 但如果理性人的标志是基于超越成本-收益分析的理由来行动的能力，我们如何来不偏不倚地推演我们的理性指责，而不受个人利益或偏见的影响？

column1: Kant offers a famous example: Language is what distinguishes us from other species; without it, we are mere beasts.
column2: 康德提出了一个著名的例子：语言是区分我们和其他物种的关键；没有语言，我们就只是野兽。

column1: While lying often pays, if we all lied all the time, language would become obsolete.
column2: 尽管说谎常常会带来好处，但如果我们总是说谎，语言就会成为障碍。

column1: Rational humans, Kant concludes, must recognize that they have a duty to abstain from a practice (lying) that, if adopted by everyone at once, would annul our most precious invention (language).
column2: 理性人，康德推论说，必须认识到他们有责任克制某种行为（说谎 ） ， 如果每个人都做出这种行为的话，将会让我们最宝贵的发明（语言）作废。

column1: No god is necessary, no moralizing is required, to demonstrate our duty to tell the truth.
column2: 这里不需要上帝也不需要道德化来说明我们说真话的职责。

column1: Practical reasoning is all it takes: A world where everyone lies is one in which human rationality, which depends entirely on language, dies.
column2: 实践理性足矣：在所有人都说谎的世界，完全取决于语言的人类理性将被杀死。

column1: So it is our rational duty to tell the truth, regardless of the benefits lying might bring in practice.
column2: 因此，说真话是我们的理性职责，不管在实际中说谎会带来多少收益。

column1: Applied to market societies, Kant’s idea yields fascinating conclusions.
column2: 应用于市场社会，康德的概念会产生一些极好的结论。

column1: Strategic reductions in price to undercut a competitor pass the test of rational duty (as long as prices do not fall below costs).
column2: 策略性降价以破坏竞争对手能通过理性职责测试（只要价格不下降到成本线以下 ） 。

column1: After all, producing maximum quantities at minimum prices is the holy grail of any economy.
column2: 毕竟，以最低价格生产最大数量是一切经济的圣杯。

column1: But strategic reductions of wages to ever lower levels (the Uberization of society) cannot be rational, because the result would be a catastrophic collapse, owing to disappearing aggregate demand.
column2: 但策略性地不断降低工资 — — 社会的优步化（Ubersization ） — —则必然是非理性的，因为其结果将是总需求消失进而导致灾难性崩盘。

column1: Turning to Europe, Kant’s principle implies important duties for governments and polities.
column2: 回到欧洲。 康德的原则暗示了政府和政策的重要职责。

column1: And Germany and France would be held to be in dereliction of their duties to a functioning Europe.
column2: 德国和法国应该因为对它们让欧洲正常运转的指责玩忽职守而受到谴责。

column1: If Germany’s current-account surpluses, currently running at 9% of GDP, were universalized, with every member state’s government, private sector, and households net savers, the euro would shoot through the roof, destroying most of Europe’s manufacturing.
column2: 如果德国的经常项目盈余 — — 目前占GDP的9 % — —平摊到各个成员国政府、私人部门和家庭净储蓄者头上的话，欧盟将会一飞冲天，破坏欧洲制造业大部。

column1: Equally, universalized Greco-Latin deficits would turn Europe into a basket case.
column2: 同样地，将希腊-拉丁债务平摊的话，欧洲也将陷入瘫痪。

column1: The trick, and our rational duty, is to embrace policies and to build institutions that are consistent with balanced trade and financial flows.
column2: 诀窍，以及我们的理性职责，在于制定政策、建设机构，使之与平衡贸易和金融流相一致。

column1: Put differently, authentic German rectitude cannot be achieved without a form of redistribution that is bound to clash with the interests of, say, a French or a Greek oligarchy too lazy to come to terms with its own unsustainability.
column2: 换言之，如果没有势必导致（比如）与懒得解决自身的不可持续问题的法国或希腊寡头的利益冲突的再分配的话，真正的德国式公正也无从实现。

column1: A critic of this German idea for reforming Europe might credibly ask why anyone should do their rational duty, rather than remain on the time-honored path of narrow self-interest?
column2: 这一德国式欧洲改革思维的批评者可能会不无道理地问，为何人们应该履行他们的理性职责，而不在经受时间考验的狭隘自利的老路上一直走下去？

column1: The only sound answer is: because there is no truly rational alternative.
column2: 唯一可靠的答案是：因为这不是真正的理性方案。

column1: Or, rather, the alternatives are all cant.
column2: 或者，其他方案都是伪善的。

column1: The Fertility Conundrum
column2: 生育难题

column1: BOSTON – It is perhaps inevitable that contraception and population growth are controversial topics, given the many perspectives brought to bear on them.
column2: 波士顿 — — 鉴于认识的角度多种多样，避孕和人口增长不可避免地会成为争议话题。

column1: Reproductive-health activists focus on family planning and a woman’s right to control her own body.
column2: 生殖健康活动人士关注计划生育和妇女控制身体的权利。

column1: Economists look at the impact on sustainable growth.
column2: 经济学家关注对可持续发展的影响。

column1: Governments fret about over-population and unemployment.
column2: 政府则担心人口泛滥和失业问题。

column1: Health workers worry about sexually transmitted diseases and malnutrition.
column2: 医务人员担心营养不良和性传播疾病。

column1: Striking the right balance among these different viewpoints is no easy task – but much depends on getting it right.
column2: 在不同的诉求之间实现恰到好处的平衡绝非易事 — — 但上述目标能否实现却在很多领域具有决定性意义。

column1: New contraceptive technologies – in the form of condoms, pills, and implantable devices – provide reversible and permanent forms of protection.
column2: 避孕套、避孕药和植入器械等全新避孕技术提供了可逆及永久形式的生殖保护。

column1: But their usage varies widely – from just 4.8% of young women in Chad to 84.6% in China – reflecting differences in cost, availability, and cultural norms.
column2: 但具体使用状况差异很大 — — 从乍得年轻女性的4.8%到中国青年女性的84.6 % — —反映出不同国家在成本、使用便捷度和文化规范方面的差异。

column1: Contraception indisputably brings health and socioeconomic benefits.
column2: 避孕无疑会带来健康和社会经济效益。

column1: A 2012 study reported that its use averted an estimated 272,040 maternal deaths in 2008, 44% fewer than might otherwise have occurred.
column2: 2012年的一份研究报告显示避孕措施仅在2008年估计就避免了272,040例产妇死亡，比不采取避孕措施的情况要低44 % 。

column1: Contraception use has also helped less developed economies by raising women’s employment and earnings potential.
column2: 避孕措施的使用还通过提高女性就业及收入能力帮助了欠发达经济体。

column1: But perhaps one of the most important economic effects of contraception concerns the “dependency ratio” – the proportion of available workers to pensioners, children, and the infirm.
column2: 但或许避孕最重要的经济影响涉及“抚养比率 ” — —也就是现有劳动力与养老金领取者、儿童和体弱者的比率。

column1: Lowering the birth rate lowers the overall dependency ratio – though at the risk of future labor shortages, weaker consumer spending, and reduced productivity.
column2: 降低生育率一般会降低总抚养率 — — 进而有可能造成未来劳动力短缺、消费力和生产力下降。

column1: And, as more people live longer, and the relative size of the working-age population falls, the dependency ratio can begin to rise, with serious socioeconomic repercussions, because older people require more health care and draw pensions.
column2: 而且人口寿命增加造成劳动年龄人口相对规模下降及抚养率攀升，并因为老年人需要领取养老金和获取更多医疗保健服务，因而造成严重的社会经济后果。

column1: On the other hand, rapid population growth as a result of higher birth rates can threaten the wellbeing of the poorest communities and countries, by altering the dependency ratio at the other end of the scale.
column2: 另一方面，出生率高所导致的人口快速增长通过改变天平另一端的抚养比率，可能威胁到最贫困群体和国家的福祉。

column1: Sub-Saharan Africa and the world’s other poorest regions have recorded significantly more than 2% annual population growth in recent years, whereas the demographic trend in the advanced economies of Europe and Asia has been flat or declining
column2: 撒哈拉以南非洲地区和世界其他最贫困地区近年来已经实现超过2%的年人口增长，而欧洲和亚洲先进经济体的人口基本呈平稳或下降趋势。

column1: Simulations indicate that the optimal average number of children born to a woman over her lifetime is around 2.3.
column2: 模拟计算显示女性一生的最佳平均产子数约为2.3个。

column1: This is the total fertility rate (TFR) required to maintain current population levels (the replacement rate).
column2: 这是维持目前人口水平（替代率）所需的总生育率（TFR ） 。

column1: Unfortunately, few countries strike the right balance, with country averages ranging from 6.9 (in Niger) to 0.8 (in Singapore).
column2: 遗憾的是，鲜有国家能恰到好处地实现平衡，各国的平均产子数从尼日尔的6.9人到新加坡的0.8人波动很大。

column1: The CIA World Factbook reports that 141 countries (approximately half of the world’s population) fall below the replacement rate, with population decline projected in some cases to reach 20% by 2050.
column2: 美国中情局世界概况报告显示有141个国家（约占一半的世界人口）处于替代率以下，某些情况下截止2050年的人口下降预计将达到20 % 。

column1: Some countries, such as Germany and France, are trying to raise their TFR to the replacement level.
column2: 有些国家，比方说德国和法国，正努力将总生育率提高到与替代率相等。

column1: Others are struggling to bring down their TFR, because of fears about future mass unemployment and social unrest.
column2: 还有些国家因为担心未来大规模失业和社会动荡而努力降低总生育率。

column1: In all cases, economic circumstances and social pressures will dictate the level and speed of population growth.
column2: 无论如何，经济环境和社会压力将决定人口增长的水平和速度。

column1: That is why much attention has focused on the impact of a growing global population on food demand.
column2: 这解释了人们为什么极为关注世界人口不断增长对粮食需求的影响问题。

column1: A rising population has been associated with starvation and malnutrition in some parts of the world.
column2: 人口增长在某些国家一直与饥饿和营养不良息息相关。

column1: Until recently, the global population was predicted to surpass 11 billion by 2050, triggering Malthusian fears.
column2: 不久前尚有预测显示全球人口到2050年将超过110亿，而这激起了马尔��斯主义者的忧虑。

column1: Thanks in part to lower fertility rates in industrialized countries, this projection has been adjusted downward, to about 8.9 billion.
column2: 幸亏工业化国家生育率较低，该预测数据已向下调整至约89亿。

column1: But such fears remain.
column2: 但依然存在这样的忧虑。

column1: The risk is that policymakers and campaigners will conflate the problems of food shortages and starvation with that of population management and its long-term social and economic consequences.
column2: 危险在于决策者及活动家把粮食短缺与饥饿问题和人口管理及其长期社会经济影响混淆在一起。

column1: In fact, according to a forecast in 2002 by the United Nations Food and Agricultural Organization (FAO), global food production will exceed the needs of the global population by the year 2030, largely owing to the Green Revolution of the past half-century.
column2: 事实上，联合国粮农组织（FAO）2002年的一份预测显示全球粮食产量到2030年将超过全球人口需求，这在很大程度上是因为过去半个世纪的绿色革命提高了粮食生产能力。

column1: Arguably, the causes of food shortages are to be found in the organization, distribution, and waste of resources, not population growth.
column2: 可以说，是组织、分配和资源浪费，而不是人口增长造成了粮食的短缺。

column1: The United Kingdom’s Institution of Mechanical Engineers estimated in 2013 that 1.2-2 billion tons of food (30-50% of total food production) is wasted annually.
column2: 英国机械工程师学会估计2013年每年浪费约12-20亿吨的粮食（相当于粮食总产量的30-50 % ） 。

column1: This far exceeds the 230 million tons of food produced in Sub-Saharan Africa.
column2: 这一数字远远超过了撒哈拉以南非洲地区生产的2.3亿吨粮食。

column1: At the same time, the FAO estimates that 870 million people worldwide – 90% of them living in developing countries – suffer chronic undernourishment.
column2: 与此同时，粮农组织估计全球8.7亿人 — — 其中90%生活在发展中国家 — — 受困于慢性营养不良症。

column1: Furthermore, approximately half of the 10.9 million children who die each year do so as a result of poor nutrition, while more than 1.4 billion adults and 40 million children are overweight or obese.
column2: 此外，每年死亡的1，090万儿童中约半数是因为营养不良，而超过14亿成人和4，000万儿童却为超重或肥胖所困。

column1: None of this should divert attention from the need to achieve a balance between population growth, appropriate dependency ratios for countries at different stages of economic development, and the fight for women’s reproductive rights.
column2: 这一切均不应将注意力从实现人口增长平衡、在不同经济发展阶段的国家维持恰当的抚养率和为女性生殖权利做斗争中转移开去。

column1: These are long-term issues that require international cooperation and collaborative research.
column2: 这些都是需要国际合作和共同研究的长期问题。

column1: Indeed, like climate change, population balance is a global issue that must be addressed carefully and rigorously – and before it is too late.
column2: 事实上，就像气候变化一样，人口平衡也是要赶在为时已晚之前认真严肃解决的世界性问题。

column1: Disrupting Putin’s Game Plan
column2: 干扰普京的游戏计划

column1: MUNICH – No sooner did the Sochi Winter Games end than Russia bade farewell to the Olympic spirit by invading and occupying a foreign country.
column2: 慕尼黑—索契冬奥会一结束，俄罗斯就和奥林匹克精神分道扬镳了 — — 它入侵并占领了外国。

column1: With its aggression against Ukraine, the Kremlin has breached the United Nations Charter, the Helsinki Final Act, and other international agreements, including the Budapest Memorandum on Security Assurances and the Black Sea basing agreement, which spelled out Russia’s relations with Ukraine.
column2: 对乌克兰的侵犯触犯了联合国宪章、赫尔辛基最后议定书（Helsinki Final Act）和其他国际协定，包括确定俄罗斯与乌克兰关系的布达佩斯安全保证备忘录（Budapest Memorandum on Security Assurances）和黑海基地协定。

column1: Crimea has been turned into a military zone, and its inhabitants might soon find themselves trapped in the firing line if the crisis continues to escalate.
column2: 克里米亚已经变成了军事区，如果危机继续发酵，其居民或许很快就会陷入战场。

column1: Russians now face international diplomatic and economic isolation, thus exacerbating their country’s economic woes.
column2: 如今，俄罗斯面临着国际外交和经济孤立，这进一步加剧了俄罗斯的经济混乱。

column1: And Russian President Vladimir Putin’s reckless gamble risks dragging the world into a wider conflict.
column2: 而俄罗斯普京的孤注一掷可能把世界拖入更大的冲突。

column1: In light of Putin’s dangerous behavior, the West must rethink its stance toward him.
column2: 面对普京的危险行动，西方必须反思对普京的立场。

column1: Here is a leader who read a hidden, menacing agenda into a technical European Union document about export subsidies and anti-fraud provisions.
column2: 这位领导人把技术性的关于出口补贴和反欺诈条款的���盟文件解读成隐蔽的威胁论。

column1: More broadly, here is a paranoiac who sees an implausible coalition of liberal Russians, Ukrainian fascists, the CIA, and Islamist terrorists trying to thwart his preferences, if not topple him, at every turn.
column2: 更广义地说，他是一位偏执狂，认为自由派俄罗斯人、乌克兰法西斯主义者、CIA和伊斯兰极端分子组成了一个不可思议的联盟，在一切事务上都要和他对着干，甚至试图推翻他。

column1: Indeed, what we are seeing is not an unfortunate over-reaction to recent events, but a result of meticulous preparation.
column2: 事实上，我们看到的不是对最新事件的不幸的过度反应，而是精心准备的结果。

column1: Armies do not mobilize 150,000 troops within days, or have vehicles and thousands of uniforms without insignias ready, or hold military exercises in peaceful regions of the world without warning.
column2: 否则军队不可能在几天内动员150,000大军，不可能准备好大量汽车和数千名身穿无标识制服的部队，也不可能在没有警告信号的和平地区举行军演。

column1: It would be a mistake for NATO to respond to Russia’s provocations with similar saber rattling.
column2: 如果北约对俄罗斯的挑衅以牙还牙，那将是一个错误。

column1: After all, the United States and the EU still have a range of tools to modify Putin’s calculus, or that of those bankrolling his regime.
column2: 毕竟，美国和欧盟有很多办法可以改变普京的算盘，或者影响普京政权的收入。

column1: Most important, the US and Europe must cooperate much more closely than they have so far.
column2: 最重要的是，美国和欧洲必须比现在更加紧密地合作。

column1: The impression of disunity on sanctions plays into Putin’s hands.
column2: 在制裁问题上莫衷一是，得利的是普京。

column1: Some EU members, like Germany, must live up to the expectations they have recently raised.
column2: 一些欧盟成员国，比如德国，决不能辜负人们对他们的新近预期。

column1: If German leaders are serious about instituting a “culture of responsibility,” they are obliged to act accordingly, even if doing so entails economic costs.
column2: 如果德国领导人所谓树立“责任文化”是认真的，那么他们就有义务据此行动起来，即便这样做会到来经济代价。

column1: The West should also listen carefully to Ukraine’s neighbor, Poland, which probably has the deepest insight into the complexities of the crisis.
column2: 西方也必须认真聆听乌克兰的邻国波兰的声音，波兰也许是对这场危机的复杂性洞见最深刻的国家。

column1: Most important, it is essential to adhere to certain key principles:
column2: 最重要的是，必须坚守几条关键原则：

column1: Use diplomacy.
column2: 利用外交。

column1: Europe, the US, and Japan have already suspended their cooperation with Russia in the G-8.
column2: 欧洲、美国和日本已经叫停了与俄罗斯的G-8合作。

column1: Similarly, the OECD should put Russia’s accession process on hold.
column2: 类似地，经合组织也把接受俄罗斯的进程冻结了。

column1: Following punitive measures by the US, the EU has now decided on some “soft” sanctions.
column2: 跟随美国的惩罚措施，眼下欧洲已决定采取一些“软”制裁。

column1: But modest steps like suspending talks on visa liberalization will not impress the Kremlin much.
column2: 但中止签证自由化这样的温和步骤并不会让克里姆林宫感冒。

column1: Stronger signals, such as cancellation or suspension of agreements concerning the South Stream gas pipeline and a trade embargo on arms and dual-use items, merit serious consideration.
column2: 更强的信号 — — 比如取消或中止南溪（South Stream）输气管道协议、武器贸易禁令或者双管齐下的选择应该得到认真考虑。

column1: Impose targeted sanctions against those responsible for Russia’s Crimean incursion.
column2: 对俄罗斯入侵克里米亚的责任人实施定向制裁。

column1: An obvious tool here is to broaden the US Magnitsky Act, which prohibits the 18 people identified as being directly responsible for the detention, abuse, and death of the Russian lawyer Sergei Magnitsky from entering the US or using its financial system.
column2: 在这方面，一个现成的工具是扩大美国马格尼茨基法（Magnitsky Act）的范围。 马格尼茨基法禁止18位被认定对俄罗斯律师谢尔盖·马格尼茨基的被捕、虐待和死亡负有直接责任的人员禁止进入美国和使用美国的金融服务。

column1: The Magnitsky Act should be amended to include the names of political and military leaders responsible for the invasion of Ukraine.
column2: 马格尼茨基法应该做出修订，将应该对入侵乌克兰负责的政治和军事领导人纳入其中。

column1: Moreover, the modified bill should be adopted by the US and the EU simultaneously – thus delivering a credible threat to freeze the foreign assets of Russia’s government, state-owned companies, individual officials, and relevant oligarchs.
column2: 此外，修正后的法案应该在美国和欧盟同时获得通过 — — 从而构成可信的冻结俄罗斯政府、国有公司、个别官员和相关寡头的海外资产的威胁。

column1: Engage Russians.
column2: 将俄罗斯纳入进来。

column1: The West needs to communicate to ordinary Russians the spuriousness of Putin’s zero-sum, us-versus-them narrative.
column2: 西方需要和普通俄罗斯人交流，揭开普京你死我亡的零和博弈论的虚伪。

column1: Closer relations between Ukraine and the EU pose no threat to Russia; on the contrary, a Ukraine closely integrated with its Western neighbors could boost Russia’s economy as well.
column2: 乌克兰和欧盟走得更近决不是对俄罗斯的威胁，相反，与西方邻国紧密一体化的乌克兰能够提振俄罗斯的经济。

column1: That may be irrelevant to a leader who is guided by visions of restored imperial glory, but not to the people under his rule.
column2: 对于一位着眼于重塑帝国荣光的领导人来说，这或许无关紧要，但对受他统治的人民来说并非如此。

column1: Knocking holes in the Kremlin’s wall of propaganda will not be easy, but it should not be impossible in our hyper-connected world.
column2: 在克里姆林宫的宣传机器上寻找破绽决非易事，但在我们的高度互联的世界也并非不可能的任务。

column1: Support Ukraine with financial aid – as the EU has now done –and by securing its upcoming elections.
column2: 用金融援助 — — 如欧盟现在所做的那样 — — 和保证即将到来的选举支持乌克兰。

column1: Military assistance should include, at a minimum, Western intelligence sharing and cooperation through the NATO-Ukraine Commission.
column2: 军事援助也应该最低限度地包括进来，西方应该与乌克兰共享情报，并通过北约-乌克兰委员会（NATO-Ukraine Commission）展开合作。

column1: Should the situation deteriorate further, the West should also provide medical aid and surveillance assets.
column2: 如果局势进一步恶化，西方还应该提供医疗援助和监控设备。

column1: If the 2008 Russo-Georgian war is any guide, NATO’s Cyber Defense Center should help Ukraine prepare for a large-scale digital offensive.
column2: 2008年拉索-格鲁吉亚战争的前车之鉴表明，北约的网络防务中心应该帮助乌克兰做好准备抵抗大规模数字攻击。

column1: Defend NATO allies.
column2: 捍卫北约盟国。

column1: NATO should discuss concrete steps to protect its members.
column2: 北约必须讨论采取保护其成员国的具体步骤。

column1: Ukraine borders four NATO members (Poland, Slovakia, Hungary, and Romania), while a fifth (Turkey), along with Romania, borders the Black Sea.
column2: 乌克兰与四个北约成员国接壤（波兰、斯洛伐克、匈牙利和罗马尼亚 ） ， 更与和俄罗斯接壤的第五国（土耳其）共享黑海沿岸。

column1: Moreover, Estonia and Latvia are alarmed at Russia’s geopolitical ambitions, especially given the pretext of protecting ethnic kin.
column2: 此外，爱沙尼亚和拉脱维亚也对俄罗斯的地缘政治野心引起了警惕，特别是考虑到俄罗斯保护同族人民的借口的情况下。

column1: Both have populations that are about 25% Russian – a legacy of their Soviet past.
column2: 两国都有约25%的俄罗斯族人口，这是苏联时代的遗留问题。

column1: Finally, Poland and Lithuania border Kaliningrad, Russia’s exclave in the middle of Europe (and the scene of its most recent combat-readiness exercise).
column2: 最后，波兰和立陶宛都和俄罗斯的中欧飞地（及其最近的备战行动地）加里宁格勒接壤。

column1: This is a time for diplomacy, and NATO must try to avoid direct confrontation, but not at all costs.
column2: 这是一个外交时机，北约必须试图避免直接冲突，但也不能不惜代价。

column1: It must reckon that Russia’s actions might deliberately run counter to a peaceful settlement.
column2: 北约必须认识到，俄罗斯的行动可能是有意地与和平解决方案渐行渐远。

column1: The alliance cannot afford to launch a lengthy and heated debate about the deployment of its forces and capabilities only at the moment diplomatic efforts fail.
column2: 北约决不能等到外交手段失败才开始热烈讨论部署它的力量和能力。

column1: When Ukrainians stood up against their corrupt elite, they became the first people to put their lives on the line for the goal of EU membership.
column2: 当乌克兰人站起来反对他们的腐败精英时，他们已成为第一批把他们的生命和欧盟成员国目标系在一起的人。

column1: The result was unwarranted retaliation from Russia.
column2: 结果，他们招致了俄罗斯毫无理由的打击报复。

column1: So this is not Ukraine’s war.
column2: 因此这不是乌克兰的战争。

column1: Ukraine is the immediate victim, but it is by no means Putin’s ultimate target.
column2: 乌克兰是首当其冲的受害者，但这决不是普京的最终目标。

column1: This is a blatant attack on the principles of state sovereignty, inviolability of negotiated borders, and adherence to multilateral agreements that underpin today’s rule-based international system.
column2: 这是对国家主权原则、议定边界的神圣不可侵犯性以及对作为当今世界基于规则的国际体系的基础的多边协定的赤裸裸的攻击。

column1: Countering Russia’s aggression is thus the responsibility of all who would uphold that system.
column2: 因此，制衡俄罗斯的恣睢行为是所有赞成这一体系的人的责任。

column1: How Money is Made
column2: 如何创造货币

column1: BERLIN/SOUTHAMPTON – Last month, the BRICS countries (Brazil, Russia, India, China, and South Africa) announced the establishment of their own development bank, which would reduce their dependence on the Western-dominated, dollar-focused World Bank and International Monetary Fund.
column2: 柏林/南安普顿—上个月，金砖国家（巴西、俄罗斯、印度、中国和南非）宣布成立它们自己的开发银行，该银行可以减少它们对西方主导的、以美元为核心的世界银行和国际货币基金组织（IMF）的依赖。

column1: These economies will benefit from increased monetary-policy agency and flexibility.
column2: 这些经济体将从货币政策中介（agency）和弹性增加中获益。

column1: But they should not discount the valuable lessons offered by advanced-country central banks’ recent monetary-policy innovation.
column2: 但它们不能低估发达国家央行最近的货币政策干预所提供的重要教训。

column1: In June, the European Central Bank, following the example set by the Bank of England in 2012, identified “bank credit for the real economy” as a new policy goal.
column2: 6月，欧洲央行效仿英格兰银行2012年的做法，将“面向实体经济的银行信用”作为新的政策目标。

column1: A couple of weeks later, the Bank of England announced the introduction of a form of credit guidance to limit the amount of credit being used for property-asset transactions.
column2: 几周后，英格兰银行宣布引入一种形式的信用指引以限制用于房地产资产交易的信用。

column1: Before the financial crisis hit in 2008, all of these policies would have been disparaged as unwarranted interventions in financial markets.
column2: 2008年金融危机爆发前，所有这些政策都被视为毫无根据的金融市场干预。

column1: Indeed, in 2005, when one of us (Werner) recommended such policies to prevent “recurring banking crises,” he faced vehement criticism.
column2: 事实上，2005年，当本���作者之一（沃纳）建议采取这些政策以防止“银行危机重现”时，他遭到了猛烈的批评。

column1: This March, however, the Bank of England acknowledged the observation that he and others had made – that, by extending credit, banks actually create 97% of the money supply.
column2: 但是，今年3月，英格兰银行承认了他和其他人所做的观察 — — 通过扩张信用，银行实际创造了97%的货币供给。

column1: Given that a dollar in new bank loans increases the money supply by a dollar, banks are not financial intermediaries; they are money creators.
column2: 一美元银行贷款可以增加一美元货币供给，因此，银行并非金融中介（intermediary ） ； 而是货币创造者。

column1: The growing recognition of banks’ true function will be a game-changer in areas like monetary policy and financial regulation, enabling officials to tackle effectively problems like recurring banking crises, unemployment, and underdevelopment.
column2: 对银行真正功能的逐渐认识将是货币政策和金融监管等领域的局面改变因素，官员因此得以有效处理银行危机重现、失业和发展不足等问题。

column1: But it will take time to be fully accepted – not least because it challenges a fundamental tenet of traditional economics.
column2: 但这一点被完全接受需要时间 — — 因为它挑战了传统经济学的一个基本信条。

column1: Indeed, according to this new paradigm, savings, while useful, are not an essential prerequisite to investment and thus to economic growth.
column2: 事实上，根据这一新范式，储蓄尽管有用，并非投资的先决条件，因此也不是经济增长的先决条件。

column1: The United States, which experienced a prolonged period of growth without savings, is a case in point.
column2: 在无储蓄条件下经历了长期增长的美国就是明证。

column1: In general, economic growth depends on an increasing number of transactions and an increasing amount of money to finance them.
column2: 总体而言，经济增长依赖于交易数量的增加和用于交易融资的货币数量的增加。

column1: Banks provide that finance by extending more credit, the impact of which depends on who receives it.
column2: 银行通过扩张信用提供融资，而其影响取决于谁得到融资。

column1: Bank credit for GDP transactions affects nominal GDP, while bank credit for investment in the production of goods and services delivers non-inflationary growth.
column2: 用于GDP交易的信用影响名义GDP，用于商品和服务生产投资的银行信用带来无通胀增长。

column1: The problem lies in bank credit-for-asset transactions, which often generate boom-bust cycles.
column2: 问题出在银行资产信用（credit-for-asset）交易，这类交易常常引起枯荣循环。

column1: By extending too much of this type of credit, banks pump up asset prices to unsustainable levels.
column2: 这类银行信用的过度扩张导致资产价格上升到不可持续的水平。

column1: When credit inevitably slows, prices collapse.
column2: 当信用不可避免地放缓时，价格就崩盘了。

column1: As the late-coming speculators go bankrupt, the share of non-performing loans on banks’ balance sheets rises, forcing banks to reduce credit further.
column2: 迟来的投机者纷纷破产，银行负债表的不良贷款比例也随之上升，迫使银行进一步缩减信用。

column1: It takes only a 10% decline in banks’ asset values to bankrupt the banking system.
column2: 只要银行资产价值下降10 % ， 就可以让整个银行系统破产。

column1: With an understanding of this process, policymakers can take steps to avert future banking crises and resolve post-crisis recessions more effectively.
column2: 理解了这一过程，决策者就可以采取行动以更有效地避免未来银行危机和解决后危机衰退。

column1: For starters, they should restrict bank credit for transactions that do not contribute to GDP.
column2: 首先，他们应该限制用于无益于GDP的交易的银行信用。

column1: Moreover, in the event of a crisis, central banks should purchase non-performing assets from banks at face value, completely restoring banks’ balance sheets, in exchange for an obligation to submit to credit monitoring.
column2: 此外，在出现危机时，央行应该以面值向银行收购不良资产，彻底重塑银行资产负债表，并以银行接受信用监控为交换条件。

column1: Given that no new money would be injected into the rest of the economy, this process – which the US Federal Reserve undertook in 2008 – would not generate inflation.
column2: 由于没有新货币会注入经济的其余部分，这一过程 — — 正如2008年美联储所采取的 — — 不会引起通胀。

column1: In order to stimulate productive bank credit – and boost the effectiveness of fiscal policy – governments should stop issuing bonds, and instead borrow from banks through loan contracts, often available at lower rates than bond yields.
column2: 为了刺激生产性银行信用 — — 并提振财政政策的效果 — — 政府应该停止发行债券，而应该通过贷款契约向银行借钱，这样做的利率往往会比债券收益率低。

column1: This would bolster bank credit and stimulate demand, employment, GDP, and tax revenues.
column2: 这将提振银行信用并刺激需求、就业、GDP和税收收入。

column1: Finally, a network of small not-for-profit local banks should be established to provide universal banking services, and loans to small and medium-size firms, like the scheme that has underpinned Germany’s economic strength and resilience over the last 200 years.
column2: 最后，应该建立小型非盈利地方银行网络以提供普惠银行服务以及中小企业贷款，如在过去200年中成为德国经济坚挺和坚韧基础的制度。

column1: Beyond making the banking sector more robust, such an initiative would boost job creation per dollar in bank credit.
column2: 这一做法不但能够让银行部门更加强健，也能提高单位美元银行信用所创造的就业岗位数量。

column1: Of course, large multinational banks, which have long benefited from the perception that economies need savings, are likely to resist such reforms.
column2: 当然，从经济需要储蓄的观念中长期获益的大型跨国银行可能会抵制这样的改革。

column1: For decades, these banks have been selling “foreign savings” to developing countries by lending at high interest rates and in a foreign currency, fueling the accumulation of massive amounts of foreign debt, which would often be converted into equity.
column2: 几十年来，这些银行都在通过高利率外币贷款将“外国储蓄”卖给发展中国家，助长了外债（往往会被转换为股权）的大幅积累。

column1: In other words, they issued credit that contributed little to the local economy, and then drained local resources through interest and exploding foreign currency-denominated debt.
column2: 换句话说，它们发行的信用对地方经济几乎毫无用处，随后又通过利息和爆炸式增长的外币计价债务榨干地方资源。

column1: Just as the BRICS have rejected Western-led economic institutions, developing economies would do well to expel foreign banks and allow local financial institutions to create money for productive purposes.
column2: 正如金砖银行拒绝西方主导的经济机构，发展中经济体可以很好地驱逐外国银行并允许地方金融机构为生产性目的创造货币。

column1: After all, successful economic development – in countries like the US, Germany, Japan, and China – has depended on domestic credit creation for productive investment.
column2: 毕竟，成功的经济发展 — — 如美国、德国、日本和中国 — — 取决于为生产性投资而创造的国内信用。

column1: During the Great Depression of the 1930s, Michael Unterguggenberger, the mayor of the Tyrolean town of Wörgl, performed an experiment.
column2: 20世纪30年代大萧条期间，沃格尔（Wörgl）提洛尔镇（Tyrolean）镇长迈克尔·温特古根伯格（Michael Unterguggenberger）做了一个实验。

column1: In order to reduce unemployment and complete much-needed public-works projects, he hired workers and paid them with “work receipts” that could be used to pay local taxes.
column2: 为了降低失业、完成急需的公共设施工程，他聘用工人，并用可用于抵付本地税的“工作券”支付工资。

column1: With the local authority effectively issuing money for work performed, the local economy boomed.
column2: 这实际上等于是地方当局有效地为完成的工作发行货币，地方经济也因此繁荣。

column1: The central bank, however, was not pleased, and decided to assert its monopoly over currency issuance, forcing Unterguggenberger to scrap the local public money and causing Wörgl to fall back into depression.
column2: 但是，央行很不高兴，并决定捍卫其对货币发行的垄断，强迫温特古根伯格废除地方公共货币，而沃格尔也再次陷入萧条。

column1: Some 80 years later, the English city of Hull has begun to implement a similar scheme, using a digital crypto-currency that is, so far, not prohibited by law.
column2: 80年后，英国赫尔市（Hull）开始实施类似的计划，启用了一种目前未被法律禁止的数字型秘密货币。

column1: The unfettered creation of money by large private banks has generated overwhelming instability, undermining the fundamental principle that money creation should serve the public good.
column2: 大型私人银行自由创造货币产生过不可挽回的动荡，破坏了货币创造必须符合公共利益这一基本原则。

column1: This does not have to be the case.
column2: 这并非放之四海而皆准。

column1: By implementing safeguards that ensure that credit serves productive and public purposes, policymakers can achieve debt-free, stable, and sustainable economic growth.
column2: 通过实施确保信用服务于生产性和公共目的的保护措施，决策者可以实现无债务的稳定而可持续的经济增长。

column1: Merkel’s American Minders
column2: 默克尔的美国看守

column1: BERLIN – Germans used to joke that Chancellor Angela Merkel’s penchant for communicating via fleeting text messages effectively marked the end of traditional historiography.
column2: 柏林—德国人曾经打趣说，总理默克尔爱用短消息沟通的习惯实际上标志着传统历史的终结。

column1: Well, at least American spy agencies seem to have kept full track of the behind-the-scenes communications – in Berlin and beyond.
column2: 呃，至少美国间谍机构似乎全程跟踪着柏林和其他地方的幕后通信。

column1: Regrettably, US President Barack Obama and his administration have yet to comprehend the scale and severity of the damage caused to America’s credibility among its European allies.
column2: 遗憾的是，美国总统奥巴马及其政府仍未能理解这给美国在其欧洲盟友中间的信誉所造成的伤害的广度和严重度。

column1: The problem is not that countries spy on each other (they all do). Rather, it is the extent of US intelligence gathering and America’s attitude toward allies that is most damaging.
column2: 问题不在于各国彼此案中监视（所有国家都这么做 ） ， 而在于美国搜集情报做法的程度和美国对盟友的态度，这才是最危险的。

column1: Previous transatlantic clashes over diverse issues such as climate change, the detainees at Guantánamo Bay, and the Iraq War exposed a breakdown of mutual understanding, sometimes stemming from sharp differences over how best to achieve certain common objectives.
column2: 此前，大西洋两岸在气候变化、关塔那摩监狱囚犯和伊拉克战争等诸多问题上的分歧暴露了互相理解方面的裂痕，有时候，分歧来自关于如何达到某些共同目标这一问题上的尖锐不同。

column1: But the wiretapping crisis and other troubling revelations from the former American intelligence contractor Edward J. Snowden point to a deeper problem: a crisis of mutual distrust that risks becoming a serious transatlantic rift at a time when closer political, economic, and security cooperation between Europe and the United States is needed more than ever.
column2: 但窃听危机和前美国情报承包商斯诺登所揭露的其他丑闻指向一个更深层次的问题：互相信任危机。 目前正是欧洲和美国之间最需要更紧密地进行政治，经济和安全合作的时候，互相信任危机有可能导致大西洋两岸的严重决裂。

column1: There is probably nothing more destructive to friendly relations among democratic states than behavior by an ally that causes the other side to lose face at home.
column2: 对于民主国家之间的友好关系来说，也许没有比盟友让另一方在国内丢脸更具破坏性的了。

column1: After all, it was Merkel who tried to calm the waters after the NSA scandal first hit Europe this summer.
column2: 毕竟，今年夏天美国国安局丑闻冲击欧洲时，默克尔还试图息事宁人。

column1: That is why the alleged US wiretapping of her cellphone is so damaging for her, both personally and politically.
column2: 正因如此，美国被指窃听其手机令她十分受伤，不管从个人角度还是政治角度都是如此。

column1: As someone who served in Merkel’s government from 2009 to 2011, I must admit that I was rather careless in the use of mobile communication devices while in office.
column2: 2009—2011年间，我在默克尔政府供职，必须承认，在此期间我对移动通信的使用并不太当心。

column1: In principle, of course, one should always assume that foreign intelligence services attempt to listen in on other governments’ conversations.
column2: 当然，从原则上说，你应该时刻假定外国情报机构试图窃听他国政府的对话。

column1: But it makes a big difference whether such activities are conducted by Russia or China, or by an ally that repeatedly emphasizes the importance of close transatlantic friendship and cooperation.
column2: 但这样的行为来自俄罗斯和中国，还是来自一再强调跨大西洋紧密友好和合作关系的盟友，其中的差别是巨大的。

column1: Obama’s personality makes matters more complicated.
column2: 奥巴马的个性让事情进一步复杂了。

column1: It is hard to recall any other US president who has been so personally disconnected from other heads of state.
column2: 很难想起还有哪位美国总统个性与其他国家首脑如此不同。

column1: Instead of immediately reaching out to a friendly country, he decided to lie low and send White House Press Secretary Jay Carney to issue a rather awkward statement that the US government “is not” and “will not” monitor Merkel’s communications.
column2: 事发后，奥巴马并未立刻与友邦取得联系，而决定采取低调免事的态度，派白宫新闻秘书卡尼（Jay Carney）发布了一份蹩脚生命，说美国政府“没有”也“不会”监控默克尔的通信。

column1: Of course, it does not take much interpretive skill to recognize a clumsy attempt to avoid confessing that US intelligence services targeted Merkel in the past.
column2: 当然，不需要深入挖掘就能看出，这番对于避免承认美国情报机构过去以默克尔为目标的说辞十分牵强。

column1: The Obama administration appears to have failed to ask itself some basic questions.
column2: 奥巴马政府似乎应该扪心自问几个基本问题。

column1: How could it justify spying on a leader who is among America’s closest allies in NATO and in the Afghanistan mission – a leader whom he invited to the Rose Garden to bestow the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the highest honor that America can give to a foreigner?
column2: 监视作为美国在北约和阿富汗任务中最紧密的盟友之一、被奥巴马邀请前往玫瑰花园授予美国对外国人的最高褒奖 — — 总统自由勋章的领导人，这如何说得过去？

column1: Moreover, Merkel was not the only target.
column2: 此外，默克尔并非唯一的目标。

column1: In the case of France, how could the Obama administration justify targeting an ally that has tried hard to build trust with the US by providing much-needed military and political cover in Libya and Syria?
column2: 就法国而言，奥巴马政府将目标对准通过向利比亚和叙利亚输送急需的军事和政治资源大力建设与美国的信任的盟友，这如何说得过去？

column1: French President François Hollande, too, must feel like a fool – not just as a result of US surveillance, but also because he probably received no advance warning from his intelligence services about Obama’s sudden decision to ask Congress to pass a resolution prior to using military force in Syria.
column2: 法国总统奥朗德也一定感到自己被愚弄了 — — 不仅仅是因为美国的监控，也因为对于奥巴马的突然决定要求国会在向叙利亚动武之前批准议案，法国情报机构没有提前向他发出预警。

column1: Finally, how can Obama explain to the EU (whose delegation in Washington, DC, was also bugged) that it is crucially important to enter into honest, serious, and comprehensive negotiations to conclude a Transatlantic Trade and Investment Partnership?
column2: 最后，奥巴马如何向欧盟解释，为了完成跨大西洋贸易和投资合作伙伴关系（TTIP ） ， 展开诚信、严肃和全面的谈判是至关重要的（欧盟代表团在华盛顿的驻地也被监听了 ） ？

column1: Prominent voices in Europe – including the president of the European Parliament and the leader of Germany’s Social Democrats (who is about to form a coalition government with Merkel) – are already demanding a suspension of the TTIP talks.
column2: 欧洲要人 — — 包括欧洲议会主席和德国社民党（马上将与默克尔组建联合政府 ） — —纷纷发声，要求中止TTIP对话。

column1: The potential economic cost of a delay or a failure to achieve closer transatlantic economic integration could total hundreds of billions of dollars – in addition to the incalculable damage done to America’s credibility in Europe.
column2: 延迟或不能实现跟紧密的跨大西洋经济一体化有可能带来数千亿美元的代价，除此之外也将给美国在欧信誉造成不可估量的伤害。

column1: There is much talk today about the risks of a new era of American isolationism and a lack of US leadership in the world.
column2: 如今人们大谈美国孤立主义和世界缺少美国领导的时期的风险。

column1: It is important to remember that isolationism can be triggered not only by a potential retreat from global affairs, but also by the rather imprudent use of America’s hard and soft power on the world stage.
column2: 很重要的一点是要记住，触发孤立主义的不仅可以是从国际事务中的退出，也可以是在国际舞台上滥用美国的软硬实力。

column1: To escape the NSA mess, various options will be discussed.
column2: 为了挽救美国国安局带来的混乱，人们讨论了各种方法。

column1: The new Franco-German push for an intelligence-sharing agreement with the US is probably difficult to put into practice, especially considering that spy services operating around the world are not always fully controllable.
column2: 法国和德国新提出的与美国共享情报的协议可能很难成为现实，特别是在考虑到全世界间谍活动的操作并不总是完全可控的情况下。

column1: As a first step, Obama must rediscover the great communications skills that propelled him to the White House in the first place.
column2: 作为第一部，奥巴马必须重新拿出让他入主白宫的高超沟通技巧。

column1: From a public-diplomacy perspective, his handling of the surveillance scandal has been a complete failure.
column2: 从公共外交角度看，他对监控丑闻的处理是一场彻头彻尾的失败。

column1: To contain the damage and begin to rebuild much-needed trust, Obama must issue a credible apology to Merkel, other Western allies, and their citizens.
column2: 为了遏制损失并开始重建急需的信任，奥巴马必须向默克尔、其他西方盟友以及这些国家的公民做出可信的道歉。

column1: In the American political context, issuing an apology, especially to foreign governments, is often viewed as a sign of weakness.
column2: 从美国政治环境看，做出道歉，特别是向外国政府的道歉，通常被看作软弱的信号。

column1: In the case of the NSA scandal, an unequivocal apology by Obama is the only viable solution to leave the past behind and move forward.
column2: 在美国国安局丑闻中，由奥巴马做出明确道歉是告别过去、重新前进的唯一可行办法。

column1: Unfortunately, the window of opportunity for such a gesture to be viewed in Europe as a much-awaited olive branch – and a sign of real American strength and conviction – is closing fast.
column2: 不幸的是，摆出这一姿态、让欧洲看到期待已久的橄榄枝 — — 以及美国真正强大和令人信服的信号 — — 的机会窗口正在快速关闭。

column1: America’s Debt-Ceiling Debacle
column2: 美国的债务上限乱局

column1: NEW YORK – When Greece’s sovereign-debt crisis threatened the euro’s survival, US officials called their European counterparts to express bewilderment at their inability to resolve the issue.
column2: 发自纽约 — — 当希腊主权债务危机威胁到了欧元的生存之时，美国官员致电欧洲方面以表达对后者无力解决这一事件的困惑。

column1: Now, the tables have turned, with American leaders on the receiving end of such calls.
column2: 如今反过来是美国领导人接到了这样的电话。

column1: The most recent threat of a US debt default has been avoided, but only temporarily. Another battle looms early next year, when the US government’s debt ceiling will have to be raised again.
column2: 虽然最近一次美国债务违约的威胁警报已经解除，但这仅仅是暂时而已，因为另一场斗争将在明年年初美国政府债务上限必须再次调高时爆发。

column1: In Europe, the absence of a political union – considered a necessary precondition for sharing debt obligations and, thus, putting the euro on a sound footing – is widely held to lie at the root of the continent’s crisis.
column2: 在欧洲，危机的根源来自于一个单一政治联盟的缺位，因为这是分担债务并以此将欧元构筑在一个合理基础之上的必要前提。

column1: But the US crisis suggests that political union is no panacea for managing sovereign debt.
column2: 但美国的危机则表明政治联盟并不是根治危机的一副灵丹妙药。

column1: For weeks, Republicans in the House of Representatives threatened to keep the government shuttered – thereby preventing it from extending its borrowing authority beyond the October 17 deadline – in order to challenge laws that were enacted by Congress as a whole and upheld by the Supreme Court.
column2: 数周以来，众议院的共和党议员威胁要让政府继续停摆下去 — — 因此政府也无法在10月17日的到期日之后延长其借款授权 — — 以挑战由国会大多数通过并得到最高法院支持的相关法律。

column1: In the eurozone, the main source of disagreement has been how debts in need of refinancing were incurred – that is, whether they contravened agreed debt limits.
column2: 在欧元区，反对的声音主要来自这些需要重新筹钱偿还的债务是如何产生的 — — 也就是说，它们是否与议定的债务上限相抵触。

column1: In the United States, the bone of contention has been the purpose that the funds will serve.
column2: 在美国，斗争的核心则是这些资金究竟将用在何种用途。

column1: The difference is ultimately minor, and should not be allowed to overshadow what is really at stake: democratic self-governance in an age of high public debt.
column2: 两者的区别其实归根究底也不大，而且也都不应该掩盖了真正的危机：在一个高公共负债时代下的民主自我治理问题。

column1: In 1773, the so-called Sons of Liberty staged the Boston Tea Party under the slogan, “No taxation without representation.”
column2: 1773年，一群所谓“自由之子 ” （ Sons of Liberty）在波士顿倾茶事件中喊出了这样一句口号 ： “ 无代表，不纳税 。 ”

column1: And America’s founders clearly regarded legislative control over the budget as a key pillar of democratic governance.
column2: 而美国的建立者们也很清楚地认定对预算的立法管制是民主治理的一大关键支柱。

column1: Taxation remains the dominant source of government revenue in most developed countries.
column2: 在大多数发达国，税款依然是政府收入的主要来源。

column1: But the role of debt finance has been growing – and, with it, the need to refinance old debt when total expenditure, including debt service, exceeds total revenue.
column2: 但债务融资所扮演的角色也在不断扩大 — — 而随着该项目的发展，当政府总支出（包括征税行为）超出总收入时为旧债务重新融资的需求也不断扩大。

column1: Broad access to deep and liquid international debt markets has enabled policymakers to bypass some of the most challenging aspects of democratic governance.
column2: 通往大规模高流动性国际债务市场的广阔渠道使得政策制定者们得以绕过某些最具挑战性的民主治理问题。

column1: Rather than tackle thorny questions about how to allocate limited resources, democratic governments seem to believe that they can have it all: low taxes and ample debt finance to fund wars or electorate-pleasing programs.
column2: 比起处理那些关于如何分配有限资源的棘手问题，民主政府似乎觉得自己可以独占全部好处：一面维持低税率，一面依赖充足的债务融资来发动战争或者推动社会项目取悦选民。

column1: Growing debt burdens suggest that this form of cheap politics has run its course.
column2: 但不断增大的债务负担表明这种形式的廉价政治已经走到了尽头。

column1: But the problem runs deeper than that.
column2: 然而问题也比这严重得多。

column1: Excessive reliance on debt finance has undermined basic tenets of democracy, with government finance increasingly determined not by electoral cycles and political deliberation, but by repayment schedules.
column2: 过度依赖债务融资已经腐蚀了民主的基本原则，因为政府财政逐渐由还债时间表所决定，而非取决于选举周期和政治决策。

column1: In times of economic growth, debt finance provides an easy escape from difficult choices. When the economy falters, however, creditors – and those who are willing to entertain the prospect of default – can impose their will on everyone else.
column2: 在经济增长时债务融资可以让人轻易逃避那些艰难选择，一旦经济出了问题，债主们 — — 以及那些在违约预期中得利的人 — — 就可以把自己的意愿强加在任何人身上。

column1: This power follows from the nature of debt.
column2: 这个力量来自于债务的本质。

column1: A tax is a quasi-equity claim of the government on its citizens’ financial expectations.
column2: 税款是政府对其公民财政预期的准权益要求。

column1: Gaining the consent of the majority of citizens to raise taxes can be a tall order politically, and has become more difficult as capital mobility has narrowed the tax base and triggered a race to the bottom on rates.
column2: 在提税方面获得大多数公民的共识在政治上是极难办到的事，并随着资本流动缩小了税基并引发各国政府争相降低税率而变得越来越困难。

column1: Debt, by contrast, is a contractual commitment to repay creditors who are largely oblivious to how the money is spent.
column2: 相比之下，债务是一个答应偿还的契约承诺，但债主们大多都不知道这些钱都花到哪里去了。

column1: By incurring debt, states trade an element of sovereignty – the flexibility to alter course over time in response to the electorate’s demands – for the ability to fund expenditures without being compelled to navigate the political minefield of raising taxes.
column2: 通过发债，国家放弃了主权的其中一个部分 — — 为回应选民需求而随时间调整政策进程的灵活性，换来了不用被迫踏入征税这个政治雷区而又能维持支出的能力。

column1: Creating viable institutions for managing public debt in a democracy is difficult.
column2: 在一个民主政体中创设切实可行的体系去管理公共负债是相当困难的。

column1: The mechanisms currently on offer are treaty-based, constitutional, and statutory debt ceilings, pegged as a ratio of GDP, or, as in the US, established in nominal terms.
column2: 目前提供的机制是一个以协议为基础，符合宪法的法定债务上限，以GDP的特定比率为限，或者像美国那样基于名义条款。

column1: Treaty-based debt ceilings are largely toothless, as Europe’s experience suggests.
column2: 欧洲的经验表明，以协议为基础的债务上限基本上没什么强制力。

column1: Constitutional debt limits have yet to be tested in times of emergency, when new funding is needed quickly.
column2: 宪法规定的债务上限还需要等到迫切需要新资金的危急时刻才能检验。

column1: And, as the recent impasse in the US demonstrates, political minorities with effective veto power can abuse statutory ceilings in an economic downturn, when dependence on external debt finance increases.
column2: 而正如美国最近这次僵局所体现的那样，在对外部债务融资的需要增加的情况下，拥有有效否决权的政治上少数派可以在经济不景时滥用法定债务上限。

column1: Indeed, to the extent that reliance on debt finance undermines self-governance, debt-ceiling abuse for partisan gain becomes more likely.
column2: 事实上，在债务融资腐蚀自我管治的方面，为党派利益而滥用债务上限的行为变得越来越常见。

column1: The problem is that democracies have yet to learn how to manage debt effectively.
column2: 问题在于民主体制还未找到有效管理债务的方法。

column1: While political union may stabilize the euro, it will not sustain or strengthen democracy unless Europe’s leaders address this critical failing.
column2: 虽然政治联盟或许可以稳定欧元，但除非欧洲领导人们能够解决这一重大缺陷，否则就无法维持和加强民主制度。

column1: Even the world’s oldest continuous democracy is not immune to the erosion of self-governance.
column2: 即使世界上存续时间最长的古老民主制度也无法避免自我管治的腐蚀。

column1: Commitments never to raise taxes have left the US dependent on debt finance – and, more frightening, on those who are ready to veto refinancing it.
column2: 永不加税的承诺导致美国只能依赖债务融资 — — 更可怕是的是，依赖于那些时刻准备否决再融资的人。

column1: Central Banking’s New Club Class
column2: 央行的新俱乐部阶层

column1: NEW YORK – In the wake of the 2007-2008 financial crisis, the world’s central banks played a critical role in rescuing the global financial system.
column2: 纽约—2007—2008年金融危机爆发时，全球央行在捍卫全球金融系统方面起到了关键作用。

column1: They stepped in when private markets froze, acting as lenders and dealers of last resort, and provided additional liquidity to grease the wheels of finance.
column2: 它们在私人市场冻结时出手干预，承担了最后贷款人和最后交易人的角色，并提供了额外的流动性润滑金融之轮。

column1: These central banks offered their services primarily to domestic actors, but they also extended their largess to foreign private entities.
column2: 这些央行主要为国内行为人提供服务，但它们的慷慨也惠及了外国私人实体。

column1: Indeed, even foreign states benefited after central banks entered into swap agreements, giving one another unlimited access to their respective currencies.
column2: 事实上，就连外国也从央行的互换安排中得到了好处。 货币安排使其范围的各国可以无限制地获得各自的货币。

column1: This has created a worrying precedent.
column2: 这开启了令人担心的先例。

column1: Originally created as a temporary fix in 2007, the swap lines established at that time connecting the US Federal Reserve, the European Central Bank, and the Swiss National Bank have been extended each time a new crisis has unsettled the markets.
column2: 始于2007年的互换安排最初是临时性措施，在美联储、欧洲央行和瑞士国民银行间建立了联系，但每逢新危机动摇市场，这一安排就会扩大一次。

column1: More recently, however, six central banks announced that they had made their swap lines permanent.
column2: 但是，最近六大央行宣布将把互换安排永久化。

column1: But did these central banks have the legal authority to do so?
column2: 但这些央行有法定权力这样做吗？

column1: And, even if they did, should they have used it?
column2: 如果有，它们应该如何使用这一权力？

column1: The original swap lines might fairly be classified as emergency measures.
column2: 最初的互换安排应该被归于紧急措施。

column1: But what may be permissible and justifiable in a financial emergency may not be appropriate as standard practice during normal times.
column2: 但在金融紧急状态中可许可行的措施未必适合成为正常时期的标准行为。

column1: Central bankers might argue that we have entered a state of permanent market crisis analogous to the never-ending “war on terror.”
column2: 央行行长可能会说，我们进入了持久市场危机状态，类似于永无止境的“反恐战争 ” 。

column1: But even this frightening analogy does not answer the question of whether central banks should assume positions of power in international relations.
column2: 但即使是这一耸人听闻的类比也没有回答央行是否应该效仿国际关系中的实力结构的问题。

column1: Of course, a central bank’s mandate is price stability in the national economy that it serves, and price stability is influenced by exchange rates.
column2: 当然，央行的使命是所在国国民经济的价格稳定，而价格稳定受汇率的影响。

column1: So a case can be made that central banks should have the power to intervene in foreign-exchange markets, and that this power should – at least in times of crisis – include commitments to foreign central banks to provide unlimited liquidity in the domestic currency.
column2: 因此央行应该有权力干预外汇市场的看法不无道理，并且这一权力应该 — — 至少在危机时期应该 — — 包括向外国央行承诺无限制供应本币流动性。

column1: What is less clear, though, is whether the same justification can be used by central banks to create permanent swap lines with just a few other central banks of their choosing.
column2: 但是，并不如此明确的是同样的论证是否适用于央行与一小撮由它们选定的其他央行建立永久的互换通道。

column1: This is akin to an announcement on a cruise ship approaching an iceberg that the crew will definitely rescue first-class passengers but not necessarily others.
column2: 这就好比是在邮轮撞向冰山时宣布肯定会救助一等舱乘客，其他乘客就听天由命吧。

column1: Not every country’s central bank – not even every “friendly” country’s central bank – has been invited to join the swap-lines club.
column2: 并不是所有国家的央行 — — 甚至不是所有“友好”国家的央行 — — 都被邀请进入这一互换俱乐部。

column1: Membership is restricted to the United States Federal Reserve, the Bank of England, the European Central Bank, the Bank of Japan, the Swiss National Bank, and the Bank of Canada.
column2: 其成员只限于美联储、英格兰银行、欧洲央行、日本银行、瑞士国民银行和加拿大银行。

column1: There may be a legal rationale for this neo-imperial elitism.
column2: 这一新帝国主义精英论或许有其法律上的合理性。

column1: The so-called C-6 might argue that, given their price-stability mandate, only central banks of countries whose economic fate might destabilize domestic prices should receive privileged access to domestic currency.
column2: 所谓的C-6会说，在价格稳定使命的前提下，只有经济前景可能破坏国内价格稳定的国家的央行才应该拥有获得本币的特权。

column1: But the choice of monetary partners is nonetheless a matter of judgment.
column2: 但货币合作伙伴的选择仍只是判断问题。 比如，为何是加拿大而不是墨西哥？

column1: For example, why Canada and not Mexico?
column2: 这两个国家不都是北美自由贸易区成员吗？

column1: Aren’t both members of NAFTA?
column2: 为何是瑞士而不是巴西？

column1: Why Switzerland and not Brazil, one of the largest emerging markets?
column2: 后者可视最大的新兴市场国家之一？

column1: Picking partners is an inherently political act.
column2: 挑选合作伙伴自然是一种政治动作。

column1: It bestows access to high-demand currencies on a select few, relatively strong, countries precisely when the weakest countries are at their most vulnerable.
column2: 它把需求程度高的货币给予一小撮选定的相对坚挺的国家，而此时最疲软国家才是最脆弱的。

column1: Having been left outside the club, these countries have no option but to self-insure by accumulating foreign-exchange reserves.
column2: 由于被排除在这一俱乐部之外，这些国家别无选择，只能通过囤积外汇储备来保护自己。

column1: Indeed, empirical research suggests that countries without explicit or implicit access to liquidity tend to hold much higher reserves than the privileged few – only to be blamed by the same privileged few for contributing to global imbalances by hoarding excess reserves.
column2: 事实上，实证研究表明，无法直接或间接得到流动性的国家倾向于囤积比少数特权国更多的储备，而这样做又会让少数特权国指责通过囤积外汇储备加剧了全球失衡。

column1: The C-6 swap club’s members may be correct in thinking that global finance requires more proactive central banking.
column2: C-6互换俱乐部成员认为全球金融需要更具前瞻性的央行业务，这是对的。

column1: But is it fair or right that they should be allowed to take matters into their own hands and determine a system of international monetary management designed to serve their own interests, with little regard for other, equally exposed, countries?
column2: 但这就能证明应该允许它们大权独揽、决定国际货币管理体系了吗？ 这一体系难道是为了保护它们的自身利益、而不顾及其他风险同样大的国家的吗？

column1: The joint announcement by the C-6 cements the great divide between first-class and coach economies.
column2: C-6的联合声明坐实了一等舱经济体和大通铺经济体之间的巨大分歧。

column1: We are being asked to trust that these select central banks will do the right thing.
column2: 我们被要求相信这些被选定的央行会做出正确的决定。

column1: Trust is important.
column2: 信任十分重要。

column1: But when it comes to political decision-making, democratic control and accountability are essential.
column2: 但当问题来到政治决策时，民主控制和问责才是至关重要的。

column1: Europe’s Top-Down Myopia
column2: 欧洲自上而下的短视

column1: MUNICH – The French statesman Georges Clemenceau famously remarked that, “Generals always fight the last war.”
column2: 慕尼黑—法国政治家克莱蒙梭有一句名言 ： “ 将军们打得永远是上一场战争 。 ”

column1: Today, in the wake of the euro crisis, the same might be said of the European Union as it seeks to put itself on a more stable institutional footing.
column2: 如今，在欧元危机背景下，这句话也同样适用于寻求让自己获得更稳定的机构基础的欧盟。

column1: The EU is undergoing fundamental changes, many of which have gone largely unnoticed, owing to the overwhelming focus on large-scale top-down reforms.
column2: 欧盟正在经历根本性变革，其中许多变革在静悄悄地进行而���有被人注意到，因为注意力绝大部分都投向了大规模的自上而下的改革。

column1: Officials seem not to recognize change unless it takes the form of Eurobonds, new European treaties, or policy reversals by German Chancellor Angela Merkel.
column2: 官员似乎只看得见欧元债券、新欧洲条约、德国总理默克尔扭转政策方向这样的大改变。

column1: But the case for small steps guided by market mechanisms is strong.
column2: 但由市场机制所引领的小变革也十分活跃。

column1: Europe’s obsession with top-down reforms is rooted in prevailing analyses of the causes of the euro crisis.
column2: 欧洲沉迷于自上而下的改革，其根源在于对欧元危机原因的一致分析。

column1: Most people in Germany, the Netherlands, and Finland blame excessive public spending and inadequate regulation in countries like Greece, Spain, and Cyprus for destabilizing the eurozone and, in turn, the EU.
column2: 大部分人德国、荷兰和芬兰人认为希腊、西班牙和塞浦路斯等国家的公共支出过度和监管不力是欧元区以及欧盟发生动荡的罪魁。

column1: A somewhat more nuanced analysis holds that the euro itself is responsible for these countries’ problematic spending.
column2: 更细致的分析认为，欧元本身要对这些国家的支出问题负责。

column1: The European Central Bank’s one-size-fits-all monetary policy created destabilizing imbalances in the eurozone.
column2: 欧洲央行的大一统货币政策造成了欧元区的破坏性失衡。

column1: Interest rates were too low in Southern Europe, where governments and households binged on cheap loans, and arguably too high in Germany, which was already held back by the economic burden of reunification.
column2: 南欧利率太低，政府和家庭因为便宜的贷款而挥霍无度；而德国的利率又太高，令饱受重新统一经济负担重压的德国雪上加霜。

column1: If the euro generated these imbalances, the argument goes, country-level solutions are inadequate.
column2: 这种观点指出，如果是欧元造成了这些失衡，那么光有国家层面的解决方案是不够的。

column1: Europe’s only option is to repair and strengthen the currency union through banking, fiscal, and political union.
column2: 欧洲的唯一选择是通过银行、财政和政治联盟修正和强化货币联盟。

column1: A banking union really is needed to break the vicious cycle of weak banks and debt-laden governments.
column2: 确实需要银行联盟打破银行疲软、政府负债的恶性循环。

column1: The good news is that its contours are fairly clear, and the process of constructing it is already underway, though the pace is very slow.
column2: 好消息是银行联盟的轮廓十分清晰，建设银行联盟的过程也已经开始，尽管节奏十分缓慢。

column1: But the logic behind fiscal union is muddier – not least because its proponents have largely failed to explain exactly what it means.
column2: 但财政联盟背后的逻辑就没有那么清晰了 — — 不仅是因为其支持者没能解释它的确切含义。

column1: The implication is that it would entail a much larger EU budget, presumably financed by some kind of EU-wide taxation, as well as eurozone-backed unemployment insurance and a debt-mutualization mechanism like Eurobonds.
column2: 其影响是它将带来更大的欧盟预算，并很有可能需要用某种形式的欧盟税来融资，此外还将有欧元区支持的失业保险和类似于欧元债券的债务共担机制。

column1: The centralization of financial and fiscal powers would demand increased accountability at the European level.
column2: 金融和财政权力的集中要求增加欧元层面的问责能力。

column1: For that, a political union – with directly elected European officials and a significantly more powerful European Parliament – would be needed.
column2: 在这方面，我们需要政治联盟，即直选产生的欧洲官员加上权力大大加强的欧洲议会。

column1: This is unlikely to happen, at least in the foreseeable future.
column2: 这是不可能的任务，至少在可预见的未来是如此。

column1: But that probably does not matter as much as many people claim.
column2: 但这可能并不像很多人担心的那样会造成大问题。

column1: The fact is that in designing elaborate new institutions in response to the events of the last five years, there is a risk of fighting a rearguard action, rather than looking ahead to meet new challenges.
column2: 事实是，在应对过去五年那样的危机时，设计全面细致的新机构的风险在于和顽固阻力作斗争，而不在于战胜新挑战。

column1: After all, the eurozone crisis was rooted in the emergence of imbalances generated by the euro’s introduction and, to a lesser extent, German reunification.
column2: 毕竟，欧元区危机的根源在于欧元引入后所造成的失衡以及德国重新统一（后者只是次要根源 ） 。

column1: But neither event will happen again.
column2: 但这两个事件都不会再次发生。

column1: Moreover, the imbalances generated during the euro’s first decade are already being resolved.
column2: 此外，在欧元的第一个十年中所产生的失衡已经进入了解决阶段。

column1: Indeed, the painful adjustments that southern European countries (and Ireland) have endured have led to substantially smaller external deficits and declining unit labor costs.
column2: 事实上，南欧国家（和爱尔兰）所进行的痛苦的调整已经让外部赤字大大减少，也降低了单位劳动力成本。

column1: Nowadays, Spain’s exports are growing faster than Germany’s.
column2: 如今，西班牙的出口增长比德国还要快。

column1: The changes that countries like Spain and Portugal are making to their labor laws, pension schemes, and regulatory systems are encouraging.
column2: 西班牙和葡萄牙等国家的变化对它们的劳动法、退休制 度和监管体系是有利的。

column1: These improvements will put increasing pressure on France and Italy to follow suit, which could make Europe as a whole more competitive.
column2: 这些改善给法国和意大利带来了跟进的压力，从而让作为整体的欧洲变得更具竞争力。

column1: Furthermore, the politics of the eurozone currently are not conducive to lasting reforms.
column2: 此外，目前的欧元区政治并不有利于持续改革。

column1: The crisis has amplified the role of Germany – with its economic size and large external surplus – and made everyone else look weak.
column2: 危机放大了德国的作用 — — 因其拥有庞大的经济规模和外部盈余 — — 而让所有其他国家变得孱弱不堪。

column1: If Europe were to thrash out a fiscal and political union now, it would look too rigidly rules-based, too Germanic.
column2: 如果欧洲现在就想研究解决财政和政治联盟问题，其结果将过于墨守成规、过于德国化。

column1: As the rest of Europe recovers (and as Germany squanders some of its economic power by going slow on domestic reforms), Germany’s relative strength will decline.
column2: 随着欧洲其余部分的复苏（以及德国因为国内改革缓慢而丧失一些经济实力 ） ， 德国的相对优势将减弱。

column1: An EU without one overly dominant power could probably establish more broadly acceptable – and thus more durable – institutions.
column2: 不存在高高在上的主宰势力的欧盟可能能够建立接受范围更广、从而也更能持久的机构。

column1: If past problems are already being corrected, and future problems will be of a different kind and magnitude, then perhaps there is no need for Eurobonds or EU taxes.
column2: 如果过去的问题已经开始纠正，而未来的问题将以不同的类型和程度出现，那么也许就没有必要推出欧元债券和欧盟税。

column1: And, without debt mutualization or large-scale redistribution of wealth, political union becomes unnecessary – at least for now.
column2: 此外，如果不搞债务共同化或大规模财富再分配，政治联盟也就失去了必要性 — — 至少现在是如此。

column1: This is not to say that European institutions did not need more authority than they had before the crisis.
column2: 这并不是说欧洲机构不需要比危机前更大的权力。

column1: Even without fiscal and political union, the European Commission has been empowered to supervise fiscal spending and other macroeconomic developments – such as wage growth and real-estate prices – that could cause imbalances to re-emerge.
column2: 即使没有财政和货币联盟，欧盟委员会也有权监督财政支出和其他可能导致失衡重现的宏观经济发展，如工资增长和房地产价格。

column1: Likewise, the ECB, together with national bodies, has gained the authority to supervise major eurozone banks.
column2: 类似地，欧洲央行以及国家有关部门已经获得了监督主要欧元区银行的权力。

column1: But it is also critical to recognize that financial markets have become more disciplined.
column2: 但同样关键的是，金融市场已经变得更守纪律。

column1: Herein lies the discrepancy between those who put their faith in institutional fixes and those who trust a more bottom-up approach.
column2: 相信机构调整和相信自下而上方针的人之间的分歧就在此处。

column1: Many people, especially in the United Kingdom and the United States, seem to believe that “solving” the euro crisis means returning to the Elysian state in which all European government bonds are equally risk-free assets.
column2: 许多人，特别是英国人和美国人，似乎认为“解决”欧元区危机就意味着回归所有欧洲政府债券被一视同仁为无风险资产的乐土。

column1: But, for Germans, Dutch, and Austrians, interest-rate spreads are not the problem; they are part of the solution, given that they impose discipline that extends beyond European institutions’ new powers.
column2: 但是，对德国人、荷兰人和奥地利人来说，利差不是问题，而是解决方案的一部分，因为利差加强了纪律，并扩张到欧洲机构的新权力之外。

column1: The eurozone’s new institutional framework does not have to direct 18 countries’ fiscal and economic policies. It just needs to be strong enough to enable markets to recognize and react to worrying developments, while offering real help to countries that find themselves temporarily in trouble.
column2: 欧元区的新机构框架并不一定要指导18个国家的财政和经济政策，儿只需要足够强大从而让市场认识到令人担忧的发展态势并做出反应，同时为暂时陷入麻烦的国家提供真正的帮助。

column1: This is not only doable; it is being done.
column2: 这不仅是可行的，也正在进行中。

column1: Now European countries can turn to the challenge of becoming more flexible and productive so that they can be more competitive in the future.
column2: 现在欧洲国家可以转向新的挑战：增加灵活性、改善生产率，从而在未来变得更有竞争力。

column1: This commentary reflects the author's personal views.
column2: 本文只代表作者个人观点

column1: The False Promise of Digital Democracy
column2: 数字民主的假承诺

column1: MUNICH – Most people used to think of the Internet as a force for good.
column2: 慕尼黑—大部分人都把互联网看成是好力量。

column1: It was supposed to allow us not only to shop, stay in touch with former classmates, and find a new sushi restaurant; it was also supposed to empower us politically by allowing the disenfranchised to make their voices heard, help activists mobilize supporters, and enable ordinary citizens to publicize evidence of official corruption or police brutality.
column2: 互联网不但可以让我们购物、和老同学取得联系、找到新开的寿司店，还能让被剥夺公民权的人发出声音从而让我们得到更多的政治力量、帮助活动家动员支持者、让普通民众能够公布官员腐败或警察暴力行为的证据。

column1: But doubts have crept in – and not only since the revelations of government agencies’ use of the Internet to spy on us, our leaders, and one another.
column2: 但质疑声也接踵而至 — — 并非在政府机构利用互联网监控彼此、我们和我们的领导人被曝光后才是如此。

column1: The Internet’s impact on politics is deeply ambiguous.
column2: 互联网对政治的影响是非常模糊的。

column1: Unless and until it becomes a space where rules and rights apply like they do in the real world, that is unlikely to change.
column2: 除非在我们可以在像现实生活中那样在互联网上行使规则和权利，否则就无法改变这一点。

column1: Early enthusiasts dreamed that mere access to the Internet would help spread democracy.
column2: 早期拥趸梦想着靠接入互联网就能帮助传播民主。

column1: This did not happen.
column2: 这并没有发生。

column1: At the end of the 1990’s, 4% of the world’s population was using the Internet; today, almost 40% do.
column2: 20世纪90年代末，只有4%的世界人口在使用与联网。 如今这一比例是40 % 。

column1: But the share of countries classified as “not free” or “partly free” by the democracy watchdog Freedom House has hardly changed over the same period.
column2: 但被民主观察机构自由之家（Freedom House）归类为“不自由”或“部分自由”的国家比例在同一时期并未发生多大变化。

column1: In the battle between networks and hierarchies, the hierarchies seem to be winning more often than not.
column2: 在网络和层级之间的战争中，更常获胜的是层级。

column1: One reason is that governments have become as skillful at using the Internet and modern communications technology as activists.
column2: 一个原因是政府越来越擅长利用活跃的互联网和现代通信技术。

column1: Autocratic governments use it to track down protest and opposition leaders, as we have recently seen in Ukraine.
column2: 专制政府利用它追踪抗议活动和反对派领袖，最近的乌克兰就是如此。

column1: They employ armies of people to vet and skew online conversations.
column2: 它们部署网络水军判断和引导网络话语。

column1: Some people even argue that the Internet acts as a political release valve that helps dictators stay in power.
column2: 一些人甚至认为互联网是一种政治减压阀，有助于独裁者掌权。

column1: But even the most determined autocrat cannot fully control political activity online.
column2: 但即使是最强大的独裁者也无法完全控制网络活动。

column1: Tech-savvy young people tend to circumvent attempts at official censorship.
column2: 长于技术的年轻人总是能够绕过官方审查措施。

column1: And yet Internet activists are not necessarily gaining power.
column2: 但互联网活跃分子并不一定能够赢得力量。

column1: Internet-inspired movements usually have lasting impact only if they generate traditional political activity, such as street protests or the establishment of political parties.
column2: 互联网推动的运动往往只有在产生了传统政治活动时 — — 如街头抗议或建立政党等 — — 才能形成持续影响。

column1: For this, they need leadership, which net activists tend to reject, because they view themselves as pure grassroots movements.
column2: 因此，它们需要领袖，而这往往被网络活动家所拒绝，因为他们视自己为纯草根运动。

column1: In the absence of viable strategies and clear direction, most Internet-aided uprisings have dissipated quickly.
column2: 大部分互联网支持的骚乱没有可行的战略和明确的方向，很快就消散了。

column1: The Internet has thus turned out to be less potent than expected in the fight against tyranny.
column2: 因此，就与暴政的斗争而言，互联网并不像预期的那样给力。

column1: Nor is its effect on established democracies straightforward.
column2: 其对建立民主的影响力也没有那么直观。

column1: While democracies have arguably become more vibrant, their politics have become more volatile.
column2: 尽管民主国家变得更有活力，但它们的政治也变得日益波动。

column1: Consider the media.
column2: 以媒体为例。

column1: Only 16% of Americans in their 40’s read (print) newspapers these days; the share among 20-somethings is 6%.
column2: 如今只有16%的40—50年龄段美国人读（印刷）报纸；20岁以下人群比例更是只有6 % 。

column1: Digital media offer great diversity, easy access, and opportunities to comment.
column2: 数字媒体提供了充分的多样性、轻易的获取渠道和评论机会。

column1: But they encourage people to retrieve only information and commentaries that fit their existing views.
column2: 但它们也鼓励人们只接受符合既有观念的信息和评论。

column1: While traditional media can present their readers with balanced coverage, digital media can fuel political polarization.
column2: 传统媒体可以为读者呈现平衡的报道，数字媒体则可能助长政治两极分化。

column1: Moreover, political firebrands, populists, and radicals, from Italy’s Beppe Grillo to American Tea Party members, use social media and the blogosphere to appeal directly to potential supporters.
column2: 此外，政治煽动者、民粹主义者和激进分子 — — 从意大利的格里洛（Beppe Grillo）到美国的茶党成员 — — 利用社交媒体和博客圈直接面向潜在支持者。

column1: The Internet allows many political upstarts to amass a large following quickly, only to disappear just as fast.
column2: 互联网让许多政治新星迅速地集结大量追随者，但来得快去得也快。

column1: But the ebb and flow can unsettle established politics – for example, when centrist parties move to the right to lure voters away from more extreme parties.
column2: 然则如此兴衰更替可能动摇现行政治 — — 比如当中间派政党转为右倾以吸引更为极端的政党的选民时。

column1: At the same time, young people seem to think that they have exhausted their civic duties by tweeting and blogging.
column2: 与此同时，年轻人可能认为发几条微博和博客就算行使了他们的公民责任。

column1: They no longer join political parties, trade unions, and other interest groups.
column2: 他们不再参与政党、工会和其他利益集团。

column1: The average age of party members in Germany is over 50.
column2: 德国的政党成员平均年龄超过了50岁。

column1: In the United Kingdom, a retiree over 60 is more likely to be a trade-union member than a worker under 30 is.
column2: 在英国，60多岁的退休者比不到30的工人更有可能是工会成员。

column1: Without civil-society organizations, politics becomes more fragmented and less cohesive – and finding workable compromises becomes harder.
column2: 没有公民社会组织，政治变得更加支离破碎，凝聚力更小，更难找到可行的承诺。

column1: The revelations of snooping by the US National Security Agency (NSA) will hasten a more realistic assessment of the Internet’s effect on politics, providing a welcome opportunity to consider what has gone wrong and what could be put right.
column2: 美国国家安全局监控丑闻的曝光将加快对互联网政治影响的更加现实的评估，提供难得的机会思考是什么出了问题以及怎样做对的事。

column1: A multitude of small steps could help – such as giving pro-democracy movements the technology needed to evade autocrats, presenting digital media in a balanced way, and making political parties more responsive to their members.
column2: 一系列小步骤可以有所助益 — — 如给予亲民主运动躲避专制所必须的工具、以平衡的方式呈现数字媒体，以及提高政党对其党员的响应度。

column1: But the fundamental challenge is to suffuse the Internet with the same rules, rights, and values that pervade our democracies.
column2: 但根本挑战是用我们的民主中的相同规则、权利和价值充实互联网。

column1: Freedom cannot be absolute, whether online or offline.
column2: 自由永远不是绝对的，不管在线上还是在线下。

column1: Human rights, and not only the right to personal privacy, must be respected in cyberspace.
column2: 人权 — — 不仅仅是个人隐私权 — — 在网络空间中叶必须得到尊重。

column1: Because no single body or government sets rules for the entire Internet, any digital code of conduct would have to emerge from the grassroots – and thus would be highly imperfect.
column2: 由于没有个人和政府为整个互联网制定规则，因此任何数字行为规范都必须来自草根 — — 也因此必然是极不完美的。

column1: But perhaps the NSA has helped start the discussion: though we may not know which rules we want, we may now have gained a much better idea of which rules we do not want.
column2: 但也许美国国安局帮助我们开启了讨论：尽管我们可能不知道想要什么规则，但至少已经有了关于我们不想要什么规则的好主意。

column1: The Fear of “L”
column2: “L”恐慌

column1: WASHINGTON, DC – For the last few years, economists have been running through the alphabet to describe the shape of the long-awaited recovery – starting with an optimistic V, proceeding to a more downbeat U, and ending up at a despairing W. But now a deeper anxiety is beginning to stalk the profession: the fear of what I call an “L-shaped” recovery.
column2: 华盛顿—过去几年来，经济学家一直在用字母表描述期待已久的复苏 — — 一开始是乐观的“V ” ， 接着是不那么乐观的“U ” ， 最后是令人绝望的“W ” 。 但如今经济学界开始出现更深的焦虑，我将此称为“L”型复苏恐慌。

column1: Viewed in the light of the past five dismal years, 2013 was not bad for the advanced economies.
column2: 从过去的令人失望的五年看，2013年对发达经济体来说并不坏。

column1: The eurozone technically emerged from recession, the unemployment rate in the United States was lower than in previous years, and Japan began to stir after a long slumber and the negative shock of the earthquake and tsunami in 2011.
column2: 欧元区从技术上走出了衰退，美国的失业率也比前几年低，日本也在长期萎靡和2011年地震和海啸冲击之后开始觉醒。

column1: But if we look beneath the surface, it becomes evident that we are still hovering on the edge of a precipice.
column2: 但如果透过表现看本质，那么很显然我们仍在悬崖边缘徘徊。

column1: In the third quarter of this year, GDP contracted, on a year-on-year basis, not just in well-known cases like Greece and Portugal, but also in Italy, Spain, the Netherlands, and the Czech Republic.
column2: 今年3季度，GDP同比出现了收缩，不仅希腊、葡萄牙等出了名的疲软国是如此，意大利、西班牙、荷兰和捷克也是如此。

column1: And GDP in some countries, like France and Sweden, grew at rates lower than population growth, implying that per capita income declined.
column2: 法国和瑞典等国的GDP增长则赶不上人口，这意味着人均收入下降。

column1: Moreover, labor-market conditions deteriorated toward the end of the year.
column2: 此外，随着年底临近，劳动力市场状况在恶化。

column1: The number of unemployed in Germany grew for four consecutive months up to November.
column2: 今年前11个月，德国失业人口连续四年增加。

column1: Among the industrialized countries, the US is the bright spot.
column2: 在工业化国家中，美国一枝独秀。

column1: But, even there, while the unemployment rate has dropped during the year, and now stands at 7%, long-term joblessness is at an unusually high 36% of total unemployment, threatening to erode the skills base and make recovery that much more difficult.
column2: 但是，即使在美国，失经过一整年的下降后，失业率仍有7 % ， 长期失业占总失业的比重则高达反常的36 % ， 这意味着技能基础可能会受到影响，复苏将更加艰难。

column1: Japan’s revival, meanwhile, was caused by a much-needed liquidity injection.
column2: 与此同时，日本的复苏是由急需的流动性注入所带来。

column1: But Japan’s upturn will be short-lived unless Prime Minister Shinzo Abe’s government follows through on its promise of deeper structural reforms.
column2: 但日本的上升之势将是短暂的，除非首相安倍晋三的政府兑现其深化结构性改革的承诺。

column1: Given these developments, a few commentators have written recently about the possibility of a prolonged slowdown in industrialized countries.
column2: 基于这些发展态势，一些评论者最近开始大谈工业化国家长期减速的可能性。

column1: This is not a popular view, with others criticizing its advocates for stoking pessimism.
column2: 这一观点并不受欢迎，一些人批评这是咋刺激悲观情绪。

column1: But the pessimists cannot be dismissed out of hand.
column2: 但眼下我们无法驳倒悲观者。

column1: The fear of an L-shaped recovery is legitimate.
column2: “L”型复苏恐慌有其合理性。

column1: Modern technology has enabled workers in emerging economies to join a global labor market; in the absence of major policy innovation, this is likely to cause a prolonged drag on rich countries.
column2: 现代技术使得新兴经济体工人加入到全球劳动力市场；在没有重大政策创新的背景下，这可能造成对发达国家的长期拖累。

column1: And there are few signs of innovation.
column2: 而创新的迹象难以寻觅。

column1: There is, instead, a crisis of the economics profession, one that mirrors the crisis of the advanced economies.
column2: 相反，经济学界也存在一场危机，一场与发达经济体危机相映成趣的危机。

column1: Thanks to technological change and relentless globalization, the character of entire economies has changed dramatically over the last 50 years.
column2: 由于技术变迁和突进的全球化，在过去50年里，整体经济的性质发生了剧烈的变化。

column1: This has not been matched by changes in policymakers’ thinking.
column2: 而决策者思维并没有跟上。

column1: Why this stasis?
column2: 为什么会这样？

column1: One possibility is that the same factors that are making entrepreneurs over-cautious about new ventures are making policymakers prone to conservatism.
column2: 一种可能是，让企业家对创业企业过度谨慎的相同因素也促使决策者容易陷入保守。

column1: An engaging paper by the World Bank economists Leora Klapper and Inessa Love shows that one major consequence of the financial crisis has been entrepreneurs’ reluctance to start new firms.
column2: 世界银行经济学家克莱普尔（Leora Klapper）和洛夫（Inessa Love）的一篇出色论文指出，金融危机的重大后果之一是企业家不再愿意创办新企业。

column1: They show that after a steady increase from 2004 to 2007, firm creation dropped sharply.
column2: 他们指出，在2004年—2007年的稳步增长后，创业数量大幅下降。

column1: In the United Kingdom, for example, the number of newly registered limited-liability companies fell from 450,000 in 2007 to 372,000 in 2008 and 330,000 in 2009.
column2: 比如，在英国，新注册有限责任公司数量2007年为45万家，2008年为37万2千家，2009年为33万家。

column1: What is interesting is that while this decline is most marked in advanced economies, which are especially dependent on financial markets, it is visible in virtually all of the 95 countries that the authors studied.
column2: 有趣的是，尽管这一下降趋势主要出现在特别倚重金融市场的发达经济体，但在两位作者所研究的95个国家中，几乎每一个都能察觉到这一变化。

column1: The reason is not hard to fathom: A recession is a time when we tend to become cautious and stick to familiar territory, steering clear of new projects.
column2: 原因不难弄清：衰退时我们倾向于变得谨慎，坚守熟悉的领域，回避新项目。

column1: The same mindset has become apparent among economists and policymakers.
column2: 同样的思维也明显地存在于经济学家和决策者的脑海中。

column1: In times of profound uncertainty, the tendency is to cling to the domain of the familiar and avoid innovative thinking.
column2: 在存在重大不确定性的时期，有一种坚持熟悉领域、避免创新思维的倾向。

column1: This is especially unfortunate nowadays, when the structure of the global economy is changing rapidly.
column2: 眼下，这一倾向尤其不幸，因为全球经济的结构正在快速变化。

column1: A telltale sign of over-caution among economists and policymakers has been their propensity to convert the need for evidence to an aversion to analytical creativity.
column2: 经济学家和决策者过度谨慎的一个迹象是他们从要求证据变成厌恶分析创新。

column1: We should, of course, use the best available evidence in crafting policy.
column2: 当然，在制定政策中，我们应该使用能获得的最好的证据。

column1: But there are areas in which there is no evidence.
column2: 但有些领域没有证据可循。

column1: In these uncharted territories, one must rely on a combination of intuition and theory.
column2: 在这些未知领域，你必须依靠直觉和理论相结合。

column1: To resist new policy on the grounds that it is not founded in hard evidence is to trap us in the status quo.
column2: 抵制没有过硬证据的新政策将我们困在了现状之中。

column1: To see the mistake in this criticism, imagine that, on the basis of theory and some assumptions, one recommends new policy X, even though there is no hard evidence regarding whether or not X works.
column2: 要理解这一批评中的错误，设想你在理论和一定的假设的基础上建议实施新政策X，但你没有关于X是否奏效的过硬证据。

column1: Now use Y to refer to “not doing X.”
column2: 现在假设实施Y意味着“不实施X ” 。

column1: If there is no evidence regarding whether X works, there clearly is no evidence concerning whether Y works.
column2: 如果没有关于X是否奏效的证据，也显然没有关于Y是否奏效的证据。

column1: So, if the lack of evidence is considered a good reason not to do X, it is also a good reason not to do Y. But this is a contradiction, because it is impossible not to do either X or Y.
