column2: 因此，如果缺少证据被认为是不采用X的好理由，那么它同样也是不采取Y的好理由。 但这就形成了一个悖论，因为你不可能既不实施X，也不实施Y。

column1: The propensity to use this inconsistent argument reflects a proclivity for the status quo and a bias against policy innovation.
column2: 持有这一站不住脚的观念体现了偏袒现状、阻挠政策创新的倾向。

column1: But what we need now is precisely the type of new analytical thinking that spurred the great advances of economics as a discipline over the last two and a half centuries – and that led to major policy breakthroughs during the Great Depression.
column2: 但我们现在所需要的正是新的分析思维，新的分析思维刺激了经济学作为一门学科在过去两个半世纪取得重大进步，也刺激了大萧条期间的重大政策突破。

column1: It is the absence of such creative thinking that has led the economics profession into an impasse, forcing economists and policymakers to contend with the fear of “L.”
column2: 缺少创造性思维让经济学界陷入了死胡同，也迫使经济学家和决策者陷入了“L”恐慌。

column1: Reason and the End of Poverty
column2: 推理和贫困的终结

column1: WASHINGTON, DC – The World Bank has set two new goals for itself: ending extreme and chronic poverty in the world by 2030, and promoting shared prosperity, defined in terms of progress of the poorest 40% of the population in each society.
column2: 华盛顿—世界银行给自己制定了两个新目标：2030年终结全世界的极端和长期贫困，并促进共同繁荣 — — 衡量标准是各个社会最贫困40%人群的改善。

column1: Now that the United Nations General Assembly Open Working Group on Sustainable Development Goals has endorsed the Bank’s anti-poverty target, debate about how to achieve it has revived an old question: Will the benefits of economic growth trickle down on their own, reaching all, or will we need targeted redistributive policies?
column2: 联合国大会可持续发展目标开放工作组（Open Working Group on Sustainable Development Goals）支持世行的减贫目标，而关于如何实现的争论让我们重新面对了一个老问题：经济增长的好处会自动向下流动、触及所有人，还是需要定向的分配政策？

column1: Many people remain in the growth-only camp only because of an error in deductive reasoning; unlike committed ideologues, they can be weaned from their position.
column2: 许多人站在唯增长论阵营，之所以如此，唯一原因是演绎推理的错误；与坚定的空想家不同，他们可以转变立场。

column1: That is why the World Bank’s second goal of promoting shared prosperity is important not only in itself, but as an essential complement to the goal of ending poverty.
column2: 正因如此，世界银行的第二个目标 — — 促进共同繁荣的重要性不但在于其本身，也在于其是终结贫困目标的不可缺少的部分。

column1: Recognizing that some “frictional” poverty will inevitably persist over the next two decades, the World Bank’s formal target is to reduce the percentage of people living below the poverty line – defined as daily consumption of less than $1.25 (in purchasing-power-parity terms) per person – to less than 3%.
column2: 世界银行认识到一些“摩擦性”贫困在未来二十年是不可避免的，因此其正式目标让生活在贫困线以下的人的比重低于3 % 。 贫困线的标准是每人每天消费少于1.25美元（以购买力平价衡量 ） 。

column1: World Bank research predicts that if all countries grow at the same rates that they did over the past 20 years, with no change in income distribution, world poverty will fall to 7.7% by 2030, from 17.7% in 2010.
column2: 世行研究预测，如果所有国家都以与过去20年相同的速度增长，且收入分配情况不变，则2030年世界贫困率将从2010年的17.7%降至7.7 % 。

column1: If they grow faster, at the average rates recorded in the 2000’s, the poverty rate will fall to 5.5%.
column2: 如果增长得更快，达到2000年代的平均增长率，则贫困率将下降至5.5 % 。

column1: These numbers suggest that growth alone is unlikely to get us to the 3% target.
column2: 这些数字表明光靠增长无法达到3%的目标。

column1: But this is mere suggestion.
column2: 但这仅仅是“表明 ” 。

column1: One can argue that we should nonetheless rely on growth and simply adopt measures that encourage more of it.
column2: 你可以说，我们应该依靠增长，只是要采取进一步提振增长的手段。

column1: In a new paper, David Dollar, Tatjana Kleineberg, and Aart Kraay analyze empirically the relationship between growth and poverty.
column2: 在一篇新论文中，多拉（David Dollar ） 、 克莱因伯格（Tatjana Kleineberg）和库雷（Aart Kraay）从实证角度分析了增长和贫困的关系。

column1: Their comprehensive study draws on high-quality survey data from 118 countries and reaches a clear conclusion: the bulk of poverty eradication that took place in recent decades was driven by economies’ overall income growth.
column2: 他们的全面研究建立在118个国家的高质量调查数据之上，并得出了明确的结论：近几十年以来的减贫成就大部分要归功于经济的总体收入增长。

column1: More specifically, 77% of the cross-country variation in the income growth of the poorest 40% of the population reflects differences in average income growth.
column2: 更具体地说，最贫困的40%的人口的收入增长的77%的跨国差异反映了平均收入增长的差异。

column1: Findings like these lead many people to conclude that eradicating poverty requires us to rely on overall growth, and that direct government policy interventions have little merit.
column2: 此类发现让许多人认为减贫要求我们依赖总体增长，直接政府政策干预没有什么效果。

column1: But this is a wrong conclusion, which illustrates a lapse of logic.
column2: 但这一结论是错误的，它体现了错误的逻辑。

column1: To see why, suppose that in 1930 an economist conducted an empirical study of what cured infectious diseases, and, analyzing masses of data from previous years, concluded that 98% of all treatable illnesses were cured by non-antibiotic medicines – “tradicines,” which include all traditional medicines of various schools.
column2: 我们来看看为什么。 假设1930年有一位经济学家做了什么治好了流行病的实证研究，在分析了大量往昔年份数据后，他认为98%的可治疗治病是通过非抗生素 — — 即各种各样的“传统药物 ” — —治好的。

column1: This conclusion would most likely be valid, because the use of antibiotics before 1930 – just two years after Alexander Fleming discovered penicillin and years before it was fully workable as a cure – was rare and mostly inadvertent.
column2: 这一结论很有可能是成立的，因为在1930年以前 — — 此时弗莱明刚刚发现盘尼西林两年，距离盘尼西林的全面使用还有多年时间 — — 很少使用抗生素，即使用了也往往不是有意为之。

column1: But now suppose that the economist goes on to argue that, therefore, it would be silly to give patients penicillin, because we know that 98% of all treatable diseases were cured by tradicines, and penicillin is not a tradicine.
column2: 但再假设这位经济学家继续指出，因此，给病人使用盘尼西林是愚蠢的，因为我们知道98%的可治疗疾病是通过传统药物治愈的，而盘尼西林不属于传统药物。

column1: That is a wrong deduction, based on evidence that does not exist.
column2: 这是错误的演绎，它的基础是子虚乌有的证据。

column1: What the economist’s study in 1930 showed is that tradicines accounted for 98% of the cases that were successfully treated.
column2: 这位1930年的经济学家的研究表明了传统药物在98%的被治愈疾病中起了作用。

column1: It does not show that penicillin does not work.
column2: 它并没有标明盘尼西林起不了作用。

column1: This is a common mistake.
column2: 这是个常见错误。

column1: We often hear assertions like, “We must rely on the private sector to create jobs, because studies show that 90% of past jobs were created by the private sector.”
column2: 我们经常听到这样的论断 ： “ 我们必须依靠私人部门创造就业，因为研究表明90%的昔日岗位是私人部门创造的 。 ”

column1: If we accepted this reasoning, we would have to accept a Soviet researcher’s assertion in the late 1980’s that we must rely on the state to create jobs, because 90% of past jobs were created by the state.
column2: 如果我们接受这一推理，我们同样也必须接受1980年代末一位苏联经济学家的论断 — — 我们必须依靠国家创造就业，因为90%的昔日岗位是由国家创造的。

column1: On job creation, there is both theory and evidence to support the conclusion that the private sector is the main driver of sustainable expansion (which is not to deny that there may be scope for tweaking public policies to make the private sector more employment-friendly).
column2: 在就业创造方面，理论和证据都支持私人部门是可持续扩张的主要动力的结论（这并没有否认存在让私人部门变得更加利于就业的公共政策空间 ） 。

column1: But on poverty eradication, theory and evidence show that policy interventions, when skillfully designed, can play a significant role.
column2: 但在减贫方面，理论和证据表明政策干预 — — 如果设计合理的话 — — 可以扮演重要角色。

column1: Some of these policies already exist; some have to be crafted – the antibiotics of our time.
column2: 一些政策已经存在，一些则需要构思 — — 它们就是现时代的抗生素。

column1: In India, the government has tried for decades to get cheap food to the poor.
column2: 在印度，政府尝试为穷人提供廉价食品已有数十年。

column1: Cost-benefit analysis has led many to declare it a failed policy.
column2: 成本收益分析让许多人认为这是项失败的政策。

column1: But the fault lies with the program’s method, which is to rely on the state both to collect the food from farmers and to deliver it to the poor.
column2: 但问题在于该计划的方法 — — 从农民手中收集食品和把食品送到穷人手中的过程都依赖国家。

column1: Around 45% of food grain leaks out and disappears in this process.
column2: 大约45%的食用谷物在此过程中漏出并下落不明。

column1: This means that the program’s leaks need to be repaired, not that the entire scheme should be abandoned.
column2: 这意味着该计划需要填补漏洞，而不意味着应该抛弃整套机制。

column1: A carefully designed public-private partnership – in which the state gives a subsidy directly to the poor, who then buy food from private farmers and traders – would benefit all.
column2: 谨慎设计的公私合作 — — 国家直接向穷人发放补贴，然后穷人从私人农民和贸易商手中购买粮食 — — 能让所有人受益。

column1: Obviously, when the poor have more (and healthier) food, their nutrition improves; when better-nourished people go to school, they become more productive; the same is true of health services.
column2: 显然，当穷人拥有更多（更健康）的食物时，营养就能得到改善；当营养更好的人们进入学校时，他们的生产率就会得到提高；同样的道理也适用于健康服务方面。

column1: Overall economic growth is important, but the poor should not have to wait until its benefits trickle down to them; with the right anti-poverty policies, governments can encourage trickle-up growth as well.
column2: 总体经济增长十分重要，但穷人不能坐等好处渗透到自己身上；在正确的减贫措施的帮助下，政府也能够鼓励自下而上渗透的增长。

column1: A Radioactive Bank to be Welcomed
column2: 值得欢迎的放射性元素银行

column1: CANBERRA – One of the many things the world has learned from the Iran nuclear saga is that its leaders made a mistake, when negotiating the Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty (NPT) in the 1960s, in not doing anything to constrain uranium enrichment and plutonium reprocessing.
column2: 堪培拉—世界从伊朗核传奇中学到的众多教训之一是其领导人在20世纪60年代谈判核不扩散条约式犯了一个错误，没有做任何事情约束铀浓缩和钚再处理。

column1: This failure apparently stemmed from the belief – long since proven wrong, certainly in the case of uranium – that the only states ever likely to possess that technical capability already possessed nuclear weapons, or (like Germany) were totally committed never to acquire them.
column2: 这一错误显然源自一个早就在铀问题上被证明错误的信念 — — 仅有的那些有可能拥有这一技术能力的国家要么已经拥有了核武器，要么（如德国）承诺永远不会拥有该能力。

column1: As a result, any member state can argue for its “inalienable right” under the NPT to pursue any stage of the nuclear fuel cycle.
column2: 结果，任何成员国都可以主张根据核不扩散条约拥有追求核燃料循环任何阶段的“不可侵犯的权利 ” 。

column1: Although any such right extends only to activities for “peaceful purposes,” the loophole is gaping.
column2: 尽管这一权利只适用于“和平目的”活动，但存在巨大的漏洞。

column1: Any technically capable state – and there are now dozens of them – can build uranium enrichment facilities with the official purpose of producing fuel for nuclear power or research reactors, but which are nonetheless inherently capable of producing the much higher-grade fuel needed for nuclear weapons.
column2: 任何有技术能力的国家 — — 目前有几十个之多 — — 都可以建造核浓缩设施，只要官方目的是为核能或研究性反应堆生产能源，但它们当然都有能力制造核武器所需要的更高级别的燃料。

column1: It is not for nothing that such facilities have been described as “bomb starter kits,” and that Iran’s progress down that path – whether deliberately designed to give it a latent weapons breakout capability or not – has spooked so many others in the international community.
column2: 这些设施被称为“核弹发射装置”不是没有道理，伊朗在这方面取得进展 — — 不管是否有意设计成具有潜在武器突破能力 — — 让国际社会的许多国家恐慌不已。

column1: That is why there was so much pressure to produce the deal now on the table, which dramatically limits Iran’s enrichment capability.
column2: 因此才会有如此大的压力促成了现在摆到台面上的协议，该协议极大地限制了伊朗的核浓缩能力。

column1: While renegotiating the NPT itself to close the enrichment loophole seems for now a lost cause, there are other ways to address this proliferation risk.
column2: 如今，重新谈判核不扩散条约本身、补上浓缩漏洞纯属出新妄想，但又其他办法可以遏制这一核扩散风险。

column1: One of the most important, and long-advocated, strategies is to demonstrate to countries that rely on nuclear power, or are planning to develop it, that they do not need their own uranium-enrichment program to ensure their fuel supply’s security.
column2: 最重要的办法之一、也得到长期支持的战略是向依赖或计划发展核能的国家证明，它们不需要拥有自己的核浓缩计划来确保能源供给安全。

column1: Concern about fuel-supply security has always been Iran’s main publicly stated justification for acquiring its enrichment capability – a justification that its critics assert was manufactured simply to conceal a covert weapons agenda.
column2: 担心燃料供给安全一直是伊朗为获得铀浓缩能力厄尔提出的主要公开理由 — — 批评者指出，这一理由纯粹是为了掩盖武器日程而捏造的。

column1: Whether or not that is the case, all current and would-be nuclear power producers are entitled to be anxious about having an absolutely assured fuel supply, given the major economic and social consequences they would face in the event of a disruption.
column2: 无论是否真的如此，所有当前和潜在核能生产商都有权利担忧有绝对保障的燃料供给，因为一旦发生干扰，将带来巨大的经济和社会后果。

column1: Yes, until now, the commercial nuclear-fuel market has worked well: no power reactor has had to shut down because of fuel-supply disruptions.
column2: 诚然，到目前为止，商业核燃料市场运转良好：没有一个核反应堆因为燃料供给干扰而关闭。

column1: But the cut-off of the supply of other energy resources (notably Russia’s disruption of natural-gas supplies to Ukraine and, by extension, to Western Europe) has raised legitimate concerns about whether this could happen with nuclear fuel.
column2: 但切断其他能源资源的供给（令人关注的有俄罗斯干扰乌克兰进而影响西欧的天然气供给）引起了关于核燃料是否也会发生类似事件的合理担忧。

column1: Although the issue has been much debated, until now there has been only modest progress in developing fuel-supply assurance arrangements that would meet this concern.
column2: 尽管这一问题经过了大量争论，但到目前为止，在制定燃料供给保障安排以解决这一担忧方面，进展十分有限。

column1: Russia, with the support of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), maintains a sizeable reserve of low-enriched uranium (LEU) at its international center in Angarsk; but, in the current security environment, there has been understandable international reluctance to rely on it.
column2: 在国际原子能机构的支持下，俄罗斯安加尔斯克（Angarsk）国际中心保留了大量低浓缩铀储备；但是，在当前的安全环境下，不难理解国际社会不愿意依赖这些能源。

column1: The United Kingdom has proposed a supply guarantee of its own, though it has so far attracted little attention.
column2: 英国已提出其自身的供给保障安排，尽管到目前为止没有受到多少关注。

column1: Now, in an important new development, to be officially launched this month (on August 27), Kazakhstan is establishing a major new international fuel bank, which it will operate on behalf of the IAEA.
column2: 如今，在一项将在本月（8月27日）正式启动的计划中，哈萨克斯坦将成立一家新的国际燃料银行，并代表国际原子能机构经营它。

column1: The new facility should once and for all remove the main excuse that has been advanced, sincerely or not, for building and maintaining homegrown enrichment capability.
column2: 该新银行理应一劳永逸地消除一直以来为了维持本国铀浓缩能力而有意或无意地宣传的借口。

column1: Scheduled to commence operations in 2017, the Kazakh fuel bank will store up to 90 tons of LEU, sufficient to refuel three typical power-producing light water reactors.
column2: 按计划，哈萨克燃料银行将在2017年开张营业，它将储存90吨低浓缩铀，足以为三个典型的发电用轻水反应堆提供燃料补给。

column1: While Kazakhstan will physically operate the bank, the uranium will be owned and controlled by the IAEA, and made available to non-nuclear-weapon states if, for any reason, they cannot secure the LEU they need from the commercial market.
column2: 该银行由哈萨克斯坦实际经营，但铀将由国际原子能机构所有和控制，并且只能用于无核武器国家，条件是（不管出于什么原因）它们无法从商业市场上获得它们所需要的低浓缩铀。

column1: Provided the state in question is in compliance with its comprehensive non-proliferation safeguards agreement with the IAEA, it can draw the required fuel from the bank and transfer it to a fuel fabricator to make fuel assemblies for the reactors involved.
column2: 如果问题国家遵守其与国际原子能机构的全面核不扩散安全保障协议，它���以从该银行获得所需要的燃料，运送至燃料生产商为相关核反应堆制作燃料组件。

column1: The Kazakh fuel bank has very wide and high-level international backing, helped by the country’s credentials.
column2: 哈萨克燃料银行获得了十分广泛的高级别国际支持，这要归功于哈萨克斯坦的国家信誉。

column1: A former nuclear test-site state, Kazakhstan willingly gave up the nuclear weapons on its territory when the opportunity arose with the dissolution of the Soviet Union, and it has been a strong and consistent advocate of nuclear arms control and disarmament ever since.
column2: 作为前核试验场地所在国，哈萨克斯坦愿意在苏联解体时放弃拥有核武器的良机，并且此后一直强烈支持核武器控制和裁军。

column1: The bank has been funded by voluntary contributions, including $50 million from the Nuclear Threat Initiative, a United States-based NGO, $49 million from the US government, up to $25 million from the European Union, $10 million each from Kuwait and the United Arab Emirates, and $5 million from Norway.
column2: 该银行通过自愿捐款筹集资金，包括来自美国非政府组织核威胁计划（Nuclear Threat Initiative）的5,000万美元、来自美国政府的4,900万美元，来自欧盟的最多2,500万美元，来自科威特和阿联酋的1,000万美元以及来自挪威的500万美元。

column1: Aside from the Iran deal, good news on nuclear weapons has been sparse in recent years.
column2: 除了伊朗协议，关于核武器的好消息在近几年里鲜有耳闻。

column1: The new Kazakh fuel bank is a significant step toward achieving a world free of nuclear weapons.
column2: 新的哈萨克燃料银行是迈向无核世界的重大进步。

column1: Those who have worked to establish it deserve the world’s gratitude.
column2: 致力于成立这家银行的人应该获得全世界的感谢。

column1: A Young State in an Uncertain World
column2: 身处不确定世界的年轻国家

column1: ALMATY – In mid-November, Kazakhstan hosted the third annual “Astana Club,” a new independent and unbiased platform for dialogue among international experts, politicians, and media representatives on the “critical issues affecting all the countries of Eurasia.”
column2: 阿拉木图—11月中旬，哈萨克斯坦主办了第三次“阿斯塔纳俱乐部”年会。 阿斯塔纳俱乐部是一个新成立的国际商界领袖、政治家、媒体代表和其他专家就“影响欧亚全体国家的关键问题”进行探讨的独立和中立的平台。

column1: The event epitomized Kazakhstan’s foreign policy over the last two decades, at a moment when that policy is set to confront unprecedented tests.
column2: 它是哈萨克斯坦过去二十年来外交政策成果的集中体现，如今，哈萨克斯坦外交政策正面临前所未有的考验。

column1: Participants in this year’s Astana Club were as high-profile as they were diverse.
column2: 今年阿斯塔纳俱乐部的与会者规格高且多样化。

column1: They included representatives of leading think tanks from Europe, Asia, the United States, and the Middle East; former presidents, such as Turkey’s Abdullah Gül and Slovenia’s Danilo Türk; former European Commissioner Benita Ferrero-Waldner; Indian member of parliament Shashi Tharoor; and CEO of Channel One Russia Konstantin Ernst.
column2: 其中包括来自欧洲、亚洲、美国和中东的领先智库代表；一些前国家首脑，如土耳其的居尔和斯洛文尼亚的图尔克；前欧盟委员费雷罗-沃尔德纳（Benita Ferrero-Waldner ） ； 印度议会议员沙鲁尔（Shashi Tharoor）以及俄罗斯一频道（Channel One Russia）首席执行官恩斯特（Konstantin Ernst ） 。

column1: The discussions took place in the Nazarbayev Centre, housed in an imposing and futuristic building designed by the renowned British architect Norman Foster.
column2: 讨论在纳扎尔巴耶夫中心举行，这是一座美轮美奂的未来主义建筑，由英国著名建筑师福斯特（Norman Foster）设计。

column1: In a scene reminiscent of the intergalactic assembly in Star Wars, participants sat at a large table encircling a map of Eurasia to discuss the emerging world order, great power rivalries, sanction wars, nuclear proliferation, and regional integration projects.
column2: 会议的情景很像是《星球大战》中的星系议会，与会者坐在一张大桌子旁，四周环绕着欧亚地图，讨论新兴国际秩序、大国对立、制裁战争、核扩散和地区一体化等议题。

column1: This combination of status-seeking public relations and the provision of public goods that characterizes the Astana Club discussions has long been a feature of Kazakhstan’s foreign policy.
column2: 阿斯塔纳俱乐部的讨论既是追求地位（status-seeking）的公关活动，也提供公共品，这一组合也是哈萨克斯坦外交政策的长期特征。

column1: For example, every three years Kazakhstan hosts a Congress of Leaders of World and Traditional Religions, for which it commissioned Foster to build another imposing and futuristic building, the Palace of Peace and Reconciliation.
column2: 比如，每三年，哈萨克斯坦都要举办一次世界和传统宗教领导人会议（Congress of Leaders of World and Traditional Religions ） ， 为此，哈萨克斯坦委托福斯特设计了另一座美轮美奂的未来主义建筑 — — 和平和妥协宫（Palace of Peace and Reconciliation）

column1: Kazakhstan’s leadership has also worked to place itself at the forefront of the international non-proliferation movement.
column2: 哈萨克斯坦领导层还致力于让这个国家成为国际不扩散运动的先锋。

column1: And this past October, talks were held in Astana, the capital, on the Syrian crisis, with representatives of the Syrian government and some armed opposition groups in attendance – despite Kazakhstan’s distance from the tragic developments in that country.
column2: 在刚刚过去的10月份，首都阿斯塔纳举行了叙利亚危机谈判，来自叙利亚政府和一些武装反对集团的代表出席了会议 — — 尽管哈萨克斯坦和叙利亚的悲剧相隔万里之遥。

column1: This approach emerged soon after Kazakhstan’s independence in 1991, when the country initiated the Conference on Interaction and Confidence-Building Measures in Asia, modeled after the Conference on Security and Cooperation in Europe (now the OSCE).
column2: 这一方针在1991年哈萨克斯坦独立后不久便开始实施。 当时，哈萨克斯坦效仿欧洲安全与合作会议（即现在的欧安组织 ） ， 举办了亚洲相互协调和建设信心措施会议（Conference on Interaction and Confidence-Building Measures in Asia ） 。

column1: It reflects Kazakhstan’s appreciation of the liberal world order into which it was born in 1991 – an order that, at that time, had just received a major boost, with the Soviet Union’s collapse.
column2: 这体现出哈萨克斯坦对让它得以在1991年诞生的自由世界秩序的感激之情 — — 当时，这一秩序因为苏联解体而大大增强。

column1: Kazakhstan was never one to settle for being an accepted member of the liberal world order.
column2: 哈萨克斯坦从未满足于被自由世界秩序接受。

column1: It wanted to be exemplary, not just joining multilateral regimes and organizations, but also making its own contribution.
column2: 它希望成为一个典范 — — 不仅仅加入到多边机制和组织，还要做出自己的贡献。

column1: That is why Kazakhstan sought the chairmanship of the Organization for Security and Cooperation (OSCE) in Europe, which it obtained in 2010, and pursued a difficult but ultimately successful campaign to become a non-permanent UN Security Council member in 2017-2018.
column2: 因此，哈萨克斯坦寻求成为欧安组织主席国（在2010年如愿 ） ， 并克服万难，最终成功被选为2017—2018年联合国安理会非常人理事国。

column1: Kazakhstan aspires eventually to join the advanced economies in the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development.
column2: 哈萨克斯坦的目标是最终加入发达经济体行列，进入经合组织。

column1: But the international community that Kazakhstan is trying so hard to impress is undergoing fundamental change.
column2: 但哈萨克斯坦努力加入的国际社会正在经历更本性变革。

column1: Russia, the great power of Kazakhstan’s neighborhood, has unsettled the region with its invasion of Ukraine, in which it illegally annexed Crimea and started a war in the eastern Donbas region.
column2: 哈萨克斯坦的强大邻邦俄罗斯用入侵乌克兰、非法吞并克里米亚并在其东部的顿巴斯发动战争的举动让地区陷入不安。

column1: Compounding the problem, it seems that the United States under President Donald Trump cannot be counted on to continue constraining Russia or underwriting the post-1945 liberal world order that it created.
column2: 令问题更加棘手的是，特朗普治下的美国似乎无法继续遏制俄罗斯或支持其一手创造的1945年后的自由世界秩序。

column1: Having ridden to power on a wave of popular anger, Trump can’t even be counted on to follow its rules.
column2: 特朗普依靠群众的愤怒赢得权力，因此你甚至不能期望他会遵守规则。

column1: The European Union is similarly beset by internal political challenges – including negotiations with the United Kingdom over its withdrawal from the bloc – that stem from a surge in anti-establishment and nationalist sentiment.
column2: 类似地，欧盟也受制于源自反建制和民族主义情绪激昂的内部政治挑战 — — 包括与英国之间的退欧谈判。

column1: China has sought to step into the breach of global leadership – and has been met with surprisingly strong approval from the rest of the world.
column2: 中国试图填补全球领导力的空缺 — — 并且出人意料地受到了世界其他国家的高度评价。

column1: Such tectonic shifts are jarring enough for the large powers that bring them about; for smaller countries, they can be even more disorienting.
column2: 这些结构性变化足以让造成变化的大国感到震动；对小国来说，这些变化更令它们无所适从。

column1: Even as some welcome the demise of Western hegemony, the fact is that, for a country like Kazakhstan, unpredictability implies danger.
column2: 一些人乐于见到西方霸权的衰落，但事实是，对于像哈萨克斯坦这样的国家，不可预见性就意味着危险。

column1: It does not help that the emerging powers are less bound to international human rights norms and conventions, and thus less likely to attempt to enforce them.
column2: 新兴强国较少受到国际人权规范和公约的约束，因此不太可能努力执行这些规范和公约，这绝不是有利的情况。

column1: Kazakhstan achieved independence at a time when international cooperation, free trade, and collective security were encouraged, and it has long worked to support these principles.
column2: 哈萨克斯坦获得独立时正逢国际合作、自由贸易和集体安全大受鼓舞的时期，长期以来，它也致力于支持这些原则。

column1: Though Kazakhstan’s government, like other young states in the region, has lagged in advancing democracy and human rights, it has at least avoided foreclosing them entirely.
column2: 尽管和域内其他年轻国家一样，哈萨克斯坦政府在推动民主和人权方面有所落后，但至少没有完全压制它们。

column1: For now, Kazakhstan is trying to stay the course.
column2: 如今，哈萨克斯坦要坚持到底。

column1: But if today’s trends continue, it might lose direction.
column2: 但如果现在的趋势持续下去，它可能失去方向。

column1: Keeping Africa's Turnaround on Track
column2: 把非洲的复兴之路保持下去

column1: MONROVIA – For more than a decade, much of Africa has been moving forward.
column2: 发自蒙罗维亚 — — 近十多年以来，大部分非洲国家都取得了进步。

column1: Economic growth is rising, poverty is falling and democratic governance is spreading.
column2: 经济增长持续增加，贫困人口不断下降，而民主管治的范围则不断得到延伸。

column1: But the global financial crisis threatens to undo this progress by reducing investment, exports and aid just as they should be expanding to build on these successes.
column2: 然而这一进程如今却因全球经济危机而面临中断，因为本应不断扩大以实现上述发展的投资，出口和援助额都残遭削减。

column1: While international attention has been understandably focused on events in Darfur, Somalia and Zimbabwe, countries across the continent including Ghana, Tanzania, Mozambique and Liberia have been quietly turning their economies around.
column2: 当国际社会的目光还停留在达尔富尔、索马里和津巴布韦的问题之上时，加纳、坦桑尼亚，莫桑比克和利比里亚等一批非洲国家的经济形势已经悄悄发生了逆转。

column1: Economic growth rates regularly exceed 5% in many nations. The key to this progress is stronger African leadership and more accountable governance.
column2: 许多非洲国家的经济增长率一般都会超过5 % ， 而实现这一点的关键则是更有力的非洲人领导和更可靠的政府管治。

column1: Today, more than 20 African countries are democracies, up from just three in the 1980’s.
column2: 事实上相较于1980年代非洲只有3个民主国家的尴尬境况，如今已经有超过20个非洲国家实现了民主政治。

column1: They have competitive elections and improved human rights, and a much freer media.
column2: 这些国家都拥有更具竞争性的选举，人权也获得了改善，且媒体也更为自由。

column1: These efforts have been supported by increasingly effective development assistance.
column2: 而上述进步都是拜逐渐增加的有效发展援助所赐。

column1: Consider what has happened in my country, Liberia.
column2: 让我们看看利比里亚所发生的一些情况。

column1: After 14 years of devastating war, we faced enormous challenges.
column2: 在持续14年的毁灭性战争中走出来的人们面临着巨大的挑战。

column1: Our democratically elected government has worked with international partners and a growing number of private investors to turn things around.
column2: 我国的民选政府因此也连同国际合作伙伴以及接踵而来的私人投资者，大家共同携手希望把局面扭转过来。

column1: In the past three years, we have doubled primary school enrollment nationwide, refurbished hundreds of health facilities, begun rebuilding roads and restoring electricity.
column2: 在过去三年中，利比里亚全国的小学生入学率翻了一番，政府还重修了数百所卫生机构，并着手重建道路和电力系统。

column1: We have taken steps to root out corruption and remove unscrupulous officials.
column2: 我们也正在逐步根除腐败并撤换品行不良的官员。

column1: Growth has exceeded several percent per year.
column2: 全国每年的增长率都要比上一年额外增加了几个百分点。

column1: And, most critical, we are at peace.
column2: 更关键的是，我们维持住了和平的局面。

column1: We are restoring our once-vibrant nation, and the crucial component -- hope -- has already been revived.
column2: 我们正在重整这个曾经动荡不安的国度，连希望 — — 这个至关紧要的元素 — — 也开始回到了人民心中。

column1: Without international support, we would not have made this progress and would be at much greater risk of returning to war.
column2: 而如果没有国际支援的话，我们将难以取得上述的成就，甚至很可能重新沦落到战火当中。

column1: The global economic crisis threatens the progress in my country and elsewhere on our continent.
column2: 全球经济危机正威胁着我们国家及其他非洲国家的发展。

column1: Declining remittances from overseas workers, shrinking trade flows and investment could undermine new businesses, throw thousands out of work, and increase tensions and instability. The crisis -- which Africa did nothing to cause -- demands a strong response.
column2: 海外劳工汇款减少，贸易和投资资金流的萎缩将威胁到某些新兴行业，导致数千人失业并激发社会矛盾和不稳定性。

column1: African nations must do their part by continuing to address corruption, eliminate red tape and reduce obstacles to private-sector growth.
column2: 如果说这场跟非洲完全无关的危机需要得到强而有力回应的话，那么非洲国家必须尽自己的一份努力去杜绝腐败和官僚主义，并减少对私人部门增长所设置的障碍。

column1: But just as industrialized countries need a stimulus, African economies need a boost to keep their progress on track.
column2: 但正如发达工业国家需要采取经济刺激计划那样，非洲经济体也需要某些措施去启动经济，以保证整个发展势头得以保持。

column1: The G8 nations meeting in Italy this week have a useful role to play. Among other measures, they must keep their promises to increase aid and make it more effective by reducing bureaucratic delays, speeding disbursements and better aligning programs with African priorities. Effective aid is certainly not the only answer, but it has an increasingly vital role to play as other sources of finance dry up.
column2: 本周在意大利举办的8国集团（G8）会议将可以扮演一个有用的角色。 除了其他措施以外，这些国家都必须得遵守它们增加对非洲援助的诺言，并通过减少行政拖延，加速支付程序并以非洲优先的原则来令这些诺言更好地实现。

column1: It is needed to lay the foundations to help stimulate private sector growth.
column2: 当然，虽然援助并不是唯一的药方，但当其他经济来源面临枯竭之时它就是最为现实和关键的一环。 而这些援助款项将可以为刺激私人部门增长的计划提供一个坚实的基础。

column1: It would be a cruel irony if, just as Africa begins to succeed, its prospects are cut short by a crisis beyond its control.
column2: 如果当非洲在开始走向成功，但它的发展前景却被一场与之无关的危机所荼毒的话，那么整个事件将堪称是一个莫大的讽刺。

column1: Strong action by African governments and robust support from the international community can keep Africa's recovery on track.
column2: 非洲的复兴之路只有在非洲国家政府的强有力手段和国际社会源源不断的援助下才能得到保证。

column1: Both must continue to do their part.
column2: 而这也意味着双方都必须继续履行好自己的责任，缺一不可。

column1: Keep the IMF Out of Europe
column2: IMF不应该介入欧洲事务

column1: BUENOS AIRES – A short-lived rumor recently suggested that the International Monetary Fund was putting together a €600 billion ($803 billion) package for Italy to buy its new government about 18 months to implement the necessary adjustment program.
column2: 布宜诺斯艾利斯 — — 最近，一则短命流言说，IMF正在为意大利筹集6000亿欧元资金，目的是给意大利新政府赢得18个月的时间实施必要的调整计划。

column1: Except for the magnitude of the package, this sounds no different from a standard IMF adjustment program – the kind that we are accustomed to seeing (and criticizing) in the developing world.
column2: 除了资金规模之外，这一举动与标准的IMF调整计划 — — 那些我们发展中国家早已熟识（和一再批评）的措施 — — 别无二致。

column1: But there is one crucial difference: Italy is part of a select club that does not need outside rescue funds.
column2: 但有一个关键不同点：意大利是不需要外部援助资金的精英俱乐部的一员。

column1: So far, programs for the eurozone periphery have been spearheaded and largely financed by European governments, with the IMF contributing financially, but mainly acting as an external consultant – the third party that tells the client the nasty bits while everyone else in the room stares at their shoes.
column2: 到目前为止，为欧元区外围国家制定的计划均由欧洲政府牵头并提供主要资金，IMF会在财务上有所支持，但主要扮演外部顾问的角色 — — 即在房间里的所有人都自顾自时告诉客户房间里有恶棍的第三方。

column1: By contrast, the attempt to crowd multilateral resources into Europe was made explicit by eurozone finance ministers’ call in November for IMF resources to be boosted – preferably through debt-generating bilateral loans,– so that it could “cooperate more closely” with the European Financial Stability Facility.
column2: 相比之下，欧元区各国财长在11月呼吁IMF增加资源 — — 最好是通过产生债务的双边贷款 — — 以便其“更紧密地”与欧洲金融稳定基金“合作 ” ， 大量向欧洲注入多边资源的想法昭然若揭了。

column1: That means that the short-lived story of Italy’s jumbo IMF package, which was to be funded largely by non-European money, can be regarded as a game changer: while Italy may never receive such a package, Europe, it seems, is determined to resolve its problems using other people’s money.
column2: 这意味着短命的IMF意大利融资计划流言 — — 这笔资金将主要来自非欧洲资源 — — 可视为博弈变化器：意大利也许永远不会收到这笔钱，但欧洲似乎已下定决心要用他人的钱来解决自己的问题。

column1: There are at least three reasons why the IMF should resist this pressure, and abstain from increasing its (already extremely high) exposure to Europe.
column2: IMF至少有三大理由抵制这一要求，并拒绝增加其（已然极高的）对欧洲的风险暴露。

column1: First, and most obviously, Europe already has its own in-house lender of last resort.
column2: 首先，也是最为显而易见的是，欧洲已经有了其自身的最后贷款人。

column1: The European Central Bank can make available all the euros needed to backstop Italy’s debt.
column2: 欧洲央行可以提供支撑意大利债务所需要的所有欧元。

column1: And printing them would only offset, through mild inflation, the effects of the otherwise Draconian relative price adjustment that is taking place under the corset of the common currency.
column2: 印刷这笔钱将通过温和通胀抵消替代方案 — — 在共同货币的束缚下所发生的严厉的相对价格调整 — — 的影响。

column1: So it is puzzling that some observers have saluted the IMF’s involvement as a virtuous effort by the international community to bring the listing European ship to port.
column2: 因此，某些观察者赞扬IMF的介入行为，称其为国际社会力助欧洲巨船不沉的善举，这实在令人奇怪。

column1: Why should the IMF (or, for that matter, the international community) do for Europe what Europe can but does not want to do for Italy?
column2: 为何IMF（或国际社会）应该替欧洲帮助欧洲能够而不愿意帮助的意大利？

column1: Why should international money be mobilized to pay for European governance failures?
column2: 为何要动员国际资金为欧洲治理失买单？

column1: And if, as appears to be the case, Germany is playing a dangerous game of chicken with some of its eurozone partners, why should the cost be shifted to the IMF for the benefit of Europe’s largest and most successful economy?
column2: 此外，正如实际情形所显示的，如果德国是在和其欧元区伙伴玩一场危险的胆小鬼博弈，那么为何要把成本转移给IMF，而使欧洲最大最成功的经济体获益？

column1: Letting the ECB off the hook in this manner would simply validate for Europe as a whole the same moral hazard feared by German and other leaders who oppose ECB intervention.
column2: 用这种方式让欧洲央行脱身只能将整个欧洲置于德国和其他反对欧元区干预的领导人所担心的道德风险之中。

column1: The second reason to avoid IMF intervention in Europe is that lending to a potentially insolvent country has serious implications for the Fund.
column2: 避免IMF干预欧洲的第二个理由是，向本质上已经破产的国家提供贷款会对IMF造成严重影响。

column1: For starters, taking the IMF’s preferred-creditor status at face value, an IMF loan would entail substituting its “non-defaultable” debt for “defaultable” debt with private bondholders, because the Fund’s money is used primarily to service outstanding bonds.
column2: 从IMF的优先债权人地位看，IMF贷款将意味着用其“不可违约”债务替代私人债权人的“可违约”债务，因为IMF的资金将首先用于��还现有债务。

column1: As a result, a group of lucky bondholders would be bailed out at the expense of those that became junior to IMF debt and remained highly exposed to a likely restructuring.
column2: 结果，幸运的债权人将得到援助，但这是以那些沦为低于IMF债务一等且仍需面临重组风险的债权人的牺牲为代价的。

column1: Since a “haircut” can be imposed only on whatever is left of the defaultable private debt, the larger the IMF share, the deeper the haircut needed to restore sustainability.
column2: 因为损失只会落到可违约的私人债务头上（取决于偿还了IMF债务之后还有多少资金能够偿还这些债务 ） ， 因此IMF债务的比重越大，重建可持续性所需的损失就越深。

column1: For the same reason, IMF loans can be a burdensome legacy from a market perspective.
column2: 出于同样的理由，IMF贷款可能被市场视为负担。

column1: Because they represent a massive senior claim, they may discourage new private lending for many years to come.
column2: 由于它们代表着巨额的优先求偿权，因此将在多年内抑制新的私人贷款。

column1: This brings us to the third reason why the IMF should stay out of Europe’s crisis: what if Fund seniority fails?
column2: 由此产生了IMF应该之身欧洲事务之外的第三大理由：IMF债务失去了优先地位会怎样？

column1: The implicit preferred-creditor status is based on central-bank practices that establish that the lender of last resort is the “last in and first out.”
column2: 默认的优选债权人地位是建立在确定最后贷款人“后进先出”的央行行为的基础上的。

column1: It is this seniority that enables the IMF to limit the risk of default so that it can lend to countries at reasonable interest rates when nobody else will.
column2: 这一优先地位使得IMF得以限制违约风险，从而让其以合理利率在找不到其他贷款者的情况下向各国提供贷款。

column1: This works when the IMF’s share of a country’s debt is small, and the country has sufficient resources to service it.
column2: 这只有在IMF贷款占一国债务比重较低时、且该国有足够资源偿还IMF贷款时才有效。

column1: But seniority is not written in stone: poor economies that are unable to repay even the IMF are eligible for debt reduction under the Heavily Indebted Poor Countries program, and 35 have received it since the program was established in 1996.
column2: 但这一优先地位并非铁板一块：连IMF贷款都无力偿还的贫困经济体可以获得在重债穷国（Heavily Indebted Poor Countries）计划的框架下进行债务削减的资格，自该计划于1996年实施以来，共有35个国家走过这一程序。

column1: What would happen if, in five years, Italy were heavily indebted to the IMF?
column2: 如果5年后意大利成为对IMF的重债国会怎么样？

column1: What if private debt represented a share so small that no haircut would restore sustainability, forcing multilateral lenders to pitch in with some debt relief?
column2: 如果私人债务的比例是如此之低，以至于损失再大也无法重塑可持续性，逼迫多边贷款人接受某种程度的债务豁免会怎么样？

column1: The IMF’s seniority is an unwritten principle, sustained in a delicate equilibrium, and high-volume lending is testing the limit.
column2: IMF的优先地位并没有写成白纸黑字，只能在微妙的均衡中得以维持，大额贷款在考验它的极限。

column1: From this perspective, the proposal to use the IMF as a conduit for ECB resources (thereby circumventing restrictions imposed by European Union’s treaties), while providing the ECB with preferred-creditor status, would exacerbate the Fund’s exposure to risky borrowers.
column2: 从这一点看，将IMF用作欧洲央行资源管道（从而绕过欧盟条约的限制 ） ， 同时给予欧洲央行有限债权人地位，将增加IMF对高风险借款人的风险暴露。

column1: This arrangement could be seen as an unwarranted abuse of Fund seniority that, in addition, unfairly frees the ECB from the need to impose its own conditionality on one of its members.
column2: 这一安排可视为对IMF的无保险措施的滥用，也不公平地让欧洲央行逃脱了制约某个成员的需要。

column1: It makes little sense for the international community to assume that unnecessary risk.
column2: 国际社会没有必要假设非必须的风险。

column1: Let us hope that the IMF’s non-European stakeholders will be able to contain the pressure.
column2: 但愿IMF的非欧洲相关利益方能够顶住压力。

column1: The solution for Europe is not IMF money, but its own.
column2: 欧洲的问题不应该由IMF的资金解决，它们必须自力更生。

column1: The Noose Tightens
column2: 索套收紧

column1: WASHINGTON, DC – Even with a new minder trying to bring some order to the White House, President Donald Trump remains in a heap of trouble.
column2: 华盛顿—特朗普即使有心要让白宫井然有序，也要面对一系列麻烦。

column1: The recent installation of retired Marine Corps general John Kelly, formerly Trump’s Secretary for Homeland Security, as Chief of Staff, replacing the hapless Reince Priebus, has reduced some of the internal chaos and induced a bit more discipline in Trump’s behavior.
column2: 最近，特朗普任命他的前国土安全部部长、退役陆军上将约翰·凯利（John Kelly）为幕僚长，以取代倒霉的伦斯·普里巴斯（Reince Priebus ） ， 此举在一定程度上遏制了内部混乱，也给特朗普的行为带来了更多的纪律性。

column1: But all this could change any day, or at any moment.
column2: 但所有这一切都有可能在一夜之间，甚至一眨眼间发生变化。

column1: Kelly has put a stop to aides sauntering into the Oval Office whenever they felt like it – Trump tends to echo the last person he’s spoken with – and has demanded that papers and memos for the president be submitted to him first.
column2: 凯利已经禁止特朗普的助手随时随地进入椭圆办公室 — — 特朗普总是接受最后一个与他交谈的人的意见 — — 并要求呈递给总统的文本和备忘录先经他过目。

column1: For the time being, at least, the president’s tweeting has been reduced in number and nuttiness.
column2: 至少现在特朗普的推特已不再像过去那样频繁而疯狂了。

column1: Keen Trump observers expect that he’ll soon begin to chafe under the discipline Kelly has encouraged.
column2: 急不可耐的特朗普观察员们期待他很快就会厌烦凯利的雷厉风行。

column1: Understanding Trump’s enormous ego, Kelly is said to encourage gently rather than instruct.
column2: 凯利十分清楚特朗普的膨胀的自我，据说他推行纪律的方式是通过礼貌而不是指令。

column1: Kelly also has the advantage of Trump’s high regard for generals.
column2: 凯利还拥有一个优势：特朗普很看重将军。

column1: But Trump could well become incensed by news stories praising Kelly for bringing order to the White House.
column2: 但特朗普可能会因为表扬凯利给白宫带来秩序的报道而大发雷霆。

column1: (Counselor Steve Bannon never fully recovered in the president’s esteem after he was on the cover of Time magazine soon after the inauguration.)
column2: （白宫顾问史蒂夫·班农（Steve Bannon）自从特朗普就职典礼后不久上了《时代》杂志的封面，就再也没有赢得总统的充分尊重。 ）

column1: Meanwhile, Trump’s poll ratings are lower than ever – and the lowest of any president at such an early point in an administration.
column2: 与此同时，特朗普的支持率下降到了新低 — — 也是所有总统在执政早期的最低水平。

column1: Members of his own Republican Party are distancing themselves from him.
column2: 在他本人所在的共和党内，党员们纷纷与他保持距离。

column1: The recent failure of the Republican-dominated Congress to repeal Barack Obama’s signature achievement, the Affordable Care Act, which made health care available for millions of people who previously couldn’t afford it, was a humiliating defeat for Trump.
column2: 共和党占多数的国会最近没有能够推翻奥巴马的标志性成就 — — 平价医疗法（ACA ） ， 这特朗普的一次耻辱性惨败。 ACA让数百万此前无力承担医保的美国人能够获得医保。

column1: Just enough Republican senators (three, but more were in reserve if needed) voted to reject the last of several efforts to fulfill the party’s vow to replace “Obamacare.”
column2: 恰到好处的共和党参议员（三人，但如果需要的话，会有更多人“反水 ” ） 投票拒绝了共和党最后一次承诺取代“奥巴马医保”的议案。

column1: That nickname for the ACA, coined by the Republicans when the law was enacted in early 2010, was intended to be derogatory, and their opposition to the program seemed to be vindicated in that year’s midterm elections, when they swept both houses of congress.
column2: ACA的这个外号正是共和党在该法案于2010年初实施时所起，原本含有贬义，他们对该计划的反对也在当年举行的中期选举（共和党在国会两院赢得压倒性胜利）中得到了印证。

column1: But the Republicans didn’t reckon on two things: that as people gained access to health insurance (some 20 million by this year), it became popular – as did Obama, who ended his second term as one of America’s most liked presidents.
column2: 但共和党没有料到两件事：随着人们获得了医保（到今年为止有2,000万人 ） ， ACA也变得日益受到欢迎 — — 奥巴马也是如此，第二个任期结束时，他已经跻身美国最受喜爱的总统之一。

column1: Over Obama’s tenure, Republicans came to realize that it was no longer sufficient simply to call for a repeal of Obamacare, and their rhetoric shifted to the need to “repeal and replace.”
column2: 奥巴马执政期间，共和党开始认识到，仅仅要求取消奥巴马医保是不够的，他们的口风也变为要“取消并取代 ” 。

column1: They held more than 50 roll-call votes saying that they’d do just that, knowing that it didn’t really matter because Obama would veto any serious repeal.
column2: 他们进行了不下50次唱名投票（roll-call votes）说明他们就是要这样做，但十分清楚这其实没有什么用，因为奥巴马会否决一切严肃的取消议案。

column1: The roll calls were actually fundraisers: appeals to the unsuspecting Republican base to send money to keep up the fight against the supposedly hated program.
column2: 唱名投票实际上是为了筹集资金：号召毫不怀疑的共和党票仓贡献资金以保持反抗这个据说是饱受厌憎的计划。

column1: But when the 2016 election put a Republican in the White House, the party’s congressional leaders had nowhere to hide.
column2: 但当2016年大选让共和党入主白宫时，共和党的国会领袖们便无处可藏了。

column1: The Republicans were now in full control of the government – and they hadn’t a clue about what should replace Obamacare.
column2: 如今，共和党完全控制了政府 — — 并没有拿出应该如何取代奥巴马医保的方案来。

column1: At the end of six months in office, Trump doesn’t have a single legislative achievement to crow about (though he has claimed the Senate’s approval of Neil Gorsuch as a new Supreme Court justice as a victory).
column2: 执政六个月后，特朗普还没有一项立法成就值得宣扬（尽管他宣称参议院批准尼尔·哥萨奇（Neil Gorsuch）为新的最高法院法官是一场胜利 ） 。

column1: Significantly, Senate Republican leaders ignored Trump’s demand that they take up repeal and replace of Obamacare again, before they consider any other major issue.
column2: 令人瞩目的是，参议院共和党领袖们根本无视特朗普要他们在考虑任何重大议题之前，先再次着手取消和取代奥巴马医保的要求。

column1: While the health-care bill was commanding most of the attention on Capitol Hill, another piece of legislation was moving along in the Congress, representing another setback for Trump.
column2: 尽管医保法案占据了国会山的大部分精力，还有一项立法也在国会走了一遭，而特朗普再次遭受打击。

column1: Troubled by the president’s apparent soft spot for (or perhaps fear of) Vladimir Putin, overwhelming bipartisan majorities in both chambers passed a bill to impose more sanctions on Russia and – most unusually – to prevent the president from lifting any such penalties.
column2: 显然，总统对普京立场偏软（甚至可能有些畏惧 ） ， 受此影响，国会两院两党以压倒性多数通过了一项法案，加强对俄制裁，并 — — 反常地 — — 阻止总统取消一切惩罚。

column1: And, because the bill passed with enough votes to override a presidential veto, Trump had little choice but to sign it, which he did in private, without the customary presence of a bill’s sponsors and the press.
column2: 此外，该法案获得赞成票数足以推翻总统的否决权，因此特朗普别无选择，只能签署它，他也低调地这么做了，并没有按照惯例邀请法案发起人和媒体在场。

column1: Meanwhile, the investigation into Trump and his campaign’s relations with Russia in connection with its meddling in Trump’s favor in the 2016 election has continued out of the public’s sight.
column2: 与此同时，对特朗普及其选战阵营与俄罗斯的关系如何对特朗普的2016年总统竞选形成了有利影响的调查，仍然在公众的视线之外进行。

column1: That investigation has broadened to include Trump’s son-in-law Jared Kushner and his son Donald Jr.
column2: 该调查的范围有所扩大，特朗普的女婿贾雷德·库什纳（Jared Kushner）和他的儿子小唐纳德都已经受到牵连。

column1: This spring, Trump let it be known that he wanted the special counsel running that investigation, Robert Mueller, a former FBI director who is highly respected by both parties, to be fired.
column2: 今年春天，特朗普公开表示他想解雇负责调查的特别检察官罗伯特·穆勒（Robert Mueller ） 。 身为前联邦调查局局长，穆勒在两党中间都拥有崇高的威望。

column1: He’d already fired FBI director James Comey, but by law, he couldn’t fire Mueller himself, so he tried to bully Attorney General Jeff Sessions, who had (appropriately) recused himself from the investigation, into resigning.
column2: 他已经解雇了联邦调查局局长詹姆斯·科米（James Comey ） ， 但根据法律，他本人不能解雇穆勒，因此他试图胁迫司法部长 、 （ 合理地）将自己与调查撇清了关系的杰夫·塞申斯（Jeff Sessions）辞职。

column1: That way, Trump could appoint a replacement who would fire Mueller.
column2: 这样，特朗普就可以任命一位新的司法部长，让他来解雇穆勒。

column1: But Sessions, the first Republican senator to endorse Trump, was enjoying rolling back numerous Obama-era protections in areas like civil rights, and refused to resign.
column2: 但塞申斯作为第一位支持特朗普的共和党参议员，正在十分愉快地取消公民权利等领域的大量奥巴马时代的保护法令，拒绝辞职。

column1: Several of Sessions’ former Senate colleagues also demanded that Trump back off.
column2: 塞申斯的几位前参议员同事也要求特朗普收回成命。

column1: Though Kelly called Sessions to tell him that his job was safe, Republican senators, concerned that Trump might remove him during the August recess, established a procedure that would prevent Trump from appointing an interim attorney-general to fire Mueller, and warned that such a move would provoke a constitutional crisis.
column2: 尽管凯利打致电塞申斯，告诉他他的位置安全，但共和党参议员们担心特朗普可能会在8月份休假期间取而代之，因此制定了一套流程防止特朗普任命一位过渡司法部长来解雇穆勒，并警告这样的举动将导致宪政危机。

column1: Then, as Congress prepared to leave for the August recess, it was learned that Mueller – who had hired highly regarded prosecutors specializing in international financial transactions, despite Trump’s warnings not to investigate his finances – had impaneled a grand jury in Washington.
column2: 然后，就在国会散会迎接8月假期的时候，穆勒 — — 他招募了专长于国际金融交易的德高望重的检察官，尽管特朗普警告不要调查他的财务状况 — — 已经在华盛顿确定了大陪审团名单。

column1: The noose tightens.
column2: 索套收紧了。

column1: Northern Europe’s Drag on the World Economy
column2: 北欧对世界经济的拖累

column1: MADRID – In recent years, China’s current-account surpluses – which have averaged almost $220 billion annually since 2000 – have attracted much criticism from the rest of the world.
column2: 马德里—近几年来，中国的经常项目赤字 — — 自2000年以来平均每年可达近2200亿美元 — — 招致世界其他国家的猛烈批评。

column1: But Germany’s similar-size surpluses – which have averaged about $170 billion since the euro’s introduction in 1999 – have, until recently, largely escaped scrutiny.
column2: 但德国的盈余与中国规模相当 — — 自1999年引入欧元以来平均每年1700亿美元 — — 却一直没有引起多少关注，直到最近才有所改变。

column1: The difference, it was argued, was monetary union.
column2: 人们指出，区别就在于货币联盟。

column1: So long as the eurozone as a whole was relatively balanced, Germany’s surpluses were considered irrelevant – just as, say, Texas’s surpluses have never been considered an issue in the United States.
column2: 只要欧元区作为一个整体相对平衡，德国的盈余就被视为无关紧要 — — 正如（比如）得克萨斯州的盈余从来不会被认为是美国的问题。

column1: Chinese surpluses, by contrast, were seen as a cause of global imbalances.
column2: 相反，中国的盈余被视为全球失衡的源头之一。

column1: This argument is correct in the sense that it is the current-account surplus or deficit of a monetary union as a whole that can be expected to have exchange-rate implications.
column2: 作为整体的货币联盟的经常项目盈余或赤字可以预期带来汇率影响，从这一点上看，区别对待中国和德国是正确的。

column1: And, unlike China, Germany no longer has a “national” exchange rate that can adjust in response to its current-account surplus.
column2: 此外，与中国不同，德国不再拥有可以根据经常项目盈余调整的“国家”汇率。

column1: These factors – together with the lack of trade data for regions within countries – have led economists only rarely to consider countries’ internal surpluses or deficits.
column2: 这些因素 — — 以及缺少国家内地区的贸易数据 — — 导致经济学家很少考虑国家内部的盈余或赤字。

column1: But, in net terms, a region within a country – or, like Germany, a country or sub-region within a monetary union – still “subtracts” from national and global aggregate demand if it exports more than it imports.
column2: 但是，从净值角度讲，一国内部地区 — — 或者向德国那样的货币联盟内部的一国或次级地区 — — 如果出口多于进口，仍然是国家或全球总需求的“减少”项。

column1: Witness how expenditure cuts by US state governments – many of which are constitutionally required to balance their budgets – frustrated, to some degree, America’s massive federal-government stimulus in 2010-2011.
column2: 看看2010—2011年间美国州政府 — — 根据宪法，许多州政府必须平衡预算 — — 的减支如何在一定程度上阻碍了联邦政府的大规模刺激。

column1: For this reason, it is relevant to ask whether a country as large as Germany – or even a large state like California or Texas – augments or depletes global aggregate demand.
column2: 出于这个原因，有必要问一问，像德国这样的大国 — — 甚或像加州或得州这样的大州 — — 增加还是减少了全球总需求。

column1: (In fact, as sovereign countries, California and Texas would have been the world’s 12th and 14th largest economies, respectively, in 2012 – ahead of the Netherlands, Mexico, and South Korea.)
column2: （事实上，若作为主权国家，加州和得州分别是2012年世界第12大和第14大经济体，位于荷兰、墨西哥和韩国之前。 ）

column1: That question is all the more important, because the Netherlands and Austria, two of Germany’s Northern European eurozone neighbors, continue to run current-account surpluses, while the Southern European crisis countries have reversed their previously large deficits, as austerity has squeezed domestic demand and made room for an increase in exports.
column2: 这一问题非常重要，因为德国的两个北欧欧元区邻国 — — 荷兰和奥地利一直有经常项目盈余，而随着紧缩挤压了内需、为出口增长创造了空间，南欧危机国也扭转了此前的巨额赤字。

column1: As a result, the eurozone as a whole will produce a surplus close to $260 billion this year, which represents a new global imbalance that is more directly comparable to China’s in the past decade.
column2: 结果，欧元区作为一个整体今年将有近2600亿美元的盈余，这将带来可以与过去十年的中国直接比较的新的全球失衡。

column1: Europe’s non-eurozone surplus countries – Sweden, Denmark, Switzerland, and Norway (all of which tie their exchange rates to the euro to some degree) – magnify this global imbalance.
column2: 欧洲的非欧元区盈余国 — — 瑞典、丹麦、瑞士和挪威（所有这些国家都在一定程度上将汇率盯住欧元 ） — —放大了这一全球失衡。

column1: Northern Europe – including these four countries and Germany, the Netherlands, and Austria – is running a massive current-account surplus of about $550 billion.
column2: 北欧 — — 包括上述四国和德国、荷兰和奥地利 — — 的经常项目盈余高达5500亿美元。

column1: Meanwhile, China’s surplus is unlikely to exceed $150 billion this year.
column2: 与此同时，中国的盈余今年不可能超过1500亿美元。

column1: In fact, the highest level that China’s annual surplus has ever reached was around $400 billion in 2007-2008 – when the US was poised to introduce trade sanctions against the country, because it viewed this imbalance as a threat to the stability of the US and the world economy.
column2: 事实上，中国年度盈余的最高水平为2007—2008年间的4000亿美元左右，当时美国甚至意欲对中国采取贸易制裁，因为它认为这一失衡已威胁到美国和世界经济的稳定。

column1: What is most problematic about the eurozone’s situation is that unemployment in some of the crisis countries – Spain and Greece – remains above 20%.
column2: 欧元区局面问题最大的地方在于一些危机国 — — 西班牙和希腊 — — 的失业率仍在20%以上。

column1: These countries are trying to achieve a difficult “internal devaluation” – that is, a reduction in their domestic unit labor costs relative to the eurozone’s stronger economies – while the overall eurozone surplus caused by Northern Europe puts upward pressure on the exchange rate, undermining their competitiveness outside the monetary union.
column2: 这些国家正在试图实现艰难的“内部贬值 ” ， 即降低其相对于欧元区坚挺经济体的国内单位劳动力成本，但北欧造成的欧元区整体盈余给汇率造成了升值压力，破坏了它们在欧元区之外的竞争力。

column1: Spain and Greece have managed to achieve an internal devaluation of about 5% this year vis-à-vis Germany, but their competitiveness vis-à-vis the US and dollar-linked countries has not improved, because the euro has appreciated by more than 5% against the dollar.
column2: 西班牙和希腊在今年设法实现了约5%的（相对德国的）内部贬值，但它们相对美国和美元相关国家的竞争力并未得到改善，因为欧元相对美元升值了5%以上。

column1: And, indeed, the euro should appreciate, because the eurozone as a whole is now running a large current-account surplus.
column2: 事实上，欧元应该升值，因为欧元区作为一个整体存在巨大的经常项目盈余。

column1: One can only pity the Southern European countries.
column2: 我们只能对南欧国家表示同情。

column1: They should almost thank the French for their inability to impose effective austerity measures and thereby still run a small current-account deficit, which has prevented the eurozone surplus from becoming even larger.
column2: 它们应该感谢法国，因为法国没能采取有效的紧缩措施，因此仍保持经常项目略有赤字的状态，阻止了欧元区盈余的进一步扩大。

column1: But an abundance of pity alone will not help.
column2: 但光有同情泛滥无济于事。

column1: Northern European countries, which have ample room to increase wages and implement expansionary policies, must do so.
column2: 北欧国家有充足的空间提高工资和实施扩张性政策，也必须这样做。

column1: This would directly benefit Northern European citizens themselves, while helping to keep the euro down and stimulate growth and adjustment in Southern Europe and the global economy as a whole.
column2: 这将直接有利于北欧公民本身，同时有助于拉低欧元币值，刺激南欧和整个全球经济的增长和调整。

column1: Tailspin or Turbulence?
column2: 永久坠落还是暂时危机？

column1: WASHINGTON, DC – Since the beginning of the year, a new wave of doubt has engulfed emerging markets, driving down their asset prices.
column2: 发自华盛顿特区 — — 自年初以来，新一轮的质疑声淹没了新兴市场，导致这些国家的资产价格下跌。

column1: The initial wave struck in the spring of 2013, following the Federal Reserve’s announcement that it would begin “tapering” its monthly purchases of long-term assets, better known as quantitative easing (QE).
column2: 第一波冲击始于2013年春季，当时美联储宣布将开始“逐渐削减”每月的长期资产收购数额（即所谓的量化宽松 ） 。

column1: Now that the taper has arrived, the emerging-market bears are ascendant once again.
column2: 如今削减如约而至，新兴市场的熊市也再度降临。

column1: Pressure has been strongest on the so-called “Fragile Five”: Brazil, India, Indonesia, South Africa, and Turkey (not counting Argentina, where January’s mini-crisis started).
column2: 其中压力最大的是所谓“脆弱五国 ” — —巴西、印度、印尼，南非以及土耳其（1月份爆发小型危机的阿根廷并未计算在内 ） 。

column1: But worries have extended to other emerging economies, too.
column2: 但忧虑情绪也已蔓延到了其他新兴市场国家。

column1: Will the Fed’s gradual reduction of QE bring with it more emerging-market problems this year?
column2: 美联储逐渐缩减量化宽松的行动是否在今年催生更多的新兴市场危机？

column1: To what extent are today’s conditions comparable to those that triggered the Asian crisis of 1997 or other abrupt capital-flow reversals in recent decades?
column2: 相比于导致1997年亚洲金融危机或其他突发性资本外流事件，当今的状况究竟处于何种程度？

column1: Emerging-market bulls point out that most major middle-income countries have substantially lowered their public debt/GDP ratios, giving them fiscal space that they lacked in the past.
column2: 新兴市场的牛市表明大多数主要中等收入国家都已经切实降低了自身的公共负债/GDP比率，并使之获得了过去所缺少的财政空间。

column1: But neither the Mexican “Tequila crisis” of 1994 nor the Asian crisis of 1997 was caused by large public deficits.
column2: 但无论是1994年墨西哥的“龙舌兰危机”还是1997亚洲金融风暴都并非由公共负债所引发。

column1: In both cases, the effort to defend a fixed exchange rate in the face of capital-flow reversals was a major factor, as was true in Turkey in the year prior to its currency collapse in February 2001.
column2: 在两起事件中，在面对资本外流时试图维护固定汇率的举措才是主要原因，而2001年二月土耳其货币崩盘前一年的情况也是如此。

column1: Today, most emerging countries not only have low public-debt burdens, but also seem committed to flexible exchange rates, and appear to have well-capitalized banks, regulated to limit foreign-exchange exposure.
column2: 如今，大多数新兴市场国家不仅公共债务负担较低，同时似乎都实行浮动汇率，而且国内银行资本充足，并施行监管以限制外汇风险。

column1: Why, then, has there been so much vulnerability?
column2: 但为什么它们依然会如此脆弱？

column1: To be sure, the weakest-looking emerging countries have large current-account deficits and low net central-bank reserves after deducting short-term debt from gross reserves.
column2: 无可否认，那些看上去最为脆弱的新兴市场国家都有着巨额经常帐户逆差，同时在总储备扣除短期债务后的，这些国家中央银行的净储备也所剩无几。

column1: But one could argue that if there is a capital-flow reversal, the exchange rate would depreciate, causing exports of goods and services to increase and imports to decline; the resulting current-account adjustment would quickly reduce the need for capital inflows.
column2: 但有人也会说：如果存在资本外流的话那么汇率将会下降，导致商品和服务的出口增加而进口减少；那么随后的经常帐户调整将很快减少国家对资本流入的依赖。

column1: Given fiscal space and solid banks, a new equilibrium would quickly be established.
column2: 既然存在一定财政回旋空间而且银行较为稳固，那么一个新的均衡状态将会很快建立起来。

column1: Unfortunately, the real vulnerability of some countries is rooted in private-sector balance sheets, with high leverage accumulating in both the household sector and among non-financial firms.
column2: 不幸的是，对于某些国家来说，真正的弱点其实是在私人部门的资产负债表上，家庭和非金融企业都承担着极高的金融杠杆。

column1: Moreover, in many cases, the corporate sector, having grown accustomed to taking advantage of cheap funds from abroad to finance domestic activities, has significant foreign-currency exposure.
column2: 此外在许多情况下，那些逐渐依赖利用廉价外国资金来发展国内业务的企业部���也会暴露在极大的外汇风险之下。

column1: Where that is the case, steep currency depreciation would bring with it serious balance-sheet problems, which, if large enough, would undermine the banking sector, despite strong capital cushions.
column2: 在这种情况下，汇率暴跌将引发严重的资产负债表风险，一旦危机发展到一定程度就将波及银行系统，即便拥有强大的资本作缓冲都将无济于事。

column1: Banking-sector problems would, in turn, require state intervention, causing the public-debt burden to rise.
column2: 而银行部门危机将转而需要政府介入，导致公共债务上升。

column1: In an extreme case, a “Spanish” scenario could unfold (though without the constraint of a fixed exchange rate, as in the eurozone).
column2: 在极端的情况下，就会出现类似“西班牙式”的境况（虽然不存在欧元区那样的固定汇率限制 ） 。

column1: It is this danger that sets a practical and political limit to flexible exchange rates.
column2: 而这也是为什么要为浮动汇率设定一个实用性和政治性的限制。

column1: Some depreciation can be managed by most of the deficit countries; but a vicious circle could be triggered if the domestic currency loses too much value too quickly.
column2: 有些贬值能被大多数赤字国家掌控；但如果本地货币过快且过大幅度贬值的话就会激发一个不断恶化的循环。

column1: Private-sector balance-sheet problems would weaken the financial sector, and the resulting pressure on public finances would compel austerity, thereby constraining consumer demand – and causing further damage to firms’ balance sheets.
column2: 私人部门资产负债表问题将削弱金融部门，而因此对公共财政所产生的压力又会迫使出台紧缩措施，进而压制消费者需求 — — 从而令企业资产负债表进一步恶化。

column1: To prevent such a crisis, therefore, the exchange rate has to be managed – and in a manner that depends on a country’s specific circumstances.
column2: 为了防止这一危机，就必须对汇率进行管理 — — 并按照每个国家的特殊国情行事。

column1: Large net central-bank reserves can help ease the process.
column2: 庞大的央行净外汇储备将有助于舒缓这一进程。

column1: Otherwise, a significant rise in interest rates must be used to retain short-term capital and allow more gradual real-sector adjustment.
column2: 此外，必须大幅提升利率以留住短期资金并允许实体部门进行更为渐进式的调整。

column1: Higher interest rates will of course lead to slower growth and lower employment, but such costs are likely to be smaller than those of a full-blown crisis.
column2: 虽然高利率必然导致增长放缓以及失业率增高，但这些成本都将比一场大危机所带来的成本更低。

column1: The challenge is more difficult for countries with very large current-account deficits.
column2: 而那些拥有大量经常账户逆差的国家面临的挑战则更严峻。

column1: And it becomes harder still if political turmoil or tension is thrown into the mix, as has been the case recently in a surprisingly large number of countries.
column2: 一旦与政治风暴/紧张局势结合起来则境况会更糟，令人震惊的是最近有一大批国家都出现了这种状况。

column1: Nonetheless, despite serious dangers for a few countries, an overall emerging-market crisis is unlikely in 2014.
column2: 虽然如此，但即便有一些国家目前正在水深火热之中，在2014年不太可能爆发一场新兴市场全面危机。

column1: Actual capital-flow reversals have been very limited, and no advanced country will raise interest rates sharply; in fact, with the United States’ current-account deficit diminishing, net flows from the US have increased over the last 12 months.
column2: 实际的资金外流极为有限，也没有发达经济体国家大幅提高利率；事实上，随着美国的经常账户赤字不断缩减，来自美国的净资本流入在过去12个月内不断增加。

column1: Moreover, most emerging-market countries have strong enough fiscal positions and can afford flexible enough exchange rates to manage a non-disruptive adjustment to moderately higher global interest rates.
column2: 与此同时，大多数新兴市场国家拥有足够强大的财政实力，也有足够的汇率变化空间去实现一场非破坏性的调整以应对适度提升的全球利率。

column1: Much of the recent turmoil reflects the growing realization that financial-asset prices worldwide have been inflated by extraordinarily expansionary monetary policies.
column2: 最近的大部分危机都反映出人们逐渐认识到全球的金融资产价格都是由极端的扩张性货币政策所导致的。

column1: As a result, many financial assets have become vulnerable to even minor shifts in sentiment, and this will continue until real interest rates approach more “normal” long-run levels.
column2: 结果许多金融资产变得如此脆弱，以致一点情绪的波动都难以承受，而这种情况将持续到实际利率接近更“正常”的长期水平为止。

column1: In the medium term, however, the potential for technological catch-up growth and secular convergence remains strong in most emerging countries.
column2: 但在中期看来，大多数新兴经济体实现科技赶超以及长期缩小（与发达经济体）差距的潜力依然强大。

column1: The pace of a country’s convergence will depend, even more than in the past, on the quality of governance and the pace of structural reforms.
column2: 而一个国家缩小差距的步伐将取决于政府治理的质量以及结构性改革的步伐，而且这两点比过往更加重要。

column1: The Great Income Divide
column2: 收入大分化

column1: WASHINGTON, DC – Thomas Piketty’s book Capital in the Twenty-First Century has captured the world’s attention, putting the relationship between capital accumulation and inequality at the center of economic debate.
column2: 华盛顿—托马斯·皮克提（Thomas Piketty）的书《二十一世纪资本论 》 （ Capital in the Twenty-First Century）吸引了全世界的注意，让资本积累与不平等性的关系成为经济争论的中心。

column1: What makes Piketty’s argument so special is his insistence on a fundamental trend stemming from the very nature of capitalist growth.
column2: 皮克提的观点如此特殊，是因为他坚持认为资本主义增长的内在性质到这了一个基本趋势。

column1: It is an argument much in the tradition of the great economists of the nineteenth and early twentieth centuries.
column2: 这一论断遵循了十九世纪和二十世纪早期伟大经济学家的传统。

column1: In an age of tweets, his bestseller falls just short of a thousand pages.
column2: 在这个微博时代，他写出了一本厚达近千页的畅销书。

column1: The book’s release follows more than a decade of painstaking research by Piketty and others, including Oxford University’s Tony Atkinson.
column2: 本书是皮克提和包括牛津大学的托尼·阿特金森（Tony Atkinson）在内的多人多年苦心研究的结果。

column1: There were minor problems with the treatment of the massive data set, particularly the measurement of capital incomes in the United Kingdom.
column2: 其中包括一些处理超大数据集，特别是如何测量英国资本收入的小问题。

column1: But the long-term trends identified – a rise in capital owners’ share of income and the concentration of “primary income” (before taxes and transfers) at the very top of the distribution in the United States and other major economies – remain unchallenged.
column2: 但他们所识别的长期趋势 — — 美国和其他主要经济体资本所有者占收入比例上升以及“初级收入 ” （ 税收和转移支付前收入）集中于收入分配最顶层 — — 是不容置疑的。

column1: The law of diminishing returns leads one to expect the return on each additional unit of capital to decline.
column2: 回报递减定律让我们知道，每一新增单位资本的回报是递减的。

column1: A key to Piketty’s results is that in recent decades the return to capital has diminished, if at all, proportionately much less than the rate at which capital has been growing, thereby leading to an increasing share of capital income.
column2: 皮克提的结论的一个关键是，最近几十年来资本的递减（如有）远远低于资本成长速度，从而导致资本收入占比上升。

column1: Within the framework of textbook microeconomic theory, this happens when the “elasticity of substitution” in the production function is greater than one: capital can be substituted for labor, imperfectly, but with a small enough decline in the rate of return so that the share of capital increases with greater capital intensity.
column2: 在微观经济教材框架中，这一现象发生于生产函数的“替代弹性”大于1时发生：资本可以用劳动力不完美地替代，但回报率下降幅度很小，因此资本占比会随着资本密集度的增加而增加。

column1: Larry Summers recently argued that in a dynamic context, the evidence for elasticity of substitution greater than one is weak if one measures the return net of depreciation, because depreciation increases proportionately with the growth of the capital stock.
column2: 拉里·萨默斯（Larry Summers）最近指出，在动态环境中，如果你考察折旧的净回报，会发现替代弹性大于1的证据很弱，因为折旧会随资本存量的增加而成比例地增加。

column1: But traditional elasticity of substitution measures the ease of substitution with a given state of technical knowledge.
column2: 但传统替代弹性测量的是给定技术知识状态下的替代的容易程度。

column1: If there is technical change that saves on labor, the result over time looks similar to what high elasticity of substitution would produce.
column2: 如果发生节约劳动力的技术变化，随时间发生的变化就会类似于高替代弹性情形。

column1: In fact, just a few months ago, Summers himself proposed a reformulation of the production function that distinguished between traditional capital (K1), which remains, to some degree, a complement to labor (L), and a new kind of capital (K2), which would be a perfect substitute for L.
column2: 事实上，在几个月前，萨默斯本人提出了一个改进的生产函数公式，该公式区分传统资本（K1，在某种程度上仍属于劳动（L）的互补要素）和新型资本（K2，是L的完美替代要素 ） 。

column1: An increase in K2 would lead to increases in output, the rate of return to K1, and capital’s share of total income.
column2: K2的增加将导致产出、K1回报率和资本占总收入比的增加。

column1: At the same time, increasing the amount of “effective labor” – that is, K2 + L – would push wages down.
column2: 与此同时 ， “ 有效劳动 ” （ 即K2+L）的增加会促使工资下降。

column1: This would be true even if the elasticity of substitution between K1 and aggregate effective labor were less than one.
column2: 即使在K1和总有效劳动之间的替代弹性小于1时，这一结论也成立。

column1: Until recently not much capital could be classified as K2, with machines that could substitute for labor doing so far from perfectly.
column2: 此前，可归于K2的资本很少，机器对劳动力的替代远远称不上完美。

column1: But, with the rise of “intelligent” machines and software, K2’s share of total capital is growing.
column2: 但是，随着“智能”机器和软件的崛起，K2占总资本之比正在上升。

column1: Oxford University’s Carl Benedikt Frey and Michael Osborne estimate that such machines eventually could perform roughly 47% of existing jobs in the US.
column2: 牛津大学的卡尔·本尼迪克特·弗雷（Carl Benedikt Frey）和迈克尔·奥斯本（Michael Osborne）估算，这些机器最终将取代大约47%的美国现有岗位。

column1: If that is true, the aggregate share of capital is bound to increase.
column2: 果真如此的话，资本总比重必然会上升。

column1: Given that capital ownership remains concentrated among those with high incomes, the share of income going to the very top of the distribution also will rise.
column2: 由于资本所有权仍集中在高收入群体，因此流向分配最顶层的收入占比也会上升。

column1: The tendency of these capital owners to save a large proportion of their income – and, in many cases, not to have a large number of children – would augment wealth concentration further.
column2: 这些资本所有者有将很大部分收入储蓄起来的倾向 — — 并且在很多情形中，他们的子女数量不多 — — 因此财富集中度将进一步增加。

column1: Other factors could help to augment inequality further.
column2: 其他因素也在推动不平等性加剧。

column1: One that has been largely neglected in the debate about Piketty’s book is the tendency of the superrich to marry one another – an increasingly common phenomenon as more women join the group of high earners.
column2: 其中之一在关于皮克提的书的争论中鲜有提及，即巨富之间的联姻倾向 — — 随着更多女性加入高收入行列，这一现象正变得日益普遍。

column1: This, too, causes income concentration to occur faster than it did two or three decades ago, when wealthy men married women less likely to have comparably large incomes.
column2: 这也导致收入集中的速度比二三十年前更快，当时的富有男性与收入相当的女性结婚的概率更低。

column1: Add to that the modern scale effects on professional and “superstar” incomes – a result of winner-take-all global markets – and a picture emerges of fundamental forces tending to concentrate primary income at the top.
column2: 此外还有现代职业规模效应和“超级巨星”收入 — — 这是赢家通吃的全球市场所带来的结果 — — 所有这些组成了一股基本力量，让初级收入向最顶层集中。

column1: Without potent policies aimed at counteracting these trends, inequality will almost certainly continue to rise in the coming years.
column2: 如果不对这些趋势采取强有力的政策，不平等性几乎肯定会在未来几年中继续加剧。

column1: Restoring some balance to the income distribution and encouraging social mobility, while strengthening incentives for innovation and growth, will be among the most important – and formidable – challenges of the twenty-first century.
column2: 重塑收入分配和鼓励社会流动的平衡，同时增强创新和增长激励是二十一世纪最重要也最艰巨的挑战。

column1: Europe’s Political Transcendence
column2: 欧洲的政治超越

column1: WASHINGTON, DC – This month, European citizens will head to the polls to select the 751 members of the European Parliament to represent 507 million people.
column2: 华盛顿—本月，欧洲公民将选出751位代表5.07亿人民的欧洲议会议员。

column1: The way the election campaign has unfolded marks a small but significant step in the emergence of the first transnational political space in European – indeed, world – history.
column2: 此次选举竞争的展开方式标志着欧洲 — — 事实上，是世界 — — 历史上第一个跨国政治空间出现的一小步，但这一小步意义重大。

column1: To be sure, the European Parliament elections have been bringing smaller shares of voters to the polls: 43% in 2009, compared to almost 60% in 1978-1994.
column2: 事实上，欧洲议会选举投票率越来越低了：2009年是43 % ， 而1978—1994年间是近60 % 。

column1: Nonetheless, the participation rate over the last decade is comparable to average turnout in American congressional elections.
column2: 尽管如此，过去十年的参与率与美国国会选举平均水平相当。

column1: Given the perceived remoteness of the European parliament and widespread frustration with the European Union’s bureaucracy, the level of participation and the movement toward transnational politics is remarkable.
column2: 考虑到欧洲议会与选民日常生活距离比较遥远，并且欧盟的官僚主义也饱受诟病，因此这一参与率水平以及朝向跨国政治的趋势是值得瞩目的。

column1: The transnational nature of the election is stronger this time because the major pan-European political parties have, for the first time, nominated specific candidates for the presidency of the European Commission, and the candidates are campaigning, including in televised debates.
column2: 此次选举的跨国性质更大了，因为主要泛欧洲政党第一次提名了具体的欧盟委员会主席候选人，并且这些候选人都开展了包括电视辩论在内的竞选活动。

column1: The European Council, as mandated by the Lisbon Treaty, will have to take into account the election results in selecting the candidate to put forward for parliamentary endorsement.
column2: 根据里斯本条约的授权，欧洲理事会必须在提出候选人供议会审议支持时必须考虑选举结果。

column1: The campaign for the Commission’s presidency may turn out to be as significant as the final selection.
column2: 欧盟委员会主席选战可能与最终决选一样重大。

column1: The first debate, held late last month, included Jean-Claude Juncker of the center-right European People’s Party (EPP), the Green Party’s Ska Keller, Martin Schultz of the center-left Progressive Alliance of Socialists and Democrats, and Guy Verhofstadt of the centrist Alliance of Liberals and Democrats.
column2: 在上个月举行的第一场辩论中，中右翼的欧洲人民党（EPP）的让-克劳德·容克（Jean-Claude Juncker ） 、 绿党的斯卡·凯勒（Ska Keller ） 、 中左翼的社会和民主进步联盟（Progressive Alliance of Socialists and Democrats）的马丁·舒尔茨（Martin Schultz）和中间派的自由和民主联盟（Alliance of Liberals and Democrats）的盖伊·沃尔霍夫斯塔特（Guy Verhofstadt）悉数登场。

column1: Alexis Tsipras, representing the Party of the European Left, is expected to participate in the final debate this month.
column2: 代表欧洲左翼党（Party of the European Left）的阿莱克西斯·齐普拉斯（Alexis Tsipras）预计将在本月的最终辩论中露面。

column1: All of the candidates spoke flawless English – though the debate was translated into 16 languages.
column2: 所有这些候选人都说得一口好英语 — — 尽管辩论被翻译为16国语言。

column1: Given the United Kingdom’s reservations about European integration, it is somewhat ironic that English is playing such a critical role in facilitating the creation of a transnational political space.
column2: 由于英国对欧洲一体化持保留态度，因此英语在促进建立跨国政治空间方面起着如此关键的作用显得有些讽刺。

column1: The debate attracted significant social-media attention, with tens of thousands of tweets on the subject reflecting the passion that some Europeans – especially the younger generation – feel about Europe’s political evolution.
column2: 辩论吸引了社交媒体的广泛关注，关于此话题的推特数量成千上万，反映出一些欧洲人 — — 特别是年轻一代 — — 很关心欧洲的政治演进。

column1: More generally, while public interest in the campaign remains far below that seen in national political contests, it has become stronger than in recent pan-European elections, despite the rise of nationalism and Euro-skepticism.
column2: 更一般地说，尽管对此次选战的公共兴趣仍远低于国家政治竞争，但比最近几次泛欧洲选举都要高，虽然民族主义和欧元怀疑主义正在日益流行。

column1: In this context, it would be strange if the European Council tried to nominate the Commission president without regard for the public’s response to the campaign.
column2: 在这样的情况下，欧洲委理事会在不考虑公众对选战反应的情况下提名欧盟委员会主席显得有些奇怪。

column1: And yet there is a risk that the selection process becomes no more than an exercise in political horse-trading, with Council members awarding leadership positions, including seats on the Commission, purely on the basis of national political considerations.
column2: 但另一个风险是遴选过程沦为讨价还价过程，理事会委员授予领导位置的决定 — — 包括欧盟委员会的职位 — — 纯粹取决于国家政治考虑。

column1: Such an approach would deal a powerful blow to the citizens who took their European ballot seriously – and to the credibility of the EU as a whole.
column2: 这样的做法将对认真对待欧洲选票的公民造成重大打击，也极大地影响欧盟作为一个整体的信誉。

column1: Could this really happen?
column2: 真的会发生这样的情况吗？

column1: Or has the transnational European space – however young – already grown to the point that it cannot be ignored?
column2: 还是跨国欧洲空间 — — 不管多么年轻 — — 已经成长到了不可忽视的程度？

column1: Much will depend on the election results.
column2: 这很大程度上取决于选举结果。

column1: First and foremost, the participation rate will be critical.
column2: 首先也是最重要的，参与率十分关键。

column1: If it were to fall below the 43% attained in 2009, the Council could more plausibly argue that the preferences of a decreasingly interested public can be largely ignored.
column2: 如果还不如2009年43%的参与率，那么欧洲理事会可以更加理直气壮地指出，兴趣日渐的公众的偏好大可忽略。

column1: A substantial increase, however – say, toward the 45-47% range – would make it much more difficult to ignore the outcome of the campaign.
column2: 但是，如果参与率大幅上升 — — 比如达到45—47%的水平 — — 那么要忽略选战结果就很困难了。

column1: The relative performance of the pan-European parties will also matter.
column2: 泛欧洲政党的相对表现也很重要。

column1: If, for example, the Socialists won 215 seats, compared to 185 for the EPP, the substantial difference would make their leader, Martin Schultz, a very strong contender, even though no party came close to an absolute majority of 376 seats.
column2: 比如，孤弱社会党赢得215席而EPP赢得185席，那么这一重大差距将使其领导人马丁·舒尔茨成为有力竞争者，即便没有一个政党接近于376席的绝对多数。

column1: If the outcome turns out to be closer, with a difference of only five or ten seats between the two top parties, it could be argued that neither of the leading candidates had “won.”
column2: 如果结果更加接近，比如最领先的两个政党只相差了五席或十席，那么可以说没有哪位领先候选人“赢”了。

column1: This would give the Council more space to consider an “outside” candidate (for example, Pascal Lamy, who is closer to the center left, or Christine Lagarde, who is closer to the center right, both of whom are extremely experienced European policymakers whose names have already been raised in the media).
column2: 这可以让理事会获得更大空间考虑“外部”候选人（比如更接近中左翼的帕斯卡尔·拉米（Pascal Lamy）或更接近于中右翼的克里斯汀·拉加德（Christine Lagarde ） ， 他们都是经验丰富的欧洲决策者，名字经常出现在媒体 ） 。

column1: To bolster the legitimacy of such a move, the Council would have to select the candidate more closely associated with the party that gained more votes, however narrow the margin.
column2: 为了增加这一行动的合法性，欧洲理事会必须选择与获得多数选票的政党（不管领先优势多小）更接近的候选人。

column1: Moreover, an outside candidate must be likely to generate backing by a sufficiently large coalition in the parliament.
column2: 此外，外部候选人必须有望获得议会内足够大的联盟的总体支持。

column1: Alternatively, with neither of the larger parties able to declare real victory, they could decide as a compromise to indicate preference for one of the other leaders who had campaigned – perhaps Verhofstadt, the liberal centrist.
column2: 或者，如果没有哪个大党可以宣布真正的胜利，它们可以决定形成妥协，表示更愿意提名代表自由中间派的一位其他领导人 — — 也许是沃尔霍夫斯塔特。

column1: As Jean Pisani-Ferry has explained, despite the European Parliament’s substantial – and increasing – power, it cannot be the central actor in Europe’s economic-policy debates in the short term.
column2: 正如让·皮萨尼-费里（Jean Pisani-Ferry）所解释的，尽管欧洲议会的实质权力很大并且还在增加，但它不可能在短期成为欧洲经济政策争论的核心行动方。

column1: Real decision-making power will remain largely national.
column2: 真正的决策权力基本上仍属于国家层面。

column1: But, given the parliament’s position at the center of a nascent transnational European space that could, over time, transform Europe’s politics and help the continent overcome resurgent and dangerous chauvinism, this first European election with a transnational flavor should not be ignored.
column2: 但是，由于议会在尚在襁褓阶段的跨国欧洲空间中占有核心地位，而随着时间的推移，这一跨国空间有可能改变欧洲的政局、帮助欧洲大陆克服危险的沙文主义死灰复燃，因此第一次带跨国印记的欧洲选举不可忽视。

column1: When they meet on May 28, European leaders would do well to encourage the strength of European institutions by choosing both competence and legitimacy.
column2: 在5月28日会晤时，欧洲领导人应该选择胜任性和合法性，这样能够极大地强化欧洲机构。

column1: A Great Breakdown?
column2: 大崩溃？

column1: ISTANBUL – This month – the centenary of the outbreak of World War I – is an opportune time to reflect on big risks.
column2: 伊斯坦布尔—本月是一战爆发一百周年纪念，也是深刻思考大风险的良机。

column1: As Michael Spence recently warned, the international order’s widening security deficit, reflecting the weakening of whatever global governance we have, is fast becoming the biggest risk facing the world economy.
column2: 正如迈克尔·斯宾塞（Michael Spence）最近所警告的，国际秩序的安全赤字日益扩大，这反映出我们所具备的全球治理正在日益衰落，这一问题正在快速成为世界经济所面临的最大风险。

column1: The same point could have been made a century ago.
column2: 一个世纪以前也是如此。

column1: On July 30, 1914, Austrian warships bombarded Belgrade, five weeks after the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand in Sarajevo.
column2: 1914年7月30日，在斐迪南大公于萨拉热窝遇刺五周后，奥地利军舰开始炮轰贝尔格莱德。

column1: By mid-August, the world was at war.
column2: 到8月中旬，全世界都卷入了战争。

column1: The armistice that was agreed four years later, after about 20 million people had died, amounted only to an interlude before the horror of World War II.
column2: 四年后，当停战协议最终达成时，已有2,000万人失去了生命，而在短暂的停战期后爆发了更加恐怖的第二次世界大战。

column1: In the years preceding August 1914, until the assassination of the archduke, the global economy performed relatively well: trade expanded worldwide, financial markets seemed healthy, and the business community shrugged off political problems as either temporary or irrelevant.
column2: 在1914年8月之前的几年中，直到斐迪南大公遇刺之前，全球经济表现相对来说相当出色：贸易在全球扩张，金融市场看起来十分健康，商界对政治问题不太关心，认为即便不是暂时性的也与商业无关。

column1: It was a political breakdown that led to three terrible decades for the world economy.
column2: 一场政治崩溃把世界经济拖入了可怕的三十年。

column1: Markets and economic activity can withstand a great deal of political stress and uncertainty – up to the point that the international order breaks down.
column2: 市场和经济活动可以战胜大量政治压力和不确定性 — — 直到国际秩序崩溃。

column1: Today, for example, the economic mood is rather upbeat.
column2: 比如，如今的经济情绪十分高涨。

column1: The International Monetary Fund forecasts 4% growth for the world economy in 2015, while stock-market indices are up in many parts of the world; indeed, the Dow Jones reached an all-time high in July.
column2: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）预测2015年世界经济可以增长4 % ， 世界各地的股市也纷纷上涨，道琼斯指数更是创出历史新高。

column1: In the last few months, however, a civilian airliner was downed in eastern Ukraine by a sophisticated Russian-made missile, tensions have increased around disputed islands in the South and East China Seas, and chaos in the Middle East has continued to spread.
column2: 但是，在过去几个月中，民航班机在东乌克兰被先进的俄罗斯制导弹击落，中国东海和南海的争议岛屿紧张局势升级，中东的乱局也在继续蔓延。

column1: The Israeli-Palestinian conflict is in one of its worst phases in decades, with the renewed frustration unleashed by the massive loss of civilian life in Gaza likely to encourage extreme reactions.
column2: 以色列-巴勒斯坦冲突进入了几十年来最糟糕的阶段，加沙平民大量伤亡的坏消息有可能鼓励极端反应。

column1: Terrorists may be on the verge of designing much less detectable weapons.
column2: 恐怖分子也许很快就能获得极难侦测到的武器。

column1: There are other, less “political” dangers.
column2: 还有其他不那么“政治”的危险。

column1: West Africa is afflicted by a terrible outbreak of the deadly Ebola virus, which will kill thousands of people.
column2: 西非正在经历可怕的埃博拉致命病毒大爆发，数千人将因此丧命。

column1: The outbreak has so far remained regional, but it serves as a reminder that in an age of air travel by millions, no one is safe from the spread of infectious disease.
column2: 埃博拉病毒的爆发目前仍是地区性的，但它提醒我们，在这个数百万人坐着飞机满世界飞的时代，在传染病大爆发面前，没有人是安全的。

column1: Containing a disease or a terrorist threat by curtailing international travel or transport would devastate the world economy.
column2: 通过切断国际旅行或交通战胜一种疾病或恐怖威胁会摧毁世界经济。

column1: Thinking about August 1914 should remind us that great catastrophes can materialize gradually.
column2: 反思1914年8月可以提醒我们，大灾难可能是逐渐积累起来的。

column1: Leaders can be “sleepwalkers” who fail to manage risk by, say, establishing institutions that can channel the rival interests and claims that fuel international conflict.
column2: 领导人可能成为“梦游者 ” ， 无法通过（比如）建立能够协调导致和助长国际冲突的对立利益的机构遏制风险。

column1: Such sleepwalking by policymakers caused the financial meltdown of 2008 as well.
column2: 这种��策者的梦游情况也正是2008年金融崩盘的原因。

column1: Its consequences were not as deadly, though the political effects of mass unemployment and the heightened perception of economic insecurity are still with us.
column2: 金融危机的后果不那么致命，尽管大规模失业和经济不安全感的政治影响仍然挥之不去。

column1: These examples should spur the world to find ways forward for cooperative action.
column2: 这些例子应该刺激世界寻找合作行动的办法。

column1: But the opposite appears to be happening.
column2: 但局面指向了相反的方向。

column1: The United Nations seems more paralyzed than ever.
column2: 联合国似乎陷入了前所未有的瘫痪状态。

column1: The US Congress still has not approved the IMF reform package agreed in 2010, weakening one of the most important international institutions.
column2: 美国国会至今仍未批准2010年达成一致的IMF改革计划，这削弱了最重要的国际机构之一。

column1: Partly because the United States makes capital increases and governance reforms in global financial institutions so difficult, the BRICS countries (Brazil, Russia, India, China, and South Africa) have launched their own development bank, to be based in Shanghai.
column2: 部分地因为美国让全球金融机构的增资和治理改革变得如此困难，金砖国家（巴西、俄罗斯、印度、中国和南非）另起炉灶在上海成立了它们自己的开发银行。
