column1: Likewise, instead of providing a shining example of supranational cooperation and pooled sovereignty for the twenty-first century, the European Union remains mired in rather petty disputes.
column2: 类似地，欧盟没有为二十一世纪超国家合作和主权集中树立积极的榜样，而是仍然在细枝末节的纠缠中裹足不前。

column1: While it still cannot fully agree on the design of its banking union, it is allowing Prime Minister Viktor Orbán of Hungary, a member country, to denigrate the democratic and liberal values upon which the EU rests.
column2: 欧盟至今仍无法一致通过银行联盟设计方案，甚至还放任其成员国之一匈牙利总理欧尔班（Viktor Orbán）诋毁作为欧盟基石的民主和自由的价值。

column1: The way forward cannot be a return to the past, with its clashing nation-states.
column2: 前进之路不能开道车，欧洲不能倒退回民族国家互相碰撞的状况。

column1: The future can be secured only by strong cooperation among all those committed to liberal democracy and the rule of law, with no double standards or excuses, and by patient strengthening of international institutions that embody these values and can translate them into practice.
column2: 唯有所有致力于自由民主和法治精神的国家展开强有力的合作，杜绝双重标准和各种借口，耐心地强化坚持这些价值并能将它们转化为实践的国际机构，才能保障我们的未来。

column1: Whenever a global or regional power acts in a way that contradicts these values, or allies itself closely with those who do, it undermines the international order, which should deliver security and increasing prosperity (and to some degree has).
column2: 每当全球和地区强国与这些价值背道而驰，或与这样的国家建立紧密盟友关系时，本应带来安全和日益繁荣（从某种程度上说也的确如此）的国际秩序就会遭到破坏。

column1: The global economy holds great promise, but it is a promise that can be realized only in an international system based on rules, consent, respect, and a shared sense of justice.
column2: 全球经济许下了重大的承诺，但这一承诺只有在基于规则、同意、尊重和共同的正义感的国际制度下才能实现。

column1: The fact that neither the mayhem in the Middle East nor the crisis in Ukraine seem to touch financial markets should not lull us into complacency.
column2: 中东的重大创伤和乌克兰危机都没有波及金融市场，决不能让这一事实导致我们的自满。

column1: The memory of August 1914 should remind us how the world stumbled into catastrophe.
column2: 1914年8月的经验应该提醒我们，世界灾难是如何产生的。

column1: As we know – or should know – from the example of climate change, big risks must be managed, even if the probability of worse-case outcomes is low.
column2: 从气候变化的例子中，我们知道 — — 也应该知道重大风险必须得到很好地管理，即使糟糕结果出现的概率很低。

column1: Catching Up at Different Speeds
column2: 不同的赶超速度

column1: PARIS – With weak demand in advanced countries now impeding growth in emerging economies, including major players in Asia and Latin America, many are arguing that the era of income convergence has come to an end.
column2: 巴黎—如今，发达经济体需求不振正在影响亚洲和拉美大国在内的新兴经济体的增长，据此，许多人指出收入趋同时代已经走向了结束。

column1: Nothing could be further from the truth.
column2: 大错特错。

column1: As I have argued before, convergence of emerging countries’ real average incomes, in the aggregate, with advanced countries’ incomes is likely to continue into the 2020’s.
column2: 正如我此前所指出的，新兴国家实际平均收入向发达国家趋近的总体趋势可能会一直持续到21世纪20年代。

column1: That process started in the late 1980’s, and continued unabated, except in the years around the Asian financial crisis in 1997-1998.
column2: 这一过程始于20世纪80年代，其势头一直不减，只在1997—1998年亚洲金融危机期间略有衰退。

column1: The pace of convergence accelerated further during, and just after, the global financial crisis of 2008-2009: the aggregate average differential in per capita income growth increased to more than four percentage points in the 2008-2012 period, from a little more than two percentage points in the two decades before.
column2: 趋同的速度在2008—2009年全球金融危机期间及稍后有所加快：2008—2012年，人均收入增长率的总体平均差异扩大到四个百分点以上，而二十年前为两个百分点。

column1: As the advanced economies recover, however weakly, the growth differential is likely to narrow again, perhaps to about two percentage points, which still implies steady convergence at a decent pace.
column2: 随着发达经济体的复苏（不管其势头多么虚弱 ） ， 增长差异可能再度缩小，也许会回到两个百分点的水平，但仍是相当可观的稳定趋同速度。

column1: In that sense, it is not “the end of the party” for emerging markets, as some claimed early last summer, when US Federal Reserve Chairman Ben Bernanke’s suggestion of a possible “taper” of the Fed’s policy of quantitative easing triggered a “mini-crisis” in several of the more vulnerable emerging markets.
column2: 照此看，这决非新兴市场“派对结束 ” 。 在过去的这个夏天，美联储主席伯南克暗示可能“逐渐收缩”美联储量化宽松政策，这在几个较脆弱的新兴市场引起了“迷你危机 ” ， 从而导致一些人迫不及待地放出了“派对结束”论。

column1: These economies have since recovered a significant part of the lost ground in terms of exchange rates and asset prices.
column2: 从汇率和资产价格角度看，这些经济体纷纷收复了迷你危机中的失地。

column1: A major part of the economic-convergence process that has been taking place since the late 1980’s has been due to “catch-up” growth.
column2: 20世纪80年代末以来的经济趋同过程很大程度上要归因于“赶超”增长。

column1: The emerging markets developed the institutions and the skills base needed to import and adapt technology, which is easier than generating new technology from scratch.
column2: 新兴市场发展了进口和适应技术所需要的制度和技能基础，这比自主开发新技术容易得多。

column1: The pace of catch-up growth declines only gradually over time, as the less advanced economies slowly move closer to the technological frontier.
column2: 随着技术较不发达经济体慢慢地接近技术前沿，赶超增长速度也随时间的推移而渐渐下降。

column1: The catch-up process also takes place within countries, as labor moves from low-productivity rural activities to higher-productivity urban activities, and as low-productivity firms in all sectors emulate their more advanced domestic counterparts.
column2: 赶超过程也存在于国家内部 — — 劳动力从低生产率的农村活动转向高生产率的城市活动，各部门的低生产率企业纷纷模仿更先进的国内同行。

column1: Moreover, the transfer and diffusion of technology has been facilitated greatly over the last few decades by increased foreign direct investment, the information revolution, which has facilitated access to knowledge, increased trade, and the globalization of financial markets.
column2: 此外，在过去几十年中，技术的转移和扩散也增加了外国直接投资，带来了促进知识普及的技术革命，增加了贸易，推进了金融市场全球化，从而起到了极大的助力作用。

column1: These factors apply to emerging countries generally.
column2: 这些因素对于所有新兴国家都适用。

column1: Why, then, do Latin American economists seem to share a cautious – even pessimistic – mood about future growth and convergence in the region, whereas most Asian economists, while conceding that further structural reforms are needed, believe strongly that Asia will continue to converge rather rapidly?
column2: 那么，为什么拉美经济学家对未来增长和地区趋同无不表示谨慎（甚至悲观 ） ， 而大部分亚洲经济学家尽管也承认需要进一步的结构性改革，但都坚信亚洲将继续以较快的速度趋同？

column1: Beyond global factors that apply to all, rapid catch-up growth requires sufficient investment in both physical and human capital.
column2: 除了适用于所有国家的全球因素，快速赶超增长还需要对实物和人力资本进行充分的投资。

column1: New manufacturing techniques and new products or product improvements are usually embodied in new machines and skills.
column2: 新制造技术和新产品或产品改良往往包含在新机器和新技能中。

column1: China has invested about 43% of its GDP, on average, during the 2000-2013 period.
column2: 2000—2013年，平均而言中国GDP中有43%被用于投资。

column1: Emerging Asia, excluding China but including India, has invested about 28% of GDP over the same period, while the investment share for Latin America has been just 21%.
column2: 新兴亚洲（不含中国但包括印度）的同期水平是28 % ， 而拉美的投资比例只有21 % 。

column1: That alone probably explains much of the difference among China, in a category of its own, emerging Asia, and Latin America.
column2: 光是这一点就可以解释独树一帜的中国、新兴亚洲和拉美之间的大部分差异。

column1: The quality of skills and education cannot be measured as easily by a single figure, but there is ample evidence that Latin America has also lagged behind most of Asia when it comes to skills accumulation.
column2: 技能和教育的质量无法用一个简单的数字来轻易地衡量，但有充分的证据表明拉美���技能积累方面也落后于大部分亚洲国家。

column1: Many other factors, of course, influence growth and convergence: macroeconomic stability, the efficiency and robustness of the financial sector, the terms of trade, the quality of public administration, demographic factors, and political factors.
column2: 当然，还有许多其他因素也影响着增长和趋同：宏观经济稳定性、金融部门效率和稳健性、贸易条件、公共管理质量、人口因素和政治因素等。

column1: There also is variation within regions, including among provinces of China.
column2: 此外还有地区内差异，如中国各省之间的差异。

column1: (Likewise, Africa’s growth performance has improved spectacularly since the turn of the century, but variance within the continent is even larger than elsewhere.)
column2: （类似地，自世纪之交以来，非洲的增长表现颇为亮眼，但非洲大陆内部的差异比其他地区都要大。

column1: Nonetheless, in terms of the likely strength of the convergence process that globalization has facilitated, it is important to distinguish between Latin America and Asia, and, within Asia, to distinguish China from the rest of the continent.
column2: ）尽管如此，从得力于全球化的趋同过程的可能优势的角度看，区分拉美和亚洲以及在亚洲内部区分中国和其他国家是十分重要的。

column1: China’s economy will most likely continue to converge rapidly, though its annual growth rate may fall from 9% to 7%.
column2: 中国经济最可能继续快速趋同过程，尽管其年增长率可能从9%下降至7 % 。

column1: The rest of emerging Asia will also converge reasonably quickly, though not as quickly as China.
column2: 其他亚洲新兴国家也将以较快速度趋同，但不如中国。

column1: Latin America, however, will likely converge only very slowly in the absence of major structural reforms that increase its ability to invest and improve the quality of education.
column2: 但是，拉美若无法通过重大结构性改革增强器投资能力、改善其教育质量，其趋同速度可能将相当缓慢。

column1: There will surely be exceptions to this general trend, but there are some stable regional characteristics.
column2: 当然，这一总体趋势难免会出现些许例外，但有些地区特征十分稳定。

column1: Overall, however, basic economics, which has always stressed the need to save and invest in order to grow, still explains a lot.
column2: 但是，总体而言，经济学基础 — — 一贯强调储蓄和投资对提振增长的重要性 — — 仍具有强大的解释力。

column1: Latin America and Asia operate in the same global economy, with access to similar technology and markets.
column2: 拉美和亚洲存在于一个共同的全球经济中，面临相似的技术和市场。

column1: If Latin America invests around 20% of its national income in a sustained manner, while emerging Asia invests close to 30% – including investments in education – emerging Asia will converge significantly more rapidly.
column2: 如果拉美一直将20%左右的国民收入用于投资，而亚洲这一比例接近30 % — —包括对教育的投资 — — 那么新兴亚洲的趋同速度将显著快于拉美。

column1: Democracy in Europe
column2: 欧洲的民主

column1: ROME – A real struggle over who will preside over the European Commission has begun.
column2: 罗马—争夺谁领衔欧盟委员会的现实斗争开始了。

column1: Though the center-right European People’s Party won only a narrow plurality of 221 seats in the 751-seat European Parliament, center-left, green, and liberal MEPs have all rallied behind the EPP’s candidate, Jean-Claude Juncker, as the “legitimate” choice.
column2: 尽管中右翼的欧洲人民党（European People’s Party）只获得了欧洲议会751个议席中的221个，但中左翼政党、绿党和MEP都在背后支持欧洲人民党候选人让-克劳德·容克（Jean-Claude Juncker）为“合法”选择。

column1: The opposition, led by British Prime Minister David Cameron with the support of “sovereignists” across Europe, particularly in Scandinavia, but also in Hungary, contends that someone whom the majority of European citizens hardly know, cannot claim any kind of political legitimacy.
column2: 反对派则由英国首相大卫·卡梅伦领衔，背后有全欧洲（特别是斯堪的纳维亚国家，也包括匈牙利 ） “ 主权主义者”的支持，主张大部分欧洲公民都没有听说过的名字无法获得任何政治合法性。

column1: German Chancellor Angela Merkel is now in a bind.
column2: 德国总理默克尔现在陷入了两难。

column1: Though she endorsed Juncker before the election, she never really backed the notion that the European Parliament should have a decisive part in selecting the Commission’s president.
column2: 尽管在选举前她支持容克，但她从未支持欧洲议会应该在选择欧盟委员会主席方面起到决定性作用这一观点。

column1: She was certain that no party would win an absolute majority, but she did not foresee that almost all representatives from moderate parties would back whichever candidate won a plurality, making it difficult to appoint anyone else.
column2: 她笃定地认为没有一个政党能够获得绝对多数，但她没有预料到几乎所有来自温和政党的代表不论谁获得多数都会支持他，这使得任命其他人变得十分困难。

column1: The larger issue at stake is whether Europe is prepared to establish the common political space that is needed to manage the monetary union and strengthen the European Union’s influence in world affairs.
column2: 更大的问题是欧洲是否准备好了建立一个管理货币联盟、强化欧盟在世界事务上的影响力所必须的共同政治空间。

column1: Most economists agree that in the absence of advanced fiscal-policy coordination and a real banking union, Europe’s monetary union cannot succeed.
column2: 大部分经济学家都同意，没有高级财政政策协作和真正的银行联盟，欧洲的货币联盟就不可能成功。

column1: This does not bother the United Kingdom, which has no desire to join the eurozone.
column2: 英国对此并不担心，因为它本无意加入欧元区。

column1: Among eurozone members, however, the need for greater political integration is broadly accepted, and not just by the economic and political elites.
column2: 但是，在欧元区国家中间，加强政治一体化的必要性已被广泛接受，并且不仅仅局限于经济和政治精英中间。

column1: Moreover, as Russia’s recent assertions of power in Ukraine and elsewhere in the former Soviet Union demonstrate, European countries need to deepen their security cooperation and develop a common energy policy.
column2: 此外，俄罗斯最近在乌克兰和其他前苏联地区耀武扬威，这表明欧洲国家需要深化安全合作、发展共同能源政策。

column1: And, though cooperation in areas such as of data privacy, financial-sector regulation, and climate change may not require the degree of political integration that a common currency does, it would benefit greatly from stronger political cohesion and a more profound sense of shared European identity.
column2: 而尽管在数据隐私、金融部门监管和气候变化等领域的合作并不需要如共同货币那么深的政治一体化程度，但加强政治团结、深化欧洲身份的认同感能够带来巨大的裨益。

column1: The pan-European parties’ nomination of Spitzenkandidaten for the Commission presidency – and the three direct debates among the nominees – marked the start of building a genuine supranational European political space.
column2: 泛欧洲政党所提名的欧盟委员会主席首席候选人 — — 以及被提名者之间的三次直接争论 — — 标志着开始建立真正的超国家欧洲政治空间。

column1: Indeed, the endorsement of Juncker by the Social Democrats, the Greens, and the Liberals reflects their belief in the need for such a space.
column2: 事实上，社会民主党、绿党和自由派支持容克反映出他们认为需要有这样一个空间。

column1: The candidates, particularly Martin Schulz, the leader of the Party of European Socialists, campaigned beyond their national borders.
column2: 候选人 — — 特别是欧洲社会党（Party of European Socialists）领袖马丁·舒尔茨（Martin Schultz ） — —的竞选活动也超越了国界。

column1: But Europe still has a long way to go, which is apparent from the fact that only a minority of European citizens followed the campaign.
column2: 但欧洲仍有很长的路要走，这一点从只有少数欧洲公民跟进了竞选活动这一事实便可一览无余。

column1: A supra-national political space can develop only if European politics gains visibility, influence, and credibility.
column2: 超国家政治空间只有在欧洲政治获得透明度、影响力和信誉的情况下才有可能获得发展。

column1: For this reason, Europe’s leaders should reach a compromise on the next Commission president quickly and transparently, thereby dispelling the impression among ordinary citizens that European politics is shaped by a dysfunctional process of behind-the-scenes horse-trading.
column2: 因此，欧洲领导人应该就下任欧盟委员会主席的人选问题迅速形成妥协，从而打消普通公民关于欧洲政治仍被幕后扯皮左右的印象。

column1: As usual, Merkel has a critical role to play.
column2: 与往常一样，默克尔在其中作用十分关键。

column1: Her endorsement of a candidate whom she knew Cameron would vehemently oppose was a serious mistake, because it strengthened the hand of those in the UK who want to leave the EU.
column2: 她支持明知卡梅伦强烈反对的候选人是一个严重错误，因为这让想脱离欧盟的英国人底气更足了。

column1: Merkel must now determine how to forge a compromise that does not discredit the Europe-wide democratic process, which currently has more support in Germany than in any other large European country.
column2: 现在，默克尔必须决定如何制造一个妥协不令泛欧洲民主进程失去信誉。 目前，欧洲民主进程在德国所获得的支持多于任何一个其他欧洲大国。

column1: To this end, support from Italian Prime Minister Matteo Renzi – whose party won 41% of his country’s vote, arguably making him the only real winner at the national level – could help.
column2: 在这方面，来自意大利总理伦齐的支持 — — 他的政党在意大利获得了41%的选票，这意味着他很有可能是硕果仅存的货真价实的国家层面赢家 — — 是大有裨益的。

column1: The stakes are high – and not just for Europe.
column2: 这是一场豪赌 — — 不仅对欧洲是如此。

column1: The world needs a thriving, cohesive EU to advance democratic principles, facilitate conflict resolution, protect the global commons, promote peace, and build trust across borders.
column2: 世界需要繁荣、团结的欧洲推进民主原则、促进冲突解决、保护全球平民、推广和平、建立国家间信任。

column1: The alternative – already gaining traction – is the resurgence of naked power politics and dangerous xenophobia.
column2: 否则 — — 可能性越来越大 — — 迎接我们的将是赤裸裸的权力政治和危险的排外主义的复兴。

column1: Without a shared European political space, everyone will be much worse off.
column2: 没有共同的欧洲政治空间，所有人都会大大受损。

column1: Revamping Europe’s Tattered Social Contract
column2: 改造欧洲破坏的社会契约

column1: WASHINGTON, DC – For most of the beginning of 2014, the eurozone seemed to be in a state of recovery – weak and unsteady, but nonetheless real.
column2: 华盛顿—在2014年初的大部分时间里，欧元区似乎进入了复苏状态 — — 疲软又踉跄，但确实是复苏。

column1: In April, the International Monetary Fund estimated that overall GDP growth would reach 1.2% this year, with slowly declining unemployment, up from its previous forecast of 1% growth.
column2: 4月，国际货币基金组织（IMF）估计今年总体GDP增长将达1.2 % ， 失业率将缓慢下降，较此前的预测（增长1 % ） 有所提高。

column1: With the threat of unsustainably high interest rates in the countries of the eurozone periphery having disappeared, the path to moderate recovery was supposedly open, to be followed by some acceleration in growth in 2015.
column2: 欧元区外围高得不可持续的利率开始下降，人们因此认为温和复苏的大门已经打开，增长将在2015年出现加速。

column1: While it is important not to overreact to quarterly figures, recent data, as well as some of the revised data for the first quarter, are deeply disappointing.
column2: 尽管对季度数据不必过度反应，但最新数据以及一些一季度的修正数据令人大失所望。

column1: The pessimism of two years ago has returned – with good reason.
column2: 两年前的悲观情绪开始回潮 — — 理由相当充分。

column1: Italy is in an outright recession, and, far from showing hoped-for signs of vitality. French growth is close to zero.
column2: 意大利已经陷入了彻底的衰退，并且远远没有表现出人们所盼望的活力信号。

column1: Even Germany’s GDP declined in quarterly terms in the first half of the year.
column2: 法国增长率接近于零，甚至德国GDP季度表现也在今年上半年有所退步。

column1: Finland, a staunch supporter of firm austerity policies, is in negative territory for the first half of the year.
column2: 紧缩政策的坚决支持者芬兰今年上半年更是出现了负增长。

column1: Nominal interest rates for periphery countries’ sovereign debt have remained extremely low, and, even when taking into account expectations of very low inflation (or even deflation), real interest rates are low.
column2: 外围国主权债务名义利率仍然非常低，而即使将极低的通胀预期（甚至通缩预期）考虑在内，实际利率仍然很低。

column1: The eurozone now is facing not only a financial crisis, but a stagnation crisis.
column2: 如今，欧元区不仅面临金融危机，也面临停滞危机。

column1: Tensions with Russia may make recovery even more difficult, and it is unlikely that the eurozone can attain 1% growth in 2014 without major policy changes.
column2: 与俄罗斯的紧张局面让复苏变得更加困难，没有重大政策变化，2014年欧元区增长不可能大到1 % 。

column1: The European Central Bank has announced that it will offer new monetary-policy support and has decided to use all instruments short of direct quantitative easing (it is still not buying sovereign bonds).
column2: 欧洲央行宣布将提供新的货币政策支持，并决定使用除量化宽松之外的一切工具（它仍然没有购买主权债券 ） 。

column1: But it is far from clear whether the proverbial horse led to water will actually drink.
column2: 但是否能有效果还远未可知。

column1: If growth and employment expectations remain dismal, it will be difficult to rekindle demand, particularly private business investment, no matter how low interest rates are, or how many resources banks have for potential lending.
column2: 如果增长和就业预期继续萎靡，就很难重振需求，特别是私人商业投资，不管利率多么低，也不管银行拥有多么大的潜在贷款资源。

column1: ECB President Mario Draghi’s message in his speech last month in Jackson Hole, Wyoming, as well as at his September press conference was a clear call for more fiscal support to boost effective demand.
column2: 欧洲央行行长德拉吉在上个月的怀俄明州杰克森霍尔（Jackson Hole）的讲话以及9月记者招待会上的发言都在明确呼吁采取更多的财政支持以提振有效需求。

column1: The essential economic problem is clear: there is an almost desperate need for more fiscal space in the eurozone to boost aggregate demand, including more investment in Germany.
column2: 根本的经济学问题很清楚：欧元区极度渴望增加财政空间以提振总需求，包括增加德国的投资。

column1: But there is also a persistent need for deep structural reforms on the supply side, so that fiscal stimulus translates into sustainable long-term growth, not just temporary spurts and further increases in countries’ debt ratios.
column2: 但在需求端，还存在持久的深刻结构性改革需要，以使财政刺激转化为可持续长期增长而不仅仅是暂时性的爆发和国家债务比率的进一步上升。

column1: What the “best” structural reforms actually are remains a matter for debate.
column2: 什么是“最佳”结构性改革还有待争论。

column1: But in most countries, they include some combination of tax, labor-market, service-sector, and education reforms, as well as reforms in territorial administration, particularly in France.
column2: 但���大部分国家，税收、劳动力市场、服务业和教育改革多管齐下，同时进行国土改革是必不可少的，特别是在法国。

column1: These reforms should seek to achieve a thoroughly revamped social contract that reflects the realities of twenty-first-century demographics and global markets, but that also remains sensitive to Europeans’ commitment to distributive fairness and political equality, and insures citizens against shocks.
column2: 这些改革的目标应该是彻底改造社会契约，使其反映二十一世纪人口和全球市场的现实，同时也要顾及欧洲分配公平和政治平等的承诺，并保护公民免受影响。

column1: It is easy to call for “reforms” without specifying their content or taking into account the social, historical, and political context.
column2: 呼吁“改革”而不具体指明内容或考虑社会、历史和政治因素是很容易的。

column1: At the same time, it will not be possible to design this new social contract country by country.
column2: 与此同时，各国逐一设计这一新社会契约是不可能的。

column1: Europe has become too interwoven in myriad ways – not just in purely financial and economic terms, but also psychologically.
column2: 欧洲以各种方式水乳交融 — — 不仅仅在纯粹的金融和经济上，在心理上也是如此。

column1: It must have come as a surprise to many that it was a German court, not a French one, that banned Uber, the mobile app that is revolutionizing the taxi business.
column2: 对许多人来说，德国而不是法国法庭禁止给出租车行业带来革命的移动应用Uber令人震惊。

column1: If the new social contract cannot be forged Europe-wide, it must at least apply to the eurozone to enable the necessary structural reforms.
column2: 如果不能在全欧洲水平上建立新的社会契约，也必须在欧元区使用以使必须的结构性改革得以进行。

column1: Otherwise, given that the politics and economics of eurozone reform are inseparably linked, fiscal expansion could prove to be as ineffective as efforts by monetary policymakers to foster growth.
column2: 否则，由于欧元区改革的政治和经济之间存在不可分割的联系，财政扩张将与货币决策者的努力一样对提振增长毫无效果。

column1: Italy’s finance minister, Pier Carlo Padoan, is rightly pushing for a eurozone “reform scorecard,” which would enable direct comparison among national reforms.
column2: 意大利财政部长帕多安（Pier Carlo Padoan）正确地指出应该采取欧元区“记分牌 ” ， 直接比较各国的改革。

column1: But, beyond such a scorecard, the will to overcome the stagnation trap must be more than a sum of national wills.
column2: 但是，除了记分牌之外，克服停滞陷阱的意愿应该比各国意愿的总和更强。

column1: Germany must be reassured by what is happening in France and Italy; conversely, Southern Europeans must be able to trust that their efforts will gain additional traction from greater investment throughout the region, particularly in Germany.
column2: 德国看到法国和意大利的情形想必不会再担心；反之，南欧人必须要能相信他们的努力能从整个地区（特别是德国）的投资增加中获得新动力。

column1: A new social contract will not appear out of thin air.
column2: 新社会契约不会凭空产生。

column1: Now is the time for the new European Commission to propose – and the new European Council and European Parliament to endorse – a political pact to legitimize and sustain the reforms needed to solve Europe’s economic problems.
column2: 新欧洲委员会应该提出一个新的政治契约以使解决欧洲经济问题所需要的改革合法化并得以维持，同时新的欧洲理事会和欧洲议会应该批准这一契约。

column1: The Future of Economic Progress
column2: 经济进步的未来

column1: WASHINGTON, DC – Slowly but surely, the debate about the nature of economic growth is entering a new phase.
column2: 华盛顿—关于经济增长的性质的争论进入了新阶段，这一变化虽然缓慢，但无可置疑。

column1: The emerging questions are sufficiently different from those of recent decades that one can sense a shift in the conceptual framework that will structure the discussion of economic progress – and economic policy – from now on.
column2: 信服显得问题与近几十年来的争论问题大相径庭，我们可以从中感受到决定未来经济进步（以及经济政策）讨论的概念框架的变化。

column1: The first question, concerning the potential pace of future economic growth, has given rise to serious disagreement among economists.
column2: 第一个问题是关于未来经济增长潜在速度的，这一问题造成了经济学家之间的严重分歧。

column1: Robert Gordon of Northwestern University, for example, believes that the US economy will be lucky to achieve 0.5% annual per capita growth in the medium term.
column2: 比如，西北大学的罗伯特·戈登（Robert Gordon）认为，从中期看，美国经济年人均增长达到0.5%就要谢天谢地了。

column1: Others, perhaps most carefully Dani Rodrik, have developed a version of growth pessimism for the emerging economies.
column2: 另一些人 — — 其中最认真的大概是丹尼·罗德里克（Dani Rodrik ） ， 对新兴经济体深感悲观。

column1: The key premise, common to many of these leading analysts, is that technological progress will slow, including the catch-up gains that are most relevant for emerging and developing countries.
column2: 许多大牌分析家的共同假设是技术进步将会减速，包括与新兴和发展中国家关系最密切的赶超收益。

column1: On the opposite side are the “new technologists.” They argue that we are at the beginning of a fourth industrial revolution, characterized by truly “intelligent machines” that will become almost perfect substitutes for low- and medium-skill labor.
column2: 另一边是“新科技派 ” ， 他们认为我们正站在第四次工业革命的门口，这次工业革命的特征是真正的“智能机器 ” ， 它们将成为中低技能劳动力的近乎完美的替代品。

column1: These “robots” (some in the form of software), as well as the “Internet of things,” will usher in huge new productivity increases in areas such as energy efficiency, transport (for example, self-driving vehicles), medical care, and customization of mass production, thanks to 3D printing.
column2: 这些“机器人 ” （ 其中一些以软件的面目出现）也可称为“物联网 ” （ Internet of things ） ， 拜3D打印所赐，它们将在能源效率、交通（如自动驾驶汽车 ） 、 医疗和个性化大生产等领域极大地提高生产率。

column1: Second, there is the question of income distribution.
column2: 第二个问题是收入分配。

column1: In his instantly famous book, Thomas Piketty argues that fundamental economic forces are fueling a persistent rise in profits as a share of total income, with the rate of return on capital constantly higher than the rate of economic growth.
column2: 在最近出版的畅销书中，托马斯·皮克提（Thomas Piketty）指出，基本经济力正在让利润占总收入的比例持久性地提高，资本回报率将持续高于经济增长率。

column1: Moreover, many have observed that if capital is becoming a close substitute for all but very highly skilled labor, while education systems need long adjustment times to supply the new skills in large quantities, much greater wage differentials between highly skilled and all other labor will cause inequality to worsen.
column2: 此外，许多人观察到，如果资本能够日益替代出高技能劳动力之外的一切，而教育体系需要经过长期调整才能大规模提供新技能，那么高技能和其他所有工种工资之间的巨大差异将导致不平等性恶化。

column1: Perhaps the US economy in ten years will be one in which the top 5% – large capital owners, very highly skilled wage earners, and global winner-take-all performers – get 50% of national income (the percentage is not far below 40% today).
column2: 或许十年后美国经济将是这样的：顶层5 % — —大资本所有者、高技能工资工人、赢家通吃的全球领先者 — — 拿走50%的国民收入（今天的比例已接近40 % ） 。

column1: Though national circumstances still differ greatly, the fundamental economic trends are global.
column2: 尽管国家间环境仍然大不相同，但基本经济趋势是全球性的。

column1: Are they politically sustainable?
column2: 这些趋势在政治上可持续吗？

column1: The third question concerns the employment effects of further automation.
column2: 第三个问题是进一步自动化的就业效应。

column1: As was true in previous industrial revolutions, human beings may be freed from much “tedious” work.
column2: 在前几次工业革命期间，人类从非常“繁琐”的工作中得到了解放。

column1: There will be no need for cashiers, call operators, and toll collectors, for example, and less need for accountants, travel or financial advisers, drivers, and many others.
column2: 比如，收银员、电话操作员、计票员都会消失，会计师、旅行或财务顾问、司机和其他工种的需求也会大大减少。

column1: If the “technologists” are half-right, GDP will be much higher.
column2: 如果“科技派”部分正确，那么GDP将有很大提高。

column1: So why should we not rejoice at the prospect of a 25- or 30-hour workweek and two months of annual leave, with intelligent machines taking up the slack?
column2: 既然如此，为何我们不能为获得25—30小时的每周工作时长和两个月的年假、让智能机器替我们劳动而欢呼雀跃呢？

column1: Why, with all this new technology and imminent productivity increases, do so many continue to argue that everyone has to work more and retire much later in life if economies are to remain competitive?
column2: 既然有这些新科技，生产率也即将大幅度提高，为何还有这么多人继续认为所有人都必须更多地工作、更晚地退出才能让经济保持竞争力？

column1: Or is it just the highly skilled who have to work harder and longer, because there are not enough of them?
column2: 还是说，只有高技能者才需要更努力、更长时间地工作，因为他们数量太少？

column1: In that case, perhaps older workers should retire sooner to make room for the young, who have skills more appropriate to the new century.
column2: 果真如此的话，也许老工人应该更早退休给技能更适合新世纪的年轻人腾出空间。

column1: If such a shift were to increase overall GDP, fiscal transfers could pay for early retirement, while retirement itself could become a flexible and gradual process.
column2: 如果这样的改变有利于增加总体GDP，财政转移就可以负担提早退休，而退休本身也可以变成有弹性的、逐渐实现的过程。

column1: Finally, there is the question of climate change and possible natural-resource constraints, issues that have become more familiar over the last decade.
column2: 最后一个问题是气候变化以及可能的自然资源约束，这一问题在过去十年中已经耳熟能详。

column1: Will these factors impede long-term growth, or can a transition to a clean-energy economy fuel another technological revolution that actually increases prosperity?
column2: 这些因素会妨碍长期增长吗？ 还是向清洁能源经济的转型能催生新的技术革命，实际增加繁荣？

column1: As these questions move to the top of the policy agenda, it is becoming clearer that the traditional focus on growth, defined as an increase in aggregate GDP and calculated using national accounts invented a century ago, is less and less useful.
column2: 随着这些问题成为政策日程的最当务之急，我们可以更加清晰地看到，传统上对增长（定义为总GDP的增加，用一个世纪前发明的国民收入账户来计算衡量）的关注的用处已经越来越小。

column1: The nature and measurement of economic progress should involve a new social contract that allows societies to manage the power of technology so that it serves all citizens.
column2: 经济进步的性质和衡量标准应该包括能够让社会驯服科技的力量使其为全体人民服务的新的社会契约。

column1: Working, learning, enjoying leisure, and being healthy and “productive” should be part of a continuum in our lives, and policies should be explicitly aimed at what facilitates this continuum and increases measured wellbeing.
column2: 工作、学习、休闲、保持健康和“生产性”应该成为我们生活的连续统的一部分，政策目标应该明确指向促进这一连续统、增加可测福祉。

column1: The trends underpinning widening inequality will have to be counteracted using many policy instruments, with tax regimes and life-long, inclusive, and affordable education and health care at the center of the effort to ensure equity and social mobility.
column2: 不平等性扩大背后的趋势必须用多种政策工具来解决，将税收手段和终身、包容、可负担的教育和医疗放在确保平等和社会流动的政策的核心。

column1: Though the quality of human lives can still be greatly improved, even in the advanced countries, focusing on aggregate GDP will be less helpful in achieving this goal.
column2: 尽管人类生命质量仍可以大大改善（即使在发达国家也是如此 ） ， 但将注意力集中在总体GDP上无助于实现这一目标。

column1: The questions surrounding future economic growth are becoming clearer.
column2: 围绕未来经济增长的问题正变得日渐清晰。

column1: But we are only at the start of the process of creating the new conceptual framework needed to enable national and global policies to advance the cause of human progress.
column2: 但我们才站在建立新的概念框架从而促进国家和全球政策有利于推动人类进步的起点。

column1: The Great War and Global Governance
column2: 大战和全球治理

column1: ISTANBUL – This year marks the hundredth anniversary of the outbreak of World War I – and, arguably, the worst year in human history.
column2: 伊斯坦布尔—今年是第一次世界大战爆发一百周年。 一百年前的今天可能是人类历史上最糟糕的一天。

column1: A century later, is the world any safer?
column2: 一个世纪之后的今天，世界有没有变得更安全？

column1: Not only did WWI leave almost 40 million people dead; it can be viewed as a precursor to World War II.
column2: 一战不但带走了近4000万人的生命，也酝酿了第二次世界大战。

column1: After all, had Germany’s hyperinflation of the 1920’s – a direct result of the war – been avoided, Hitler may well never have risen to power, and WWII might not have occurred.
column2: 毕竟，如果德国可以避免20世纪20年代的恶性通货膨胀（一战的直接后果之一 ） ， 那么希特勒就不会上台，二战也可能不会发生。

column1: Instead, the assassination of Austrian Archduke Franz Ferdinand in Sarajevo on June 28, 1914, set in motion a chain of bloodletting that killed nearly 100 million people by 1945 and caused human suffering on a previously unimaginable scale.
column2: 相反，1914年6月28日刺杀奥地利斐迪南大公的行为造成了到1945年才最终结束、让近1亿人失去生命的冤冤相报，人类遭遇了此前无法想象的灾难。

column1: Of course, generations of historians have meticulously researched the origins of the world wars and written elegantly about their conclusions.
column2: 当然，历代历史学家呕心沥血地寻找着世界大战的起源，并漂亮地写出各自的结论。

column1: That history should spur today’s economists and policymakers to reflect on the difficult trade-off between efficiency and robustness when it comes to global governance.
column2: 历史应该刺激今天的经济学家和决策者深思全球治理问题上效率和鲁棒之间的艰难权衡。

column1: The painstaking effort since the end of WWII to build effective regional and global governance institutions has reduced considerably the risk of catastrophes like the world wars or the Great Depression.
column2: 二战结束以来的艰苦努力造就了有效的地区和全球治理机构，极大地减小了世界大战和大萧条这样的灾难的风险。

column1: Indeed, while such institutions are far from perfect, the progress that has been made in terms of preventing human suffering is worth far more than the efficiency costs of ensuring that they are adequately robust.
column2: 事实上，尽管这些机构远远称不上完美，但它们在防止人道灾难方面所取得的进步的价值远远超过了确保他们足够鲁棒的效率成本。

column1: This efficiency-robustness tradeoff exists in many fields.
column2: 效率-鲁棒权衡存在于诸多领域。

column1: When designing an airplane, aeronautical engineers must ensure sufficient robustness so that their creation can avoid crashing even under highly unusual or unforeseen circumstances.
column2: 在设计飞机时，航空工程师必须保证足够的鲁棒性，以保证他们的产品即使在极不寻常和从未遇见过的环境中也不会坠毁。

column1: This requires a degree of redundancy – for example, extra engines and extensive backup systems – that comes at the cost of efficiency.
column2: 这要求一定程度的冗余性 — — 比如，额外的发动机和充足的备用系统 — — 这就造成了效率成本。

column1: Economic systems also must be robust, as episodes like the Great Depression or the 2008 global financial crisis demonstrate.
column2: 经济系统也必须是鲁棒的，大萧条和2008年全球金融危机等事件就是明证。

column1: In the United States, in particular, the financial sector’s structure prior to the recent crisis emphasized the efficient generation of huge profits – and succeeded for more than a decade.
column2: 特别是在美国，最近的危机前的金融部门结构强调高效地产生巨额利润，并在十多年的时间里取得了成功。

column1: But the realization in 2007 that some of the system’s fundamental assumptions were no longer valid triggered a crisis with huge economic and social costs.
column2: 但2007年的现实 — — 该系统的一���根本假设不再成立触发了导致巨大经济和社会成本的危机。

column1: Had governments worldwide not intervened with massive rescue and stimulus packages, the consequences would have been catastrophic.
column2: 如果全球政府不以大规模援助和刺激计划出手干预，后果将是灾难性的。

column1: That near miss highlighted the unsustainability of pre-crisis policies.
column2: 如此万幸彰显出危机前政策的不可持续性。

column1: The new Basel III banking guidelines, together with new national regulations, aim at creating a more robust financial system by insisting on higher capital-adequacy ratios, less leverage, greater separation between investment and retail banking, a better macro-prudential framework, and measures to prevent financial institutions from becoming “too big to fail.”
column2: 新的巴塞尔III银行指引和新的国家层面监管措施旨在通过更高的资本充足度、更低的杠杆水平，投资和零售银行业务更大的分离、更好的宏观审慎框架和预防金融机构变得“太大而不能倒”的措施增加金融系统的鲁棒性。

column1: All of these efforts are shaped by the efficiency-robustness tradeoff.
column2: 所有这些措施都是效率-鲁棒权衡的结果。

column1: If capital requirements are pushed too high, banks become less profitable, making it more difficult for them to channel savings to investment and undermining economic growth.
column2: 如果资本要求设置得太高，银行就无法盈利，从而难以将储蓄引至投资上去，破坏经济增长。

column1: The challenge, therefore, is to find the ideal balance between opportunity and security – that is, between efficiency and robustness.
column2: 因此，挑战在于找出机会和安全之间 — — 即效率和鲁棒之间的理想平衡。

column1: Policymakers face a similar challenge when designing, for example, efforts to combat climate change.
column2: 决策者在制定（比如）气候变化政策时也面临类似的挑战。

column1: The scientific consensus is that greenhouse-gas emissions are generating significant risks, but the scale and timing of these risks remain uncertain.
column2: 科学界的共识是温室气体排放正在造成极大的风险，但这一风险的规模和时机还不确定。

column1: To illustrate the tradeoff (in admittedly simplistic terms), a 14% capital-adequacy ratio for banks may be compared to the objective of stabilizing carbon-dioxide levels in the atmosphere at 450 parts per million, with both targets reflecting caution and a desire for robustness, at an immediate economic cost.
column2: 简单地说明一下权衡问题。 14%的银行资本充足度就好比是将大气二氧化碳浓度稳定在450ppm，这两个目标都体现了谨慎性和对鲁棒性的追求，但会造成即刻的经济成本。

column1: By contrast, a capital-adequacy target of 7% and a CO2 target of 550 ppm would demonstrate policymakers’ willingness to place a higher priority on short-term gains – even if that means allowing another financial crisis or global warming’s long-term economic and human consequences to manifest themselves.
column2: 相反，7%的资本充足度和550ppm的二氧化碳浓度目标反映了决策者愿意更多地考虑短期收益 — — 即使这意味着可能放任又一场金融危机或全球变暖的长期经济和人道后果自由发展。

column1: An extreme course in either direction would be a bad idea.
column2: 在两个方面走极端都是坏主意。

column1: After all, it is impossible to avoid all risk, and, at a certain point, the level of inefficiency generated by excessive robustness would create new risks of collapse.
column2: 毕竟，我们不可能避免所有风险，到达一定阈值后，过度鲁棒带来的无效率将产生新的崩溃风险。

column1: Minimizing the risk of a major war, depression, or financial breakdown thus requires that policymakers find the optimal balance – and that requires more explicit discussion of the efficiency-robustness trade-off.
column2: 因此，实现大战、萧条和金融崩溃风险的最小化需要决策者找出最优平衡 — — 而这要求更直率的效率-鲁棒权衡争论。

column1: As it stands, policies are often presented without any mention of costs in terms of efficiency or robustness – and mere awareness of the tradeoff is insufficient for effective decision-making.
column2: 政策呈现时往往不会提及效率和鲁棒方面的成本 — — 而仅仅意识到需要权衡不足以带来有效决策。

column1: Instead, the tradeoff must be quantified in approximate and reasonably accessible terms to facilitate productive debate and preempt polarized ideological clashes that have little hope of resolution.
column2: 相反，效率-鲁棒权衡必须得到粗略的量化，形成可合理接受的条件，以促进有意义的争论，预先防止极难解决的极端化的意识形态之争。

column1: Perhaps the commemoration this year of the disaster unleashed in 1914 will inspire people to think more deeply about how to avoid major risks without having to pay a prohibitively high price in lost efficiency and dynamism to ensure robustness and resilience.
column2: 或许，今年对1914年灾难的共同记忆能激发人们更深地思考如何在不必付出不可承受的高代价的情况下避免重大风险 — — 即在牺牲效率和活力确保鲁棒性和恢复力之间权衡。

column1: Now, as then, the fate of the world hangs in the balance.
column2: 和往常一样，世界的命运悬于平衡一线。

column1: Good Governance and Economic Performance
column2: 良好治理与经济成效

column1: BERLIN – The debate about emerging countries’ growth prospects is now in full swing.
column2: 发自柏林 — — 对于新兴市场国家增长前景的讨论如今已经呈现两极化。

column1: Pessimists stress the feared reversal of private capital flows, owing to the US Federal Reserve’s tapering of its purchases of long-term assets, as well as the difficulties of so-called second- and third-generation structural reforms and the limits to “catch up” growth outside of manufacturing.
column2: 悲观主义者们对美联储收缩长期资产购买规模所导致的私人资金恐慌性回流忧心不已，再担心所谓第二代和第三代结构改革的艰巨性以及在制造业以外实现“赶超性”增长的局限性。

column1: Optimists argue that the potential for rapid growth remains immense, owing to better macroeconomic fundamentals and the promise of best-practice technology spreading throughout the emerging world.
column2: 乐观主义者则认为还存在极大的快速增长空间，因为宏观经济基本面已经大有改善，而且最先进技术也被广泛引入各国，带来更可靠的前景。

column1: So who is right?
column2: 那谁才是对的？

column1: Recent events point once again to the importance of good governance and responsive political systems, a familiar topic in studies of long-term economic growth.
column2: 最近的事件再一次显示出了良好治理和灵活反应政治体制的重要性，这也是研究长期经济增长中的一个常见议题。

column1: Countries that appeared successful for a long time, such as Turkey or Thailand, suddenly seem to face obstacles related to governance and the ability to forge domestic political compromises.
column2: 像土耳其或者泰国这类国家看似长期繁荣，但突然就遭遇了与治理以及实现国内政治妥协有关的桎梏。

column1: The resulting divisiveness and dysfunction are surely bigger threats than the Fed’s tapering.
column2: 因此而导致的派系分裂以及国家失能很显然也要比美联储的收缩威胁更大。

column1: It is the nature of governance that determines whether people deploy their talents and energy in pursuit of innovation, production, and job creation, or in rent seeking and lobbying for political protection.
column2: 治理的本质就是决定人们是把自己的聪明才智用在创新，生产及制造就业领域，还是花在权力寻租和寻求政治庇护之上。

column1: And here the contrast between Egypt and Tunisia may turn out to be an object lesson in what makes the difference between success and failure.
column2: 而埃及和突尼斯之间的差别就成为了定义成功和失败国家之间区别的真实课程。

column1: In Egypt, the old regime under Hosni Mubarak, having failed to democratize, collapsed in the face of massive protest.
column2: 在埃及，未能实现民主化的胡斯尼·穆巴拉克旧政权最终在大规模示威下倒台。

column1: A low-turnout election gave a plurality of the popular vote to the Muslim Brotherhood, which came to power alone and proceeded to ignore good governance and alienate all except its most fervent followers.
column2: 一场投票率低下的大选让穆斯林兄弟会夺得了多数，随后该党派独立执政并开始忽略良好治理，疏远除了自身狂热支持者之外的所有人。

column1: The Brotherhood’s approach to governance also explains the mess it made of the economy.
column2: 兄弟会的治理方式同时也解释了他们为何会把经济搞得一团遭。

column1: Instead of trying to build non-partisan and competent regulatory institutions, all positions were stacked with political followers.
column2: 他们不去建立一个中立而称职的监管机构，而是把所有位置都分给了自己的政治支持者。

column1: Unfortunately, the military intervention last July gave rise to yet another regime that seems unable to build durable institutions that could foster political reconciliation and deliver inclusive growth.
column2: 不幸的是，去年7月的军队干涉也仅仅是扶持了另一个无力构建长期性机制的政权，自然也无法去孕育政治和解并实现包容性增长。

column1: Tunisia may give us an example of the opposite scenario: a real constitutional compromise supported by an overwhelming majority (reflected in a 200-16 vote in the National Constituent Assembly).
column2: 而突尼斯则呈现给我们另一片景象：一场由绝大多数议员所支持的真正的宪法妥协（制宪会议中200票赞成对16票反对 ） 。

column1: If that compromise holds, stability will take hold, markets will function, Tunisia will attract investment, and tourism will thrive again.
column2: 如果这一妥协能维持下去，国家就将实现稳定，市场恢复运作，突尼斯也将在再次成为投资和旅游热点。

column1: At the heart of the difference between the two cases is a vision of governance that makes such compromise possible.
column2: 而这两个国家的核心区别就是是否拥有一个可以实现政治妥协的治理理念。

column1: Such a vision presupposes an assurance that a winner-take-all system will not be established, as well as broad agreement that regulatory institutions should be reasonably non-partisan and staffed with competent professionals.
column2: 这一理念的存在意味着确保不会出现一个赢家通吃的政治体制，同时也广泛认同监管机构应当保持合理中立而其成员高度专业的理念。

column1: China’s long-lasting success is sometimes given as a counterexample to the importance of good governance for economic performance.
column2: 但中国的长期繁荣却在某种程度上提供了一个良好治理对经济成效重要性的反例。

column1: The Chinese example certainly calls into question a strong correlation between multi-party democracy and economic growth.
column2: 中国显然令人对那些多党制民主和经济增长之间的强相关关系产生了怀疑。

column1: Democracy is of course something valuable in itself and can be desired independently of its effect on economic growth.
column2: 民主制度显然本身就具有某种价值，而且不管对其对经济增长的有无作用都值得追求。

column1: But, in the context of economic performance, it is important to emphasize that there is a huge difference between dictatorial regimes, where a single individual monopolizes all power – à la Mubarak or Syrian President Bashar al-Assad – and China, where there has been competition and contestability within a large communist party.
column2: 但在经济表现的语境下，应该重点强调那些一人霸占所有权力的独裁政权 — — 比如埃及的穆巴拉克和叙利亚的阿萨德 — — 与中国这样一个在庞大的共产党内部存在竞争和讨论的体制。

column1: And it is the party, operating as a fairly inclusive and meritocratic institution, not an autocratic leader, that has governed in the post-Mao period.
column2: 在毛泽东时代过去后，中共是作为一个相当包容而且精英的体制在运作，而不是一人之下万人之上。

column1: Lack of reasonably independent regulation and competent public administration – or, worse, one-person dictatorships – lead inexorably to economic waste and inefficiency, and eventually to political turmoil.
column2: 缺乏适当独立的监管和称职的公共行政机构 — — 或是更糟糕的一人专制��—无可避免地导致经济上的浪费和低效，最后引发政治风波。

column1: This is true even in cases like Venezuela, where large oil revenues masked the underlying weakness for a while.
column2: 这在委内瑞拉这样在短期内用巨额石油收入掩盖了潜在缺陷的国家也是如此。

column1: In the complex global economy of the twenty-first century, sustained good economic performance requires a panoply of well-functioning institutions that do not fall within a single leader’s purview.
column2: 在21世纪的复杂全球经济下，长期持续的良好经济成效取决于一整套运作良好的机制，不可被一个单一领导人所左右。

column1: For example, successful economies require a reasonably independent central bank, and competent bank supervision that does not get dragged into short term politics.
column2: 比如说，成功的经济体育要一个相对独立的央行，以及一个不会陷入短期政治的称职银行银行监管机制。

column1: They also need regulatory agencies in sectors such as telecommunications and energy that can pursue policies in accordance with broad goals established by the political process, but with appointees selected according to nonpartisan criteria who then exercise their authority in a way that fosters competition open to all.
column2: 它们同时还需要在电信或能源部门建立一些监管机构，这些机构既可以执行一些与政治进程宏大目标相适应的政策，但又必须拥有一批不被党派左右，可以利用自身的权力去促进公开竞争的官员。

column1: When credit decisions, public procurement, construction contracts, and price determination reflect only short-term and purely political goals, good economic performance becomes impossible – even in countries with large natural-resource endowments.
column2: 当信贷决策，政府采购，建设合同和价格设定仅仅是短期和单纯政治目的的体现，良好的经济成效就不可能实现 — — 即便是在那些资源资源丰富的国家。

column1: In countries with little or no such endowments – where innovation, competitive efficiency, and a focus on production rather than rents is all the more important – the lack of good governance will lead to failure more rapidly.
column2: 在那些资源缺乏的国家 — — 创新，竞争效率和对生产力的关注在这里变得更为重要 — — 没有好的治理就只会堕落得越快。

column1: All of this implies that analyzing the determinants of economic success is a subject not just for economists.
column2: 所有这一切都意味着分析力经济成功地决定因素并不仅仅是经济学家的任务。

column1: Why do some societies achieve the compromises needed to sustain an independent judiciary and a modern regulatory framework – both necessary for an efficient modern economy – while others perpetuate a partisan, winner-take-all approach to governance that weakens public policy and erodes private-sector confidence?
column2: 为什么某些社会能达成一个支撑现代高效经济体所必需的司法独立和现代监管框架的妥协，而其他国家则长期党同伐异，赢者通吃，最终损害了公共政策并令私人投资者失去信心？

column1: The contrast is starkest in emerging countries, but differences also exist among the advanced economies.
column2: 这些对比在新兴市场国家最为明显，但差别同样出现在发达国家之间。

column1: Perhaps Germany’s ability to reach sociopolitical compromise – again demonstrated by the formation of a right-left coalition after the 2013 elections – has been more fundamental to its recent economic success than the details of the fiscal and structural policies it has pursued to achieve it.
column2: 或许相对于一些细节性的财政和经济结构政策，德国实现社会政治妥协的能力 — — 在2013年大选后左右联合政府上再度体现出来 — — 才是实现最近一系列经济成就的更基础性因素？

column1: The Cuban Missile Crisis at 50
column2: 50年代的古巴导弹危机

column1: CAMBRIDGE – This month marks the 50th anniversary of the Cuban missile crisis – those 13 days in October 1962 that were probably the closest the world has come to a major nuclear war.
column2: 坎布里奇 — — 本月是古巴导弹危机50周年纪念日 — — 1962年10月的这13天或许是有史以来世界最接近一场全面核战争的时刻。

column1: President John F. Kennedy had publicly warned the Soviet Union not to introduce offensive missiles into Cuba.
column2: 约翰·F·肯尼迪总统已经公开警告苏联不要向古巴部署攻击性导弹。

column1: But Soviet leader Nikita Khrushchev decided to cross Kennedy’s red line surreptitiously and confront the Americans with a fait accompli.
column2: 可苏联领导人尼基塔·赫鲁晓夫决定偷偷越过肯尼迪划出的红线，看看美国人面对既成事实会怎么办。

column1: When an American surveillance plane discovered the missiles, the crisis erupted.
column2: 美国侦察机发现导弹之后，危机全面爆发。

column1: Some of Kennedy’s advisers urged an air strike and invasion to destroy the missiles.
column2: 肯尼迪某些顾问敦促发动空袭和入侵来销毁导弹。

column1: Kennedy mobilized troops, but also bought time by announcing a naval blockade of Cuba.
column2: 肯尼迪调集了部队，但同时宣布对古巴实施海上封锁来争取时间。

column1: The crisis subsided when Soviet ships carrying additional missiles turned back, and Khrushchev agreed to remove the existing missiles from the island.
column2: 携带后续导弹的苏联船只掉头返回后危机逐渐消退，赫鲁晓夫也答应移走岛上已有的导弹。

column1: As then US Secretary of State Dean Rusk put it: “We were eyeball to eyeball, and I think the other fellow just blinked.”
column2: 正如时任美国国务卿迪安·腊斯克所言 ： “ 双方的相互对峙最终以对方的退缩而告结束 。 ”

column1: At first glance, this was a rational and predictable outcome.
column2: 乍看之下，这是一个可以合理预见的结果。

column1: The United States had a 17-to-1 advantage in nuclear weaponry.
column2: 美国拥有的核武器优势为17比1。

column1: The Soviets were simply outgunned.
column2: 简直可以用势单力薄来形容苏联人。

column1: And yet the US did not preemptively attack Soviet missile sites, which were relatively vulnerable, because the risk that even one or two of the Soviet missiles would be fired at an American city was enough to deter a first strike.
column2: 但美国并没有先发制人地打击苏联相对脆弱的导弹基地，因为即使只有一两枚苏联导弹打向美国城市也足以阻止美国首先发起进攻。

column1: In addition, both Kennedy and Khrushchev feared that rational strategies and careful calculation might spin out of control.
column2: 此外，肯尼迪和赫鲁晓夫都担心理性的战略和谨慎的计算可能会最终失控。

column1: Khrushchev offered a vivid metaphor in one of his letters to Kennedy: “We and you ought not now to pull on the ends of the rope in which you have tied the knot of war.”
column2: 赫鲁晓夫在寄给肯尼迪的信中做了一个生动的比喻 ： “ ��我双方现在都不该扯动打着战争之结的绳索 。 ”

column1: In 1987, I was part of a group of scholars that met at Harvard University with Kennedy’s surviving advisers to study the crisis.
column2: 1987年，我参与了哈佛大学与肯尼迪依然健在的顾问见面研究这场危机的学者团。

column1: Robert McNamara, Kennedy’s secretary of defense, said he became more cautious as the crisis unfolded.
column2: 时任肯尼迪国防部长罗伯特·麦克纳马拉表示随着危机逐渐展开，他自己也变得越来越谨慎。

column1: At the time, he thought that the probability of nuclear war resulting from the crisis might have been one in 50 (though he rated the risk much higher after he learned in the 1990’s that the Soviets had already delivered nuclear weapons to Cuba).
column2: 当时他曾认为危机引发核战争的可能性是五十分之一（尽管20世纪90年代获悉苏联已将核武器运抵古巴后，麦克纳马拉大幅提高了自己的风险评分 ） 。

column1: Douglas Dillon, Kennedy’s treasury secretary, said he thought that the risk of nuclear war had been about zero.
column2: 时任肯尼迪财政部长道格拉斯·狄龙曾说他认为核战争的危险约等于零。

column1: He did not see how the situation could possibly have escalated to nuclear war, and thus had been willing to push the Soviets harder and to take more risks than McNamara was.
column2: 他看不出局势怎么可能升级为核战争，因此他比麦克纳马拉更愿意冒险向苏联进一步施压。

column1: General Maxwell Taylor, the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, also believed that the risk of nuclear war was low, and he complained that the US let the Soviet Union off too easily.
column2: 参谋长联席会议主席马克斯韦尔·泰勒将军也认为核战争的风险很低，并因此抱怨美国太过轻易地放过了苏联。

column1: He felt that the Americans should have removed the Castro regime.
column2: 他认为这本来是美国人推翻卡斯特罗政权的好时机。

column1: But the risks of losing control of the situation weighed heavily on Kennedy, too, which is why he took a more prudent position than some of his advisers would have liked.
column2: 但局势失控的风险也深深困扰着肯尼迪，他也因此采取了比某些顾问希望的更加谨慎的姿态。

column1: The moral of the story is that a little nuclear deterrence goes a long way.
column2: 故事的核心思想是一点点核威慑所起到的作用也不容小觑。

column1: Nonetheless, there are still ambiguities about the missile crisis that make it difficult to attribute the outcome entirely to the nuclear component.
column2: 尽管如此，这场导弹危机仍然存在含混之处，因此其中的核元素很难完全解释最终的结果。

column1: The public consensus was that the US won.
column2: 公众普遍认为美国是这场危机的赢家。

column1: But how much the US won, and why it won, is hard to determine.
column2: 但谁都难以说清美国为什么会赢、又赢了多少。

column1: There are at least two possible explanations of the outcome, in addition to Soviet acquiescence to America’s superior nuclear firepower.
column2: 除去苏联默许美国拥有优势核火力之外，至少还有两种解释可以导致同样的结果。

column1: One focuses on the importance of the two superpowers’ relative stakes in the crisis: the US not only had a greater stake in neighboring Cuba than the Soviets did, but could also bring conventional forces to bear.
column2: 一种偏重于两个超级大国在危机中相对利益的重要程度：与苏联相比美国不仅在邻国古巴拥有更大的利益，还可以更多地利用传统军事力量。

column1: The naval blockade and the possibility of a US invasion strengthened the credibility of American deterrence, placing the psychological burden on the Soviets.
column2: 海上封锁和美国入侵的可能性增强了美国威慑的可信度，因此将心理负担推给了苏联一方。

column1: The other explanation questions the very premise that the Cuban missile crisis was an outright US victory.
column2: 另一种解释质疑了美国在古巴危机中取得完胜的前提条件。

column1: The Americans had three options: a “shoot-out” (bomb the missile sites); a “squeeze out” (blockade Cuba to convince the Soviets to withdraw the missiles); and a “buyout” (give the Soviets something they want).
column2: 美国当时面临三种选择：一种是“全面开战（轰炸导弹基地 ） ； 一种是“挤出 ” （ 封锁古巴迫使苏联撤出导弹 ） ； 最后一种是“收买 ” （ 给苏联某些想要的东西作为交换 ） 。

column1: For a long time, the participants said little about the buyout aspects of the solution.
column2: 很长一段时间以来，鲜有参与者提到过解决方案的收买层面。

column1: But subsequent evidence suggests that a quiet US promise to remove its obsolete missiles from Turkey and Italy was probably more important than was thought at the time (the US also gave a public assurance that it would not invade Cuba).
column2: 但随后的证据表明收买因素比人们当时所想的更加重要，美国暗中承诺从土耳其和意大利撤出过期导弹（美国还当众保证不会入侵古巴 ） 。

column1: We can conclude that nuclear deterrence mattered in the crisis, and that the nuclear dimension certainly figured in Kennedy’s thinking.
column2: 我们可以认定核威慑在此次危机当中至关重要，并且核问题肯定曾在肯尼迪的思考过程中出现。

column1: But it was not the ratio of nuclear weapons that mattered so much as the fear that even a few nuclear weapons would wreak intolerable devastation.
column2: 但真正重要的并不是核武器的比例，而是担心少量核武器也会造成令人无法忍受的破坏。

column1: How real were these risks?
column2: 核威胁的风险究竟有多大？

column1: On October 27, 1962, just after Soviet forces in Cuba shot down a US surveillance plane (killing the pilot), a similar plane taking routine air samples near Alaska inadvertently violated Soviet air space in Siberia.
column2: 1962年10月27日，就在苏联军队刚刚在古巴击落一架美国侦察机（导致飞行员丧生）后不久，一架类似的飞机在阿拉斯加附近常规搜集空气样本时无意间侵犯了苏联的西伯利亚领空。

column1: Fortunately, it was not shot down.
column2: 幸运的是，这架飞机并未被击落。

column1: But, even more serious, unbeknownst to the Americans, Soviet forces in Cuba had been instructed to repel a US invasion, and had been authorized to use their tactical nuclear weapons to do so.
column2: 但还有更严重的事实并不为美国人所知，驻古巴的苏联军队已经接到使用战术核武器击退美国的入侵的指令。

column1: It is hard to imagine that such a nuclear attack would have remained merely tactical.
column2: 很难想象这样的核攻击能仅仅停留在战术层面。

column1: Kenneth Waltz, an American scholar, recently published an article entitled “Why Iran Should Get the Bomb.”
column2: 美国学者肯尼思·沃尔兹最近发表了一篇文章，题目是“伊朗为什么应该得到炸弹 。 ”

column1: In a rational, predictable world, such an outcome might produce stability.
column2: 在可以预测的理性世界，这样的结果可能会带来稳定。

column1: In the real world, the Cuban missile crisis suggests that it might not.
column2: 但在现实世界，古巴导弹危机表明结果可能相去甚远。

column1: As McNamara put it, “We lucked out.”
column2: 正如麦克纳马拉所说 ， “ 我们幸免于难 。 ”

column1: Social Choice and Social Welfare
column2: 社会选择与社会福利

column1: CAMBRIDGE – Human beings have always lived in groups, and their individual lives have invariably depended on group decisions.
column2: 剑桥—人类一直生活在群体中，他们的个体生活总是取决于群体选择。

column1: But the challenges of group choice can be daunting, particularly given the divergent interests and concerns of the group’s members.
column2: 但群体选择的挑战也许令人畏缩，特别是考虑到群体成员之间利益与关注点的分歧。

column1: So, how should collective decision-making be carried out?
column2: 那么，集体决策应该如何进行？

column1: A dictator who wants to control every aspect of people’s lives will seek to ignore the preferences of everyone else.
column2: 希望掌握人们生活方方面面的独裁者会寻求忽略所有其他人的偏好。

column1: But that level of power is hard to achieve.
column2: 但如此水平的权力很难获得。

column1: More important, dictatorship of any kind can readily be seen to be a terrible way to govern a society.
column2: 更重要的是，任何类型的独裁都天生被视为恐怖的治理社会方式。

column1: So, for both ethical and practical reasons, social scientists have long investigated how the concerns of a society’s members can be reflected in one way or another in its collective decisions, even if the society is not fully democratic.
column2: 因此，出于伦理和实际理由，社会科学家长期以来一直在研究社会成员的关注点如何以某种方式反映于集体决策中，即使该社会非完全民主的社会。

column1: For example, in the fourth century BC, Aristotle in Greece and Kautilya in India explored various possibilities of social choice in their classic books, Politics and Economics, respectively (the Sanskrit title of Kautilya’s book, Arthashastra, translates literally as “the discipline of material wellbeing”).
column2: 比如，在公元前四世纪，希腊的亚里士多德和印度的考底利耶（Kautilya）就分别在各自的经典著作《政治学 》 （ Politics）和《经济学 》 （ Economics）中探索了社会选择的各种可能性。 （考底利耶著作的梵文标题为Arthashastra，直译过来就是“关于物质财富的学科 ” ） 。

column1: The study of social choice as a formal discipline first came into its own in the late eighteenth century, when the subject was pioneered by French mathematicians, particularly J. C. Borda and Marquis de Condorcet.
column2: 社会选择研究第一次步入正式学科是在十九世纪末，先驱式法国数学家，主要包括波尔达（J. C. Borda）和马奎斯·孔多塞（Marquis de Condorcet ） 。

column1: The intellectual climate of the time was greatly influenced by the European Enlightenment, with its interest in reasoned construction of a social order, and its commitment to the creation of a society responsive to people’s preferences.
column2: 当时的知识界气候受欧洲文艺复兴的巨大影响，人们对理性的社会秩序的构建兴趣浓厚，开始致力于创建响应人民偏好的社会。

column1: But the theoretical investigations of Borda, Condorcet, and others often yielded rather pessimistic results.
column2: 但波尔达、孔多塞和其他人的理论研究常常指向悲观结果。

column1: For example, the so-called “voting paradox” presented by Condorcet showed that majority rule can reach an impasse when every alternative is defeated in voting by some other alternative, so that no alternative is capable of standing up to the challenge of every other alternative.
column2: 比如，孔多塞提出的所谓的“投票悖论”表明多数统治可能陷入僵局，出现每一种方案都被其他方案在选举中击败的情况，以至于没有一种方案能够战胜其他所有方案的挑战。

column1: Social choice theory in its modern and systematic form owes its rigorous foundation to the work of Kenneth J. Arrow in his 1950 Columbia University PhD dissertation.
column2: 现代、系统性的社会选择理论的一个主要基础是肯尼斯·阿罗（Kenneth J. Arrow）在其1950年哥伦比亚大学的博士论文中做出的工作。

column1: Arrow’s thesis contained his famous “impossibility theorem,” an analytical result of breathtaking elegance and reach.
column2: 阿罗的论文包括了著名的“不可能定理 ” ， 这一分析结果优美无比，也深邃无比。

column1: Arrow’s theorem shows that even very mild conditions of reasonableness in arriving at social decisions on the basis of simple preference rankings of a society’s individuals could not be simultaneously satisfied by any procedure.
column2: 阿罗的定理证明，对于以社会中个人的简单偏好排序为基础形成社会决策这一问题，即使是弱理性条件也无法通过任何程序（procedure）同时获得满足。

column1: When the book based on his dissertation, Social Choice and Individual Values, was published in 1951, it became an instant classic.
column2: 以其博士论文为基础的《社会选择与个人价值 》 （ Social Choice and Individual Values）出版于1951年，立刻就成为经典著作。

column1: Economists, political theorists, moral and political philosophers, sociologists, and even the general public rapidly took notice of what seemed like – and indeed was – a devastating result.
column2: 经济学家、政治理论家、道德和政治哲学家、社会学家、甚至普罗大众很快就注意到了这个似乎 — — 也确实是 — — 灾难性的结果。

column1: Two centuries after visions of social rationality flowered in Enlightenment thinking, the project suddenly seemed, at least superficially, to be inescapably doomed.
column2: 在社会理性观点借助文艺复兴思想发展了两个世纪之后，这项大工程突然走向了无可避免的倒塌 — — 至少从表面看是如此。

column1: It is important to understand why and how Arrow’s impossibility result comes about.
column2: 理解阿罗不可能定理为何会出现、如何出现十分重要。

column1: Scrutiny of the formal reasoning that establishes the theorem shows that relying only on the preference rankings of individuals makes it difficult to distinguish between very dissimilar social choice problems.
column2: 对建立该定理的正式推理的仔细审读表明，只依赖个体偏好顺序导致很难区分截然不同的社会选择问题。

column1: The usability of available information is further reduced by the combined effects of innocuous-seeming principles that are popular in informal discussions.
column2: 易得信息的可用性因为在非正式讨论中十分流行的看似无伤大雅的各种原则的组合效应而进一步削弱了。

column1: It is essential, particularly for making judgments about social welfare, to compare different individuals’ gains and losses and to take note of their relative affluence, which cannot be immediately deduced only from people’s rankings of social alternatives.
column2: 比较不同个体的利益和损失、注意他们的相对丰裕程度（这无法通过人们对社会方案的排序立刻推得）是至关重要的，特别是在做出关于社会福利的判断方面。

column1: It is also important to examine which types of clusters of preference rankings are problematic for different types of voting procedures.
column2: 同样重要的是考察哪些类型的偏好排列窜（cluster）对于不同类型的投票程序有问题。

column1: Nonetheless, Arrow’s impossibility theorem ultimately played a hugely constructive role in investigating what democracy demands, which goes well beyond counting votes (important as that is).
column2: 尽管如此，阿罗的不可能定理最终在研究民主要求什么的问题上扮演了巨大的建设性角色，这一问题远远超过了点算票数的范围（尽管这也很重要 ） 。

column1: Enriching the informational base of democracy and making greater use of interactive public reasoning can contribute significantly to making democracy more workable, and also allow reasoned assessment of social welfare.
column2: 丰富民主的信息基础、让互动型公共推理排上更大用场可以极大地增强民主的可运作性，也让社会福利的理性评估成为可能。

column1: Social choice theory has thus become a broad discipline, covering a variety of distinct questions.
column2: 因此，社会选择理论是一门广阔的科学，覆盖了大量不同问题。

column1: Under what circumstances would majority rule yield unambiguous and consistent decisions?
column2: 在何种环境下多数同志能产生不含糊的一致性决策？

column1: How robust are the different voting procedures for yielding cogent results?
column2: 产生令人信服结果的不同投票程序的鲁棒性如何？

column1: How can we judge how well a society as a whole is doing in light of its members’ disparate interests?
column2: 我们如何判断社会作为一个整体在其成员利益完全不相干的情况下运行的如何？

column1: How, moreover, can we accommodate individuals’ rights and liberties while giving appropriate recognition to their overall preferences?
column2: 此外，我们能够在协调个人权利与自由同时给予他们的总体偏好以恰当的承认？

column1: How do we measure aggregate poverty in view of the varying predicaments and miseries of the diverse people who comprise the society?
column2: 我们如何在度量总贫困水平时顾及组成社会的不同的人所经历的不同窘况和苦难？

column1: How do we arrive at social valuations of public goods such as the natural environment?
column2: 我们如何形成对自然环境等公共品的社会评估？

column1: Beyond these questions, a theory of justice can draw substantially on the insights and analytical results emerging from social choice theory (as I discussed in my 2009 book The Idea of Justice).
column2: 除了这些问题，关于正义的理论可以深刻影响来自社会选择理论的洞见和分析结果（我在2009年的著作《正义观念 》 （ The Idea of Justice）中讨论了这一点 ） 。

column1: Furthermore, the understanding generated by social choice theorists’ study of group decisions has helped some research that is not directly a part of social choice theory – for example, on the forms and consequences of gender inequality, or on the causation and prevention of famines.
column2: 此外，来自社会选择理论家对群体决策的研究的理解帮助了一些并非直接属于社会选择理论的研究 — — 比如对性别不平等的后果的形式的研究、对饥荒的成因和预防的研究等。

column1: The reach and relevance of social choice theory is extensive.
column2: 社会选择理论的深度和重要性是巨大的。

column1: Rather than undermining the pursuit of social reasoning, Arrow’s deeply challenging impossibility theorem, and the large volume of literature that it has inspired, has immensely strengthened our ability to think rationally about the collective decision-making on which our survival and happiness depend.
column2: 形成深刻挑战的阿罗不可能定理及其所启发的大量文献并未阻碍对社会理性的追求，而是大大增强了我们理性地思考作为我们的生存和幸福基础的集体决策的能力。

column1: What’s the Problem With Advanced Economies?
column2: 发达经济体出了什么问题？

column1: CAMBRIDGE – Is today’s slow growth in advanced economies a continuation of long-term secular decline, or does it reflect the normal aftermath of a deep systemic financial crisis?
column2: 美国剑桥—发达经济体目前的低增长是长期衰落的延续，还是反映了深度系统性金融危机后的常态？

column1: More important, do we need to answer that question definitively in order to boost the pace of economic recovery?
column2: 更重要的是，为了提振经济增长速度，我们需要对这个问题做出确定的回答吗？

column1: At a recent International Monetary Fund (IMF) conference, former US Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers argued that today’s growth blues have deep roots that pre-date the global financial crisis.
column2: 在最近的国际货币基金组织（IMF）会议上，前美国财政部长萨默斯（Lawrence Summers）指出，现今的增长萎靡在全球金融危机之前就埋下了祸根。

column1: Summers placed particular emphasis on the need for more infrastructure investment, a sentiment that most economists wholeheartedly share, especially if one is referring to genuinely productive investment.
column2: 萨默斯特别强调了需要进行更多的基础设施投资，大部分经济学家都十分支持这一��法，特别是真正的生产性投资。

column1: Others also certainly worry about secular decline, though most have emphasized the supply side rather than the demand side.
column2: 显然也有人担心长期衰落，尽管大部分强调的是供给面而不是需求面。

column1: The economist Jeffrey Sachs, for example, has argued that the US economy needs to confront a plethora of structural impediments to sustained growth, including offshoring, skill mismatches, and decaying infrastructure.
column2: 比如，经济学家萨克斯（Jeffrey Sachs）指出，美国经济需要面临太多的可持续增长的结构性障碍，包括离岸化、技能错配和基础设施陈旧。

column1: The Internet entrepreneur Peter Thiel and the legendary chess champion Garry Kasparov have suggested that the malaise runs even deeper, as has the economist Robert Gordon.
column2: 互联网创业家提尔（Peter Thiel）和国际象棋传奇卡斯帕罗夫认为经济萎靡更加严重，经济学家戈登（Robert Gordon）亦作如是观。

column1: They argue that the technology engine that has driven mankind from one economic plateau to the next over the past 200 years is running out of steam.
column2: 他们指出，在过去200年中引领人类从一个经济高原走向另一个经济高原的技术引擎正在失去动力。

column1: Simply put, the Internet may be cool, but it is hardly as essential as running water, electrification, or the internal combustion engine.
column2: 简言之，互联网看起来很酷，但根本不能和蒸汽机、电气化和内燃机相提并论。

column1: The Gordon-Kasparov-Thiel thesis is extremely interesting, though I have challenged their negative conclusions, both in print and in a debate at Oxford.
column2: 戈登-卡斯帕罗夫-提尔理论非常有趣，尽管我撰文并在牛津的讨论会上挑战了他们的消极推论。

column1: Personally, I think the greater risk is that the pace of technological progress will accelerate too much for societies to adapt, though the experience so far has basically been positive.
column2: 就个人而言，我认为更大的风险在于技术进步的速度增加得太快，使社会难以适应，尽管到目前为止的经验从根本上说都是积极的。

column1: Certainly, today’s advanced economies urgently need to address all kinds of technological, social, and political deficiencies.
column2: 显然，如今发达经济体急切地需要纠正各种技术、社会和政治缺陷。

column1: Nevertheless, the subpar growth of the past half-decade still bears all the hallmarks of a typical sluggish recovery from a deep systemic financial crisis, as Carmen Reinhart and I documented in our 2009 book This Time is Different.
column2: 尽管如此，过去五年来的增长不振仍表现出深度系统性金融危机后增长停滞的全部典型特征，我和莱因哈特（Carmen Reinhart）在2009年的著作《这次不一样 》 （ This Time is Different）中描述了这些特征。

column1: Of course, structural reform is essential after a financial crisis, as are policies to maintain aggregate demand while the economy heals.
column2: 当然，金融危机后，结构性改革是不必可少的，在经济复原时维持总需求的政策亦然。

column1: To my mind, the biggest failure of post-2008 economic policy has consisted in governments’ inability to find creative ways to write down unsustainable debts, for example in US mortgage markets, and in Europe’s periphery.
column2: 在我看来，2008年后的经济政策最大的失败之处在于政府无法找到减记不可持续的债务的创新办法，如美国按揭市场和欧洲外围国家债务。

column1: This includes the failure to issue public debt where necessary to facilitate restructuring, particularly if overall economy-wide (or eurozone-wide) debt could be reduced in the same operation.
column2: 这其中包括了没有在必要时发行公债促进重组，特别是在全经济（或全欧元区）债务可以同时减少的情况下。

column1: But Summers is certainly right that productive infrastructure investment is the low-hanging fruit.
column2: 但萨默斯认为生产性基础设施投资是唾手可得的成果毫无疑问是正确的。

column1: Of course, governments should be concerned about the long-term trajectory of public debt, all politically charged and polemical nonsense to the contrary.
column2: 当然，政府应该关注公债的长期走势、所有带政治色彩的反对意见和无意义的争论。

column1: But productive infrastructure investment that generates long-term growth pays for itself, so there need not be any conflict between short-term stabilization and risks to long-term debt sustainability.
column2: 但有利于增长的生产性基础设施投资自会产生成效，因此在这方面不应该有任何短期稳定和长期债务可持续性风险之间的冲突。

column1: With today’s ultra-low interest rates and high unemployment, public investment is cheap and plenty of projects offer high returns: fixing bridges and roads, updating badly outmoded electricity grids, and improving mass-transportation systems, to take just a few notable examples.
column2: 如今，利率处于极低水平，而失业处于极高水平，公共投资十分廉价，并且有足够多的可提供高回报的项目：架桥修路、升级陈旧损坏的电网、改善大众交通系统，等等（以上只是几个显著的例子 ） 。

column1: I appreciate that there are those who take on faith that Keynesian multipliers are much bigger than one, implying that even wasteful government spending is productive.
column2: 有人相信凯恩斯乘数远大于一，也就是说，即使是浪费性质的政府支出也是生产性的，我同意这一点。

column1: But, given thin empirical evidence and legitimate concerns about undermining trust in the effectiveness of government, and with so many options for the productive use of resources, this seems like a titanic ideological distraction.
column2: 但是，由于实证证据较少以及关于破坏对效果和政府的信任的合理担忧，并且我们有许多选择可以把资源用於生产性用途，因此这似乎是对思想统一的极大干扰。

column1: It is also far from clear why virtually all infrastructure needs to be publicly financed.
column2: 另一个远未得到澄清的问题是为何几乎所有基础设施都需要通过公共融资。

column1: There are still huge pools of private wealth sitting on the sidelines that can be rapidly mobilized to support productive infrastructure.
column2: 有大量私人财富可以快速动员以支持生产性基础设施。

column1: The government needs to help with rights of way before construction, and with strong regulation to protect the public interest afterwards.
column2: 政府需要在建设之前帮助厘清路权，并在道路建成后采取强有力的监管保护公众利益。

column1: In his first term in office, US President Barack Obama suggested the creation of an infrastructure bank to help promote public-private partnerships.
column2: 在其第一个任期内，美国总统奥巴马提出成立基础设施银行促进公私合作。

column1: It is still a good idea, particularly if the bank maintained a professional staff to help guide public choice on costs and benefits (including environmental costs and benefits).
column2: 这依然是个好主意，特别是在银行拥有专业人员可以帮助计算公共选择的成本收益（包括环境成本和收益）的情况下。

column1: Even if Keynesian multipliers are truly at the upper end of consensus, mobilizing private capital for investment has most of the advantages of issuing public debt.
column2: 即使凯恩斯乘数确实高到共识的上限，动员私人资本进行投资也具有发行过公债的绝大部分优点。

column1: One qualification is in order.
column2: 有一种观点很有市场。

column1: Some commentators have suggested that the root cause of secular decline, as well as the main explanation of ultra-low interest rates, is low fertility throughout the advanced world.
column2: 一些评论者指出，长期衰落的根源 — — 以及超低利率的主要解释 — — 是发达国家的低生育率。

column1: If true, the case for any kind of investment, public or private, would be more mixed; there must be labor to use the capital.
column2: 如果这一看法正确，那么投资的问题 — — 不管是私人投资还是公共投资 — — 就会变得更加复杂；必须要有人来使用资本。

column1: But I suspect that the drivers of today’s slow growth and low interest rates go far beyond low fertility rates, in which case this should not be an obstacle.
column2: 但我怀疑现今的低增长和低利率远远不是低生育率所能解释的，低生育率不应该成为障碍。

column1: The important point is that the case for expanding productive infrastructure investment does not rest on one narrow ideological viewpoint or economic theory.
column2: 要点在于扩张生产性基础设施投资的问题并不是狭隘的经济学理论思想问题。

column1: Whether Summers is right about secular stagnation in advanced economies, or whether we are still mainly suffering the aftermath of the financial crisis, it is time to break the political gridlock and restore growth.
column2: 不管萨默斯关于发达经济体的长期停滞的观点是否正确，也不管我们是否仍在经历金融危机的后遗症，现在都应该打破政治僵局、重塑增长。

column1: A Surplus of Controversy
column2: 争论盈余

column1: CAMBRIDGE – When the US Treasury recently added its voice to the chorus of critics of Germany’s chronic current-account surplus, it underscored the deep disagreement over what, if anything, should be done about it.
column2: 美国剑桥—美国财政部最近提高了对德国长期经常项目盈余的批评声音，这凸显出关于如何应对这一问题的深刻分歧。

column1: The critics want Germany to increase its contribution to global demand by importing more and exporting less.
column2: 批评者想要德国增加进口、减少出口，从而为全球需求做出更大贡献。

column1: The Germans view the maintenance of strong balance sheets as essential to their country’s stabilizing role in Europe.
column2: 德国人则认为维护其强劲的国际收支盈余对于德国在欧洲扮演稳定者角色至关重要。

column1: Both sides’ arguments will certainly receive a full airing at the spring meetings of the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank.
column2: 双方观点都必定会在国际货币基金组织（IMF）和世界银行的春季会议上获得充分的支持。

column1: Unfortunately, the debate has too often been informed more by ideology than facts.
column2: 不幸的是，这场争论总是太多地披上了意识形态色彩，而太少关注事实。

column1: The difference between what a country exports and imports can reflect myriad factors, including business cycles, demographics, investment opportunities, and economic diversification.
column2: 一国出口和进口之间的差额可以反映诸多原因，包括商业周期、人口结构、投资机会和经济多样化等。

column1: It can also reflect the government’s penchant for running fiscal surpluses; after all, the current-account surplus, by definition, is the excess of public and private savings over investment.
column2: 它还可能反映了政府的财政盈余偏好；毕竟，经常项目盈余的定义是公共和私人储蓄超出投资的部分。

column1: During the first half of the 2000’s, US policymakers chose not to worry about sustained current-account deficits, which peaked at above 6% of GDP.
column2: 在21世纪的第一个五年，美国决策者不担心持续的经���项目赤字（最高时超过了GDP的6%以上 ） 。

column1: They argued at first that the deficits merely reflected the world’s attraction to superior US investment opportunities, an odd position given that the US was not growing especially quickly compared to emerging markets.
column2: 他们首先指出，盈余无非反映了世界对上佳美国投资机会的吸引力，考虑到美国的增长并不比新兴市场快，这一离场有些奇怪。

column1: Later, academic researchers identified more plausible reasons why the US might be able to run large deficits without great risk, as long as investors’ desire for diversification, safety, and liquidity sustained global demand for US assets.
column2: 随后，学术研究者找到了关于美国为何可以维持巨大赤字而不招致巨大风险的更合理的理由：投资者对多样化、安全性和流动性的渴望维持了美国资产的全球需求。

column1: But policymakers should have recognized that even these better rationales had limits, and that massive sustained current-account deficits are often a blinking red signal of deeper problems – in this case, over-borrowing by households to finance home purchases.
column2: 但决策者应该认识到，即便这一更好的理由也有局限性，持续大规模经常项目盈余通常是更深层次问题的警示信号 — — 在当时的美国是家庭为融资买房而进行的过度借贷。

column1: In the case of Germany, of course, we are talking about surpluses, not deficits.
column2: 当然，在德国的问题上，我们讨论的是盈余而不是赤字。

column1: And even though the surpluses exceed 6% of German national income and would seem to be on the same order of magnitude as pre-crisis US deficits, one must remember that the German economy is less than a quarter the size of the US (at market exchange rates).
column2: 虽然盈余超过了德国国民收入的6 % ， 已骎骎然与危机前美国赤字水平相当，但是别忘了，德国经济规模还不到美国的四分之一（按市场汇率衡量 ） 。

column1: However, as the Center for European Policy Studies’ Daniel Gros has pointed out, the issue is not simply Germany.
column2: 但是，正如欧洲政策研究中心（Center for European Policy Studies）的丹尼尔·格罗斯（Daniel Gros）所指出的，这个问题并不只是德国的问题。

column1: Smaller northern European countries, including the Netherlands, Switzerland, Sweden, and Norway have been collectively running surpluses at least as large as Germany’s relative to national income, and, in absolute terms, their combined surpluses are even larger.
column2: 较小的北欧经集体，包括荷兰、瑞士、瑞典和挪威，总盈余占国民收入比与德国不想上相，若用绝对数字衡量则更有过之。

column1: So the issue obviously merits attention.
column2: 因此，这一问题显然应该引起注意。

column1: But what is the cause, and is it related to policy?
column2: 但原因何在？ 与政策有关系吗？

column1: Certainly, no one can criticize northern Europe for exchange-rate undervaluation.
column2: 显然，我们不可能批评北欧汇率低估。

column1: By almost any purchasing-power measure, the euro seems overvalued (and the Swiss franc even more so).
column2: 几乎从任何购买力标准衡量，欧元都是被高估的（瑞士法郎高估得更多 ） 。

column1: Keynesians look at these surpluses and say that the northern European countries should drive them down by running much larger fiscal deficits to boost domestic demand.
column2: 凯恩斯主义者看到这些盈余会说，北欧国家应该通过增加财政赤字、提高内需来让盈余下降。

column1: They have a point, but they grossly overstate the case.
column2: 他们的话不无道理，但他们把说的太自信了。

column1: Many studies have shown that changes in private savings and investment tend to offset partly the current-account effects of higher fiscal deficits.
column2: 许多研究表明，私人储蓄和投资的变化倾向于抵消部分财政赤字的经常项目效应。

column1: For example, larger German fiscal deficits would hardly have been a decisive factor in Europe.
column2: 比如，德国提高财政赤字几乎不可能成为欧洲的决定性因素。

column1: Research by the IMF and others suggests that the demand spillovers from German fiscal policy to Europe are likely to be modest, particularly in the eurozone’s troubled countries, like Greece and Portugal.
column2: IMF和其他机构的研究表明德国财政政策对欧洲的需求溢出效应可能十分微小，特别是对希腊和葡萄牙等欧元区受困经济体而言。

column1: Germany trades with the entire world.
column2: 德国的贸易伙伴是全世界。

column1: The European Commission has recently completed its own report on Germany’s surpluses, concluding that it is difficult to pin down the many factors underlying it, which of course is true.
column2: 欧盟委员会最近完成了其自身的德国盈余问题报告，认为很难一一确定其诸多因素，这毫无疑问是正确的。

column1: For example, Germany’s capital-goods exporters have benefited enormously from growth in China.
column2: 比如，德国的资本商品商因为中国的增长而获益良多。

column1: The Commission nonetheless argues persuasively that policies to promote public and private investment would tame the surpluses in the short term and strengthen German growth in the long term.
column2: 尽管如此，欧盟委员会令人信服地指出，刺激公共和私人投资的政策可以在短期减少盈余，在长期提振德国的增长。

column1: One might add that there are still extensive impediments to competition in the service and retail sectors in many northern European countries.
column2: 还可以加上一点：许多北欧国家的服务和零售部门仍然存在巨大的竞争障碍。

column1: Removing them would increase consumption of all goods, including imports.
column2: 消除这些障碍能够提高所有商品的消费，包括进口品。

column1: And Germany is right to point out that its strong balance sheet underpins Europe’s fragile stability today.
column2: 德国指出其强劲的收支盈余状况体现了欧洲的脆弱现状，这也是正确的。

column1: Would European Central Bank President Mario Draghi’s vow in the summer of 2012 to do “whatever it takes” to save the euro have been nearly as effective if investors doubted Germany’s underlying financial strength and resolve?
column2: 如果投资者怀疑德国的金融基本面健康状况和决心，欧洲央行行长德拉吉在2012年夏所做出的“竭尽全力”拯救欧元的承诺还会如此有效吗？

column1: At the same time, it is also true that Germany could have been more forthcoming and more liberal in using its balance sheet to defuse debt-overhang problems in periphery countries like Portugal and Greece, and perhaps even Ireland and Spain.
column2: 与此同时，同样正确的是，德国原本可能更容易、更慷慨地利用其收支盈余平息葡萄牙和希腊（也许还包括爱尔兰和西班牙）等外围国的债务积压问题。

column1: The bottom line is that large sustained external imbalances are something that global policymakers do need to monitor closely, because, as the US housing bust showed, they can be an indicator of problems that need to be investigated more deeply.
column2: 总而言之，持续大规模外部失衡是全球决策这需要密切监控的问题，因为正如美国房地产泡沫破裂所标明的，它们可能是需要深度调查的问题的表征。

column1: And critics of the surplus countries are right that there are two sides to every balance, and that policies in both surplus and deficit countries should be subject to review.
column2: 盈余国的批评者正确地指出，有盈余则必有赤字，盈余国和赤字国的政策都应该仔细检视。

column1: But it is wrong to believe that simplistic answers, such as more fiscal stimulus or more austerity, are a panacea; more often, the underlying problems relate to debt, structural rigidities, low investment, and weak competitiveness.
column2: 但指望简单的答案 — — 如更多财政刺激或更多紧缩 — — 成为万灵丹是不正确的；在更多时候，根本问题与债务、结构僵化、投资不足和竞争力疲软有关。

column1: The Exaggerated Death of Inflation
column2: 夸大其词的通胀之死

column1: CAMBRIDGE – Is the era of high inflation gone forever?
column2: 发自剑桥 — — 高通胀时代已经一去不复返了吗？

column1: In a world of slow growth, high debt, and tremendous distributional pressures, whether inflation is dead or merely dormant is an important question.
column2: 在一个增长缓慢，债务高企，分配压力巨大的世界，通货膨胀究竟是死了还是仅仅休眠是一个重要问题。

column1: Yes, massive institutional improvements concerning central banks have created formidable barriers to high inflation.
column2: 没错，大量有关中央银行的制度改革针对高通胀建立了巨大的屏障。

column1: But a significant part of a central bank’s credibility ultimately derives from the broader macroeconomic environment in which it operates.
column2: 但中央银行信誉的一个重要组成部分最终来自于其运作的宏观经济环境。

column1: In the first half of the 1990s, annual inflation averaged 40% in Africa, 230% in Latin America, and 360% in the transition economies of Eastern Europe.
column2: 上世纪90年代前半期，非洲国家年通胀率平均为40 % ， 拉丁美洲为230 % ， 东欧转型经济体为360 % 。

column1: And, in the early 1980s, advanced-economy inflation averaged nearly 10%.
column2: 而在80年代初，发达经济体的通胀率平均接近10 % 。

column1: Today, high inflation seems so remote that many analysts treat it as little more than a theoretical curiosity.
column2: 今天，高通货膨胀看起来那么遥远，许多分析人士只把它当成一个理论上的玩意儿。

column1: They are wrong to do so.
column2: 他们这么想是不对的。

column1: No matter how much central banks may wish to present the level of inflation as a mere technocratic decision, it is ultimately a social choice.
column2: 无论中央银行如何希望显示出通胀水平仅仅是一个技术性的决定，但它最终还是一个社会选择。
