column1: And some of the very pressures that helped to contain inflation for the past two decades have been retreating.
column2: 而某些在过去二十年中有助于遏制通货膨胀的压力已经消退。

column1: In the years preceding the financial crisis, increasing globalization and technological advances made it much easier for central banks to deliver both solid growth and low inflation.
column2: 在全球金融危机爆发前的几年，越来越多的全球化和技术进步使中央银行更易于实现硬增长和低通胀。

column1: This was not the case in the 1970s, when stagnating productivity and rising commodity prices turned central bankers into scapegoats, not heroes.
column2: 这跟上世纪70年代不一样，当时停滞不前的生产力和上涨的商品价格使得中央银行成为替罪羊而非大明星。

column1: True, back then, monetary authorities were working with old-fashioned Keynesian macroeconomic models, which encouraged the delusion that monetary policy could indefinitely boost the economy with low inflation and low interest rates.
column2: 毫无疑问，那时，货币机构用老派的凯恩斯主义宏观经济模型来工作，该模型鼓励产生这样一个错觉：货币政策可能会无限期在低通胀和低利率条件下刺激经济。

column1: Central bankers today are no longer so naive, and the public is better informed.
column2: 中央银行今天已不再那么天真，公众也了解得更多。

column1: But a country’s long-term inflation rate is still the outcome of political choices not technocratic decisions.
column2: 但是，一个国家的长期通胀率仍然是政治选择而非技术专家的决策结果。

column1: As the choices become more difficult, the risk to price stability grows.
column2: 当选择变得更加困难，价格稳定的风险也不断增加。

column1: A quick tour of emerging markets reveals that inflation is far from dead.
column2: 对新兴市场的快速浏览显示，通货膨胀远远没有��束。

column1: According to the International Monetary Fund’s April 2014 World Economic Outlook, inflation in 2013 reached 6.2% in Brazil, 6.4% in Indonesia, 6.6% in Vietnam, 6.8% in Russia, 7.5% in Turkey, 8.5% in Nigeria, 9.5% in India, 10.6% in Argentina, and a whopping 40.7% in Venezuela.
column2: 国际货币基金组织2014年4月的《世界经济展望》指出，2013年巴西的通货膨胀率达到6.2 % ， 印度尼西亚6.4 % ， 越南6.6 % ， 俄罗斯6.8 % ， 土耳其7.5 % ， 尼日利亚8.5 % ， 印度9.5 % ， 阿根廷10.6 % ， 委内瑞拉高达40.7 % 。

column1: These levels may be a big improvement from the early 1990s, but they certainly are not evidence of inflation’s demise.
column2: 这些水平比起上世纪90年代初可能是一大进步，但它们肯定不是通胀已死的证明。

column1: Yes, advanced economies are in a very different position today, but they are hardly immune.
column2: 是的，今天的发达经济体处于不同的位置，但它们也在劫难逃。

column1: Many of the same pundits who never imagined that advanced economies could have massive financial crises are now sure that advanced economies can never have inflation crises.
column2: 许多专家从未想过发达经济体会遭受大规模的金融危机，同样，专家现在也确信发达经济体可以没有通货膨胀危机。

column1: More fundamentally, where, exactly, does one draw the line between advanced economies and emerging markets?
column2: 更重要的是，在哪里，确切地说，有谁为发达经济体和新兴市场之间划出了界线？

column1: The eurozone, for example, is a blur.
column2: 例如，欧元区，是一个模糊的界限。

column1: Imagine that there was no euro and that the southern countries had retained their own currencies – Italy with the lira, Spain with the peseta, Greece with the drachma, and so on.
column2: 试想如果那些南欧国家从未加入欧元并保留了自己货币 — — 意大利的里拉，西班牙的比塞塔，希腊的德拉克马等等。

column1: Would these countries today have an inflation profile more like the United States and Germany or more like Brazil and Turkey?
column2: 这些国家现在的通货膨胀形势究竟会更像美国和德国，还是更像巴西和土耳其？

column1: Most likely, they would be somewhere in between.
column2: 最有可能的是，它们会在两者之间。

column1: The European periphery would have benefited from the same institutional advances in central banking as everyone else; but there is no particular reason to suppose that its political structures would have evolved in a radically different way.
column2: 欧洲外围国家将和其他人一样受益于中央银行制度的进步；但是没有特别的理由认为其政治结构会往一个完全不同的方向发展。

column1: The public in the southern countries embraced the euro precisely because the northern countries’ commitment to price stability gave them a currency with enormous anti-inflation credibility.
column2: 南部国家的公众接受欧元正是因为北部国家对物价稳定的承诺给予了他们一个有着强大反通胀信誉的货币。

column1: As it turned out, the euro was not quite the free lunch that it seemed to be.
column2: 事实证明，欧元并不是像它看起来那样是免费的午餐。

column1: The gain in inflation credibility was offset by weak debt credibility.
column2: 在通货膨胀方面的信誉增益被不良的债务信誉所抵消。

column1: If the European periphery countries had their own currencies, it is likely that debt problems would morph right back into elevated inflation.
column2: 如果欧洲外围国家有自己的货币，那么债务问题将很有可能会引发通胀上涨。

column1: I am not arguing that inflation will return anytime soon in safe-haven economies such as the US or Japan.
column2: 我不认为通胀将很快回归经济安全港如美国和日本。

column1: Though US labor markets are tightening, and the new Fed chair has emphatically emphasized the importance of maximum employment, there is still little risk of high inflation in the near future.
column2: 尽管美国的劳动力市场正在收紧，以及新任美联储主席着重强调就业最大化的重要性，但在不久的将来，高通货膨胀的风险依然很小。

column1: Still, over the longer run, there is no guarantee that any central bank will be able to hold the line in the face of adverse shocks such as continuing slow productivity growth, high debt levels, and pressure to reduce inequality through government transfers.
column2: 然而从长远来看，没有人能保证任何中央银行将能够在面对不利冲击时保持通胀水平，例如持续的生产力增长放缓，高负债水平，以及通过政府转移支付减少不平等的压力。

column1: The risk would be particularly high in the event of other major shocks – say, a general rise in global real interest rates.
column2: 风险会在遭受其他重大冲击时变得特别高 — — 例如说，全球实际利率的上升。

column1: Recognizing that inflation is only dormant renders foolish the oft-stated claim that any country with a flexible exchange rate has nothing to fear from high debt, as long as debt is issued in its own currency.
column2: 认识到通胀率仅仅是休眠了，我们将看到“任何国家只要拥有灵活的汇率制度，以本国货币发行债务，就不必担心高负债”的通常想法是愚蠢的。

column1: Imagine again that Italy had its own currency instead of the euro.
column2: 再次想象一下，如果意大利有自己的货币而不是欧元。

column1: Certainly, the country would have much less to fear from an overnight run on debt.
column2: 当然，这个国家不用太担心一夜之间产生的债务。

column1: Nevertheless, given the huge governance problems that Italy still faces, there is every chance that its inflation rate would look more like Brazil’s or Turkey’s, with any debt problems spilling over faster price growth.
column2: 然而，由于巨大的治理问题，意大利仍然很有可能因为债务问题溢出快于价格增长而面临像巴西或土耳其那样的通胀率。

column1: Modern central banking has worked wonders to bring down inflation.
column2: 现代中央银行已经在降低通胀上创造了奇迹。

column1: Ultimately, however, a central bank’s anti-inflation policies can work only within the context of a macroeconomic and political framework that is consistent with price stability.
column2: 然而最终，央行的反通胀政策只能在符合价格稳定的背景下，在宏观经济和政治框架内运作。

column1: Inflation may be dormant, but it is certainly not dead.
column2: 通货膨胀可能处于休眠状态，但它肯定并未消亡。

column1: The 4% Non-Solution
column2: 4%不是灵药

column1: PARIS – For some time now, there has been concern that central bankers have “run out of bullets.”
column2: 巴黎—一段时间以来，有一种声音认为央行行长们已经“黔驴技穷 ” 。

column1: Having lowered their policy rates to near zero, they have engaged in increasingly extravagant measures such as “quantitative easing” and “forward guidance.”
column2: 他们已将政策利率降至近零水平，越来越多地采取了“量化宽松”和“前瞻性指引”等“大招 ” 。

column1: Given the fog cast over real economic activity by the financial crisis, it is difficult to offer a definitive assessment of just how well or badly those measures have worked.
column2: 考虑到金融危机让实体经济活动状况不甚明了，很难确定地评估这些措施效果的好坏。

column1: But it is clear that there must be a better way to do things.
column2: 但显然这些措施不是最好的办法。

column1: There is no longer any reason to let the zero bound on nominal interest rates continue to hamper monetary policy.
column2: 让名义利率为零的下限羁绊货币政策早已毫无道理。

column1: A simple and elegant solution is to phase in a switchover to a fully electronic currency, where paying interest, positive or negative, requires only the push of a button.
column2: 一个简单又优美的解决方案是逐步向完全电子化的货币靠拢，使用电子货币后，支付利息（正或负）只要按个按钮就行了。

column1: And with paper money – particularly large-denomination notes – arguably doing more harm than good, currency modernization is long overdue.
column2: 而若使用纸币 — — 特别是大面额钞票 — — 实际上弊大于利，货币现代化可谓姗姗来迟。

column1: Using an electronic currency, central banks could continue to stabilize inflation exactly as they do now.
column2: 使用电子货币，央行能够如同现在所做的那样稳定通胀。

column1: (Citigroup’s chief economist, Willem Buiter, has suggested numerous ways to address the constraint of paper currency, but eliminating it is the easiest.)
column2: （花旗集团首席经济学家威廉·布伊特（Willem Buiter）给出了多种解决纸币造成的不便的方法，但取消纸币是最简单的。 ）

column1: A second, less elegant idea is to have central banks simply raise their target inflation rates from today’s norm of 2% to a higher but still moderate level of 4%.
column2: 其次，还有一种不那么优美的办法，即让央行将目标通胀率从今天的标准水平2%提高到仍属温和水平的4 % 。

column1: The idea of permanently raising inflation targets to 4% was first proposed in an interesting and insightful paper led by IMF chief economist Olivier Blanchard, and has been endorsed by a number of other academics, including, most recently, Paul Krugman.
column2: 将通胀目标永久提高到4%的方案首先由IMF首席经济学家奥利佛·布兰查德（Olivier Blanchard）在一篇有趣又深邃的论文中提出，并获得了其他许多学者的支持，包括最近的保罗·克鲁格曼（Paul Krugman ） 。

column1: Unfortunately, the problem of making a smooth and convincing transition to the new target is perhaps insurmountable.
column2: 不幸的是，实现平稳而有说服力地向新目标转变可能是无法实现的任务。

column1: When Blanchard first proposed his idea, I was intrigued but skeptical.
column2: 布兰查德第一次提出他的方案是，我感到非���新鲜，但也有所怀疑。

column1: Mind you, two years previously, at the outset of the financial crisis, I suggested raising inflation to 4% or more for a period of a few years to deflate the debt overhang and accelerate wage adjustment.
column2: 请注意，两年前金融危机爆发时，我建议在几年的时间里将通胀提高到4%以实现债务积压的再通胀并加速工资调整。

column1: But there is a world of difference between temporarily raising inflation to address a crisis and unhinging long-term expectations.
column2: 但暂时提高通胀解决危机和改变长期预期是完全不同的两码事。

column1: After two decades of telling the public that 2% inflation is Nirvana, central bankers would baffle people were they to announce that they had changed their minds – and not in some minor way, but completely.
column2: 二十年来，央行行长们一直告诉公众，2%的通胀是最佳状态，因此人们会产生困惑，难道他们在宣布他们改变主意了吗？ 并且主意还不是略有改变，而是全盘改变。

column1: Just recall the market’s “taper tantrums” in May 2013, when then-Fed Chairman Ben Bernanke suggested a far more modest turn in monetary policy.
column2: 想想2013年5月，时任美联储主席伯南克表示货币政策将回到更温和的节奏，结果引起了市场的“收回之怒 ” （ taper tantrums ） 。

column1: People might well ask why, if central bankers can change their long-term target from 2% to 4%, they could not later decide that it should be 5% or 6%?
column2: 人们会问，既然央行行长把长期目标从2%提高到4 % ， 那么难保他们又说应该提高到5%或6 % 。

column1: Given the likelihood of a confused, mistrustful public, it is hard to find any deep rationale for a 4% target.
column2: 考虑到可能引起公众的迷惑和不信任，因此4%的通胀目标没有任何令人信服的理由。

column1: At least the existing 2% inflation target stands for something, because central bankers can portray it as the moral equivalent of zero.
column2: 至少2%的通胀目标还有点道理可言，因为央行行长可以说它已经相当接近于零。

column1: (Most experts believe that a true welfare-based price index would show significantly lower inflation than government inflation statistics indicate, because official data fail to capture the benefits of the constant flow of new goods into the economy.)
column2: （大部分专家认为，真正的基于福利的价格指数所表现的通胀将大大低于政府通胀数据，因为官方数据不能体现新产品源源不断进入经济带来的好处。 ）

column1: There is an analogy to the problems countries faced when they tried to re-establish the gold standard after World War I. Until the war, money was backed by gold and could be redeemed at a fixed rate.
column2: 这和各国在一战后试图重建金本位时面临的问题有些相似。 开战前，货币由黄金作支撑，并且兑换率可视为固定。

column1: Though the system was highly vulnerable to bank runs and there was little scope for a monetary stabilization policy, people’s confidence in the system enabled it to anchor expectations.
column2: 尽管这一体系导致银行挤兑频发、货币稳定政策空间狭小，但人们对这一体系的信心使其能够锚定预期。

column1: Unfortunately, the system completely collapsed after the war broke out in August 1914.
column2: 不幸的是，这一体系在1914年8月大战爆发后全盘崩溃了。

column1: Revenue-desperate combatants were forced to turn to inflation finance.
column2: 急需收入的参战国被迫转向通胀金融。

column1: They could not simultaneously debase the currency and back it with gold at a fixed rate.
column2: 它们无法同时实现货币贬值又维持其与黄金的固定兑换率。

column1: After the war, as things settled down, governments tried to return to gold, partly as a symbol of a return to normalcy.
column2: 战后，随着秩序的恢复，政府试图回归黄金，部分也是因为要摆出回归常态的姿态。

column1: But the revived inter-war gold standard ultimately fell apart, in no small part because it was impossible to rebuild public trust.
column2: 但两次大战间的金本位复辟最终还是崩溃了，很大程度上是因为无法重新建立公共信任。

column1: A move by central banks to a long-term 4% inflation target risks triggering the same dynamic.
column2: 央行将长期通胀目标变为4%有可能导致同样的过程。

column1: Fortunately, there is a much better way.
column2: 幸运的是，我们有比这好得多的办法。

column1: Moving to an electronic government currency would not require a destabilizing change in the inflation target.
column2: 转向电子政府货币不需要通胀目标的破坏性变化。

column1: Minor technical issues could easily be ironed out.
column2: 次要的技术问题也可以轻松解决。

column1: For example, ordinary citizens could be allowed zero-interest-transactions balances (up to a limit).
column2: 比如，普通公民将被允许（一定程度的）零利息交易余额。

column1: Presumably, nominal interest rates would move into negative territory only in response to a deep deflationary crisis.
column2: 理论上，名义利率只有在发生深度通缩危机时才会跌入负区间。

column1: But when such a crisis does occur, central banks could power out of it far more quickly than is possible today.
column2: 但当这样的危机真的发生时，央行可以以比现在可行的快得多的速度采取强力手段解决危机。

column1: And, as I have argued elsewhere, governments have long been penny-wise and pound-foolish to provide large-denomination notes, given that a large share are used in the underground economy and to finance illegal activities.
column2: 正如我在别处所指出的，长期以来，政府都在提供大面额钞票，这是拣了芝麻丢了西瓜，因为大面额钞票的大部分都用在了地下经济和非法活动上。

column1: Moving to a twenty-first-century currency system would make it far simpler to move to a twenty-first-century central-banking regime as well.
column2: 转向二十一世纪货币体系可以让二十一世纪央行制度也变得更加可行。

column1: Malthus, Marx, and Modern Growth
column2: 马尔萨斯、马克思和现代增长

column1: CAMBRIDGE – The promise that each generation will be better off than the last is a fundamental tenet of modern society.
column2: 美国剑桥—每一代人都能过得比上一代人更好，这是现代社会的一个基本信条。

column1: By and large, most advanced economies have fulfilled this promise, with living standards rising over recent generations, despite setbacks from wars and financial crises.
column2: 总的来说，大部分发达经济体都兑现了这一承诺，最近几代人的社会标准一直在提高，尽管战争和金融危机也会带来一些倒退。

column1: In the developing world, too, the vast majority of people have started to experience sustained improvement in living standards and are rapidly developing similar growth expectations.
column2: 发展中国家亦然，大部分人民已开始享受持续的生活水平改善，类似的增长预期也在快速形成。

column1: But will future generations, particularly in advanced economies, realize such expectations?
column2: 但子孙后代，特别是发达国家的子孙后代，能够实现这一预期吗？

column1: Though the likely answer is yes, the downside risks seem higher than they did a few decades ago.
column2: 尽管可能的答案是肯定的，但下行风险比几十年前已经有所增加。

column1: So far, every prediction in the modern era that mankind’s lot will worsen, from Thomas Malthus to Karl Marx, has turned out to be spectacularly wrong.
column2: 到目前为止，从马尔萨斯到马克思，凡是预测现代人的丰裕程度会下降的，最后都被证明错得离谱。

column1: Technological progress has trumped obstacles to economic growth.
column2: 技术进步战胜了经济增长的障碍。

column1: Periodic political rebalancing, sometimes peaceful, sometimes not, has ensured that the vast majority of people have benefited, albeit some far more than others.
column2: 周期性的权力再平衡 — — 有时是和平的，有时是不和平的 — — 确保了大部分人受益，尽管有些人的受益程度远高于其他人。

column1: As a result, Malthus’s concerns about mass starvation have failed to materialize in any peaceful capitalist economy.
column2: 因此，马尔萨斯关于大面积饥荒的担忧在任何和平资本主义经济中都没有发生。

column1: And, despite a disconcerting fall in labor’s share of income in recent decades, the long-run picture still defies Marx’s prediction that capitalism would prove immiserating for workers.
column2: 而尽管最近几十年中劳动力占��入的份额的下降令人担忧，但长期趋势仍否定了马克思关于资本主义将让工人万劫不复的预言。

column1: Living standards around the world continue to rise.
column2: 全世界的生活水平都在持续上升。

column1: But past growth performance is no guarantee that a broadly similar trajectory can be maintained throughout this century.
column2: 但过去的增长表现并不能保证本世纪都能够保持类似的大趋势。

column1: Leaving aside potential geopolitical disruptions, there are some formidable challenges to overcome, mostly stemming from political underperformance and dysfunction.
column2: 抛开潜在地缘政治干扰不谈，仍有一些可怕的挑战有待克服，大部分都来自政治表现不力和功能失调。

column1: The first set of issues includes slow-burn problems involving externalities, the leading example being environmental degradation.
column2: 第一类问题包括一些缓慢发酵的问题，如外部性，最显著的例子便是环境破坏。

column1: When property rights are ill-defined, as in the case of air and water, government must step in to provide appropriate regulation.
column2: 在产权不够明晰时 — — 比如空气和水的产权 — — 政府必须站出来提供恰当的监管。

column1: I do not envy future generations for having to address the possible ramifications of global warming and fresh-water depletion.
column2: 子孙后代或许不得不面对全球变暖和清洁水耗竭的难题。

column1: A second set of problems concerns the need to ensure that the economic system is perceived as fundamentally fair, which is the key to its political sustainability.
column2: 第二类问题事关确保经济制度能给人民带来公平感，这是政治可持续性的关键。

column1: This perception can no longer be taken for granted, as the interaction of technology and globalization has exacerbated income and wealth inequality within countries, even as cross-country gaps have narrowed.
column2: 公平感已不再是理所当然之事，技术和全球化扩大了国家内部的财富不平等，尽管国家间差距已有所缩小。

column1: Until now, our societies have proved remarkably adept at adjusting to disruptive technologies; but the pace of change in recent decades has caused tremendous strains, reflected in huge income disparities within countries, with near-record gaps between the wealthiest and the rest.
column2: 到目前为止，我们的社会表现出极强的适应破坏性技术的能力，但近几十年来，变化之迅速带来巨大的紧张局面，体现在国家内部的巨大收入差距上，最富有人群和其他人的差距接近历史记录。

column1: Inequality can corrupt and paralyze a country’s political system – and economic growth along with it.
column2: 不平等性可能侵蚀甚至崩坏一国的政治制度，经济增长也将随之东流。

column1: The third problem is that of aging populations, an issue that would pose tough challenges even for the best-designed political system.
column2: 第三个问题是人口老化，即使是设计最合理的政治制度也将面临这一问题的严峻挑战。

column1: How will resources be allocated to care for the elderly, especially in slow-growing economies where existing public pension schemes and old-age health plans are patently unsustainable?
column2: 如何配置资源以照顾老年人，特别是在现有公共养老金制度和老人医疗计划难以为继的低增长经济体？

column1: Soaring public debts surely exacerbate the problem, because future generations are being asked both to service our debt and to pay for our retirements.
column2: 公共债务水平的暴增显然加剧了这一问题，因为子孙后代将不得不在为我们偿债的同时供养我们的退休生活。

column1: The final challenge concerns a wide array of issues that require regulation of rapidly evolving technologies by governments that do not necessarily have the competence or resources to do so effectively.
column2: 最后一个挑战关系到一系列问题，这些问题需要政府对快速演进的技术进行监管，而政府并不一定具有进行有效监管的能力和资源。

column1: We have already seen where poor regulation of rapidly evolving financial markets can lead.
column2: 我们已经看到，对快速演进的金融市场的拙劣监管导致了怎样的问题。

column1: There are parallel shortcomings in many other markets.
column2: 在许多其他市场上也存在相同的不足。

column1: A leading example is food supply – an area where technology has continually produced ever-more highly processed and genetically refined food that scientists are only beginning to assess.
column2: 一个显著的例子是食品供给。 在这一领域，科技在持续生产着日益复杂的转基因食品，而科学家对这些食品的评估才刚刚开始。

column1: What is known so far is that childhood obesity has become an epidemic in many countries, with an alarming rise in rates of type 2 diabetes and coronary disease implying a significant negative impact on life expectancy in future generations.
column2: 如今，我们知道儿童肥胖已是很多国家的一个普遍问题，2型糖尿病和冠心病的高发也是一个令人警惕的信号，会对子孙后代的预期寿命带来巨大的消极影响。

column1: Many leading health researchers, including Kelly Brownell, David Ludwig, and Walter Willett, have documented these problems.
column2: 许多尖端健康研究者，包括布朗尼尔（Kelly Brownell ） 、 路德维格（David Ludwig ） 、 维莱特（Walter Willett ） ， 都提出了这一问题。

column1: Government interventions to date, mainly in the form of enhanced education, have proved largely ineffective.
column2: 目前政府干预往往以强化教育的形式出现，但收效甚微。

column1: Self-destructive addiction to processed foods, which economists would describe as an “internality,” can lower quality of life for those afflicted, and can eventually lead to externalities for society, such as higher health-care costs.
column2: 自我毁灭的加工食品瘾 — — 经济学家称之为“内部性 ” — —会降低成瘾者的生活质量，并最终带来对社会的外部性，如更高的医疗成本。

column1: Again, despite a rising chorus of concern from researchers, political markets have seemed frozen.
column2: 在这方面，尽管越来越多的研究者呼吁要引起关注，但政治市场仍是坚冰一块。

column1: All of these problems have solutions, at least in the short to medium run.
column2: 所有这些问题都有解决办法，至少在短期和中期是如此。

column1: A global carbon tax would mitigate climate risks while alleviating government debt burdens.
column2: 全球碳税能降低气候风险，同时减轻政府债务负担。

column1: Addressing inequality requires greater redistribution through national tax systems, together with enhanced programs for adult education, presumably making heavy use of new technologies.
column2: 纠正不平等性需要通过国家税收体系进行更深程度的再分配，并辅之以充分利用高科技手段的强化成人教育。

column1: The negative effects of falling population growth can be mitigated by easing restrictions on international migration, and by encouraging more women and retirees to enter or stay in the workforce.
column2: 人口增长下降的消极效应可以通过降低国际移民壁垒和鼓励更多女性和退休者进入或留在工作大军内来抑制。

column1: But how long it will take for governments to act is a wide-open question.
column2: 但政府需要多长时间才能有所行动远未可知。

column1: Capitalist economies have been spectacularly efficient at enabling growing consumption of private goods, at least over the long run.
column2: 资本主义经济在促进私人商品消费增长方面效率极高，至少在长期是如此。

column1: When it comes to public goods – such as education, the environment, health care, and equal opportunity – the record is not quite as impressive, and the political obstacles to improvement have seemed to grow as capitalist economies have matured.
column2: 而对于公共商品 — — 如教育、环境、医疗和机会平等 — — 资本主义经济的记录便不那么令人瞩目了，而随着资本主义经济走向成熟，改善的政治障碍似乎也在提高。

column1: Will each future generation continue to enjoy a better quality of life than its immediate predecessor?
column2: 每一代人还能继续比上一代人享受更高的生活质量吗？

column1: In developing countries that have not yet reached the technological frontier, the answer is almost certainly yes.
column2: 在尚未抵达技术前沿的发展中国家，答案几乎必然是肯定的。

column1: In advanced economies, though the answer should still be yes, the challenges are becoming formidable.
column2: 而在发达经济体，尽管答案应该仍然是肯定的，但挑战已经十分艰巨。

column1: Europe’s Debt Wish
column2: 欧洲的债务愿望

column1: CAMBRIDGE – Eurozone leaders continue to debate how best to reinvigorate economic growth, with French and Italian leaders now arguing that the eurozone’s rigid “fiscal compact” should be loosened.
column2: 美国剑桥—欧洲领导人仍在争论如何最好地为经济增长注入动力，法国和意大利领导人现在认为，欧元区死板的“财政契约”应该放松。

column1: Meanwhile, the leaders of the eurozone’s northern member countries continue to push for more serious implementation of structural reform.
column2: 与此同时，欧元区北欧成员国领导人继续要求更严格地实施结构性改革。

column1: Ideally, both sides will get their way, but it is difficult to see an endgame that does not involve significant debt restructuring or rescheduling.
column2: 在理想状况下，双方可以自行其是，但目前难以看到可以免于重大债务重组或期限重排的结局。

column1: The inability of Europe’s politicians to contemplate this scenario is placing a huge burden on the European Central Bank.
column2: 欧洲政客不能想象这一情形，这给欧洲央行造成了非常沉重的负担。

column1: Although there are many explanations for the eurozone’s lagging recovery, it is clear that the overhang of both public and private debt looms large.
column2: 尽管关于欧元区的复苏迟缓存在许多解释，但显然公共和私人债务积压是很重要的原因。

column1: The gross debts of households and financial institutions are higher today as a share of national income than they were before the financial crisis.
column2: 如今，家庭和金融机构总债务占国民收入的比重比金融危机前还要高。

column1: Nonfinancial corporate debt has fallen only slightly.
column2: 非金融企业债略有下降。

column1: And government debt, of course, has risen sharply, owing to bank bailouts and a sharp, recession-fueled decline in tax revenues.
column2: 而政府债务当然出现了剧增，这是拜银行援助和衰退导致税收收入猛降所赐。

column1: Yes, Europe is also wrestling with an aging population.
column2: 是的，欧洲还在与人口老龄化角力。

column1: Southern eurozone countries such as Italy and Spain have suffered from rising competition with China in textiles and light manufacturing industries.
column2: 欧元区南部成员国（如意大利和西班牙）日益受到中国纺织和轻型制造业的竞争。

column1: But just as the pre-crisis credit boom masked underlying structural problems, post-crisis credit constraints have greatly amplified the downturn.
column2: 但正如危机前信用繁荣掩盖了根本的结构性问题，危机后信用约束也大大加剧了衰退之势。

column1: True, German growth owes much to the country’s willingness a decade ago to engage in painful economic reforms, especially of labor-market rules.
column2: 诚然，德国增长在很大程度上要归因于该国在十年前愿意采取痛苦的经济改革，特别是劳动力市场规则。

column1: Today, Germany appears to have full employment and above-trend growth.
column2: 如今，德国正处于充分就业状态，增长也高于趋势水平。

column1: German leaders believe, with some justification, that if France and Italy were to adopt similar reforms, the changes would work wonders for their economies’ long-term growth.
column2: 德国领导人相信 — — 有一定根据 — — 如果法国和意大利也采取类似的改革，它们的经济长期增长前景将迎来巨大的改观。

column1: Yet what of Portugal, Ireland, and (especially) Spain, all of which have taken significant steps toward reform since the crisis?
column2: 但葡萄牙、爱尔兰和（特别是）西班牙呢？

column1: All are still experiencing double-digit unemployment rates amid moribund growth, and, as the last International Monetary Fund Fiscal Monitor made abundantly clear, all still suffer from significant debt problems.
column2: 自危机以来，它们已经采取了不少重大改革步骤，但它们都仍在经历两位数的失业率和停滞不前的增长，并且，正如上一期国际货币基金组织《财政观察 》 （ Fiscal Monitor）所揭示的，它们都仍在为严重的债务问题焦头烂额。

column1: Debt overhang traps countries in a vicious circle.
column2: 债务积压让国家陷入恶性循环。

column1: Exceptionally high public and private debts constrain a country’s options and are indisputably associated with slower growth, which in turn makes it difficult to escape a debt trap.
column2: 过高的公共和私人债务约束了一国的选择，并且毫无例外地伴随着更低的增长，而更低的增长反过来又让国家难以摆脱债务陷阱。

column1: Last spring’s campaign against anyone who dared to worry about the long-run effects of high debt largely ignored the substantial academic literature, just as a remarkably similar recent challenge to Thomas Piketty’s research on inequality took no account of a larger body of evidence.
column2: 去年春天针对所有敢于担忧高债务的长期影响者的批评大多对大量学术研究成果视而不见，与此形成惊人相似的是，眼下对托马斯·皮克提（Thomas Piketty）关于不平等性的研究的诘难也根本不顾大量证据。

column1: It is true that not all debt is created equal, and there is a strong case for adding more of it if the purpose is to finance highly productive infrastructure investments.
column2: 诚然，并非所有债务都是以相同方式创造出来的，有强烈的理由认为，如果目的是为高生产率的基础设施投资，就应该增加债务。

column1: Europe greatly lags many Asian countries in its efforts to expand the reach of broadband.
column2: 欧洲在拓展道路网络方面的措施远远落后于许多亚洲国家。

column1: Outside the Nordic countries, electricity networks are thoroughly Balkanized, and major efforts are needed to integrate them.
column2: 除了北欧国家，电网几乎都是地方化的，要实现整合必须投入巨资。

column1: Raising debt for the purposes of significantly increasing or ensuring long-run growth makes sense, especially in an environment of low real interest rates.
column2: 为了大幅提高或确保长期增长而正价债务是值得的，特别是在实际利率低下的环境中。

column1: A similar argument can be made for expenditures aimed at improving education, for example to improve Europe’s underfunded universities.
column2: 类似的观点也适用于旨在改善教育（如资金短缺的欧洲的大学）的支出。

column1: Beyond growth-enhancing investment, however, the case for greater stimulus becomes more nuanced.
column2: 但是，除了强化增长的投资，加强刺激的理由便不再强烈了。

column1: Brad Delong and Larry Summers have argued that in a repressed economy, short-term increases in borrowing can pay for themselves, even if the expenditures do not directly increase long-run potential. By contrast, Alberto Alesina and Silvia Ardagna argue that in an economy with a large and inefficient government, debt-stabilization measures directed at reducing the size of government can actually be expansionary.
column2: 布拉德·德隆（Brad Delong ）和拉里·萨默斯（Larry Summers）指出，在存在庞大而低效的政府的经济中，以收缩政府规模为目标的稳定债务措施实际上可能产生扩张的效果。

column1: I admit to being an outsider to this debate.
column2: 我得承认，我并没有加入过这场争论。

column1: (The word “austerity” does not appear once in my 2009 book with Carmen Reinhart on the history of financial crises.)
column2: （ “ 紧缩”一词在我和莱因哈特（Carmen Reinhart）2009年关于金融危机史的著作中一次也没有出现过。

column1: My general sense, however, is that both views are extreme.
column2: ）但是，我的总体感觉是，两种观点都有走极端的嫌疑。

column1: In general, neither pure austerity nor crude Keynesian stimulus can help countries escape high-debt traps.
column2: 整体而言，不管是单纯的紧缩，还是原始的凯恩斯主义刺激，都不能帮助一国摆脱高债务陷阱。

column1: Throughout history, other measures, including debt rescheduling, inflation, and various forms of wealth taxation (such as financial repression), have typically played a significant role.
column2: 纵观历史，其他措施，包括债务期限重排、通胀和各种形式的财富税（如金融抑制 ） ， 通常都会起到显著作用。

column1: It is hard to see how European countries can indefinitely avoid recourse to the full debt toolkit, especially to repair the fragile economies of the eurozone’s periphery.
column2: 很难想象欧洲国家能够永远避免债务工具全开，特别是在修复欧元区外围脆弱的经济时。

column1: The ECB’s expansive “whatever it takes” guarantee may indeed be enough to help finance greater short-term stimulus than is currently being allowed; but the ECB’s guarantee will not solve long-run sustainability problems.
column2: 欧洲央行扩张性的“竭尽全力”担保确实可能足以为比目前所允许的更大规模短期刺激提供资金；但欧洲央行的担保无法解决长期可持续性问题。

column1: Indeed, the ECB will soon have to confront the fact that structural reforms and fiscal austerity fall far short of being a complete solution to Europe’s debt problems.
column2: 事实上，欧洲央行很快就必须面对一个事实：结构性改革和财政紧缩远不足以成为解决欧洲债务问题的完整方案。

column1: In October and November, the ECB will announce the results of its bank stress tests.
column2: 在10月和11月，欧洲央行将宣布其银行压力测试结果。

column1: Because many banks hold a large volume of eurozone government debt, the results will depend very much on how the ECB assesses sovereign risk.
column2: 由于许多银行持有大量欧元区政府债务，其结果将在很大程度上取决于欧洲央行如何评估主权风险。

column1: If the ECB grossly understates the risks, its credibility as a regulator will be badly tarnished.
column2: 如果欧洲央行只能大致上理解这些风险，其作为监管者的信誉将受到严重打击。

column1: If it is more forthright about the risks, there is a chance that some periphery countries might have difficulty plugging the holes, and will require help from the north.
column2: 如果它能更深入地理解这些风险，那么一些外围国家有可能已难以自保，需要北欧的帮助。

column1: One hopes that the ECB will be forthright.
column2: 我们希望欧洲央行的认识深刻一些。

column1: It is high time for a conversation on debt relief for the entire eurozone periphery.
column2: 为整个欧元区外围展开债务纾困谈判刻不容缓。

column1: How Fragile are Emerging Markets?
column2: 新兴市场有多脆弱？

column1: CAMBRIDGE – Emerging-market equities and exchange rates are again under severe downward pressure, but are the underlying economies really as fragile as global traders seem to fear?
column2: 美国剑桥—新兴市场股票和汇率再议处于严重的压力之下，但基础经济真的如全球交易者担忧的那样脆弱吗？

column1: The short answer, for a few, is probably “yes,” but for most, “not just yet.”
column2: 简单的回答，对一部分人可能是“是 ” ， 但对大部分人是“尚未 ” 。

column1: For most countries, what we are seeing is a recalibration as investors incorporate the risk that China’s GDP might rise more slowly, the US Federal Reserve might start tightening monetary conditions more quickly, and policy backsliding in many countries might undermine potential growth.
column2: 对大部分国家，我们看到的是重估 — — 投资者开始考虑中国GDP增长可能进一步放缓、美联储可能开始更快地收紧货币政策、许多国家的政策倒退可能威胁潜在增长。

column1: At the same time, Europe’s massive shift to a trade surplus (a key factor underpinning the region’s new-found stability) and the Japanese yen’s sharp depreciation are among myriad factors squeezing countries seeking to rein in current-account deficits.
column2: 与此同时，欧洲大规模转向贸易盈余（该地区新近出现的稳定之势的关键原因）和日元的大幅贬值以及其他众多原因让寻求解决经常项目赤字问题的国家十分被动。

column1: It seems like only yesterday that Goldman Sachs analysts were celebrating the growth miracle of the “BRICS” (Brazil, Russia, India, China, and South Africa) and the International Monetary Fund, in its April 2013 World Economic Outlook, was forecasting a three-speed global recovery led by emerging markets.
column2: 高盛分析师大唱“金砖国家 ” （ 巴西、俄罗斯、印度、中国和南非）增长奇迹的赞歌和国际货币基金组织（IMF）在其《2013年世界经济展望》预测新兴市场将领导三速全球复苏彷佛就在昨天。

column1: What happened?
column2: 发生了什么事？

column1: The most popular culprit is the Fed, which has begun to taper its highly experimental policy of “quantitative easing,” or purchases of long-term assets aimed at supporting growth beyond what could be achieved with zero nominal interest rates.
column2: 最受千夫所指的是美联储，它开始收紧其具有高度实验性的“量化宽松”政策，即购买长期资产以支持零��义利率条件下的进一步增长。

column1: But the Fed’s role is almost certainly overblown.
column2: 但美联储的作用几乎可以肯定被高估了。

column1: For one thing, the Fed’s retreat partly reflects growing confidence in the US economy, which should mean a stronger export market for most emerging economies.
column2: 一方面，美联储的退出政策部分反映了美国经济信心的增加，而这应该给大部分新兴经济体带来更强劲的出口。

column1: Moreover, the Fed’s modest tightening is being matched by a trend toward looser monetary policy in the eurozone and Japan; so, overall, advanced-country monetary policy remains highly accommodative.
column2: 此外，在美联储采取温和的紧缩的同时，欧元区和日本的货币政策呈现宽松之势；因此，总体而言发达国家货币政策仍是相当有利的。

column1: Uncertainty over China’s growth path is more fundamental.
column2: 对中国增长路径的担忧更加根本。

column1: For more than a decade, China’s stunning growth has fueled a remarkable price boom that has flattered policymakers in commodity-exporting emerging markets from Russia to Argentina.
column2: 十多年来，中国卓越的增长助长了令人瞩目的价格繁荣，这让从俄罗斯到阿根廷的各个商品出口新兴经济体的决策者踌躇满志。

column1: Remember how the Argentines were able to thumb their noses at the pro-market “Washington Consensus” in favor of an interventionist “Buenos Aires consensus”?
column2: 还记得阿根廷是如何对支持市场的“华盛顿共识”嗤之以鼻、并支持干预主义的“布宜诺斯艾利斯共识”的吗？

column1: Now, not so much.
column2: 现在，一切都变了。

column1: China’s near-term growth is an open question, as its new leadership attempts to curb the unsustainable credit-fueled boom.
column2: 中国短期增长结果前景不明，因为其新领导层试图抑制不可持续的信用推动的繁荣。

column1: Until recently, global markets had not seemed to recognize that a growth recession was even a possibility.
column2: 直到最近，全球市场都并不认为会发生增长衰退。

column1: Certainly, if there ever is a pause in China’s heady growth, today’s emerging-market turmoil will seem like a mere hiccup compared to the earthquake that will ensue.
column2: 显然，如果中国强劲的增长迎来一次暂停，将会造成新兴市场的地震，与之相比，今天新兴市场的波动只不过是打了个嗝。

column1: There are other notable, if less consequential, fundamentals in the mix.
column2: 还有其他重要（如果因果关系较弱的话）的基本因素。

column1: The shale-gas revolution in the US is changing the global energy equation.
column2: 美国的页岩气革命正在改变全球能源格局。

column1: Energy exporters such as Russia are feeling the downward pressure on export prices.
column2: 俄罗斯等能源出口国正在感到出口价格下降的压力。

column1: At the same time, hyper-low-cost energy in the US is affecting Asian manufacturers’ competitiveness, at least for some products.
column2: 与此同时，美国超低的能源成本正在影响亚洲制造业的竞争力，至少对某些产品是如此。

column1: And, as Mexico reforms its energy sector, the range of pressures on Asian manufacturing will expand; Mexico is already benefitting from cost pressures in China.
column2: 此外，墨西哥开始了其能源部门改革，亚洲制造业的压力还会扩大；墨西哥已经从中国的成本压力中获得了好处。

column1: Japan’s Abenomics is also important for some countries, as the sharp depreciation in the value of the yen puts pressure on Korea in particular and on Japan’s Asian competitors in general.
column2: 日本的安倍经济学对一些国家来说也很重要，因为日元的急剧贬值给日本的亚洲竞争对手造成了压力，特别是韩国。

column1: In the long run, a Japanese resurgence would, of course, be beneficial to the region’s economies.
column2: 当然，在长期，日本的重新崛起是有益于地区经济的。

column1: Stability in the eurozone has been perhaps the single most important positive factor underpinning market confidence in the last year.
column2: 欧元区的稳定也许是去年支撑市场信心的唯一最重要的积极因素。

column1: But, as periphery countries move into current-account balance and northern countries such as Germany run massive surpluses, the flip side has been deterioration in emerging-market surpluses, heightening their vulnerabilities.
column2: 但是，随着外围国转向经常项目平衡、德国等北欧国家存在大量盈余，新兴市场盈余将遭受冲击，增加它们的脆弱度。

column1: At the core of emerging-market problems, however, is policy and political backsliding.
column2: 但是，新兴经济体问题的核心是政策和政治倒退。

column1: Here, there are significant differences among countries.
column2: 在这方面，不同国家存在很大的不同。

column1: In Brazil, the government’s efforts to weaken the central bank’s independence and meddle in energy and lending markets have harmed growth.
column2: 在巴西，政府削弱央行独立性和干涉能源和借贷市场的举动已经对增长造成了伤害。

column1: Turkey is suffering acute challenges to its democratic institutions, as well as government pressure on the central bank.
column2: 土耳其因为民主制度以及政府对央行的压力而遭受了严峻挑战。

column1: Russia’s failure to develop strong independent institutions has made it difficult for an entrepreneurial class to emerge and help diversify the economy.
column2: 俄罗斯没有发展出强大的独立机构让它的创业家阶层难以崛起并促进经济的多样化。

column1: In India, central-bank independence remains reasonably strong, with the Reserve Bank of India now mulling a move to an inflation-targeting regime.
column2: 在印度，央行独立性仍非常坚挺，印度储备银行正在考虑通胀目标机制。

column1: But a sustained period of populist policies has weakened trend growth and exacerbated inflation.
column2: 但持续的民粹主义政策削弱了趋势增长率，也加剧了通胀。

column1: Nevertheless, some emerging markets are moving forward and stand to benefit from the turmoil if they are able to stay the course.
column2: 尽管如此，一些新兴市场仍在进步，如果保持势头将能够从动荡中获益。

column1: Aside from Mexico, countries such as Chile, Colombia, and Peru are well positioned to gain from investments in institution-building.
column2: 除了墨西哥，智利、哥伦比亚和秘鲁等国家也很有希望从制度建设投资中获得好处。

column1: But, of course, new institutions can take decades, and sometimes longer, to consolidate.
column2: 但是，毫无疑问，新制度需要几十年甚至更长时间才能得到巩固。

column1: So, overall, how fragile are emerging markets?
column2: 那么，总体而言新兴市场有多脆弱？

column1: Unlike in the 1990’s, when fixed exchange rates were widespread, most countries now have shock-absorbing flexible rates.
column2: 与通行固定利率的20世纪90年代不同，如今大部分国家都实施了能吸收冲击的弹性汇率。

column1: Indeed, today’s drama can be interpreted, in part, as a reflection of these shock absorbers at work.
column2: 事实上，今天的情景从一定程度上可以看成这些冲击吸收器在工作的反映。

column1: Emerging-market equities may have plummeted, but this, too, is a shock absorber.
column2: 新兴市场股票在下跌，但这也是冲击吸收器。

column1: The real question is what will happen when the turmoil moves to debt markets.
column2: 真正的问题是当动荡蔓延到债务市场时会发生什么。

column1: Many countries have built up substantial reserves, and are now issuing far more debt in domestic currency.
column2: 许多国家建立了庞大的储备，并且绝大部分债务用本币计价。

column1: Of course, the option of inflating away debt is hardly a panacea.
column2: 当然，用通胀来解决债务绝不是灵丹妙药。

column1: Unfortunately, there is surely more drama to come over the next few years.
column2: 不幸的是，未来几年必然还会发生很多戏剧性的场景。

column1: Why Wealth Taxes Are Not Enough
column2: 为什么光有财富税是不够的

column1: CAMBRIDGE – Should advanced countries implement wealth taxes as a means of stabilizing and reducing public debt over the medium term?
column2: 美国剑桥—发达国家应该实施财富税以作为中期稳定和减少公共债务的手段吗？

column1: The normally conservative International Monetary Fund has given the idea surprisingly emphatic support.
column2: 通常较为保守的国际货币基金组织（IMF）出人意料地非常支持这一看法。

column1: The IMF calculates that a one-time 10% wealth levy, if introduced quickly and unexpectedly, could return many European countries to pre-crisis public debt/GDP ratios.
column2: 据IMF计算，快速而出乎意料地一次性征收10%的财富税可以让许多欧洲国家的债务/GDP比率回到危机前水平。

column1: It is an intriguing idea.
column2: 这是一个颇有吸引力的想法。

column1: The moral case for a wealth tax is more compelling than usual today, with unemployment still at recession levels, and with deep economic inequality straining social norms.
column2: 财富税的道德问题在今天比以往更具紧迫性，因为如今的失业率仍处在衰退水平，而深刻的经济不平等正在挑战社会规范。

column1: And, if it were really possible to ensure that the wealth levy would be temporary, such a tax would, in principle, be much less distortionary than imposing higher marginal tax rates on income.
column2: 此外，如果真能确保财富税为临时性税种，那么从原理上说，该税比提高边际所得税率所造成的扭曲作用更小。

column1: Unfortunately, while a wealth tax may be a sound way to help a country dig out of a deep fiscal pit, it is hardly a panacea.
column2: 不幸的是，尽管财富税可能是帮助一国走出财政泥淖的可靠方法，却难以成为万灵丹。

column1: For starters, the revenue gains from temporary wealth taxes can be very elusive.
column2: 首先，来自临时性财富税的收入可能难以计算。

column1: The economist Barry Eichengreen once explored the imposition of capital levies in the aftermath of World Wars I and II.
column2: 经济学家巴里·艾肯格林（Barry Eichengreen）曾探索过两次世界大战后资本税的构成。

column1: He found that, owing to capital flight and political pressure for delay, the results were often disappointing.
column2: 他发现，由于资本外逃和推迟执行的政治压力，结果通常令人失望。

column1: Italy’s armada of Guardia di Finanza boats would hardly forestall a massive exodus of wealth if Italians see a sizable wealth tax coming.
column2: 如果意大利将实施大规模财富税政策，则该国海关很难阻止大规模财富外流。

column1: Over- and under-invoicing of trade, for example, is a time-tested way to spirit money out of a country.
column2: 比如，高报和低报贸易是经历了时间考验的将资金抽离一国的良方。

column1: (For example, an exporter under-reports the price received for a foreign shipment, and keeps the extra cash hidden abroad.)
column2: （比如，出口商低报从对外出口获得的价格，将多出来的现金藏在国外。

column1: And there would be a rush into jewelry and other hard-to-detect real assets.
column2: ）还有大笔资金将涌入珠宝和其他难以侦测的实体资产。

column1: The distortionary effects of a wealth levy would also be exacerbated by concerns that the “temporary” levy would not be a one-off tax.
column2: 财富税的扭曲效应还会因为担心“临时性”税收并非一次性而被放大。

column1: After all, most temporary taxes come for lunch and stay for dinner.
column2: 毕竟，大部分临时性税收最后都演变成永久性。

column1: Fears of future wealth taxes could discourage entrepreneurship and lower the saving rate.
column2: 对未来财富税的担心可能会阻碍企业家精神、降低储蓄率。

column1: In addition, the administrative difficulties of instituting a comprehensive wealth tax are formidable, raising questions about fairness.
column2: 此外，制定全面财富税的行政难处极大，会造成关于公平的质疑。

column1: For example, it would be extremely difficult to place market values on the family-owned businesses that pervade Mediterranean countries.
column2: 比如，用市场价值衡量家族企业（在地中海国家颇为常见）是非常困难的。

column1: Wealth taxes that target land and structures are arguably insulated from some of these concerns, and property taxes are relatively underused outside the Anglo-Saxon countries.
column2: 针对土地和建筑的财富税基本与这些担心无关，物业税在盎格鲁-撒���逊国家以外的地区也相对少见。

column1: In theory, taxing immobile assets is less distortionary, though taxes on structures obviously can discourage both maintenance and new construction.
column2: 理论上，对不动产课税的扭曲效应较低，严厉的建筑税显然不利于建筑的新建和维护。

column1: So what else can eurozone governments do to raise revenue as their economies recover?
column2: 那么，随着经济的复苏，欧元区政府还可以从哪里增加收入？

column1: Most economists favor finding ways to broaden the tax base – for example, by eliminating special deductions and privileges – in order to keep marginal tax rates low.
column2: 大部分经济学家倾向于扩大税基 — — 比如，取消特殊扣减项和特权 — — 从而保持边际税率的低水平。

column1: Broadening the income-tax base is a central element of the highly regarded Simpson/Bowles proposals for tax reform in the United States.
column2: 扩大所得税基是获得盛赞的美国辛普森/鲍尔斯（Simpson/Bowles）税收改革方案的核心要素。

column1: In Europe, efficiency would be enhanced by a unified VAT rate, instead of creating distortions by charging different rates for different goods.
column2: 在欧洲，可以用统一的增值税率来增进效率，而不应该通过对不同商品课以不同税率制造扭曲。

column1: In principle, low-income individuals and families could be compensated through lump-sum transfer programs.
column2: 理论上，低收入个人和家庭应该通过一次性转移支付计划补偿。

column1: Another idea is to try to raise more revenue from carbon permits or taxes.
column2: 另一个思路是试图从碳排许可和碳排税中增加收入。

column1: Raising funds by taxing negative externalities reduces distortions rather than creating them.
column2: 通过对负外部性课税筹资能减少而不会创造扭曲。

column1: Though such taxes are spectacularly unpopular – perhaps because individuals refuse to admit that the externalities they themselves create are significant – I regard them as an important direction for future policy (and I intend to suggest other ideas along these lines in future columns).
column2: 尽管这些税非常不受欢迎 — — 也许是因为个人拒绝承认他们所造成的外部性十分巨大 — — 但我认为这是未来政策的重要方向（我还会在后续专栏中继续介绍这一方向的其他思路 ） 。

column1: Unfortunately, advanced countries have implemented very little fundamental tax reform so far.
column2: 不幸的是，目前发达国家几乎没有实施根本性的税收改革。

column1: Many governments are giving in to higher marginal tax rates rather than overhauling and simplifying the system.
column2: 许多政府提高了边际税率，而没有修正和简化税制。

column1: In Europe, officials are also turning to stealth taxes, particularly financial repression, to resolve high public-debt overhangs.
column2: 在欧洲，官员还打起了用隐性税（特别是金融抑制）解决公共债务大量积压的问题。

column1: Through regulation and administrative directives, banks, insurance companies, and pension funds are being forced to hold much higher shares of government debt than they might voluntarily choose to do.
column2: 通过监管和行政指导，银行、保险公司和退基金进被迫大量增加政府债务的持有比例，远远高出自愿选择情形时的水平。

column1: But this approach is hardly progressive, as the final holders of pensions, insurance contracts, and bank deposits are typically the beleaguered middle class and the elderly.
column2: 但这一方法很难具有累进性，因为退休基金、保险合同和银行存款的最终持有者通常是处处受压迫的中产阶级和老年人。

column1: There is also the unresolved question of how much the periphery countries really should be asked to pay on their debilitating debt burdens, whatever the tax instrument.
column2: 还有一个未解决的问题：不管使用什么税收工具，外围国在应该被要求偿付多少令其不堪重负的债务。

column1: Although the IMF seems particularly enthusiastic about using wealth taxes to resolve debt overhangs in Spain and Italy, some burden sharing with the north seems reasonable.
column2: 尽管IMF似乎十分热衷于用财富税解决西班牙和意大利的债务积压，但北方更多地承担债务共担似乎也是合理的。

column1: As the economists Maurice Obstfeld and Galina Hale recently noted, German and French banks earned large profits intermediating flows between Asian savers and Europe’s periphery.
column2: 经济学家毛里斯·奥布斯菲尔德（Maurice Obstfeld）和加里纳·赫尔（Galina Hale）最近指出，德国和法国银行在为亚洲储蓄者和欧洲外围国家充当中介的业务中赚取了大量利润。

column1: Unfortunately, arguing over burden sharing creates more scope for delay, potentially undermining the efficacy of any wealth tax that might finally be instituted.
column2: 不幸的是，争论债务共担问题给拖延造成了更大的空间，这可能破坏最终可能实施的财富税的效力。

column1: Still, the IMF is right – on grounds of both fairness and efficiency – to raise the idea of temporary wealth taxes in advanced countries to relieve fiscal distress.
column2: 尽管如此，IMF提出在发达国家实施临时性财富税来纾解财政困境的思路是对的 — — 不管从公平还是从效率角度。

column1: However, the revenues will almost certainly be lower, and the costs higher, than calculations used to promote them would imply.
column2: 但是，与用来促使财富税实施的推算相比，财富税的收入几乎肯定要更低，成本几乎肯定要更高。

column1: Temporary wealth taxes may well be a part of the answer for countries in fiscal trouble today, and the idea should be taken seriously.
column2: 临时性财富税也许最好作为现今陷入财政困境的国家的解决方案的一部分，并且这一思路应该得到认真对待。

column1: But they are no substitute for fundamental long-term reform to make tax systems simpler, fairer, and more efficient.
column2: 但它们绝不是让税制更简单、更公平和更高效的根本性长期改革的替代品。

column1: Where Is the Inequality Problem?
column2: 不平等问题在哪里？

column1: CAMBRIDGE – Reading Thomas Piketty’s influential new book Capital in the Twenty-First Century, one might conclude that the world has not been this unequal since the days of robber barons and kings.
column2: 美国剑桥—阅读托马斯·皮克提（Thomas Piketty）风靡一时的新书《二十一世纪资本论 》 （ Capital in the Twenty-First Century）会让你有这样一种感觉：自从强盗贵族和国王时代以来，世界从未如此不平等。

column1: That is odd, because one might conclude from reading another excellent new book, Angus Deaton’s The Great Escape (which I recently reviewed), that the world is more equal than ever.
column2: 这有些奇怪，因为阅读另一部出色的新书、安格斯·迪顿（Angus Deaton）的《大脱贫 》 （ The Great Escape，我最近为它写了书评）会让你觉得世界比从前任何时候都更加平等。

column1: Which view is right?
column2: 哪种观点才是正确的？

column1: The answer depends on whether one looks only at countries individually or at the world as a whole.
column2: 答案取决于你看的是以各个国家的视角还是以世界整体视角看待这一问题。

column1: The overarching fact in Deaton’s book is that over the last few decades, several billion people in the developing world, particularly in Asia, have escaped truly desperate levels of poverty.
column2: 迪顿的书所提出的最重要的事实是，最近几十年中，生活在发展中世界的数十亿人（特别是在亚洲 ） ， 名符其实地逃脱了令人绝望的贫困。

column1: The same machine that has increased inequality in rich countries has leveled the playing field globally for billions.
column2: 在发达国家造成不平等加剧的同一套机制为全球数十亿人创造了公平竞技场。

column1: Looking from afar, and giving, say, an Indian the same weight as an American or a Frenchman, the last 30 years have been among the greatest in human history for improving the lot of the poor.
column2: 拉远视角并赋予（比如）硬度名字和美国或法国名字同样的权重你会发现，过去三十年是人类历史上穷人改善最大的时期。

column1: Piketty’s brilliant book documents within-country inequality, with the main focus being on the rich world.
column2: 皮克提的畅销新书讨论了国家内的不平等问题，主要关注发达世界。

column1: Much of the cultural groundswell surrounding his book has come from people who view themselves as middle class within their own countries, but who are upper middle class or even rich by global standards.
column2: 这本书所造成的巨大争议主要存在于自视为所在国中产阶级、但从全球标准看属于中上甚至富裕阶级的人中间。

column1: There are various arcane technical debates surrounding the facts that Piketty has established over the past 15 years with his co-author Emmanuel Saez.
column2: 皮克提和他的合作者阿玛努尔·萨茨（Emmanuel Saez）所描述的过去15年中的事实包含了晦涩难懂的学术争论。

column1: But I find their results persuasive, especially given that other authors, using completely different methods, have reached similar conclusions.
column2: 但我认为结论是有说服力的，尤其是考虑到其他作者使用完全不同的方法也获得了类似的结论。

column1: Brent Neiman and Loukas Karabarbounis of the University of Chicago, for example, argue that labor’s share of GDP has been declining globally since the 1970’s.
column2: 比如，芝加哥大学的布伦特·尼曼（Brent Neiman）和洛卡斯·卡拉巴波尼斯（Loukas Karabarbounis）指出，全球劳动力占GDP比重自20世纪70年代以来一直在下降。

column1: However, Piketty and Saez do not really offer a model; nor does this new book.
column2: 但是，皮克提和萨茨实际上并未提出模型；他们的新书亦然。

column1: And the lack of a model, combined with a focus on the world’s upper-middle-class countries, matters a lot when it comes to policy prescriptions.
column2: 而缺少模型加上内容主要关注世界中上阶层国家导致他们的政策药方有很大问题。

column1: Would Piketty’s followers be nearly as enthusiastic about his proposed progressive global wealth tax if it were aimed at correcting the huge disparities between the richest countries and the poorest, instead of between those who are well off by global standards and the ultra-wealthy?
column2: 如果皮克提所提出的累进全球财富税的目的是减少最富裕国家和最贫穷国家之间的巨大差距，而不是减少按全球标准看属于富裕阶层者语最富有者之间的差距，他的追随者还会如热情吗？

column1: Piketty argues that capitalism is unfair.
column2: 皮克提认为资本主义是不正义的。

column1: Wasn’t colonialism unfair, too?
column2: 殖民主义不也是不正义的吗？

column1: In any event, the idea of a global wealth tax is replete with credibility and enforcement problems, aside from being politically implausible.
column2: 无论如何，全球财富税的构想存在巨大的信誉和实施问题，更不用说在政治上不讨好了。

column1: Though Piketty is right that returns to capital have increased in the last few decades, he is too dismissive of the wide-ranging debate among economists concerning the causes.
column2: 皮克提说，过去几十年来资本回报有所上升，这是对的，但他对关心这一现象原因的经济学家之间的广泛争论所知太少。

column1: For example, if the main driver is the massive influx of Asian labor into globalized trade markets, the growth model put forth by the Nobel laureate economist Robert Solow suggests that eventually capital stocks will adjust and the wage rate will rise.
column2: 比如，如果这一现象的主要原因是亚洲劳动力大量涌入全球贸易市场，那么诺贝尔奖获得者罗伯特·索洛（Robert Solow）所提出的的增长模型表明，最终资本存量会出现调整，工资率会出现上升。

column1: Retirements from an aging labor force will eventually drive up wages as well.
column2: 老龄化劳动力大军的退休也会最终推高工资。

column1: If, on the other hand, labor’s share of income is falling because of the inexorable rise of automation, downward pressures on that share will continue, as I discussed in the context of artificial intelligence a few years ago.
column2: 另一方面，如果劳动力占收入比重下降的原因是自动化程度的不断提高，那么这一比例的下降压力将会继续，几年前，我以人工智能为背景讨论过这一问题。

column1: Fortunately, there are much better ways to address rich-country inequality while still fostering long-term growth in demand for products from developing countries.
column2: 幸运的是，有更好的办法纠正发达国家的不平等问题，同时提振对发展中国家产品的长期需求增长。

column1: For example, a shift to a relatively flat consumption tax (with a large deductible for progressivity) would be a far simpler and more effective way to tax past wealth accumulation, especially if citizens’ tax home can be linked to the locale where their income was earned.
column2: 比如，相对扁平的消费税（在累进性之上增加大量减扣项）是远为更简单、更有效的过去财富积累税，特别是在公民的报税地可以与他们的收入来源地挂钩时。

column1: A progressive consumption tax is relatively efficient and does not distort savings decisions as much as today’s income taxes do.
column2: 累进的消费税相对高效，造成的储蓄决策扭曲也比现在的所得税小。

column1: Why try to move to an improbable global wealth tax when alternatives are available that are growth friendly, raise significant revenue, and can be made progressive through a very high exemption.
column2: 既然有可行的增长友好型替代方案，能够带来重大收入提高并且可以通过极高的税收豁免实现累进性，为何还要采取不可行的全球财富税？

column1: In addition to a global wealth tax, Piketty recommends an 80% marginal tax rate on income for the United States.
column2: 除了全球财富税，皮克提还建议美国实施80%的边际所得税率。

column1: Though I strongly believe that the US needs more progressive taxation, particularly of the top 0.1%, I don’t understand why he assumes that an 80% rate would not cause significant distortions, especially as this assumption contradicts a large body of work by the Nobel laureates Thomas Sargent and Edward Prescott.
column2: 尽管我强烈认为美国需要更累进的税制，特别是对顶层的0.1%人群，但我不明白为何他认为80%的税率不会造成重大扭曲，特别是考虑到这一假设与诺贝尔奖获得者托马斯·萨金特（Thomas Sargent）和爱德华·普雷斯科特（Edward Prescott）的大部分工作相悖。

column1: There are many practical policies that can be adopted to reduce inequality, in addition to a progressive consumption tax.
column2: 除了累进消费税，还有很多实际的政策可以用来减少不平等性。

column1: Focusing on the US, Jeffrey Frankel of Harvard University has suggested the elimination of payroll taxes for low-income workers, a cut in deductions for high-income workers, and higher inheritance taxes.
column2: 以美国为例，哈佛大学的杰弗里·弗兰克尔（Jeffrey Frankel）提出豁免低收入工人的工资税，并削减高收入工人的扣减项、提高遗产税。

column1: Universal pre-school education would enhance long-term growth, as would a much greater emphasis on lifetime adult education (my addition), possibly via online courses.
column2: 全民学前教育能够提振长期增长，大幅增强终身成人教育（可通过在线课程实现）亦然（这是我所做的引申 ） 。

column1: Carbon taxes would help mitigate global warming while raising considerable revenues.
column2: 碳税将有助于在减轻全球变暖的同时大幅提高税收收入。

column1: In accepting Piketty’s premise that inequality matters more than growth, one needs to remember that many developing-country citizens rely on rich-country growth to help them escape poverty.
column2: 如果你接受了皮克提关于不平等性比增长更重要的前提，你最好回忆一下，许多发展中国家人民依赖发达国家增长帮助他们摆脱贫困。

column1: The first problem of the twenty-first century remains to help the dire poor in Africa and elsewhere.
column2: 二十一世纪的首要问题仍是帮助极端贫困的非洲和其他国家。

column1: By all means, the elite 0.1% should pay much more in taxes, but let us not forget that when it comes to reducing global inequality, the capitalist system has had an impressive three decades.
column2: 无论如何，0.1%的精英都应该付出多得多的税收，但不要忘了，对降低全球不平等这一问题，资本主义制度在过去三十年中表现十分出色。

column1: Foreign-Aid Follies
column2: 愚蠢的援助

column1: MUMBAI – The huge gap between the world’s richest and poorest countries remains one of the great moral dilemmas for the West. It also presents one of the greatest challenges for development economics.
column2: 发自孟买 — — 世界上那些最富有和最贫穷国家之间的巨大鸿沟一直是西方遭遇的道德困境之一，也一直是发达国家所面临的其中一项最大挑战。

column1: Do we really know how to help countries overcome poverty?
column2: 那么我们究竟知不知道如何才能帮助那些国家摆脱贫困？

column1: In his eloquently written and deeply researched new book The Great Escape: Health, Wealth, and the Origins of Inequality, Princeton University’s Angus Deaton urges caution.
column2: 对此普林斯顿大学的安格斯·迪顿教授在他精心研究撰写的新书《大逃亡：健康，财富，以及不平等的本原》中提出了警告。

column1: For those interested in world poverty, it is unquestionably the most important book on development assistance to appear in a long time.
column2: 对那些关注世界贫困的人来说，此书无疑是长期来研究发展援助的最重要著作。

column1: Deaton suggests that far too often, Western aid serves to assuage donors’ guilt rather than improve recipients’ plight.
column2: 迪顿指出，在很大程度上西方援助都不是要改善受助者的境况，而是为了缓解捐助者的愧疚感。

column1: This is particularly the case when naïve assistance serves to reinforce a dysfunctional status quo.
column2: 这在一些草率的援助反而导致糟糕现状不断固化的案例中显得尤为明显。

column1: Although Deaton supports select initiatives, particularly for delivering medical and technological knowledge, he questions whether the vast majority of aid passes the basic Hippocratic litmus test of “first do no harm.”
column2: 虽然迪顿支持某些特定的举措 — — 尤其是输送药物和科学知识 — — 但他也质疑大多数援助是否通过了希波克拉底誓言的检验 ： “ 首先，不要伤害病人 。 ”

column1: For starters, assessing and implementing aid policy requires developing tools to gauge accurately where need is greatest.
column2: 首先，获取和实施援助政策要求使用某些工具去准确判定哪些地方最需要帮助。

column1: Economists have developed some useful indicators, but they are vastly less precise than politicians and the media seem to understand.
column2: 对此经济学家创立了一些有用的指数，但这些指数的准确度却远不如政治家和媒体以为的那样精确。

column1: Most experts agree, and Deaton concurs, that at least a billion people on the planet live in desperate circumstances resembling conditions that prevailed hundreds of years ago.
column2: 大多数专家认定而迪顿也赞成的是，地球上至少有十亿人生活在跟前几个世纪类似的悲惨境地之中。

column1: Our failure to alleviate their plight is morally reprehensible.
column2: 我们在缓解这些苦难方面的无能是应当受到道德谴责的。

column1: But where, exactly, are the greatest concentrations of poor people?
column2: 但究竟穷人最集中的地方在哪里？

column1: Data are hard to come by and even harder to interpret.
column2: 这样的数据非常难以搜集，甚至更难去解读？

column1: Attempts to convert national incomes into a common denominator are fraught with complications.
column2: 尝试将国民收入转化为一个普遍标准的做法是充满复杂性的。

column1: To take one prominent example, there is a 25% margin of error on purchasing-power-parity comparisons between GDP in the United States and China.
column2: 举一个著名的例子，美国和中国的GDP购买力平价对比之间存在着25%的误差幅度。

column1: In other words, we cannot say whether Chinese output today equals 55% of US GDP or 92%.
column2: 换言之，我们无法确定当前的中国生产总值究竟是相当于美国GDP的55%还是92 % 。

column1: So much for precise forecasts of the date when China will overtake the US as the world’s largest economy; we won’t even know for sure when it happens!
column2: 同样我们也无法精确预测中国究竟在何时超越美国成为世界第一大经济体；我们根本就不知道这事什么时候才会发生！

column1: This problem is hardly unique to comparisons of China and the US; it applies with perhaps even greater force when comparing incomes of the poor in Mumbai with those of the poor in Freetown.
column2: 而这个问题可不仅存在于中美对比之中；甚至在比��印度孟买和塞拉里昂弗里敦两地的贫民收入时差距更大。

column1: Another major problem is measuring progress in a given country over time.
column2: 另一个主要问题是如何测量某特定国家随时间不断发展进步的程度。

column1: How can one compare cost-of-living indices in different periods when new goods are constantly upending traditional consumption models?
column2: 在新商品不断颠覆传统消费模式的情况下，你该如何比较不同时期的生活成本指数？

column1: Consider the impact of cell phones in Africa, for example, or the Internet in India.
column2: 试想手机对非洲的影响，或是互联网对印度的冲击。

column1: Deaton goes on to offer a revealing critique of some of the most hyped and fashionable approaches to improving aid.
column2: 迪顿接着对目前最受追捧的流行改善援助手段提出了启发性的批评。

column1: For example, the “hydraulic model” of aid – the idea that if we simply pumped in more aid, better results would gush out – ignores the fact that funds are often fungible.
column2: 比如说，援助的“液压模式 ” — —所谓只要简单直接地提供更多援助，就能挤压出更好的结果 — — 却忽略了援助往往是可替换的事实。

column1: Even if aid is narrowly targeted at say, food or health, a government can simply economize on expenditures that it might have made anyway and redirect them elsewhere – for example, to the military.
column2: 即便援助仅限于食品或者是医疗药品，受援地政府也可以直接节省下援助所产生的开支并将其转移到其他地方 — — 比如军事用途。

column1: Direct delivery of medical help is one of the best options, but it still can be a huge drain on already-scarce local resources – hospitals, doctors, and nurses.
column2: 直接医疗援助是最好的选择之一，但它也可能吞咽掉本已稀缺的当地资源 — — 医院，医生和护士。

column1: An influx of Western NGOs often bids talent away from nascent businesses that could help the country long after the NGOs reset their priorities and move on.
column2: 每当大量非政府组织涌入，它们通常会从当地新生的医疗机构中招募人才，一旦这些组织完成任务撤离，就只留下残缺不全的机构长期服务这个国家。

column1: Indeed, there is a striking parallel between the problems caused by aid inflows and the “natural resource curse” (or “Dutch disease” as it is termed in Western countries), whereby inflows into one economic sector – typically oil or minerals – drive up economy-wide prices (including the exchange rate), rendering other sectors uncompetitive.
column2: 事实上，援助流入所导致的问题与“自然资源诅咒 ” （ 或是西方国家所说的“荷兰病 ” ） 之间存在着惊人的相似之处 — — 援助流入某些经济部门（一般是石油或者矿业）导致了整个经济体内部的价格（包括汇率）上升，令到其他经济部门丧失竞争力。

column1: Moreover, a great deal of this aid is delivered in kind and for strategic reasons, often supporting ineffective and kleptocratic governments.
column2: 此外，许多这类援助都是用实物支付并出于战略原因，常常被用来支持效率低下的权贵政府。

column1: Deaton observes that, in general, Western countries developed without receiving any aid. (Perhaps America’s post-World War II Marshall Plan in Europe is an exception, but that aid was intended more for reconstruction than for development.)
column2: 迪顿观察到，总体才说西方国家都是在毫无援助的情况下发展起来的（或许二战后美国支援欧洲的马歇尔计划是个例外，但该计划更加集中于重建而非发展 ） 。

column1: China and India, too, have succeeded in lifting hundreds of millions of people out of poverty with relatively little Western aid (particularly China).
column2: 中国和印度的成功同样也是在较少西方援助下让数亿人摆脱贫困而取得的。

column1: Deaton argues that aid providers must be extremely careful not to interfere with political and social forces that, over time, can generate organic – and therefore more lasting – internal change.
column2: 迪顿指出援助者必须极端谨慎，不要干涉那些随时间推移会引发有机 — — 并因此催生更持续内部变革 — — 的政治和社会力量。

column1: Another intellectually fashionable approach is to conduct small randomized trials to examine, say, the effectiveness of school-attendance incentives or immunization campaigns.
column2: 另一个理论上较为流行的手段就是实施小型随机实验去考察提高入学率或者免疫项目的有效性。

column1: Deaton rightly argues that this approach, now enshrined in World Bank procedures, is of very little use for understanding how to help a country develop more broadly.
column2: 迪顿正确地指出这个当前世界银行奉为至宝的方法对于认识如何帮助一个国家更大范围地发展是没什么作用的。

column1: The results are often specific to a particular country’s circumstances, and there is no reason to presume that they would scale up when fully confronted with a developing country’s governance problems.
column2: 考察结果往往局限于某个国家的独特状况，也无法证明这些结果能广泛推广开来去应对一个发展中国家的治理问题。

column1: The fact that people in several African countries appear to be worse off now than in 1960 is far more related to despotism and internal conflict than it is to the effectiveness of aid-delivery programs.
column2: 而多个非洲国家人民的生存状况比1960年代更加恶化的事实其实与专制独裁和内部冲突更加相关，而不是援助项目的有效性。

column1: Despite these caveats, Deaton’s message is fundamentally positive.
column2: 尽管提出了这些警告，迪顿所传达出来的信息归根结底是积极正面的。

column1: For most of mankind, now is a better time than ever before to be alive.
column2: 对于大多数人来说，如今的生活要比以往更好。

column1: The path to development remains for others to follow.
column2: 发展的路径依旧等待其他人去跟随。

column1: Highly targeted Western aid and advice can help, but donors must take more care not to stand in the way of the beneficiaries in assisting them.
column2: 高度针对性的西方援助和顾问工作依然有所裨益，但援助者们必须更加谨慎小心，不要阻碍了受援者获取帮助的道路。

column1: A Tear for Argentina
column2: 为阿根廷流泪

column1: CAMBRIDGE – Argentina’s latest default poses unsettling questions for policymakers.
column2: 美国剑桥—阿根廷最近的违约给决策者造成了令人不安的问题。

column1: True, the country’s periodic debt crises are often the result of self-destructive macroeconomic policies.
column2: 诚然，该国时常发生的债务危机大多是自我破坏性宏观经济政策的结果。

column1: But, this time, the default has been triggered by a significant shift in the international sovereign-debt regime.
column2: 但是，这一回，违约是由国际主权债务机制的重大变化引发的。

column1: The shift favors hardline creditors in bond issuances governed by US law.
column2: 根据美国法律，这一变化有利于债券发行中的强硬债权人。

column1: With emerging-market growth slowing, and external debt rising, new legal interpretations that make debt future write-downs and reschedulings more difficult do not augur well for global financial stability.
column2: 随着新兴市场增长放缓和外部债务增加，让未来债务减记和重新安排变得更加困难的新法律解释绝非全球金融稳定的福音。

column1: There are no heroes in this story, certainly not Argentina’s policymakers, who a decade ago attempted unilaterally to force a massive generalized write-down on foreign bondholders.
column2: 在这个故事里没有英雄，阿根廷决策者显然不是，十年前他们试图单方面强行对外国债券持有人实施大规模的一般化减记。

column1: Economists who trumpeted the “Buenos Aires consensus” as the new way to run economies also look foolish in hindsight.
column2: 有些经济学家将“布宜诺斯艾利斯共识”吹成经济运行新方式，事后看来这一观点也是相当愚蠢。

column1: The International Monetary Fund has long recognized that it made one too many loans to try to save Argentina’s unsustainable dollar peg as it collapsed back in 2001.
column2: 国际货币基金组织很早就认识到，2001年不可持续的盯住美元政策崩溃时，它给了阿根廷太多的救命贷款。

column1: This is not the first time that an Argentine default has upended international capital markets.
column2: 这不是阿根廷��机第一次扰动资本市场。

column1: According to the tabulation that Carmen Reinhart and I compiled in our 2009 book This Time is Different, Argentina has defaulted on seven previous occasions – in 1827, 1890, 1951, 1956, 1982, 1989, and 2001.
column2: 卡门·莱因哈特（Carmen Reinhart）和我在2009年的书《这次不一样 》 （ This Time is Different）总结过一张表格，阿根廷此前已有七次违约记录 — — 分别在1827年、1890年、1951年、1956年、1982年、1989年和2001年。

column1: Argentina may be almost as famous for its defaults as it is for its soccer teams, but it is hardly alone.
column2: 阿根廷的违约史和它的足球队一样著名，但它绝非孤例。

column1: Virtually every emerging-market country has experienced recurrent sovereign-debt problems.
column2: 几乎所有新兴市场国家都经历过反复的主权债务问题。

column1: Venezuela is the modern-day record holder, with 11 defaults since 1826 and possibly more to come.
column2: 委内瑞拉是现代纪录保持着，自1826年以来违约过11次，未来可能还会有更多次。

column1: Back in 2003, partly in response to the Argentine crisis, the IMF proposed a new framework for adjudicating sovereign debts.
column2: 2003年，部分出于对阿根廷危机的反应，国际货币基金组织为裁定主权债务提出了一个新框架。

column1: But the proposal faced sharp opposition not only from creditors who feared that the IMF would be too friendly to problem debtors, but also from emerging markets that foresaw no near-term risk to their perceived creditworthiness.
column2: 但这一建议不但受到担心国际货币基金组织对问题债务国太友好的债权国的反对，也受到预料到近期信誉可能遭到质疑的新兴市场的反对。

column1: The healthy borrowers worried that creditors would demand higher rates if the penalties for default softened.
column2: 健康的债务人担心，如果违约惩罚放松，债权人就会要求更高的利率。

column1: Recently, as an outgrowth of a reconsideration of the IMF’s lending to the periphery of Europe (and Greece in particular), the Fund has advanced another approach to debt rescheduling, one that might be easier to implement.
column2: 最近，国际货币基金组织考虑向欧洲外围（特别是希腊）提供贷款，在此过程中，该组织推出了另一个债务重新安排方针，这一方针实施起来更加容易。

column1: The IMF now recognizes that the bulk of its financing was effectively being used to allow short-term creditors to exit loss-free.
column2: 国际货币基金组织现在认识到，其融资的大头实际上被用在了让短期债权人毫发无伤地全身而退上。

column1: As a result, there was not enough money left over to help soften budget cuts necessitated by the sudden stop in foreign funding.
column2: 结果是没有足够的钱帮助减轻外国融资骤停所带来的不得不削减预算的压力。

column1: The experience of the recent eurozone crisis stands in sharp contrast to the Latin American debt crisis in the 1980s, when banks were not allowed to exit precipitously from their loans.
column2: 最近的欧元区危机与20世纪80年代的拉美危机形成了鲜明对比。 在拉美危机中，银行不允许突然收回贷款。

column1: If the new proposal is adopted, the IMF would conditionally refuse funds to countries carrying debt burdens that Fund staff determine are most likely unsustainable; creditors would first have to agree to a “reprofiling” of debt.
column2: 如果新方案被采用，国际货币进组织将有条件地拒绝将资金投入该组织所认定的债务负担最有可能无法持续下去的国家；债权人将第一次被迫同意债务的“重估 ” （ reprofiling ） 。

column1: Reprofiling is a euphemism for debt restructuring, which allows countries to borrow from existing creditors for longer periods and at lower interest rates than they would be able to do on the open market.
column2: 重估是债务重组的委婉说法，它让各国以更长期限、更低利率从现有债权人处借钱，债务国在公开市场上无法获得这样的条件。

column1: Although it is far from clear how easily the IMF could hold the line against hard-bargaining creditors, the new policy, if adopted, would toughen the Fund’s approach to cases where it finds itself repeatedly throwing good money after bad.
column2: 对于在谈判中态度强硬的债权人，国际货币基金组织是否可以自如地坚持原则还远未可知，但这一新政策如果被采用，将会收紧国际货币基金组织对一再事倍功半的国家的态度。

column1: At present, the United States seems reluctant to go along with the IMF’s proposal.
column2: 目前，美国似乎不愿支持国际货币基金组织的方案。

column1: Evidently, US authorities believe that in some situations geopolitics trump economics (reflected, for example, in the IMF’s recent re-entry into Ukraine after a string of failed programs).
column2: 显然，美国当局认为，在某些情形中，地缘政治比经济考虑更重要（比如，国际货币基金组织在一系列失败计划后最近再次进入乌克兰就是明证 ） 。

column1: This American resistance is unfortunate.
column2: 美国的抵制是不幸的。

column1: It would be far better if the US found ways simply to organize outright grants in exceptional cases like Ukraine, rather than design the international financial system around them.
column2: 如果美国能够设法为乌克兰这样的突出事件实施赠款，而不是设计围绕这些事件的国际金融系统，情况将会好得多。

column1: Given the recurring complications of adjudicating sovereign-debt contracts in foreign courts, and the world’s inability to organize a credible and fair procedure for foreign bankruptcies, perhaps the best idea is to steer the bulk of international debt flows through debtor-country courts.
column2: 由于在外国法庭裁定主权债务合同会一再引发各种状况，而世界有不能阻止可信而公平的外国破产程序，也许最好的办法是通过债务国法院引导国际债务流大部的流向。

column1: Jeremy Bulow and I made a proposal along these lines 25 years ago; it is still the right approach.
column2: 杰雷米·布罗（Jeremy Bulow）和我25年前曾 提出过一个这样的方案；现在它仍然是正确的方案。

column1: In this scenario, countries interested in borrowing large amounts from abroad would need to develop institutions that made the promise to repay credible.
column2: 在这一情形中，有意从海外大量借贷的国家将需要发展让偿付承诺变得可靠的制度。

column1: By and large, experience supports this method.
column2: 迄今为止的经验支持这一办法。

column1: Indeed, the huge expansion in emerging-market domestic-debt issuance in recent years has helped reduce market tensions (though continuing reliance by corporates on foreign debt still leaves many countries vulnerable).
column2: 事实上，近几年来新兴市场国内债务发行量的暴增有助于减少市场紧张（尽管公司继续依赖外国债务仍然让许多国家十分脆弱 ） 。

column1: But domestic borrowing is not a panacea.
column2: 但国内借贷并非万灵丹。

column1: To believe that any country issuing debt in its own currency is risk-free as long as the exchange rate is flexible is astonishingly naive.
column2: 相信只要汇率具有弹性，一国以本国货币发行债务就是无风险的，这一观点是非常幼稚的。

column1: For one thing, there is still inflation risk, particularly for countries with weak fiscal institutions and heavy debt burdens.
column2: 一方面，仍然需要面对通胀风险，特别是财政制度不健全、背负沉重债务负担的国家。

column1: Nonetheless, Argentina’s latest debt trauma shows that the global system for sovereign-debt workouts remains badly in need of repair.
column2: 尽管如此，阿根廷最近的债务灾难表明，全球主权债务系统运转状况急需修正。

column1: Deepening domestic debt markets – and perhaps change along the lines proposed by the IMF – is sorely needed.
column2: 深化国内债务市场 — — 也许可以依照国际货币基金组织提出的方针 — — 是极有必要的。

column1: The Case for Burning Ivory
column2: 焚烧象牙的理由

column1: JOHANNESBURG – Kenya is about to destroy its entire stockpile of elephant ivory.
column2: 约翰内斯堡 — — 肯尼亚即将销毁其全部的象牙库存。

column1: More than 100 metric tons of “white gold” – both illegally harvested (confiscated from poachers or traders) and naturally accruing (from natural mortality) – will go up in smoke this weekend.
column2: 超过100吨的“白色黄金 ” — —无论是非法采集（从偷猎者或商人手里没收）还是自然累积（采集自自然死亡的大象 ） — —都将在本周末付之一炬。

column1: In China – where the majority of the world’s ivory is consumed or stockpiled – the recently reported price is $1,100 per kilogram, putting the total value of the material to be burned at roughly $110 million.
column2: 在世界最主要的象牙消费或存储国中国，最新报价高达1，100美元每公斤，照此计算这批即将焚毁的象牙材料总价值约为1.1亿美元。

column1: To most economists, the idea of destroying something with so much value is anathema.
column2: 多数经济学家认为销毁如此高价的物品令人不可思议。

column1: But there are good reasons for a country – even one as poor as Kenya – to surrender its ivory wealth to the flames.
column2: 但即使对像肯尼亚这样的穷国来说，将象牙财富付之一炬理由也非常充分。

column1: For starters, stockpile destruction fortifies the credibility of demand-reduction campaigns in East Asia, without which the poaching problem will never be solved.
column2: 首先，销毁库存强化了东亚需求削减活动的公信力，没有这样的公信力，偷猎问题也永远无法得到解决。

column1: Demand reduction aims to weaken the market for the product by changing consumer tastes.
column2: 消费削减活动的目标是通过改变消费者的口味来削弱产品市场。

column1: As prices drop, so does the incentive for poachers to kill elephants.
column2: 价格的下跌将影响偷猎者猎杀大象的积极性。

column1: When countries keep their stockpiles, however, they signal that they anticipate being able to sell ivory in the future.
column2: 但当国家试图保留库存时，他们向外界表明希望能在未来出售这批象牙。

column1: This undermines the credibility of demand-reduction efforts; if the trade is likely to be legalized one day, any stigma associated with ivory consumption will be eroded.
column2: 这在很大程度上损害了需求削减工作的公信力；如果有一天象牙贸易能够合法化，那么与象牙消费有关的任何耻辱均将遭到侵蚀。

column1: Proponents of a regulated, legal international ivory trade argue that demand-reduction efforts can coexist with a limited legitimate supply.
column2: 合法管制国际象牙贸易的支持者认为需求削减工作可以和有限度的合法供应并存。

column1: But this line of reasoning has a dangerous weakness: It assumes that a legal cartel – one proposed model for regulating supply – would crowd out illegal suppliers by providing ivory to the market at a lower cost.
column2: 但上述推理有一个危险的弱点：即假定合法卡特尔 — — 即需求管理的拟议模式之一 — — 会因为低成本向市场提供象牙而挤出非法的象牙供应。

column1: This assumption is dubious at best.
column2: 这种假设充其量也不可全信。

column1: The quantities traded through a legal mechanism would be insufficient to flood the market and suppress the price.
column2: 通过合法机制的象牙贸易数量完全不足以占领市场、打压价格。

column1: Indeed, with legalized trade undermining demand-reduction efforts, the price of ivory is likely to remain high, ensuring that poaching continues.
column2: 事实上，在合法贸易破坏需求削减工作的情况下，象牙价格很有可能维持高位，从而保证偷猎活动能得以持续。

column1: Some southern African countries argue that they should be allowed to sell their ivory in CITES-permitted, one-off sales to fund conservation efforts aimed at maintaining healthy elephant populations.
column2: 南部非洲某些国家认为应当允许他们按照《濒临绝种野生动植物国际贸易公约》的规定从事一次性的象牙销售活动，从而为保护健康象群的工作提供资金支持。

column1: But, aside from the low probability in some countries that the revenue would be directed to that end, it is not clear that much money would be made.
column2: 但抛开某些国家不太可能将收入用于上述领域的情况不谈，这种方法能挣到多少钱依然是未知数。

column1: Under CITES regulations, governments are permitted to sell only to other governments.
column2: 根据《濒临绝种野生动植物国际贸易公约》的规定，只允许在各国政府间进行贸易。

column1: But what other governments are willing to pay may be as low as one-tenth of the illicit value.
column2: 但其他政府可能仅愿意支付非法贸易价值的区区十分之一。

column1: And even then, governments can sell only naturally accrued ivory, not what was confiscated from poachers or illicit dealers.
column2: 而且即便如此，政府也只允许出售自然累积的象牙，从偷猎者或非法经销商手中没收的象牙不在其列。

column1: China and the United States are in the process of formulating bans on domestic ivory trade, so it is not clear which governments would be interested in purchasing African stockpiles.
column2: 中美两国都在制定国内象牙贸易禁令，因此目前尚不清楚哪国政府会对购买非洲象牙库存感兴趣。

column1: Vietnam and Laos are likely candidates, but they are also part of the infamous “golden triangle,” where illegal trade in wildlife and wildlife products continues to thrive.
column2: 越南和老挝虽然是可能的买家，但上述两国现实中是臭名昭著的“金三角”的组成部分，那里是野生动物及其产品非法贸易蓬勃发展的大本营。

column1: The possibility of the legal ivory trade shifting to poorly regulated markets calls for a concerted international response, spearheaded by African governments through coalitions like the Elephant Protection Initiative, together with countries such as China.
column2: 合法象牙贸易可能转向监管不力的市场要求国际社会作出协调一致的反应，而牵头的理应是通过大象保护倡议联盟参与这项工作并与中国等国合作的非洲政府。

column1: Preserving – rather than burning – stockpiles is the inefficient choice.
column2: 保留象牙库存是一种低效的选择，但焚毁不是。

column1: Maintaining a stockpile is administratively and operationally expensive – and often pointless.
column2: 库存维护需要付出行政和运营成本 — — 而且往往毫无意义。

column1: Inventory management is labor-intensive and technologically demanding.
column2: 库存管理属于劳动密集型项目，而且对技术有着很高的要求。

column1: The ivory also must be air-conditioned to prevent the tusks from cracking or becoming brittle (important factors for attracting higher prices).
column2: 而且象牙必须在空调环境下保存，以防止破裂或者变脆（这是卖出高价的重要因素 ） 。

column1: Given the low probability of being able to sell ivory in the future, the cost of storing and protecting it is unlikely to be recouped.
column2: 鉴于未来出售象牙的可能性十分之低，导致储存和保护成本不太可能被收回。

column1: Meanwhile, criminal syndicates need only corrupt a handful of local officials to make off with the goods.
column2: 此外，犯罪集团仅需要向当地少数官员行贿即可带着象牙离开。

column1: Then there are the high opportunity costs of investment in maintaining stockpiles.
column2: 再就是维护库存投资超高的机会成本。

column1: The scarce human and financial resources allocated toward stockpile management could be more efficiently directed toward landscape preservation efforts (which can become self-sustaining over time through payment for ecosystem services).
column2: 用于库存管理的稀缺的人力和财力资源本来可以更为有效的运用于景观保护工作（这项工作从长远来看可以通过出售生态系统服务而逐步实现自我维系 ） 。

column1: Finally, burning ivory worth millions of dollars has an undeniable symbolic impact.
column2: 最后，焚毁价值成百上千万美元的象牙能够带来无可辩驳的象征性冲击。

column1: It sends a clear message: Ivory belongs to elephants and to no one else.
column2: 它向外界传递了一个明确的信号：象牙只属于大象，而不属于任何人。

column1: And it makes clear that elephants are worth more alive than dead.
column2: 它清楚地告诉人们大象活着比死去更有价值。

column1: Indeed, elephants’ value is anything but symbolic.
column2: 事实上，大象绝不仅仅具备象征性价值。

column1: Elephants are a keystone species for preserving important ecosystems.
column2: 大象是保护重要生态系统的关键物种。

column1: And yet rampant poaching is destroying elephant populations across Africa, killing, on average, 30,000 a year.
column2: 但猖獗的偷猎活动正在毁灭整个非洲大陆的大象种群，平均每年遭到猎杀的大象多达30,000头。

column1: Poaching also has a negative impact on communities, benefiting a few at the expense of the many.
column2: 偷猎活动还对社会产生了负面影响，以牺牲多数人的代价来满足少数人的利益。

column1: Recent research has shown that community conservancies (areas set aside for wildlife conservation) in northern Kenya are highly effective forms of landscape (and therefore elephant) preservation, provided the right incentives are in place.
column2: 最近的研究已经表明只要建立正确的激励机制，肯尼亚北部的社会保护区（也就是专门划定用于保护野生动物的区域）是景观（以及大象）保护的一种非常有效的形式。

column1: This is important because in countries like Kenya and Tanzania, the majority of wildlife exists outside formally protected areas.
column2: 这一点之所以重要，是因为在肯尼亚和坦桑尼亚这样的国家，绝大多数野生动物都生活在正式划定的保护区以外。

column1: Kenya should be commended for making a wise – and efficient – decision.
column2: 肯尼亚理当因为作出这一明智 — — 而且高效的 — — 决策而受到赞誉。

column1: Its neighbors, as well as countries farther south, should follow its example.
column2: 其邻国以及更加靠南的非洲国家应当以其为榜样跟进。

column1: Ideally, all range-state countries should destroy their stockpiles to overcome the regional collective action problem.
column2: 理想状况下，所有地区国家均应销毁象牙库存以解决地区集体行动问题。

column1: Doing so would send an unmistakable signal to the global market: Ivory is not for sale, not now and not in the future.
column2: 这样做会向全球市场发出明确无误的信号：即象牙不允许出售，无论是现在还是将来。

column1: A Massacre in Africa
column2: 非洲大屠杀

column1: LONDON – Why is it that schools and schoolchildren have become such high-profile targets for murderous Islamist militants?
column2: 伦敦—为什么学校和在校学生成为杀人不眨眼的伊斯兰教武装分子如此的突出目标？

column1: The 147 students killed in an attack by the extremist group Al-Shabab at a college close to Kenya’s border with Somalia are only the latest victims in a succession of outrages in which educational institutions have been singled out for attack.
column2: 极端组织青年党（Al-Shabab）最近袭击了一所肯尼亚靠近索马里边境地区的学院、杀戮147名学生。 这只是一连串以教育机构为袭击目标的暴行中的最新一次。

column1: Last December, in Peshawar, Pakistan, seven Taliban gunmen strode from classroom to classroom in the Army Pubic School, executing 145 children and teachers.
column2: 去年12月，在巴基斯坦白沙瓦（Peshawar ） ， 七名塔利班分子持枪在军人子弟学校（Army Pubic School）杀害了145名儿童和教师。

column1: More recently, as more than 80 pupils in South Sudan were taking their annual exams, fighters invaded their school and kidnapped them at gunpoint.
column2: 最近又有80多名南苏丹学生在期末考试时遭遇武装分子闯入学校，持枪将他们绑架。

column1: Their fate has been to join the estimated 12,000 students conscripted into children’s militias in the country’s escalating civil war.
column2: 他们的命运是成为童子军加入该国愈演愈烈的内战，据估计和他们命运相同的学生已有12,000人。
