column1: Every day, another once-vibrant Syrian school is bombed or militarized, with two million children now in refugee camps or exiled to makeshift tents or huts.
column2: 每一天，都有曾经生气勃勃的叙利亚学校被轰炸或武装入侵，200万儿童沦落在难民营或居住在临时搭建的帐篷和小屋中。

column1: And next week will mark the first anniversary of the extremist group Boko Haram’s night-time abduction of 276 schoolgirls from their dormitories in Chibok, in Nigeria’s northern Borno state.
column2: 一年前的下周，极端组织博科圣地（Boko Haram）趁夜间闯入尼日利亚北部的博尔诺州（Borno）奇伯克（Chibok）的一间学校，从学生宿舍中绑架了276名女生。

column1: With continued assaults on local schools, Boko Haram has escalated its war against education – making the last two years Nigeria’s worst in terms of the violation of children’s rights.
column2: 博科圣地不断地袭击当地学校，掀起了一场针对教育的战争 — — 也让过去两年成为尼日利亚儿童权利侵害最严重的时期。

column1: In the past five years, there have been nearly 10,000 attacks on schools and educational establishments.
column2: 在过去五年中，发生了近10,000起袭击学校和教育机构事件。

column1: Why is it that schools, which should be recognized as safe havens, have become instruments of war, and schoolchildren have become pawns in extremists’ strategies?
column2: 为什么应该被视作安全港的学校会成为战争的工具，学生会成为极端分子战略中的人质？

column1: And why have such attacks been treated so casually – the February abduction in South Sudan elicited barely any international comment – when they in fact constitute crimes against humanity.
column2: 为什么我们对待这些袭击事件如此心不在焉 — — 2月份的南苏丹绑架案几乎没有任何国际评论 — — 它们事实上已经构成了人道主义犯罪行为。

column1: In the depraved minds of terrorists, each attack has its own simple logic; the latest shootings, for example, are revenge by Al-Shabab for Kenya’s intervention in Somalia’s civil war.
column2: 在恐怖分子的卑鄙思维中，每一次袭击都有一个自身的简单理由；比如，最近的枪击事件是青年党对肯尼亚干预索马里内战的报复。

column1: But all of the recent attacks share a new tactic – to create shock by exceeding what even many of the most hardened terrorists had previously considered beyond the pale.
column2: 但所有的最近袭击都包含了一项新策略：通过让许多最死硬的恐怖分子此前都感到无法接受的暴行制造冲击波。

column1: They have become eager to stoke publicity from the public outrage at their methods, even transmitting images of their crimes around the world.
column2: 他们渴望通过引起公众对他们所作所为的激愤获得知名度，他们甚至将暴行影像向全世界展示。

column1: But there is an even more powerful explanation for this spate of attacks on children.
column2: 但对于这一袭击儿童的潮流，还有另一个更有力的解释。

column1: A now-common extremist claim is that education is acculturating African and Asian children to Western ways of thinking (Boko Haram in the local Hausa dialect means “Western education is a sin”).
column2: 目前，一个常见的极端主义主张是教育让非洲和亚洲儿童与西方思维同化（博科圣地在其所在地豪萨（Hausa）方言中的意思是“西方教育是一种罪恶 ” ） 。

column1: Moreover, extremists like Boko Haram and Al-Shabab calculate that they can attack schools with impunity.
column2: 此外，博科圣地和青年党这样的极端组织认为他们可以袭击学校并且逍遥法外。

column1: Hospitals tend to be more secure, because the Geneva Conventions give them special protection as safe havens – a fact often recognized by even the most murderous of terrorist groups.
column2: 医院总是更加安全，因为日内瓦公约授予医院作为 安全港的特殊保护 — — 甚至是最杀人不眨眼的极端组织一般也承认这一事实。

column1: Until recently, we have done far too little to protect schools and prevent their militarization during times of conflict.
column2: 到目前为止，我们在保护学校、防止学校在冲突期间军事化方面做得远远不够。

column1: But, just as wars should never be waged by targeting hospitals, so combatants should never violate schools.
column2: 但是，正如战争绝不应该因为将目标对准医院而起，交战双方也绝不应该侵犯学校。

column1: Once slow to respond, the world is now acting.
column2: 曾经反应缓慢的现在正在采取行动。

column1: Thirty countries have recently signed up to the Lucens or Safe School guidelines, which instruct their military authorities how to prevent schools from being used as instruments of war.
column2: 最近，三十个国家签署了Lucens或安全学校指引，该指引指导军事当局如何防止学校沦为战争工具。

column1: Leila Zerrougui, Special Representative of the UN Secretary-General for Children and Armed Conflict, recommends designating abductions of children from schools a “trigger violation” for the naming of terrorist organizations in the secretary-general’s annual report to the Security Council.
column2: 联合俄国秘书长儿童和武装冲突特别代表雷拉·泽罗圭（Leila Zerrougui）建议将从学校绑架儿童作为将极端组织列入联合国秘书长安理会年报的“触发事件 ” 。

column1: And, thanks to the United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF), the Global Coalition to Protect Education from Attack, the Global Business Coalition for Education, and former Nigerian Finance Minister Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala, Nigeria has now piloted the concept of safe schools. This has meant funding school guards, fortifications, and surveillance equipment to reassure parents and pupils that everything possible is being done to ensure their school is safe to attend.
column2: 此外，在联合国儿童基金会（UNICEF ） 、 全球保护教育免受袭击联盟（Global Coalition to Protect Education from Attack ） 、 全球教育商业联盟（Global Business Coalition for Education）和前尼日利亚外交部长恩戈齐·奥孔约-伊维拉（Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala）的努力下，尼日利亚已经成为安全学校概念的先锋。

column1: Now, under Prime Minister Muhammad Nawaz Sharif, Pakistan is adopting the safe school plan.

In a year when there are more local conflicts than ever – and in which children have become among the first (and forgotten) casualties – it is urgent that we make stopping attacks on schools a high priority.
column2: 在地方冲突比以往任何时候都更频繁的一年里，在儿童成为首要受害群体（并且惨遭遗忘）的一年里，对于我们来说，将阻止袭击学校作为重中之重十分紧迫。

column1: In dark times, children and parents continue to view their schools as sanctuaries, as places of normality and safety.
column2: 在黑暗时期，儿童和父母们继续将学校视为圣殿，视为道德和安全之所。

column1: When law and order break down, people need not only material help – food, shelter, and health care – but also hope.
column2: 当法律和秩序崩溃时，人们需要的不仅是物质帮助 — — 食品、住所和医疗等 — — 还有希望。

column1: There is no more powerful way to uphold the vision of a future free from conflict than by keeping schools running.
column2: 没有比让学校正常运行更强大的捍卫没有冲突的未来愿景的办法了。

column1: A Loss for Kenyan Democracy
column2: 肯尼亚民主的教训

column1: NAIROBI – On March 27, eight columnists from the Nation Media Group resigned from the Nation newspaper, citing a lack of editorial independence.
column2: 内罗毕—3月27日，八位国家传媒集团（Nation Media Group）专栏作家从《国家 》 （ Nation）报辞职，原因是缺乏编辑独立性。

column1: For Kenya’s largest daily, the exodus of top talent was the latest blow to an already tarnished reputation.
column2: 对这份肯尼亚最大的日报来说，顶尖人才的出走只是对其已经败坏的名誉的最新一击。

column1: The newspaper has suffered a series of embarrassing episodes in recent months, including high-profile firings, mass layoffs by the parent company, and allegations of state meddling in the editorial process.
column2: 近几个月来 ， 《 国家》经历了一系列尴尬，包括高管遭遇解雇、母公司大量裁员，以及关于国家干预编辑过程的指控。

column1: But the resignations were more than another repudiation of a once-vaunted institution; they were a reminder that the media remain a powerful player in Kenya’s fledgling democracy.
column2: 但辞职事件的意义不仅仅是一个曾经名高望重的机构的唾弃；它提醒我们，媒体仍然是初出茅庐的肯尼亚民主的强大参与者。

column1: When governments constrain journalists – in Kenya or elsewhere – they do so at their own peril.
column2: 当政府控制记者时 — — 不论在肯尼亚还是在其他地方 — — 都会自食其果。

column1: Like many African countries, Kenya has a long tradition of what might be called “activist journalism” – the dissemination of news and ideas to inspire political or social action.
column2: 同许多非洲国家一样，肯尼亚有相当长的可称之为“积极新闻 ” （ activist journalism）的传统 — — 传播新闻和思想启发政治或社会行动。

column1: The practice has its roots in anti-colonialism; when the Nation was founded in 1960, it joined other pan-African publications like the New African and Drum to oppose colonial rule.
column2: 这一行为有其反殖民主义根源；1960年《国家》创立时，便和《新非洲人 》 （ New African）和《鼓声 》 （ Drum）等泛非洲出版物一道反对殖民统治。

column1: By giving Kenyans a platform to voice their dissent, the Nation – led by its journalists – helped protesters articulate the ideas, slogans, and catchphrases that animated their movements.
column2: 《国家》给了肯尼亚人一个发出异见的平台，在它的记者的领导下，它帮助示威群众构思概念、口号和标语，生动展现他们的运动。

column1: For many columnists, simply writing for these magazines was an act of resistance.
column2: 对许多专栏作家来说，为这些杂志写作便是一种抵抗活动。

column1: In the West, activist journalism carries a negative connotation, suggesting bias.
column2: 在西方，积极新闻含有贬义，暗指偏见。

column1: But in Africa, this type of journalism has historically kept the media honest by forcing owners to focus more on public good than on profit.
column2: 但在非洲，这种新闻在历史上通过迫使所有者更多地关注公共利益而非利润，从而保持媒体的诚实。

column1: In Kenya, however, this model is being eroded by the flow of public funds into private media outlets in advertising and through increasing repression.
column2: 但在肯尼亚，这一模式因为公共资金在私人媒体上做广告以及日益激烈的镇压而受到制约。

column1: The media industry in Kenya is more lucrative than in most African countries, which has led some to assume that Kenya’s press is free.
column2: 肯尼亚传媒业比大部分非洲国家利润更高，这让一些人认为肯尼亚的媒体是自由的。

column1: But, increasingly, the opposite is true.
column2: 但情况日益与此相反。

column1: Many media companies are dependent on government advertising revenue, and, according to the Committee to Protect Journalists, this spending is being used as leverage by the authorities to censor unfavorable coverage.
column2: 许多媒体公司依赖政府广告收入，据保护记者委员会（Committee to Protect Journalists ） ， 这笔支出被当局用来审查不利的报道。

column1: This is one element of the “state capture of the media” that the eight Nation columnists cited in resigning.
column2: 这就是八位辞职《国家》专栏作家所说的“国家俘虏媒体”的要素之一。

column1: To be sure, official censorship is not new in Kenya.
column2: 平心而论，官方审查在肯尼亚不是新鲜事。

column1: After an attempted coup in 1982, many smaller newspapers were shut down by the state, and between 1988 and 1990, at least 20 newspapers were forced to cease publication permanently.
column2: 1982年未遂政变后，许多小报纸被国家关闭，1988—1990年间，至少有20家报纸被迫永久停止发行。

column1: And yet, even during periods of government repression, savvy journalists have always found audiences for their dissenting views.
column2: 但是，即使在政府压迫时期，聪明的记者也总能找到异见观点的受众。

column1: During Kenya’s democracy movement in the 1990s, one of the most influential was Wahome Mutahi, a humorist who skirted state control to parody the authoritarian president, Daniel Toroitich arap Moi.
column2: 20世纪90年代肯尼亚民主运动年其间，最有影响力人之一是幽默作家瓦赫姆·木塔希（Wahome Mutahi ） ， 他绕过国家管制，模仿极权总统莫伊。

column1: Mutahi eventually spent 15 months in the infamous Nyayo House torture chambers as punishment for his writings.
column2: 木塔希最终因为他的文字而在臭名昭著的那雅约大楼（Nyayo House）经历了15个月的折磨。

column1: Kenyan media experienced a revival in the post-Moi era; by 2012, the country had 301 radio stations and 83 television stations, up from only three television networks in the 1990s.
column2: 莫伊下台后，肯尼亚媒体经历了复兴；到2012年，肯尼亚有301家广播台和83家电视台，而20世纪90年代时只有三个电视网络。

column1: But the growth in media outlets and liberalization of the country’s politics did not translate into more press freedom.
column2: 但新闻媒体的增长和国家政治的自由化并未转化为更多新闻自由。

column1: Instead, after a brief reprieve between successful elections in 2002 and post-election violence in 2007, journalists were targeted once more.
column2: 相反，在从成功的2002年选举到2007年选举后暴力期间的短暂放松后，记者再一次成为目标。

column1: Crackdowns have ranged from the severe – including detention, torture, and disappearances – to the subtle.
column2: 镇压有的严酷 — — 包括羁押、拷打和消灭 — — 有的微妙。

column1: For example, when the political cartoonist Godfrey Mwampembwa, known as Gado, was forced from his post at the Nation in 2016, his bosses didn’t explicitly fire the newspaper’s most popular contributor.
column2: 比如，2016年政治漫画家古德弗雷·姆万彭瓦（Godfrey Mwampembwa，以加多（Gado）的名字为人所知）被迫从《国家》的岗位上离职。 他的老板并没有直接炒掉这位最受欢迎的供稿人的鱿鱼。

column1: Rather, they simply refused to renew his contract when it expired.
column2: 相反，他只是合同到期不续签而已。 同样的事情也发生在大卫·恩迪（David Ndii）身上。

column1: The same thing happened to David Ndii, an economist and opposition-affiliated columnist for the Sunday Nation.
column2: 恩迪是一位经济学家为《周日国家 》 （ Sunday Nation）撰写反对意见专栏。

column1: But these dismissals pale in comparison to a government-imposed blackout in early February.
column2: 但这些离职与2月初的政府行动相比只是小巫见大巫。

column1: To prevent journalists from reporting on a political rally by then-opposition leader Raila Odinga, the Kenyan government forced three private television stations off the air for days, ignoring court orders to end the blockade.
column2: 为了阻止记者报道当时的反对派领导人雷拉·奥丁加（Raila Odinga）所举行的示威，肯尼亚政府强迫三家私人电视台停播多日，完全无视法院停止播送管制的裁决。

column1: Journalists at one station, Nation Television, huddled in their offices as they coordinated with lawyers and sought to avoid arrest.
column2: 其中一家电视台国家电视台（Nation Television）的记者们被堵在办公室中，与律师合作寻求避免被捕。

column1: When the dust eventually settled, executives from all three networks had resigned.
column2: 事件过去后，所有三甲电视网络的高管都辞去了职务。

column1: Without courageous, pioneering journalists, Kenya’s pro-democracy movement may never have succeeded.
column2: 如果没有敢为天下先的记者，肯尼亚的亲民主运动可能永远不会成功。

column1: Activist columnists helped the public understand political decisions by making policy accessible.
column2: 积极专栏作家普及了政策，帮助公众理解政治决定。

column1: In Mutahi’s case, the use of his own family in his parodies was a device intended to demonstrate that petty domestic despotism was no different from the political tyranny orchestrated by an autocratic president.
column2: 在木塔希的例子中，在模仿中用自己的家人是一个策略，意在证明小家的独裁与政治暴君式的极权总统没有什么区别。

column1: Kenyans need similar means of reflection today.
column2: 如今，肯尼亚人需要类似的思考方式。

column1: And yet, just when the country’s democratic institutions could most benefit from such a mirror, those who have historically held it up now believe they have no alternative but to put it down.
column2: 但是，就在肯尼亚民主制度可以成为这面明镜的最大受益者的同时，在历史上坚持这样做的人现在却相信他们别无选择，只能镇压。

column1: For Kenya, the very public decline of the Nation has come at a high cost.
column2: 对肯尼亚来说 ， 《 国家》的公开陨落代价高昂。

column1: But it has also demonstrated that press freedom means much more than letting journalists say what they want, when they want, and how they want.
column2: 但这也说明，新闻自由远不止于让记者言所欲言，随时发言，不拘一格。

column1: It also means holding media owners accountable.
column2: 新闻自由还意味着问责媒体所有者。

column1: A highly competitive electoral system framed by a compromised media is more likely to fuel dissent than to stem it, and Kenya’s democracy will suffer so long as the country’s stewards of public enlightenment turn their backs on it.
column2: 一个由妥协的媒体制定的高度竞争性的选举制度更有可能助推而不是阻止异见，而肯尼亚的民主将因为肯尼亚公众启蒙的领航者的倒行逆施而蒙受损失。

column1: Good Fences Make Safe Species
column2: 好隔离制造安全物种

column1: NAIROBI – African countries are often criticized for failing to meet their environmental challenges.
column2: 内罗毕—非洲国家常常被批评没有很好应对环境挑战。

column1: Observers often cite loss of habitat in the face of population growth, land degradation, and industrialization.
column2: 观察者常用的论据包括人口增长导致栖息地收缩、土地退化以及工业化。

column1: And then there is the most frequent charge of all: that an increase in poaching is endangering species such as elephants and rhinos.
column2: 还有最常用的指责：非法狩猎的日渐增加正在威胁大象和犀牛等物种的生存。

column1: In Kenya, however, an innovative and extensive conservation project is underway.
column2: 但是，在肯尼亚，人们已开始实施一项创新性大范围保护措施。

column1: Begun in the Aberdare mountains in central Kenya, “Rhino Ark,” originally conceived to protect the highly endangered black rhino from the ravages of poachers, is supported by the very people who might have resisted it: the local communities in some of the country’s most productive farming areas.
column2: 这项称为“犀牛方舟 ” （ Rhino Ark）措施从肯尼亚中部的亚伯达（Aberdare）山区开始，初衷是为了保护高度濒危的黑犀牛免遭偷猎，并得到了最有可能反对它的人 — — 肯尼亚产量最高的农场地区的本地居民的支持。

column1: In 1988, conservationists decided to finance and build an electrified fence to protect an area of the Aberdare National Park bordering smallholder farms.
column2: 1988年，环保人士决定筹资兴建电网以保护毗邻小农农场的亚伯达国家公园。

column1: The fence was designed to prevent intrusion from the human population and degradation of the park’s habitat.
column2: 这条电网是为了防止人类闯入保护区和国家公园栖息地的退化。

column1: But it also protected the farmers, whose crops were regularly being destroyed by marauding elephant and other wildlife.
column2: 但它也保护了农民，此前他们的庄稼常常被大象和其他野生动物破坏。

column1: Local farmers welcomed the initiative, which influenced the decision to expand the fence to surround the perimeter of the entire Aberdare range.
column2: 本地农民很欢迎这项措施，这促使肯尼亚决定将电网范围扩大，将整个亚伯达山区包括进来。

column1: The Aberdare Mountains, encompassing 2,000 square kilometers of indigenous forest and vital water catchment areas, as well as a national park, are vital to Kenya.
column2: 亚伯达山区包括2,000平方公里的天然森林和水源汇集区，以及一个国家公园，对肯尼亚来说至关重要。

column1: Four of the country’s largest rivers, flowing north, west, east and south, begin there, providing water and power to seven major towns, including the capital, Nairobi.
column2: 肯尼亚的四条最大河流分别从东南西北四个方向汇聚在此，为大城镇提供水和电力，包括首都内罗毕。

column1: On the mountains’ lower slopes, four million farmers benefit from rich soil and plentiful rainfall.
column2: 在山区地势较低的地方生活着四百万农民，接受着肥沃的土壤和充足的降水的馈赠。

column1: In the foothills and high slopes, 30% of Kenya’s tea and 70% of its coffee are produced.
column2: 山脚和高坡出产了肯尼亚30%的茶叶和70%的咖啡。

column1: For 21 years, the fence around the Aberdares was painstakingly built, supported mainly by Kenya’s corporate sector, individual donors, and innovative fundraising exercises such as the Rhino Charge, an off-road motor event that has captured the Kenyan public’s imagination and annually raises more than $1 million.
column2: 21年来，环绕亚伯达的电网的建设可谓费尽心思，其资金主要来自肯尼亚企业、个人捐赠和创新性筹资活动。 后者包括一项名为“犀牛冲锋 ” （ Rhino Charge）的筹资运动，这次越野车比赛吸引了肯尼亚公众的想象力，每年筹资超过100万美元。

column1: But, by the time the fully electrified fence was completed, in 2009, the government, under then-President Mwai Kibaki, had become an essential partner, with the Kenya Wildlife Service (KWS) and the Kenya Forest Service (KFS) deeply involved in the project.
column2: 但是，到2009年电网全部建成时，时任总统齐贝吉（Mwai Kibaki）的政府已成为最重要的合作方，肯尼亚野生动物协会（KWS）和肯尼亚森林协会（KFS）也深深卷入了这一工程。

column1: With Kenyan government backing, Rhino Ark has been able to turn its attention to other forested but degraded areas – such as Mount Eburu in the Mau Forests Complex, overlooking Lake Naivasha, and Mount Kenya, a World Heritage Site that has been heavily affected by human-wildlife conflicts.
column2: 在肯尼亚政府的支持下，犀牛方舟得以将注意力转向其他有森林覆盖但已退化的地区 — — 比如鸟瞰纳伊瓦沙湖（Lake Naivasha）马乌林地（Mau Forests Complex）厄布鲁山（Mount Eburu）和饱受人与野生动物冲突困扰的世界遗���肯尼亚山（Mount Kenya ） 。

column1: The 45-kilometer Mount Eburu fence was completed last year.
column2: 45公里长的厄布鲁山电网去年完工。

column1: The Mount Kenya fence, at 450 kilometers, will be longer than the Aberdares’ project and is now making rapid progress, with 80 kilometers completed.
column2: 肯尼亚山电网长达450公里，比亚伯达工程还要长，目前正在迅速推进中，已完成80公里。

column1: Of course, building a fence is just the beginning.
column2: 当然，建设电网只是开始。

column1: Fences must be managed and maintained (some of the original fence posts in the Aberdares, for example, have had to be replaced), wildlife corridors must be developed, and local communities require support.
column2: 电网必须得到管理和维护（比如，亚伯达山区最初建设的一些电网桩已经需要更换 ） ， 还必须保留野生动物迁徙通道，当地社区也需要支持。

column1: All areas are kept under surveillance by air and foot patrols along the fence line – a constant monitoring process with considerable cost implications.
column2: 所有地区都由电网空中和地面巡逻队负责监督 — — 这项长期监督活动将带来巨大的成本。

column1: The benefits, however, are significant.
column2: 但是，收益也是巨大的。

column1: The fences keep the authorities fully alert to any incidents of poaching – particularly of elephant, rhino, and exceptionally rare species such as the Mountain Bongo antelope, which now exist only in the Aberdares, Mount Kenya, and the Mau Forests Complex, including Mount Eburu.
column2: 电网能够向当局报警任何偷猎事件 — — 特别是大象、犀牛和山地紫羚等濒危物种。 后者现在只生存于亚伯达、肯尼亚山和包括厄布鲁山在内的马乌林地。

column1: Local communities are involved in all areas of fence and forest maintenance.
column2: 在所有电网和森林保护区都存在当地社区。

column1: In effect, they are the guardians of the fences, keeping them clear of vegetation and repairing damage caused by wildlife and other factors – and learning new skills in the process.
column2: 事实上，他们是电网的守护者，负责清理周边植被和修复因野生动物和其他因素造成的损坏情况 — — 并在此过程中学习新技能。

column1: The longer-term goal is the protection of these critical forests in perpetuity.
column2: 长期目标是永远保护这些关键森林。

column1: To achieve this, endowment funds are being established as public-private partnerships, bringing together the Rhino Ark, the KWS and the KFS, and representatives from local communities.
column2: 为了实现这一目标，肯尼亚正在建立捐赠基金，由犀牛方舟、KWS和KFS，以及来自地方社区的代表共同商议。

column1: So-called trust deeds, set up locally, will manage these funds, which will eventually pay for the fences’ maintenance.
column2: 所谓的（当地）信托契约将负责管理这些资金，最终用于电网的维护。

column1: The Aberdare Trust Deed became effective last October.
column2: 亚伯达信托契约已于去年10月生效。

column1: The region’s hard-working farmers can now see added value in co-existing with the fence.
column2: 该地区勤劳的农民现在已经看见与电网共存所带来的新价值。

column1: Since the completion of the Aberdares fence, the value of local farmers’ land has quadrupled.
column2: 自亚伯达电网完工以来，当地农民的土地价值翻了两番。

column1: They can work their fields in peace for the first time in more than a century, their children can walk to and from school without fear of being attacked by wild animals, and conservation is now part of the curriculum.
column2: 一百多年来，他们第一次可以平静地耕种土地，他们的孩子可以往返学校而不必担心受到野生动物的袭击，而环境保护也已列入学校课程。

column1: The main lesson is straightforward: Good fences are good for everyone.
column2: 主要教训显而易见：好的隔离对所有人都好。

column1: Will the Kerch Blockade Make Putin Great Again?
column2: 刻赤封锁能让普京再次伟大吗？

column1: MOSCOW – Millions of people have now watched a video of a Russian coast guard vessel ramming a Ukrainian tugboat in the Kerch Strait. For some Russians, this show of force undoubtedly aroused a sense of pride, much to President Vladimir Putin’s pleasure.
column2: 莫斯科—眼下，已有数百万人观看了刻赤海峡俄罗斯边防船拦截乌克兰拖船的视频，如此展现武力显然激发了一种自豪感，令总统普京感到满意。

column1: But for many others, the footage evoked feelings of fear at the prospect of a full-blown war in Ukraine.
column2: 但对其他很多人来说，这一镜头引起了一种担忧，对乌克兰爆发全面战争的担忧。

column1: Most Russian parents, like parents everywhere, would prefer to send their 18-year-old children to study, not to fight.
column2: 大部分俄罗斯家长和全世界家长一样，更愿意把18岁的孩子送去读书而不是打仗。

column1: The narrative that Russia is under attack has long dominated Kremlin propaganda, with Putin positioning himself as the commander of a fortress besieged – militarily, economically, and even in the domain of international sports – by a hostile West.
column2: 克里姆林宫的宣传向来主要渲染俄罗斯遭到袭击，而普京就是陷入敌对的西方重围的城堡上的指挥官 — — 军事、经济乃至国际体育领域的指挥官。

column1: This propaganda, already building in volume in 2012, after Putin won his third presidential term, reached a crescendo in 2014, after the annexation of Crimea.
column2: 这一宣传在2012年普京赢得第三个总统任期后开始大量出现，2014年吞并克里米亚后更是变本加厉。

column1: So far, there has been no diminuendo, and there is unlikely to be one so long as Putin’s siege narrative strategy continues to yield political dividends.
column2: 目前，这一宣传丝毫没有减弱迹象，而只要普京的围困叙事战略继续产生政治红利，这一状况也不太可能发生改变。

column1: Prior to the annexation of Crimea, his approval rating had dropped to record lows; afterwards, it surged to more than 80%.
column2: 在吞并克里米亚之前，他的支持率曾经降到历史最低点；吞并克里米亚之后，他的支持率一举超过80 % 。

column1: But, since last summer, Putin’s approval ratings have again dropped precipitously, to 66% in October and November.
column2: 但自夏天以来，普京的支持率再次急剧下降，在10到11月份下降至66 % 。

column1: Beyond “making Russia great again” on the international stage, Putin was supposed to improve Russians’ standard of living.
column2: 除了在国际舞台上“让俄罗斯再次伟大 ” ， 普京还应该改善俄罗斯人的生活水平。

column1: Instead, after four years of falling real incomes, the government announced deeply unpopular pension reforms, which included an increase in the retirement age.
column2: 相反，在真实收入连降四年的情况下，政府又退出了非常不受欢迎的退休金改革，包括提高退休年龄。

column1: Addressing Russians’ economic grievances will not be easy.
column2: 解决俄罗斯人的经济仇恨并非易事。

column1: Russia’s economy is under severe strain as a result of the sanctions imposed by the West over Crimea.
column2: 俄罗斯经济因为西方对克里米亚的制裁而承受巨大压力。

column1: More important, Russia’s state-capitalist model has led to weak competition and declining incentives for private investment and entrepreneurship.
column2: 更重要的是，俄罗斯国家资本主义模式导致竞争不足，私人投资和企业家精神激励下降。

column1: With few options for rallying public opinion, Putin may well have decided that it is time to “remind” Russians that they are under attack.
column2: 普京已想不出办法扭转公众看法，可能因此认为是时候“提醒”俄罗斯人他们正在受到攻击了。

column1: (Ukraine’s president, Petro Poroshenko, may also benefit politically from escalating tensions as he seeks to lift his dismal approval ratings ahead of his reelection bid in March.)
column2: （乌克兰总统波罗申科为了在3月的连任竞选中提升其萎靡不振的支持率而选择让紧张局面升级，这也有可能给普京带来政治好处。 ）

column1: To be clear, Ukraine is not attacking Russia.
column2: 明确一点：乌克兰没有攻击俄罗斯。

column1: The Ukrainian naval vessels were in full compliance with a 2003 bilateral treaty governing access to the Kerch Strait and the Sea of Azov.
column2: 乌克兰海军舰只完全遵守约束刻赤海峡和亚速海航行的2003年双边条约。

column1: But, by asserting that the vessels entered Russian waters illegally, not to mention escalating tensions with the West, Putin may be hoping to breathe new life into the siege narrative, thereby inspiring the kind of primitive patriotism on which he has long relied.
column2: 但普京宣称乌克兰舰只非法进入俄罗斯领海，甚至不惜升级与西方的紧张对立，可能是希望借此为围困叙事注入新鲜活力，从而激发他长期所依赖的原始爱国主义。

column1: This could involve direct provocations and potentially even armed clashes.
column2: 这可能包括直接挑衅甚至武装冲突。

column1: But Putin is likely also to draw more public attention to Russia’s military-industrial complex and weapons development, while celebrating past glory, especially the mythologized version of World War II that he has established as a component of his own legitimacy.
column2: 但普京可能会将更多公共目光转向俄罗斯军工行业和武器开发，同时庆祝昔日荣光，特别是传说式的二战叙事 — — 他已经将这打造为自己的遗产的一部分。

column1: For example, the veneration of Stalin, with whom Putin shares more than a few traits, has no doubt contributed to many Russians’ greater willingness to accept repression.
column2: 比如，斯大林崇拜 — — 普京身上颇可以找到一些斯大林的影子 — — 显然让许多俄罗斯人对镇压有了更大的接受度。

column1: The grand military parade commemorating the anniversary of the end of the Siege of Leningrad, planned for January 29 in St. Petersburg, may inspire patriotism, but it will in no way reflect the real drama of the city’s starving inhabitants.
column2: 1月29日，圣彼得堡将举行列宁格勒保卫战胜利大阅兵，这可能会激发爱国主义，但并不能反映这座城市挨饿的居民的真实情景。

column1: Still, Putin’s nationalist appeals may well be insufficient to rally public opinion this time, not least because, among Russians, animosity toward the West – which is now linked to Ukraine in the minds of many – has waned.
column2: 尽管如此，这一回普京的民族主义号召可能不足以刺激民意，因为俄罗斯人对西方的仇视 — — 在许多人看来，现在的西方和乌克兰已经联系在一起 — — 已经消退。

column1: In this sense, another glory-drenched commemoration planned for January in Novgorod might turn out to be more true to history than intended.
column2: 从这个角度讲，另一场计划于1月在诺夫哥罗德举行的光荣历史庆典可能会更加符合历史。

column1: In the “Great Waltz” of July 1944 – which the Novgorod event will reenact – 57,000 German prisoners of war were marched through the streets of Moscow, Stalin’s goal being to humiliate the Germans and remind Muscovites of their hatred for their enemies.
column2: 在1944年7月的“翠堤春晓 ” （ Great Waltz）事件中 — — 诺夫哥罗德的庆典将再现这一幕 — — 57,000名德国战俘在莫斯科游街示众，斯大林此举的目的是羞辱德国人，同时提醒莫斯科人憎恨他们的敌人。

column1: But, in the event, many Russians pitied the prisoners, and some even threw bread to them.
column2: 但是，在这场游行中，许多俄罗斯人同情战俘，甚至向他们投掷面包。

column1: When sociologists from the Levada Center recently asked 20-year-old Russians to identify the country they view as a model for others, they chose Germany, followed by China and Putin’s favorite villain, the United States.
column2: 列瓦达中心（Levada Center）的社会学家最近调查20岁的俄罗斯人哪个国家可以作为其他国家的榜样，他们选择了德国，然后是中国和普京最爱的反派美国。

column1: While these young people support Russian greatness, they define greatness not only in military terms, but also on the basis of economic prosperity and social progress.
column2: 这些年轻人也支持俄罗斯的伟大，但他们所定义的伟大不仅是军事上的伟大，也包括经济繁荣和社会进步等方面。

column1: It does not help that Putin’s foreign-policy gambits have become increasingly dubious.
column2: 普京外交政策主题变得越来越值得怀疑，这绝非好事。

column1: It is hard for many Russians to see why their leaders have channeled so many resources to Syria when there are such pressing challenges at home.
column2: 很多俄罗斯人难以理解他们的领导人为什么要向叙利亚投入如此多的资源，而让他们在国内饱受压力。

column1: Watching a Russian boat ram a Ukrainian boat is no substitute for economic opportunities.
column2: 目睹俄罗斯船只阻挡乌克兰船只并不能代替经济机会。

column1: For a long time, the slogan “we can repeat” – a reference to the Soviet Union’s WWII victory – was popular in Russia.
column2: 长期以来 ， “ 我们能重复”的口号在俄罗斯非常流行，这句话说的是苏联的二战胜利。

column1: But the truth is that we cannot.
column2: 但真相是我们不能。

column1: We lack not only the resources, but also the will to let our young people die fighting another country’s young people.
column2: 我们不但缺少资源，也不愿意让我们的年轻人与另一个国家的年轻人作战而死。

column1: Indeed, the last thing Russians want is to repeat a war that left 27 million of their countrymen dead.
column2: 事实上，俄罗斯人最不想要的就是重复一场让2,700万同胞死亡的战争。

column1: When Shall We Overcome?
column2: 我们何时才会胜利？

column1: NEW YORK – In 1967, riots erupted in cities throughout the United States, from Newark, New Jersey, to Detroit and Minneapolis in the Midwest – all two years after the Watts neighborhood of Los Angeles exploded in violence.
column2: 发自纽约 — — 1967年，在洛杉矶的华兹（Watts）社区出现暴力事件两年后，美国各地 — — 从新泽西州的纽瓦克到中西部明尼阿波利斯的底特律 — — 纷纷爆发了骚乱。

column1: In response, President Lyndon B. Johnson appointed a commission, headed by Illinois Governor Otto Kerner, to investigate the causes and propose measures to address them.
column2: 为此总统林登·约翰逊指派了一个由伊利诺伊州州长奥托·克纳（Otto Kerner）领导的委员会去调查事件成因并提出相应对策。

column1: Fifty years ago, the National Advisory Commission on Civil Disorders (more widely known as the Kerner Commission), issued its report, providing a stark account of the conditions in America that had led to the disorders.
column2: 五十年前，全国民事骚乱咨询委员会（人称克纳委员会）发表一份报告，毫不留情地描述出了骚乱背后的美国社会状况。

column1: The Kerner Commission described a country in which African-Americans faced systematic discrimination, suffered from inadequate education and housing, and lacked access to economic opportunities.
column2: 克纳委员会指出非裔美国人面临着系统性的歧视，遭受着求学无门，住房短缺，经济机会匮乏等种种不公。

column1: For them, there was no American dream.
column2: 对他们来说美国梦是不存在的。

column1: The root cause was “the racial attitude and behavior of white Americans toward black Americans.
column2: 其根源是“美国白人对黑人的种族歧视态度和行为。

column1: Race prejudice has shaped our history decisively; it now threatens to affect our future.”
column2: 种族偏见无疑塑造了我们的历史；但现在又威胁到了我们的未来 。 ”

column1: I was part of a group convened by the Eisenhower Foundation to assess what progress had been made in the subsequent half-century.
column2: 艾森豪威尔基金会曾经召集成立了一个小组，旨在评估在报告出台后的半个世纪中所取得的进展，而笔者则是小组成员之一。

column1: Sadly, the Kerner Commission report’s most famous line – “Our Nation is moving toward two societies, one black, one white – separate and unequal” – still rings true.
column2: 可悲的是，我发现克纳委员会报告中最著名的论断 — — “我们的国家正在分裂成为两个社会群体，一个是黑人，一个是白人 — — 既互相隔离又不平等 ” — —在今天依然有效。

column1: The just-published book based on our efforts, Healing Our Divided Society: Investing in America Fifty Years After the Kerner Report, edited by Fred Harris and Alan Curtis, makes for bleak reading.
column2: 而凝聚了小组研究成果的新书 — — 《治愈我们分裂的社会：在克纳报告发布五十年后的调查》编辑：弗雷德·哈里斯（Fred Harris ） / 艾伦·柯蒂斯（Alan Curtis ） — —并不是一本令人愉悦的读物。

column1: As I wrote in my chapter, “Some problematic areas identified in the Kerner Report have gotten better (participation in politics and government by black Americans – symbolized by the election of a black president), some have stayed the same (education and employment disparities), and some have gotten worse (wealth and income inequality).” Other chapters discuss one of the most disturbing aspects of America’s racial inequality: inequality in securing access to justice, reinforced by a system of mass incarceration largely targeted at African-Americans.
column2: 正如我在自己负责的那章中写道 ： “ 克纳报告中某些问题严重的领域已经得到改善（黑人的政治和政府参与，以一位黑人总统的当选为标志 ） ， 有的保持不变（教育和就业不平等 ） ， 有的则变得更糟（财富和收入不平等 ） ” 书中其他章节则讨论了美国种族不平等中最令人不安的一个方面：确保获取司法公正方面的不平等，而且这种不平等还被一个主要针对非裔美国人的大规模监禁体系所强化。

column1: There is no doubt that the civil rights movement of a half-century ago made a difference.
column2: 毋庸置疑，半个世纪前的民权运动确实实现了一些改变。

column1: A variety of overt forms of discrimination were made illegal.
column2: 各种明显的歧视形式都被定为非法。

column1: Societal norms changed.
column2: 社会规范也有所改变。

column1: But rooting out deep-seated and institutional racism has proven difficult.
column2: 但要铲除根深蒂固且制度化种族主义则相当困难。

column1: Worse, President Donald Trump has exploited this racism and fanned the flames of bigotry.
column2: 更糟糕的是特朗普总统正是利用了这种种族主义并助长了偏见的火焰。

column1: The core message of the new report reflects the great insight of the civil rights leader Martin Luther King, Jr.: achieving economic justice for African-Americans cannot be separated from achieving economic opportunities for all Americans.
column2: 新报告的核心信息印证了民权运动领袖马丁·路德·金的深刻洞见：实现对非裔美国人的经济正义不能与实现所有美国人的经济机会分开。

column1: King called his August 1963 march on Washington, which I joined and at which he delivered his ringing, unforgettable “I Have a Dream” speech, a march for jobs and freedom.
column2: 他将1963年8月在华盛顿的游行 — — 他正是在那里发表了充满力量且令人难忘的“我有一个梦想”演讲，而笔者也参与了游行 — — 称之为一场争取工作和自由的游行。

column1: And yet the economic divide in the US has grown much wider, with devastating effects on those without a college education, a group that includes almost three-quarters of African-Americans.
column2: 然而在此之后美国经济鸿沟却日益拉宽，对那些没有受过大学教育的人产生了毁灭性的影响，而该群体里包含了近3/4的非裔美国人。

column1: Beyond this, discrimination is rampant, if often hidden.
column2: 除此之外歧视现象依然猖獗，而且往往是以隐藏的形式。

column1: America’s financial sector targeted African-Americans for exploitation, especially in the years before the financial crisis, selling them volatile products with high fees that could, and did, explode.
column2: 美国的金融业有针对性地剥削非裔美国人，尤其是在金融危机之前，专门向他们销售一些可能 — — 也最终 — — 崩盘的高费率高波动性产品。

column1: Thousands lost their homes, and in the end, the disparity in wealth, already large, increased even more.
column2: 成千上万的人因此失去了家园，而最终本已巨大的财富差距又被拉宽了许多。

column1: One leading bank, Wells Fargo, paid huge fines for charging higher interest rates to African-American and Latino borrowers; but no one was really held accountable for the many other abuses.
column2: 其中一家主要银行 — — 富国银行 — — 因为向非裔美国人和拉丁裔借款人收取更高利息而遭受巨额罚款；但没有人真正为许多其他侵权行为负责。

column1: Almost a half-century after the enactment of anti-discrimination laws, racism, greed, and market power still work together to the disadvantage of African-Americans.
column2: 在反歧视法出台近半个世纪后，种族主义，贪婪和市场力量仍在一起努力给非裔美国人挖坑。

column1: There are, however, several reasons for hope.
column2: 然而还有几个因素让我们不至于放弃希望。

column1: First, our understanding of discrimination is far better.
column2: 首先我们如今对歧视的理解要深刻得多。

column1: Back then, the Nobel laureate economist Gary Becker could write that in a competitive market, discrimination was impossible; the market would bid up the wage of anyone who was underpaid.
column2: 当年诺贝尔奖经济学奖得主加里·贝克尔（Gary Becker）可以认定在竞争激烈的市场上歧视是不可能存在的；市场会提高所有收入不足者的工资。

column1: Today, we understand that the market is rife with imperfections – including imperfections of information and competition – that provide ample opportunity for discrimination and exploitation.
column2: 今天，我们知道市场充斥着不完善之处 — — 包括信息和竞争的不充分 — — 从而为歧视和剥削提供了充足的机会。

column1: Moreover, we now recognize that the US is paying a high price for inequality, and an especially high price for its racial inequality.
column2: 此外我们现在认识到美国正在为不平等付出高昂的代价，而且在种族不平等的代价尤其高。

column1: A society marked by such divisions will not be a beacon to the world, and its economy will not flourish.
column2: 以这种分裂为特征的社会不会成为世界的灯塔，其经济也无法蓬勃发展。

column1: The real strength of the US is not its military power but its soft power, which has been badly eroded not just by Trump, but also by persistent racial discrimination.
column2: 美国的真正力量并不在于军事而是其软实力，但这已经被特朗普以及持续的种族歧视所严重侵蚀。

column1: Everyone will lose if it is not addressed.
column2: 如果这点无法得到解决，每个人都会成为输家。

column1: The most promising sign is the outpouring of activism, especially from young people, who realize that it is high time that the US lives up to its ideals, so nobly expressed in its Declaration of Independence, that all men are created equal.
column2: 而最有希望的迹象来自于一大批行动起来的人（特别是年轻人 ） ， 他们意识到美国应该奉行自身的理念，正如在《独立宣言》中高尚地申明那样：人生而平等。

column1: A century and a half after the abolition of slavery, the legacy of that system lingers.
column2: 在废除奴隶制一个半世纪之后，这一制度的遗毒却尚未肃清。

column1: It took a century to enact legislation ensuring equal rights; but today, Republican-controlled courts and politicians often renege on that commitment.
column2: 我们花了一个世纪制定法律以确保平等权利; 但如今共和党控制下的法院和政客却经常违背这一承诺。

column1: As I concluded my chapter, “An alternative world is possible. But 50 years of struggle has shown us how difficult it is to achieve that alternative vision.”
column2: 正如我在自己负责的章节末尾所写的那样 ， “ 另一个世界是可能达成的，但是持续50年的抗争已经向我们展现了实现这种替代愿景是多么困难 。 ”

column1: Further progress will require determination, sustained by the faith expressed in the immortal words of the spiritual that became the hymn of the civil rights movement: “We shall overcome.”
column2: 而进一步向前迈进需要坚定的决心，并秉承着已经成为民权运动赞歌的不朽精神口号中所表达的信念 ： “ 我们一定会胜利 。 ”

column1: Kerry and Europe
column2: 凯利和欧洲

column1: Those whom the gods would destroy, they grant their wishes.
column2: 神要毁灭哪些人，就会实现他们的愿望。

column1: Those in Europe and around the world who yearn for a victory by John Kerry in the US presidential election ought to keep that bit of ancient Greek wisdom in mind.
column2: 欧洲和全世界希望约翰·凯利在美国总统大选中获胜的人真该学学这种古希腊智慧。

column1: During the Cold War, America was the natural leader of the Atlantic community, but the price of this leadership was that the US had to accept the autonomy and influence of its European allies.
column2: 冷战期间，美国理所当然成了大西洋地区的领袖，但代价就是不得不承认了欧洲盟国的自治，而且要尊重它们的影响。

column1: After the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001, President Bush embarked on a unilateral foreign policy.
column2: 2001年9月11日发生恐怖袭击后，布什总统开始推行单边外交政策。

column1: The traditional Atlantic alliance was replaced by what the US called "coalitions of the willing," where "the mission determines the coalition," not historic alliances.
column2: 传统上的大西洋区域联盟被美国称为"志愿者同盟"的组织所取代，这里"在联盟中起决定作用的是使命 ， " 而不再是所谓的历史联盟。

column1: This policy divided Europe. It has also fueled deep divisions in the US presidential campaign, with one of the most potent arguments used by Kerry being that he will restore trust between America and its allies; that as president he will recruit international help in Iraq.
column2: 这项政策让欧洲四分五裂，也使美国总统大选产生了严重的分歧，凯利手中最有效的杀手锏就是恢复美国和盟友之间的信任，还有他当总统会为伊拉克问题赢得国际支援。

column1: America undoubtedly needs more allies to bring Iraq's chaos under control and to build an Iraqi state that is seen as legitimate both by Iraqis and the world.
column2: 勿庸置疑，美国要找到更多盟友，才能控制住伊拉克的混乱局势，建起伊拉克和全世界都能接受的合法政府。

column1: Allies are seen as an answer to America's twin credibility and legitimacy deficits in its occupation of Iraq.
column2: 盟友被人们看成美国对伊占领所造成可信性与合法性危机的唯一解决之道。

column1: But can a Kerry-led US get a fresh start in Europe?
column2: 但凯利领导的美国真的能在欧洲重新开始吗？

column1: Will a President Kerry really be able to rally allies to America's side?
column2: 凯利总统真的能把盟友重新召回美国的旗下？

column1: Iraq's mayhem has hardened the antagonism of countries like France and Germany, which led the opposition to the war in the first place.
column2: 对伊拉克的伤害已经加深了法德对我们的敌意，他们最先站出来反对这场战争。

column1: Even countries that rallied to Bush's call for help, like my homeland, Poland, are now wary of their involvement.
column2: 即使是那些响应布什号召的国家，像我的家乡波兰，现在也对自己的决定产生了怀疑。

column1: Consider the attitudes of France and Germany.
column2: 让我们看看法德两国的态度。

column1: Their leaders can scarcely hold their tongues, so badly do they want a Kerry victory.
column2: 他们的领袖很少保持沉默，他们迫切地希望凯利能够获胜。

column1: But they are not going to change their policy to help Kerry win, and they won't change even if he does.
column2: 可他们不会改变政策来帮助凯利，即便他真的当选他们的政策也不会有任何改变。

column1: As a gesture intending to boost Kerry's chances, German Defense Minister Peter Struck suggested that his country might reconsider its position on troops in Iraq.
column2: 为了替凯利创造更多机会，德国国防部长彼得·斯特拉克曾说德国有可能重新考虑自己在向伊拉克派兵问题上的立场。

column1: But Chancellor Gerhard Schröder instantly shot down that trial balloon, declaring: "To be clear, we will send no troops to Iraq."
column2: 但格哈德·施罗德总理立刻打消了这种试探并再次郑重宣布 ： " 坦白地说，我们绝不会派兵到伊拉克 。 "

column1: Actually, Germany, like most European countries, is politically and logistically unable to send meaningful military forces to Iraq.
column2: 实际上，德国和大多数欧洲国家一样，无论从政治还是后勤保障的角度都不可能真正向伊拉克派兵。

column1: France, which did ponder sending 15 000 soldiers to Iraq had the UN given its blessing to the war, is as clear as Schröder.
column2: 法国倒确实考虑过如果这场战争能得到联合国的认可，它会派驻15，000名士兵，在这个问题上，法国的立场和施罗德一样明确。

column1: According to Michel Barnier, France's Foreign Minister, "Neither today, nor tomorrow," will French troops be sent.
column2: 法国外长米歇尔•巴尼耶说 ， " 法国不仅今天不会派兵，明天也还是不会 。 "

column1: Both countries firmly believe that military success in Iraq is impossible.
column2: 法德两国都坚信：军事成功的可能性在伊拉克近乎为零。

column1: So will transatlantic relations remain as poisoned as they are now if Kerry wins?
column2: 那么如果凯利获胜，大西洋关系是否还会像现在一样糟糕？

column1: Is Texas swagger merely to be replaced by the distinguished disdain of a Boston Brahmin?
column2: 凯利当选是否只是波士顿贵族取代了德克萨斯牛皮大王？

column1: This is probably too pessimistic.
column2: 这种观点可能太悲观了。

column1: Europe cannot give an openly negative answer to Kerry's request for help, because that would be a slap in the face to the most pro-European American likely to be elected president anytime soon.
column2: 欧洲无法公开拒绝凯利的援助请求，因为这无异于在可能很快当选美国总统的凯利脸上重重地抽上一记耳光，更何况凯利在总统候选人里与欧洲的关系最为亲密。

column1: Such a rejection would not only put transatlantic relations even more at risk than they are today; it would also put relations between European countries in peril.
column2: 这样的公开拒绝不仅会使大西洋关系变得更加危险，而且还会危及到欧洲国家间的相互关系。

column1: So some compromise must be found should Kerry win.
column2: 因此如果凯利当选，双方必须达成某种形式的妥协。

column1: Fortunately, one is possible.
column2: 幸运的是，我们有个现成的方案。

column1: The first part is purely face-saving: both parties must simply declare their good will.
column2: 首先是纯粹的"面子工程 " ： 双方都必须明确表达自己建立良好关系的意愿。

column1: Today, European leaders are unlikely to throw even that slender lifeline to Bush.
column2: 而今天，欧洲领导人就连甩给布什这样一根救命稻草的可能性都微乎其微。

column1: The reality behind such a declaration is that Europe would deliver low-level military and economic involvement in Iraq.
column2: 声明背后的事实是：欧洲会派少量部队进驻伊拉克，然后再象征性地给点援助。

column1: Most European leaders understand the tiny wiggle room that Kerry will have if elected.
column2: 多数欧洲领袖对凯利当选后狭窄的活动空间心知肚明。

column1: The near certainty that the House of Representatives will be in Republican hands, and perhaps the Senate, too, means that America's Congress will pounce on any supposed attempt by Kerry to "sell out" Bush's war.
column2: 共和党几乎肯定会在众议院选举中获胜，参议院也可能会成为他们的囊中之物，也就是说，凯利任何可能"出卖"布什战争的行为都会遭到美国国会的无情镇压。

column1: So Kerry may put even more pressure on Europe to help out in Iraq than the unilateralist Bush ever did.
column2: 因此与奉行单边主义的布什相比，凯利可能会给欧洲施加更多的压力，以摆脱美国目前在伊拉克陷入的困境。

column1: But there is a second, more fundamental, part to any viable compromise: a redefinition of transatlantic relations.
column2: 但在任何可行的妥协中还有另外一个更重要的部分：那就是重新塑造大西洋地区关系。

column1: The key point here is joint recognition that a fundamental transatlantic community of values exists, and that both sides need each other.
column2: 其中的关键是双方都要认识到大西洋地区国家有着共同的基本价值观，而且双方都需要得到对方的支持。

column1: That transatlantic community must jointly feel responsible for maintaining peace and stability in the world.
column2: 此外还有一点：大西洋地区必须对维护世界的和平与稳定负起共同的责任。

column1: The US must accept this principle, and recognize that Europe is a partner, not merely a servant, whether willing or unwilling, of American orders.
column2: 美国必须接受这一原则，承认欧洲是自己的战略伙伴，而不能不管欧洲愿意与否，都像对待佣人那样强迫它执行命令。

column1: If burdens are to be shared, decisions must be shared as well.
column2: 如果需要共同承担责任，那么就必须共同做出决策。

column1: This will require that America recognize the validity of Europe's view of the Israel-Palestinian conflict as the major roadblock toward a peaceful Middle East. Europe, for its part, must not only show that it feels responsible for the world, but that it is ready and willing to act accordingly by contributing in a significant way to reconstructing Iraq.
column2: 这意味着美国要接受欧洲的看法，即以色列－巴勒斯坦冲突是中东和平最大的绊脚石，而对欧洲来讲，则需要表明它不仅愿意负起责任，还愿意采取相应的行动，为伊拉克重建做出重要的贡献。

column1: Europe's military means may be limited, but it has important experience in peacekeeping and "state building" that can be brought to bear.
column2: 欧洲的军事能力也许有限，但它在维和及"国家建设"方面却有着丰富的经验，能够派上很大的用场。

column1: Is Europe really ready to undertake such an effort if its wish for a Kerry victory comes true?
column2: 如果欧洲真的希望凯利获胜，那么它是否已经做好准备，要完成这样艰巨的任务？

column1: Kerry vs. Bush: Will Reason Prevail?
column2: 凯利对阵布什：理性能否占据上风？

column1: With over 1,000 US deaths in Iraq, and the huge pressures that the occupation of that benighted country has put on American troops around the world, it is clear that - for the first time in decades - foreign policy issues may determine the outcome of a US presidential election.
column2: 随着美国在伊阵亡将士超过千人，以及占领那个蒙昧国家在全球范围内给美军造成的巨大压力，非常明显¾几十年来，外交政策可能首次成为美国总统大选的决定因素。

column1: Ordinary Americans are asking themselves the same questions that people around the world are asking: how should America's global supremacy be used?
column2: 全世界各国人民都在问的问题，现在普普通通的美国人也在问：那就是美国的全球霸权到底该如何使用？

column1: What price must be paid for that supremacy to be maintained?
column2: 为了维持这样的霸权，到底应该付出多大的代价？

column1: What limits on the use of US military power are acceptable or necessary?
column2: 美国军事力量的使用在何种程度上是必要和可以接受的？

column1: These have long been dominant questions in America's strategic debate. But, after the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001, they became confused with another debate, one far more important for a US electorate that feels threatened: how can alliances and multilateral institutions protect Americans?
column2: 这个问题早就成了美国战略讨论的重点，但在2001年911恐怖袭击发生后，这个问题又和感觉受到威胁的美国选民心目中另外一个重要问题发生了混淆：盟国和多边机构怎样才能保护美国人的安全？

column1: John Kerry's great virtue has been to resist confusing the demand for security and peace with the hegemonic impulses of America the hyper-power.
column2: 约翰·凯利最大的优点就是拒绝把对和平安全的需求与希望美国扮演超级大国的霸权冲动混为一谈。

column1: Nationalist and neo-conservative currents within the Bush administration believe that unilateral action best serves US interests because it handcuffs American power the least.
column2: 布什政府中涌动的民族主义和新保守主义浪潮认为：采取单边行动最能保护美国的利益，因为它对美国的军事力量限制最小。

column1: On this view, the security of the US can be guaranteed through energetic military action, with or without allies.
column2: 按照这种观点，不管我们有没有盟友，积极地采取军事行动都最能确保美国的安全。

column1: Hence the Bush administration's tendency to weaken the ties of America's permanent alliances, including those that NATO represents.
column2: 紧接着就有了布什政府削弱美国永久性联盟的错误倾向，甚至连北约联盟都未能幸免。

column1: Unilateral announcement of troop reductions in Europe and Asia, where US forces primarily serve (as in South Korea) to dissuade aggression, can only be seen as a corollary of this tendency.
column2: 单方面宣布在欧亚这些传统驻军地区的裁军计划(比如南朝鲜)来制止侵略，也只能被看成是上述趋势的必然结果。

column1: The Bush doctrine's bedrock notion is that of "pre-emptive war," a doctrine that lacks international legitimacy and that therefore can usually count on only a limited number of allies.
column2: 布什信条的理论基础是"把握战争先机 " ， 这样的原则十分缺乏国际基础，因此能得到的支持肯定也非常有限。

column1: The idea behind pre-emptive wars is that American force should be projected through high-tech, blitzkrieg type wars waged from US soil, or from the soil of uncritical allies.
column2: 把握战争先机背后的理念是：美军应该从美国本土、或不持反对意见的盟国领土发动高科技闪电战。

column1: On this view, NATO is merely to serve as a means to mobilize Europeans to tackle the inevitable postwar stabilization and reconstruction missions - obviating the need for the US to place its forces under NATO command.
column2: 在这种情况下，北约不过是动员欧洲人负起不可推卸的战后稳定和重建责任的一种手段－美国也根本用不着把军队置于北约的领导之下。

column1: This is what happened in Afghanistan.
column2: 阿富汗的情况就是这样。

column1: But as NATO's Secretary General has said, if it is the mission that defines the coalition, then NATO - a permanent alliance - is no longer needed.
column2: 但正如北约秘书长所言，如果这就是北约联盟的所谓使命，那么北约－这个永久性的战略联盟－根本就没有存在的必要。

column1: John Kerry is focused upon the same type of security problems as Bush. This leaves many observers skeptical about the possibility for real change.
column2: 约翰·凯利关注的安全问题和布什一样，这也使不少观察家怀疑他能否带来真正的变化。

column1: Where he differs fundamentally from Bush is in his belief that resolving international problems that affect the US almost always calls for the support of others. He therefore considers the revival of America's alliances to be a key foreign policy priority, and he has proposed that US forces in Iraq should be integrated into a NATO operation, as long as this remains under US command.
column2: 但他与布什最大的不同之处就是相信解决对美国造成重大影响的国际问题几乎无一例外地需要得到别国的支持，他也因此把美国战略联盟的复兴看作是外交政策的重中之重，而且还建议在保持美国领导的前提下，把驻伊美军纳入北约联盟的控制之中。

column1: Acting jointly means that the US will have to take into account other interests and views - views that may not always be in harmony with its own.
column2: 联合行动意味着美国将不得不考虑到别国的利益和看法－尽管这些看法不一定总能与自己保持一致。

column1: America will have to accept a world that is regulated not by the US unilaterally, but by global institutions and permanent alliances.
column2: 美国必须接受不由美国单边控制、而由世界组织和永久性联盟管理的世界。

column1: And the norms and rules that govern international institutions constitute a boundary on American power - and thus as a check on its hegemony.
column2: 如果这样，管理国际组织的原则和惯例就构成了美国权力的界线¾进而也就阻止了美国的霸权企图。

column1: Kerry and a growing number of Americans recognize that accepting limits on US power and the use of military force are a precondition for America's ultimate security, that what binds can also strengthen, and that such limits will reinforce America's ability to tackle the crisis in Iraq.
column2: 凯利和越来越多的美国人都意识到：接受对美国权力和使用军事力量的限制是享受终极安全的前提条件，必要的限制同样能加强美国的力量，而这些限制将增强美国处理伊拉克危机的能力。

column1: Kerry knows that in most cases military power alone cannot be decisive, as there are other dimensions of power - so-called "soft power" - that are essential to resolving crises and establishing peace.
column2: 凯利知道在很多情况下仅有军事实力是不够的，因为还存在其它形式的力量－那就是所谓的"软性力量 " － 这种"软性力量"在解决危机和建立和平方面发挥了关键的作用。

column1: These dimensions include international legitimacy, values (including tolerance), and public opinion.
column2: 上述领域涵盖了国际合法性、价值观（其中也包括容忍）和公众舆论。

column1: The coming US election recalls a famous debate described by Thucydides in his History of the Peloponnesian War, concerning how Athens should respond to the revolt of Mytilene.
column2: 即将举行的美国大选让我想起了修西得底斯在《伯罗奔尼撒战史》中所描绘的一个著名争议，讲的就是雅典人该如何对待米蒂利尼人的反抗。

column1: The vote supported those who felt that "those who make wise decisions are more formidable to their enemies than those who rush madly into strong action."
column2: 最终的表决结果是：多数人认为"做出明智决定的人比采取疯狂行动的人更能让敌人害怕 " 。

column1: Let us hope that reason also prevails this time round.
column2: 让我们希望这次理性同样能够占据上风。

column1: Problem Solving in the Anthropocene
column2: 人类纪的问题解决

column1: STOCKHOLM – Take a deep breath.
column2: 斯托克霍姆—深吸一口气。

column1: Savor it for a moment.
column2: 屏住一段时间。

column1: Now consider this: None of our modern human ancestors ever breathed anything like it – and, the way things are going, nor will our descendants.
column2: 现在，想一想：我们的现代人祖先从未呼吸过类似的空气 — — 以及体验过现在的一切，我们的后代亦是如此。

column1: Since the Industrial Revolution began, human activity has substantially changed the atmosphere’s composition.
column2: 自工业革命开始以来，人类活动极大地改变了大气成分。

column1: Carbon-dioxide levels are higher today than they have been in at least 800,000 years.
column2: 如今，二氧化碳水平至少比过去80万年都要高。

column1: The amount of nitrogen and sulfur circulating through the Earth system has doubled.
column2: 进入地球循环系统的氮和硫的数量也翻了一番。

column1: The ocean’s pH is changing at an unprecedented rate, reaching levels of acidity that marine organisms have not experienced in the last 20 million years.
column2: 海洋pH值以前所未有的速度改变着，目前的酸度是过去2000万年的海洋生物从未体验过的。

column1: Clearly, humans – who now occupy almost 40% of the planet’s ice-free land surface – are shaping many of the planet’s fundamental processes.
column2: 显然，人类 — — 目前占领了地球无冰覆盖地表的近40 % — —正在决定许多地球的基本过程。

column1: According to Nobel laureate Paul Crutzen, this shift is so profound that it amounts to the beginning of a new epoch: the Anthropocene.
column2: 诺贝尔奖获得者克鲁岑指出，这一变化是如此之大，足以开启一个新纪元 — — 人类纪。

column1: While some scientists believe that the Anthropocene actually began when humans started farming and domesticating animals, others (including me) consider it to be a more recent development.
column2: 一些经济学家认为人类纪实际上从人类从事农业、驯化动物时便已开始，也有科学家（包括我）认为人类纪是更晚才发展出现的。

column1: But, regardless of when the Anthropocene began, it is clear that humanity’s impact on the planet increased substantially after World War II’s end.
column2: 但是，不管人类纪何时开始，显然人类对地球的影响在二战以后迅速地增加了。

column1: Indeed, around 1950, the world seems to have reached a tipping point, with practically every factor that heightens humanity’s impact on the planet – population, GDP, fertilizer use, the proliferation of telephones, and paper consumption, to name only a few – beginning to increase rapidly.
column2: 事实上，1950年前后的世界正处在引爆点，从实际而言，每一个代表人类对地球影响的因子 — — 人口、GDP、化肥使用量、电话普及度、纸张消费，以上仅仅是一些例子 — — 都开始快速增长。

column1: During this period, which the scientist Will Steffen dubbed the “Great Acceleration,” the human population became sufficiently large and connected, with high enough consumption, to become a major global force.
column2: 在此期间 — — 科学家威尔·斯特芬（Will Steffen）称之为“大加速 ” — —人口变得众多，人际联系变得紧密，消费变得庞大，足以成为主要全球推动力。

column1: In a 2009 study, scientists concluded that, by crossing any of nine “planetary boundaries” – climate change, biodiversity loss, disruption of nitrogen and phosphorus cycles, land use, freshwater extraction, ocean acidification, ozone depletion, atmospheric aerosol loading, and chemical pollution – humans would increase the risk of fundamentally changing the Earth system.
column2: 在一份2009年的研究中，科学家指出，九大“地球边界 ” — —气候变化、生物多样性损失、氮和磷循环的破坏、土地使用、清洁水抽取、海洋酸化、臭氧耗竭、大气悬浮微粒负载和化学污染 — — 都已被人类突破，人类也因此增加了地球系统发生根本性变化的风险。

column1: Given that these boundaries are closely interlinked, allowing trends toward any of them to continue, especially at the current rate, would drive the environment into unknown territory, potentially causing serious damage to the systems that underpin human survival.
column2: 这些边界彼此之间联系十分紧密，因此九个方向中任何一个趋势继续维持下去，特别是以当前速度继续维持下去的话，环境将发生未可知的变化，特别是，人类赖以生存的系统可能受到严重损害。

column1: In order to cope with the unique challenges of the Anthropocene, humans need a new approach to management and strategic decision-making.
column2: 为了应对人类纪特有的挑战，人类需要新的管理方针和战略性决策。

column1: Developing successful strategies will require abandoning long-held assumptions that worked in the past, but that have become counterproductive myths today.
column2: 发展成功的战略需要抛弃过去一直有效、但如今已适得其反的长期假设。

column1: One such myth is that it is best to tackle one problem at a time with straightforward, targeted solutions.
column2: 假设之一是最好以直接、定向的方案每次解决一个问题。

column1: While this approach may be appealing, it is inadequate to address today’s most pressing issues.
column2: 这一方针看上去颇具吸引力，但并不足以解决当今最紧迫的问题。

column1: For example, producing and delivering nutritious food consistently to upwards of nine billion people by mid-century has implications for water and energy consumption, agricultural development and land use, the nitrogen and phosphorus cycles, and ocean acidification, not to mention biodiversity loss, such as through overfishing.
column2: 比如，为到本世纪中叶将跨越九十亿门槛的全体人口不断地生产和运送有营养的食物将影响水和能源消费、农业发展和土地使用、��和磷循环以及海洋酸化，更不用说生物多样性损失了（比如过度渔业捕捞行为 ） 。

column1: Given this, the Green Revolution’s narrow, production-focused approach cannot overcome food insecurity in the future, even though it produced truly impressive output increases in the past.
column2: 因此，绿色革命的专注于生产的狭隘方针无法克服未来食品安全问题，虽然它曾在过去带来过名符其实的产出暴增。

column1: The world needs an innovative, comprehensive strategy aimed at optimizing the entire food system – for example, by improving fertilizer and water use and food transportation and storage; by ensuring that adequate nutrition is accessible and affordable for all; and by changing communities’ eating habits to include less resource-intensive food.
column2: 世界需要以优化整个粮食系统的创新、全面的战略 — — 比如通过改善化肥和水使用以及粮食运输和储存；或是通过确保足够的营养可以以足够低廉的价格获得；或是通过改变社会饮食习惯、将资源密集度低的食物纳入进来。

column1: The trouble is that complexity can be overwhelming, so people often prefer to break down complex systems into individual components.
column2: 麻烦在于复杂性可能成为不可逾越的障碍，以至于人们通常想把复杂系统分解为诸个别组分。

column1: Rather than consider, say, eradicating extreme poverty and averting global warming in tandem – and developing mutually reinforcing strategies to achieve these goals – proposed solutions focus on one or the other, undermining their effectiveness.
column2: 比如，建议方案不会考虑在根除极端贫困和扭转全球变暖两方面双管齐下 — — 并发展互相强化的战略达到这些目标 — — 而是会逐一考虑这两个问题，这就破坏了有效性。

column1: Of course, addressing interconnected issues simultaneously carries its share of challenges.
column2: 当然，同时解决互相联系的问题需要共同分担挑战。

column1: For one thing, no single person or group has enough knowledge or experience to solve all of the problems afflicting a complex system at once.
column2: 一方面，没有哪个个人或群体能够拥有足够的知识和专业性一次性解决影响复杂系统的所有问题。

column1: But a wider community – including governments, businesses, researchers, philosophers, faith communities, and even poets and artists – could devise and implement holistic strategies.
column2: 但更广义的社会 — — 包括政府、企业、研究者、思想家、信仰界甚至诗人和艺术家 — — 可以设计出并实施全盘战略。

column1: Success will depend on participants’ willingness to cooperate and their commitment to put evidence before ideology.
column2: 能否成功将取决于参与者的合作意愿以及是否能够做到将证据置于意识形态之前。

column1: Thus, the real challenge lies in marshaling such an inclusive community – something at which global leaders have not proved adept.
column2: 因此，真正的挑战在于组织起这样一个包容性社会 — — 这是全球领袖所不擅长的。

column1: A second major challenge is that resources are limited, making it impossible to solve all of the world’s problems at once.
column2: 第二个主要挑战是资源是有限的，这意味着不可能同时解决世界面临的所有问题。

column1: In this context, the ability to prioritize effectively is essential.
column2: 在这样的背景下，有效地编排优先顺序至关重要。

column1: But, rather than emphasizing one problem over another, the top priority should be building resilience into all global systems.
column2: 但是，最要紧的不是决定甲问题是否比乙问题重要，而是让所有全球系统都具有恢复力。

column1: Mechanisms aimed at solving a problem in one system should not be allowed to compromise another system’s resilience.
column2: 旨在解决甲系统的问题的机制不能影响乙系统的恢复力。

column1: Another challenge will be to devise new metrics to replace GDP as the leading measure of human well-being.
column2: 另一个挑战是以新的指标取代GDP作为人类福祉的主要指标。

column1: Even Simon Kuznets, the main architect of the concept of GDP, recognized that it does not account for many of the factors affecting human well-being; he argued that it should be used “only with some qualifications.”
column2: GDP概念的主要设计者西蒙·库兹涅茨也承认，GDP并未考虑到众多影响人类福祉的因素；他认为GDP只能在“某些场合”使用。

column1: In the Anthropocene, GDP must be part of an array of metrics for assessing economic, natural, and social capital – that is, the value of the goods and services produced, as well as the dignity of the ecosystems and social structures that underpin this output.
column2: 进入人类纪，GDP只能作为评估经济、自然和社会资本的一系列指标中的一个，全面的指标既要表示生产出来的商品和服务的价值，也要体现作为产出基础的生态系统和社会结构的尊严。

column1: Navigating the Anthropocene effectively and ethically is perhaps the most daunting challenge that modern humans have faced.
column2: 在效率和伦理方面在人类纪游刃有余也许是现代人类所面临的最艰巨的挑战。

column1: Overcoming it will require a smarter approach to strategic decision-making and a broader understanding of innovation.
column2: 克服这一挑战需要更明智的战略决策方针和更广泛的对创新的理解。

column1: It is time for us to rise to the challenge.
column2: 我们应该从现在开始应对这一挑战。

column1: Stop Subsidizing Climate Change
column2: 停止补贴气候变化

column1: LONDON – Next week, governments will gather in Warsaw, Poland, for a crucial round of climate negotiations, with both expectation and ambition running at an all-time low.
column2: 伦敦—下周，各国政府将汇聚在波兰华沙展开气候变化谈判的关键轮次，而期望和雄心都处于历史最低点。

column1: But it does not have to be like this: The Warsaw meeting provides an opportunity to galvanize action on one of the most potent forces driving climate change – the billions of dollars spent by governments on fossil-fuel subsidies.
column2: 但本来没必要如此：华沙会议提供了一次刺激对最强力地推动气候变化的行为 — — 政府对化石燃料的数十亿美元的补贴采取行动的机会。

column1: The Warsaw talks are a staging post on the route to the 2015 United Nations climate summit in Paris, at which governments will seek to forge an agreement that prevents dangerous climate change, defined as global warming of more than two degrees Celsius.
column2: 华沙谈判是2015年巴黎联合国气候峰会之前的预热。 在巴黎峰会上，各国政府将寻求形成防止气候变化（其定义是全球变暖超过二摄氏度）的协定。

column1: Failure would expose future generations to catastrophic climate risks, while trapping millions of people in poverty as a result of more frequent, intense, and protracted droughts, floods, and storms.
column2: 失败将让子孙后代面临灾难性气候风险，让几百万人因为更频繁、剧烈和长期的干旱、洪水和风暴而陷入贫困。

column1: Basic carbon arithmetic illustrates the scale of the problem.
column2: 基本碳算术说明了问题的严重性。

column1: According to the most recent assessment of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC), we are on a trajectory toward exhausting the twenty-first century’s entire carbon budget by 2030.
column2: 根据政府间气候变化委员会（IPCC）的最新评估，我们在2030年就将用完二十一世纪的全部碳预算。

column1: So, can we head off the impending collision between the energy systems driving the global economy and our planet’s ecological limits?
column2: 那么，我们可以避免推动全球经济的能源体系和地球的生态极限之间的即将到来的碰撞吗？

column1: The necessary innovations are emerging.
column2: 必要的创新正在显现。

column1: Recent developments in wind, solar, tidal, bio-energy, geothermal, and fuel-cell technology are transforming the scope for low-carbon energy production.
column2: 风能、太阳能、潮汐能、生物能、地热能和燃料电池技术的最新发展正在改变低碳能源产品领域。

column1: Aside from saving the planet, these technologies could open up new investment opportunities, deliver affordable energy, and sustain growth.
column2: 除了拯救地球，这些技术可以带来新的投资机会、可负担的能源和持续的增长。

column1: But that potential will be realized only if governments actively pursue green industrial policies.
column2: 但要实现这一潜力，政府必须积极地追求绿色产业政策。

column1: They need to align the goal of avoiding dangerous climate change with disincentives for carbon-intensive energy – including taxes, carbon markets, and support for green alternatives.
column2: 政府需要将避免危险的气候变化的目标与鼓励远离碳密集能源的手段（包括税收、碳市场和支持绿色替代能源）结合起来。

column1: Fossil-fuel subsidies have the opposite effect.
column2: 化石燃料补贴效果则相反。

column1: They actively promote carbon-intensive energy and deter green investment.
column2: 它们积极地促进了碳密集能源，阻碍了绿色投资。

column1: According to the International Energy Agency, governments pumped $523 billion into fossil-fuel subsidies in 2011.
column2: 根据国际能源署的估计，2011年各国政府在化石燃料补贴上耗资5230亿美元。

column1: From a climate-change perspective, this is a world turned upside down: for every $1 in support for renewable energy, another $6 promotes carbon-intensive fuels.
column2: 从气候变化角度看，这是颠倒是非：对应支持可再生能源的每1美元，促进碳密集燃料花费6美元。

column1: Most fossil-fuel subsidies can be traced to developing countries, where they drain budgets and provide transfers to wealthy households.
column2: 大部分化石燃料补贴可以追溯到发展中国家，这是在康预算之慨向富裕家庭转移支付。

column1: But rich countries operate their own subsidies, which average $7 for every ton of CO2 they emit.
column2: 但富国也有补贴，排放的每一吨二氧化碳中平均包含7美元补贴。

column1: Research by the United Kingdom’s Overseas Development Institute that examined tax and consumer subsidies provided by governments in 11 OECD countries found support equivalent to $72 billion, or around $112 per adult.
column2: 英国海外发展研究所的研究考察了11个经合组织国家政府的税收和消费者补贴，结果发现化石燃料支持合720亿美元，或每个成年人112美元。

column1: It is difficult to think of a more irresponsible use of public money.
column2: 很难想象还有比这更不负责任的公共资金支出。

column1: The inconsistencies between climate goals and energy policies are becoming increasingly stark.
column2: 气候目标和能源政策之间的不一致正变得越来越尖锐。

column1: Germany is providing lavish support for the construction of new coal plants.
column2: 德国为新建煤电站提供慷慨的支持。

column1: Britain offers generous tax concessions for oil and gas exploration, including bumper deals for companies involved in fracking.
column2: 英国为油气勘探提供慷慨的免税待遇，包括针对液压致裂法有关公司的巨大好处。

column1: The United States spends heavily to subsidize gasoline and other fossil fuels.
column2: 美国花巨资补贴汽油和其他化石燃料。

column1: In all of these cases, bold climate-change targets are being undermined by business-as-usual subsidies.
column2: 在所有这些例子中，大胆的气候变化目标因为老方一帖的补贴政策而遭到破坏。

column1: Carbon markets could provide a corrective to fossil-fuel subsidies, but they are not doing so.
column2: 碳市场可以提供正确的化石燃料补贴，但它们没有这样做。

column1: The European Union claims the mantle of global leadership on climate change, yet its leaders have allowed the price of carbon in the EU’s Emissions Trading Scheme to collapse, owing to reckless over-supply of carbon credits.
column2: 欧盟号称是全球气候变化领头羊，但其领导人放任欧盟碳排交易机制（Emissions Trading Scheme）碳定价因为鲁莽的碳信用过度供给而崩溃。

column1: By contrast, South Korea has signaled that it will enforce a greenhouse-gas cap that is projected to push prices to 20 times the EU level by 2017 – and green-energy investment there is booming.
column2: 相反，韩国释放的信号表明它将强化温室气体上限，预计到2017年将碳排价格推高到欧盟水平的20倍，而韩国的绿色能源投资也迎来了繁荣。

column1: With energy prices moving center stage, there is a danger that already-weak incentives for investment in low-carbon energy will be further undermined.
column2: 随着能源价格成为核心问题，已然十分脆弱的低碳能源投资激励有可能被进一步削弱。

column1: Across Europe, calls for “affordable energy” are fast becoming a euphemism for increased fossil-fuel subsidies and a rollback of commitments on green energy.
column2: 放眼欧洲，对“可负担能源”的吁求正在快速变为增加化石燃料补贴、收回绿色能源承诺的委婉说法。

column1: Recent debates in the UK illustrate the emerging fault lines.
column2: 最近在英国发生的争论表明裂痕正在产生。

column1: Five years ago, Britain broke the international mold by enacting legislation mandating an 80% cut in greenhouse-gas emissions by 2050.
column2: 五年前，英国打破国际常规，立法要求到2050年削减80%的温室气体排放量。

column1: Today, political leaders openly attack “burdensome” green taxes.
column2: 如今，政治领袖公开攻讦“不堪重负”的绿色税。

column1: The government has delayed setting a decarbonization target for electricity generation, there is uncertainty over pricing for green energy sources, and the Green Investment Bank is under-financed.
column2: 政府推迟了电力去碳化目标的设定，绿色能源资源的定价充满了不确定性，而绿色投资银行（Green Investment Bank）也处于资金不足状态。

column1: Unsurprisingly, investment in renewable energy has fallen to a four-year low.
column2: 毫不奇怪，可再生能源投资降至四年新低。

column1: Expecting the Warsaw climate negotiations to deliver a major breakthrough would be a triumph of hope over evidence.
column2: 期待华沙气候谈判产生重大突破只是没有证据的空想。

column1: Yet the talks provide a platform for practical action – and for governments to demonstrate leadership by example.
column2: 但谈判提供了一个实践平台，也提供了政府用榜样证明领导力的平台。

column1: The G-20 countries, which have already agreed, in principle, to phase out fossil-fuel subsidies, should seize the moment.
column2: G-20国家已经在原则上同意逐步取消化石燃料补贴，它们应该抓住这个机会。

column1: They could hold a “side-summit” in Warsaw at which they set a schedule for translating principle into practice.
column2: 它们可以在华沙举办一个“方面峰会 ” ， 为将原则落实为政策设定时间表。

column1: The target should be full elimination of all fossil-fuel subsidies by 2020.
column2: 目标应该是到2020年全部取消化石燃料补贴。

column1: Rich G-20 countries could go further and faster.
column2: G-20富国可以走得更快更远。

column1: They should pledge to eliminate all subsidies by the time they arrive at the UN’s COP 21 climate-change summit in Paris in 2015, starting next year with the withdrawal of all support for gasoline and for coal, oil, and gas exploration.
column2: 它们应该承诺在2015年出席联合国COP 21气候变化峰会前取消所有化石燃料补贴，从明年开始取消所有对汽油和煤炭、石油和天然气勘探的支持。

column1: And they should divert part of the savings into energy cooperation aimed at supporting low-carbon transitions in developing countries.
column2: 它们还应该将部分储蓄用于旨在支持发展中国家低碳转型的能源合作。

column1: Eliminating fossil-fuel subsidies would be just one small step on the road to a global climate agreement.
column2: 取消化石燃料补贴将只是通往全球气候协定道路上的一小步。

column1: But it would at least be a step in the right direction – and it might just restore confidence in a negotiating process that is slowly going nowhere.
column2: 但这至少是朝正确方向的一步 — — 或许能够为缓缓滑向僵局的谈判进程树立信心。

column1: Keynes and Social Democracy Today
column2: 凯恩斯和今天的社会民主

column1: LONDON – For decades, Keynesianism was associated with social democratic big-government policies.

But John Maynard Keynes’s relationship with social democracy is complex. Although he was an architect of core components of social democratic policy – particularly its emphasis on maintaining full employment – he did not subscribe to other key social democratic objectives, such as public ownership or massive expansion of the welfare state.
column2: 伦敦 — —

column1: In The General Theory of Employment, Interest and Money, Keynes ends by summarizing the strengths and weaknesses of the capitalist system.
column2: 数十年以来，凯恩斯主义都和社会民主的大政府主义政策相关联。

column1: On one hand, capitalism offers the best safeguard of individual freedom, choice, and entrepreneurial initiative.
column2: 但其实凯恩斯和其关系比较复杂。

column1: On the other hand, unregulated markets fail to achieve two central goals of any civilized society: “The outstanding faults of the economic society in which we live are its failure to provide for full employment and its arbitrary and inequitable distribution of wealth and incomes.” This suggested an active role for government, which dovetailed with important strands of left-wing thought.
column2: 虽然他是社会民主政策核心价值观的设计师 — — 特别是侧重于充分就业方面而言 — — 但他和社会民主的其他政策，例如公有制或福利国家的无限延伸等却并不想关。

column1: Until The General Theory was published in 1936, social democrats did not know how to go about achieving full employment.
column2: 在《就业、利息和货币通论》一书中，凯恩斯以资本主义的优劣评判作为结束语。 一方面，资本主义给了个人自由，选择和创新精神以最好的保护。

column1: Their policies were directed at depriving capitalists of the ownership of the means of production.
column2: 另一方面，无监管的市场无法实现文明社会的两个中心目标 ： “ 经济社会的致命错误在于无法提供充分的就业以及保证社会财富收入分配的公平性 。 ”

column1: How this was to produce full employment was never worked out.
column2: 这就凸显出政府在其中的重要性，这也是左派思想的重要观点。

column1: There was an idea, originally derived from Ricardo and Marx, that the capitalist class needed a “reserve army of the unemployed” to maintain its profit share.
column2: 在1936年《通论》一书发表之前，社会民主人士并不清楚如何实现就业的充分性。

column1: If profits were eliminated, the need for that reserve army would disappear.
column2: 他们只是侧重于剥夺资本家对生产资料的所有权。

column1: Labor would be paid what it was worth, and everyone willing to work would be able to find a job.
column2: 对如何实现充分的就业一无所知。

column1: But, apart from the political impossibility of nationalizing the whole economy peacefully, this approach suffered from the fatal flaw of ignoring the role of aggregate demand.
column2: 这种理论起源于李嘉图和马克思的思想，所谓资产阶级需要保持“一定数量的失业大军”来维持其利润。 如果消灭了利润，失业大军也没有存在的必要了。

column1: It assumed that demand would always be sufficient if profits were eliminated.
column2: 劳动者就会获取应得的报酬，任何想要工作的人都能找到工作。

column1: Keynes demonstrated that the main cause of bouts of heavy and prolonged unemployment was not worker encroachment on profits, but the fluctuating prospects of private investment in an uncertain world.
column2: 但是，想用政治的手段和平地实现整个社会财富的公有化几乎不可能，这种方法致命的缺陷在于忽略了人类不断提升的需求。

column1: Nearly all unemployment in a cyclical downturn was the result of the failure of investment demand.
column2: 其假设的前提是如果消灭利润，需求一直维持充足。

column1: Thus, the important thing was not to nationalize the capital stock, but to socialize investment. Industry could be safely left in private hands, provided the state guaranteed enough spending power in the economy to maintain a full-employment level of investment.
column2: 凯恩斯告诉我们，严重失业现象产生的原因不是劳工受到资本家的剥削，而是在未知世界中的私人投资不确定的投资前景。

column1: This could be achieved by monetary and fiscal policy: low interest rates and large state investment programs.
column2: 几乎所有的失业起源于经济萧条周期中的投资需求低迷。

column1: In short, Keynes aimed to achieve a key social democratic objective without changing the ownership of industry.
column2: 那么，我们要做的不是将生产资料国有化，而是投资收益的社会化。

column1: Nevertheless, he did think that redistribution would help secure full employment. A greater tendency to consume would “serve to increase at the same time the inducement to invest.”
column2: 私人运营不是错误的源泉，如果再加上政府担保足够的支出，就能保证充分的就业。

column1: And the low interest rates needed to maintain full employment would lead in time to the “euthanasia of the rentier” – of those who live off the rents of capital.
column2: 这可以通过财政金融政策手段来加以实现：调低利率和加大政府投资。

column1: Moderate re-distribution was the more politically radical implication of Keynes’s economic theory, but the measures outlined above were also the limits of state intervention for him.
column2: 简而言之，凯恩斯在没有改变所有权的前提下，实现了社会民主人士的核心目标。 而且他认为，财富的再分配确实能保证充分的就业。
消费需求的提升可以同时刺激投资者意愿。

column1: As long as “the state is able to determine the aggregate amount of resources devoted to augmenting the instruments [i.e., the capital base] and the basic reward to those who own them,” there is no “obvious case” for further involvement.
column2: 同时，低利率环境下的充分就业可以消灭食利阶层 — — 那些靠利息和租金来存活的人。 适度的财富再分配是凯恩斯经济学理论较为激进的政治理念，但政府的干预也应有一定的限度。

column1: The public was never to substitute for the private, but merely to complement it.
column2: 只要“增加的财富是用于改良生产工具，劳动者能得到基本的回报 ” ， 政府就不应该干预。 公有不能替代私有，只能作为补充。

column1: Today, ideas about full employment and equality remain at the heart of social democracy.
column2: 今天，关于充分就业和平等的理念一直是社会民主的核心。

column1: But the political struggle needs to be conducted along new battle lines.
column2: 但政治斗争的方式已经呈现出了新形态。

column1: Whereas the front used to run between government and the owners of the means of production – the industrialists, the rentiers – now, it runs between governments and finance.
column2: 政府和生产资料所有者（实业家和剥削者）之争已经演变为政府和金融之争。

column1: Such measures as the efforts by the European Parliament to regulate the derivatives market or the British government’s ban on short selling in the wake of the financial crisis or the demand to caps bankers’ bonuses are contemporary expressions of the wish to reduce the power of financial speculation to damage the economy.
column2: 不论欧洲议会对衍生品市场的监管措施，英国政府在金融危机时禁止卖空的措施，或是对银行家的奖金设置上限，这些都是减少金融投机客破坏经济的现代翻版。

column1: The new focus on the need to tame the power of finance is largely a consequence of globalization.
column2: 全球化的结果导致我们要限制金融的权力。

column1: Capital moves across borders more freely and more quickly than goods or people do.
column2: 资本比货物人力更易于流动。

column1: Yet, while large global firms habitually use their high concentration of financial resources to press for further de-regulation (“or we will go somewhere else”), the crisis has turned their size into a liability.
column2: 然而，跨国公司更习惯于运用其巨大的金融资源来给政府施压，要求放松管制（否则他们就抽走资本 ） ， 这场危机后果导致规模越大的公司损失越大。

column1: Being too big to fail simply means being too big.
column2: 大而不倒就说明太大了。

column1: Keynes saw that “it is the financial markets’ precariousness which creates no small part of our contemporary problem of securing sufficient investment.”
column2: 凯恩斯认为“金融市场”不稳定造成了我们当今不算小的问题 。 ”

column1: That rings truer today – more than 70 years later – than in his own day. Rather than securing investment for productive sectors of the economy, the financial industry has become adept at securing investment in itself.
column2: 这样的警钟70多年之后依旧有效，如今的金融行业不是为了保障投资者的权益，而是为了自身的权利。

column1: This, once again, calls for an activist government policy.
column2: 在这里，我们再一次呼吁政府的积极干预。

column1: Yet, as Keynes would have argued, it is important that the expansion of government involvement is informed by sound economics rather than political ideology, social democratic or otherwise.
column2: 然而，凯恩斯认为，政府的干预应由基于成熟的经济经济学，而不是意识形态，社会民主或是其他什么。

column1: State intervention needs to bridge gaps that the private sector cannot reasonably be expected to do on its own.
column2: 国家干预用来弥补私人企业非理性行为所导致的缺陷。

column1: The current crisis has shown with utmost clarity that private markets are unable to self-regulate; domestic regulation is therefore a key area in which government has a role to play.
column2: 目前的危机非常清楚地表明，市场无法自我监管；政府对本国监管非常重要。

column1: Similarly, time-inconsistency issues prevent large international firms from compartmentalizing their markets. Re-erecting barriers to capital flows in the form of international taxes, thereby cordoning off crises before they turn global, is therefore another task for government.
column2: 同样，时间不一致性问题防止跨国机构操纵市场，征收国际税可以重新对资本流动限制，在危机蔓延到全球之前加以控制，这也是政府应该做的一件事情。

column1: Keynes’s main contribution to social democracy, however, does not lie in the specifics of policy, but in his insistence that the state as ultimate protector of the public good has a duty to supplement and regulate market forces.
column2: 然而，凯恩斯对社会民主最大的贡献不在于具体的政策，而是他坚持认为，国家作为公共产品的最终保护者，有着监管和补充市场的责任。

column1: If we need markets to stop the state from behaving badly, we need the state to stop markets from behaving badly.
column2: 如果我们需要市场来阻止国家做恶，我们同样需要国家来阻止市场作恶。

column1: Nowadays, that means stopping financial markets from behaving badly.
column2: 如今，也就是阻止金融市场来作恶。

column1: That means limiting their power, and their profits.
column2: 即限制其权力和利润。

column1: Keynes’s General Theory at 80
column2: 凯恩斯《通论》80周年

column1: LONDON – In 1935, John Maynard Keynes wrote to George Bernard Shaw: “I believe myself to be writing a book on economic theory which will largely revolutionize – not, I suppose, at once but in the course of the next ten years – the way the world thinks about its economic problems.”
column2: 伦敦—1935年，凯恩斯给萧伯纳写信说 ： “ 我在写一本经济理论的书，我自信它将掀起一场世界看待经济问题的大革命 — — 不是立刻，而是在十年后 。 ”

column1: And, indeed, Keynes’s magnum opus, The General Theory of Employment, Interest and Money, published in February 1936, transformed economics and economic policymaking.
column2: 确实，1936年2月出版的凯恩斯的名著《就业、利息和货币通论》改变了经济学和经济决策。

column1: Eighty years later, does Keynes’s theory still hold up?
column2: 八十年后，凯恩斯的理论仍然成立吗？

column1: Two elements of Keynes’s legacy seem secure.
column2: 凯恩斯的遗产中有两个要素地位稳固。

column1: First, Keynes invented macroeconomics – the theory of output as a whole.
column2: 首先，凯恩斯发明了宏观经济学 — — 关于作为整体的产出的理论。

column1: He called his theory “general” to distinguish it from the pre-Keynesian theory, which assumed a unique level of output – full employment.
column2: 他将他的理论称为“通论 ” ， 以区别于凯恩斯之前的理论。 此前的理论假设一个独特的产出水平 — — 充分就业。

column1: In showing how economics could remain stuck in an “underemployment” equilibrium, Keynes challenged the central idea of the orthodox economics of his day: that markets for all commodities, including labor, are simultaneously cleared by prices.
column2: 凯恩斯证明了经济可能陷入“就业不足”均衡，从而挑战了当时正统经济学的中心思想：所有商品，包括劳动力在内的市场通过价格同时实现出清。

column1: And his challenge implied a new dimension to policymaking: Governments may need to run deficits to maintain full employment.
column2: 他的挑战产生了全新的决策维度：政府可能需要用赤字来维持充分就业。

column1: The aggregate equations that underpin Keynes’s “general theory” still populate economics textbooks and shape macroeconomic policy.
column2: 作为凯恩斯“通论”基础的总量方程仍然充斥着经济学教科书，影响着宏观经济政策。

column1: Even those who insist that market economies gravitate toward full employment are forced to argue their case within the framework that Keynes created.
column2: 即使那些坚持市场经济自动趋向充分就业的人也被迫在凯恩斯所建立的框架中为自己辩护。

column1: Central bankers adjust interest rates to secure a balance between total demand and supply, because, thanks to Keynes, it is known that equilibrium might not occur automatically.
column2: 中央银行调整利率以保证总需求和供给的平衡，因为，拜凯恩斯所赐，人们知道均衡不会自动发生。

column1: Keynes’s second major legacy is the notion that governments can and should prevent depressions.
column2: 凯恩斯的第二大遗产是政府可以也应该阻止萧条的概念。

column1: Widespread acceptance of this view can be seen in the difference between the strong policy response to the collapse of 2008-2009 and the passive reaction to the Great Depression of 1929-1932.
column2: 这一观点被广泛接受，2008—2009年崩溃引起了强力政策应对措施，而对于1929—1932年大萧条政府只是消极反应。

column1: As the Nobel laureate Robert Lucas, an opponent of Keynes, admitted in 2008: “I guess everyone is a Keynesian in a foxhole.”
column2: 诺贝尔奖获得者、凯恩斯的反对者罗伯特·卢卡斯（Robert Lucas）在2008年承认 ： “ 我猜每个人都是隐藏很深的凯恩斯主义者 。 ”

column1: Having said this, Keynes’s theory of “underemployment” equilibrium is no longer accepted by most economists and policymakers.
column2: 话虽如此，凯恩斯“就业不足”均衡理论已不再被大部分经济学家和决策者所接受。

column1: The global financial crisis of 2008 bears this out.
column2: 2008年全球金融危机证明了这一点。

column1: The collapse discredited the more extreme version of the optimally self-adjusting economy; but it did not restore the prestige of the Keynesian approach.
column2: 这场崩盘让更加极端的自我调整经济最优论信誉扫地，但也没有重塑凯恩斯观点的声望。

column1: To be sure, Keynesian measures halted the global economy’s downward slide.
column2: 诚然，凯恩斯主义措施阻止了全球经济雪崩。
