column1: On the moratorium, we remained pragmatic and built a strong European foreign policy.
column2: 在暂停死刑问题上，我们保持了现实主义并且建立了一个强大的欧洲外交政策。

column1: And it was an advantage in the UN negotiations to have a common Europeans position and to have spoken with a single voice.
column2: 在联合国谈判中具有一个共同的欧洲立场以及用一个声音说话是一个优势。

column1: A second lesson that I learned is also useful for the EU, which finds itself in a world in which new powers are emerging and where all actors from Manila to Algiers, from Doha to Libreville, must deal with the challenges of globalization and interdependence on a daily basis.
column2: 我所学到的第二个经验教训对欧盟也有作用。 当今世界新的大国正在显现，欧盟必须每天都处理全球化和相互依赖的挑战。

column1: That lesson is that Europe has more friends than it has enemies in the world.
column2: 得出的经验就是，在世界上，欧盟的朋友要比敌人多。

column1: These friends deserve respect and attention.
column2: 这些朋友值得尊重和关注。

column1: If Italy and the EU had not understood the need to work with non-European countries, and make them feel that they were responsible and fully-fledged protagonists, the efforts to establish the ICC and be so close to declare a universal moratorium on the death penalty would have failed.
column2: 如果意大利和欧盟没有理解与非欧盟国家合作的需要，并且让它们感到它们是负责以及完全的主角，建立国际刑事法庭以及如此接近全面暂停死刑就会失败。

column1: I know that this is not exactly a new lesson, but it is what I have in mind when I think of efficient multilateralism.
column2: 我知道，这并非是一个全新的经验，但是当我思考有效的多边主义的时候我总是想到这一点。

column1: Not only does it work, but, above all, in some cases, it is the only way of moving forward.
column2: 它不仅可以奏效，而且在某些情况下，它是前进的唯一途径。

column1: Finally, a third lesson – relevant to the fight against the death penalty and, indeed, to winning any political battle – is perseverance, which I consider to be a mix of pig-headedness and the ability to maintain one’s position.
column2: 最后，第三个经验就是坚持不懈。 这与废除死刑的斗争以及赢得任何政治斗争有关。

column1: Without perseverance, there can be no progress.
column2: 我认为这结合了固执和坚持自己立场的能力。 没有坚持不懈就没有进步。

column1: All this is a success, not only for anti-death penalty radicals, for the “Hands off Cain” association, the Italian government, and for the European Union and its friends in the world.
column2: 所有这些都是一个成功，这不仅对废除死刑的极端人士而言如此，而且对于废除死刑协会、意大利政府、欧盟及其在全世界的朋友而言也是如此。

column1: It is much more: it is a success for all those who believe that it is still possible to improve our world – and ultimately the human condition – every day.
column2: 其意义不止如此，这对于所有相信依旧有可能每天改良世界以及最终改良人类境况的人而言都是一个成功。

column1: Is Tsipras the New Lula?
column2: 齐普拉斯是新卢拉吗？

column1: CAMBRIDGE – Greek Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras has the chance to become to his country what South Korean President Kim Dae-jung and Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva were to theirs: a man of the left who moves toward fiscal responsibility and freer markets.
column2: 美国剑桥—希腊总理齐普拉斯有机会成为希腊的金大中（韩国总统）和卢拉（巴西总统 ） — —推进财政责任和自由市场的左派。

column1: Like Tsipras, both were elected in the midst of an economic crisis.
column2: 与齐普拉斯类似，金大中和卢拉都在经济危机中当选总统。

column1: Both immediately confronted the international financial constraints that opposition politicians can afford to ignore.
column2: 两人上任伊始便面临着反对派政客才能忽视是国际金融约束。

column1: On assuming power, Kim and Lula were able to adjust, politically and mentally, to the new realities that confronted them, launching much-needed reforms.
column2: 掌握了权力的金大中和卢拉能够从政治上和思想上做出调整以适应他们所面临的现实，启动急需的改革。

column1: Some reforms were “conservative” (or “neo-liberal”) and might not have been possible under politicians of the right.
column2: 一些改革是“保守 ” （ 或“新自由主义 ” ） 的，绝不可能在右派政客手中实行。

column1: But others were consistent with their lifetime commitments.
column2: 但其他改革与他们一生的承诺一致。

column1: South Korea under Kim began to rein in the chaebols, the country’s huge family-owned conglomerates.
column2: 金大中治下的韩国开始遏制财阀（家族所有的巨型企业集团 ） 。

column1: Brazil under Lula implemented Bolsa Familia, a system of direct cash payments to households that is credited with lifting millions out of poverty.
column2: 卢拉治下的把戏实施了家庭补助金（Bolsa Familia）计划，该计划向家庭直接派发现金，将数百万人带出了贫困。

column1: Tsipras and his Syriza party, however, spent their first six months in office still blinkered about financial realities, unable to see things from the perspective of others.
column2: 但是，齐普拉斯和他的左翼联盟党（Syriza）执政已经六个月，却仍没有看清金融现实，无法借助他人的角度看待问题。

column1: The decision to hold a referendum on the bailout terms set by Greece’s creditors showed that they were politically blinkered as well.
column2: 就希腊债权人所要求的条件进行公投的决定表明，他们在政治上也没有认清现实。

column1: If Tsipras were reading from a normal script, he would logically have asked Greeks to vote yes.
column2: 如果齐普拉斯从常理出发，合乎逻辑的做法是要求希腊人民投赞成票。

column1: But he asked them to vote no, which they did by a surprisingly wide margin.
column2: 但他要求希腊人民投反对票，并出人意料地获得了绝大多数人的顺从。

column1: He evidently thought that this would strengthen his hand; instead, it merely strengthened the position of those Germans convinced that the time had come to let Greece drop out of the euro.
column2: 他显然认为这将加强他的立场；相反，这仅仅加强了那些认为是时候让希腊退出欧元区的德国人的立场。

column1: Only a week after the referendum, Tsipras finally faced up to reality: Greece’s euro partners are not prepared to offer easier terms.
column2: 公投后不过一周，齐普拉斯终于开始面对现实：希腊的欧元伙伴国不准备向它提供更加容易的条件。

column1: On the contrary, they are insisting on more extensive concessions as the price of a third bailout.
column2: 相反，它们坚持希腊做出更大的让步换取第三轮援助。

column1: The only possible silver lining to this sorry history is that some of Tsipras’s supporters at home may now be willing to swallow the creditors’ bitter medicine.
column2: 这段悲哀历史的唯一一个闪光点是一些齐普拉斯的国内支持者现在也许愿意吞下债权人的苦口良药。

column1: One should not underestimate the opposition that reforms continue to face among Greeks.
column2: 你不应该低估改革在希腊人中间所继续面临的反对。

column1: But like Kim and Lula, Tsipras could marshal political support from some on the left who reckon, “If he now says that these measures are unavoidable, there truly must be no alternative.”
column2: 但与金大中和卢拉一样，齐普拉斯可以从一些认为“如果他现在说这些措施不可避免，那么确实是别无选择了”的左派中赢得政治支持。

column1: (The same thing has of course happened on the right: Only Nixon could go to China.)
column2: （同样的事情当然也在右派身上发生过：只有尼克松可能去中国。 ）

column1: None of this is to say that the international financial realities a country faces are necessarily always reasonable.
column2: 所有这些都不是说一国所面临的国际金融现实永远是合理的。

column1: Sometimes global financial markets’ eagerness to lend results in unreasonable booms, followed by abrupt reversals.
column2: 有时全球金融市场急切地想要贷款，结果导致非理性的繁荣，随之而来的急转直下。

column1: Foreign creditor governments can be unreasonable as well.
column2: 外部债权人政府也有可能不理性。

column1: The misperceptions and errors by leaders in Germany and other creditor countries have been as damaging as those on the part of the less-experienced Greek leaders.
column2: 德国和其他债权国领导人的误解和错误与经验欠缺的希腊领导人的误解和错误一样危险。

column1: For example, the belief that fiscal austerity raises income, rather than lowering it, even in the short run, was a mistake, as was the refusal in 2010 to write down the debt.
column2: 比如，认为财政紧缩增加而不是降低了收入（哪怕是短期收入）就是一个错误，2010年拒绝减记债务亦然。

column1: These mistakes explain why Greece’s debt/GDP ratio is even higher today than it was then.
column2: 这些错误解释了为何今天的希腊债务/GDP之比比当时还要高。

column1: Each side’s refusal to admit its mistakes reinforced the other side’s stubbornness.
column2: 各方都拒绝承认错误，这让另一方更加顽固。

column1: The Germans would have done better to admit that fiscal austerity is contractionary in the short run.
column2: 德国人如果能够承认财政紧缩在短期引起衰退，就能做出更好的选择。

column1: The Greeks would have done better to admit that democracy does not mean that one country’s people can vote to give themselves other countries’ money.
column2: 希腊如果承认民主并不意味着一国人民可以让自己获得其他国家的钱，也可以做得更好。

column1: In terms of game theory, the fact that the Greeks and Germans have different economic interests is not enough to explain the poor outcome of negotiations to date.
column2: 用博弈论的话说，希腊人和德国人经济利益不同，这一事实不足以解释到目前为止的糟糕的谈判结果。

column1: The difference in perceptions has been central.
column2: 感觉的不同是核心问题。

column1: “Getting to yes” in a bargaining situation requires that the negotiators not only have a clear idea of their own top priorities, but also that they understand what the other side wants most.
column2: 在讨价还价局面中“形成一致”要求谈判者不但清楚地明白自身的当务之急，还要求他们理解对方最想要什么。

column1: A “bad bargain” would call on each side to forego its top priorities.
column2: “坏讨价还价”要求各方放弃最重要的重点。

column1: The European Central Bank should not have to agree to an explicit write-down of Greek debt.
column2: 欧洲央行不应该同意直接减记希腊债务。

column1: And Greece should not have to run a substantial primary budget surplus for now.
column2: 希腊也不应该现在保持巨大的初级预算盈余。

column1: Under a relatively “good bargain,” the creditors would modify interest rates and extend maturities further, as the International Monetary Fund now suggests, so that Greece does not have to pay the unpayable over the coming years, in exchange for growth-enhancing structural reforms.
column2: 在相对较“好的讨价还价”中，债权人应该如IMF现在所建议的那样调整利率并进一步延长期限，以使希腊不必在未来几年中偿付它无力偿付的金额来换取加强增长所需要的结构改革。

column1: One hopes that the awful experience of the last six months has led both sides to a clearer perception of economic realities and priorities.
column2: 我们希望过去六个月的糟糕经验让双方都对经济现实和当务之急有了更清晰的认识。

column1: This will be necessary if the two sides are to arrive at a good bargain, rather than a bad one – or even an outright failure to cooperate, so that Greece effectively drops out of the euro.
column2: 如果双方想形成好的而不是坏的讨价还价（甚至彻底的合作失败，从而导致希腊事实退出欧元区 ） ， 这是必要条件。

column1: A recurrent theme of the Greek crisis since it erupted in late 2009 is that both the Greeks and the eurozone’s creditor countries have been reluctant to consider lessons from previous emerging-market crises.
column2: 自2009年爆发以来，希腊危机的一个反复出现的主题���希腊人和欧元区债权国不愿从此前的新兴市场危机中汲取经验。

column1: After all, they said, Greece was a eurozone member, not a developing country.
column2: 他们说，毕竟希腊是欧元区成员国而不是发展中国家。

column1: That is why, for example, the ECB and European Commission initially did not want Greece to go to the IMF and did not want to write down Greek debt.
column2: 因此 ， （ 比如）欧洲央行和欧盟委员会最初不愿意让希腊求助IMF，也不愿减记希腊债务。

column1: Emerging market crises do hold important lessons.
column2: 新兴市场危机确实可以提供重要经验。

column1: If Tsipras can now follow the course taken by Kim and Lula, he will serve his country well.
column2: 如果齐普拉斯可以效仿金大中和卢拉，将给希腊带来巨大的好处。

column1: How Kim Has Played Trump
column2: 金正恩如何玩弄特朗普

column1: ATLANTA – North Korean leader Kim Jong-un is eager to hold a second summit with US President Donald Trump.
column2: 亚特兰大—朝鲜领导人金正恩急切地想和美国总统特朗普举行第二次峰会。

column1: Since their first meeting in Singapore in June, Kim has consistently outmaneuvered his counterpart.
column2: 自6月份在新加坡第一次会面以来，金正恩一直智胜特朗普。

column1: Trump may still fancy himself a world-class dealmaker, but the truth is that Kim – like Russian President Vladimir Putin – has got Trump’s number.
column2: 特朗普可能仍自我陶醉地认为他是世界级交易者，但真相是金正恩 — — 就像俄罗斯总统普京 — — 早已看穿了特朗普的底牌。

column1: Kim’s bonhomie (real or feigned) and promises of denuclearization have muted Trump’s threats, brought the South Korean government closer to his side, and eroded international sanctions against his regime.
column2: 金正恩的亲和姿态（不管是真的还是装的）和去核化承诺让悄然化解了特朗普的威胁，拉近了韩国政府，并影响到针对其政权的国际制裁。

column1: Kim has accomplished all of this without diminishing his regime’s nuclear capacity, and he appears to have continued ballistic-missile development at 16 hidden sites.
column2: 金正恩在达成所有这些成果的同时，丝毫没有削弱其核实力，他可能继续在16个秘密基地继续着弹道导弹的开发。

column1: Having gone from nuclear-armed pariah to presidential negotiating partner, it is little wonder that Kim would want a second summit to consolidate his newfound international legitimacy and position in the global limelight.
column2: 从拥有核武器的贱民，到与总统谈笑风生，毫不奇怪金正恩想要第二次峰会以巩固他新获得的国际合法性以及在全球舞台上的地位。

column1: Kim has already outdone his forebears.
column2: 金正恩已经超过了他的先人。

column1: His father and grandfather both tried and failed to create a high-level channel to the US government.
column2: 他的父亲和祖父都试图与美国政府建立高规格沟通渠道，但都失败了。

column1: The relationship that Kim has forged with Trump is thus an historic and personal success.
column2: 因此，金正恩构建的与特朗普的关系是历史性的、个人的成功。

column1: After six reclusive years in power, the 35-year-old scion of North Korea’s dynastic regime has made a remarkable debut on the world stage, both managing an erratic, ego-driven president and setting the terms of the negotiations.
column2: 在经过了六年不露声色的统治后，这位朝鲜政权王朝接班人在世界舞台上粉墨登场，不但治住了一位翻覆自我的总统，还确定了谈判条件。

column1: By contrast, the Trump administration has little to show for its efforts.
column2: 相反，特朗普政府几乎没有什么拿得出手的成绩。

column1: Since the Singapore summit, US officials have reportedly been pushing the Kim regime to lay out a path to denuclearization.
column2: 自新加坡峰会以来，据说美国官员敦促金氏政权拿出去核化路线图。

column1: But the North Koreans have refused to turn over even the most basic facts about their arsenal.
column2: 但朝鲜人拒绝交代关于他们的武器的哪怕是最基本的事实。

column1: This stonewalling suggests that Kim has read Trump well.
column2: 如此顽固表明金正恩看透了特朗普。

column1: As Trump himself contends, “I am the only one that matters.”
column2: 正如特朗普本人所说 ， “ 我就是唯一的重要因素 。 ”

column1: Trump’s narcissism, hunger for the spotlight, and desperation to match former President Barack Obama’s Nobel Peace Prize are all that Kim needs to know about the man.
column2: 特朗普的自恋、对曝光的渴望，以及对能够与前前总统奥巴马的诺贝尔和平奖相提并论的急切之心，便是金正恩所需要了解的一切。

column1: The only question is how far Trump will go to secure something that he can hawk as an unprecedented deal with North Korea.
column2: 唯一的问题是特朗普能够拿出什么来确保他能够吹嘘为前所未有的对朝协议。

column1: By agreeing to another summit while slow-rolling preliminary talks, Kim is reconnoitering Trump’s bottom line.
column2: 通过同意再次举行峰会，同时慢条斯理地地准备预备会谈，金正恩在试探特朗普的底线。

column1: Recall that, as its up-front price for serious denuclearization talks, the North initially pushed for diplomatic steps, such as a treaty to end to the Korean War.
column2: 不要忘了，作为严肃去核化谈判的先期条件，最初是朝鲜提出了外交方案，比如朝鲜战争停战条约。

column1: In Singapore, Trump promised to do just that, surprising American allies and US officials alike.
column2: 在新加坡，特朗普承诺就要这样做，另美国的盟友和美国官员大吃一惊。

column1: Then, in talks last month with US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo, Kim upped the ante by also calling for an end to the international sanctions against his regime.
column2: 接着，在上个月与美国国务卿蓬佩奥的会谈中，金正恩由提高了赌注，要求结束针对其政权的制裁。

column1: No doubt, Kim is hoping that Trump’s impulsiveness will lead him to fold.
column2: 毫无疑问，金正恩希望特朗普的冲动会让他就范。

column1: This month, Kim’s foreign ministry issued a public threat that North Korea could restart its weapons program if the US does not soften its position on sanctions.
column2: 本业，金正恩的外交部长公开威胁说，如果美国不软化在制裁问题上的立场，朝鲜可能重启武器计划。

column1: As Pompeo pursues further talks in Pyongyang this month, Kim will surely hold his ground.
column2: 当蓬佩奥寻求这个月在平壤进行进一步谈判时，金正恩肯定会坚持自己的要求。

column1: Since declaring in June that North Korea is “no longer a nuclear threat”, Trump has backpedaled on virtually all of his demands, dropped his draconian deadlines, and failed even to hint that Kim’s foot-dragging is a cause for concern.
column2: 自6月份宣布朝鲜“不再是一个核威胁”以来，特朗普收回了几乎全部要求，取消了严苛的最后期限，甚至都不表态金正恩的拖拉值得关注。

column1: In October, Pompeo made no headway toward defining even the basic vocabulary of a future agreement.
column2: 10月份，蓬佩奥在未来协定的基本要件方面毫无进展。

column1: According to officials who are familiar with the talks, on at least two occasions, the North Koreans asked him if he wanted to step out and call his boss.
column2: 据熟悉谈判的官员透露，至少有两次，朝鲜人问他是否想出去给上司打个电话。

column1: As matters stand, the Kim regime and the US have yet to agree on the definition of terms such as “denuclearization,” “verifiable,” and “irreversible.”
column2: 目前的情况是，金氏政权和美国尚未就“去核化 ” 、 “可核实”和“不可逆”等术语的定义达成一致。

column1: To be sure, playing Trump and reneging on promised steps toward denuclearization has its risks.
column2: 平心而论，玩弄特朗普、食言承诺的去核化举措自有其风险。

column1: In May, Trump temporarily canceled the Singapore meeting in response to North Korean statements, and he did the same with talks between Pompeo and the North Koreans in August.
column2: 5月份，特朗普因为朝鲜的言论而临时取消了新加坡挥舞，对于8月份蓬佩奥和朝鲜人的谈判，他也这么做了。

column1: There is no guarantee that he will not repeat that gambit.
column2: 不能保证他不会再重复这一伎俩。

column1: And yet, even if he does, Kim’s own penchant for drama – from firing missiles over Japan to carrying out frequent purges at home – suggests that he knows how to command the stage and bring Trump to the table.
column2: 但是，即使他这么做了，金正恩自身的戏剧偏好 — — 从向日本发射火箭到国内的频繁清洗 — — 表明他长袖善舞，知道如何让特朗普坐在谈判桌前。

column1: Moreover, his ego-stroking personal letters to Trump show that he has a good fix on the president’s psyche.
column2: 此外，他给特朗普的奉承的个人信件表明他很能把握总统的心理。

column1: So far, he has proved to be highly effective at keeping the bromance alive, and the forthcoming summit on track.
column2: 目前，他十分善于保持这一“兄弟情 ” ， 让下一次峰会箭在弦上。

column1: Regardless of when the second summit occurs, the North Korean regime will continue to reap dividends at America’s expense in the meantime.
column2: 无论第二次峰会何时举行，朝鲜政权都会继续将成果建立在美国的损失之上。

column1: Trump’s cancellation of two major US-South Korean joint military exercises already has commanders from both countries worried about their military readiness.
column2: 特朗普取消了两次美韩重要军演已经让两国的将军们担心备战情况。

column1: And international support for economic sanctions – particularly on the part of China and Russia – has been steadily eroding since even before the Singapore summit.
column2: 而经济制裁的国际支持 — — 特别是中国和俄罗斯的支持 — — 自新加坡峰会以来也在稳步削弱。

column1: With a fourth 2018 summit between Kim and South Korean President Moon Jae-in now in the works, it is clear that Moon’s political future is tied to rapprochement.
column2: 2018年金正恩与韩国总统文在寅之间的第四次峰会眼看就要举行，显然文在寅的政治前途系于和朝鲜改善关系。

column1: During his October trip to Europe, Moon lobbied hard for the easing of sanctions, reflecting his government’s desire to engage, not embargo, the North.
column2: 在其10月份的欧洲之行中，文在寅竭力游说放松制裁，表明其政府渴望与朝鲜交往而非封杀。

column1: It is time for the self-described master of the “art of the deal” to admit that he doesn’t have one.
column2: 自封的“交易的艺术”大师应该承认，他根本没有什么交易的艺术。

column1: Trump prefers hype to the hard work of hammering out arms-control agreements, so controlling his craving for the spotlight will not be easy.
column2: 特朗普更喜欢大肆宣传而非下苦功夫促成军备控制协议，因此要控制他的曝光欲望绝非易事。

column1: Nonetheless, when it comes to Kim, a bit of 54-year-old wisdom from Barry Goldwater, another outsider-turned-Republican Party icon, still applies: “The only summit meeting that can succeed is the one that doesn’t take place.”
column2: 尽管如此，对于金正恩，巴里·戈德华特 — — 另一位局外人转变而来的共和党标志性人物 — — 54年前的智慧仍然成立 ： “ 唯一有可能成功的峰会是没有开成的峰会 。 ”

column1: Getting to Yes With Kim Jong-un
column2: 与金正恩会面

column1: SEOUL – Has North Korea’s ruler, Kim Jong-un, made a strategic decision to trade away his nuclear program, or is he just engaged in another round of deceptive diplomacy, pretending that he will denuclearize in exchange for material benefits for his impoverished country?
column2: 首尔 — — 朝鲜统治者金正恩是否作出了放弃核计划的战略决定，抑或他仅仅是在展开又一轮的外交欺骗，假装要以无核化为条件换取物质利益以挽救朝鲜的贫困？

column1: This is, perhaps, the key question in the run-up to the summit between Kim and US President Donald Trump in Singapore on June 12.
column2: 这或许是6月12日金正恩与美国总统唐纳德·特朗普在新加坡举行首脑会晤之前的关键点。

column1: Until then, no one will know the answer, perhaps not even Kim himself.
column2: 直到谜底揭晓，没有人，甚至包括金正恩本人在内，能够知晓答案。

column1: Optimists tend to believe that Kim’s declared intention to denuclearize is sincere.
column2: 乐观主义者倾向于认为金宣布无核化不乏诚意。

column1: They highlight the fact that North Korea’s economy has changed fundamentally since he succeeded his father, Kim Jong-il, in 2011.
column2: 他们强调自2011年他接替其父金正日以来，朝鲜经济已经发生了根本性的变化。

column1: It is now more open, with foreign trade accounting for almost half of GDP, the result of a gradual marketization process that began in the mid-1990s.
column2: 朝鲜经济现在更加开放，外贸几乎占到GDP的一半，这是金在20世纪90年代中期逐渐推进市场化进程的结果。

column1: But with this openness comes vulnerability, which explains Kim’s active diplomatic efforts to prevent serious economic disruption from the existing international sanctions regime.
column2: 但开放的朝鲜经济也更加脆弱，这解释了金为什么愿意付出积极的外交努力，以防止现有的国际制裁机制对朝鲜经济造成严重破坏。

column1: Unlike his father, the 34-year-old Kim has been active in pursuing pro-market economic growth and may be aiming to emulate Deng Xiaoping, the architect of China’s reforms in the late 1970s.
column2: 与其父不同，34岁的金正恩一直积极寻求以市场为导向的经济增长，他或许以模仿20世纪70年代后期中国改革开放的总设计师邓小平为目标。

column1: Kim’s recent sacking of three senior old-guard military officials may hint that he is ready to offer some important concessions to prepare a favorable diplomatic environment for concentrating on economic development.
column2: 金最近解雇了三名资深的护卫军官可能暗示他为营造对经济发展有利的外交环境准备做出某些重要让步。

column1: The key question remains whether Trump is now ready to embrace Kim’s North Korea as President Richard Nixon did with Deng’s China.
column2: 但关键问题依然是特朗普是否做好准备像理查德·尼克松总统接纳邓小平的中国一样接纳金正恩的朝鲜。

column1: Pessimists, however, caution against believing that Kim is serious about denuclearization.
column2: 相反，悲观主义者警告不要相信金的无核化。

column1: There is so far no evidence, they argue, that Kim is different from his father (and grandfather, Kim Il-sung), when it comes to adhering to international agreements.
column2: 他们认为，迄今为止，没有证据表明金正恩在遵守国际协议方面与他的父亲（及其祖父金日成）有任何不同。

column1: They are skeptical, for example, that North Korea will cooperate fully on three major issues.
column2: 例如，他们怀疑朝鲜能否就三大问题进行充分合作。

column1: First, despite Kim’s declaration, it remains unclear whether he is agreeing to “complete, verifiable, and irreversible dismantlement” (CVID) of North Korea’s nuclear weapons program.
column2: 首先，尽管发表了声明，但尚不清楚金正恩是否同意“完全、可核查及不可逆转地（CVID）废除”朝鲜的核武计划。

column1: His commitment remains aspirational and lacks substance or operational content.
column2: 他的承诺仍然停留在希望层面，缺乏实际或可操作的内容。

column1: Second, given North Korea’s bad track record, the pessimists think it unlikely that Kim will permit intrusive nuclear inspections, which is a critical component of CVID.
column2: 其次，鉴于朝鲜过往的不良记录，悲观主义者认为金不太可能批准进行完全、可核查及不可逆转的无核化所不可或缺的侵入式核检查。

column1: Finally, North Korea has not yet clarified the terms of its denuclearization.
column2: 最后，朝鲜尚未澄清其无核化条件。

column1: Its past official position – withdrawal of US troops from South Korea and an end to the bilateral alliance, would be a non-starter.
column2: 朝鲜过去的官方立场 — — 要求美国从韩国撤军并中止两国双边联盟，根本就没有成功的希望。

column1: But there may be a way to achieve denuclearization that satisfies both optimists and pessimists.
column2: 但仍然有可能以一种乐观主义者和悲观主义者都能满意的方式实现朝鲜无核化。

column1: To find it requires taking a step back and considering the most fundamental reason for the diplomatic failures of the last three decades: the high level of mutual distrust, which has made a small and weak country like North Korea, surrounded by big powers, paranoid about its own security.
column2: 找到这种方式需要双方都后退一步，认真思考一下过去30年外交失败的最根本的理由：美朝高度缺乏互信，导致像朝鲜这样的弱小国家在大国的包围下，陷入对自身安全偏执的忧虑中而无法自拔。

column1: In order to address this problem at the root, the US should have taken a political approach, rather than focusing repeatedly on concluding a narrowly defined military-security deal.
column2: 为从根本上解决这一问题，美国应当采取政治手段，而不是一再以达成狭隘的军事安全协议为目标。

column1: For example, President George H.W. Bush’s administration declined North Korea’s offer to establish diplomatic relations in 1991-92, when the fall of the Soviet Union heightened Kim Il-sung’s sense of insecurity.
column2: 例如，老布什总统政府拒绝了朝鲜在1991到92年间提出的美朝建交提议，当时苏联的垮台致使金日成的不安全感增加。

column1: Likewise, North Korea’s major complaint regarding the October 1994 Geneva Agreed Framework was that the US did not keep its promise to improve political relations with North Korea.
column2: 同样，朝鲜对1994年10月日内瓦协议框架主要的不满在于美国并未兑现与朝鲜改善政治关系的承诺。

column1: The Clinton administration tried a political approach in 2000, but it was too little too late.
column2: 克林顿政府曾在2000年时尝试以政治方式解决，但这样的工作太少也太迟了。

column1: The first Trump-Kim summit may not be able to resolve all three major issues dividing the US and North Korea all at once.
column2: 首次特金会可能无法一次性解决美朝间存在的三个主要问题。

column1: But that does not mean the summit will be a failure.
column2: 但这并不意味着峰会注定无法逃脱失败的结果。

column1: For the first time, the US is tackling the fundamental cause of the North Korea problem, rather than focusing on its symptoms.
column2: 有史以来首次，美国正试图解决朝鲜问题的根本原因，而不是把注意力集中在表象。

column1: And this is why Trump’s seemingly impromptu decision to meet Kim face to face is meaningful and productive, especially if he can bolster Kim’s confidence that he and his regime will be safe without nuclear weapons and that the international community will help him to focus on economic growth.
column2: 这解释了为什么特朗普与金正恩面对面会晤的即兴决定意义深远且富有成效，尤其如果他能借此增强金正恩的信心，让金正恩相信他和他的政权在没有核武器的情况下也是安全的，而国际社会将会帮他专注于经济增长。

column1: That said, Trump would be well advised to leave the details of the denuclearization process in the hands of diplomats who have much experience in dealing with North Korea.
column2: 也就是说，特朗普将无核化进程的细节交由与朝鲜打交道有丰富经验的外交人员处理将是明智的决策。

column1: In the meantime, he will need to rebuild an international coalition to maintain effective economic sanctions, which is the most powerful leverage for persuading Kim to accept CVID.
column2: 与此同时，他需要重建国际联盟来维持有效的经济制裁，这是说服金正恩接受完全、可验证及不可逆转的无核化的最有效的筹码。

column1: Here, close cooperation with China will be essential.
column2: 在此，与中国保持密切合作至关重要。

column1: Moreover, the US should reward critical concessions by North Korea – for example, permission to conduct intrusive inspections of its entire nuclear program by international inspectors – even before the completion of CVID.
column2: 此外，美国应当鼓励朝鲜做出关键让步 — — 例如，甚至是在完全、可验证及不可逆转的无核化完成之前，允许国际核查人员对其整个核计划展开侵入性核查。

column1: There are of course no guarantees that it will work.
column2: 当然，无法确保这样的举措将会取得成功。

column1: What is clear is that successful denuclearization of North Korea will require a combination of bold political decisions – say, formally ending the Korean War, opening liaison offices, or relaxing some economic sanctions – and realistic prudence.
column2: 显而易见的是，朝鲜成功无核化将需要大胆的政治决策 — — 比如正式结束朝鲜战争、开设联络处或者放松某些经济制裁 — — 以及务实的谨慎。

column1: What Sank the Kim-Trump Summit?
column2: 金正恩特朗普峰会破裂的理由？

column1: CANBERRA – When US President Donald Trump abruptly canceled his summit with North Korea’s leader Kim Jong-un, he blamed “tremendous anger and open hostility” from the North.
column2: 堪培拉 — — 当美国总统唐纳德·特朗普突然取消与朝鲜领导人金正恩的首脑会晤，他将原因归咎于朝鲜的公开敌意和巨大愤怒。

column1: In fact, the summit, scheduled for June 12 in Singapore, was doomed for three reasons.
column2: 事实上，这场原定于6月12日在新加坡举行的峰会注定失败的理由主要有三个。

column1: First, the two sides mirrored each other’s misperception of the main motivation for the summit.
column2: 首先，双方都误解了对方参与首脑会晤的主要动机。

column1: Both thought the other had agreed to meet because of weakness and had made major concessions.
column2: 双方都认为对方同意会面是因为软弱并已做出重大让步。

column1: Kim believed that his nuclear strength had forced Trump to the summit without preconditions, making him Trump’s equal as a head of state.
column2: 金正恩相信其核力量迫使特朗普在不设先决条件的情况下参与会面，因此他可以作为与特朗普对等的国家元首进行会晤。

column1: He could afford to explore possible avenues for a peace regime, he thought, because North Korea’s nuclear sword provided immunity from US attacks.
column2: 于是他认为自己有资格探索可能的和平机制，因为核武器能确保朝鲜免于成为美国的攻击对象。

column1: But the Americans concluded that international sanctions had brought North Korea to its knees, leaving Kim desperate to conclude a deal on US terms.
column2: 但美国人却认为国际制裁已经迫使朝鲜屈服，金正恩正绝望地想要按照美国开出的条件达成协议。

column1: Part of the US strategy was to place additional pressure on China to rein in its client state or itself face tough financial penalties from Washington.
column2: 美国的部分策略是向中国施压要求其控制好自己的附庸国，不然中国自己就要面对华盛顿严厉的金融惩罚措施。

column1: South Korea’s President Moon Jae-in, who deserves the most credit for recent developments on the Korean Peninsula, unwittingly stoked this misperception by attributing his summit with Kim to Trump’s policy of “maximum pressure” on the North.
column2: 为近期朝鲜半岛局势发展做出最大贡献的韩国总统文在寅无意之中强化了这种误解，因为他将与金正恩的首脑会晤归功于特朗普对朝鲜的“最大压力”政策发挥了作用。

column1: This was calculated flattery on Moon’s part.
column2: 从文在寅的角度看这不过是有意的奉承。

column1: By validating Trump’s self-serving belief that tough sanctions bend countries to America’s will, Moon gained political cover from US foreign-policy hawks unhappy about diplomatic overtures to Kim.
column2: 因为证明了特朗普所谓强硬制裁能使他国屈从于美国意志的自私自利的理念，文在寅赢得了无法容忍对金氏政权做出任何外交提案的美国外交政策鹰派人士的政治掩护。

column1: Unfortunately, endorsement of this narrative emboldened the US hardliners now surrounding Trump to prevail upon him to exit the Iran nuclear deal.
column2: 不幸的是，对这种说法的认可鼓舞了目前围绕在特朗普周围的美国强硬派，诱使特朗普废除伊核协议的内容。

column1: To Kim, who expects to rule for decades, the reinstatement of US sanctions against Iran signaled that a deal concluded with one administration could be canceled without penalty by the next.
column2: 在未来数十年仍将继续掌权的金正恩看来，美国重新对伊朗实施制裁意味着下一届美国政府可以在不受任何惩罚的情况下推翻上一届政府达成的协议。

column1: To China (and Russia), it signaled the futility of falling in line with US demands against an ally and the pointlessness of engaging in tough multi-party negotiations over several years.
column2: 而在中国和俄罗斯看来，这表明在美国的要求下进行反对盟国之举完全徒劳无益，而且参与长达数年的多边谈判也毫无意义。

column1: To the rest of the world, it highlighted America’s growing international isolation.
column2: 而在世界其他国家看来，这凸显了美国越来越孤立的国际态度。

column1: The second reason for the summit’s cancellation was contradictory understandings of “denuclearization” – the single most critical issue in the entire episode.
column2: 峰会取消的第二个原因是对无核化矛盾的理解 — — 在整个过程中仅有这个问题是最关键的。

column1: The US, believing Kim had buckled under pressure, understood this to mean achievement of its long-sought goal of “CVID”: complete, verifiable, and irreversible denuclearization of North Korea.
column2: 美国认为金正恩因为压力而屈服，因此将其理解为美国长期追求的完全、可核查及不可逆转的无核化（即CVID）目标的实现。

column1: The North, mistakenly concluding that its nuclear deterrent had brought Trump to the summit, believed it was on the cusp of achieving its own long-sought goal: a nuclear-free Korean Peninsula, including an end to the US nuclear umbrella for Japan and South Korea.
column2: 而朝鲜则错误地认为其核威慑力迫使特朗普参加峰会，并因此认为自己长期追求的目标即将实现：那就是实现朝鲜半岛无核化，包括终结美国为日本和韩国提供核保护伞。

column1: If it played its cards right, it could even end the US alliance with South Korea and Japan, with all US troops withdrawing from East Asia.
column2: 如果筹码运用得当，甚至可以终结美国与韩国及日本的联盟状态，甚至实现从东亚撤出所有美国军队。

column1: Because the US misread Kim’s primary motivation and expectations, it ran into a third problem – in fact a trap of its own making, from which there was no escape.
column2: 因为美国误解了金正恩的主要动机和期望，它遇到第三个问题就不可避免 — — 这个问题实际是它自己制造而且无法逃避的陷阱。

column1: The North Koreans made it abundantly clear that they understood what can happen to regimes that pick fights with America without having the ultimate weapon.
column2: 朝鲜已明确表示他们非常了解不掌握终极武器的国家与美国对垒将会得到什么样的结果。

column1: They were very conscious of what happened to Slobodan Milošević, Saddam Hussein, and Muammar el-Qaddafi.
column2: 他们非常清楚斯洛博丹·米洛舍维奇、萨达姆·侯赛因和穆阿迈尔·卡扎菲的结果。

column1: And the example of Qaddafi turned out to be especially important.
column2: 而其中卡扎菲的例子显得尤为重要。

column1: After abandoning his quest for nuclear weapons in exchange for normalization of relations with the US and the world, Qaddafi died a horrible death (during which he was tortured and sodomized with a bayonet).
column2: 在放弃研发核武器以换取实现与美国和全球关系正常化之后，卡扎菲的下场是恐怖的死亡（死时他受尽刺刀的折磨 ） 。

column1: And then, on April 30, Trump’s national security adviser, John Bolton, made the incendiary suggestion that North Korea could follow the “Libya model” of denuclearization.
column2: 而后在4月30日，特朗普的国家安全顾问约翰·博尔顿提出了煽动性的建议，即要求朝鲜无核化遵循“利比亚模式 ” 。

column1: Vice Foreign Minister Kim Kye-gwan delivered the North’s furious response: “We do not hide our feeling of repugnance toward him.”
column2: 金桂冠外相代表朝鲜给出了愤怒的回复 ： “ 我们毫不掩饰对博尔顿的厌恶 。 ”

column1: The North was not interested in a dialogue aimed at a coerced “unilateral nuclear abandonment.”
column2: 朝鲜对旨在强迫“单方面弃核”的对话不感兴趣。

column1: The “world knows too well that our country is neither Libya nor Iraq, which have met miserable fates.”
column2: “全世界都知道我们的国家既不是利比亚也不是伊拉克，这两个国家所遭遇的下场都是非常悲惨的 。 ”

column1: Although Trump distanced himself from Bolton’s remarks, Vice President Mike Pence warned three weeks later that if North Korea did not make a deal, it would indeed meet with Libya’s fate.
column2: 尽管特朗普与博尔顿的言论划清了界限，但副总统迈克·彭斯却在三周后警告如果朝鲜未能达成协议，利比亚的命运就会发生在朝鲜身上。

column1: Choe Son Hui, vice minister of foreign affairs, replied by threatening a “nuclear-to-nuclear showdown” if Washington stuck to “unlawful and outrageous” belligerence.
column2: 而朝鲜副外长崔善熙则威胁进行“核摊牌 ” ， 如果华盛顿拒不放弃其“非法而无耻的”好战态度。

column1: So what happens next?
column2: 下一步将会发生什么？

column1: If North Korea resumes nuclear and long-range missile tests, Trump, whose instinct is to escalate the rhetoric of conflict, will come under pressure to respond forcefully.
column2: 如果朝鲜恢复核及远程导弹试验，那么本能的反应是升级冲突言论的特朗普将会面临作出强硬反应的巨大压力。

column1: Amid a re-run of last year’s lurid schoolyard taunts – “little rocket man” and “mentally deranged dotard” – Moon will be desperate to rescue a semblance of improvement in relations with the North.
column2: 如果去年嘲笑对方为“小火箭人”和“精神错乱的老糊涂”那样戏剧性的校园口水战再次上演 — — 文在寅将竭尽全力挽救与朝鲜改善关系的工作。

column1: Kim could try to drive a deep wedge between South Korea and the US.
column2: 而金正恩则可能进一步试图分裂美韩。

column1: Japan’s hardline Prime Minister Shinzo Abe is probably relieved that the summit has been called off.
column2: 日本强硬派首相安倍晋三很可能会因为峰会取消而长出一口气。

column1: The best the rest of the world can hope for is that, however slim the prospects, a diplomatic process will be maintained, along with channels of clear, accurate communication.
column2: 世界其他国家的最高期望是无论前景多么黯淡，有清晰准确沟通渠道的外交进程将会得以持续。

column1: A modest goal would be to reach an agreement to keep North Korea’s nuclear and missile program at current levels of capability.
column2: 相对合理的目标是达成一份协议，使朝鲜的核及导弹计划保持在目前的能力水平而不继续升级。

column1: But the US may have cornered itself by rejecting such a cap with respect to Iran.
column2: 但美国拒绝为伊朗核问题设置上限的做法或许已经将自己逼进了死胡同。

column1: Having made the perfect the enemy of the good in the Middle East, the Trump administration will find it humiliating to agree to a comparable arrangement on the Korean Peninsula.
column2: 因为在中东完美地扮演了善良的死敌，特朗普政府会因为在朝鲜半岛达成类似协议而感到屈辱。

column1: For Trump, the art of breaking deals is more important.
column2: 对特朗普而言，更重要的或许是破坏交易的艺术。

column1: Could the Trump-Kim Summit Succeed?
column2: “金特会”能成功吗？

column1: CANBERRA – Last year, North Korea’s Kim Jong-un and US President Donald Trump were hurling kindergarten insults at each other – “Rocket Man is on a suicide mission,” said Trump of Kim; “mentally deranged US dotard,” Kim retorted – while threatening to reduce East Asia to a post-atomic wasteland.
column2: 堪培拉—去年，朝鲜的金正恩和美国总统特朗普像稚童那样互相攻讦 — — “火箭人正在执行自杀任务 ， ” 特朗普说金正恩 ； “ 丧心病狂的美国老糊涂 ， ” 金正恩回击 — — 差点让东亚遭到核夷平。

column1: Now, in a stunning and dramatic development, the two are to meet by May.
column2: 如今，情况发生了令人咋舌的戏剧性变化，两人要在5月会面。

column1: Kim reportedly is willing to denuclearize and eager to talk directly to Trump, who has agreed.
column2: 据说金正恩准备去核，渴望直接和特朗普对话。 而特朗普答应了他。

column1: But optimism about this turn of events must be tempered with cautious realism.
column2: 但如果你对局势的转变充满乐观的话，请你务必保持谨慎的现实主义。

column1: North Korea is the nuclear problem from hell.
column2: 朝鲜是来自地狱的核问题。

column1: Neither South Korea nor the United States can control the narrative; definitions of success or failure are highly relative; and Trump must enter the talks with no exit strategy.
column2: 朝鲜和美国都无法控制叙事（narrative ） ， 成功还是失败，都只能从相对角度判断；而特朗普进入谈判时肯定没有退出策略。

column1: The six decades since the Korean War ended in 1953 – with a ceasefire but no peace agreement – have hardened an increasingly dangerous stalemate.
column2: 自1953年朝鲜战争结束六十年来 — — 停战但没有签订和平协定 — — 日益危险的僵局越来越难以打破。

column1: Although neither side is likely to launch a premeditated nuclear attack, the risk of war from miscommunication, misperception, or miscalculation is real.
column2: 尽管双方都不可能发动预谋的核打击，但因为沟通不畅、错觉或误判而导致战争的风险是实实在在的。

column1: All key announcements so far have come from Seoul, not Pyongyang or Washington.
column2: 到目前为止，所有重要消息都来自首尔，而不是平壤或华盛顿。

column1: President Moon Jae-in, a son of refugees from North Korea, was elected on the promise of a two-track approach to the North: sanctions and diplomacy.
column2: 韩国总统、朝鲜难民之子文在寅凭借针对朝鲜的双轨方针 — — 制裁加外交而当选。

column1: This led to the Olympic initiative whereby Kim’s sister, Kim Yo-jong, attended the Winter Games in Pyeongchang, and the two countries competed as one team.
column2: 因此，金正恩的妹妹金与正出席了平昌冬奥会，两国还组成一支队伍参赛。

column1: Afterwards, Moon’s national security adviser, Chung Eui-yong, and intelligence chief Suh Hoon traveled to Pyongyang and Washington, where, standing on the White House lawn with Cho Yoon-je, South Korea’s ambassador to the US – but with no US officials present – they announced the summit.
column2: 奥运会后，文在寅的国家安保室长郑义溶和国家情报院院长徐薰访问了平壤和华盛顿，在白宫草坪上与韩国驻美大使赵润济（但没有美国官员出席）一同宣布了金特会的消息。

column1: North Korea conducted the first of six nuclear tests in 2006.
column2: 20016年，朝鲜发动了其六次核试验中的第一次。

column1: The regime’s nuclear program has many components, and discussions could founder on what is to be proscribed, permitted, and reversed, and in exchange for what concessions by the US.
column2: 朝鲜政权的核计划有很多要素，在禁止什么、允许什么、保留什么、换取美国的什么让步等方面，都有可能令讨论夭折。

column1: Will the deal require freezing North Korea’s capability at current levels, or complete, verifiable, and irreversible denuclearization?
column2: 达成协议要求将朝鲜的核能力冻结在当前水平，还是要求完全、可查、不可撤销的去核化？

column1: The answer will depend on North Korea’s motives in getting the bomb and agreeing to talk.
column2: 答案取决于朝鲜获得核弹和同意谈判的动机。

column1: For the Kim regime, the main lesson from the fates of Slobodan Milošević, Saddam Hussein, and Muammar el-Qaddafi was that only nuclear weapons can neutralize US efforts at regime change.
column2: 对金氏政权来说，米洛舍维奇、萨达姆和卡扎菲的命运的主要教训是只有核武器能让美国不寻求颠覆政权。

column1: But the US never attacked North Korea in the decades after 1953, when it clearly did not have the bomb.
column2: 但自1953年以来的几十年中，美国从未在朝鲜没有核弹的情况下攻击过朝鲜。

column1: Conversely, the North’s growing nuclear capability provoked the US into quietly preparing for war while hoping to avert one.
column2: 相反，朝鲜不断强大的核实力促使美国一边悄然备战，一边希望避免战争。

column1: Sanctions are an ineffective tool to force North Korea’s compliance with the UN’s demand that it give up nuclear weapons, and it could prove dangerous to conclude that their pain brought Kim to the talks.
column2: 制裁并非迫使朝鲜遵守联合国的要求 — — 放弃核武器的有效工具，认为制裁带来的阵痛就能让金正恩来到谈判桌前的观点是危险的。

column1: Similarly, the threat of US military strikes did little to concentrate Kim’s mind: even Western analysts do not find that threat credible.
column2: 类似地，美国军事打击的威胁也没有引起金正恩多大的在乎：甚至连西方分析师也不认为这个威胁可信。

column1: The US lacks the ability to identify, locate, and destroy all three categories of nuclear targets: warheads, bomb production infrastructure, and delivery vehicles.
column2: 美国不具备辨别、定位和摧毁所有三类核目标的能力：核弹头、核弹生产基础设施以及运载工具。

column1: North Korea also has formidable conventional military capabilities, and estimates of human casualties could total as many as 25 million, depending on the types of weapons used, the geographical theater of the conflict, and the countries sucked into it.
column2: 朝鲜还拥有可怕的常规军力，估算的人员伤亡总数可能高达2,500万人，具体取决于使用哪种武器、冲突的地缘政治以及牵涉其中的国家。

column1: In February, Moon said: “The United States needs to lower its bar for dialogue and the North, too, must show its willingness to denuclearize” as critical first steps.
column2: 2月份，文在寅说 ： “ 美国需要降低谈话门槛，朝鲜则必须表现出去核化的意愿 ” ， 这是关键的第一步。

column1: The summit became possible because the US acceded to that counsel, turning its demand for denuclearization, which had previously been a precondition for talks, into a goal of negotiations.
column2: 峰会之所以成为可能，是因为美国接受了这一忠告，将去核化（此前一直是谈判的先决条件）从谈判要求变为谈判目标。

column1: But Kim will not trust unilateral US guarantees.
column2: 但金正恩不会相信美国的单方面保证。

column1: Therefore, any deal would require the support of China and Russia, economic and energy assistance from Japan and others, and endorsement by the UN Security Council.
column2: 因此，任何协议都需要中国和俄罗斯的支持、日本和其他国家的经济和能源援助，以及联合国安理会的认可。

column1: China and Russia have welcomed news of the direct talks, but Japan is uneasy.
column2: 中国和俄罗斯对直接对话表示欢迎，但日本感到不安。

column1: All parties will explore six elements of a deal that North Korea is seeking: a peace treaty to replace the 1953 armistice, comprehensive sanctions relief, an end to US-South Korea military exercises, diplomatic recognition, acceptance of North Korean space activities, and nuclear energy assistance.
column2: 所有各方都将探究朝鲜所寻求的六点协议要素：用和平条约取代1953年停战协议、全面放松制裁、停止美韩联合军演、获得外交承认、接受朝鲜的空间活动，以及核能援助。

column1: The North must halt all nuclear and missile tests until the summit, and sanctions will remain in place.
column2: 朝鲜必须在峰会之前停止一切核和导弹试射，制裁则会照旧。

column1: But will the US and South Korea suspend military exercises?
column2: 但美国和韩国会停止军事演习吗？

column1: To North Korea, complete denuclearization means the withdrawal of US extended nuclear deterrence from the peninsula.
column2: 对朝鲜来说，完全去核化意味着美国必须从朝鲜半岛撤出其巨大的核威慑。

column1: The Kim-Trump summit is an opportunity that will be difficult to seize and easy to squander.
column2: 金特会是一个很难把握但很容易流失的机会。

column1: For example, if Trump decertifies the Iran nuclear deal on May 12, ahead of the summit, the move would almost certainly call into question America’s good faith and ability to honor negotiated international agreements.
column2: 比如，如果特朗普在3月12日（峰会前夕）撤销伊朗核协议，那么这一举动几乎肯定会让美国尊重议定国际协定的善意和能力受到质疑。

column1: Moreover, there is the general matter of Trump’s ignorance, lack of foreign-policy experience, and the many unfilled posts in the US State Department.
column2: 此外，特朗普的无知、缺乏外交政策经验以及美国国务院大量职位空缺已成常态。

column1: There is still no US ambassador in Seoul, and Joseph Yun, US Special Representative for North Korea Policy, retired this month.
column2: 至今美国仍没有任命驻首尔大使，而美国朝鲜政策特别代表尹汝尚（Joseph Yun）又在本月退休。

column1: Without extensive diplomatic groundwork, the wily Kim could outsmart Trump.
column2: 在缺乏全面外交基础的情况下，狡猾的金正恩能够智胜特朗普。

column1: Participation in the Winter Olympics and willingness to sit down with Trump have already given the North a propaganda boost, and a summit with the US president will confer legitimacy on Kim.
column2: 参加冬奥会和愿意坐下来和特朗普谈判让朝鲜获得了宣传优势，而与美国总统举行峰会将让金正恩获得合法性。

column1: Yet Trump has proven to be pragmatic, not ideological.
column2: 但特朗普终究是个务实派，而非意识形态挂帅。

column1: His transactional approach could prove the key.
column2: 他的交易型方针可能成为关键。

column1: Whether genuine or tactical, Moon has constantly praised Trump’s tough stance of maximum pressure as helpful to gaining Kim’s interest in a possible diplomatic solution.
column2: 不管是出于肺腑还是故作姿态，文在寅始终赞扬特朗普保持最大的压力的强硬立场，认为这有助于让金正恩有兴趣寻求可能的外交解决方案。

column1: Moreover, Trump carries no historical baggage, and his decisiveness, even if rooted in impulsiveness, could provide the necessary breakthrough to overcome decades of accumulated inertia.
column2: 此外，特朗普没有历史包袱，而他的果断 — — 即使这源自他的冲动 — — 能够形成必要的突破，克服几十年来所积累的惯性。

column1: Trump’s ability to reverse himself and deny having done so could be equally advantageous.
column2: 特朗普否定自己、对已经做的事翻脸不认的也可能是一个优势。

column1: If a good deal is on the table, nothing the US has done, or that Trump has said in the past, will stop him from seizing the moment.
column2: 一旦好协议摆上桌面，不管美国做了什么，也不管特朗普从前说过什么，都不会阻止他抓住机会。

column1: On such slender threads of hope hang nuclear peace.
column2: 核和平的希望便是如此绵绵不绝如缕。

column1: Kipling’s Wisdom
column2: 吉卜林的智慧

column1: LONDON – The beginning of October marked the seventh anniversary of the beginning of the American-led bombardment of Afghanistan.
column2: 伦敦– 十月的开始标志着由美国领导的对阿富汗的轰炸已经过去了七年。

column1: Seven years later, the Taliban are still fighting.
column2: 七年后，塔利班依然在战斗。

column1: Some 50 insurgents died recently in an assault on Lashkar gar, the capital of Helmand province.
column2: 在最近一次对Helmand 省会Lashkar Gar的袭击中有大约50名叛乱者被击毙。

column1: Osama bin Laden is nowhere to be found.
column2: 奥萨马·本·拉登依然不知藏身何处。

column1: Has the time come for NATO to declare victory and leave?
column2: 北约是时候宣布胜利并离开了吗？

column1: Recently, a French diplomatic cable relating a conversation on September 2 between the French ambassador to Afghanistan, Francois Fitou, and his British colleague, Sherard Cowper-Coles, was leaked in Le Canard Enchainé , a French satirical magazine.
column2: 最近一份有关法国驻阿富汗大使Francois Fitou与英国驻阿富汗大使Sherard Cowper-Coles谈话的法国外交电报的内容在法国的一份讽刺杂志《Le Canard Enchainé》上被泄露。

column1: Cowper-Coles was reported to have said that the security situation in Afghanistan was deteriorating, that NATO’s presence was making it worse, and that the two American presidential hopefuls should be dissuaded from getting bogged down further.
column2: Cowper-Coles据说声称阿富汗的安全形势正在恶化，而北约的存在使情况变得更加糟糕，两名美国总统候选人应该被劝说不要在那里陷得更深。

column1: The only realistic policy would be to cultivate an “acceptable dictator.”
column2: 唯一现实的政策应该是扶植一位“可接受的独裁者 ” 。

column1: Of course, the British Foreign Office denied that these thoughts reflected the British government’s views.
column2: 当然，英国外交部否认这些想法代表了英国政府的观点。

column1: The departing commander of British forces in Afghanistan, Brigadier Mark Carleton-Smith, has claimed that defeating the Taliban was “neither feasible nor supportable.”
column2: 即将离职的英国驻阿富汗部队指挥官Mark Carleton-Smith准将曾经说过击溃塔利班“既不可行也得不到支持 ” 。

column1: Two days after making that gloomy assessment, the French chief of the defense staff, General Jean-Louis Georgelin, followed suit.
column2: 而在这个令人沮丧的评论发表两天后，法国国防参谋长Jean-Louis Georgelin将军也作出了类似的表述。

column1: And Kai Eide, the United Nations Secretary-General’s special representative in Afghanistan, has agreed that the situation cannot be stabilized by military means alone.
column2: 联合国秘书长阿富汗问题特别代表Kai Eide同意仅仅依靠军事行动无法稳定那里的局势。

column1: All call for a concerted political effort implying some form of negotiation with the Taliban.
column2: 所有的人都呼吁各方作出共同的政治努力以便与塔利班开展某种形式的谈判。

column1: A draft report by American intelligence agencies has also concluded that Afghanistan is in a “downward spiral” and casts serious doubt on the Afghan government’s ability to stem the Taliban’s resurgence.
column2: 美国情报部门的一份简报也曾得出结论说阿富汗处于“恶性循环”中，并且对阿富汗政府阻止塔利班重新崛起的能力表示严重怀疑。

column1: Moreover, King Abdullah of Saudi Arabia hosted a Ramadan breakfast for the Afghan government and Taliban representatives.
column2: 此外，沙特国王阿卜杜拉为阿富汗政府和塔利班代表举行了一次斋月早餐会。

column1: Predictably, both parties deny that any serious negotiations took place, while the United States and Britain claimed to know nothing about this “Saudi initiative.”
column2: 两方并不令人意外地否认进行了任何正式的谈判，同时美国和英国也表示对于“沙特倡议”一无所知。

column1: But Afghan Defense Minister Abdul Rahim Wardak subsequently said that resolution of the conflict required a “political settlement” with the Taliban.
column2: 但是阿富汗国防部长Abdul Rahim Wardak随后表示解决冲突需要与塔利班达成“政治和解 ” 。

column1: Yet at the recent NATO summit in Budapest, US Defense Secretary Robert Gates called on NATO members to provide more troops for missions in Afghanistan.
column2: 然而最近在布达佩斯召开的北约峰会上，美国国防部长盖茨呼吁北约成员国向阿富汗增派更多的部队。

column1: He accused the British of being “defeatist” and argued that Afghanistan’s deteriorating security situation could be addressed with an Iraq-style “surge,” which has undoubtedly brought down violence levels in that country.
column2: 他指责英国是“失败主义者 ” ， 指出阿富汗恶化的安全形势是可以通过伊拉克式的“大量增兵”来解决的，在伊拉克的增兵行动无疑大大降低了该国的暴力活动水平。

column1: The Americans have already committed 8,000 extra troops for next year.
column2: 美国已经承诺明年再增兵8000人。

column1: So there seems to be a split.
column2: 看起来各方存在着分歧。

column1: The British and French are busy briefing, and preparing to scale down their commitments in Afghanistan.
column2: 英国和法国正忙于吹风、并且准备缩减它们在阿富汗的驻军。

column1: They believe that boosting allied forces will only increase the sense of occupation and give the Taliban more targets.
column2: 它们认为加强联军的力量只会增加当地群众被占领的感觉并且为塔利班提供更多袭击的靶子。

column1: The emergence of a “realistic dictator” might allow NATO to withdraw most of its troops within a few years.
column2: 一个“现实的独裁者”的出现也许能使北约在未来几年内撤出其大部分的部队。

column1: But the Americans want a “surge,” and the US general commanding NATO forces in the country said last month that he needed three more brigades, some 15,000 troops in all, and Gates has asked the Europeans either to send or pay for them.
column2: 但是美国却希望“增兵 ” ， 负责指挥北约在该国的部队的美国将军上个月表示他需要增加三个旅，总共大约15000名士兵，而盖茨已经要求欧洲国家要么派兵要么出钱。

column1: The Americans do recognize the importance of courting those Taliban leaders they believe to be motivated by tribal loyalties rather than religious ideology, but they oppose the latest Afghan policy of negotiating directly and officially with the Taliban.
column2: 美国确实认识到与那些他们认为更多地受部族忠诚而非宗教意识形态所驱动的塔利班领导人示好的重要性，他们只是反对阿富汗最近直接与塔利班举行正式谈判的政策。

column1: Both Barack Obama and John McCain advocate increasing troop levels in Afghanistan above the levels that the Bush administration has already pledged.
column2: 奥巴马和麦凯恩都支持在布什政府已经承诺的基础上再向阿富汗增派更多的部队。

column1: Obama has that said he would send troops from Iraq as an urgent priority.
column2: 奥巴马表示他将从伊拉克抽调部队来应付这一当务之急的问题。

column1: McCain has given no details of his plans.
column2: 麦凯恩尚未给出他的计划的细节。

column1: Obama has made it a campaign issue to criticize the Bush administration for neglecting Afghanistan and diverting resources needed there to the misguided war in Iraq.
column2: 奥巴马把指责布什政府忽视阿富汗以及把那里急需的资源用到伊拉克被误导的战争上作为他的一个竞选议题。

column1: McCain, though, has always maintained that Iraq is the more important battlefield.
column2: 而麦凯恩则一直认为伊拉克是更重要的战场。

column1: What candidates promise on the stump is not always what they do in office.
column2: 候选人在巡回演说中的承诺在他们当选后并不一定会兑现。

column1: In the second presidential debate, Obama said, “We will kill bin Laden.
column2: 在第二场总统候选人辩论中，奥巴马说“我们将杀死本·拉登。

column1: We will crush al-Qaeda.”
column2: 我们将击溃基地组织 。 ”

column1: Are his patriotic credentials strong enough for him to renege on this pledge and pursue negotiations to withdraw without capturing the talismanic Osama?
column2: 他的爱国口碑是否足够强到让他违背自己的承诺而寻求撤军谈判，同时不去抓捕似乎有护身符保护的奥萨马？

column1: What would a US withdrawal mean for Afghanistan, for Pakistan, and for the future of NATO?
column2: 而美国的撤军对阿富汗、巴基斯坦以及北约��未来又意味着什么？

column1: To retreat from its first major “out of area” mission would be a damaging blow for the alliance.
column2: 从它在“区域外”的第一次重大行动中撤军对于这个联盟来说将是一次毁灭性的打击。

column1: Curiously, McCain may have more room for maneuver.
column2: 奇怪的是，麦凯恩可能有更大的操作空间。

column1: Republican presidents have a better record in negotiating with enemies than do Democratic ones.
column2: 共和党总统在与敌人的谈判上有着比民主党更好的记录。

column1: Eisenhower ended the Korean War, Nixon the war in Vietnam – both wars started by their Democrat predecessors.
column2: 埃森豪威尔结束了朝鲜战争，尼克松结束了越南战争 — — 这两场战争都是由他们的民主党前任发起的。

column1: Nixon, a vitriolic anti-Communist, opened relations with Mao’s China and started détente with the Soviet Union.
column2: 是尼克松，一位刻薄的反共产主义者，开始了与毛的中国的联系并且开始与苏联缓和关系。

column1: Reagan brought the US hostages back from Iran.
column2: 里根从伊朗带回了美国人质。

column1: Having condemned the “evil empire” of communism, he helped bring the Cold War to an end. Only recently, George W Bush evicted North Korea from his “axis of evil” by removing that country from America’s list of countries that sponsor terrorism.
column2: 在谴责了共产主义的“邪恶帝国”后，他帮助结束了冷战。 而最近布什将朝鲜从支持恐怖主义的国家名单中撤出，不再称其为“邪恶轴心国 ” 。

column1: And what about the British?
column2: 英国人怎么办呢？

column1: Have they suddenly remembered the unsustainable cost of fighting asymmetric conflicts?
column2: 他们是否突然想起了对抗不对称冲突的不可持续的代价？

column1: Afghanistan has never been a place any foreign army could stay for long.
column2: 从来没有任何外国军队能在阿富汗久留。

column1: The British were burned there twice (1840-1, 1878-80).
column2: 英国在那里失败了两次（1840-1841年以及1878-1880年 ） 。

column1: So were the Russians.
column2: 苏联也同样遭到了失败。

column1: Rudyard Kipling got his arithmetic right in 1886:
column2: 吉卜林1886年所作的计算是绝对正确的：

column1: No proposition Euclid wrote,
column2: 欧几里德所写的任何定理，

column1: No formulae the text-books know,
column2: 书本上所学到的任何方程，

column1: Will turn the bullet from your coat,
column2: 都不会使飞向你的子弹改变方向，

column1: Or ward the tulwar’s downward blow
column2: 或者避开向下砍来的弯刀，

column1: Strike hard who cares – shoot straight who can –
column2: 那些对此表示反对的人会被痛击 — — 那些逞能的人会被直接命中 — —

column1: The odds are on the cheaper man.
column2: 倒霉的总是那些更低级的人。

column1: Asia’s Giants Under New Management
column2: 新管理下的亚洲巨人

column1: BALI – More than one-third of the world’s population lives in just three countries: China, India, and Indonesia.
column2: 巴厘岛—世界上三分之一多的人口生活在三个国家中：中国、印度和印尼。

column1: With all three undergoing significant political transitions – whether electing a new leader or experiencing a recently installed leader’s first key decisions – this is a decisive moment in shaping the global economy’s future.
column2: 这三个国家都在经历重大政治转型 — — 或者是新领导人选举，或者是领导人的关键决定 — — 全球经济的未来也迎来了决定形时刻。

column1: If Narendra Modi and Joko “Jokowi” Widodo win the upcoming elections in India and Indonesia, respectively, they will join Chinese President Xi Jinping in spurring regional economic growth – likely causing Asia’s rise to global economic preeminence to occur faster than the world ever imagined.
column2: 如果纳兰德拉·莫迪（Narendra Modi）和“佐科维”佐科·维多多（Joko “Jokowi” Widodo）在即将到来的印度和印尼大选中获胜，他们就会加入中国国家主席习近平的行列刺激地区经济增长，这可能让亚洲以比世界所能想象的速度更快地成为全球经济主宰。

column1: In the year since Xi assumed the Chinese presidency, he has centralized power to a remarkable degree.
column2: 习近平成为中国国家主席一年以来，他令人瞩目地集中了权力。

column1: Not only has he positioned himself as General Secretary of the Chinese Communist Party and Chairman of the Central Military Commission; he has also neutralized potential rivals, including former Chongqing party boss Bo Xilai and former security chief Zhou Yongkang.
column2: 他不但集中共总书记和中央军委主席于一身；还打击了潜在对手，包括前重庆市委书记薄熙来和国家安全主管周永康。

column1: Consolidating power in a country as large and messy as China is extremely difficult, making Xi’s accomplishment remarkable, to say the least.
column2: 在庞大而复杂的中国巩固权力是十分困难的，因此，习近平的成就令人瞩目。

column1: After all, it took Xi’s predecessor, Hu Jintao, far longer to achieve a similar degree of authority.
column2: 毕竟，习近平的前任胡锦涛花了很长的时间才获得类似的权威。

column1: But it is only a first step.
column2: 但这只是第一步。

column1: Xi is now attempting to use this power to push through the difficult reforms that Hu and his prime minister, Wen Jiabao, have been widely criticized for neglecting.
column2: 现在，习近平正在试图用这一权力来推动艰难的改革。 而胡锦涛和前总理温家宝因为忽略这些改革而饱受批评。

column1: Despite the pressure to make up for lost time, Xi knows that he must be pragmatic in his reform efforts.
column2: 尽管需要奋起直追夺回时间，但习近平也明白改革措施需要务实精神。

column1: First, he must build a national consensus capable of overcoming the powerful vested interests that oppose changes – including the dissolution of monopolies, improved market regulation, increased transparency, and tax reform – that would level the economic playing field.
column2: 首先，他必须建立能够克服反对改变的强大既得利益的全国一致，破除垄断、改善市场监管、增加透明度、实施税收改革，从而让经济变竞争得更加公平。

column1: While Western leaders generally support Xi’s market-oriented reform strategy, they remain puzzled by his devotion to the CCP.
column2: 西方领导人总体都支持习近平的市场导向改革计划，但仍对习近平对党的热爱迷惑不解。

column1: To the Western mind, any truly effective reformer must be a closet democrat, like the Soviet Union’s last president, Mikhail Gorbachev.
column2: 从西方思维看，所有真正高效的改革家必然是亲民主派，如苏联末代总统戈尔巴乔夫。

column1: But Xi has no intention of being the People’s Republic’s last president, and the Soviet Union’s collapse in the wake of Gorbachev’s political reforms taught him the importance of balancing change with stability.
column2: 但习近平无意成为中华人民共和国的末代主席，戈尔巴乔夫的政治改革带来了苏联解体，这教育了习近平在变化和稳定之间保持平衡的重要性。

column1: For Xi, the CCP’s appeal lies not so much in its ideology as in its capacity to help bolster China’s prosperity.
column2: 对习近平来说，中共的号召力主要不是来自它的意识形态，而是来自它推动中国繁荣的能力。

column1: Indeed, China’s current leaders are modernizing nationalists, not communists.
column2: 事实上，中国现任领导集体都是现代化民族主义者而非共产主义者。

column1: They recognize that China’s success over the last three decades is a direct result of its shift toward a more open economy and a freer society – a shift that will continue under Xi.
column2: 他们认为，中国在过去三十年的成功是经济更开放、社会更自由的直接结果，习近平将继续这一变化。

column1: Another modernizing nationalist, Narendra Modi, is likely to become India’s prime minister following the elections that started this month.
column2: 另一位现代化民族主义者纳兰德拉·莫迪有望在本月开始的大选后成为印度总理。

column1: Modi’s pro-business approach is a major theme of his election campaign, and ordinary Indians are hopeful that his policy program will enhance their wellbeing.
column2: 莫迪的亲商业方针是其主要竞选主题之一，普通印度人也希望他的政策计划能够增加他们的福利。

column1: As Chief Minister of Gujarat, Modi worked to encourage foreign investment, provide around-the-clock electricity, build roads, and engage in intelligent urban planning.
column2: 在担任古吉拉特邦首席部长期间，莫迪致力于鼓励外国投资、提供24小时供电、建设公路并着手进行智能城市规划。

column1: Annual economic growth in the state averaged more than 10% from 2006 to 2012, when the Gujarati city of Ahmedabad was short-listed for the Lee Kuan Yew World City Prize.
column2: 2006—2012年，古吉拉特邦年平均经济增长率高达10%以上，该邦城市艾哈迈达巴德（Ahmedabad）也进入了李光耀世界城市奖决选名单。

column1: But history haunts Modi’s campaign – namely, the deaths of more than 1,000 people in anti-Muslim riots in Gujarat in 2002.
column2: 但历史不利于莫迪的选战 — — 2002年，古吉拉特邦爆发了反穆斯林动乱，超过1,000人丧生。

column1: Though the Supreme Court cleared him of all personal wrongdoing, the tragedy’s legacy persists, making it difficult for Modi to win Muslim votes without alienating his Hindu nationalist base.
column2: 尽管最高法院判决他并无个人过错，但这场悲剧的后果一直存在，莫迪如果不撇清他与印度教民族主义者的干系，就难以赢得穆斯林的选票。

column1: This has not prevented Modi from taking political risks, beginning with his assertion that India needs toilets more than temples.
column2: 这并未防止莫迪的政治冒险，他首先提出，印度需要更多地厕所，而不是庙宇。

column1: But his decision to run for Prime Minister is by far his riskiest move, as it will test his national appeal.
column2: 但他决定参选总理才是最大的冒险，这将考验他的全国吸引力。

column1: Of course, even if he wins, Modi will never be able to consolidate power to the degree that Xi has, owing to India’s separation of powers and democratic constitution.
column2: 当然，即使胜出，拜权力分裂程度和民主宪法所赐，莫迪也无法获得像习近平那样的权力。

column1: At best, he will lead a coalition government, in which his capacity to make compromises and connect with unlikely allies will dictate his success.
column2: 他最多只能领导一个联合政府，他促成妥协和与不可能与其结盟的对手的打交道的能力将决定他能否成功。

column1: Jokowi, the governor of Jakarta, will face a similar challenge if he wins Indonesia’s presidential election in July, given that his party, the Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle, will not have a majority in parliament.
column2: 雅加达省省长佐科维也将面临类似的挑战，如果他赢得7月印尼总统大选的话。 因为他所在的印尼民主斗争党（Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle）不可能赢得议会多数。

column1: Fortunately, he is a skilled politician – popular, but not populist, with tremendous persuasive powers.
column2: 幸运的是，他是政治老手，他受欢迎，但并不民粹主义，并且说服力很强。

column1: These qualities enable Jokowi to deliver results, exemplified in his success in convincing Jakarta’s slum dwellers to leave their shanties to allow for urban development.
column2: 这些资质让佐科维能够带来成果，能够说服雅加达贫民窟居民离开棚户以供城市开发就是明证。

column1: Under his leadership, highway projects that had been blocked for 16 years have been relaunched in the city.
column2: 在他的领导下，被阻止了16年的雅加达高速公路建设获得了重启。

column1: Like Xi and Modi, Jokowi is focused mainly on economic development.
column2: 和习近平和莫迪一样，佐科维的主要关注点在经济发展。

column1: In this regard, his background as a furniture manufacturer and exporter is a major asset, enabling him to bring a level of hands-on knowledge and experience that past Indonesian presidents have lacked.
column2: 从这方面看，他的家具制造商和出口商背景十分有利，这能给他带来此前几任印尼总统所欠缺的实践知识和经验。

column1: Given Jokowi’s business acumen, he understands that Indonesia must improve its logistical capabilities if its economy is to engage the world.
column2: 佐科维拥有敏锐的商业思维，因此他明白，如果印尼经济想融入世界，就必须改善其物流力。

column1: Perhaps most important, Xi, Modi, and Jokowi are all pragmatists.
column2: 也许最重要的是，习近平、莫迪和佐科维都是务实派。

column1: They know that, in order to achieve rapid economic growth and modernization – a key priority for all of them – they will need to compromise with opposition forces at home and adopt best practices from abroad.
column2: 他们知道，为了实现快速经济增长和现代化 — — 他们都面临这一紧迫挑战 — — 就需要与国内反对势力妥协并洗后国外的最佳经验。

column1: Their shared desire to engage the modern world suggests that their leadership will improve the lives of their countries’ citizens.
column2: 他们都想融入现代世界，这意味着他们的领导将改善国民生活。

column1: And better lives for one-third of the world’s population will benefit the rest of us as well.
column2: 而三分之一世界人口生活的改善将让我们其他人也都受益。

column1: Asia’s Reform Trinity?
column2: 亚洲的改革三位一体？

column1: SINGAPORE – Asia is poised to enter a historical sweet spot, with three of its most populous countries – China, India, and Indonesia – led by strong, dynamic, and reform-minded leaders.
column2: 新加坡—亚洲正站在历史的黄金机会点，三个人口最多的国家 — — 中国、印度和印度尼西亚都由强大且有活力的改革派领导人领导。

column1: In fact, China’s Xi Jinping, India’s Narendra Modi, and Indonesia’s Joko “Jokowi” Widodo could end up ranked among their countries’ greatest modern leaders.
column2: 事实上，中国的习近平、印度的莫迪和印尼的“佐科维”佐科·维多多（以下称佐科维）都有望跻身各自国家最伟大现代领导人行列。

column1: In China, Mao Zedong united the country in 1949, while Deng Xiaoping was responsible for engineering its unprecedented economic rise.
column2: 毛泽东在1949年统一了中国，而邓小平发动了前所未有的经济崛起。

column1: For Xi to join their ranks, he must create a modern, rules-based state.
column2: 习近平要想和毛邓看齐，就必须建立以基于规则（rules-based）的现代中国。

column1: That requires, first and foremost, slaying the massive dragon of corruption.
column2: 而这首先需要清除腐败的“大老虎 ” 。

column1: Over the years, corruption has become endemic in China, with regional party leaders and bosses in state-owned enterprises wielding their vast privileges and authority to accumulate personal wealth.
column2: 多年来，腐败已成为中国的顽疾，地方党政领导人和国有企业负责人利用巨大的特权和权威敛聚个人财富。

column1: This has severely undermined the Chinese Communist Party’s legitimacy, while hampering the kind of market-based competition that China’s economy needs to propel the country to high-income status.
column2: 这严重破坏了中国共产党的合法性，也妨碍了驱动中国经济迈入高收入行列所必须的基于市场的竞争。

column1: So far, Xi seems to be up to the challenge.
column2: 目前，习近平似乎占据了对这一挑战的上风。

column1: He has been boldly pursuing major figures who were previously considered “untouchable,” such as General Xu Caihou, a former vice chairman of the Central Military Commission, and Zhou Yongkang, a former member of the Politburo Standing Committee, China’s highest government body.
column2: 他大胆地将目标对准了此前被认为“不可触及”的大人物，如前中央军委副主席徐才厚和前中共中央政治局常委周永康。

column1: But the long-term fight against corruption cannot depend on Xi alone.
column2: 但与腐败的长期斗争不能光依靠习近平。

column1: It will succeed only if strong institutions are created to protect and nurture the rule of law long after Xi is out of power.
column2: 只有建立强大的制度以保护和培育习近平退休之后的法治精神，才能赢得这场斗争。

column1: If Xi chooses to establish such institutions, he has a strong legal tradition upon which to call.
column2: 如果习近平选择建立这样的制度，他有强大的法律传统可以援引。

column1: As former US Ambassador to China Gary F. Locke reported in a speech early this year, the concept of equality before the law has deep historical roots.
column2: 正如前美国驻华大使骆家辉在今年出的演讲中所言，法律面前人人平等的观念具有深刻的历史渊源。

column1: Indeed, in the fourth century BC, the statesman and reformer Shang Yang famously asserted that, “When the prince violates the law, the crime he commits is the same as that of the common people.”
column2: 事实上，在公元前四世纪，政治家、改革家商鞅就说 ， “ 王子犯法与庶民同罪 。 ”

column1: Building on this tradition, Xi can create strong institutions that will stand the test of time.
column2: 根据这一传统，习近平可以建立强大的经得起时间考验的制度。

column1: If he does – recognizing that, to be credible, the rule of law must apply even to the Party’s most influential figures – he will become modern China’s third-strongest leader.
column2: 如果他这么做了 — — 认识到要想赢得信誉就必须以法治精神约束党的最高人物 — — 他就能成为现代中国第三强势的领导人。

column1: In India, Mahatma Gandhi rejuvenated the country’s soul, which had been battered by colonialism, and Jawaharlal Nehru established its democratic political culture.
column2: 在印度，圣雄甘地重新唤醒了遭遇殖民主义重创的国家精神，尼赫鲁则确立了印度的民主政治文化。

column1: Modi now must lay the foundations for India’s emergence as a global economic power.
column2: 如今，莫迪必须为印度崛起成为全球经济强国奠定基础。

column1: Replicating the 10% annual growth rates achieved in Gujarat under Modi’s leadership from 2004 to 2012 would obviously be a boon to India’s development prospects and global standing.
column2: 复制2004—2012年主政古吉拉特邦每年经济增长10%的成绩显然将提振印度的发展前景和全球地位。

column1: But achieving such high growth rates in a sustainable way will demand far-reaching, sometimes painful reforms, such as the removal of wasteful subsidies, especially for fuel, in order to free up resources for, say, increased health-care expenditure.
column2: 但以可持续的方式实现如此高的增长率需要深远的、有时甚至是痛苦的改革，如取消纯属浪费的补贴，特别是能源补贴，以解放资源用于（比如）增加医疗支出。

column1: Other imperatives include shrinking the budget deficit, removing internal barriers to trade, and encouraging private investment.
column2: 其他当务之急包括缩减预算赤字、取消内部贸易壁垒、鼓励私人投资等。

column1: To win the support needed to implement these reforms without undermining political stability or social cohesion, Modi must demonstrate that he is an inclusive leader capable of cooperating with Indians outside of his Hindu nationalist base – including the country’s 150 million-plus Muslims.
column2: 要赢得实施这些改革而不破坏政治稳定或社会团结所需要的支持，莫迪必须证明他是一个包容的领导人，有能力与不属于其印度教民族主义者圈子的印度人合作 — — 包括1,500多万印度穆斯林。

column1: If he succeeds, he, like Xi, will become his country’s next iconic leader.
column2: 如果获得成功，他将和习近平一样，成为祖国的下一个标志性领导人。

column1: In Indonesia’s case, the two most influential leaders so far have been Sukarno, who used powerful rhetoric to foster a sense of national unity in one of the world’s most diverse countries, and Suharto, who overthrew Sukarno and created a strong economic base that lifted millions out of poverty.
column2: 在印度尼西亚，到目前为止影响力最大的两位领导人是苏加诺和苏哈托。 苏加诺用他的雄辩为这个世界上最多样化的国家之一构建了民族团结。

column1: Jokowi must now lay the institutional foundations for good governance.
column2: 而推翻苏���诺的苏哈托建立了一个强大的经济基础，将数百万人带出贫困。

column1: Jokowi has risen from humble beginnings to the apex of power without compromising his image as a “man of the people” or his reputation for pragmatism and honesty.
column2: 佐科维以卑微的出身稳定权力巅峰，并且从未在其“人民之子”的形象和务实诚信的声誉方面妥协。

column1: Jokowi has a long track record of good governance, having implemented effective policies during his stint as Mayor of Surakarta (such as refurbishing markets, relocating slum dwellers, and cutting bureaucratic red tape), and as Governor of Jakarta (where he broadened access to health care and education).
column2: 佐科维拥有长期且优秀的治理成绩，担任苏拉卡尔塔（Surakarta）市长期间，他实施了一系列有效政策（如翻新市场、搬迁贫民窟和削减官僚繁文缛节 ） ， 担任雅加达省省长期间亦然（增加了医疗和教育的普及程度 ） 。

column1: But replicating this success at the national level will be no easy feat.
column2: 但在全国范围复制这一成功决非易事。

column1: Jokowi, who takes office in October, must implement policies that address rising inequality, unsustainable fuel subsidies, entrenched corruption, inadequate infrastructure, and restrictive labor laws – all while rebuilding trust in Indonesian institutions.
column2: 10月上台的佐科维必须采取措施治理不平等性加剧、不可持续的燃料补贴、根深蒂固的腐败、基础设施不足和过于严格的劳动法 — — 与此同时还要重新建立对印尼制度的信任。

column1: The challenges facing Jokowi are compounded by the fact that his ruling coalition holds only about one-third of the seats in Indonesia’s parliament, with the rest loyal to the coalition of his rival in the presidential election, Prabowo Subianto.
column2: 让佐科维所面临的挑战更加复杂的事实是，他的执政联盟只拥有印尼议会的约三分之一议席，其余议员忠于他在总统选举中的对手普拉博沃·苏毕安托（Prabowo Subianto）的联盟。

column1: So, in introducing a new style of governance, exemplified by merit-based cabinet appointments, Jokowi must be careful not to alienate the political and business elites who have long benefited from their tight grip on power.
column2: 因此，在引入新的治国风格时 — — 比如根据能力任命内阁成员 — — 佐科维必须小心从事，避免得罪长期从把持权力中获益的政治和商界精英。

column1: In short, if Jokowi is to form a national consensus on the institutions that Indonesia needs, he will have to reach across this political divide.
column2: 简言之，如果佐科维要想构建一个印尼所需要的国家制度共识，就必须超越政治分歧。

column1: To this end, Mexican President Enrique Peña Nieto’s cross-party “Pact for Mexico” could serve as a useful model.
column2: 在这方面，墨西哥总统涅托的超越党派的“墨西哥契约 ” （ Pact for Mexico）可以作为有用的榜样。

column1: Promisingly, Jokowi has a reputation for independence from partisan and religious politics, and a talent for communicating with the people.
column2: 幸运的是，佐科维拥有独立于党派和宗教政治的声誉，并且长于沟通。

column1: And, as a political outsider, he is in a unique position to direct Indonesia toward a more prosperous, united future – and vault himself into the country’s pantheon of great leaders.
column2: 而作为政治外部人士，他拥有独一无二的地位引导印尼走向更繁荣、更团结的未来 — — 也使他本人进入印尼伟大领导人俱乐部。

column1: China, India, and Indonesia are all well positioned to take important steps forward.
column2: 中国、印度和印尼都处于跨出重要前进步伐的有利位置。

column1: A commitment by Xi, Modi, and Jokowi to do what is needed would bring rapid, far-reaching progress to their respective countries, Asia, and the global order.
column2: 习近平、莫迪和佐科维致力于应做之事将为各自国家、亚洲和全球秩序带来迅速的、影响深远的进步。

column1: The Techno-Political Transformation
column2: 技术政治转型

column1: GENEVA – It would be an understatement to say that our world is undergoing rapid and far-reaching change.
column2: 日内瓦—说我们的世界正在经历快速而深远的变革有些保守了。

column1: The global economy, the geopolitical landscape, the environment, and technology are subject to constantly shifting conditions that reinforce and transform one another in a web of complex interactions.
column2: 全球经济、地缘政治局势、环境以及科技面临不断变化的条件的约束，这些条件组成了一个复杂的互动网络，互相强化和转化。

column1: In such an unpredictable and interconnected setting, effective leadership must be based on a radical outlook, a multifaceted skillset, and an understanding of technology and talent.
column2: 在这样一个不可预测又相互联系的环境中，有效领导必须建立在不同凡响的远见、多方位的技能和对科技和人才的理解之上。

column1: The trends that are shaping the twenty-first-century world embody both promise and peril.
column2: 决定二十一世纪世界的趋势既包含了希望，也包含了危险。

column1: Globalization, for example, has lifted hundreds of millions of people out of poverty, while contributing to social fragmentation and a massive increase in inequality, not to mention serious environmental damage.
column2: 比如，全球化将数亿人带出了贫困，但也造成了社会分裂和不平等性剧增，更不用说严重的环境问题了。

column1: Likewise, big data offers untold benefits to companies and consumers, but poses a real threat to privacy and personal freedom.
column2: 类似地，大数据给公司和消费者带来了难以估量的好处，但也给隐私和个人自由造成了实实在在的威胁。

column1: A similar dichotomy applies to many other critical issues, including adaptation to climate change, efforts to improve resource management, urbanization and the rise of megacities, increased labor mobility, and human-capital expansion.
column2: 类似的二分法也适用于其他许多关键问题，包括适应气候变化、改善资源管理的措施、城市化和大都市的兴起、劳动力流动性的增加和人力资本扩张等。

column1: The scale and complexity of the challenges that lie ahead are undoubtedly daunting.
column2: 未来挑战的规模和复杂性毫无疑问是令人畏惧的。

column1: But rapid, far-reaching change can also present great opportunities.
column2: 但快速、深远的变革也带来了很大的机会。

column1: To make the most of them, the world needs technologically literate leaders – call them “techno-politicians” – who have an intuitive understanding of how to shape progress in this new, unpredictable environment.
column2: 为了抓住其中大部分机会，世界需要精通科技的领导人 — — 不妨称之为“技术政治家 ” （ techno-politician ） ， 他们应该拥有对如何在这一不可预测的新环境中取得进步这一问题的直觉理解。

column1: Within the framework of techno-politics, economic growth and technological innovation are the two most important factors shaping the global landscape.
column2: 在技术政治框架内，经济增长和科技创新是决定全球图景的最重要的两个因素。

column1: How we adapt to and guide their trajectories will determine our collective future.
column2: 我们如何适应它们、如何引导它们的轨迹将决定着我们的集体未来。

column1: In economic terms, the world is entering an era of diminished expectations.
column2: 用经济学术语讲，世界正在进入一个预期递减的时代。

column1: If, as predicted, average annual GDP growth amounts to 3% in the foreseeable future, it will take 25 years for the world economy to double in size – ten years longer than it took before the global economic crisis, when average GDP growth stood at 5%.
column2: 如果如同预测的那样，在可预见的未来，平均年GDP增长率达到3 % ， 那么世界经济规模每隔25年可以扩大一倍 — — 比全球金融及危机前（平均年GDP增长率为5 % ） 长了十年。

column1: Learning to live with slower growth will not be easy.
column2: 学习如何在增长减速的环境下生活并非易事。

column1: Given that debt-fueled consumption has run its course, productivity gains will become an increasingly critical driver of economic growth.
column2: 债务驱动型消费已是明日黄花，生产率提高将成为日益关键的经济增长驱动力。

column1: But, at a time when rising inequality is undermining social cohesion, it is far from certain that the conditions required to support such gains – that is, improved education and stronger incentives to innovate – can be met.
column2: 但是，在不平等的加剧破坏着社会凝聚力的时期，支持生产率提高所要求的条件 — — 即教育和创新激励的改善 — — 是否能够满足远未可知。

column1: Perhaps most important, even as economic growth slows, technological change continues at a breakneck pace, raising seemingly unanswerable questions about its potential impact on the global economy.
column2: 也许最重要的是，即使经济增长减速，科技变革仍能以极快的速度发展，这就引起了一个似乎无法解决的问题，即其对全球经济的潜在影响力几何。

column1: While some warn that technological progress will leave many unemployed, others remain convinced that displaced workers will find new jobs that do not yet exist, as has occurred in the past.
column2: 尽管一些人警告科技进步将让许多人失业，但其他人仍相信被替代的工人能够在从前不存在的岗位上找到新工作，一如过去所发生的那样。

column1: All that is certain is that technology and innovation are disrupting virtually every aspect of life.
column2: 唯一可以确定的是，科技和创新将破坏生活的几乎每一个方面。

column1: How can we adapt to such a world?
column2: 我们如何能够适应这样一个世界？

column1: What underpins success in this new and challenging environment?
column2: 在这个新的挑战性环境中，什么才是成功的基础？

column1: In a techno-polity, two inextricably linked factors are crucial: talent and innovation.
column2: 在技术政治中，两大牢不可破的联系因素至关重要：人才和创新。

column1: Talent is now the key factor driving competitiveness (or the lack thereof) for companies and countries alike.
column2: 人才是推进（或缺少）公司和国家竞争力的关键因素。

column1: Indeed, “talentism” will be the prevailing economic credo, with human or intellectual capital becoming the most critical asset – and the one most difficult to acquire and retain.
column2: 事实上 ， “ 人才论”将成为普遍的经济教条，人力和知识资本将成为最关键的资产 — — 也是最难获得和保存的资产。

column1: Innovation, spurred by talent, will determine success.
column2: 受人才刺激的创新将决定成功。

column1: In the future, the distinction between high- and low-income countries, or between emerging and mature markets, will no longer matter.
column2: 在未来，高收入和低收入国家的区别，或新兴市场和成熟市场的区别将不复重要。

column1: The question will be whether or not an economy can innovate.
column2: 问题将在于经济能否创新。

column1: A techno-polity also recognizes the critical role of cooperation, strategic thinking, and adaptation.
column2: 技术政治也认识到合作、策略思维和适应的关键作用。

column1: The biggest challenges nowadays are global in nature, and thus can be addressed only by engaging decision-makers and interest groups from various spheres.
column2: 今天的最大挑战都是全球性的，也只有通过各领域有魅力的决策者和利益集团才能应对。

column1: New partnerships must be forged, even among actors with seemingly disparate interests.
column2: 必须塑造新型合作关系，即便不同行动方之间利益看似大相径庭。

column1: Those who struggle to cope with change must be supported, not scorned.
column2: 在变革面前手忙脚乱的行动方应该获得支持而不是嘲笑。

column1: But effective techno-politicians must go beyond firefighting to think about the long term.
column2: 但高效的技术政治家必须超越救火思维，而将目光放长远。

column1: They must be able to respond to new and impending developments without delay, constantly experimenting with new ideas and processes.
column2: 他们必须能够毫不迟疑地应对发展局势，连续不断地实验新思想和过程。

column1: Moreover, they must to be able to understand and react simultaneously to multiple competing realities.
column2: 此外，他们还必须能够同时理解和对多重竞争现实产生反应。

column1: The role of the techno-polity is to steer the world toward positive outcomes.
column2: 技术政治的作用是引导世界走向积极方向。

column1: It will demand that decision-makers use their heads and hearts – and it will also test their nerves.
column2: 它要求决策者用脑也用心，还会考验他们的神经。

column1: The Global Economy in 2014
column2: 2014全球经济

column1: GENEVA – At the dawn of a new year, the world is in the midst of several epic transitions.
column2: 日内瓦—新年来临之际，世界仍处在世界仍在极大几大划时代的变化当中。

column1: Economic growth patterns, the geopolitical landscape, the social contract that binds people together, and our planet’s ecosystem are all undergoing radical, simultaneous transformations, generating anxiety and, in many places, turmoil.
column2: 经济增长模式、地缘政治局势、实现人类团结的社会契约、以及地球生态系统都在经历彻底而同时的变革，让人感到焦虑，也让很多地方陷入了动荡。

column1: From an economic standpoint, we are entering an era of diminished expectations and increased uncertainty.
column2: 从经济角度看，我们正在进入预期下降、不确定性增加的时代。

column1: In terms of growth, the world will have to live with less.
column2: 增长方面，我们将面临不如从前的局面。

column1: To understand the implications of this, consider the following: If the global economy grew at its pre-crisis pace (more than 5% per year) for the foreseeable future, its size would double in less than 15 years; at 3%, doubling world GDP would take about 25 years.
column2: 要理解这所带来的影响，试想若全球经济在可预见的未来继续以危机前的速度（每年超过5 % ） 增长，则世界规模将在15年内翻番；若按3%的速度增长，世界GDP翻番需要大约25年。

column1: This makes a significant difference to the speed at which wealth creation occurs, with profound effects on expectations.
column2: 这意味着财富创造的速度将发生极大的变化，从而对预期造成深远影响。

column1: We ignore the power of compound growth to our detriment.
column2: 我们忽视了复合增长的力量对我们造成的伤害。

column1: As for uncertainty, the world’s four largest economies are currently undergoing major transitions.
column2: 在不确定性方面，世界最大的四个经济体目前都在经历重要转型。

column1: The US is striving to boost growth in a fractured political environment.
column2: 美国在竭尽全力在破碎的政治环境中提振增长。

column1: China is moving from a growth model based on investment and exports to one led by internal demand.
column2: 中国在促使增长模式从基于投资和出口转变为基于内需。

column1: Europe is struggling to preserve the integrity of its common currency while resolving a multitude of complex institutional issues.
column2: 欧洲正在勉力维持共同货币并解决众多复杂的制度性问题。

column1: And Japan is trying to combat two decades of deflation with aggressive and unconventional monetary policies.
column2: 日本正在通过非常规的激进货币政策与二十年的通缩作斗争。

column1: For each, the formulation and outcome of complex and sensitive policy decisions implies many “unknowns,” with global interdependence heightening the risk of large unintended consequences.
column2: 对于每一个经济体，复杂而敏感的政策决策的形式和结果都存在诸多“未知 ” ， 而全球相互依赖的特征让意料之外的重大后果的风险更大了。

column1: For example, the US Federal Reserve’s policy of quantitative easing (QE) has had a major effect on other countries’ currencies, and on capital flows to and from emerging markets.
column2: 比如，美联储的量化宽松（QE）政策对其他国家的货币和进出新兴市场的资本流具有重大影响。

column1: When QE was launched, it was the least flawed of the available policies, and it averted a catastrophic global depression.
column2: QE出台时，它是所有可行政策中缺陷最小的，并且扭转了灾难性的全球萧条。

column1: But its downsides are now apparent, and its abatement in 2014 could fuel further uncertainty.
column2: 但如今QE的副作用逐渐显现，而它在2014年的逐渐退出将带来新的不确定性。

column1: The Fed’s QE policy, and variants of it elsewhere, have caused the major central banks’ balance sheets to expand dramatically (from $5-6 trillion prior to the crisis to almost $20 trillion now), causing financial markets to become addicted to easy money.
column2: 美联储的QE政策以及其他国家的众多变化版QE让主要央行的资产负债表迅速扩张（从危机前的5—6万亿美元扩大到今天的近20万亿美元 ） ， 导致金融市场患上了廉价资金瘾。

column1: This has led, in turn, to a global search for yield, artificial asset-price inflation, and misallocation of capital.
column2: 而这反过来又导致全球追逐收益率，造成人为的资产泡沫和资本错配。

column1: As a result, the longer QE lasts, the greater the collateral damage to the real economy.
column2: 因此，QE维持时间越长，对实体经济的附带伤害就越大。

column1: The concern now is that when the Fed begins to taper QE and dollar liquidity drains from global markets, structural problems and imbalances will resurface.
column2: 现在的担心是当美联储开始逐渐减少QE、美元流动性从全球市场中抽走时2，结构性问题和失衡将卷土重来。

column1: After all, competitiveness-enhancing reforms in many advanced economies remain far from complete, while the ratio of these countries’ total public and private debt to GDP is now 30% higher than before the crisis.
column2: 毕竟，许多发达经济体的增强竞争力的改革措施远远没有到位，而这些国家的公私债务总额/GDP比率比危机前高了30 % 。

column1: This source of uncertainty coincides with weakening performance in many emerging countries.
column2: 除此之外的另一个不确定性源头是许多新兴国家表现萎靡。

column1: Back in 2007, emerging-market growth was expected to outpace that of advanced economies by a wide margin, before converging.
column2: 2007年，人们预期新兴市场增长会在趋同前超出发达经济体很多。

column1: Today, the advanced economies contribute more to global GDP growth than emerging countries, where growth is forecast to average 4% in the coming years.
column2: 如今，发达经济体对全球GDP增长的贡献已经超过新兴国家，新兴国家未来几年的增长率预计平均为4 % 。
