column1: The Maidan movement, for all of the nasty antecedents of some of its participants, began as a true popular uprising against a corrupt and despotic regime supported by an expansionist Russia.
column2: 迈丹运动 — — 尽管一些参与者此前有过不良案底 — — 是真正的反对腐败残暴政权的群众起义，其背后有扩张主义俄罗斯的支持。

column1: Illiberal nationalism is one of the movement’s driving elements, owing to its widely shared and understandable anti-Russia appeal.
column2: 狭隘民族主义是这场运动背后的推动力之一，因为这场运动有人所共有、亦不难理解的反俄诉求。

column1: And, though that nationalism may yet be directed against Ukraine’s Russians, Poles, and Jews, as it was in the past, the rest of the movement would resist such a turn (which may well explain why it has not happened).
column2: 此外，尽管民族主义可能如过去一样被引导为反对乌克兰的俄罗斯人、波兰人和犹太人，但迈丹运动的其他部分将能抵制这一转变（这也很好地解释了为什么没有变成这样 ） 。

column1: Putin’s claim that fascists have taken control in Kyiv is fundamentally bogus, while Russia’s despicable actions in Crimea and eastern Ukraine are all too real.
column2: 普京的主张 — — 法西斯主义者控制了基辅 — — 是彻头彻尾的谎言，而俄罗斯在克里米亚和东乌克兰的卑劣行动则是铁一样的事实。

column1: Russia does retain some support among Russophone Ukrainians of all ethnicities, including some Jews.
column2: 俄罗斯确实拥有来自各民族俄罗斯裔乌克兰人的支持，包括一些犹太人。

column1: But Zissels is right: The battle is not about them; it is about the survival of a fledgling democratic nation-state.
column2: 但吉赛尔斯是对的：这场战争和他们无关；这场战争和刚刚起步的民主民族国家的生死存亡有关。

column1: Toward a People-Centered ASEAN Community
column2: 通往以人民为中心的东盟社会

column1: SEOUL – I am delighted that my first meeting with the leaders of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations comes at a historic moment: the 50th anniversary of ASEAN’s founding.
column2: 首尔—很高兴我与东南亚国家联盟领导人的第一次会晤正逢历史时刻：东盟成立50周年。

column1: During those 50 years, not only my country, the Republic of Korea, but almost all of Asia has been utterly transformed.
column2: 在这50年里，我的祖国韩国以及几乎整个亚洲都发生了翻天覆地的变化。

column1: ASEAN’s role in harnessing and spreading economic dynamism has been essential to the region’s success.
column2: 东盟在促进和传播经济活力方面所起到的作用，对于亚洲地区的成功至关重要。

column1: For Korea, ASEAN has undoubtedly been a special and valued friend.
column2: 对韩国来说，东盟是毋庸置疑的宝贵的特殊朋友。

column1: Last year alone, some six million Koreans visited ASEAN member states, both as tourists and for business.
column2: 光是在去年，就有约六百万韩国人来到东盟成员国旅行，他们当中既有游客，也有商务人士。

column1: Approximately 500,000 citizens of ASEAN member states now live and work in Korea, while roughly 300,000 Koreans live and work in ASEAN countries.
column2: 大约500,000东盟成员国公民现在在韩国生活和工作，大约300,000韩国人在东盟国家生活和工作。

column1: This is one example of why Korea’s ties with ASEAN are more than just intergovernmental relations.
column2: 这是韩国与东盟的关系不仅局限于政府间关系的一个例子。

column1: Our relationship is deepened in the most personal way possible, through the intertwining of so many individuals’ lives.
column2: 我们的关系因为如此多个体生活之间的牵挂，而通过最为个人化的方式得到了深化。

column1: This fact should not surprise anyone.
column2: 这个事实并不足为奇。

column1: ASEAN 2025: Forging Ahead Together, which was endorsed by ASEAN leaders at their 27th Summit in November 2015, states that the group strives to be a “people-centered, people-oriented community” that seeks to build a caring and sharing society which is inclusive and where the well-being, livelihood, and welfare of the people are enhanced.
column2: 2015年11月，东盟领导人在第27次东盟峰会上推出了《东盟2025：携手前进 》 （ ASEAN 2025: Forging Ahead Together ） ， 该宣言指出，该集团致力于“以人民为中心、以人民为导向的社会 ” ， 寻求构建一个关怀共享的包容社会，让人民的福祉、生计和福利得到提升。

column1: “People first” has been my longstanding political philosophy as well, and it is a vision in line with the spirit of Korea’s “candlelight revolution” that lit and heated up the winter in Korea a year ago.
column2: “人民优先”也一直是我长期以来的政治哲学，它是一个和一年前照亮和温暖韩国的“烛光革命”精神异曲同工的愿景。

column1: Korea and ASEAN share a common philosophy that values people, and that shared outlook will set the path that Korea and ASEAN take together in the years and decades ahead.
column2: 韩国和东盟有着共同的哲学，即注重人民，而这一共同前景将为韩国和东盟铺就未来几十年携手共进的道路。

column1: Since 2010, Korea and ASEAN have made significant strides together as strategic partners.
column2: 2010年以来，韩国和东盟作为战略合作伙伴，一起取得了重大进步。

column1: Korea-ASEAN cooperation so far, however, has remained focused mainly on government-led collaboration in political, security, and economic affairs.
column2: 但是，目前韩国-东盟合作仍然主要集中在政府领导的政治、安全和经济领域的合作项目。

column1: I intend to help advance Korea-ASEAN relations while placing a high priority on the “people” – both Koreans and the people of ASEAN.
column2: 我想在助力韩国-东盟关系的同时，将“人民”列为工作重点 — — 既包括韩国人，也包括东盟人民。

column1: My vision is to create, in cooperation with ASEAN, a “peace-loving, people-centered community where all members are better off together.”
column2: 我的愿景，是与东盟一起建立一个“热爱和平、以人民为中心的社会，让所有成员的境况都能得到改善 。 ”

column1: This can be summed up in “three Ps”: People, Prosperity, and Peace.
column2: 这可以归结为“3P ” ： 人民（People ） 、 繁荣（Prosperity）和和平（Peace ） 。

column1: To realize this vision, I will pursue “people-centered diplomacy.”
column2: 为了实现这一愿景，我将追求“以人民为中心的外交 ” 。

column1: So, from this point onward, cooperation between Korea and ASEAN will be developed in a way that respects public opinion among all of the peoples of our association, gains their support, and invites their hands-on participation.
column2: 因此，从这一点出发，韩国与东盟之间的合作将尊重我们中间所有民族的公共观念，赢得他们的支持，邀请他们躬身参与。

column1: To this end, and in commemoration of ASEAN’s 50th anniversary, we have designated this year as “Korea-ASEAN Cultural Exchange Year,” and actively promoted various cultural and people-to-people exchanges.
column2: 在这方面，以及为了纪念东盟成立50周年，我们将今年定为“韩国-东盟文化交流年 ” ， 积极地推动不同文化之间和人际之间的交流。

column1: Last September, the ASEAN Culture House (ACH) opened in Korea’s southern port city of Busan.
column2: 去年9月，东盟文化学院（ASEAN Culture House，ACH）在韩国南部的港口城市釜山开门。

column1: The ACH is the first of its kind to be opened in an ASEAN dialogue partner country, and it is expected to serve as a hub for cultural and people-to-people exchanges between Korea and ASEAN members.
column2: ACH是东盟对话伙伴国家开设的第一家此类学院，我们希望它成为韩国和东盟成员国之间文化和人际交流的枢纽。

column1: The Korean government will spare no effort to expand these exchanges, especially among the young people who will lead Korea-ASEAN relations in the future.
column2: 韩国政府将全力以赴扩大这些交流，特别是在将成为未来韩国-东盟关系领导者的年轻人之间的交流。

column1: We should also work to build a community of peace where people are safe.
column2: 我们还应该致力于构建一个人民可以安全地生活在其中的社会。

column1: In Asia, we all are facing the threat posed by North Korea’s nuclear weapons and missiles, as well as non-traditional security threats, including terrorism, violent extremism, and cyber-attacks on our businesses, our social and civic infrastructure, and our official institutions.
column2: 在亚洲，我们都面临着朝鲜核武器和导弹所带来的威胁，除此之外还有非传统安全威胁，包括恐怖主义、暴力极端主义以及对我们的企业、我们的社会和民用基础设施，以及我们的官方机构的网络袭击。

column1: The Korean government will strive to ensure that both Koreans and the people of ASEAN are able to lead happy and safe lives, which means cooperating with all ASEAN member states, at both the bilateral and multilateral level, to overcome the security challenges that we jointly face.
column2: 韩国政府将致力于确保韩国人和东盟人民能够过上幸福安全的生活，这意味着要与所有东盟成员国进行双边和多边层次的合作，以克服我们共同面对的安全挑战。

column1: Finally, I will endeavor to promote greater mutual prosperity, which benefits citizens of both ASEAN and Korea.
column2: 最后，我将竭尽全力促进更大的共同繁荣，让东盟和韩国公民共同受益。

column1: To ensure the sustainability of people-centered cooperation, all countries in the region must grow and develop together.
column2: 为了确保以人民为中心的合作的可持续性，所有域内国家必须实现共同增长和发展。

column1: Creating a structure for mutual prosperity requires lowering regional and transnational barriers to facilitate the flow of goods and promote people-to-people interactions.
column2: 为构建一个共同繁荣构架需要消除地区和跨国壁垒，以便利商品流动、促进人际交流。

column1: In short, ASEAN’s dynamism must now be tied to its inclusiveness.
column2: 简言之，东盟的活力现在已经与其包容性紧密相连。

column1: That is why Korea will actively support the “Master Plan on ASEAN Connectivity 2025” and “Initiative for ASEAN Integration (IAI) Work Plan,” both of which call for enhancing the connectivity between ASEAN economies and citizens.
column2: 因此，韩国将积极支持“2025年东盟联动性总体规划 ” （ Master Plan on ASEAN Connectivity 2025）和“东盟一体化（IAI）工作计划方案 ” （ Initiative for ASEAN Integration (IAI) Work Plan ） ， 两者都要求加强东盟经济体和公民之间的联动性。

column1: We will also accelerate the pace of negotiations for the further liberalization of a Korea-ASEAN Free Trade Agreement (FTA), in order to pave the way for freer and more inclusive growth in the region.
column2: 我们还将加快韩国-东盟自由贸易协定（FTA）进一步自由化的谈判，从而为更自由、更包容的地区增长铺平道路。

column1: Korea is now preparing for yet another “hot” winter: the PyeongChang Olympic and Paralympic Winter Games, to be held in February 2018.
column2: 目前，韩国正在准备有一个“热”冬天：将在2018年2月举行的平昌冬奥会和冬残奥会。

column1: Our preparations are focused on ensuring that these Games deliver a message of reconciliation, peace, mutual understanding, and cooperation throughout the world.
column2: 我们的准备工作的重点是要确保这次冬奥会传递全世界和谐、和平、互相理解以及合作的精神。

column1: I happily invite you all to discover a peaceful and joyous winter in PyeongChang, and experience the dynamism sweeping through Korea and ASEAN.
column2: 我愉快地邀请你们所有人来平昌渡过一个和平快乐的冬季，体验韩国和东盟无处不在的活力。

column1: Don’t miss an opportunity to find out and enjoy what Korea and ASEAN share in common.
column2: 不要错过发现和享受韩国和东盟共同点的机会。

column1: Kosovo’s Original Sin
column2: 科索沃的原罪

column1: PRISTINA – Hundreds of people disappeared ten years ago in Kosovo, the former Serbian province that is now the world’s newest state.
column2: 普里什蒂纳 — — 10年前有数百人在科索沃失踪，这个曾经的塞尔维亚省已经是全世界最新成立的一个国家。

column1: These are not missing persons like the Albanians whom Serbian police executed and buried in secret graves during the Kosovo conflict of 1999.
column2: 这些人不同于1999年科索沃战争期间被塞尔维亚警察枪决后掩埋在秘密坟墓中的阿尔巴尼亚失踪者。

column1: These missing persons disappeared after the conflict, on NATO’s and the United Nations’ watch.
column2: 这些失踪人员的失踪时间是在 战后 ，在北约和联合国的众目睽睽之下。

column1: Most were Serb civilians.
column2: 其中多数人是塞族平民。

column1: Relatives of most report that they were abducted.
column2: 多数失踪者的亲属报告他们被人绑架。

column1: Kosovo, to a significant degree, owes its independence to a NATO military intervention undertaken in the name of human rights.
column2: 很大程度上科索沃独立应归功于北约以人道主义为名发起的军事干预行动。

column1: And in the name of human rights, it is time for the truth to come out about the people who went missing after the conflict, and about why, for a decade, UN officials ignored appeals by the victims’ families and launched no criminal investigation.
column2: 以人权的名义，现在是时候揭开战后人员失踪真相，以及为什么在10年时间里，联合国官员不理睬受害者家属提出的申诉，没有进行任何刑事调查。

column1: Kosovo’s Albanian authorities have for years made no significant decision without receiving the imprimatur of the European Union and, especially, the United States.
column2: 多年以来，科索沃阿尔巴尼亚当局未获欧盟、特别是美国的批准没有做出任何重要的决策。

column1: They should urge the Kosovo government to mount a credible investigation, for the sake of the victims and people in Kosovo who want their state to be ruled by law.
column2: 看在受害者和希望实现法治的科索沃民众份上，他们应当敦促科索沃政府进行令人信服的调查。

column1: In 1999, the US led NATO into war against Slobodan Milosevic’s Serbia to end gross violations of the rights of Kosovo’s majority Albanians.
column2: 1999年，以美国为首的北约向斯洛博丹·米洛舍维奇的塞尔维亚宣战，以结束对科索沃多数阿尔巴尼亚人权利的严重侵犯。

column1: Serb nationalists had quashed Kosovo’s autonomy.
column2: 塞尔维亚民族主义者不承认科索沃自治。

column1: Serb troops beat, killed, and jailed Albanians, whose leaders, following cues from Western embassies, urged nonviolence.
column2: 塞族军队殴打、杀戮和关押阿尔巴尼亚人，而阿族领袖在西方各国使馆的暗示下，敦促非暴力解决争端。

column1: After the rise of an Albanian insurgency, the Kosovo Liberation Army (UCK), Milosevic launched a violent, all-out campaign to expel Kosovo’s Albanians.
column2: 在阿尔巴尼亚叛军科索沃解放军（UCK）成立之后，米洛舍维奇发起了一场暴力行动，全力驱赶科索沃的阿尔巴尼亚人。

column1: Villages were burned.
column2: 村庄被焚毁。

column1: Serbian police forces killed Albanian civilians and cast out hundreds of thousands.
column2: 塞族警察部队杀害阿尔巴尼亚平民，驱逐了数十万人。

column1: (The authorities in Belgrade have yet to come clean on the Albanians civilians executed and buried on police and military bases in Serbia.)
column2: （贝尔格莱德当局至今尚未就塞尔维亚军警基地中处决和掩埋的阿尔巴尼亚平民全盘招供 ） 。

column1: NATO forced Serb forces to withdraw in June 1999, and international peacekeepers, under NATO’s leadership, occupied Kosovo.
column2: 北约军队迫使塞族军队于1999年6月撤军，以北约为首的国际维和部队随之占领科索沃。

column1: The UN sent a mission to help establish local institutions.
column2: 联合国派遣使团协助重建当地机构。

column1: The US and West European countries began shepherding Kosovo’s new Albanian authorities toward statehood.
column2: 美欧国家开始指导科索沃新的阿尔巴尼亚政权建国。

column1: Last year, Kosovo gained independence.
column2: 去年，科索沃宣布独立。

column1: Sixty countries, including the US and most EU states, have recognized it.
column2: 包括美国和欧盟国家在内的60个国家承认科索沃建国。

column1: According to a recent BBC news investigation, however, UCK members abducted Serbs, Albanians, Roma, and others after NATO’s arrival.
column2: 但据不久前BBC新闻调查报道，科索沃解放军在北约进驻后绑架塞族、阿族、罗马族和其他民族群众。

column1: UN missing-persons researchers – not criminal investigators – searched for them for years and found no trace of them in Kosovo.
column2: 联合国失踪研究员（而非刑事调查员）调查了几年时间，在科索沃没有找到任何线索。

column1: They did, however, find Albanian witnesses who asserted that UCK members took captured Serbs, Albanians, and Roma into Albania, where they were killed.
column2: 但他们确实发现了阿族目击者指称科索沃解放军将被俘的塞尔维亚人、阿尔巴尼亚人和罗马人带到阿尔巴尼亚，并在阿境内将他们杀害。

column1: Now the BBC has broadcast interviews with Albanians who were imprisoned in secret UCK camps in Albania.
column2: BBC播出了对关押在科索沃解放军阿尔巴尼亚秘密集中营的阿尔巴尼亚人的采访录像。

column1: These witnesses confirmed that the camps also held Serbs, Roma, and others.
column2: 这些目击者证实集中营也关押塞族、罗马族和其他民族群众。

column1: The BBC located graves of some of the missing in Albania.
column2: BBC在阿尔巴尼亚找到了一些失踪者的坟墓。

column1: There have been leaks of UN documents citing Albanian sources who name people involved.
column2: 传闻一份泄露的联合国文件列出了参与人员名单等情报。

column1: From June 1999, the UN and NATO contingents in Kosovo clearly calculated that stability trumped justice.
column2: 从1999年6月开始，科索沃的联合国及北约分遣队明确认为稳定压倒了公正。

column1: Despite the urging of staff members, leaders of these missions avoided launching criminal investigations into the missing.
column2: 各分遣队领袖不顾工作人员的一再敦促，拒绝对失踪事件进行刑事调查。

column1: Some UCK leaders, lionized by the local Albanian population as the victors of 1999, are now running Kosovo’s government.
column2: 被当地阿尔巴尼亚人视为1999年胜利者而与之结交的某些科索沃解放军领袖现在掌管着科索沃政府。

column1: Their blanket denials are no longer credible.
column2: 他们空洞的否认无法再让人信服。

column1: Kosovo will not convince many more countries to recognize its independence unless it investigates these disappearances and demonstrates a commitment to the rule of law.
column2: 除非调查失踪事件，显示实现法治的决心，否则科索沃将无法说服更多国家承认它的独立。

column1: (Likewise, no one should forget the Albanian dead that Serbia has not returned.)
column2: （同样，人们也不该忘记塞尔维亚尚未归还的阿尔巴尼亚遇难者。

column1: A credible investigation requires full backing from the authorities in Albania and from the newly established EU mission in Kosovo.
column2: ）需要有阿尔巴尼亚当局和新成立的欧盟科索沃行动小组的全力支持才能开战令人信服的调查。

column1: On the record, leaders of this mission say that they are interested in investigating.
column2: 在公开场合，行动小组领导人说愿意展开调查。

column1: Diplomats speaking off the record, however, tell a different tale, even as some Albanian political leaders, including some former UCK officials, call for an inquiry.
column2: 但就算包括某些前科索沃解放军军官在内的阿尔巴尼亚政治领袖呼吁展开调查行动，私下谈话的外交官态度却截然不同。

column1: The US should use its political clout with Albania and Kosovo to press for a thorough investigation, and for criminal proceedings against anyone who is implicated.
column2: 美国应当利用对阿尔巴尼亚和科索沃的政治影响促成全面彻底的调查，并对涉案人员提起刑事起���。

column1: Albanians are outraged at the allegations that UCK members engaged in war crimes and other criminal behavior.
column2: 科索沃解放军参与战争和其他刑事犯罪的指控让阿尔巴尼亚人愤怒。

column1: Some Albanians claim that these allegations are Serbian propaganda.
column2: 一些阿尔巴尼亚人宣称这种指控是塞族人的烟幕。

column1: But there are many Albanians who know differently, and believe that Kosovo is failing to come to terms with the acts of a few rogue fighters.
column2: 但也有很多阿尔巴尼亚人知道事实真相，相信科索沃由于极少数流氓战士的行为未能实现目标。

column1: These Albanians fear that, in the absence of the rule of law, Kosovo will become a mafia state.
column2: 这些阿尔巴尼亚人担心没有了法治，科索沃将成为一个黑手党国家。

column1: Kosovo’s Albanians do not want a state tainted by such allegations.
column2: 科索沃的阿尔巴尼亚人要的不是被指控污染的国家。

column1: They want a state that respects human rights for everyone.
column2: 他们希望国家尊重每个人的人权。

column1: And they want answers about the fate of hundreds of people who have been missing for a decade.
column2: 他们也想找到数百位长达10年的失踪者命运的答案。

column1: India’s Deadly Entrance Exams
column2: 印度的夺命高考

column1: NEW DELHI – In late April, a 17-year-old girl named Kriti Tripathi leaped to her death in Kota, India, shortly after passing the country’s examination for admission to the prestigious Indian Institutes of Technology (IIT).
column2: 新德里—4月底，17岁的女孩克里提·特立帕提（Kriti Tripathi）在印度科塔（Kota）跳楼身亡。

column1: A week later, another Kota student, Preeti Singh, hanged herself, succumbing to her injuries after a few days.
column2: 她刚刚通过印度理工 学院（IIT）入学考试。

column1: Singh’s was the ninth suicide by a student in Kota this year alone, and the 56th in the last five.
column2: 一周后，另一位科塔学生普利提·辛格（Preeti Singh）自缢，几天后身亡。

column1: All attended Kota’s “coaching institutes,” whose sole purpose is to prepare high-school students for the IIT Joint Entrance Examination (JEE).
column2: 她们都参加了科塔“补习班 ” ， 这些补习班的唯一目的是帮助高中生准备IIT入学联考。

column1: In a five-page suicide note, Tripathi expressed her frustration at having been compelled to study engineering, when her real ambition was to become a NASA scientist.
column2: 在五页长的遗书中，特立帕提表示对于自己被迫学习工科感到沮丧，她真正的志向是成为一名美国宇航局（NASA）科学家。

column1: She also described the pressure she had faced at the coaching institution.
column2: 她还描述了自己在补习班所遇到的压力。

column1: Tripathi implored the Human Resource Development Ministry to shut down such institutes, which force their students to endure unbearable stress and depression.
column2: 特立帕提恳请人力资源部关闭这些强迫学生忍受不可承受的压力和抑郁的补习班。

column1: The story is all too common, but should the blame really be laid on the coaching institutes?
column2: 她的故事太平常了，但矛头真的应该指向补习班吗？

column1: In fact, Kota’s coaching institutes are a symptom of a larger problem, hinted at by the city’s senior administrator, District Collector Ravi Kumar Surpur, in an emotional letter he wrote in response to the latest deaths.
column2: 事实上，科塔的补习班只是一个更大的问题的症候。 该市高级官员、区税务官拉维·库马尔·苏尔珀尔（Ravi Kumar Surpur）在一封回应最近的死亡事件的充满感情色彩的信中提到了这一问题。

column1: Addressing parents directly, Surpur pleaded with them not to subject their children to excessive stress in an attempt to live vicariously through them.
column2: 苏尔珀尔将矛头直指家长，恳请他们不要让孩子承受过度压力，替自己完成心愿。

column1: Indian parents are known for demanding academic excellence from their children.
column2: 印度家长以对孩子成绩要求严格闻名。

column1: They know that a professional degree in the right field is a passport to social and economic advancement, so they push hard to ensure that their children get one – something that India’s higher-education system does not make easy.
column2: 他们知道，在正确专业取得专业学位有助于社会和经济成就，因此他们竭尽全力确保孩子能获得一个这样的学位 — — 而在印度高等教育体系中，获得这一学位绝不容易。

column1: Given this deeply entrenched culture of academic ambition, the planned administrative inquiry into conditions at the Kota coaching institutes is unlikely to result in remedial action.
column2: 在这一根深蒂固的成绩文化影响下，计划对科塔补习班环境进行行政调查不可能形成纠正措施。

column1: The toll this culture takes on young people is obvious.
column2: 这种文化对年轻人造成的伤害是显而易见的。

column1: Students are forced to pass brutally difficult examinations – only about 10,000 of the 500,000 who take the IIT-JEE each year score high enough to be admitted – in subjects they often detest.
column2: 学生们被迫参加难道变态的考试 — — 每年参加IIT联考的人数有500,000，只有大约10,000能上线 — — 而他们往往很讨厌这些考试科目。

column1: And Indian students are far more likely to push themselves until they crack than to drop out.
column2: 印度学生常常把自己逼到崩溃也不肯放弃。

column1: Engineering and medicine remain the subjects of choice for middle-class Indian parents.
column2: 工科和医科仍是印度中产阶级家长的科目选择。

column1: The country graduates a half-million engineers every year, some 80% of whom end up in jobs that do not require an engineering degree.
column2: 每年印度有五十万工程师毕业，其中80%的人从事不需要工科学位的工作。

column1: But, in a throwback to the mid-twentieth century, Indian parents view engineering as the gateway to modernity, and continue pressing their children to study it.
column2: 但是，印度家长的观念还停留在二十世纪中叶，认为工科是现代化的敲门砖，继续强迫孩子学工科。

column1: Students who do not make it to an IIT end up in institutions of varying quality, many of which do not equip their graduates for today’s labor market.
column2: 考不上ITT最后会进入水平参差不齐的各种院校，其中许多院校的无法让毕业生具备当今劳动力市场所需要的技能。

column1: But at least there are enough engineering colleges in India to meet demand.
column2: 但至少印度有足够的工学院满足需求。

column1: Medicine, by contrast, is a frustratingly crowded field – and for no good reason.
column2: 相反，医科的拥挤程度令人丧气 — — 并且有些“无厘头 ” 。

column1: India’s medical profession is controlled by the Medical Council of India, an opaque and self-serving cabal that has intentionally limited the supply of available medical college seats.
column2: 印度医学界由印度医学委员会把持，这是一个不透明的自利组织，刻意限制医学院学位供给。

column1: Medical colleges must be recognized by the MCI, which has seen fit to permit only 381 to exist.
column2: 医学院必须获得印度医学委员会承认，而该委员会只承认381家医学院。

column1: That leaves only 63,800 slots each year in a country of 1.2 billion people – enough space for fewer than 1% of Indian students aspiring to attend medical school.
column2: 这意味着12亿印度人每年只有638,000个医学学位 — — 只占想读医科的印度学生的不到1 % 。

column1: As if that were not bad enough, some of the seats are awarded against “donations,” with the wealthy essentially purchasing positions that their marks do not merit.
column2: 雪上加霜的是，其中一些学位还要为“捐赠”保留，即有钱人分不够可以花钱上学。

column1: Meanwhile, high-achieving students who just barely missed the cutoff have to find alternatives – or pursue another field altogether.
column2: 与此同时，恰好被卡的优秀学生则必须另寻出路 — — 或者换一个专业。

column1: Those whose families can afford it often end up studying medicine abroad.
column2: 负担得起的家庭的孩子常常出国去读医科。

column1: Many do not return to India, depriving the country of their much-needed expertise.
column2: 许多不再回到印度，导致印度无法获得急需的 医学专家。

column1: Some return after having attended obscure colleges in countries like Georgia or China, only to have the MCI refuse to recognize their degrees and block them from practicing.
column2: 一些人在格鲁吉亚或中国的严苛医学院学成归国，学位却得不到医学委员会的承认，无法行医。

column1: For those who cannot afford to go abroad – even bright students who barely missed the cutoff for a spot at an Indian university – studying medicine is no longer an option.
column2: 对于无力出国留学的人来说 — — 即使他是非常聪明的学生，只不过恰好考不上某个印度大学 — — 学医医科就此梦断。

column1: Yet India desperately needs doctors.
column2: 但印度急需医生。

column1: According to the World Health Organization, the country has just 0.7 doctors per 1,000 people.
column2: 据世界卫生组织的数据，印度每1,000人只有0.7名医生。

column1: In the United States and the United Kingdom – two countries to which Indian doctors often emigrate – the rate is 2.5 per 1,000 and 2.8 per 1,000, respectively.
column2: 在常常作为印度医生移民目的地的美国和英国，这一比例分别为2.5和2.8。

column1: The crippling lack of capacity means that lives are lost every day – particularly in rural areas – for want of medical attention.
column2: 医务人员严重不足意味着每天都会发生因为缺医少药而导致的生命损失 — — 特别是在农村地区。

column1: India could be graduating four or five times as many capable doctors as it does each year.
column2: 印度有能力每年培养比现在多三四倍的医学毕业生。

column1: Yet the MCI has been allowed to pursue its restrictive approach, depriving poor Indians of adequate health care, while augmenting the already-huge pressure on students to gain a seat in a medical college.
column2: 但印度放任医学委员会严格控制医学生人数，导致印度穷人无法获得充足的医疗服务，同时也进一步增加了压力已然非常巨大的学生考取医学院的压力。

column1: It is in this context – with a huge population competing for a tiny number of seats in professional colleges – that coaching institutes like those in Kota thrive.
column2: 正是在这样的背景下 — — 巨大的人口竞争极少数专业学院学位 — — 科塔补习班这样的机构得以兴盛。

column1: When succeeding in tough entrance examinations is the only way to fulfill one’s educational goals, test preparation becomes the be-all and end-all of schooling.
column2: 当“千军万马过独木桥”成为实现教育目标的唯一途径时，复习就成为教育的一切和终极目标。

column1: Eager to satisfy pushy parents, young people sacrifice their own interests at the altar of a false god.
column2: 为了满足家长的“进取心 ” ， 印度年轻人为了这个伪神坛而牲了自己的兴趣。

column1: The 56 pyres lit in Kota over the last five years are a tragic testament to how damaging this conception of academic excellence can be.
column2: 过去五年，科塔有56名学生自杀，这便是应试教育危害的悲剧写照。

column1: The Kremlin and the US Election
column2: 克里姆林宫与美国大选

column1: CAMBRIDGE – In early November, US President Barack Obama reportedly contacted Russian President Vladimir Putin personally to warn against cyber attacks aimed at the American presidential election.
column2: 发自剑桥 — — 据报道，11月初美国总统奥巴马曾亲自致电与俄罗斯总统普京，警告其不要针对美国总统大选发动网络袭击。

column1: The previous month, the Director of National Intelligence, James Clapper, and Jeh Johnson, the Secretary of Homeland Security, publicly accused Russia’s most senior officials of using cyber attacks to “interfere with the US election process.”
column2: 而上个月，美国国家情报局局长詹姆斯·克莱珀（James Clapper）和国土安全部长杰·约翰逊（Jeh Johnson）则公开指责某些俄罗斯最高级别官员利用网络攻击来“干扰美国大选进程 ” 。

column1: In the aftermath of the November 8 election, no firm evidence has emerged that hacking interfered with voting machines or other electoral machinery.
column2: 在回顾11月8日大选的过程中，并无确切证据表明黑客曾入侵投票机或其他选举机制。

column1: But in an election that turned on 100,000 votes in three key states, some observers argue that Russian cyber interference in the political process may have had a significant impact.
column2: 但是在涉及100万票的三个关键州投票中，一些观察家认为俄罗斯对该政治程序的网络干预可能已经产生了重大影响。

column1: Can such Russian behavior be deterred in the future?
column2: 俄罗斯的这种行为在将来能否被遏制？

column1: Deterrence always depends on who and what one is trying to deter.
column2: 这取决于由谁出手，以及遏制的对象是什么。

column1: Ironically, deterring states from using force may be easier than deterring them from actions that do not rise to that level.
column2: 讽刺的是，阻止各国发动网络行动甚至比阻止它们使用更高级别的武力更困难。

column1: The threat of a surprise attack such as a “cyber Pearl Harbor” has probably been exaggerated.
column2: 但遭到“网络珍珠港”这类突袭的威胁或许是被夸大了。

column1: Critical infrastructures such as electricity or communications are vulnerable, but major state actors are likely to be constrained by interdependence.
column2: 虽然电力或通信等关键基础设施相对脆弱，但各主要国家都会受到相互依存关系的制肘。

column1: And the United States has made clear that deterrence is not limited to cyber retaliation (though that is possible), but can target other sectors with any tools it chooses, ranging from naming and shaming and economic sanctions to nuclear weapons.
column2: 而美国也已明确表示，遏制行动不仅限于网络报复（尽管这是可能的 ） ， 还可能选择任何工具 — — 从公开指责羞辱到经济制裁，再到核武器 — — 来打击其他部门。

column1: The US and others, including Russia, have agreed that the laws of armed conflict apply in cyberspace.
column2: 美国以及包括俄罗斯在内的其他国家都已同意将武装冲突的相关法则适用于网络空间。

column1: Whether a cyber operation is treated as an armed attack depends on its consequences, rather than on the instruments used.
column2: 一场网络行动是否被视为武装攻击并非取决于使用何种工具，而是其所造成的后果。

column1: It would have to result in destruction of property or injury or death to individuals.
column2: 它必须导致财产损失或人员伤亡。

column1: But what about deterring operations that are not equivalent to an armed attack?
column2: 但如何阻止那些不等同于武装进攻的行动呢？

column1: There are gray areas in which important targets (say, a free political process) are not strategically vital in the same way as the electrical grid or the financial system.
column2: 其中存在一些灰色地带，比如某些目标（例如自由的政治程序）虽然重要，但其战略重要性的表现方式却与电网或金融系统不一样。

column1: Destroying the latter could damage lives and property; interference with the former threatens deeply held political values.
column2: 摧毁后者可能会破坏生命财产；对前者的干涉则威胁着深层次的政治价值观。

column1: In 2015, a United Nations Group of Government Experts (including the US, Russia, China, and most states with significant cyber capabilities) agreed to a norm of not targeting civilian facilities in peacetime.
column2: 2015年，一个联合国政府专家组（包括美国，俄罗斯，中国和大多数具备强大网络实力的国家）就一个在和平时期不得攻击民用设施的规范上达成了一致。

column1: This agreement was endorsed by the G20 countries at their summit in Turkey in November 2015.
column2: 这个协议随后在2015年11月G20土耳其峰会上被签署通过。

column1: When an anonymous cyber attack interfered with the Ukrainian electric grid the following month, some analysts suspected the Russian government of using cyber weapons in its continuing hybrid warfare against Ukraine.
column2: 谁知刚过一个月，乌克兰电网就遭到了一个匿名网络攻击，一些分析师怀疑俄罗斯政府针对乌克兰的合成战争中使用了网络武器。

column1: If true, it would mean that Russia had violated the agreement it had just signed.
column2: 如果此事属实，就意味着俄罗斯违反了自身刚刚签署的协议。

column1: But how should one interpret Russian behavior in regard to the American election?
column2: 但是如何解释俄罗斯在美国大选中的行为呢？

column1: According to US officials, Russian intelligence agencies hacked into the email accounts of important Democratic Party officials and provided the materials to WikiLeaks to dribble out over the course of the campaign, thereby ensuring a continuous steam of news stories that were unfavorable to Hillary Clinton.
column2: 据美国官员说，俄罗斯情报机构入侵了民主党官员的电子邮���帐户，并在整个选举进程中持续透露材料给维基解密网站，从而确保不断有关于希拉里的负面新闻曝光。

column1: This alleged Russian disruption of the Democratic presidential campaign fell into a gray area that could be interpreted as a propaganda response to Clinton’s 2010 proclamation of a “freedom agenda” for the Internet or retaliation for what Russian officials saw as her critical comments about Putin’s election in 2012.
column2: 这种所谓俄罗斯对民主党总统大选的破坏行动落入一个灰色地带，可以解释为针对希拉里2010年提出的互联网“自由议程”所发动的宣传战，或是俄罗斯官员为她抨击普京2012年竞选总统的言论而做出报复。

column1: Whatever the motive, it looked like an effort to skew the US political process – precisely the type of nonlethal political threat that one would want to deter in the future.
column2: 但无论动机为何，这看起来像一种扭曲美国政治进程的行动 — — 也正是在人们未来想要遏制的那种非致命性政治威胁。

column1: The Obama administration had previously made efforts to rank the seriousness of cyber attacks, but without sorting out the ambiguities of these gray areas.
column2: 奥巴马政府曾试图于将网络攻击按照其严重性划分等级，但依然未能理清这些这些模糊的灰色地带。

column1: In 2016, Obama faced difficult choices in estimating the escalatory potential of responding with cyber measures or with a cross-sector response such as sanctions.
column2: 今年奥巴马有点手足无措，不知道应该更多地考虑利用网络手段，还是采取类似制裁等跨部门应对措施。

column1: The administration did not want to take steps that might themselves disrupt the election.
column2: 但政府担心这些措施本身可能就会对选举造成干扰。

column1: So, eight days before the vote, the US sent Russia a warning about election meddling over a hotline – created three years earlier to deal with major cyber incidents – that connects the Nuclear Risk Reduction Centers in both countries.
column2: 因此在投票前八天，美国通过三年前建立的一条连接了两国减少核风险中心（Nuclear Risk Reduction Center）的热线 — — 专责处理重大网络事件 — — 向俄罗斯发出了停止干涉选举的警告。

column1: Because Russian hacking activity seemed to slow or halt, the Obama administration cited the warning as a successful exercise in deterrence.
column2: 因为俄罗斯黑客活动似乎已经减少或停止，奥巴马政府将该警告视为一次成功的威慑行动。

column1: But some critics say the Russians had already achieved their main goals.
column2: 但一些批评者则认为俄罗斯人已经实现了其主要目的。

column1: Three weeks after the election, the administration said that it remained confident in the overall integrity of America’s electoral infrastructure, and that the election was free and fair from a cyber-security perspective.
column2: 大选结束后三个星期，政府表示对美国选举基础架构的整体完整性依然充满信心，从网络安全的角度看，选举是自由和公平的。

column1: But intelligence officials continued to investigate the impact of a broader Russian information-warfare campaign, in which fake stories about Clinton appeared intended to influence voters.
column2: 但美国情报官员依然在调查更宏观的俄罗斯信息战的影响，其中关于希拉里的虚假报道似乎试图左右选民。

column1: Many of the false reports originated from RT News and Sputnik, two state-funded Russian outlets.
column2: 同时许多假新闻都始发于今日俄罗斯（RT News）和俄罗斯卫星网（Sputnik）这两家受政府资助的俄罗斯媒体。

column1: Should this be treated as traditional propaganda or something new?
column2: 那么这应该被视为传统宣传战还是某些新生事物？

column1: A number of critics believe that the level of official Russian state involvement in the 2016 US election process crossed a line and should not be dismissed as a form of tolerable gray-area behavior.
column2: 一些评论家认为，俄罗斯官方对2016年美国大选进程的介入程度相当过分，不应被视为一种可容忍的灰色地带行为。

column1: These critics have urged the Obama administration to go further in naming and shaming, by providing a fuller public description of what US intelligence knows about Russia’s behavior, and by imposing financial and travel sanctions against high-level Russian officials who are identified.
column2: 这些批评者敦促奥巴马政府进一步指明始作俑者，更充分地公开披露美国情报部门掌握的俄罗斯行动情况，并对确认涉事的高级俄罗斯官员实施财务和旅行制裁。

column1: Other US officials, however, are reluctant to jeopardize the intelligence means used for attribution, and are wary of escalation.
column2: 然而其他美国官员却不愿意披露用于收集这些情况的情报手段，并担心冲突升级。

column1: Russia’s involvement in the 2016 US election was a watershed.
column2: 俄罗斯对2016年美国大选的介入是一个分水岭。

column1: With important elections coming in a number of Western democracies, analysts will be watching closely to see what lessons the Kremlin draws from it.
column2: 鉴于一些西方民主国家也即将举行重要选举，分析人士将密切关注克里姆林宫会从中吸取什么样的经验教训。

column1: Kremlin Musical Chairs
column2: 克里姆林宫的换椅子游戏

column1: It’s that time again – Russia’s pre-election season when prime ministers are changed as in a game of musical chairs.
column2: 在俄罗斯又一次面临大选的时候，总理宝座像换椅子游戏那样不断地变换着人选。

column1: The last one seated, it is supposed, will become Russia’s next president.
column2: 而最后一个坐上这个位置的人被认为会成为俄罗斯的下一任总统。

column1: As the end of his rule approached, Boris Yeltsin went through at least a half-dozen prime ministers, looking for the one who would ensure the security not only of Russia’s new democracy and market economy, but also of his “family” and the wealth that it had accumulated during his rule.
column2: 在任期行将结束前，叶利钦换了至少六个总理，以寻找到一个不但能保证俄罗斯的新民主和市场经济的安全，同时更能保证他的“家族”以及在他的执政期间累积起来的巨大财富的安全的人选。

column1: The last man seated then was, of course, Vladimir Putin.
column2: 当然，最后一个坐上这个位置的人就是普京。

column1: Now it is Putin’s turn to call the tune, dismissing Mikhail Fradkov and dissolving the government that had served him throughout his second term in order to prepare for the parliamentary elections looming in December and the presidential ballot in March 2008.
column2: 现在轮到普京来做这场游戏了，将一直在他的第二任期内担任总理的弗拉德科夫解职以及解散政府正是在为将于11月份进行的议会选举和2008年3月份进行的总统选举做准备。

column1: In 1999, Yeltsin picked Putin, who was then the little-known head of the FSB (formerly the KGB).
column2: 1999年的时候，叶利钦挑选了当时不太为人所知的联邦安全局（前克格勃）的局长普京。

column1: Putin chose to elevate the equally mysterious Victor Zubkov, head of the Federal Financial Monitoring Service (also known as the “finance espionage” agency).
column2: 而现在普京选择提拔同样神秘的祖布科夫，联邦金融监测局（也被称为“金融间谍”机构）局长。

column1: Despite that similarity, the reasoning behind these choices appears to be somewhat different.
column2: 尽管有这种相似性，在这些选择背后的原因却似乎有所不同。

column1: Yeltsin’s choice of Putin – encouraged, ironically, by Boris Berezovsky, the prominent Russian oligarch and Yeltsin advisor who is now exiled in London as Putin’s mortal enemy – was based on his belief that the quiet apparatchik, even if a former KGB spy, was a democrat at heart.
column2: 具有讽刺意味的是，叶利钦选择普京是受到别列佐夫斯基的鼓动，他是俄罗斯寡头统治集团的重要成员以及叶利钦的顾问，现在流亡在伦敦，成了普京不共戴天的敌人。 叶利钦是因为他相信这一寡言少语的党政官员，即便是一个前克格勃的间谍，在本质上也是一个民主主义者。

column1: After all, Putin had been a protegé of Anatoly Sobchak, the liberal mayor of St. Petersburg as communism collapsed.
column2: 不管怎样，普京曾是索布恰克，这一在共产主义倒台后担任彼得堡市市长的自由主义者的门徒。

column1: A security services insider, Putin was seen as well placed to protect Yeltsin and his oligarchic allies.
column2: 作为一个在安全部门局内人，挑选普京还被认为可以保护叶利钦和他的寡头统治集团成员。

column1: Indeed, Berezovsky intended to continue ruling the country from behind the scenes, first as Yeltsin’s health failed in the final months of his presidency, and then by controlling the successor he had helped to choose.
column2: 事实上，别列佐夫斯基希望能够继续在幕后操纵这个国家，开始在叶利钦总统任期的最后几个月当他健康情况恶化的时候，然后可以通过控制他帮助挑选的继任者来达到这一目的。

column1: In Russia, however, the KGB is famous for turning the tables in any struggle with the Kremlin apparat.
column2: 然而，在俄罗斯，克格勃一向以其在与克里姆林宫的任何斗争最终总能转败为胜而著称。

column1: So no one but Yeltsin and Berezovsky was surprised when Putin, their supposed marionette, began pulling the strings.
column2: 所以当普京这个他们想象中的提线木偶人开始操纵局势时，大概除了叶利钦和别列佐夫斯基之外没有人会感到惊讶。

column1: And pull them he did, turning Berezovsky into an international villain, exiling former media mogul Vladimir Gusinsky, jailing the oil magnate Mikhail Khodorkovsky, and eventually imposing a new authoritarian regime behind the façade of Yeltsin’s democratic institutions.
column2: 在他的操纵下，别列佐夫斯基被化身成了一个国际上的恶棍，前传媒巨头古辛斯基流亡国外，石油寡头霍多尔科夫斯基被送进了监狱，最后是在叶利钦建立起来的民主机构的外表下建立起了一个新的专制政权。

column1: Putin’s own game of prime ministerial “musical chairs” does not reflect a desire to secure for himself a quiet position behind the scenes while someone else rules, for he knows all too well that the path from the Kremlin leads only to inner exile and the grave.
column2: 普京自己所玩的这个总理宝座的“换椅子游戏”并不是想要在别人当政的时候自己能够悄悄地躲在幕后，因为他非常清楚从克里姆林宫出来后的路只会通向在国内流放以及墓地。

column1: Stalin replaced the dying Lenin, Khrushchev denounced Stalin, Brezhnev banished Khrushchev to his dacha, and Gorbachev buried Chernenko.
column2: 斯大林替代了行将死亡的列宁，赫鲁晓夫公然抨击了斯大林，勃列日涅夫将赫鲁晓夫流放到他的乡间别墅，而戈尔巴乔夫埋葬了契尔年科。

column1: Only Yeltsin did things differently.
column2: 只有叶利钦的做法有所不同。

column1: He disliked his predecessor, Mikhail Gorbachev, as much his predecessors disliked their predecessors.
column2: 他讨厌他的前任戈尔巴乔夫一如他的前任者不喜欢他们各自的前任者一样。

column1: But all the same he treated Gorbachev in a more decent manner because Yeltsin fundamentally believed in democracy.
column2: 然后他还是以一种更加体面的方式对待戈尔巴乔夫，因为叶利钦在本质上相信民主。

column1: So he left Gorbachev a private life that could also be lived in public.
column2: 所以他允许戈尔巴乔夫过他自己私人的生活，并且还可以出现在公众中。

column1: Putin, of course, did not accost the retired Yeltsin, but he didn’t have to.
column2: 当然，普京并没有与退休的叶利钦搭话，但是他并不必要这样做。

column1: He simply ignored him while reversing his achievements in building a free Russia.
column2: 他只是把他晾在一边，而在叶利钦建立自由俄罗斯的成就上开倒车。

column1: Before Zubkov’s nomination, reports swirled that the next prime minister would become Putin’s presidential successor, with Sergei Ivanov, a current deputy prime minister, dubbed the most likely candidate.
column2: 在祖布科夫被提名前，媒体纷纷流传下一任总理会成为普京的总统继承人，而现任副总理伊万诺夫是最有可能的候选人。

column1: But Ivanov, who is perceived as “strong,” would provide unwelcome competition to Putin, who, after all, remains a “strong” president.
column2: 但是伊万诺夫被认为很“强势”的人，会给普京带来令人不快的竞争，因为后者不管怎样依然是一位“强势”的总统。

column1: Had he anointed Ivanov now, Putin’s power would already begin seeping away.
column2: 如果他现在就提名伊万诺夫，那么普京的权力现在就会开始被慢慢地蚕食。

column1: The outgoing Fradkov, surprisingly, put the matter best when he explained why he had resigned: with elections approaching, Putin needed a free hand.
column2: 走下总理宝座的弗拉德科夫在解释他为什么辞职时令人惊讶地最恰如其分地解释了事情的原由。 也就是，随着大选的临近，普京需要完全自由地做出各种决定。

column1: So Zubkov’s nomination allows Putin to continue to keep his cards – and thus ultimate power in Russia – close to his chest.
column2: 所以提名祖布科夫可以让普京继续对他的计划秘而不���，同时也可以维持他在俄罗斯的最高权力。

column1: Of course, Zubkov will continue Fradkov’s “Yes, whatever you say Mr. President” management style.
column2: 当然，祖布科夫会继续弗拉德科夫的管理方式 ， “ 是的，总统先生，一切都按你的意思办 ” 。

column1: Moreover, his former position as head of the Federal Financial Monitoring Service will allow him to draw on a wealth of information to keep tabs on all possible enemies and competitors, perhaps turning them into new model Berezovsky’s, Gusinsky’s and Khodorkovsky’s, if necessary.
column2: 此外，他曾担任过联邦金融监测局局长的经历，也使他掌握了对所有可能的敌人和竞争对手进行监视的丰富信息，如果需要的话，也许会把他们变成新的别列佐夫斯基、古辛斯基和霍多尔科夫斯基。

column1: The only question now is whether Zubkov, or his successor, will eventually succeed in turning Czar Vladimir into the same sort of non-person that Putin’s rivals have become.
column2: 现在唯一的问题就是祖布科夫或者他的继任者是否会最终成功地把弗拉基米尔沙皇也变成像普京的对手已经变成的同样的那种“非人 ” 。

column1: Paul Krugman and the Obama Recovery
column2: 保罗·克鲁格曼和奥巴马复苏

column1: NEW YORK – For several years, and often several times a month, the Nobel laureate economist and New York Times columnist and blogger Paul Krugman has delivered one main message to his loyal readers: deficit-cutting “austerians” (as he calls advocates of fiscal austerity) are deluded.
column2: 纽约—几年以来，常常每个月都有几次，诺贝尔经济学奖获得者 、 《 纽约时报》专栏作家兼博客写手保罗·克鲁格曼（Paul Krugman）都会向他的忠实读者发布一条重要信息：削减赤字的“紧缩派 ” （ 他对支持财政紧缩者的称呼）被骗了。

column1: Fiscal retrenchment amid weak private demand would lead to chronically high unemployment.
column2: 事实上，赤字削减将让1937年重现。

column1: Indeed, deficit cuts would court a reprise of 1937, when Franklin D. Roosevelt prematurely reduced the New Deal stimulus and thereby threw the United States back into recession.
column2: 当时，富兰克林·罗斯福过早地缩减新政刺激，导致美国再次滑入衰退。

column1: Well, Congress and the White House did indeed play the austerian card from mid-2011 onward.
column2: 好吧，自2011年年中以来，国会和白宫确实实施了紧缩。

column1: The federal budget deficit has declined from 8.4% of GDP in 2011 to a predicted 2.9% of GDP for all of 2014.
column2: 联邦预算赤字占GDP之比从2011年的8.4%下降到2014年的2.9 % （ 预计值 ） 。

column1: And, according to the International Monetary Fund, the structural deficit (sometimes called the “full-employment deficit”), a measure of fiscal stimulus, has fallen from 7.8% of potential GDP to 4% of potential GDP from 2011 to 2014.
column2: 此外，根据国际货币基金组织（IMF）的数据，衡量财政刺激的指标结构性赤字（有时称为“充分就业赤字 ” ） 从2011年占潜在GDP的7.8%下降到2014年的4 % 。

column1: Krugman has vigorously protested that deficit reduction has prolonged and even intensified what he repeatedly calls a “depression” (or sometimes a “low-grade depression”).
column2: 克鲁格曼强烈反对削减赤字延长甚至加剧了他反复所谓的“萧条 ” （ 有时也称为“低度萧条 ” ） 的观点。

column1: Only fools like the United Kingdom’s leaders (who reminded him of the Three Stooges) could believe otherwise.
column2: 只有英国领导人这样的蠢货（让他想起了“三傻 ” （ Three Stooges ） ） 才会相信这样的观点。

column1: Yet, rather than a new recession, or an ongoing depression, the US unemployment rate has fallen from 8.6% in November 2011 to 5.8% in November 2014.
column2: 但是，美国并没有迎来新衰退，也没有继续萧条，失业率从2011年11月的8.6%下降至2014年11月的5.8 % 。

column1: Real economic growth in 2011 stood at 1.6%, and the IMF expects it to be 2.2% for 2014 as a whole.
column2: 2011年真实经济增长只有1.6 % ， 而IMF预计2014年全年可达2.2 % 。

column1: GDP in the third quarter of 2014 grew at a vigorous 5% annual rate, suggesting that aggregate growth for all of 2015 will be above 3%.
column2: 2014年三季度GDP增长年率达到了强劲的5 % ， 这意味着2015年全年总增长将高于3 % 。

column1: So much for Krugman’s predictions.
column2: 克鲁格曼的预测就是如此。

column1: Not one of his New York Times commentaries in the first half of 2013, when “austerian” deficit cutting was taking effect, forecast a major reduction in unemployment or that economic growth would recover to brisk rates.
column2: 他在2013年上半年的所有《纽约时报》评论中 — — 当时“紧缩派”赤字削减措施正在开始见效 — — 都没有预见到失业的大幅下降，也没有预见到经济增长能恢复活力。

column1: On the contrary, “the disastrous turn toward austerity has destroyed millions of jobs and ruined many lives,” he argued, with the US Congress exposing Americans to “the imminent threat of severe economic damage from short-term spending cuts.”
column2: 相反 ， “ 可怕的转向紧缩摧毁了数百万个就业岗位，也破坏了无数人的生活 ， ” 他说，而美国国会让美国人暴露在“来自短期支出削减的严重经济伤害的巨大威胁之下 ” 。

column1: As a result, “Full recovery still looks a very long way off,” he warned. “And I’m beginning to worry that it may never happen.”
column2: 因此 ， “ 充分复苏仍然十分遥远 ， ” 他警告说 ， “ 我甚至担心它到底能不能实现��”

column1: I raise all of this because Krugman took a victory lap in his end-of-2014 column on “The Obama Recovery.”
column2: 我罗列这些是因为克鲁格曼在他的2014年年底专栏《奥巴马复苏 》 （ The Obama Recovery）中俨然一副胜利者的姿态。

column1: The recovery, according to Krugman, has come not despite the austerity he railed against for years, but because we “seem to have stopped tightening the screws: Public spending isn’t surging, but at least it has stopped falling.
column2: 按他的说法，复苏并不是来自他多年来一直反对的紧缩，而是因为我们“似乎已经停止拧紧螺丝：公共支出没有大幅增加，但至少也不再下降。

column1: And the economy is doing much better as a result.”
column2: 经济也因此大有起色 。 ”

column1: That is an incredible claim.
column2: 这真是令人难以置信的观点。

column1: The budget deficit has been brought down sharply, and unemployment has declined.
column2: 预算赤字大幅减少，失业也有所下降。

column1: Yet Krugman now says that everything has turned out just as he predicted.
column2: 但现在克鲁格曼却说所有事情都和他预料的完全一样。

column1: In fact, Krugman has been conflating two distinct ideas as if both were components of “progressive” thinking.
column2: 事实上，克鲁格曼聚合了两种不同观点，让它们看起来都像是“进步”思维的要素。

column1: On one hand, he has been the “conscience of a liberal,” rightly focusing on how government can combat poverty, poor health, environmental degradation, rising inequality, and other social ills.
column2: 一方面，他是“自由派的良心 ” ， 正确地将注意力集中在政府如何减少贫困、解决穷人的医疗问题、阻止环境破坏、遏制不平等性加剧和治理其他社会问题上。

column1: I admire that side of Krugman’s writing, and, as I wrote in my book The Price of Civilization, I agree with him.
column2: 我仰慕克鲁格曼在这方面的工作，并且如我在《文明的代价 》 （ The Price of Civilization）一书中所言，我同意他的观点。

column1: On the other hand, Krugman has inexplicably taken up the mantle of crude aggregate-demand management, making it seem that favoring large budget deficits in recent years is also part of progressive economics.
column2: 另一方面，克鲁格曼令人费解地举起了粗犷总需求管理的大旗，将近几年对大规模预算赤字的支持也说成是进步经济学的一部分。

column1: (Krugman’s position is sometimes called Keynesianism, but John Maynard Keynes knew much better than Krugman that we should not depend on mechanistic “demand multipliers” to set the unemployment rate.)
column2: （克鲁格曼的立场有时被称为凯恩斯主义，但凯恩斯远比克鲁格曼清楚，我们不应该依赖机械的“需求乘数”来决定失业率。

column1: Deficits were not increased enough in 2009 to escape from high unemployment, he insisted, and were falling dangerously fast after 2010.
column2: ）他坚持认为，2009年赤字增加的不够，因此无法降低高失业；而2010年以降，赤字更是出现了危险的快速减少之势。

column1: Obviously, recent trends – a significant decline in the unemployment rate and a reasonably high and accelerating rate of economic growth – cast doubt on Krugman’s macroeconomic diagnosis (though not on his progressive politics).
column2: 显然，近期趋势 — — 失业率的大幅下降以及相当漂亮并且还在加速的经济增长 — — 让克鲁格曼的宏观经济诊断令人质疑（但他的进步政治学除外 ） 。

column1: And the same trends have been apparent in the United Kingdom, where Prime Minister David Cameron’s government has cut the structural budget deficit from 8.4% of potential GDP in 2010 to 4.1% in 2014, while the unemployment rate has fallen from 7.9% when Cameron took office to 6%, according to the most recent data for the fall of 2014.
column2: 而相同的趋势在英国也显而易见，首相卡梅伦政府将结构性预算赤字从2010年占潜在GDP的8.4%下降至2014年的4.1 % ， 而失业率则从卡梅伦执政初期的7.9%下降至6 % （ 2014年秋季最新数据 ） 。

column1: To be clear, I believe that we do need more government spending as a share of GDP – for education, infrastructure, low-carbon energy, research and development, and family benefits for low-income families.
column2: 坦白说，我认为我们确实需要提高政府支出占GDP的比例 — — 将钱花在教育、基础设施、低碳能源、研发活动和低收入家庭福利上。

column1: But we should pay for this through higher taxes on high incomes and high net worth, a carbon tax, and future tolls collected on new infrastructure.
column2: 但我们应该通过增加高收入和高净财富者的税率、提高碳税和提高新基础设施的未来费用来筹集资金。

column1: We need the liberal conscience, but without the chronic budget deficits.
column2: 我们需要自由派的良心，但不要顽固的预算赤字。

column1: There is nothing progressive about large budget deficits and a rising debt-to-GDP ratio.
column2: 巨大的预算赤字和不断上升的债务-GDP比率绝不具有进步性质。

column1: After all, large deficits have no reliable effect on reducing unemployment, and deficit reduction can be consistent with falling unemployment.
column2: 毕竟，巨额赤字对于降低失业并没有可靠影响，而赤字削减倒是与失业下降一致。

column1: Krugman is a great economic theorist – and a great polemicist.
column2: 克鲁格曼是伟大的经济理论家 — — 也是伟大的辩论家。

column1: But he should replace his polemical hat with his analytical one and reflect more deeply on recent experience: deficit-cutting accompanied by recovery, job creation, and lower unemployment.
column2: 但他应该甩掉辩论家的帽子，树立分析家的招牌，深刻思考最新的经验：赤字削减与复苏、就业创造和失业下降同时出现。

column1: This should be an occasion for him to rethink his long-standing macroeconomic mantra, rather than claiming vindication for ideas that recent trends seem to contradict.
column2: 这应该成为一次让他反思其长期坚持的宏观经济咒语的机会，而不是为已被最新趋势证明存在矛盾的观点辩护。

column1: Krugman’s Anti-Cameron Contradiction
column2: 克鲁格曼的反卡梅伦矛盾

column1: NEW YORK – It is truly odd to read Paul Krugman rail, time and again, against the British government.
column2: 纽约—保罗·克鲁格曼（Paul Krugman）反复抨击英国政府，这着实令人奇怪。

column1: His latest screed begins with the claim that “Britain’s economic performance since the financial crisis struck has been startlingly bad.”
column2: 他最近的长文在一开始就指出“自金融危机以来，英国经济表现令人难以置信地糟糕 。 ”

column1: He excoriates Prime Minister David Cameron’s government for its “poor economic record,” and wonders how he and his cabinet can possibly pose “as the guardians of prosperity.”
column2: 他批评首相卡梅伦政府需要为“糟糕的经济记录”负责，并质疑卡梅伦及其内阁是否能够担当“繁荣卫士 ” 。

column1: Hmm.
column2: 恩。

column1: In recent months, Krugman has repeatedly praised the US economic recovery under President Barack Obama, while attacking the United Kingdom’s record.
column2: 最近几个月来，克鲁格曼一再赞扬美国经济在总统奥巴马治下的复苏势头，而攻击英国的经济表现。

column1: But when we compare the two economies side by side, their trajectories are broadly similar, with the UK outperforming the United States on certain indicators.
column2: 但我们背靠背比较这两大经济体就可以发现，它们的运行轨迹大体相当，英国在一些指标上表现还强于美国。

column1: Consider, first, the unemployment rate.
column2: 首先来看失业率。

column1: In the fourth quarter of 2007, the UK’s rate was 5.2%.
column2: 2007年四季度，英国失业率为5.2 % 。

column1: When Cameron’s government took office in May 2010, it was 7.9%.
column2: 卡梅伦政府2010年5月上台时，失业率是7.9 % 。

column1: In the most recent reporting period (November 2014-January 2015), it was 5.7%.
column2: 而在最近的报告期（2014年11月—2015年1月 ） ， 失业率是5.7 % 。

column1: In the US, the unemployment rate in the fourth quarter of 2007 was 4.8%, 9.8% in March-May 2010, and 5.7% in November 2014-January 2015.
In both countries, the unemployment rate is therefore slightly above the pre-crisis (end-2007) level, with no significant net difference over the business cycle from the end of 2007 until now.
column2: 因此，两个国家的失业率均略高于危机前（2007年底）水平，在2007年底至今的商业周期中没有出现较大净差异。

column1: Next, let’s look at the employment rate, which in the UK stood at 72.9% of the population aged 16-64 at the end of 2007.
column2: 然后我们来看看就业率。 2007年，英国16—24岁年龄段人口就业率为72.9 % 。

column1: It fell to 70.4% by the time the Cameron government came to power, but since then has risen strongly, to 73.3% in November 2014-January 2015, an all-time high.
column2: 卡梅伦政府开始执政时这一就业率下跌至70.4 % ， 此后强劲反弹，2014年11月—2015年1月达到了历史最高水平73.3 % 。

column1: In the US, by contrast, the employment rate was 62.8% at the end of 2007, 58.6% in March-May 2010, and then only slightly higher, at 59.2%, during November 2014-January 2015 – still below the pre-crisis level.
column2: 相反，在美国，2007年底这一就业率为62.8 % ， 2010年3—5月为58.6 % ， 然后略有上升，2014年11月—2015年1月为59.2 % — —仍低于危机前水平。

column1: This suggests that there are more discouraged workers in the US than in the UK.
column2: 这表明美国的失望工人比英国更多。

column1: Finally, there is output growth.
column2: 最后来看看产出增长。

column1: In the UK, real (inflation-adjusted) GDP fell by 3.8% from the fourth quarter of 2007 to the second quarter of 2010.
column2: 在英国，真实（经通胀调整的）GDP在2007年四季度至2010年二季度间下降了3.8 % 。

column1: It then rose by 8.1% from that point until the fourth quarter of 2014.
column2: 此后直至2014年四季度上升了8.1 % 。

column1: In the US, real GDP fell by 1.6% from the fourth quarter of 2007 to the second quarter of 2010, and then rose by 10.5% from then until the fourth quarter of 2014.
column2: 在美国，2007年四季度到2010年二季度真实GDP下降1.6 % ， 此后直至2014年四季度增加10.5 % 。

column1: Thus, both countries have experienced moderately high and broadly similar growth rates since May 2010, when Cameron’s government took power.
column2: 因此，2010年5月卡梅伦政府开始执政以来，两国的增长率都比较高且大致相当。

column1: Yes, UK growth has been slightly slower, but the British economy has also faced, among other factors, the headwind of sharply falling North Sea oil production during this period, whereas the US benefited from a shale-oil boom.
column2: 诚然，英国增长率要略低一些，但在此期间英国经济面临着北海石油产量急剧下滑等不利因素，而美国则得益于页岩油繁荣。

column1: Obviously, neither of these long-term trends can be fairly attributed to the governments currently in office.
column2: 显然，这些长期趋势都不能完全归因于现任政府。

column1: In any case, during the past two years, from the fourth quarter of 2012 to the fourth quarter of 2014, the US economy grew by a cumulative 5.6% while the UK economy grew by 5.4%, essentially the same as the US.
column2: 无论如何，从2012年四季度到2014年四季度的两年中，美国经济累计增长5.6 % ， 而英国增长5.4 % ， 与美国旗鼓相当。

column1: Krugman seems to make much of the fact that the UK did not bounce back even more strongly from a larger output decline between the fourth quarter of 2007 and the fourth quarter of 2010 – a fall that occurred before the Cameron government took office.
column2: 克鲁格曼大做文章的一个事实是英国没有从2007年四季度到2010年四季度之间更大规模的产出下降的基础上实现更强劲的反弹 — — 这一产出下降发生在卡梅伦政府上台之前。

column1: That is true, and measured UK productivity growth has remained low, but nobody can be sure why.
column2: 诚然，并且英国测得生产率增长也仍然很低，但没人知道确切原因。

column1: Perhaps the unsustainable pre-2008 bubble was larger in the UK; perhaps the UK’s structure (particularly the larger share of finance in its GDP and the continued decline in energy output) made the initial downturn less reversible.
column2: 也许2008年前的不可持续的泡沫在英国规模更大一些；也许英国的结构（特别是金融占GDP比重更大以及能源产出持续下降）使其最初的衰退更加难以扭转。

column1: The UK has been more vulnerable than the US to the eurozone’s prolonged crisis.
column2: 英国比美国更容易受到漫长的欧元区危机的影响。

column1: Moreover, subtle differences between the US and UK in national income accounting should be taken into account in comparing productivity trends.
column2: 此外，美国和英国在国民收入记录方法上的微妙差异也应该在比较生产率趋势时有所考虑。

column1: The International Monetary Fund’s estimate of the output gap (see its World Economic Outlook database) for both countries does not suggest that, as of 2014, the UK is more cyclically depressed than the US.
column2: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）对两国的产出缺口（见IMF世界经济展望数据库）估计并不表明（如2014年）英国的周期性萧条比美国严重。

column1: Indeed, in the IMF’s estimates at least, the opposite is the case.
column2: 事实上，至少在IMF的估计中，情况正好相反。

column1: The IMF puts the UK output gap (as a percent of potential GDP) at 1.2%, compared to 3.5% in the US.
column2: IMF认为英国产出缺口（占潜在GDP的百分比）为1.2 % ， 而美国为3.5 % 。

column1: Of course, both estimates are subject to questions of interpretation; the IMF assumes, for example, that the UK was operating well above potential GDP in 2006-8.
column2: 当然，这两个估计值都要受到解释问题的影响；比如IMF假设英国在2006—2008年期间以远高于潜在GDP的水平运行。

column1: The fact is that the US and UK economies look rather alike in their overall cyclical patterns, with sharp downturns from 2007 to 2010 followed by recoveries in both jobs and GDP since then, and with a fairly rapid pace of recovery in the past two years.
column2: 事实上，美国和英国经济的总体周期模式十分相似，2007年至2010年大幅衰退，接着就业和GDP都有所复苏，并且过去两年复苏速度相当快。

column1: So, if Krugman praises the Obama recovery, he should also praise the Cameron recovery.
column2: 因此，如果克鲁格曼对奥巴马复苏大加赞赏，那么他同样应该赞赏卡梅伦复苏。

column1: They are very similar.
column2: 它们差不多。

column1: Perhaps more notable is that both the US and UK economies have cast considerable doubt on Krugman’s oft-repeated view that a robust recovery would require further fiscal stimulus, a position that he maintained at least until 2013.
column2: 也许更加引人关注的是美国和英国经济严重质疑了克鲁格曼时常挂在嘴边的观点 — — 强健复苏需要更多财政刺激。 至少在2013年之前，他一直持有这一立场。

column1: The post-2010 recoveries in both countries came despite significant cuts in the structural (cyclically adjusted) budget deficit, suggesting that both recoveries occurred in the face of fiscal contraction.
column2: 2010年后的英国和美国复苏是在结构性（经周期调整的）预算赤字大幅削减的情况下实现的，这表明两国的复苏都发生于财政收缩环境中。

column1: According to the IMF estimates, the structural budget deficit was cut from 8.4% of potential GDP in 2010 to 4.1% in 2014 in the UK, and from 9.1% to 4% in the US during the same period.
column2: 据IMF估计，英国结构性预算赤字从2010年占潜在GDP的8.4%削减至2014年的4.1 % ， 而美国同期从9.1%削减至4 % 。

column1: Rather than lambasting Cameron while lauding Obama, Krugman should be praising both countries for their recoveries.
column2: 克鲁格曼不应该抨击卡梅伦而赞扬奥巴马，而应该赞美两国的复苏。

column1: The truth is that – barring another Greek tragedy – both the UK and US are finally out of the post-2008 crisis.
column2: 真相是英国和美国阻止了又一场希腊悲剧，最终走出了2008年后危机。

column1: It is time for both countries to move beyond short-term macroeconomic policy and turn their attention to the challenges of long-term sustainable development.
column2: 两国应该超越短期宏观经济政策，将注意力转向长期可持续发展挑战。

column1: The Case for Kurdistan
column2: 库尔德斯坦建国

column1: TEL AVIV – The Kurds – who occupy a mountainous region that includes portions of Armenia, Iran, Iraq, Syria, and Turkey – are the largest ethnic group in the world without a state to call their own.
column2: 特拉维夫 — — 占据包括亚美尼亚、伊朗、伊拉克、叙利亚和土耳其等国山区的库尔德人是当今世界规模最大的未能建立自己国家的民族。

column1: It is time to change that.
column2: 现在改变的时机已经成熟。

column1: The Kurds have been making bids for statehood – and having them brutally suppressed – since the early twentieth century.
column2: 20世纪初以来库尔德人一直在努力争取国家地位 — — 并因此招致被残酷镇压的命运。

column1: But there is a strong case for the United States, in particular, to work toward securing a homeland for the Kurds – a case buttressed by Kurdish militias’ indispensable contribution to defeating the Islamic State.
column2: 但美国尤其有理由协助库尔德人建国 — — 因为库尔德民兵在打败伊斯兰国的过程中作出了不可或缺的贡献。

column1: To be sure, the establishment of a “greater Kurdistan” that includes all areas where the Kurds comprise a majority remains impossible.
column2: 可以肯定，建立包括以库尔德人为主的所有地区的“大库尔德斯坦”仍然不可能。

column1: If internal Kurdish politics were not enough to prevent such an outcome, geostrategic constraints certainly would be.
column2: 如果库尔德内部政治不足以防止出现这样的结果，地缘政治方面的限制也不能允许这样的结果发生。

column1: Kurdish independence is particularly implausible in Turkey.
column2: 库尔德人独立在土耳其尤其令人难以置信。

column1: The Kurds’ main representative in that country, the Kurdistan Workers’ Party (PKK) – which champions a distinctly secular, Marxist brand of nationalism – has been fighting the Turkish government for decades.
column2: 库尔德人在该国的主要代表库尔德工人党（PKK）明确信仰世俗、马克思式的民族主义，数十年来一直在与土耳其政府进行斗争。

column1: But, the government, led by President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan, has not wavered in its commitment to preventing the establishment of a Kurdish state, to the point that even the PKK’s founder, Abdullah Öcalan, now favors a resolution that falls short of independence.
column2: 但雷杰普·塔伊普·埃尔多安总统领导下的政府从未动摇其阻止库尔德人建国的决心，甚至就连库尔德工人党的创立者阿卜杜拉·奥卡兰现在也没有对独立方案表示赞成。

column1: Erdoğan’s commitment to ending the PKK’s quest is so strong that he is also working to prevent Syria’s Kurds from leveraging sovereignty from their military gains against ISIS.
column2: 埃尔多安终结库尔德工人党目标的决心如此强大，他也在竭力阻止叙利亚库尔德人从针对伊斯兰国的军事胜利中捞取筹码建国。

column1: He fears that Kurdish success in Syria would inspire Turkey’s Kurds to revive their own fight for statehood in the country’s southeast.
column2: 他担心库尔德人在叙利亚所取得的成功将激励土耳其库尔德人在土耳其东南部地区恢复以建国为目标的斗争。

column1: This fear of nationalist spillover has driven Erdoğan’s campaign to create a buffer zone along the Turkish border that extends well into the territory now controlled by Syrian Kurds.
column2: 这种对民族主义溢出效应的担忧已经促使埃尔多安政府沿土耳其边境设立缓冲区，该缓冲区甚至包括现在由叙利亚库尔德人控制的大片领土。

column1: But the Kurdish community in Iraq, represented by the Kurdish Regional Government, has a real shot at statehood.
column2: 但由库尔德地区政府所代表的伊拉克库尔德群体真正有机会实现建国。

column1: The KRG is a quasi-sovereign entity overseeing an efficient military and an independent economy.
column2: 库尔德地区政府是一个准主权机构，管辖着高效率的军队和独立的经济活动。

column1: Although it is plagued by corruption and cronyism, like every other political organization in the region, the KRG represents the only truly functional government in Iraq, presiding over the country’s most peaceful and stable areas.
column2: 尽管腐败和裙带关系像困扰地区其他政治机构那样困扰着库尔德地区政府，但该政府代表着伊拉克唯一一个能够真正行使职能的政府，统治着该国最和平、最稳定的地区。

column1: The strength of the KRG’s position is not lost on its leaders.
column2: 库尔德地区政府的力量并未在其领导人身上丧失。

column1: The ruling Kurdish Democratic Party plans to hold a referendum on independence this September.
column2: 执政的库尔德民主党计划在今年9月举行独立公投。

column1: Yet even a resounding call for secession will not be enough to achieve success.
column2: 但即便分裂的呼声再响也不足以取得成功。

column1: For that, the US must throw its weight behind the pro-Western KRG and offer resolute support for the independence effort.
column2: 为了确保库尔德人成功建国，美国必须全力支持亲西方的库尔德地区政府，并为库尔德人的独立事业提供坚定的支持。

column1: After 14 years of failed military intervention in Iraq, the US should recognize that “a unified, stable, democratic, and federal Iraq,” as a State Department spokesperson recently put it, is a chimera.
column2: 在长达14年的军事干预伊拉克失败后，美国应当承认像国务院发言人不久前所说的“建立一个团结、稳定、民主和联合的伊拉克”仅仅是一个美梦。

column1: Since the US-led invasion in 2003, Iraq’s political system has become highly polarized along sectarian lines, with the ruling Shia majority marginalizing the Sunnis, including the Kurds.
column2: 自从2003年美国领导入侵伊拉克以来，伊拉克的政治制度已经沿宗派界限高度两极化，导致执政的什叶派多数族裔边缘化逊尼派人口，其中也包括库尔德人。

column1: Indeed, Sunni exclusion was a key reason for the rise of ISIS.
column2: 事实上，排斥逊尼派是伊斯兰国崛起的一个关键因素。

column1: Today, Iraq is effectively an Iranian trusteeship, not a US ally.
column2: 今天，伊拉克已经实质上成为伊朗的托管国，而不是美国的盟友。

column1: To the dismay of the Kurds and other Sunni Iraqis, Shia militias controlled by the Iraqi and Iranian governments, such as Hashd al-Shaabi, are filling much of the void left behind by ISIS.
column2: 令库尔德人和其他逊尼派伊拉克人沮丧的是，由伊拉克和伊朗政府所控制的哈沙德·沙比等什叶派民兵正在填补由伊斯兰国留下的绝大部分真空。

column1: As the experience in Yugoslavia showed, when ethnic or religious cleavages explode, the most effective path to peace may well be separation.
column2: 南斯拉夫的经验表明，当种族或宗教分裂势力爆发时，分裂很可能是通往和平最有效的途径。

column1: And a Kurdish state has a real chance of thriving: an independent Kurdistan could manage to combine natural-resource wealth with a tradition of stable and pragmatic governance, thereby creating a sustainable democracy.
column2: 而且库尔德国家拥有真正的机会实现繁荣：一个独立的库尔德斯坦可以将自然资源财富与稳定务实的治理传统相结合，从而创造出可以持续的民主。

column1: This would amount to a win for pro-Western forces in the Middle East.
column2: 这相当于亲西方势力在中东地区获胜。

column1: Even Turkey may be willing to accept such an outcome.
column2: 即便土耳其或许也愿意接受这样的结果。

column1: The US and Turkish governments agree on distinguishing the Kurds in Iraq from those in Turkey, for whom statehood is not an option.
column2: 美国和土耳其政府同意区别对待伊拉克和土耳其境内的库尔德人，对土耳其境内的库尔德人来说，独立建国不是一种选择。

column1: In fact, Turkey has strong relations with the KRG – bilateral trade has lately been expanding, and KRG oil pipelines extend into Turkish territory – because Erdoğan’s government views it as a counterweight to Turkey’s PKK.
column2: 事实上，土耳其一直与库尔德地区政府关系密切 — — 双边贸易规模近年来不断扩大，而库尔德地区政府的输油管道则向土耳其控制地区延伸 — — 因为埃尔多安政府将其视作对土耳其库尔德工人党势力的平衡。

column1: Moreover, now that President Donald Trump, by ending US military support for Syria’s anti-government rebels, has effectively handed the country over to Russia and Iran, Sunni-led Turkey needs a strategic buffer against Shia-led Iraq and Syria more than ever.
column2: 不仅如此，现在唐纳德·特朗普总统通过结束美国对叙利亚反政府叛乱武装的支持，已经在实际上将该国拱手让给了伊朗和俄罗斯，因此逊尼派领导的土耳其比以往任何时候都更需要针对什叶派领导的伊拉克和叙利亚的战略缓冲区。
